verses.sanskrit: अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवं रत्वीजम होतारं रत्नधातमम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnimīḷe purohitaṃ yajñasya devaṃ ṛtvījam hotāraṃ ratnadhātamam

translations.griffith: I Laud Agni, the chosen Priest, God, minister of sacrifice,  The hotar, lavishest of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निः पूर्वेभिर्र्षिभिरीड्यो नूतनैरुत स देवानेह वक्षति |||
verses.transliteration: aghniḥ pūrvebhirṛṣibhirīḍyo nūtanairuta sa devāneha vakṣati

translations.griffith: Worthy is Agni to be praised by living as by ancient seers.  He shall bring hitherward the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निना रयिमश्नवत पोषमेव दिवे-दिवे यशसं वीरवत्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: aghninā rayimaśnavat poṣameva dive-dive yaśasaṃ vīravattamam

translations.griffith: Through Agni man obtaineth wealth, yea, plenty waxing day by day,  Most rich in heroes, glorious.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने यं यज्ञमध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि स इद्देवेषु गछति |||
verses.transliteration: aghne yaṃ yajñamadhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūrasi sa iddeveṣu ghachati

translations.griffith: Agni, the perfect sacrifice which thou encompassest about  Verily goeth to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्होता कविक्रतुः सत्यश्चित्रश्रवस्तमः देवो देवेभिरा गमत |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirhotā kavikratuḥ satyaścitraśravastamaḥ devo devebhirā ghamat

translations.griffith: May Agni, sapient-minded Priest, truthful, most gloriously great,  The God, come hither with the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: यदङग दाशुषे तवमग्ने भद्रं करिष्यसि तवेत तत सत्यमङगिरः |||
verses.transliteration: yadaṅgha dāśuṣe tvamaghne bhadraṃ kariṣyasi tavet tat satyamaṅghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Whatever blessing, Agni, thou wilt grant unto thy worshipper,  That, Aṅgiras, is indeed thy truth.

verses.sanskrit: उप तवाग्ने दिवे-दिवे दोषावस्तर्धिया वयम नमो भरन्त एमसि |||
verses.transliteration: upa tvāghne dive-dive doṣāvastardhiyā vayam namo bharanta emasi

translations.griffith: To thee, dispeller of the night, O Agni, day by day with prayer  Bringing thee reverence, we come

verses.sanskrit: राजन्तमध्वराणां गोपां रतस्य दीदिविम वर्धमानंस्वे दमे |||
verses.transliteration: rājantamadhvarāṇāṃ ghopāṃ ṛtasya dīdivim vardhamānaṃsve dame

translations.griffith: Ruler of sacrifices, guard of Law eternal, radiant One,  Increasing in thine own abode.

verses.sanskrit: स नः पितेव सूनवे.अग्ने सूपायनो भव सचस्वा नः सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ piteva sūnave.aghne sūpāyano bhava sacasvā naḥ svastaye

translations.griffith: Be to us easy of approach, even as a father to his son:  Agni, be with us for our weal.

verses.sanskrit: वायवा याहि दर्शतेमे सोमा अरंक्र्ताः तेषां पाहि शरुधी हवम |||
verses.transliteration: vāyavā yāhi darśateme somā araṃkṛtāḥ teṣāṃ pāhi śrudhī havam

translations.griffith: BEAUTIFUL Vāyu, come, for thee these Soma drops have been prepared:  Drink of them, hearken to our call.

verses.sanskrit: वाय उक्थेभिर्जरन्ते तवामछा जरितारः सुतसोमा अहर्विदः |||
verses.transliteration: vāya ukthebhirjarante tvāmachā jaritāraḥ sutasomā aharvidaḥ

translations.griffith: Knowing the days, with Soma juice poured forth, the singers glorify  Thee, Vāyu, with their hymns of praise.

verses.sanskrit: वायो तव परप्र्ञ्चती धेना जिगाति दाशुषे उरूची सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: vāyo tava prapṛñcatī dhenā jighāti dāśuṣe urūcī somapītaye

translations.griffith: Vāyu, thy penetrating stream goes forth unto the worshipper,  Far-spreading for the Soma draught.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रवायू इमे सुता उप परयोभिरा गतम इन्दवो वामुशन्ति हि |||
verses.transliteration: indravāyū ime sutā upa prayobhirā ghatam indavo vāmuśanti hi

translations.griffith: These, Indra-Vāyu, have been shed; come for our offered dainties’ sake:  The drops are yearning for you both.

verses.sanskrit: वायविन्द्रश्च चेतथः सुतानां वाजिनीवसू तावा यातमुप दरवत |||
verses.transliteration: vāyavindraśca cetathaḥ sutānāṃ vājinīvasū tāvā yātamupa dravat

translations.griffith: Well do ye mark libations, ye Vāyu and Indra, rich in spoil!  So come ye swiftly hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: वायविन्द्रश्च सुन्वत आ यातमुप निष्क्र्तम मक्ष्वित्था धिया नरा |||
verses.transliteration: vāyavindraśca sunvata ā yātamupa niṣkṛtam makṣvitthā dhiyā narā

translations.griffith: Vāyu and Indra, come to what the Soma-presser hath prepared:  Soon, Heroes, thus I make my prayer.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रं हुवे पूतदक्षं वरुणं च रिशादसम धियं घर्ताचीं साधन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: mitraṃ huve pūtadakṣaṃ varuṇaṃ ca riśādasam dhiyaṃ ghṛtācīṃ sādhantā

translations.griffith: Mitra, of holy strength, I call, and foe-destroying Varuṇa,  Who make the oil-fed rite complete.

verses.sanskrit: रतेन मित्रावरुणाव रताव्र्धाव रतस्प्र्शा करतुं बर्हन्तमाशाथे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtena mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvṛdhāv ṛtaspṛśā kratuṃ bṛhantamāśāthe

translations.griffith: Mitra and Varuṇa, through Law, lovers and cherishers of Law,  Have ye obtained your might power

verses.sanskrit: कवी नो मित्रावरुणा तुविजाता उरुक्षया दक्षं दधाते अपसम |||
verses.transliteration: kavī no mitrāvaruṇā tuvijātā urukṣayā dakṣaṃ dadhāte apasam

translations.griffith: Our Sages, Mitra-Varuṇa, wide dominion, strong by birth,  Vouchsafe us strength that worketh well.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना यज्वरीरिषो दरवत्पाणी शुभस पती पुरुभुजाचनस्यतम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā yajvarīriṣo dravatpāṇī śubhas patī purubhujācanasyatam

translations.griffith: YE Aśvins, rich in treasure, Lords of splendour, having nimble hands,  Accept the sacrificial food.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना पुरुदंससा नरा शवीरया धिया धिष्ण्या वनतं गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā purudaṃsasā narā śavīrayā dhiyā dhiṣṇyā vanataṃ ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Ye Aśvins, rich in wondrous deeds, ye heroes worthy of our praise,  Accept our songs with mighty thought.

verses.sanskrit: दस्रा युवाकवः सुता नासत्या वर्क्तबर्हिषः आ यातंरुद्रवर्तनी |||
verses.transliteration: dasrā yuvākavaḥ sutā nāsatyā vṛktabarhiṣaḥ ā yātaṃrudravartanī

translations.griffith: Nāsatyas, wonder-workers, yours are these libations with clipt grass:  Come ye whose paths are red with flame.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा याहि चित्रभानो सुता इमे तवायवः अण्वीभिस्तना पूतासः |||
verses.transliteration: indrā yāhi citrabhāno sutā ime tvāyavaḥ aṇvībhistanā pūtāsaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra marvellously bright, come, these libations long for thee,  Thus by fine fingers purified.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा याहि धियेषितो विप्रजूतः सुतावतः उप बरह्माणि वाघतः |||
verses.transliteration: indrā yāhi dhiyeṣito viprajūtaḥ sutāvataḥ upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ

translations.griffith: Urged by the holy singer, sped by song, come, Indra, to the prayers,  Of the libation-pouring priest.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा याहि तूतुजान उप बरह्माणि हरिवः सुते दधिष्वनश्चनः |||
verses.transliteration: indrā yāhi tūtujāna upa brahmāṇi harivaḥ sute dadhiṣvanaścanaḥ

translations.griffith: Approach, O Indra, hasting thee, Lord of Bay Horses, to the prayers.  In our libation take delight.

verses.sanskrit: ओमासश्चर्षणीध्र्तो विश्वे देवास आ गत दाश्वांसो दाशुषः सुतम |||
verses.transliteration: omāsaścarṣaṇīdhṛto viśve devāsa ā ghata dāśvāṃso dāśuṣaḥ sutam

translations.griffith: Ye Viśvedevas, who protect, reward, and cherish men, approach  Your worshipper's drink-offering.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवासो अप्तुरः सुतमा गन्त तूर्णयः उस्रा इवस्वसराणि |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāso apturaḥ sutamā ghanta tūrṇayaḥ usrā ivasvasarāṇi

translations.griffith: Ye Viśvedevas, swift at work, come hither quickly to the draught,  As milch-kine hasten to their stalls.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवासो अस्रिध एहिमायासो अद्रुहः मेधं जुषन्त वह्नयः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devāso asridha ehimāyāso adruhaḥ medhaṃ juṣanta vahnayaḥ

translations.griffith: The Viśvedevas, changing shape like serpents, fearless, void of guile,  Bearers, accept the sacred draught

verses.sanskrit: पावका नः सरस्वती वाजेभिर्वाजिनीवती यज्ञं वष्टु धियावसुः |||
verses.transliteration: pāvakā naḥ sarasvatī vājebhirvājinīvatī yajñaṃ vaṣṭu dhiyāvasuḥ

translations.griffith: Wealthy in spoil, enriched with hymns, may bright  Sarasvatī  desire,  With eager love, our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: चोदयित्री सून्र्तानां चेतन्ती सुमतीनाम यज्ञं दधे सरस्वती |||
verses.transliteration: codayitrī sūnṛtānāṃ cetantī sumatīnām yajñaṃ dadhe sarasvatī

translations.griffith: Inciter of all pleasant songs, inspirer of all gracious thought,  Sarasvatī accept our rite

verses.sanskrit: महो अर्णः सरस्वती पर चेतयति केतुना धियो विश्वा वि राजति |||
verses.transliteration: maho arṇaḥ sarasvatī pra cetayati ketunā dhiyo viśvā vi rājati

translations.griffith: Sarasvatī, the mighty flood,—she with her light illuminates,  She brightens every pious thought.

verses.sanskrit: सुरूपक्र्त्नुमूतये सुदुघामिव गोदुहे जुहूमसि दयवि-दयवि |||
verses.transliteration: surūpakṛtnumūtaye sudughāmiva ghoduhe juhūmasi dyavi-dyavi

translations.griffith: As a good cow to him who milks, we call the doer of fair deeds,  To our assistance day by day.

verses.sanskrit: उप नः सवना गहि सोमस्य सोमपाः पिब गोदा इद रेवतोमदः |||
verses.transliteration: upa naḥ savanā ghahi somasya somapāḥ piba ghodā id revatomadaḥ

translations.griffith: Come thou to our libations, drink of Soma; Soma-drinker thou!  The rich One's rapture giveth kine.

verses.sanskrit: अथा ते अन्तमानां विद्याम सुमतीनाम मा नो अति खय आगहि |||
verses.transliteration: athā te antamānāṃ vidyāma sumatīnām mā no ati khya āghahi

translations.griffith: So may we be acquainted with thine innermost benevolence:  Neglect us not, come hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: परेहि विग्रमस्त्र्तमिन्द्रं पर्छा विपश्चितम यस्ते सखिभ्य आ वरम |||
verses.transliteration: parehi vighramastṛtamindraṃ pṛchā vipaścitam yaste sakhibhya ā varam

translations.griffith: Go to the wise unconquered One, ask thou of Indra, skilled in song,  Him who is better than thy friends.

verses.sanskrit: उत बरुवन्तु नो निदो निरन्यतश्चिदारत दधाना इन्द्र इद दुवः |||
verses.transliteration: uta bruvantu no nido niranyataścidārata dadhānā indra id duvaḥ

translations.griffith: Whether the men who mock us say, Depart unto another place,  Ye who serve Indra and none else;

verses.sanskrit: उत नः सुभगानरिर्वोचेयुर्दस्म कर्ष्टयः सयामेदिन्द्रस्य शर्मणि |||
verses.transliteration: uta naḥ subhaghānarirvoceyurdasma kṛṣṭayaḥ syāmedindrasya śarmaṇi

translations.griffith: Or whether, God of wondrous deeds, all our true people call us blest,  Still may we dwell in Indra's care.

verses.sanskrit: एमाशुमाशवे भर यज्ञश्रियं नर्मादनम पतयन मन्दयत्सखम |||
verses.transliteration: emāśumāśave bhara yajñaśriyaṃ nṛmādanam patayan mandayatsakham

translations.griffith: Unto the swift One bring the swift, man-cheering, grace of sacrifice,  That to the Friend gives wings and joy.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य पीत्वा शतक्रतो घनो वर्त्राणामभवः परावो वाजेषु वाजिनम |||
verses.transliteration: asya pītvā śatakrato ghano vṛtrāṇāmabhavaḥ prāvo vājeṣu vājinam

translations.griffith: Thou, Śatakratu, drankest this and wast the Vṛtras’ slayer; thou  Helpest the warrior in the fray.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा वाजेषु वाजिनं वाजयामः शतक्रतो धनानामिन्द्र सातये |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā vājeṣu vājinaṃ vājayāmaḥ śatakrato dhanānāmindra sātaye

translations.griffith: We strengthen, Śatakratu, thee, yea, thee the powerful in fight,  That, Indra, we may win us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: यो रायो.अवनिर्महान सुपारः सुन्वतः सखा तस्मा इन्द्राय गायत |||
verses.transliteration: yo rāyo.avanirmahān supāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā tasmā indrāya ghāyata

translations.griffith: To him the mighty stream of wealth, prompt friend of him who pours the juice,  Yea, to this Indra sing your song.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवेता नि षीदतेन्द्रमभि पर गायत सखाय सतोमवाहसः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvetā ni ṣīdatendramabhi pra ghāyata sakhāya stomavāhasaḥ

translations.griffith: O COME ye hither, sit ye down: to Indra sing ye forth, your song,  companions, bringing hymns of praise.

verses.sanskrit: पुरूतमं पुरूणामीशानं वार्याणाम इन्द्रं सोमे सचा सुते |||
verses.transliteration: purūtamaṃ purūṇāmīśānaṃ vāryāṇām indraṃ some sacā sute

translations.griffith: To him the richest of the rich, the Lord of treasures excellent,  Indra, with Soma juice outpoured.

verses.sanskrit: स घा नो योग आ भुवत स राये स पुरन्ध्याम गमद वाजेभिरा स नः |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghā no yogha ā bhuvat sa rāye sa purandhyām ghamad vājebhirā sa naḥ

translations.griffith: May he stand by us in our need and in abundance for our wealth:  May he come nigh us with his strength.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य संस्थे न वर्ण्वते हरी समत्सु शत्रवः तस्मा इन्द्राय गायत |||
verses.transliteration: yasya saṃsthe na vṛṇvate harī samatsu śatravaḥ tasmā indrāya ghāyata

translations.griffith: Whose pair of tawny horses yoked in battles foemen challenge not:  To him, to Indra sing your song.

verses.sanskrit: सुतपाव्ने सुता इमे शुचयो यन्ति वीतये सोमासो दध्याशिरः |||
verses.transliteration: sutapāvne sutā ime śucayo yanti vītaye somāso dadhyāśiraḥ

translations.griffith: Nigh to the Soma-drinker come, for his enjoyment, these pure drops,  The Somas mingled with the curd.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सुतस्य पीतये सद्यो वर्द्धो अजायथाः इन्द्र जयैष्ठ्याय सुक्रतो |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ sutasya pītaye sadyo vṛddho ajāyathāḥ indra jyaiṣṭhyāya sukrato

translations.griffith: Thou, grown at once to perfect strength, wast born to drink the Soma juice,  Strong Indra, for preëminence.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा विशन्त्वाशवः सोमास इन्द्र गिर्वणः शं ते सन्तु परचेतसे |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā viśantvāśavaḥ somāsa indra ghirvaṇaḥ śaṃ te santu pracetase

translations.griffith: O Indra, lover of the song, may these quick Somas enter thee:  May they bring bliss to thee the Sage.

verses.sanskrit: तवां सतोमा अवीव्र्धन तवामुक्था शतक्रतो तवां वर्धन्तु नो गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ stomā avīvṛdhan tvāmukthā śatakrato tvāṃ vardhantu no ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Our chants of praise have strengthened thee, O Śatakratu, and our lauds  So strengthen thee the songs we sing.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षितोतिः सनेदिमं वाजमिन्द्रः सहस्रिणम यस्मिन विश्वानि पौंस्या |||
verses.transliteration: akṣitotiḥ sanedimaṃ vājamindraḥ sahasriṇam yasmin viśvāni pauṃsyā

translations.griffith: Indra, whose succour never fails, accept these viands thousandfold,  Wherein all manly powers abide.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो मर्ता अभि दरुहन तनूनामिन्द्र गिर्वणः ईशानो यवया वधम |||
verses.transliteration: mā no martā abhi druhan tanūnāmindra ghirvaṇaḥ īśāno yavayā vadham

translations.griffith: O Indra, thou who lovest song, let no man hurt our bodies, keep  Slaughter far from us, for thou canst.

verses.sanskrit: युञ्जन्ति बरध्नमरुषं चरन्तं परि तस्थुषः रोचन्तेरोचना दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: yuñjanti bradhnamaruṣaṃ carantaṃ pari tasthuṣaḥ rocanterocanā divi

translations.griffith: They who stand round him as he moves harness the bright, the ruddy Steed  The lights are shining in the sky.

verses.sanskrit: युञ्जन्त्यस्य काम्या हरी विपक्षसा रथे शोणा धर्ष्णू नर्वाहसा |||
verses.transliteration: yuñjantyasya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛvāhasā

translations.griffith: On both sides to the car they yoke the two bay coursers dear to him,  Bold, tawny, bearers of the Chief.

verses.sanskrit: केतुं कर्ण्वन्नकेतवे पेशो मर्या अपेशसे समुषद्भिरजायथाः |||
verses.transliteration: ketuṃ kṛṇvannaketave peśo maryā apeśase samuṣadbhirajāyathāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, making light where no light was, and form, O men: where form was not,  Wast born together with the Dawns.

verses.sanskrit: आदह सवधामनु पुनर्गर्भत्वमेरिरे दधाना नामयज्ञियम |||
verses.transliteration: ādaha svadhāmanu punargharbhatvamerire dadhānā nāmayajñiyam

translations.griffith: Thereafter they, as is their wont, threw off the state of babes unborn,  Assuming sacrificial names.

verses.sanskrit: वीळु चिदारुजत्नुभिर्गुहा चिदिन्द्र वह्निभिः अविन्द उस्रिया अनु |||
verses.transliteration: vīḷu cidārujatnubhirghuhā cidindra vahnibhiḥ avinda usriyā anu

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, with the Tempest-Gods, the breakers down of what is firm,  Foundest the kine even in the cave.

verses.sanskrit: देवयन्तो यथा मतिमछा विदद्वसुं गिरः महामनूषत शरुतम |||
verses.transliteration: devayanto yathā matimachā vidadvasuṃ ghiraḥ mahāmanūṣata śrutam

translations.griffith: Worshipping even as they list, singers laud him who findeth wealth,  The far-renowned, the mighty One.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रेण सं हि दर्क्षसे संजग्मानो अबिभ्युषा मन्दू समानवर्चसा |||
verses.transliteration: indreṇa saṃ hi dṛkṣase saṃjaghmāno abibhyuṣā mandū samānavarcasā

translations.griffith: Mayest thou verily be seen coming by fearless Indra's side:  Both joyous, equal in your sheen.

verses.sanskrit: अनवद्यैरभिद्युभिर्मखः सहस्वदर्चति गणैरिन्द्रस्य काम्यैः |||
verses.transliteration: anavadyairabhidyubhirmakhaḥ sahasvadarcati ghaṇairindrasya kāmyaiḥ

translations.griffith: With Indra's well beloved hosts, the blameless, hastening to heaven,  The sacrificer cries aloud.

verses.sanskrit: अतः परिज्मन्ना गहि दिवो वा रोचनादधि समस्मिन्न्र्ञ्जते गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: ataḥ parijmannā ghahi divo vā rocanādadhi samasminnṛñjate ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Come from this place, O Wanderer, or downward from the light of heaven:  Our songs of praise all yearn for this.

verses.sanskrit: इतो वा सातिमीमहे दिवो वा पार्थिवादधि इन्द्रं महोवा रजसः |||
verses.transliteration: ito vā sātimīmahe divo vā pārthivādadhi indraṃ mahovā rajasaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra we seek to give us help, from here, from heaven above the earth,  Or from the spacious firmament.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमिद गाथिनो बर्हदिन्द्रमर्केभिरर्किणः इन्द्रं वाणीरनूषत |||
verses.transliteration: indramid ghāthino bṛhadindramarkebhirarkiṇaḥ indraṃ vāṇīranūṣata

translations.griffith: INDRA the singers with high praise, Indra reciters with their lauds,  Indra the choirs have glorified.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र इद धर्योः सचा सम्मिश्ल आ वचोयुजा इन्द्रो वज्रीहिरण्ययः |||
verses.transliteration: indra id dharyoḥ sacā sammiśla ā vacoyujā indro vajrīhiraṇyayaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra hath ever close to him his two bay steeds and word-yoked car,  Indra the golden, thunder-armed.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो दीर्घाय चक्षस आ सूर्यं रोहयद दिवि वि गोभिरद्रिमैरयत |||
verses.transliteration: indro dīrghāya cakṣasa ā sūryaṃ rohayad divi vi ghobhiradrimairayat

translations.griffith: Indra hath raised the Sun on high in heaven, that he may see afar:  He burst the mountain for the kine.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र वाजेषु नो.अव सहस्रप्रधनेषु च उग्र उग्राभिरूतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: indra vājeṣu no.ava sahasrapradhaneṣu ca ughra ughrābhirūtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Help us, O Indra, in the frays, yea, frays, where thousand spoils are gained,  With awful aids, O awful One.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं वयं महाधन इन्द्रमर्भे हवामहे युजं वर्त्रेषु वज्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vayaṃ mahādhana indramarbhe havāmahe yujaṃ vṛtreṣu vajriṇam

translations.griffith: In mighty battle we invoke Indra, Indra in lesser fight,  The Friend who bends his bolt at fiends.

verses.sanskrit: स नो वर्षन्नमुं चरुं सत्रादावन्नपा वर्धि अस्मभ्यमप्रतिष्कुतः |||
verses.transliteration: sa no vṛṣannamuṃ caruṃ satrādāvannapā vṛdhi asmabhyamapratiṣkutaḥ

translations.griffith: Unclose, our manly Hero, thou for ever bounteous, yonder cloud,  For us, thou irresistible.

verses.sanskrit: तुञ्जे-तुञ्जे य उत्तरे सतोमा इन्द्रस्य वज्रिणः न विन्धेस्य सुष्टुतिम |||
verses.transliteration: tuñje-tuñje ya uttare stomā indrasya vajriṇaḥ na vindheasya suṣṭutim

translations.griffith: Still higher, at each strain of mine, thunder-armed Indra's praises rise:  I find no laud worthy of him.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा यूथेव वंसगः कर्ष्टीरियर्त्योजसा ईशानो अप्रतिष्कुतः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā yūtheva vaṃsaghaḥ kṛṣṭīriyartyojasā īśāno apratiṣkutaḥ

translations.griffith: Even as the bull drives on the herds, he drives the people with his might,  The Ruler irresistible:

verses.sanskrit: य एकश्चर्षणीनां वसूनामिरज्यति इन्द्रः पञ्च कसितीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ya ekaścarṣaṇīnāṃ vasūnāmirajyati indraḥ pañca ksitīnām

translations.griffith: Indra who rules with single sway men, riches, and the fivefold race  Of those who dwell upon the earth.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं वो विश्वतस परि हवामहे जनेभ्यः अस्माकमस्तु केवलः |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vo viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ asmākamastu kevalaḥ

translations.griffith: For your sake from each side we call Indra away from other men:  Ours, and none others’, may he be.

verses.sanskrit: एन्द्र सानसिं रयिं सजित्वानं सदासहम वर्षिष्ठमूतये भर |||
verses.transliteration: endra sānasiṃ rayiṃ sajitvānaṃ sadāsaham varṣiṣṭhamūtaye bhara

translations.griffith: INDRA, bring wealth that gives delight, the victor's ever-conquering wealth,  Most excellent, to be our aid;

verses.sanskrit: नि येन मुष्टिहत्यया नि वर्त्रा रुणधामहै तवोतासो नयर्वता |||
verses.transliteration: ni yena muṣṭihatyayā ni vṛtrā ruṇadhāmahai tvotāso nyarvatā

translations.griffith: By means of which we may repel our foes in battle hand to hand,  By thee assisted with the car.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र तवोतास आ वयं वज्रं घना ददीमहि जयेम सं युधि सप्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: indra tvotāsa ā vayaṃ vajraṃ ghanā dadīmahi jayema saṃ yudhi spṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: Aided by thee, the thunder-armed, Indra, may we lift up the bolt,  And conquer all our foes in fight.

verses.sanskrit: वयं शूरेभिरस्त्र्भिरिन्द्र तवया युजा वयम सासह्याम पर्तन्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ śūrebhirastṛbhirindra tvayā yujā vayam sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ

translations.griffith: With thee, O India, for ally with missile-darting heroes, may  We conquer our embattled foes.

verses.sanskrit: महानिन्द्रः परश्च नु महित्वमस्तु वज्रिणे दयौर्नप्रथिना शवः |||
verses.transliteration: mahānindraḥ paraśca nu mahitvamastu vajriṇe dyaurnaprathinā śavaḥ

translations.griffith: Mighty is Indra, yea supreme; greatness be his, the Thunderer:  Wide as the heaven extends his power

verses.sanskrit: समोहे वा य आशत नरस्तोकस्य सनितौ विप्रासो वा धियायवः |||
verses.transliteration: samohe vā ya āśata narastokasya sanitau viprāso vā dhiyāyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Which aideth those to win them sons, who come as heroes to the fight,  Or singers loving holy thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: यः कुक्षिः सोमपातमः समुद्र इव पिन्वते उर्वीरापो न काकुदः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ kukṣiḥ somapātamaḥ samudra iva pinvate urvīrāpo na kākudaḥ

translations.griffith: His belly, drinking deepest draughts of Soma, like an ocean swells,  Like wide streams from the cope of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: एवा हयस्य सून्र्ता विरप्शी गोमती मही पक्वा शाखा न दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: evā hyasya sūnṛtā virapśī ghomatī mahī pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: So also is his excellence, great, vigorous, rich in cattle, like  A ripe branch to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: एवा हि ते विभूतय ऊतय इन्द्र मावते सद्यश्चित सन्तिदाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: evā hi te vibhūtaya ūtaya indra māvate sadyaścit santidāśuṣe

translations.griffith: For verily thy mighty powers, Indra, are saving helps at once  Unto a worshipper like me.

verses.sanskrit: एवा हयस्य काम्या सतोम उक्थं च शंस्या इन्द्राय सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: evā hyasya kāmyā stoma ukthaṃ ca śaṃsyā indrāya somapītaye

translations.griffith: So are his lovely gifts; let lauds and praises be to Indra sung,  That he may drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रेहि मत्स्यन्धसो विश्वेभिः सोमपर्वभिः महानभिष्टिरोजसा |||
verses.transliteration: indrehi matsyandhaso viśvebhiḥ somaparvabhiḥ mahānabhiṣṭirojasā

translations.griffith: COME, Indra, and delight thee with the juice at all the Soma feasts,  Protector, mighty in thy strength.

verses.sanskrit: एमेनं सर्जता सुते मन्दिमिन्द्राय मन्दिने चक्रिं विश्वानि चक्रये |||
verses.transliteration: emenaṃ sṛjatā sute mandimindrāya mandine cakriṃ viśvāni cakraye

translations.griffith: To Indra pour ye forth the juice, the active gladdening juice to him  The gladdening, omnific God.

verses.sanskrit: मत्स्वा सुशिप्र मन्दिभिः सतोमेभिर्विश्वचर्षणे सचैषुसवनेष्वा |||
verses.transliteration: matsvā suśipra mandibhiḥ stomebhirviśvacarṣaṇe sacaiṣusavaneṣvā

translations.griffith: O Lord of all men, fair of cheek, rejoice thee in the gladdening lauds,  Present at these drink-offerings.

verses.sanskrit: अस्र्ग्रमिन्द्र ते गिरः परति तवामुदहासत अजोषा वर्षभं पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: asṛghramindra te ghiraḥ prati tvāmudahāsata ajoṣā vṛṣabhaṃ patim

translations.griffith: Songs have outpoured themselves to thee, Indra, the strong, the guardian Lord,  And raised themselves unsatisfied.

verses.sanskrit: सं चोदय चित्रमर्वाग राध इन्द्र वरेण्यम असदित ते विभु परभु |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ codaya citramarvāgh rādha indra vareṇyam asadit te vibhu prabhu

translations.griffith: Send to us bounty manifold, O Indra, worthy of our wish,  For power supreme is only thine.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मान सु तत्र चोदयेन्द्र राये रभस्वतः तुविद्युम्न यशस्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: asmān su tatra codayendra rāye rabhasvataḥ tuvidyumna yaśasvataḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, stimulate thereto us emulously fain for wealth,  And glorious, O most splendid One.

verses.sanskrit: सं गोमदिन्द्र वाजवदस्मे पर्थु शरवो बर्हत विश्वायुर्धेह्यक्षितम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ ghomadindra vājavadasme pṛthu śravo bṛhat viśvāyurdhehyakṣitam

translations.griffith: Give, Indra, wide and lofty fame, wealthy in cattle and in strength,  Lasting our life-time, failing not.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे धेहि शरवो बर्हद दयुम्नं सहस्रसातमम इन्द्र ता रथिनीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: asme dhehi śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ sahasrasātamam indra tā rathinīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Grant us high fame, O Indra, grant riches bestowing thousands, those  Fair fruits of earth borne home in wains.

verses.sanskrit: वसोरिन्द्रं वसुपतिं गीर्भिर्ग्र्णन्त रग्मियम होम गन्तारमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: vasorindraṃ vasupatiṃ ghīrbhirghṛṇanta ṛghmiyam homa ghantāramūtaye

translations.griffith: Praising with songs the praise-worthy who cometh to our aid, we call  Indra, the Treasure-Lord of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: सुते-सुते नयोकसे बर्हद बर्हत एदरिः इन्द्राय शूषमर्चति |||
verses.transliteration: sute-sute nyokase bṛhad bṛhata edariḥ indrāya śūṣamarcati

translations.griffith: To lofty Indra, dweller by each libation, the pious man  Sings forth aloud a strengthening hymn.

verses.sanskrit: गायन्ति तवा गायत्रिणो.अर्चन्त्यर्कमर्किणः बरह्माणस्त्वा शतक्रत उद वंशमिव येमिरे |||
verses.transliteration: ghāyanti tvā ghāyatriṇo.arcantyarkamarkiṇaḥ brahmāṇastvā śatakrata ud vaṃśamiva yemire

translations.griffith: THE chanters hymn thee, they who say the word of praise magnify thee.  The priests have raised thee up on high, O Śatakratu, like a pole.

verses.sanskrit: यत सानोः सानुमारुहद भूर्यस्पष्ट कर्त्वम तदिन्द्रो अर्थं चेतति यूथेन वर्ष्णिरेजति |||
verses.transliteration: yat sānoḥ sānumāruhad bhūryaspaṣṭa kartvam tadindro arthaṃ cetati yūthena vṛṣṇirejati

translations.griffith: As up he clomb from ridge to ridge and looked upon the toilsome task,  Indra observes this wish of his, and the Rain hastens with his troop.

verses.sanskrit: युक्ष्वा हि केशिना हरी वर्षणा कक्ष्यप्रा अथा न इन्द्र सोमपा गिरामुपश्रुतिं चर |||
verses.transliteration: yukṣvā hi keśinā harī vṛṣaṇā kakṣyaprā athā na indra somapā ghirāmupaśrutiṃ cara

translations.griffith: Harness thy pair of strong bay steeds, long-maned, whose bodies fill the girths,  And, Indra, Soma-drinker, come to listen to our songs of praise.

verses.sanskrit: एहि सतोमानभि सवराभि गर्णीह्या रुव बरह्म च नो वसोसचेन्द्र यज्ञं च वर्धय |||
verses.transliteration: ehi stomānabhi svarābhi ghṛṇīhyā ruva brahma ca no vasosacendra yajñaṃ ca vardhaya

translations.griffith: Come hither, answer thou the song, sing in approval, cry aloud.  Good Indra, make our prayer succeed, and prosper this our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: उक्थमिन्द्राय शंस्यं वर्धनं पुरुनिष्षिधे शक्रो यथा सुतेषु णो रारणत सख्येषु च |||
verses.transliteration: ukthamindrāya śaṃsyaṃ vardhanaṃ puruniṣṣidhe śakro yathā suteṣu ṇo rāraṇat sakhyeṣu ca

translations.griffith: To Indra must a laud be said, to strengthen him who freely gives,  That Śakra may take pleasure in our friendship and drink-offerings.

verses.sanskrit: तमित सखित्व ईमहे तं राये तं सुवीर्ये स शक्र उत नः शकदिन्द्रो वसु दयमानः |||
verses.transliteration: tamit sakhitva īmahe taṃ rāye taṃ suvīrye sa śakra uta naḥ śakadindro vasu dayamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Him, him we seek for friendship, him for riches and heroic might.  For Indra, he is Śakra, he shall aid us while he gives us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: सुविव्र्तं सुनिरजमिन्द्र तवादातमिद यशः गवामपव्रजं वर्धि कर्णुष्व राधो अद्रिवः |||
verses.transliteration: suvivṛtaṃ sunirajamindra tvādātamid yaśaḥ ghavāmapavrajaṃ vṛdhi kṛṇuṣva rādho adrivaḥ

translations.griffith: Easy to turn and drive away, Indra, is spoil bestowed by thee.  Unclose the stable of the kine, and give us wealth O Thunder-armed

verses.sanskrit: नहि तवा रोदसी उभे रघायमाणमिन्वतः जेषः सवर्वतीरपः सं गा अस्मभ्यं धूनुहि |||
verses.transliteration: nahi tvā rodasī ubhe ṛghāyamāṇaminvataḥ jeṣaḥ svarvatīrapaḥ saṃ ghā asmabhyaṃ dhūnuhi

translations.griffith: The heaven and earth contain thee not, together, in thy wrathful mood.  Win us the waters of the sky, and send us kine abundantly.

verses.sanskrit: आश्रुत्कर्ण शरुधी हवं नू चिद दधिष्व मे गिरः इन्द्र सतोममिमं मम कर्ष्वा युजश्चिदन्तरम |||
verses.transliteration: āśrutkarṇa śrudhī havaṃ nū cid dadhiṣva me ghiraḥ indra stomamimaṃ mama kṛṣvā yujaścidantaram

translations.griffith: Hear, thou whose ear is quick, my call; take to thee readily my songs  O Indra, let this laud of mine come nearer even than thy friend.

verses.sanskrit: विद्मा हि तवा वर्षन्तमं वाजेषु हवनश्रुतम वर्षन्तमस्य हूमह ऊतिं सहस्रसातमाम |||
verses.transliteration: vidmā hi tvā vṛṣantamaṃ vājeṣu havanaśrutam vṛṣantamasya hūmaha ūtiṃ sahasrasātamām

translations.griffith: We know thee mightiest of all, in battles hearer of our cry.  Of thee most mighty we invoke the aid that giveth thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit: आ तू न इन्द्र कौशिक मन्दसानः सुतं पिब नव्यमायुःप्र सू तिर कर्धी सहस्रसां रषिम |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū na indra kauśika mandasānaḥ sutaṃ piba navyamāyuḥpra sū tira kṛdhī sahasrasāṃ ṛṣim

translations.griffith: O Indra, Son of Kuśika, drink our libation with delight.  Prolong our life anew, and cause the seer to win a thousand gifts.

verses.sanskrit: परि तवा गिर्वणो गिर इमा भवन्तु विश्वतः वर्द्धायुमनु वर्द्धयो जुष्टा भवन्तु जुष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: pari tvā ghirvaṇo ghira imā bhavantu viśvataḥ vṛddhāyumanu vṛddhayo juṣṭā bhavantu juṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Lover of song, may these our songs on every side encompass thee:  Strengthening thee of lengthened life, may they be dear delights to thee.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं विश्वा अवीव्र्धन समुद्रव्यचसं गिरः रथीतमंरथीनां वाजानां सत्पतिं पतिम |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhan samudravyacasaṃ ghiraḥ rathītamaṃrathīnāṃ vājānāṃ satpatiṃ patim

translations.griffith: ALL sacred songs have magnified Indra expansive as the sea,  The best of warriors borne on cars, the Lord, the very Lord of strength.

verses.sanskrit: सख्ये त इन्द्र वाजिनो मा भेम शवसस पते तवामभि परणोनुमो जेतारमपराजितम |||
verses.transliteration: sakhye ta indra vājino mā bhema śavasas pate tvāmabhi praṇonumo jetāramaparājitam

translations.griffith: Strong in thy friendship, Indra, Lord of power and might, we have no fear.  We glorify with praises thee, the never-conquered conqueror.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वीरिन्द्रस्य रातयो न वि दस्यन्त्यूतयः यदी वाजस्य गोमत सतोत्र्भ्यो मंहते मघम |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvīrindrasya rātayo na vi dasyantyūtayaḥ yadī vājasya ghomata stotṛbhyo maṃhate magham

translations.griffith: The gifts of Indra from of old, his saving succours, never fail,  When to the praise-singers he gives the boon of substance rich in kine.

verses.sanskrit: पुरां भिन्दुर्युवा कविरमितौजा अजायत इन्द्रो विश्वस्यकर्मणो धर्ता वज्री पुरुष्टुतः |||
verses.transliteration: purāṃ bhinduryuvā kaviramitaujā ajāyata indro viśvasyakarmaṇo dhartā vajrī puruṣṭutaḥ

translations.griffith: Crusher of forts, the young, the wise, of strength unmeasured, was he born  Sustainer of each sacred rite, Indra, the Thunderer, much-extolled.

verses.sanskrit: तवं वलस्य गोमतो.अपावरद्रिवो बिलम तवां देवा अबिभ्युषस्तुज्यमानास आविषुः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ valasya ghomato.apāvaradrivo bilam tvāṃ devā abibhyuṣastujyamānāsa āviṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Lord of the thunder, thou didst burst the cave of Vala rich in cows.  The Gods came pressing to thy side, and free from terror aided thee,

verses.sanskrit: तवाहं शूर रातिभिः परत्यायं सिन्धुमावदन उपातिष्ठन्त गिर्वणो विदुष टे तस्य कारवः |||
verses.transliteration: tavāhaṃ śūra rātibhiḥ pratyāyaṃ sindhumāvadan upātiṣṭhanta ghirvaṇo viduṣ ṭe tasya kāravaḥ

translations.griffith: I, Hero, through thy bounties am come to the flood addressing thee.  Song-lover, here the singers stand and testify to thee thereof.

verses.sanskrit: मायाभिरिन्द्र मायिनं तवं शुष्णमवातिरः विदुष टे तस्य मेधिरास्तेषां शरवांस्युत तिर |||
verses.transliteration: māyābhirindra māyinaṃ tvaṃ śuṣṇamavātiraḥ viduṣ ṭe tasya medhirāsteṣāṃ śravāṃsyut tira

translations.griffith: The wily Śuṣṇa, Indra! thou o’erthrewest with thy wondrous powers.  The wise beheld this deed of thine: now go beyond their eulogies.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमीशानमोजसाभि सतोमा अनूषत सहस्रं यस्य रातय उत वा सन्ति भूयसीः |||
verses.transliteration: indramīśānamojasābhi stomā anūṣata sahasraṃ yasya rātaya uta vā santi bhūyasīḥ

translations.griffith: Our songs of praise have glorified Indra who ruleth by his might,  Whose precious gifts in thousands come, yea, even more abundantly.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं दूतं वर्णीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम अस्य यज्ञस्य सुक्रतुम |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam asya yajñasya sukratum

translations.griffith: WE choose Agni the messenger, the herald, master of all wealth,  Well skilled in this our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निम-अग्निं हवीमभिः सदा हवन्त विश्पतिम हव्यवाहं पुरुप्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnim-aghniṃ havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim havyavāhaṃ purupriyam

translations.griffith: With callings ever they invoke Agni, Agni, Lord of the House,  Oblation-bearer, much beloved.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने देवानिहा वह जज्ञानो वर्क्तबर्हिषे असि होता न ईड्यः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne devānihā vaha jajñāno vṛktabarhiṣe asi hotā na īḍyaḥ

translations.griffith: Bring the Gods hither, Agni, born for him who strews the sacred grass:  Thou art our herald, meet for praise.

verses.sanskrit: तानुशतो वि बोधय यदग्ने यासि दूत्यम देवैरा सत्सि बर्हिषि |||
verses.transliteration: tānuśato vi bodhaya yadaghne yāsi dūtyam devairā satsi barhiṣi

translations.griffith: Wake up the willing Gods, since thou, Agni, performest embassage:  Sit on the sacred grass with Gods.

verses.sanskrit: घर्ताहवन दीदिवः परति षम रिषतो दह अग्ने तवं रक्षस्विनः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtāhavana dīdivaḥ prati ṣma riṣato daha aghne tvaṃ rakṣasvinaḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, radiant One, to whom the holy oil is poured, burn up  Our enemies whom fiends protect.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निनाग्निः समिध्यते कविर्ग्र्हपतिर्युवा हव्यवाड जुह्वास्यः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnināghniḥ samidhyate kavirghṛhapatiryuvā havyavāḍ juhvāsyaḥ

translations.griffith: By Agni Agni is inflamed, Lord of the House, wise, young, who bears  The gift: the ladle is his mouth.

verses.sanskrit: कविमग्निमुप सतुहि सत्यधर्माणमध्वरे देवममीवचातनम |||
verses.transliteration: kavimaghnimupa stuhi satyadharmāṇamadhvare devamamīvacātanam

translations.griffith: Praise Agni in the sacrifice, the Sage whose ways are ever true,  The God who driveth grief away.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त्वामग्ने हविष्पतिर्दूतं देव सपर्यति तस्य सम पराविता भव |||
verses.transliteration: yastvāmaghne haviṣpatirdūtaṃ deva saparyati tasya sma prāvitā bhava

translations.griffith: God, Agni, be his strong defence who lord of sacrificial gifts,  Worshippeth thee the messenger.

verses.sanskrit: यो अग्निं देववीतये हविष्मानाविवासति तस्मै पावक मर्ळय |||
verses.transliteration: yo aghniṃ devavītaye haviṣmānāvivāsati tasmai pāvaka mṛḷaya

translations.griffith: Whoso with sacred gift would fain call Agni to the feast of Gods,  O Purifier, favour him.

verses.sanskrit: स नः पावक दीदिवो.अग्ने देवानिहा वह उप यज्ञं हविश्च नः |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdivo.aghne devānihā vaha upa yajñaṃ haviśca naḥ

translations.griffith: Such, Agni, Purifier, bright, bring hither to our sacrifice,  To our oblation bring the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: स न सतवान आ भर गायत्रेण नवीयसा रयिं वीरवतीमिषम |||
verses.transliteration: sa na stavāna ā bhara ghāyatreṇa navīyasā rayiṃ vīravatīmiṣam

translations.griffith: So lauded by our newest song of praise bring opulence to us,  And food, with heroes for our sons.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषा विश्वाभिर्देवहूतिभिः इमं सतोमं जुषस्व नः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne śukreṇa śociṣā viśvābhirdevahūtibhiḥ imaṃ stomaṃ juṣasva naḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, by effulgent flame, by all invokings of the Gods,  Show pleasure in this laud of ours.

verses.sanskrit: सुसमिद्धो न आ वह देवानग्ने हविष्मते होतः पावक यक्षि च |||
verses.transliteration: susamiddho na ā vaha devānaghne haviṣmate hotaḥ pāvaka yakṣi ca

translations.griffith: AGNI, well-kindled, bring the Gods for him who offers holy gifts.  Worship them, Purifier, Priest.

verses.sanskrit: मधुमन्तं तनूनपाद यज्ञं देवेषु नः कवे अद्या कर्णुहि वीतये |||
verses.transliteration: madhumantaṃ tanūnapād yajñaṃ deveṣu naḥ kave adyā kṛṇuhi vītaye

translations.griffith: Son of Thyself, present, O Sage, our sacrifice to the Gods today.  Sweet to the taste, that they may feast.

verses.sanskrit: नराशंसमिह परियमस्मिन यज्ञ उप हवये मधुजिह्वंहविष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: narāśaṃsamiha priyamasmin yajña upa hvaye madhujihvaṃhaviṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: Dear Narāśaṁsa, sweet of tongue, the giver of oblations, I  Invoke to this our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने सुखतमे रथे देवानीळित आ वह असि होता मनुर्हितः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne sukhatame rathe devānīḷita ā vaha asi hotā manurhitaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, on thy most easy car, glorified, hither bring the Gods:  Manu appointed thee as Priest.

verses.sanskrit: सत्र्णीत बर्हिरानुषग घर्तप्र्ष्ठं मनीषिणः यत्राम्र्तस्य चक्षणम |||
verses.transliteration: stṛṇīta barhirānuṣagh ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṃ manīṣiṇaḥ yatrāmṛtasya cakṣaṇam

translations.griffith: Strew, O ye wise, the sacred grass that drips with oil, in order due,  Where the Immortal is beheld.

verses.sanskrit: वि शरयन्तां रताव्र्धो दवारो देवीरसश्चतः अद्या नूनं च यष्टवे |||
verses.transliteration: vi śrayantāṃ ṛtāvṛdho dvāro devīrasaścataḥ adyā nūnaṃ ca yaṣṭave

translations.griffith: Thrown open be the Doors Divine, unfailing, that assist the rite,  For sacrifice this day and now.

verses.sanskrit: नक्तोषासा सुपेशसास्मिन यज्ञ उप हवये इदं नो बर्हिरासदे |||
verses.transliteration: naktoṣāsā supeśasāsmin yajña upa hvaye idaṃ no barhirāsade

translations.griffith: I call the lovely Night and Dawn to seat them on the holy grass  At this our solemn sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: ता सुजिह्वा उप हवये होतारा दैव्या कवी यज्ञं नो यक्षतामिमम |||
verses.transliteration: tā sujihvā upa hvaye hotārā daivyā kavī yajñaṃ no yakṣatāmimam

translations.griffith: The two Invokers I invite, the wise, divine and sweet of tongue,  To celebrate this our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इळा सरस्वती मही तिस्रो देवीर्मयोभुवः बर्हिः सीदन्त्वस्रिधः |||
verses.transliteration: iḷā sarasvatī mahī tisro devīrmayobhuvaḥ barhiḥ sīdantvasridhaḥ

translations.griffith: Iḷā, Sarasvatī, Mahī, three Goddesses who bring delight,  Be seated, peaceful, on the grass.

verses.sanskrit: इह तवष्टारमग्रियं विश्वरूपमुप हवये अस्माकमस्तुकेवलः |||
verses.transliteration: iha tvaṣṭāramaghriyaṃ viśvarūpamupa hvaye asmākamastukevalaḥ

translations.griffith: Tvaṣṭar I call, the earliest born, the wearer of all forms at will:  May he be ours and ours alone.

verses.sanskrit: अव सर्जा वनस्पते देव देवेभ्यो हविः पर दातुरस्तु चेतनम |||
verses.transliteration: ava sṛjā vanaspate deva devebhyo haviḥ pra dāturastu cetanam

translations.griffith: God, Sovran of the Wood, present this our oblation to the Gods,  And let the giver be renowned.

verses.sanskrit: सवाहा यज्ञं कर्णोतनेन्द्राय यज्वनो गर्हे तत्र देवानुप हवये |||
verses.transliteration: svāhā yajñaṃ kṛṇotanendrāya yajvano ghṛhe tatra devānupa hvaye

translations.griffith: With Svāhā pay the sacrifice to Indra in the offerer's house:  Thither I call the Deities.

verses.sanskrit: ऐभिरग्ने दुवो गिरो विश्वेभिः सोमपीतये देवेभिर्याहि यक्षि च |||
verses.transliteration: aibhiraghne duvo ghiro viśvebhiḥ somapītaye devebhiryāhi yakṣi ca

translations.griffith: To drink the Soma, Agni, come, to our service and our songs.  With all these Gods; and worship them.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा कण्वा अहूषत गर्णन्ति विप्र ते धियः देवेभिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā kaṇvā ahūṣata ghṛṇanti vipra te dhiyaḥ devebhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: The Kaṇvas have invoked thee; they, O Singer, sing thee songs of praise  Agni, come hither with the Gods;

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रवायू बर्हस्पतिं मित्राग्निं पूषणं भगम आदित्यान्मारुतं गणम |||
verses.transliteration: indravāyū bṛhaspatiṃ mitrāghniṃ pūṣaṇaṃ bhagham ādityānmārutaṃ ghaṇam

translations.griffith: Indra, Vāyu, Bṛhaspati, Mitra, Agni, Pūṣan, Bhaga,  Ādityas, and the Marut host.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो भरियन्त इन्दवो मत्सरा मादयिष्णवः दरप्सा मध्वश्चमूषदः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo bhriyanta indavo matsarā mādayiṣṇavaḥ drapsā madhvaścamūṣadaḥ

translations.griffith: For you these juices are poured forth that gladden and exhilarate,  The meath-drops resting in the cup.

verses.sanskrit: ईळते तवामवस्यवः कण्वासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः हविष्मन्तोरंक्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: īḷate tvāmavasyavaḥ kaṇvāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ haviṣmantoaraṃkṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: The sons of Kaṇva fain for help adore thee, having strewn the grass,  With offerings and all things prepared.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तप्र्ष्ठा मनोयुजो ये तवा वहन्ति वह्नयः आ देवान सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtapṛṣṭhā manoyujo ye tvā vahanti vahnayaḥ ā devān somapītaye

translations.griffith: Let the swift steeds who carry thee, thought-yoked and dropping holy oil,  Bring the Gods to the Soma draught.

verses.sanskrit: तान यजत्रान रताव्र्धो.अग्ने पत्नीवतस कर्धि मध्वः सुजिह्व पायय |||
verses.transliteration: tān yajatrān ṛtāvṛdho.aghne patnīvatas kṛdhi madhvaḥ sujihva pāyaya

translations.griffith: Adored, the strengtheners of Law, unite them, Agni, with their Dames:  Make them drink meath, O bright of tongue.

verses.sanskrit: ये यजत्रा य ईड्यास्ते ते पिबन्तु जिह्वया मधोरग्ने वषट्क्र्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ye yajatrā ya īḍyāste te pibantu jihvayā madhoraghne vaṣaṭkṛti

translations.griffith: Let them, O Agni, who deserve worship and praise drink with thy tongue  The meath in solemn sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: आकीं सूर्यस्य रोचनाद विश्वान देवानुषर्बुधः विप्रो होतेह वक्षति |||
verses.transliteration: ākīṃ sūryasya rocanād viśvān devānuṣarbudhaḥ vipro hoteha vakṣati

translations.griffith: Away, from the Sun's realm of light, the wise invoking Priest shall bring  All Gods awaking with the dawn.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेभिः सोम्यं मध्वग्न इन्द्रेण वायुना पिबा मित्रस्य धामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvebhiḥ somyaṃ madhvaghna indreṇa vāyunā pibā mitrasya dhāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: With all the Gods, with Indra, with Vāyu, and Mitra's splendours, drink,  Agni, the pleasant Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: तवं होता मनुर्हितो.अग्ने यज्ञेषु सीदसि सेमं नो अध्वरं यज |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hotā manurhito.aghne yajñeṣu sīdasi semaṃ no adhvaraṃ yaja

translations.griffith: Ordained by Manu as our Priest, thou sittest, Agni, at each rite:  Hallow thou this our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: युक्ष्वा हयरुषी रथे हरितो देव रोहितः ताभिर्देवानिहा वह |||
verses.transliteration: yukṣvā hyaruṣī rathe harito deva rohitaḥ tābhirdevānihā vaha

translations.griffith: Harness the Red Mares to thy car, the Bays, O God, the flaming ones:  With those bring hitherward the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र सोमं पिब रतुना तवा विशन्त्विन्दवः मत्सरासस्तदोकसः |||
verses.transliteration: indra somaṃ piba ṛtunā tvā viśantvindavaḥ matsarāsastadokasaḥ

translations.griffith: O INDRA drink the Soma juice with Ṛtu; let the cheering drops  Sink deep within, which settle there.

verses.sanskrit: मरुतः पिबत रतुना पोत्राद यज्ञं पुनीतन यूयं हि षठा सुदानवः |||
verses.transliteration: marutaḥ pibata ṛtunā potrād yajñaṃ punītana yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānavaḥ

translations.griffith: Drink from the Purifier's cup, Maruts, with Ṛtu; sanctify  The rite, for ye give precious gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अभि यज्ञं गर्णीहि नो गनावो नेष्टः पिब रतुना तवंहि रत्नधा असि |||
verses.transliteration: abhi yajñaṃ ghṛṇīhi no ghnāvo neṣṭaḥ piba ṛtunā tvaṃhi ratnadhā asi

translations.griffith: O Neṣṭar, with thy Dame accept our sacrifice; with Ṛtu drink,  For thou art he who giveth wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने देवानिहा वह सादया योनिषु तरिषु परि भूष पिब रतुना |||
verses.transliteration: aghne devānihā vaha sādayā yoniṣu triṣu pari bhūṣa piba ṛtunā

translations.griffith: Bring the Gods, Agni; in the three appointed places set them down:  Surround them, and with Ṛtu drink.

verses.sanskrit: बराह्मणादिन्द्र राधसः पिबा सोमं रतून्रनु तवेद धि सख्यमस्त्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇādindra rādhasaḥ pibā somaṃ ṛtūnranu taved dhi sakhyamastṛtam

translations.griffith: Drink Soma after the Ṛtus, from the Brāhmaṇa's bounty: undissolved,  O Indra, is thy friendship's bond.

verses.sanskrit: युवं दक्षं धर्तव्रत मित्रावरुण दूळभम रतुना यज्ञमाशाथे |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ dakṣaṃ dhṛtavrata mitrāvaruṇa dūḷabham ṛtunā yajñamāśāthe

translations.griffith: Mitra, Varuṇa, ye whose ways are firm—a Power that none deceives—,  With Ṛtu ye have reached the rite.

verses.sanskrit: दरविणोदा दरविणसो गरावहस्तासो अध्वरे यज्ञेषु देवमीळते |||
verses.transliteration: draviṇodā draviṇaso ghrāvahastāso adhvare yajñeṣu devamīḷate

translations.griffith: The Soma-pressers, fain for wealth, praise the Wealth-giver in the rite,  In sacrifices praise the God.

verses.sanskrit: दरविणोदा ददातु नो वसूनि यानि शर्ण्विरे देवेषु ता वनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: draviṇodā dadātu no vasūni yāni śṛṇvire deveṣu tā vanāmahe

translations.griffith: May the Wealth-giver grant to us riches that shall be far renowned.  These things we gain, among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: दरविणोदाः पिपीषति जुहोत पर च तिष्ठत नेष्ट्राद रतुभिरिष्यत |||
verses.transliteration: draviṇodāḥ pipīṣati juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata neṣṭrād ṛtubhiriṣyata

translations.griffith: He with the Ṛtu fain would drink, Wealth-giver, from the Neṣṭar's bowl.  Haste, give your offering, and depart.

verses.sanskrit: यत तवा तुरीयं रतुभिर्द्रविणोदो यजामहे अध समा नो ददिर्भव |||
verses.transliteration: yat tvā turīyaṃ ṛtubhirdraviṇodo yajāmahe adha smā no dadirbhava

translations.griffith: As we this fourth time, Wealth-giver, honour thee with the Ṛtus, be  A Giver bountiful to us.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना पिबतं मधु दीद्यग्नी शुचिव्रत रतुना यज्ञवाहसा |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā pibataṃ madhu dīdyaghnī śucivrata ṛtunā yajñavāhasā

translations.griffith: Drink ye the meath, O Aśvins bright with flames, whose acts are pure, who with  Ṛtus accept the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: गार्हपत्येन सन्त्य रतुना यज्ञनीरसि देवान देवयते यज |||
verses.transliteration: ghārhapatyena santya ṛtunā yajñanīrasi devān devayate yaja

translations.griffith: With Ṛtu, through the house-fire, thou, kind Giver, guidest sacrifice:  Worship the Gods for the pious man.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा वहन्तु हरयो वर्षणं सोमपीतये इन्द्र तवा सूरचक्षसः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā vahantu harayo vṛṣaṇaṃ somapītaye indra tvā sūracakṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: LET thy Bay Steeds bring thee, the Strong, hither to drink the Soma draught—  Those, Indra, who are bright as suns.

verses.sanskrit: इमा धाना घर्तस्नुवो हरी इहोप वक्षतः इन्द्रं सुखतमे रथे |||
verses.transliteration: imā dhānā ghṛtasnuvo harī ihopa vakṣataḥ indraṃ sukhatame rathe

translations.griffith: Here are the grains bedewed with oil: hither let the Bay Coursers bring  Indra upon his easiest car.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं परातर्हवामह इन्द्रं परयत्यध्वरे इन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ prātarhavāmaha indraṃ prayatyadhvare indraṃ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Indra at early morn we call, Indra in course of sacrifice,  Indra to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: उप नः सुतमा गहि हरिभिरिन्द्र केशिभिः सुते हि तवाहवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: upa naḥ sutamā ghahi haribhirindra keśibhiḥ sute hi tvāhavāmahe

translations.griffith: Come hither, with thy long-maned Steeds, O Indra, to he draught we pour  We call thee when the juice is shed.

verses.sanskrit: सेमं न सतोमं आ गह्युपेदं सवनं सुतम गौरो नत्र्षितः पिब |||
verses.transliteration: semaṃ na stomaṃ ā ghahyupedaṃ savanaṃ sutam ghauro natṛṣitaḥ piba

translations.griffith: Come thou to this our song of praise, to the libation poured for thee  Drink of it like a stag athirst.

verses.sanskrit: इमे सोमास इन्दवः सुतासो अधि बर्हिषि तानिन्द्र सहसेपिब |||
verses.transliteration: ime somāsa indavaḥ sutāso adhi barhiṣi tānindra sahasepiba

translations.griffith: Here are the drops of Soma juice expressed on sacred grass: thereof  Drink, Indra, to increase thy might.

verses.sanskrit: अयं ते सतोमो अग्रियो हर्दिस्प्र्गस्तु शन्तमः अथा सोमंसुतं पिब |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ te stomo aghriyo hṛdispṛghastu śantamaḥ athā somaṃsutaṃ piba

translations.griffith: Welcome to thee be this our hymn, reaching thy heart, most excellent:  Then drink the Soma juice expressed.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वमित सवनं सुतमिन्द्रो मदाय गछति वर्त्रहा सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: viśvamit savanaṃ sutamindro madāya ghachati vṛtrahā somapītaye

translations.griffith: To every draught of pressed-out juice Indra, the Vṛtra-slayer, comes,  To drink the Soma for delight.

verses.sanskrit: सेमं नः काममा पर्ण गोभिरश्वैः शतक्रतो सतवाम तवा सवाध्यः |||
verses.transliteration: semaṃ naḥ kāmamā pṛṇa ghobhiraśvaiḥ śatakrato stavāma tvā svādhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Fulfil, O Śatakratu, all our wish with horses and with kine:  With holy thoughts we sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणयोरहं सम्राजोरव आ वर्णे ता नो मर्ळातीद्र्शे |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇayorahaṃ samrājorava ā vṛṇe tā no mṛḷātaīdṛśe

translations.griffith: I CRAVE help from the Imperial Lords, from Indra-Varuṇa; may they  Both favour one of us like me.

verses.sanskrit: गन्तारा हि सथो.अवसे हवं विप्रस्य मावतः धर्ताराचर्षणीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ghantārā hi stho.avase havaṃ viprasya māvataḥ dhartārācarṣaṇīnām

translations.griffith: Guardians of men, ye ever come with ready succour at the call  Of every singer such as I.

verses.sanskrit: अनुकामं तर्पयेथामिन्द्रावरुण राय आ ता वां नेदिष्ठमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: anukāmaṃ tarpayethāmindrāvaruṇa rāya ā tā vāṃ nediṣṭhamīmahe

translations.griffith: Sate you, according to your wish, O Indra-Varuṇa, with wealth:  Fain would we have you nearest us.

verses.sanskrit: युवाकु हि शचीनां युवाकु सुमतीनाम भूयाम वाजदाव्नाम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāku hi śacīnāṃ yuvāku sumatīnām bhūyāma vājadāvnām

translations.griffith: May we be sharers of the powers, sharers of the benevolence  Of you who give strength bounteously.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सहस्रदाव्नां वरुणः शंस्यानाम करतुर्भवत्युक्थ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ sahasradāvnāṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃsyānām kraturbhavatyukthyaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra and Varuṇa, among givers of thousands, meet for praise,  Are Powers who merit highest laud.

verses.sanskrit: तयोरिदवसा वयं सनेम नि च धीमहि सयादुत पररेचनम |||
verses.transliteration: tayoridavasā vayaṃ sanema ni ca dhīmahi syāduta prarecanam

translations.griffith: Through their protection may we gain great store of wealth, and heap it up  Enough and still to spare, be ours.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुण वामहं हुवे चित्राय राधसे अस्मान सु जिग्युषस कर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇa vāmahaṃ huve citrāya rādhase asmān su jighyuṣas kṛtam

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, on you for wealth in many a form I call:  Still keep ye us victorious.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुण नू नु वां सिषासन्तीषु धीष्वा अस्मभ्यं शर्म यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇa nū nu vāṃ siṣāsantīṣu dhīṣvā asmabhyaṃ śarma yachatam

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, through our songs that seek to win you to ourselves,  Give us at once your sheltering help.

verses.sanskrit: पर वामश्नोतु सुष्टुतिरिन्द्रावरुण यां हुवे यां रधाथे सधस्तुतिम |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāmaśnotu suṣṭutirindrāvaruṇa yāṃ huve yāṃ ṛdhāthe sadhastutim

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, to you may fair praise which I offer come,  Joint eulogy which ye dignify.

verses.sanskrit: सोमानं सवरणं कर्णुहि बरह्मणस पते कक्षीवन्तं याुशिजः |||
verses.transliteration: somānaṃ svaraṇaṃ kṛṇuhi brahmaṇas pate kakṣīvantaṃ yāuśijaḥ

translations.griffith: O BRĀHMAṆASPATI, make him who presses Soma glorious,  Even Kakṣīvān Auśija.

verses.sanskrit: यो रेवान यो अमीवहा वसुवित पुष्टिवर्धनः स नः सिषक्तु यस्तुरः |||
verses.transliteration: yo revān yo amīvahā vasuvit puṣṭivardhanaḥ sa naḥ siṣaktu yasturaḥ

translations.griffith: The rich, the healer of disease, who giveth wealth, increaseth store,  The prompt,—may he be with us still.

verses.sanskrit: मा नः शंसो अररुषो धूर्तिः परणं मर्त्यस्य रक्षा णो बरह्मणस पते |||
verses.transliteration: mā naḥ śaṃso araruṣo dhūrtiḥ praṇaṃ martyasya rakṣā ṇo brahmaṇas pate

translations.griffith: Let not the foeman's curse, let not a mortal's onslaught fall on us  Preserve us, Brahmaṇaspati.

verses.sanskrit: स घा वीरो न रिष्यति यमिन्द्रो बरह्मणस पतिः सोमो हिनोति मर्त्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghā vīro na riṣyati yamindro brahmaṇas patiḥ somo hinoti martyam

translations.griffith: Ne’er is the mortal hero harmed whom Indra, Brahmaṇaspati,  And Soma graciously inspire.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तं बरह्मणस पते सोम इन्द्रश्च मर्त्यम दक्षिणा पात्वंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ taṃ brahmaṇas pate soma indraśca martyam dakṣiṇā pātvaṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Do, thou, O Brahmaṇaspati, and Indra, Soma, Dakṣiṇā,  Preserve that mortal from distress.

verses.sanskrit: सदसस पतिमद्भुतं परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यम सनिं मेधामयासिषम |||
verses.transliteration: sadasas patimadbhutaṃ priyamindrasya kāmyam saniṃ medhāmayāsiṣam

translations.griffith: To the Assembly's wondrous Lord, to Indra's lovely Friend who gives  Wisdom, have I drawn near in prayer.

verses.sanskrit: यस्माद रते न सिध्यति यज्ञो विपश्चितश्चन स धीनां योगमिन्वति |||
verses.transliteration: yasmād ṛte na sidhyati yajño vipaścitaścana sa dhīnāṃ yoghaminvati

translations.griffith: He without whom no sacrifice, e’en of the wise man, prospers; he  Stirs up the series of thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: आद रध्नोति हविष्क्र्तिं पराञ्चं कर्णोत्यध्वरम होत्रा देवेषु गछति |||
verses.transliteration: ād ṛdhnoti haviṣkṛtiṃ prāñcaṃ kṛṇotyadhvaram hotrā deveṣu ghachati

translations.griffith: He makes the oblation prosper, he promotes the course of sacrifice:  Our voice of praise goes to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: नराशंसं सुध्र्ष्टममपश्यं सप्रथस्तमम दिवो नसद्ममखसम |||
verses.transliteration: narāśaṃsaṃ sudhṛṣṭamamapaśyaṃ saprathastamam divo nasadmamakhasam

translations.griffith: I have seen Narāśaṁsa, him most resolute, most widely famed,  As ’twere the Household Priest of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: परति तयं चारुमध्वरं गोपीथाय पर हूयसे मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: prati tyaṃ cārumadhvaraṃ ghopīthāya pra hūyase marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: To this fair sacrifice to drink the milky draught thou art invoked:  O Agni, with the Maruts come.

verses.sanskrit: नहि देवो न मर्त्यो महस्तव करतुं परः मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: nahi devo na martyo mahastava kratuṃ paraḥ marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: No mortal man, no God exceeds thy mental power, O Mighty one:  O Agni, with the Maruts come:

verses.sanskrit: ये महो रजसो विदुर्विश्वे देवासो अद्रुहः मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ye maho rajaso vidurviśve devāso adruhaḥ marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: All Gods devoid of guile, who know the mighty region of mid-air:  O Agni, with those Maruts come.

verses.sanskrit: य उग्रा अर्कमान्र्चुरनाध्र्ष्टास ओजसा मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ya ughrā arkamānṛcuranādhṛṣṭāsa ojasā marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: The terrible, who sing their song, not to be overcome by might:  O Agni, with those Maruts come.

verses.sanskrit: ये शुभ्रा घोरवर्पसः सुक्षत्रासो रिशादसः मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ye śubhrā ghoravarpasaḥ sukṣatrāso riśādasaḥ marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: Brilliant, and awful in their form, mighty, devourers of their foes:  O Agni, with those Maruts come.

verses.sanskrit: ये नाकस्याधि रोचने दिवि देवास आसते मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ye nākasyādhi rocane divi devāsa āsate marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: Who sit as Deities in heaven, above the sky-vault's luminous sphere:  O Agni, with those Maruts come.

verses.sanskrit: य ईङखयन्ति पर्वतान तिरः समुद्रमर्णवम मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ya īṅkhayanti parvatān tiraḥ samudramarṇavam marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: Who scatter clouds about the sky, away over the billowy sea:  O Agni, with those Maruts come.

verses.sanskrit: आ ये तन्वन्ति रश्मिभिस्तिरः समुद्रमोजसा मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ā ye tanvanti raśmibhistiraḥ samudramojasā marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: Who with their bright beams spread them forth over the ocean in their might  O Agni, with those Maruts come.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा पूर्वपीतये सर्जामि सोम्यं मधु मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā pūrvapītaye sṛjāmi somyaṃ madhu marudbhiraghna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: For thee, to be thine early draught, I pour the Soma-mingled meath:  O Agni, with the Maruts come.

verses.sanskrit: अयं देवाय जन्मने सतोमो विप्रेभिरासया अकारि रत्नधातमः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ devāya janmane stomo viprebhirāsayā akāri ratnadhātamaḥ

translations.griffith: FOR the Celestial Race this song of praise which gives wealth lavishly  Was made by singers with their lips.

verses.sanskrit: य इन्द्राय वचोयुजा ततक्षुर्मनसा हरी शमीभिर्यज्ञमाशत |||
verses.transliteration: ya indrāya vacoyujā tatakṣurmanasā harī śamībhiryajñamāśata

translations.griffith: They who for Indra, with their mind, formed horses harnessed by a word,  Attained by works to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तक्षन नासत्याभ्यां परिज्मानं सुखं रथम तक्षन धेनुं सबर्दुघाम |||
verses.transliteration: takṣan nāsatyābhyāṃ parijmānaṃ sukhaṃ ratham takṣan dhenuṃ sabardughām

translations.griffith: They for the two Nāsatyas wrought a light car moving every way:  They formed a nectar-yielding cow.

verses.sanskrit: युवाना पितरा पुनः सत्यमन्त्रा रजूयवः रभवो विष्ट्यक्रत |||
verses.transliteration: yuvānā pitarā punaḥ satyamantrā ṛjūyavaḥ ṛbhavo viṣṭyakrata

translations.griffith: The Ṛbhus with effectual prayers, honest, with constant labour, made  Their Sire and Mother young again.

verses.sanskrit: सं वो मदासो अग्मतेन्द्रेण च मरुत्वता आदित्येभिश्च राजभिः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ vo madāso aghmatendreṇa ca marutvatā ādityebhiśca rājabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Together came your gladdening drops with Indra by the Maruts girt,  With the Ādityas, with the Kings.

verses.sanskrit: उत तयं चमसं नवं तवष्टुर्देवस्य निष्क्र्तम अकर्तचतुरः पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyaṃ camasaṃ navaṃ tvaṣṭurdevasya niṣkṛtam akartacaturaḥ punaḥ

translations.griffith: The sacrificial ladle, wrought newly by the God Tvaṣṭar's hand—  Four ladles have ye made thereof.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो रत्नानि धत्तन तरिरा साप्तानि सुन्वते एकम-एकंसुशस्तिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: te no ratnāni dhattana trirā sāptāni sunvate ekam-ekaṃsuśastibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe us wealth, to him who pours thrice seven libations, yea, to each  Give wealth, pleased with our eulogies.

verses.sanskrit: अधारयन्त वह्नयो.अभजन्त सुक्र्त्यया भागं देवेषु यज्ञियम |||
verses.transliteration: adhārayanta vahnayo.abhajanta sukṛtyayā bhāghaṃ deveṣu yajñiyam

translations.griffith: As ministering Priests they held, by pious acts they won themselves,  A share in sacrifice with Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इहेन्द्राग्नी उप हवये तयोरित सतोममुश्मसि ता सोमं सोमपातमा |||
verses.transliteration: ihendrāghnī upa hvaye tayorit stomamuśmasi tā somaṃ somapātamā

translations.griffith: INDRA and Agni I invoke fain are we for their song of praise:  Chief Soma-drinkers are they both.

verses.sanskrit: ता यज्ञेषु पर शंसतेन्द्राग्नी शुम्भता नरः ता गायत्रेषु गायत |||
verses.transliteration: tā yajñeṣu pra śaṃsatendrāghnī śumbhatā naraḥ tā ghāyatreṣu ghāyata

translations.griffith: Praise ye, O men, and glorify Indra-Agni in the holy rites:  Sing praise to them in sacred songs.

verses.sanskrit: ता मित्रस्य परशस्तय इन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे सोमपा सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: tā mitrasya praśastaya indrāghnī tā havāmahe somapā somapītaye

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni we invite, the Soma-drinkers, for the fame  Of Mitra, to the Soma-draught.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रा सन्ता हवामह उपेदं सवनं सुतम इन्द्राग्नी एह गछताम |||
verses.transliteration: ughrā santā havāmaha upedaṃ savanaṃ sutam indrāghnī eha ghachatām

translations.griffith: Strong Gods, we bid them come to this libation that stands ready here:  Indra and Agni, come to us.

verses.sanskrit: ता महान्ता सदस्पती इन्द्राग्नी रक्ष उब्जतम अप्रजाःसन्त्वत्रिणः |||
verses.transliteration: tā mahāntā sadaspatī indrāghnī rakṣa ubjatam aprajāḥsantvatriṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, mighty Lords of our assembly, crush the fiends:  Childless be the devouring ones.

verses.sanskrit: तेन सत्येन जाग्र्तमधि परचेतुने पदे इन्द्राग्नी शर्म यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: tena satyena jāghṛtamadhi pracetune pade indrāghnī śarma yachatam

translations.griffith: Watch ye, through this your truthfulness, there in the place of spacious view  Indra and Agni, send us bliss.

verses.sanskrit: परातर्युजा वि बोधयाश्विनावेह गछताम अस्य सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: prātaryujā vi bodhayāśvināveha ghachatām asya somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: WAKEN the Aśvin Pair who yoke their car at early morn: may they  Approach to drink this Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: या सुरथा रथीतमोभा देवा दिविस्प्र्शा अश्विना ता हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yā surathā rathītamobhā devā divispṛśā aśvinā tā havāmahe

translations.griffith: We call the Aśvins Twain, the Gods borne in a noble car, the best  Of charioteers, who reach the heavens.

verses.sanskrit: या वां कशा मधुमत्यश्विना सून्र्तावती तया यज्ञं मिमिक्षतम |||
verses.transliteration: yā vāṃ kaśā madhumatyaśvinā sūnṛtāvatī tayā yajñaṃ mimikṣatam

translations.griffith: Dropping with honey is your whip, Aśvins, and full of pleasantness  Sprinkle therewith the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: नहि वामस्ति दूरके यत्रा रथेन गछथः अश्विना सोमिनो गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: nahi vāmasti dūrake yatrā rathena ghachathaḥ aśvinā somino ghṛham

translations.griffith: As ye go thither in your car, not far, O Aśvins, is the home  Of him who offers Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यपाणिमूतये सवितारमुप हवये स चेत्ता देवतापदम |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyapāṇimūtaye savitāramupa hvaye sa cettā devatāpadam

translations.griffith: For my protection I invoke the golden-handed Savitar.  He knoweth, as a God, the place.

verses.sanskrit: अपां नपातमवसे सवितारमुप सतुहि तस्य वरतान्युश्मसि |||
verses.transliteration: apāṃ napātamavase savitāramupa stuhi tasya vratānyuśmasi

translations.griffith: That he may send us succour, praise the Waters’ Offspring Savitar:  Fain are we for his holy ways.

verses.sanskrit: विभक्तारं हवामहे वसोश्चित्रस्य राधसः सवितारंन्र्चक्षसम |||
verses.transliteration: vibhaktāraṃ havāmahe vasościtrasya rādhasaḥ savitāraṃnṛcakṣasam

translations.griffith: We call on him, distributer of wondrous bounty and of wealth,  On Savitar who looks on men.

verses.sanskrit: सखाय आ नि षीदत सविता सतोम्यो नु नः दाता राधांसि शुम्भति |||
verses.transliteration: sakhāya ā ni ṣīdata savitā stomyo nu naḥ dātā rādhāṃsi śumbhati

translations.griffith: Come hither, friends, and seat yourselves Savitar, to be praised by us,  Giving good gifts, is beautiful.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने पत्नीरिहा वह देवानामुशतीरुप तवष्टारं सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: aghne patnīrihā vaha devānāmuśatīrupa tvaṣṭāraṃ somapītaye

translations.griffith: O Agni, hither bring to us the willing Spouses of the Gods,  And Tvaṣṭar, to the Soma draught.

verses.sanskrit: आ गना अग्न इहावसे होत्रां यविष्ठ भारतीम वरूत्रीं धिषणां वह |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghnā aghna ihāvase hotrāṃ yaviṣṭha bhāratīm varūtrīṃ dhiṣaṇāṃ vaha

translations.griffith: Most youthful Agni, hither bring their Spouses, Hotrā, Bhāratī,  Varūtrī, Dhiṣaṇā, for aid.

verses.sanskrit: अभी नो देवीरवसा महः शर्मणा नर्पत्नीः अछिन्नपत्राः सचन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: abhī no devīravasā mahaḥ śarmaṇā nṛpatnīḥ achinnapatrāḥ sacantām

translations.griffith: Spouses of Heroes, Goddesses, with whole wings may they come to us  With great protection and with aid.

verses.sanskrit: इहेन्द्राणीमुप हवये वरुणानीं सवस्तये अग्नायीं सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ihendrāṇīmupa hvaye varuṇānīṃ svastaye aghnāyīṃ somapītaye

translations.griffith: Indrāṇī, Varuṇānī, and Agnāyī hither I invite,  For weal, to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: मही दयौः पर्थिवी च न इमं यज्ञं मिमिक्षताम पिप्र्तां नो भरीमभिः |||
verses.transliteration: mahī dyauḥ pṛthivī ca na imaṃ yajñaṃ mimikṣatām pipṛtāṃ no bharīmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: May Heaven and Earth, the Mighty Pair, bedew for us our sacrifice,  And feed us full with nourishments.

verses.sanskrit: तयोरिद घर्तवत पयो विप्रा रिहन्ति धीतिभिः गन्धर्वस्य धरुवे पदे |||
verses.transliteration: tayorid ghṛtavat payo viprā rihanti dhītibhiḥ ghandharvasya dhruve pade

translations.griffith: Their water rich with fatness, there in the Gandharva's steadfast place,  The singers taste through sacred songs.

verses.sanskrit: सयोना पर्थिवि भवान्र्क्षरा निवेशनी यछा नः शर्म सप्रथः |||
verses.transliteration: syonā pṛthivi bhavānṛkṣarā niveśanī yachā naḥ śarma saprathaḥ

translations.griffith: Thornless be thou, O Earth, spread wide before us for a dwelling-place:  Vouchsafe us shelter broad and sure.

verses.sanskrit: अतो देवा अवन्तु नो यतो विष्णुर्विचक्रमे पर्थिव्याः सप्तधामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ato devā avantu no yato viṣṇurvicakrame pṛthivyāḥ saptadhāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: The Gods be gracious unto us even from the place whence Viṣṇu strode  Through the seven regions of the earth!

verses.sanskrit: इदं विष्णुर्वि चक्रमे तरेधा नि दधे पदम समूळ्हमस्य पांसुरे |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ viṣṇurvi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padam samūḷhamasya pāṃsure

translations.griffith: Through all this world strode Viṣṇu; thrice his foot he planted, and the whole  Was gathered in his footstep's dust.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि पदा वि चक्रमे विष्णुर्गोपा अदाभ्यः अतो धर्माणि धारयन |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇurghopā adābhyaḥ ato dharmāṇi dhārayan

translations.griffith: Viṣṇu, the Guardian, he whom none deceiveth, made three steps; thenceforth  Establishing his high decrees.

verses.sanskrit: विष्णोः कर्माणि पश्यत यतो वरतानि पस्पशे इन्द्रस्य युज्यः सखा |||
verses.transliteration: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yato vratāni paspaśe indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā

translations.griffith: Look ye on Viṣṇu's works, whereby the Friend of Indra, close-allied,  Hath let his holy ways be seen.

verses.sanskrit: तद विष्णोः परमं पदं सदा पश्यन्ति सूरयः दिवीव चक्षुराततम |||
verses.transliteration: tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padaṃ sadā paśyanti sūrayaḥ divīva cakṣurātatam

translations.griffith: The princes evermore behold that loftiest place where Viṣṇu is,  Laid as it were an eye in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तद विप्रासो विपन्यवो जाग्र्वांसः समिन्धते विष्णोर्यत परमं पदम |||
verses.transliteration: tad viprāso vipanyavo jāghṛvāṃsaḥ samindhate viṣṇoryat paramaṃ padam

translations.griffith: This, Viṣṇu's station most sublime, the singers, ever vigilant,  Lovers of holy song, light up.

verses.sanskrit: तीव्राः सोमास आ गह्याशीर्वन्तः सुता इमे वायो तान परस्थितान पिब |||
verses.transliteration: tīvrāḥ somāsa ā ghahyāśīrvantaḥ sutā ime vāyo tān prasthitān piba

translations.griffith: STRONG are the Somas; come thou nigh; these juices have been mixt with milk:  Drink, Vāyu, the presented draughts.

verses.sanskrit: उभा देवा दिविस्प्र्शेन्द्रवायू हवामहे अस्य सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ubhā devā divispṛśendravāyū havāmahe asya somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Both Deities who touch the heaven, Indra and Vāyu we invoke  To drink of this our Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रवायू मनोजुवा विप्रा हवन्त ऊतये सहस्राक्षा धियस पती |||
verses.transliteration: indravāyū manojuvā viprā havanta ūtaye sahasrākṣā dhiyas patī

translations.griffith: The singers' for their aid, invoke Indra and Vāyu, swift as mind,  The thousand-eyed, the Lords of thought.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रं वयं हवामहे वरुणं सोमपीतये जज्ञाना पूतदक्षसा |||
verses.transliteration: mitraṃ vayaṃ havāmahe varuṇaṃ somapītaye jajñānā pūtadakṣasā

translations.griffith: Mitra and Varuṇa, renowned as Gods of consecrated might,  We call to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: रतेन याव रताव्र्धाव रतस्य जयोतिषस पती ता मित्रावरुणा हुवे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtena yāv ṛtāvṛdhāv ṛtasya jyotiṣas patī tā mitrāvaruṇā huve

translations.griffith: Those who by Law uphold the Law, Lords of the shining light of Law,  Mitra I call, and Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: वरुणः पराविता भुवन मित्रो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः करतां नः सुराधसः |||
verses.transliteration: varuṇaḥ prāvitā bhuvan mitro viśvābhirūtibhiḥ karatāṃ naḥ surādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Let Varuṇa be our chief defence, let Mitra guard us with all aids  Both make us rich exceedingly.

verses.sanskrit: मरुत्वन्तं हवामह इन्द्रमा सोमपीतये सजूर्गणेन तरिम्पतु |||
verses.transliteration: marutvantaṃ havāmaha indramā somapītaye sajūrghaṇena trimpatu

translations.griffith: Indra, by Maruts girt, we call to drink the Soma juice: may he  Sate him in union with his troop.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रज्येष्ठा मरुद्गणा देवासः पूषरातयः विश्वे मम शरुता हवम |||
verses.transliteration: indrajyeṣṭhā marudghaṇā devāsaḥ pūṣarātayaḥ viśve mama śrutā havam

translations.griffith: Gods, Marut hosts whom Indra leads, distributers of Pūṣan's gifts,  Hearken ye all unto my cry.

verses.sanskrit: हत वर्त्रं सुदानव इन्द्रेण सहसा युजा मा नो दुःशंस ईशत |||
verses.transliteration: hata vṛtraṃ sudānava indreṇa sahasā yujā mā no duḥśaṃsa īśata

translations.griffith: With conquering Indra for ally, strike Vṛtra down, ye bounteous Gods  Let not the wicked master us.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वान देवान हवामहे मरुतः सोमपीतये उग्रा हि पर्श्निमातरः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvān devān havāmahe marutaḥ somapītaye ughrā hi pṛśnimātaraḥ

translations.griffith: We call the Universal Gods, and Maruts to the Soma draught,  For passing strong are Pṛśni's Sons.

verses.sanskrit: जयतामिव तन्यतुर्मरुतामेति धर्ष्णुया यच्छुभं याथना नरः |||
verses.transliteration: jayatāmiva tanyaturmarutāmeti dhṛṣṇuyā yacchubhaṃ yāthanā naraḥ

translations.griffith: Fierce comes the Maruts’ thundering voice, like that of conquerors, when ye go  Forward to victory, O Men.

verses.sanskrit: हस्काराद विद्युतस पर्यतो जाता अवन्तु नः मरुतो मर्ळयन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: haskārād vidyutas paryato jātā avantu naḥ maruto mṛḷayantu naḥ

translations.griffith: Born of the laughing lightning. may the Maruts guard us everywhere  May they be gracious unto Us.

verses.sanskrit: आ पूषञ्चित्रबर्हिषमाघ्र्णे धरुणं दिवः आजा नष्टं यथा पशुम |||
verses.transliteration: ā pūṣañcitrabarhiṣamāghṛṇe dharuṇaṃ divaḥ ājā naṣṭaṃ yathā paśum

translations.griffith: Like some lost animal, drive to us, bright Pūṣan, him who bears up heaven,  Resting on many-coloured grass.

verses.sanskrit: पूषा राजानमाघ्र्णिरपगूळ्हं गुहा हितम अविन्दच्चित्रबर्हिषम |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣā rājānamāghṛṇirapaghūḷhaṃ ghuhā hitam avindaccitrabarhiṣam

translations.griffith: Pūṣan the Bright has found the King, concealed and hidden in a cave,  Who rests on grass of many hues.

verses.sanskrit: उतो स मह्यमिन्दुभिः षड युक्ताननुसेषिधत गोभिर्यवं न चर्क्र्षत |||
verses.transliteration: uto sa mahyamindubhiḥ ṣaḍ yuktānanuseṣidhat ghobhiryavaṃ na carkṛṣat

translations.griffith: And may he. duly bring to me the six bound closely, through these drops,  As one who ploughs with steers brings corn.

verses.sanskrit: अम्बयो यन्त्यध्वभिर्जामयो अध्वरीयताम पर्ञ्चतीर्मधुना पयः |||
verses.transliteration: ambayo yantyadhvabhirjāmayo adhvarīyatām pṛñcatīrmadhunā payaḥ

translations.griffith: Along their paths the Mothers go, Sisters of priestly ministrants,  Mingling their sweetness with the milk.

verses.sanskrit: अमूर्या उप सूर्ये याभिर्वा सूर्यः सह ता नो हिन्वन्त्वध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: amūryā upa sūrye yābhirvā sūryaḥ saha tā no hinvantvadhvaram

translations.griffith: May Waters gathered near the Sun, and those wherewith the Sun is joined,  Speed forth this sacrifice of ours.

verses.sanskrit: अपो देवीरुप हवये यत्र गावः पिबन्ति नः सिन्दुभ्यः कर्त्वं हविः |||
verses.transliteration: apo devīrupa hvaye yatra ghāvaḥ pibanti naḥ sindubhyaḥ kartvaṃ haviḥ

translations.griffith: I call the Waters, Goddesses, wherein our cattle quench their thirst;  Oblations to the Streams be given.

verses.sanskrit: अप्स्वन्तरम्र्तमप्सु भेषजमपामुत परशस्तये देवाभवत वाजिनः |||
verses.transliteration: apsvantaramṛtamapsu bheṣajamapāmuta praśastaye devābhavata vājinaḥ

translations.griffith: Amrit is in the Waters in the Waters there is healing balm  Be swift, ye Gods, to give them praise.

verses.sanskrit: अप्सु मे सोमो अब्रवीदन्तर्विश्वानि भेषजा अग्निं च विश्वशम्भुवमापश्च विश्वभेषजीः |||
verses.transliteration: apsu me somo abravīdantarviśvāni bheṣajā aghniṃ ca viśvaśambhuvamāpaśca viśvabheṣajīḥ

translations.griffith: Within the Waters—Soma thus hath told me—dwell all balms that heal,  And Agni, he who blesseth all. The Waters hold all medicines.

verses.sanskrit: आपः पर्णीत भेषजं वरूथं तन्वे मम जयोक च सूर्यं दर्शे |||
verses.transliteration: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajaṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama jyok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe

translations.griffith: O Waters, teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm,  So that I long may see the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: इदमापः पर वहत यत किं च दुरितं मयि यद वाहमभिदुद्रोह यद वा शेप उतान्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: idamāpaḥ pra vahata yat kiṃ ca duritaṃ mayi yad vāhamabhidudroha yad vā śepa utānṛtam

translations.griffith: Whatever sin is found in me, whatever evil I have wrought.  If I have lied or falsely sworn, Waters, remove it far from me.

verses.sanskrit: आपो अद्यान्वचारिषं रसेन समगस्महि पयस्वानग्न आगहि तं मा सं सर्ज वर्चसा |||
verses.transliteration: āpo adyānvacāriṣaṃ rasena samaghasmahi payasvānaghna āghahi taṃ mā saṃ sṛja varcasā

translations.griffith: The Waters I this day have sought, and to their moisture have we come:  O Agni, rich in milk, come thou, and with thy splendour cover me.

verses.sanskrit: सं माग्ने वर्चसा सर्ज सं परजया समायुषा विद्युर्मेस्य देवा इन्द्रो विद्यात सह रषिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ māghne varcasā sṛja saṃ prajayā samāyuṣā vidyurmeasya devā indro vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Fill me with splendour, Agni; give offspring and length of days; the Gods  Shall know me even as I am, and Indra with the Ṛṣis, know.

verses.sanskrit: कस्य नूनं कतमस्याम्र्तानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम को नो मह्या अदितये पुनर्दात पितरं च दर्शेयं मातरं च |||
verses.transliteration: kasya nūnaṃ katamasyāmṛtānāṃ manāmahe cāru devasya nāma ko no mahyā aditaye punardāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyaṃ mātaraṃ ca

translations.griffith: WHO now is he, what God among Immortals, of whose auspicious name we may bethink us?  Who shall to mighty Aditi restore us, that I may see my Father and my Mother?

verses.sanskrit: अग्नेर्वयं परथमस्याम्र्तानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम स नो मह्या अदितये पुनर्दात पितरं च दर्शेयं मातरं च |||
verses.transliteration: aghnervayaṃ prathamasyāmṛtānāṃ manāmahe cāru devasya nāma sa no mahyā aditaye punardāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyaṃ mātaraṃ ca

translations.griffith: Agni the God the first among the Immortals,—of his auspicious name let us bethink us.  He shall to mighty Aditi restore us, that I may see my Father and my Mother.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा देव सवितरीशानं वार्याणाम सदावन भागमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā deva savitarīśānaṃ vāryāṇām sadāvan bhāghamīmahe

translations.griffith: To thee, O Savitar, the Lord of precious things, who helpest us  Continually, for our share we come—

verses.sanskrit: यश्चिद धि त इत्था भगः शशमानः पुरा निदः अद्वेषो हस्तयोर्दधे |||
verses.transliteration: yaścid dhi ta itthā bhaghaḥ śaśamānaḥ purā nidaḥ adveṣo hastayordadhe

translations.griffith: Wealth, highly lauded ere reproach hath fallen on it, which is laid,  Free from all hatred, in thy hands

verses.sanskrit: भगभक्तस्य ते वयमुदशेम तवावसा मूर्धानं राय आरभे |||
verses.transliteration: bhaghabhaktasya te vayamudaśema tavāvasā mūrdhānaṃ rāya ārabhe

translations.griffith: Through thy protection may we come to even the height of affluence  Which Bhaga hath dealt out to us.

verses.sanskrit: नहि ते कषत्रं न सहो न मन्युं वयश्चनामी पतयन्त आपुः नेमा आपो अनिमिषं चरन्तीर्न ये वातस्य परमिनन्त्यभ्वम |||
verses.transliteration: nahi te kṣatraṃ na saho na manyuṃ vayaścanāmī patayanta āpuḥ nemā āpo animiṣaṃ carantīrna ye vātasya praminantyabhvam

translations.griffith: Ne’er have those birds that fly through air attained to thy high dominion or thy might or spirit;  Nor these the waters that flow on for ever, nor hills, abaters of the wind's wild fury.

verses.sanskrit: अबुध्ने राजा वरुणो वनस्योर्ध्वं सतूपं ददते पूतदक्षः नीचीना सथुरुपरि बुध्न एषामस्मे अन्तर्निहिताःकेतवः सयुः |||
verses.transliteration: abudhne rājā varuṇo vanasyordhvaṃ stūpaṃ dadate pūtadakṣaḥ nīcīnā sthurupari budhna eṣāmasme antarnihitāḥketavaḥ syuḥ

translations.griffith: Varuṇa, King, of hallowed might, sustaineth erect the Tree's stem in the baseless region.  Its rays, whose root is high above, stream downward. Deep may they sink within us, and be hidden.

verses.sanskrit: उरुं हि राजा वरुणश्चकार सूर्याय पन्थामन्वेतवा उ अपदे पादा परतिधातवे.अकरुतापवक्ता हर्दयाविधश्चित |||
verses.transliteration: uruṃ hi rājā varuṇaścakāra sūryāya panthāmanvetavā u apade pādā pratidhātave.akarutāpavaktā hṛdayāvidhaścit

translations.griffith: King Varuṇa hath made a spacious pathway, a pathway for the Sun wherein to travel.  Where no way was he made him set his footstep, and warned afar whate’er afflicts the spirit.

verses.sanskrit: शतं ते राजन भिषजः सहस्रमुर्वी गभीरा सुमतिष टे अस्तु बाधस्व दूरे निरतिं पराचैः कर्तं चिदेनः पर मुमुग्ध्यस्मत |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ te rājan bhiṣajaḥ sahasramurvī ghabhīrā sumatiṣ ṭe astu bādhasva dūre nirtiṃ parācaiḥ kṛtaṃ cidenaḥ pra mumughdhyasmat

translations.griffith: A hundred balms are thine, O King, a thousand; deep and wide-reaching also be thy favours.  Far from us, far away drive thou Destruction. Put from us e’en the sin we have committed.

verses.sanskrit: अमी य रक्षा निहितास उच्चा नक्तं दद्र्श्रे कुह चिद दिवेयुः अदब्धानि वरुणस्य वरतानि विचाकशच्चन्द्रमा नक्तमेति |||
verses.transliteration: amī ya ṛkṣā nihitāsa uccā naktaṃ dadṛśre kuha cid diveyuḥ adabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni vicākaśaccandramā naktameti

translations.griffith: Whither by day depart the constellations that shine at night, set high in heaven above us?  Varuṇa's holy laws remain unweakened, and through the night the Moon moves on in splendor

verses.sanskrit: तत तवा यामि बरह्मणा वन्दमानस्तदा शास्ते यजमानो हविर्भिः अहेळमानो वरुणेह बोध्युरुशंस मा न आयुःप्र मोषीः |||
