verses.transliteration: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānastadā śāste yajamāno havirbhiḥ aheḷamāno varuṇeha bodhyuruśaṃsa mā na āyuḥpra moṣīḥ

translations.griffith: I ask this of thee with my prayer adoring; thy worshipper craves this with his oblation.  Varuṇa, stay thou here and be not angry; steal not our life from us, O thou Wide-Ruler.

verses.sanskrit: तदिन नक्तं तद दिवा मह्यमाहुस्तदयं केतो हर्द आ वि चष्टे शुनःशेपो यमह्वद गर्भीतः सो अस्मान राजा वरुणो मुमोक्तु |||
verses.transliteration: tadin naktaṃ tad divā mahyamāhustadayaṃ keto hṛda ā vi caṣṭe śunaḥśepo yamahvad ghṛbhītaḥ so asmān rājā varuṇo mumoktu

translations.griffith: Nightly and daily this one thing they tell me, this too the thought of mine own heart repeateth.  May he to whom prayed fettered Śunaḥśepa, may he the Sovran Varuṇa release us.

verses.sanskrit: शुनःशेपो हयह्वद गर्भीतस्त्रिष्वादित्यं दरुपदेषु बद्धः अवैनं राजा वरुणः सस्र्ज्याद विद्वानदब्धो वि मुमोक्तु पाशान |||
verses.transliteration: śunaḥśepo hyahvad ghṛbhītastriṣvādityaṃ drupadeṣu baddhaḥ avainaṃ rājā varuṇaḥ sasṛjyād vidvānadabdho vi mumoktu pāśān

translations.griffith: Bound to three pillars captured Śunaḥśepa thus to the Āditya made his supplication.  Him may the Sovran Varuṇa deliver, wise, ne’er deceived, loosen the bonds that bind him.

verses.sanskrit: अव ते हेळो वरुण नमोभिरव यज्ञेभिरीमहे हविर्भिः कषयन्नस्मभ्यमसुर परचेता राजन्नेनांसि शिश्रथः कर्तानि |||
verses.transliteration: ava te heḷo varuṇa namobhirava yajñebhirīmahe havirbhiḥ kṣayannasmabhyamasura pracetā rājannenāṃsi śiśrathaḥ kṛtāni

translations.griffith: With bending down, oblations, sacrifices, O Varuṇa, we deprecate thine anger:  Wise Asura, thou King of wide dominion, loosen the bonds of sins by us committed.

verses.sanskrit: उदुत्तमं वरुण पाशमस्मदवाधमं वि मध्यमं शरथाय अथा वयमादित्य वरते तवानागसो अदितये सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: uduttamaṃ varuṇa pāśamasmadavādhamaṃ vi madhyamaṃ śrathāya athā vayamāditya vrate tavānāghaso aditaye syāma

translations.griffith: Loosen the bonds, O Varuṇa, that hold me, loosen the bonds above, between, and under.  So in thy holy law may we made sinless belong to Aditi, O thou Āditya.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चिद धि ते विशो यथा पर देव वरुण वरतम मिनीमसिद्यवि-दयवि |||
verses.transliteration: yaccid dhi te viśo yathā pra deva varuṇa vratam minīmasidyavi-dyavi

translations.griffith: WHATEVER law of thine, O God, O Varuṇa, as we are men,  Day after day we violate.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो वधाय हत्नवे जिहीळानस्य रीरधः मा हर्णानस्य मन्यवे |||
verses.transliteration: mā no vadhāya hatnave jihīḷānasya rīradhaḥ mā hṛṇānasya manyave

translations.griffith: give us not as a prey to death, to be destroyed by thee in wrath,  To thy fierce anger when displeased.

verses.sanskrit: वि मर्ळीकाय ते मनो रथीरश्वं न सन्दितम गीर्भिर्वरुण सीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: vi mṛḷīkāya te mano rathīraśvaṃ na sanditam ghīrbhirvaruṇa sīmahi

translations.griffith: To gain thy mercy, Varuṇa, with hymns we bind thy heart, as binds  The charioteer his tethered horse.

verses.sanskrit: परा हि मे विमन्यवः पतन्ति वस्यैष्टये वयो न वसतीरुप |||
verses.transliteration: parā hi me vimanyavaḥ patanti vasyaiṣṭaye vayo na vasatīrupa

translations.griffith: They flee from me dispirited, bent only on obtaining wealth,  As to their nests the birds of air.

verses.sanskrit: कदा कषत्रश्रियं नरमा वरुणं करामहे मर्ळीकायोरुचक्षसम |||
verses.transliteration: kadā kṣatraśriyaṃ naramā varuṇaṃ karāmahe mṛḷīkāyorucakṣasam

translations.griffith: When shall we bring, to be appeased, the Hero, Lord of warrior might,  Him, the far-seeing Varuṇa?

verses.sanskrit: तदित समानमाशाते वेनन्ता न पर युछतः धर्तव्रताय दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: tadit samānamāśāte venantā na pra yuchataḥ dhṛtavratāya dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: This, this with joy they both accept in common: never do they fail  The ever-faithful worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: वेदा यो वीनां पदमन्तरिक्षेण पतताम वेद नावः समुद्रियः |||
verses.transliteration: vedā yo vīnāṃ padamantarikṣeṇa patatām veda nāvaḥ samudriyaḥ

translations.griffith: He knows the path of birds that fly through heaven, and, Sovran of the sea,  He knows the ships that are thereon.

verses.sanskrit: वेद मासो धर्तव्रतो दवादश परजावतः वेदा य उपजायते |||
verses.transliteration: veda māso dhṛtavrato dvādaśa prajāvataḥ vedā ya upajāyate

translations.griffith: True to his holy law, he knows the twelve moons with their progeny:  He knows the moon of later birth.

verses.sanskrit: वेद वातस्य वर्तनिमुरोर्र्ष्वस्य बर्हतः वेदा ये अध्यासते |||
verses.transliteration: veda vātasya vartanimurorṛṣvasya bṛhataḥ vedā ye adhyāsate

translations.griffith: He knows the pathway of the wind, the spreading, high, and mighty wind:  He knows the Gods who dwell above.

verses.sanskrit: नि षसाद धर्तव्रतो वरुणः पस्त्यास्वा साम्राज्याय सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: ni ṣasāda dhṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsvā sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: Varuṇa, true to holy law, sits down among his people; he,  Most wise, sits there to govern all.

verses.sanskrit: अतो विश्वान्यद्भुता चिकित्वानभि पश्यति कर्तानि या चकर्त्वा |||
verses.transliteration: ato viśvānyadbhutā cikitvānabhi paśyati kṛtāni yā cakartvā

translations.griffith: From thence  perceiving  he beholds all wondrous things, both what hath been,  And what hereafter will be done.

verses.sanskrit: स नो विश्वाहा सुक्रतुरादित्यः सुपथा करत पर ण आयूंषि तारिषत |||
verses.transliteration: sa no viśvāhā sukraturādityaḥ supathā karat pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat

translations.griffith: May that Āditya, very wise, make fair paths for us all our days:  May he prolong our lives for us.

verses.sanskrit: बिभ्रद दरापिं हिरण्ययं वरुणो वस्त निर्णिजम परि सपशो नि षेदिरे |||
verses.transliteration: bibhrad drāpiṃ hiraṇyayaṃ varuṇo vasta nirṇijam pari spaśo ni ṣedire

translations.griffith: Varuṇa, wearing golden mail, hath clad him in a shining robe.  His spies are seated found about.

verses.sanskrit: न यं दिप्सन्ति दिप्सवो न दरुह्वाणो जनानाम न देवमभिमातयः |||
verses.transliteration: na yaṃ dipsanti dipsavo na druhvāṇo janānām na devamabhimātayaḥ

translations.griffith: The God whom enemies threaten not, nor those who tyrannize o’er men,  Nor those whose minds are bent on wrong.

verses.sanskrit: उत यो मानुषेष्वा यशश्चक्रे असाम्या अस्माकमुदरेष्वा |||
verses.transliteration: uta yo mānuṣeṣvā yaśaścakre asāmyā asmākamudareṣvā

translations.griffith: He who gives glory to mankind, not glory that is incomplete,  To our own bodies giving it.

verses.sanskrit: परा मे यन्ति धीतयो गावो न गव्यूतीरनु इछन्तीरुरुचक्षसम |||
verses.transliteration: parā me yanti dhītayo ghāvo na ghavyūtīranu ichantīrurucakṣasam

translations.griffith: Yearning for the wide-seeing One, my thoughts move onward unto him,  As kine unto their pastures move.

verses.sanskrit: सं नु वोचावहै पुनर्यतो मे मध्वाभ्र्तम होतेव कषदसे परियम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ nu vocāvahai punaryato me madhvābhṛtam hoteva kṣadase priyam

translations.griffith: Once more together let us speak, because my meath is brought: priest-like  Thou eatest what is dear to thee.

verses.sanskrit: दर्शं नु विश्वदर्षतं दर्शं रथमधि कषमि एता जुषत मे गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: darśaṃ nu viśvadarṣataṃ darśaṃ rathamadhi kṣami etā juṣata me ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Now saw I him whom all may see, I saw his car above the earth:  He hath accepted these my songs.

verses.sanskrit: इमं मे वरुण शरुधी हवमद्या च मर्ळय तवामवस्युरा चके |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ me varuṇa śrudhī havamadyā ca mṛḷaya tvāmavasyurā cake

translations.griffith: Varuṇa, hear this call of mine: be gracious unto us this day  Longing for help I cried to thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवं विश्वस्य मेधिर दिवश्च गमश्च राजसि स यामनिप्रति शरुधि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ viśvasya medhira divaśca ghmaśca rājasi sa yāmaniprati śrudhi

translations.griffith: Thou, O wise God, art Lord of all, thou art the King of earth and heaven  Hear, as thou goest on thy way.

verses.sanskrit: उदुत्तमं मुमुग्धि नो वि पाशं मध्यमं चर्त अवाधमानि जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: uduttamaṃ mumughdhi no vi pāśaṃ madhyamaṃ cṛta avādhamāni jīvase

translations.griffith: Release us from the upper bond, untie the bond between, and loose  The bonds below, that I may live.

verses.sanskrit: वसिष्वा हि मियेध्य वस्त्राण्यूर्जां पते सेमं नो अध्वरं यज |||
verses.transliteration: vasiṣvā hi miyedhya vastrāṇyūrjāṃ pate semaṃ no adhvaraṃ yaja

translations.griffith: O WORTHY of oblation, Lord of prospering powers, assume thy robes,  And offer this our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: नि नो होता वरेण्यः सदा यविष्ठ मन्मभिः अग्ने दिवित्मता वचः |||
verses.transliteration: ni no hotā vareṇyaḥ sadā yaviṣṭha manmabhiḥ aghne divitmatā vacaḥ

translations.griffith: Sit ever to be chosen, as our Priest, most youthful, through our hymns,  O Agni, through our heavenly word.

verses.sanskrit: आ नि षमा सूनवे पितापिर्यजत्यापये सखा सख्ये वरेण्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ā ni ṣmā sūnave pitāpiryajatyāpaye sakhā sakhye vareṇyaḥ

translations.griffith: For here a Father for his son, Kinsman for kinsman worshippeth,  And Friend, choice-worthy, for his friend.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो बर्ही रिशादसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा सीदन्तु मनुषो यथा |||
verses.transliteration: ā no barhī riśādaso varuṇo mitro aryamā sīdantu manuṣo yathā

translations.griffith: Here let the foe-destroyers sit, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,  Like men, upon our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्व्य होतरस्य नो मन्दस्व सख्यस्य च इमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvya hotarasya no mandasva sakhyasya ca imā u ṣu śrudhī ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: O ancient Herald, be thou glad in this our rite and fellowship:  Hearken thou well to these our songs.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चिद धि शश्वता तना देवं-देवं यजामहे तवे इद्धूयते हविः |||
verses.transliteration: yaccid dhi śaśvatā tanā devaṃ-devaṃ yajāmahe tve iddhūyate haviḥ

translations.griffith: Whate’er in this perpetual course we sacrifice to God and God,  That gift is offered up in thee

verses.sanskrit: परियो नो अस्तु विश्पतिर्होता मन्द्रो वरेण्यः परियाः सवग्नयो वयम |||
verses.transliteration: priyo no astu viśpatirhotā mandro vareṇyaḥ priyāḥ svaghnayo vayam

translations.griffith: May he be our dear household Lord, Priest, pleasant and, choice-worthy may  We, with bright fires, be dear to him.

verses.sanskrit: सवग्नयो हि वार्यं देवासो दधिरे च नः सवग्नयो मनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: svaghnayo hi vāryaṃ devāso dadhire ca naḥ svaghnayo manāmahe

translations.griffith: The Gods, adored with brilliant fires. have granted precious wealth to us  So, with bright fires, we pray to thee.

verses.sanskrit: अथा न उभयेषामम्र्त मर्त्यानाम मिथः सन्तु परशस्तयः |||
verses.transliteration: athā na ubhayeṣāmamṛta martyānām mithaḥ santu praśastayaḥ

translations.griffith: And, O Immortal One, so may the eulogies of mortal men  Belong to us and thee alike.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेभिरग्ने अग्निभिरिमं यज्ञमिदं वचः चनो धाः सहसो यहो |||
verses.transliteration: viśvebhiraghne aghnibhirimaṃ yajñamidaṃ vacaḥ cano dhāḥ sahaso yaho

translations.griffith: With all thy fires, O Agni, find pleasure in this our sacrifice,  And this our speech, O Son of Strength.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वं न तवा वारवन्तं वन्दध्या अग्निं नमोभिः सम्राजन्तमध्वराणाम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvaṃ na tvā vāravantaṃ vandadhyā aghniṃ namobhiḥ samrājantamadhvarāṇām

translations.griffith: WITH worship will I glorify thee, Agni, like a long-tailed steed,  Imperial Lord of sacred rites.

verses.sanskrit: स घा नः सूनुः शवसा पर्थुप्रगामा सुशेवः मीढ्वानस्माकं बभूयात |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghā naḥ sūnuḥ śavasā pṛthupraghāmā suśevaḥ mīḍhvānasmākaṃ babhūyāt

translations.griffith: May the far-striding Son of Strength, bringer of great felicity,  Who pours his gifts like rain, be ours.

verses.sanskrit: स नो दूराच्चासाच्च नि मर्त्यादघायोः पाहि सदमिद विश्वायुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa no dūrāccāsācca ni martyādaghāyoḥ pāhi sadamid viśvāyuḥ

translations.griffith: Lord of all life, from near; from far, do thou, O Agni evermore  Protect us from the sinful man.

verses.sanskrit: इममू षु तवमस्माकं सनिं गायत्रं नव्यांसम अग्ने देवेषु पर वोचः |||
verses.transliteration: imamū ṣu tvamasmākaṃ saniṃ ghāyatraṃ navyāṃsam aghne deveṣu pra vocaḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, graciously announce this our oblation to the Gods,  And this our newest song of praise.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो भज परमेष्वा वाजेषु मध्यमेषु शिक्षा वस्वोन्तमस्य |||
verses.transliteration: ā no bhaja parameṣvā vājeṣu madhyameṣu śikṣā vasvoantamasya

translations.griffith: Give us a share of strength most high, a share of strength that is below,  A share of strength that is between.

verses.sanskrit: विभक्तासि चित्रभानो सिन्धोरूर्मा उपाक आ सद्यो दाशुषे कषरसि |||
verses.transliteration: vibhaktāsi citrabhāno sindhorūrmā upāka ā sadyo dāśuṣe kṣarasi

translations.griffith: Thou dealest gifts, resplendent One; nigh, as with waves of Sindhu, thou  Swift streamest to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: यमग्ने पर्त्सु मर्त्यमवा वाजेषु यं जुनाः स यन्ताशश्वतीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: yamaghne pṛtsu martyamavā vājeṣu yaṃ junāḥ sa yantāśaśvatīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: That man is lord of endless strength whom thou protectest in the fight,  Agni, or urgest to the fray.

verses.sanskrit: नकिरस्य सहन्त्य पर्येता कयस्य चित वाजो अस्ति शरवाय्यः |||
verses.transliteration: nakirasya sahantya paryetā kayasya cit vājo asti śravāyyaḥ

translations.griffith: Him, whosoever he may be, no man may vanquish, mighty One:  Nay, very glorious power is his.

verses.sanskrit: स वाजं विश्वचर्षणिरर्वद्भिरस्तु तरुता विप्रेभिरस्तु सनिता |||
verses.transliteration: sa vājaṃ viśvacarṣaṇirarvadbhirastu tarutā viprebhirastu sanitā

translations.griffith: May he who dwells with all mankind bear us with war-steeds through the fight,  And with the singers win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: जराबोध तद विविड्ढि विशे-विशे यज्ञियाय सतोमं रुद्राय दर्शीकम |||
verses.transliteration: jarābodha tad viviḍḍhi viśe-viśe yajñiyāya stomaṃ rudrāya dṛśīkam

translations.griffith: Help, thou who knowest lauds, this work, this eulogy to Rudra, him  Adorable in every house.

verses.sanskrit: स नो महाननिमानो धूमकेतुः पुरुश्चन्द्रः धिये वाजाय हिन्वतु |||
verses.transliteration: sa no mahānanimāno dhūmaketuḥ puruścandraḥ dhiye vājāya hinvatu

translations.griffith: May this our God, great, limitless, smoke-bannered excellently bright,  Urge us to strength and holy thought.

verses.sanskrit: स रेवानिव विश्पतिर्दैव्यः केतुः शर्णोतु नः उक्थैरग्निर्ब्र्हद्भानुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa revāniva viśpatirdaivyaḥ ketuḥ śṛṇotu naḥ ukthairaghnirbṛhadbhānuḥ

translations.griffith: Like some rich Lord of men may he, Agni the banner of the Gods,  Refulgent, hear us through our lauds.

verses.sanskrit: नमो महद्भ्यो नमो अर्भकेभ्यो नमो युवभ्यो नम आशिनेभ्यः यजाम देवान यदि शक्नवाम मा जयायसः शंसमा वर्क्षि देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: namo mahadbhyo namo arbhakebhyo namo yuvabhyo nama āśinebhyaḥ yajāma devān yadi śaknavāma mā jyāyasaḥ śaṃsamā vṛkṣi devāḥ

translations.griffith: Glory to Gods, the mighty and the lesser glory to Gods the younger and the elder!  Let us, if we have power, pay the God worship: no better prayer than this, ye Gods, acknowledge.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र गरावा पर्थुबुध्न ऊर्ध्वो भवति सोतवे उलूखलसुतानामवेद विन्द्र जल्गुलः |||
verses.transliteration: yatra ghrāvā pṛthubudhna ūrdhvo bhavati sotave ulūkhalasutānāmaved vindra jalghulaḥ

translations.griffith: THERE where the broad-based stone raised on high to press the juices out,  O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र दवाविव जघनाधिषवण्या कर्ता उलूखलसुतानामवेद विन्द्र जल्गुलः |||
verses.transliteration: yatra dvāviva jaghanādhiṣavaṇyā kṛtā ulūkhalasutānāmaved vindra jalghulaḥ

translations.griffith: Where, like broad hips, to hold the juice the platters of the press are laid,  O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र नार्यपच्यवमुपच्यवं च शिक्षते उलूखलसुतानामवेद विन्द्र जल्गुलः |||
verses.transliteration: yatra nāryapacyavamupacyavaṃ ca śikṣate ulūkhalasutānāmaved vindra jalghulaḥ

translations.griffith: There where the woman marks and leans the pestle's constant rise and fall,  O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र मन्थां विबध्नते रश्मीन यमितवा इव उलूखलसुतानामवेद विन्द्र जल्गुलः |||
verses.transliteration: yatra manthāṃ vibadhnate raśmīn yamitavā iva ulūkhalasutānāmaved vindra jalghulaḥ

translations.griffith: Where, as with reins to guide a horse, they bind the churning-staff with cords,  O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चिद धि तवं गर्हेग्र्ह उलूखलक युज्यसे इह दयुमत्तमं वद यजतामिव दुन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yaccid dhi tvaṃ ghṛheghṛha ulūkhalaka yujyase iha dyumattamaṃ vada yajatāmiva dundubhiḥ

translations.griffith: If of a truth in every house, O Mortar thou art set for work,  Here give thou forth thy clearest sound, loud as the drum of conquerors.

verses.sanskrit: उत सम ते वनस्पते वातो वि वात्यग्रमित अथो इन्द्राय पातवे सुनु सोममुलूखल |||
verses.transliteration: uta sma te vanaspate vāto vi vātyaghramit atho indrāya pātave sunu somamulūkhala

translations.griffith: O Sovran of the Forest, as the wind blows soft in front of thee,  Mortar, for Indra press thou forth the Soma juice that he may drink.

verses.sanskrit: आयजी वाजसातमा ता हयुच्चा विजर्भ्र्तः हरी इवान्धांसि बप्सता |||
verses.transliteration: āyajī vājasātamā tā hyuccā vijarbhṛtaḥ harī ivāndhāṃsi bapsatā

translations.griffith: Best strength-givers, ye stretch wide jaws, O Sacrificial Implements,  Like two bay horses champing herbs.

verses.sanskrit: ता नो अद्य वनस्पती रष्वाव रष्वेभिः सोत्र्भिः इन्द्राय मधुमत सुतम |||
verses.transliteration: tā no adya vanaspatī ṛṣvāv ṛṣvebhiḥ sotṛbhiḥ indrāya madhumat sutam

translations.griffith: Ye Sovrans of the Forest, both swift, with swift pressers press to-day  Sweet Soma juice for Indra's drink.

verses.sanskrit: उच्छिष्टं चम्वोर्भर सोमं पवित्र आ सर्ज नि धेहि गोरधि तवचि |||
verses.transliteration: ucchiṣṭaṃ camvorbhara somaṃ pavitra ā sṛja ni dhehi ghoradhi tvaci

translations.griffith: Take up in beakers what remains: the Soma on the filter pour,  and on the ox-hide set the dregs.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चिद धि सत्य सोमपा अनाशस्ता इव समसि आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु सुभ्रिषु सहस्रेषु तुवीमघ |||
verses.transliteration: yaccid dhi satya somapā anāśastā iva smasi ā tū na indra śaṃsaya ghoṣvaśveṣu subhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha

translations.griffith: O SOMA DRINKER, ever true, utterly hopeless though we be,  Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine,  In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit: शिप्रिन वाजानां पते शचीवस्तव दंसना आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु सुभ्रिषु सहस्रेषु तुवीमघ |||
verses.transliteration: śiprin vājānāṃ pate śacīvastava daṃsanā ā tū na indra śaṃsaya ghoṣvaśveṣu subhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha

translations.griffith: O Lord of Strength, whose jaws are strong, great deeds are thine, the powerful:  Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine,  In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit: नि षवापया मिथूद्र्शा सस्तामबुध्यमाने आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु सुभ्रिषु सहस्रेषु तुवीमघ |||
verses.transliteration: ni ṣvāpayā mithūdṛśā sastāmabudhyamāne ā tū na indra śaṃsaya ghoṣvaśveṣu subhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha

translations.griffith: Lull thou asleep, to wake no more, the pair who on each other look  Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine,  In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit: ससन्तु तया अरातयो बोधन्तु शूर रातयः आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु सुभ्रिषु सहस्रेषु तुवीमघ |||
verses.transliteration: sasantu tyā arātayo bodhantu śūra rātayaḥ ā tū na indra śaṃsaya ghoṣvaśveṣu subhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha

translations.griffith: Hero, let hostile spirits sleep, and every gentler genius wake:  Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine,  In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit: समिन्द्र गर्दभं मर्ण नुवन्तं पापयामुया आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु सुभ्रिषु सहस्रेषु तुवीमघ |||
verses.transliteration: samindra ghardabhaṃ mṛṇa nuvantaṃ pāpayāmuyā ā tū na indra śaṃsaya ghoṣvaśveṣu subhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha

translations.griffith: Destroy this ass, O Indra, who in tones discordant brays to thee:  Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine,  In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit: पताति कुण्ड्र्णाच्या दूरं वातो वनादधि आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु सुभ्रिषु सहस्रेषु तुवीमघ |||
verses.transliteration: patāti kuṇḍṛṇācyā dūraṃ vāto vanādadhi ā tū na indra śaṃsaya ghoṣvaśveṣu subhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha

translations.griffith: Far distant on the forest fall the tempest in a circling course!  Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine,  In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वं परिक्रोशं जहि जम्भया कर्कदाश्वम आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु सुभ्रिषु सहस्रेषु तुवीमघ |||
verses.transliteration: sarvaṃ parikrośaṃ jahi jambhayā kṛkadāśvam ā tū na indra śaṃsaya ghoṣvaśveṣu subhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha

translations.griffith: Slay each reviler, and destroy him who in secret injures us:  Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine  In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit: आ व इन्द्रं करिविं यथा वाजयन्तः शतक्रतुम मंहिष्ठं सिञ्च इन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā va indraṃ kriviṃ yathā vājayantaḥ śatakratum maṃhiṣṭhaṃ siñca indubhiḥ

translations.griffith: WE seeking strength with Soma-drops fill full your Indra like a well,  Most liberal, Lord of Hundred Powers,

verses.sanskrit: शतं वा यः शुचीनां सहस्रं वा समाशिराम एदु निम्नं न रीयते |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ vā yaḥ śucīnāṃ sahasraṃ vā samāśirām edu nimnaṃ na rīyate

translations.griffith: Who lets a hundred of the pure, a thousand of the milk-blent draughts  Flow, even as down a depth, to him;

verses.sanskrit: सं यन मदाय शुष्मिण एना हयस्योदरे समुद्रो न वयचो दधे |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yan madāya śuṣmiṇa enā hyasyodare samudro na vyaco dadhe

translations.griffith: When for the strong, the rapturous joy he in this manner hath made room  Within his belly, like the sea.

verses.sanskrit: अयमु ते समतसि कपोत इव गर्भधिम वचस्तच्चिन न ओहसे |||
verses.transliteration: ayamu te samatasi kapota iva gharbhadhim vacastaccin na ohase

translations.griffith: This is thine own. Thou drawest near, as turns a pigeon to his mate:  Thou carest too for this our prayer.

verses.sanskrit: सतोत्रं राधानां पते गिर्वाहो वीर यस्य ते विभूतिरस्तुसून्र्ता |||
verses.transliteration: stotraṃ rādhānāṃ pate ghirvāho vīra yasya te vibhūtirastusūnṛtā

translations.griffith: O Hero, Lord of Bounties, praised in hymns, may power and joyfulness  Be his who sings the laud to thee.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वस्तिष्ठा न ऊतये.अस्मिन वाजे शतक्रतो समन्येषु बरवावहै |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvastiṣṭhā na ūtaye.asmin vāje śatakrato samanyeṣu bravāvahai

translations.griffith: Lord of a Hundred Powers, stand up to lend us succour in this fight  In others too let us agree.

verses.sanskrit: योगे-योगे तवस्तरं वाजे-वाजे हवामहे सखाय इन्द्रमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: yoghe-yoghe tavastaraṃ vāje-vāje havāmahe sakhāya indramūtaye

translations.griffith: In every need, in every fray we call as friends to succour us  Indra the mightiest of all.

verses.sanskrit: आ घा गमद यदि शरवत सहस्रिणीभिरूतिभिः वाजेभिरुप नो हवम |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghā ghamad yadi śravat sahasriṇībhirūtibhiḥ vājebhirupa no havam

translations.griffith: If he will hear us let him come with succour of a thousand kinds,  And all that strengthens, to our call.

verses.sanskrit: अनु परत्नस्यौकसो हुवे तुविप्रतिं नरम यं ते पूर्वं पिता हुवे |||
verses.transliteration: anu pratnasyaukaso huve tuvipratiṃ naram yaṃ te pūrvaṃ pitā huve

translations.griffith: I call him mighty to resist, the Hero of our ancient home,  Thee whom my sire invoked of old.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा वयं विश्ववारा शास्महे पुरुहूत सखे वसो जरित्र्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ viśvavārā śāsmahe puruhūta sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: We pray to thee, O much-invoked, rich in all precious gifts, O Friend,  Kind God to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं शिप्रिणीनां सोमपाः सोमपाव्नाम सखे वज्रिन सखीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: asmākaṃ śipriṇīnāṃ somapāḥ somapāvnām sakhe vajrin sakhīnām

translations.griffith: O Soma-drinker, Thunder-armed, Friend of our lovely-featured dames  And of our Soma-drinking friends.

verses.sanskrit: तथा तदस्तु सोमपाः सखे वज्रिन तथा कर्णु यथा त उश्मसीष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: tathā tadastu somapāḥ sakhe vajrin tathā kṛṇu yathā ta uśmasīṣṭaye

translations.griffith: Thus, Soma-drinker, may it be; thus, Friend, who wieldest thunder, act  To aid each wish as we desire.

verses.sanskrit: रेवतीर्नः सधमाद इन्द्रे सन्तु तुविवाजाः कषुमन्तो याभिर्मदेम |||
verses.transliteration: revatīrnaḥ sadhamāda indre santu tuvivājāḥ kṣumanto yābhirmadema

translations.griffith: With Indra splendid feasts be ours, rich in all strengthening things wherewith,  Wealthy in food, we may rejoice.

verses.sanskrit: आ घ तवावान तमनाप्त सतोत्र्भ्यो धर्ष्णवियानः रणोरक्षं न चक्र्योह |||
verses.transliteration: ā gha tvāvān tmanāpta stotṛbhyo dhṛṣṇaviyānaḥ ṛṇorakṣaṃ na cakryoh

translations.griffith: Like thee, thyself, the singers' Friend, thou movest, as it were, besought,  Bold One, the axle of the car.

verses.sanskrit: आ यद दुवः शतक्रतवा कामं जरितॄणाम रणोरक्षं न शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad duvaḥ śatakratavā kāmaṃ jaritṝṇām ṛṇorakṣaṃ na śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: That, Śatakratu, thou to grace and please thy praisers, as it were,  Stirrest the axle with thy strength.

verses.sanskrit: शश्वदिन्द्रः पोप्रुथद्भिर्जिगाय नानदद्भिः शाश्वसद्भिर्धनानि स नो हिरण्यरथं दंसनावान स नः सनिता सनये स नो.अदात |||
verses.transliteration: śaśvadindraḥ popruthadbhirjighāya nānadadbhiḥ śāśvasadbhirdhanāni sa no hiraṇyarathaṃ daṃsanāvān sa naḥ sanitā sanaye sa no.adāt

translations.griffith: With champing, neighing loudly-snorting horses Indra hath ever won himself great treasures  A car of gold hath he whose deeds are wondrous received from us, and let us too receive it.

verses.sanskrit: आश्विनावश्वावत्येषा यतं शवीरया गोमद दस्रा हिरण्यवत ||
verses.transliteration: āśvināvaśvāvatyeṣā yataṃ śavīrayā ghomad dasrā hiraṇyavat

translations.griffith: Come, Aśvins, with enduring strength wealthy in horses and in kine,  And gold, O ye of wondrous deeds.

verses.sanskrit: समानयोजनो हि वां रथो दस्रावमर्त्यः समुद्रे अश्विनेयते |||
verses.transliteration: samānayojano hi vāṃ ratho dasrāvamartyaḥ samudre aśvineyate

translations.griffith: Your chariot yoked for both alike, immortal, ye of mighty acts,  Travels, O Aśvins, in the sea.

verses.sanskrit: वयघ्न्यस्य मूर्धनि चक्रं रथस्य येमथुः परि दयामन्यदीयते |||
verses.transliteration: vyaghnyasya mūrdhani cakraṃ rathasya yemathuḥ pari dyāmanyadīyate

translations.griffith: High on the forehead of the Bull one chariot wheel ye ever keep,  The other round the sky revolves.

verses.sanskrit: कस्त उषः कधप्रिये भुजे मर्तो अमर्त्ये कं नक्षसे विभावरि |||
verses.transliteration: kasta uṣaḥ kadhapriye bhuje marto amartye kaṃ nakṣase vibhāvari

translations.griffith: What mortal, O immortal Dawn, enjoyeth thee? Where lovest thou?  To whom, O radiant, dost thou go?

verses.sanskrit: वयं हि ते अमन्मह्यान्तादा पराकात अश्वे न चित्रे अरुषि |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ hi te amanmahyāntādā parākāt aśve na citre aruṣi

translations.griffith: For we have had thee in our thoughts whether anear or far away,  Red-hued and like a dappled mare.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तयेभिरा गहि वाजेभिर्दुहितर्दिवः अस्मे रयिं निधारय |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tyebhirā ghahi vājebhirduhitardivaḥ asme rayiṃ nidhāraya

translations.griffith: Hither, O Daughter of the Sky, come thou with these thy strengthenings,  And send thou riches down to us.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने परथमो अङगिरा रषिर्देवो देवानामभवः शिवः सखा तव वरते कवयो विद्मनापसो.अजायन्त मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo aṅghirā ṛṣirdevo devānāmabhavaḥ śivaḥ sakhā tava vrate kavayo vidmanāpaso.ajāyanta maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, wast the earliest Aṅgiras, a Seer; thou wast, a God thyself, the Gods’ auspicious Friend.  After thy holy ordinance the Maruts, sage, active through wisdom, with their glittering spears, were born.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने परथमो अङगिरस्तमः कविर्देवानां परि भूषसिव्रतम विभुर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय मेधिरो दविमाता शयुः कतिधा चिदायवे |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo aṅghirastamaḥ kavirdevānāṃ pari bhūṣasivratam vibhurviśvasmai bhuvanāya medhiro dvimātā śayuḥ katidhā cidāyave

translations.griffith: O Agni, thou, the best and earliest Aṅgiras, fulfillest as a Sage the holy law of Gods.  Sprung from two mothers, wise, through all existence spread, resting in many a place for sake of living man.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने परथमो मातरिश्वन आविर्भव सुक्रतूया विवस्वते अरेजेतां रोदसी होत्र्वूर्ये.असघ्नोर्भारमयजो महोवसो |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo mātariśvana āvirbhava sukratūyā vivasvate arejetāṃ rodasī hotṛvūrye.asaghnorbhāramayajo mahovaso

translations.griffith: To Mātariśvan first thou, Agni, wast disclosed, and to Vivasvān through thy noble inward power.  Heaven and Earth, Vasu! shook at the choosing of the Priest: the burthen thou didst bear, didst worship mighty Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने मनवे दयामवाशयः पुरूरवसे सुक्र्ते सुक्र्त्तरः शवात्रेण यत पित्रोर्मुच्यसे पर्या तवा पूर्वमनयन्नापरं पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne manave dyāmavāśayaḥ purūravase sukṛte sukṛttaraḥ śvātreṇa yat pitrormucyase paryā tvā pūrvamanayannāparaṃ punaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni thou madest heaven to thunder for mankind; thou, yet more pious, for pious Purūravas.  When thou art rapidly freed from thy parents, first eastward they bear thee round, and, after, to the west.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने वर्षभः पुष्टिवर्धन उद्यतस्रुचे भवसि शरवाय्यः य आहुतिं परि वेदा वषट्क्र्तिमेकायुरग्रे विश आविवाससि |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne vṛṣabhaḥ puṣṭivardhana udyatasruce bhavasi śravāyyaḥ ya āhutiṃ pari vedā vaṣaṭkṛtimekāyuraghre viśa āvivāsasi

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, art a Bull who makes our store increase, to be invoked by him who lifts the ladle up.  Well knowing the oblation with the hallowing word, uniting all who live, thou lightenest first our folk

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने वर्जिनवर्तनिं नरं सक्मन पिपर्षि विदथे विचर्षणे यः शूरसाता परितक्म्ये धने दभ्रेभिश्चित सम्र्ताहंसि भूयसः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne vṛjinavartaniṃ naraṃ sakman piparṣi vidathe vicarṣaṇe yaḥ śūrasātā paritakmye dhane dabhrebhiścit samṛtāhaṃsi bhūyasaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, thou savest in the synod when pursued e’en him, farseeing One! who walks in evil ways.  Thou, when the heroes fight for spoil which men rush, round, slayest in war the many by the hands of few.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तमग्ने अम्र्तत्व उत्तमे मर्तं दधासि शरवसे दिवे दिवे यस्तात्र्षाण उभयाय जन्मने मयः कर्णोषि परया च सूरये |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tamaghne amṛtatva uttame martaṃ dadhāsi śravase dive dive yastātṛṣāṇa ubhayāya janmane mayaḥ kṛṇoṣi prayaā ca sūraye

translations.griffith: For glory, Agni, day by day, thou liftest up the mortal man to highest immortality,  Even thou who yearning for both races givest them great bliss, and to the prince grantest abundant food.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने सनये धनानां यशसं कारुं कर्णुहि सतवानः रध्याम कर्मापसा नवेन देवैर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी परावतं नः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne sanaye dhanānāṃ yaśasaṃ kāruṃ kṛṇuhi stavānaḥ ṛdhyāma karmāpasā navena devairdyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, highly lauded, make our singer famous that he may win us store of riches:  May we improve the rite with new performance. O Earth and Heaven, with all the Gods, protect us.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने पित्रोरुपस्थ आ देवो देवेष्वनवद्य जाग्र्विः तनूक्र्द बोधि परमतिश्च कारवे तवं कल्याण वसु विश्वमोपिषे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne pitrorupastha ā devo deveṣvanavadya jāghṛviḥ tanūkṛd bodhi pramatiśca kārave tvaṃ kalyāṇa vasu viśvamopiṣe

translations.griffith: O blameless Agni lying in thy Parents' lap, a God among the Gods, be watchful for our good.  Former of bodies, be the singer's Providence: all good things hast thou sown for him, auspicious One!

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने परमतिस्त्वं पितासि नस्त्वं वयस्क्र्त तव जामयो वयम सं तवा रायः शतिनः सं सहस्रिणः सुवीरं यन्ति वरतपामदाभ्य |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne pramatistvaṃ pitāsi nastvaṃ vayaskṛt tava jāmayo vayam saṃ tvā rāyaḥ śatinaḥ saṃ sahasriṇaḥ suvīraṃ yanti vratapāmadābhya

translations.griffith: Agni, thou art our Providence, our Father thou: we are thy brethren and thou art our spring of life.  In thee, rich in good heroes, guard of high decrees, meet hundred, thousand treasures, O infallible!

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने परथममायुमायवे देवा अक्र्ण्वन नहुषस्य विश्पतिम इळामक्र्ण्वन मनुषस्य शासनीं पितुर्यत पुत्रो ममकस्य जायते |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne prathamamāyumāyave devā akṛṇvan nahuṣasya viśpatim iḷāmakṛṇvan manuṣasya śāsanīṃ pituryat putro mamakasya jāyate

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, have the Gods made the first living One for living man, Lord of the house of Nahuṣa.  Iḷā they made the teacher of the sons of men, what time a Son was born to the father of my race.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने तव देव पायुभिर्मघोनो रक्ष तन्वश्च वन्द्य तराता तोकस्य तनये गवामस्यनिमेषं रक्षमाणस्तव वरते |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne tava deva pāyubhirmaghono rakṣa tanvaśca vandya trātā tokasya tanaye ghavāmasyanimeṣaṃ rakṣamāṇastava vrate

translations.griffith: Worthy to be revered, O Agni, God, preserve our wealthy patrons with thy succours, and ourselves.  Guard of our seed art thou, aiding our cows to bear, incessantly protecting in thy holy way.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने यज्यवे पायुरन्तरो.अनिषङगाय चतुरक्ष इध्यसे यो रातहव्यो.अव्र्काय धायसे कीरेश्चिन मन्त्रं मनसावनोषि तम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne yajyave pāyurantaro.aniṣaṅghāya caturakṣa idhyase yo rātahavyo.avṛkāya dhāyase kīreścin mantraṃ manasāvanoṣi tam

translations.griffith: Agni, thou art a guard close to the pious man; kindled art thou, four-eyed! for him who is unarmed.  With fond heart thou acceptest e’en the poor man's prayer, when he hath brought his gift to gain security.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्न उरुशंसाय वाघते सपार्हं यद रेक्णः परमं वनोषि तत आध्रस्य चित परमतिरुच्यसे पिता पर पाकंशास्सि पर दिशो विदुष्टरः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghna uruśaṃsāya vāghate spārhaṃ yad rekṇaḥ paramaṃ vanoṣi tat ādhrasya cit pramatirucyase pitā pra pākaṃśāssi pra diśo viduṣṭaraḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni gainest for the loudly-praising priest the highest wealth, the object of a man's desire.  Thou art called Father, caring even for the weak, and wisest, to the simple one thou teachest lore.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने परयतदक्षिणं नरं वर्मेव सयूतं परि पासि विश्वतः सवादुक्षद्मा यो वसतौ सयोनक्र्ज्जीवयाजं यजते सोपमा दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne prayatadakṣiṇaṃ naraṃ varmeva syūtaṃ pari pāsi viśvataḥ svādukṣadmā yo vasatau syonakṛjjīvayājaṃ yajate sopamā divaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, the man who giveth guerdon to the priests, like well-sewn armour thou guardest on every side.  He who with grateful food shows kindness in his house, an offerer to the living, is the type of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इमामग्ने शरणिं मीम्र्षो न इममध्वानं यमगाम दूरात आपिः पिता परमतिः सोम्यानां भर्मिरस्य रषिक्र्न मर्त्यानाम |||
verses.transliteration: imāmaghne śaraṇiṃ mīmṛṣo na imamadhvānaṃ yamaghāma dūrāt āpiḥ pitā pramatiḥ somyānāṃ bhṛmirasy ṛṣikṛn martyānām

translations.griffith: Pardon, we pray, this sin of ours, O Agni,—the path which we have trodden, widely straying,  Dear Friend and Father, caring for the pious, who speedest nigh and who inspirest mortals.

verses.sanskrit: मनुष्वदग्ने अङगिरस्वदङगिरो ययातिवत सदने पूर्ववच्छुचे अछ याह्या वहा दैव्यं जनमा सादय बर्हिषि यक्षि च परियम |||
verses.transliteration: manuṣvadaghne aṅghirasvadaṅghiro yayātivat sadane pūrvavacchuce acha yāhyā vahā daivyaṃ janamā sādaya barhiṣi yakṣi ca priyam

translations.griffith: As erst to Manus, to Yayāti, Aṅgiras, so Aṅgiras! pure Agni! come thou to our hall.  Bring hither the celestial host and seat them here upon the sacred grass, and offer what they love.

verses.sanskrit: एतेनाग्ने बरह्मणा वाव्र्धस्व शक्ती वा यत ते चक्र्मा विदा वा उत पर णेष्यभि वस्यो अस्मान सं नः सर्ज सुमत्या वाजवत्या |||
verses.transliteration: etenāghne brahmaṇā vāvṛdhasva śaktī vā yat te cakṛmā vidā vā uta pra ṇeṣyabhi vasyo asmān saṃ naḥ sṛja sumatyā vājavatyā

translations.griffith: By this our prayer be thou, O Agni, strengthened, prayer made by us after our power and knowledge.  Lead thou us, therefore, to increasing riches; endow us with thy strength-bestowing favour.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य नु वीर्याणि पर वोचं यानि चकार परथमानि वज्री अहन्नहिमन्वपस्ततर्द पर वक्षणा अभिनत पर्वतानाम |||
verses.transliteration: indrasya nu vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī ahannahimanvapastatarda pra vakṣaṇā abhinat parvatānām

translations.griffith: I WILL declare the manly deeds of Indra, the first that he achieved, the Thunder-wielder.  He slew the Dragon, then disclosed the waters, and cleft the channels of the mountain torrents.

verses.sanskrit: अहन्नहिं पर्वते शिश्रियाणं तवष्टास्मै वज्रं सवर्यं ततक्ष वाश्रा इव धेनवः सयन्दमाना अञ्जः समुद्रमव जग्मुरापः |||
verses.transliteration: ahannahiṃ parvate śiśriyāṇaṃ tvaṣṭāsmai vajraṃ svaryaṃ tatakṣa vāśrā iva dhenavaḥ syandamānā añjaḥ samudramava jaghmurāpaḥ

translations.griffith: He slew the Dragon lying on the mountain: his heavenly bolt of thunder Tvaṣṭar fashioned.  Like lowing kine in rapid flow descending the waters glided downward to the ocean.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षायमाणो.अव्र्णीत सोमं तरिकद्रुकेष्वपिबत सुतस्य आसायकं मघवादत्त वज्रमहन्नेनं परथमजामहीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣāyamāṇo.avṛṇīta somaṃ trikadrukeṣvapibat sutasya āsāyakaṃ maghavādatta vajramahannenaṃ prathamajāmahīnām

translations.griffith: Impetuous as a bull, he chose the Soma and in three sacred beakers drank the juices.  Maghavan grasped the thunder for his weapon, and smote to death this firstborn of the dragons.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राहन परथमजामहीनामान मायिनाममिनाः परोत मायाः आत सूर्यं जनयन दयामुषासं तादीत्नाशत्रुं न किला विवित्से |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāhan prathamajāmahīnāmān māyināmamināḥ prota māyāḥ āt sūryaṃ janayan dyāmuṣāsaṃ tādītnāśatruṃ na kilā vivitse

translations.griffith: When, Indra, thou hadst slain the dragon's firstborn, and overcome the charms of the enchanters,  Then, giving life to Sun and Dawn and Heaven, thou foundest not one foe to stand against thee.

verses.sanskrit: अहन वर्त्रं वर्त्रतरं वयंसमिन्द्रो वज्रेण महता वधेन सकन्धांसीव कुलिशेना विव्र्क्णाहिः शयत उपप्र्क पर्थिव्याः |||
verses.transliteration: ahan vṛtraṃ vṛtrataraṃ vyaṃsamindro vajreṇa mahatā vadhena skandhāṃsīva kuliśenā vivṛkṇāhiḥ śayata upapṛk pṛthivyāḥ

translations.griffith: Indra with his own great and deadly thunder smote into pieces Vṛtra, worst of Vṛtras.  As trunks of trees, what time the axe hath felled them, low on the earth so lies the prostrate Dragon.

verses.sanskrit: अयोद्धेव दुर्मद आ हि जुह्वे महावीरं तुविबाधं रजीषम नातारीदस्य सम्र्तिं वधानां सं रुजानाः पिपिषैन्द्रशत्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: ayoddheva durmada ā hi juhve mahāvīraṃ tuvibādhaṃ ṛjīṣam nātārīdasya samṛtiṃ vadhānāṃ saṃ rujānāḥ pipiṣaindraśatruḥ

translations.griffith: He, like a mad weak warrior, challenged Indra, the great impetuous many-slaying Hero.  He, brooking not the clashing of the weapons, crushed—Indra's foe—the shattered forts in falling.

verses.sanskrit: अपादहस्तो अप्र्तन्यदिन्द्रमास्य वज्रमधि सानौ जघान वर्ष्णो वध्रिः परतिमानं बुभूषन पुरुत्रा वर्त्रो अशयद वयस्तः |||
verses.transliteration: apādahasto apṛtanyadindramāsya vajramadhi sānau jaghāna vṛṣṇo vadhriḥ pratimānaṃ bubhūṣan purutrā vṛtro aśayad vyastaḥ

translations.griffith: Footless and handless still he challenged Indra, who smote him with his bolt between the shoulders.  Emasculate yet claiming manly vigour, thus Vṛtra lay with scattered limbs dissevered.

verses.sanskrit: नदं न भिन्नममुया शयानं मनो रुहाणा अति यन्त्यापः याश्चिद वर्त्रो महिना पर्यतिष्ठत तासामहिः पत्सुतःशीर्बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: nadaṃ na bhinnamamuyā śayānaṃ mano ruhāṇā ati yantyāpaḥ yāścid vṛtro mahinā paryatiṣṭhat tāsāmahiḥ patsutaḥśīrbabhūva

translations.griffith: There as he lies like a bank-bursting river, the waters taking courage flow above him.  The Dragon lies beneath the feet of torrents which Vṛtra with his greatness had encompassed.

verses.sanskrit: नीचावया अभवद वर्त्रपुत्रेन्द्रो अस्या अव वधर्जभार उत्तरा सूरधरः पुत्र आसीद दानुः शये सहवत्सा न धेनुः |||
verses.transliteration: nīcāvayā abhavad vṛtraputrendro asyā ava vadharjabhāra uttarā sūradharaḥ putra āsīd dānuḥ śaye sahavatsā na dhenuḥ

translations.griffith: Then humbled was the strength of Vṛtra's mother: Indra hath cast his deadly bolt against her.  The mother was above, the son was under and like a cow beside her calf lay Danu.

verses.sanskrit: अतिष्ठन्तीनामनिवेशनानां काष्ठानां मध्ये निहितंशरीरम वर्त्रस्य निण्यं वि चरन्त्यापो दीर्घं तम आशयदिन्द्रशत्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: atiṣṭhantīnāmaniveśanānāṃ kāṣṭhānāṃ madhye nihitaṃśarīram vṛtrasya niṇyaṃ vi carantyāpo dīrghaṃ tama āśayadindraśatruḥ

translations.griffith: Rolled in the midst of never-ceasing currents flowing without a rest for ever onward.  The waters bear off Vṛtra's nameless body: the foe of Indra sank to during darkness.

verses.sanskrit: दासपत्नीरहिगोपा अतिष्ठन निरुद्धा आपः पणिनेव गावः अपां बिलमपिहितं यदासीद वर्त्रं जघन्वानपतद ववार |||
verses.transliteration: dāsapatnīrahighopā atiṣṭhan niruddhā āpaḥ paṇineva ghāvaḥ apāṃ bilamapihitaṃ yadāsīd vṛtraṃ jaghanvānapatad vavāra

translations.griffith: Guarded by Ahi stood the thralls of Dāsas, the waters stayed like kine held by the robber.  But he, when he had smitten Vṛtra, opened the cave wherein the floods had been imprisoned.

verses.sanskrit: अश्व्यो वारो अभवस्तदिन्द्र सर्के यत तवा परत्यहन देव एकः अजयो गा अजयः शूर सोममवास्र्जः सर्तवे सप्त सिन्धून |||
verses.transliteration: aśvyo vāro abhavastadindra sṛke yat tvā pratyahan deva ekaḥ ajayo ghā ajayaḥ śūra somamavāsṛjaḥ sartave sapta sindhūn

translations.griffith: A horse's tail wast thou when he, O Indra, smote on thy bolt; thou, God without a second,  Thou hast won back the kine, hast won the Soma; thou hast let loose to flow the Seven Rivers.

verses.sanskrit: नास्मै विद्युन न तन्यतुः सिषेध न यां मिहमकिरद धरादुनिं च इन्द्रश्च यद युयुधाते अहिश्चोतापरीभ्यो मघवा वि जिग्ये |||
verses.transliteration: nāsmai vidyun na tanyatuḥ siṣedha na yāṃ mihamakirad dhrāduniṃ ca indraśca yad yuyudhāte ahiścotāparībhyo maghavā vi jighye

translations.griffith: Nothing availed him lightning, nothing thunder, hailstorm or mist which had spread around him:  When Indra and the Dragon strove in battle, Maghavan gained the victory for ever.

verses.sanskrit: अहेर्यातारं कमपश्य इन्द्र हर्दि यत ते जघ्नुषो भीरगछत नव च यन नवतिं च सरवन्तीः शयेनो न भीतोतरो रजांसि |||
verses.transliteration: aheryātāraṃ kamapaśya indra hṛdi yat te jaghnuṣo bhīraghachat nava ca yan navatiṃ ca sravantīḥ śyeno na bhītoataro rajāṃsi

translations.griffith: Whom sawest thou to avenge the Dragon, Indra, that fear possessed thy heart when thou hadst slain him;  That, like a hawk affrighted through the regions, thou crossedst nine-and-ninety flowing rivers?

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो यातो.अवसितस्य राजा शमस्य च शर्ङगिणो वज्रबाहुः सेदु राजा कषयति चर्षणीनामरान न नेमिः परि ता बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: indro yāto.avasitasya rājā śamasya ca śṛṅghiṇo vajrabāhuḥ sedu rājā kṣayati carṣaṇīnāmarān na nemiḥ pari tā babhūva

translations.griffith: Indra is King of all that moves and moves not, of creatures tame and horned, the Thunder-wielder.  Over all living men he rules as Sovran, containing all as spokes within the felly.

verses.sanskrit: एतायामोप गव्यन्त इन्द्रमस्माकं सु परमतिं वाव्र्धाति अनाम्र्णः कुविदादस्य रायो गवां केतं परमावर्जते नः |||
verses.transliteration: etāyāmopa ghavyanta indramasmākaṃ su pramatiṃ vāvṛdhāti anāmṛṇaḥ kuvidādasya rāyo ghavāṃ ketaṃ paramāvarjate naḥ

translations.griffith: Come, fain for booty let us seek to Indra: yet more shall he increase his care that guides us.  Will not the Indestructible endow us with perfect knowledge of this wealth, of cattle?

verses.sanskrit: उपेदहं धनदामप्रतीतं जुष्टं न शयेनो वसतिम्पतामि इन्द्रं नमस्यन्नुपमेभिरर्कैर्यः सतोत्र्भ्यो हव्यो अस्ति यामन |||
verses.transliteration: upedahaṃ dhanadāmapratītaṃ juṣṭaṃ na śyeno vasatimpatāmi indraṃ namasyannupamebhirarkairyaḥ stotṛbhyo havyo asti yāman

translations.griffith: I fly to him invisible Wealth-giver as flies the falcon to his cherished eyrie,  With fairest hymns of praise adoring Indra, whom those who laud him must invoke in battle.

verses.sanskrit: नि सर्वसेन इषुधीन्रसक्त समर्यो गा अजति यस्य वष्टि चोष्कूयमाण इन्द्र भूरि वामं मा पणिर्भूरस्मदधि परव्र्द्ध |||
verses.transliteration: ni sarvasena iṣudhīnrasakta samaryo ghā ajati yasya vaṣṭi coṣkūyamāṇa indra bhūri vāmaṃ mā paṇirbhūrasmadadhi pravṛddha

translations.griffith: Mid all his host, he bindeth on the quiver: he driveth cattle from what foe he pleaseth:  Gathering up great store of riches, Indra. be thou no trafficker with us, most mighty.

verses.sanskrit: वधीर्हि दस्युं धनिनं घनेननेकश्चरन्नुपशाकेभिरिन्द्र धनोरधि विषुणक ते वयायन्नयज्वनः सनकाः परेतिमीयुः |||
verses.transliteration: vadhīrhi dasyuṃ dhaninaṃ ghanenanekaścarannupaśākebhirindra dhanoradhi viṣuṇak te vyāyannayajvanaḥ sanakāḥ pretimīyuḥ

translations.griffith: Thou slewest with thy bolt the wealthy Dasyu, alone, yet going with thy helpers, Indra!  Far from the floor of heaven in all directions, the ancient riteless ones fled to destruction.

verses.sanskrit: परा चिच्छीर्षा वव्र्जुस्त इन्द्रायज्वानो यज्वभिः सपर्धमानाः पर यद दिवो हरिव सथातरुग्र निरव्रतानधमोरोदस्योः |||
verses.transliteration: parā cicchīrṣā vavṛjusta indrāyajvāno yajvabhiḥ spardhamānāḥ pra yad divo hariva sthātarughra niravratānadhamorodasyoḥ

translations.griffith: Fighting with pious worshippers, the riteless turned and fled, Indra! with averted faces.  When thou, fierce Lord of the Bay Steeds, the Stayer, blewest from earth and heaven and sky the godless.

verses.sanskrit: अयुयुत्सन्ननवद्यस्य सेनामयातयन्त कषितयो नवग्वाः वर्षायुधो न वध्रयो निरष्टाः परवद्भिरिन्द्राच्चितयन्त आयन |||
verses.transliteration: ayuyutsannanavadyasya senāmayātayanta kṣitayo navaghvāḥ vṛṣāyudho na vadhrayo niraṣṭāḥ pravadbhirindrāccitayanta āyan

translations.griffith: They met in fight the army of the blameless: then the Navagvas put forth all their power.  They, like emasculates with men contending, fled, conscious, by steep paths from Indra, scattered.

verses.sanskrit: तवमेतान रुदतो जक्षतश्चायोधयो रजस इन्द्र पारे अवादहो दिव आ दस्युमुच्चा पर सुन्वतः सतुवतः शंसमावः |||
verses.transliteration: tvametān rudato jakṣataścāyodhayo rajasa indra pāre avādaho diva ā dasyumuccā pra sunvataḥ stuvataḥ śaṃsamāvaḥ

translations.griffith: Whether they weep or laugh, thou hast o’erthrown them, O Indra, on the sky's extremest limit.  The Dasyu thou hast burned from heaven, and welcomed the prayer of him who pours the juice and lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit: चक्राणासः परीणहं पर्थिव्या हिरण्येन मणिना शुम्भमानाः न हिन्वानासस्तितिरुस्त इन्द्रं परि सपशो अदधात सूर्येण |||
verses.transliteration: cakrāṇāsaḥ parīṇahaṃ pṛthivyā hiraṇyena maṇinā śumbhamānāḥ na hinvānāsastitirusta indraṃ pari spaśo adadhāt sūryeṇa

translations.griffith: Adorned with their array of gold and jewels, they o’er the earth a covering veil extended.  Although they hastened, they o’ercame not Indra: their spies he compassed with the Sun of morning.

verses.sanskrit: परि यदिन्द्र रोदसी उभे अबुभोजीर्महिना विश्वतः सीम अमन्यमानानभि मन्यमानैर्निर्ब्रह्मभिरधमो दस्युमिन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: pari yadindra rodasī ubhe abubhojīrmahinā viśvataḥ sīm amanyamānānabhi manyamānairnirbrahmabhiradhamo dasyumindra

translations.griffith: As thou enjoyest heaven and earth, O Indra, on every side surrounded with thy greatness,  So thou with priests hast blown away the Dasyu, and those who worship not with those who worship.

verses.sanskrit: न ये दिवः पर्थिव्या अन्तमापुर्न मायाभिर्धनदां पर्यभूवन युजं वज्रं वर्षभश्चक्र इन्द्रो निर्ज्योतिषा तमसो गा अदुक्षत |||
verses.transliteration: na ye divaḥ pṛthivyā antamāpurna māyābhirdhanadāṃ paryabhūvan yujaṃ vajraṃ vṛṣabhaścakra indro nirjyotiṣā tamaso ghā adukṣat

translations.griffith: They who pervaded earth's extremest limit subdued not with their charms the Wealth-bestower:  Indra, the Bull, made his ally the thunder, and with its light milked cows from out the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: अनु सवधामक्षरन्नापो अस्यावर्धत मध्य आ नाव्यानाम सध्रीचीनेन मनसा तमिन्द्र ओजिष्ठेन हन्मनाहन्नभि दयून |||
verses.transliteration: anu svadhāmakṣarannāpo asyāvardhata madhya ā nāvyānām sadhrīcīnena manasā tamindra ojiṣṭhena hanmanāhannabhi dyūn

translations.griffith: The waters flowed according to their nature; he raid the navigable streams waxed mighty.  Then Indra, with his spirit concentrated, smote him for ever with his strongest weapon.

verses.sanskrit: नयाविध्यदिलीबिशस्य दर्ल्हा वि शर्ङगिणमभिनच्छुष्णमिन्द्रः यावत तरो मघवन यावदोजो वज्रेण शत्रुमवधीः पर्तन्युम |||
verses.transliteration: nyāvidhyadilībiśasya dṛlhā vi śṛṅghiṇamabhinacchuṣṇamindraḥ yāvat taro maghavan yāvadojo vajreṇa śatrumavadhīḥ pṛtanyum

translations.griffith: Indra broke through Ilībiśa's strong castles, and Śuṣṇa with his horn he cut to pieces:  Thou, Maghavan, for all his might and swiftness, slewest thy fighting foeman with thy thunder

verses.sanskrit: अभि सिध्मो अजिगादस्य शत्रून वि तिग्मेन वर्षभेण पुरो.अभेत सं वज्रेणास्र्जद वर्त्रमिन्द्रः पर सवां मतिमतिरच्छाशदानः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi sidhmo ajighādasya śatrūn vi tighmena vṛṣabheṇa puro.abhet saṃ vajreṇāsṛjad vṛtramindraḥ pra svāṃ matimatiracchāśadānaḥ

translations.griffith: Fierce on his enemies fell Indra's weapon: with. his sharp bull he rent their forts in pieces.  He with his thunderbolt dealt blows on Vṛtra; and conquered, executing all his purpose.

verses.sanskrit: आवः कुत्सम इन्द्र यस्मि चाकन परावो युध्यन्तं वर्षभं दशद्युम शफच्युतो रेणुर नक्षत दयाम उच छवैत्रेयो नर्षाह्याय तस्थौ |||
verses.transliteration: āvaḥ kutsam indra yasmi cākan prāvo yudhyantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ daśadyum śaphacyuto reṇur nakṣata dyām uc chvaitreyo nṛṣāhyāya tasthau

translations.griffith: Indra, thou helpest Kutsa whom thou lovedst, and guardedst brave Daśadyu when he battled,  The dust of trampling horses rose to heaven, and Śvitrā's son stood up again for conquest.

verses.sanskrit: आवः शमं वर्षभं तुग्र्यासु कषेत्रजेषे मघवञ्छ्वित्र्यं गाम जयोक चिद अत्र तस्थिवांसो अक्रञ्छत्रूयताम अधरा वेदनाकः |||
verses.transliteration: āvaḥ śamaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tughryāsu kṣetrajeṣe maghavañchvitryaṃ ghām jyok cid atra tasthivāṃso akrañchatrūyatām adharā vedanākaḥ

translations.griffith: Śvitrā's mild steer, O Maghavan thou helpest in combat for the land, mid Tugra's houses.  Long stood they there before the task was ended: thou wast the master of the foemen's treasure.

verses.sanskrit: तरिश चिन नो अद्या भवतं नवेदसा विभुर वां याम उत रातिर अश्विना युवोर हि यन्त्रं हिम्येव वाससो ऽभयायंसेन्या भवतम मनीषिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: triś cin no adyā bhavataṃ navedasā vibhur vāṃ yāma uta rātir aśvinā yuvor hi yantraṃ himyeva vāsaso 'bhyāyaṃsenyā bhavatam manīṣibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Ye who observe this day be with us even thrice: far-stretching is you bounty, Aśvins and your course.  To you, as to a cloak in winter, we cleave close: you are to be drawn nigh unto us by the wise.

verses.sanskrit: तरयः पवयो मधुवाहने रथे सोमस्य वेनाम अनु विश्व इद विदुः तरय सकम्भास सकभितास आरभे तरिर नक्तं याथस तरिर व अश्विना दिवा |||
verses.transliteration: trayaḥ pavayo madhuvāhane rathe somasya venām anu viśva id viduḥ traya skambhāsa skabhitāsa ārabhe trir naktaṃ yāthas trir v aśvinā divā

translations.griffith: Three are the fellies in your honey-bearing car, that travels after Soma's loved one, as all know.  Three are the pillars set upon it for support: thrice journey ye by night, O Aśvins, thrice by day.

verses.sanskrit: समाने अहन तरिर अवद्यगोहना तरिर अद्य यज्ञम मधुना मिमिक्षतम तरिर वाजवतीर इषो अश्विना युवं दोषा अस्मभ्यम उषसश च पिन्वतम |||
verses.transliteration: samāne ahan trir avadyaghohanā trir adya yajñam madhunā mimikṣatam trir vājavatīr iṣo aśvinā yuvaṃ doṣā asmabhyam uṣasaś ca pinvatam

translations.griffith: Thrice in the self-same day, ye Gods who banish want, sprinkle ye thrice to-day our sacrifice with meath;  And thrice vouchsafe us store of food with plenteous strength, at evening, O ye Aśvins, and at break of day.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर वर्तिर यातं तरिर अनुव्रते जने तरिः सुप्राव्येत्रेधेव शिक्षतम तरिर नान्द्यं वहतम अश्विना युवं तरिः पर्क्षो अस्मे अक्षरेव पिन्वतम |||
verses.transliteration: trir vartir yātaṃ trir anuvrate jane triḥ suprāvyetredheva śikṣatam trir nāndyaṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvaṃ triḥ pṛkṣo asme akṣareva pinvatam

translations.griffith: Thrice come ye to our home, thrice to the righteous folk, thrice triply aid the man who well deserves your help.  Thrice, O ye Aśvins, bring us what shall make us glad; thrice send us store of food as nevermore to fail.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर नो रयिं वहतम अश्विना युवं तरिर देवताता तरिर उतावतं धियः तरिः सौभगत्वं तरिर उत शरवांसि नस तरिष्ठं वां सूरे दुहिता रुहद रथम |||
verses.transliteration: trir no rayiṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvaṃ trir devatātā trir utāvataṃ dhiyaḥ triḥ saubhaghatvaṃ trir uta śravāṃsi nas triṣṭhaṃ vāṃ sūre duhitā ruhad ratham

translations.griffith: Thrice, O ye Aśvins, bring to us abundant wealth: thrice in the Gods’ assembly, thrice assist our thoughts.  Thrice, grant ye us prosperity, thrice grant us fame; for the Sun's daughter hath mounted your three-wheeled car.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर नो अश्विना दिव्यानि भेषजा तरिः पार्थिवानि तरिर उ दत्तम अद्भ्यः ओमानं शंयोर ममकाय सूनवे तरिधातु शर्म वहतं शुभस पती |||
verses.transliteration: trir no aśvinā divyāni bheṣajā triḥ pārthivāni trir u dattam adbhyaḥ omānaṃ śaṃyor mamakāya sūnave tridhātu śarma vahataṃ śubhas patī

translations.griffith: Thrice, Aśvins, grant to us the heavenly medicines, thrice those of earth and thrice those that the waters hold,  Favour and health and strength bestow upon my son; triple protection, Lords of Splendour, grant to him.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर नो अश्विना यजता दिवे-दिवे परि तरिधातु पर्थिवीम अशायतम तिस्रो नासत्या रथ्या परावत आत्मेव वातः सवसराणि गछतम |||
verses.transliteration: trir no aśvinā yajatā dive-dive pari tridhātu pṛthivīm aśāyatam tisro nāsatyā rathyā parāvata ātmeva vātaḥ svasarāṇi ghachatam

translations.griffith: Thrice are ye to be worshipped day by day by us: thrice, O ye Aśvins, ye travel around the earth.  Car-borne from far away, O ye Nāsatyas, come, like vital air to bodies, come ye to the three.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर अश्विना सिन्धुभिः सप्तमात्र्भिस तरय आहावास तरेधा हविष कर्तम तिस्रः पर्थिवीर उपरि परवा दिवो नाकं रक्षेथे दयुभिर अक्तुभिर हितम |||
verses.transliteration: trir aśvinā sindhubhiḥ saptamātṛbhis traya āhāvās tredhā haviṣ kṛtam tisraḥ pṛthivīr upari pravā divo nākaṃ rakṣethe dyubhir aktubhir hitam

translations.griffith: Thrice, O ye Aśvins, with the Seven Mother Streams; three are the jars, the triple offering is prepared.  Three are the worlds, and moving on above the sky ye guard the firm-set vault of heaven through days and nights.

verses.sanskrit: कव तरी चक्रा तरिव्र्तो रथस्य कव तरयो वन्धुरो ये सनीळाः कदा योगो वाजिनो रासभस्य येन यज्ञं नासत्योपयाथः |||
verses.transliteration: kva trī cakrā trivṛto rathasya kva trayo vandhuro ye sanīḷāḥ kadā yogho vājino rāsabhasya yena yajñaṃ nāsatyopayāthaḥ

translations.griffith: Where are the three wheels of your triple chariot, where are the three seats thereto firmly fastened?  When will ye yoke the mighty ass that draws it, to bring you to our sacrifice. Nāsatyas?

verses.sanskrit: आ नासत्या गछतं हूयते हविर मध्वः पिबतम मधुपेभिर आसभिः युवोर हि पूर्वं सवितोषसो रथम रताय चित्रं घर्तवन्तम इष्यति |||
verses.transliteration: ā nāsatyā ghachataṃ hūyate havir madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhiḥ yuvor hi pūrvaṃ savitoṣaso ratham ṛtāya citraṃ ghṛtavantam iṣyati

translations.griffith: Nāsatyas, come: the sacred gift is offered up; drink the sweet juice with lips that know the sweetness well.  Savitar sends, before the dawn of day, your car, fraught with oil, various-coloured, to our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: आ नासत्या तरिभिर एकादशैर इह देवेभिर यातम मधुपेयम अश्विना परायुस तारिष्टं नी रपांसि मर्क्षतं सेधतं दवेषो भवतं सचाभुवा |||
verses.transliteration: ā nāsatyā tribhir ekādaśair iha devebhir yātam madhupeyam aśvinā prāyus tāriṣṭaṃ nī rapāṃsi mṛkṣataṃ sedhataṃ dveṣo bhavataṃ sacābhuvā

translations.griffith: Come, O Nāsatyas, with the thrice-eleven Gods; come, O ye Aśvins, to the drinking of the meath.  Make long our days of life, and wipe out all our sins: ward off our enemies; be with us evermore.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो अश्विना तरिव्र्ता रथेनार्वाञ्चं रयिं वहतं सुवीरम शर्ण्वन्ता वाम अवसे जोहवीमि वर्धे च नो भवतं वाजसातौ |||
verses.transliteration: ā no aśvinā trivṛtā rathenārvāñcaṃ rayiṃ vahataṃ suvīram śṛṇvantā vām avase johavīmi vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau

translations.griffith: Borne in your triple car, O Aśvins, bring us present prosperity with noble offspring.  I cry to you who hear me for protection be ye our helpers where men win the booty.

verses.sanskrit: हवयाम्य अग्निम परथमं सवस्तये हवयामि मित्रावरुणाव इहावसे हवयामि रात्रीं जगतो निवेशनीं हवयामि देवं सवितारम ऊतये |||
verses.transliteration: hvayāmy aghnim prathamaṃ svastaye hvayāmi mitrāvaruṇāv ihāvase hvayāmi rātrīṃ jaghato niveśanīṃ hvayāmi devaṃ savitāram ūtaye

translations.griffith: AGNI I first invoke for our prosperity; I call on Mitra, Varuṇa, to aid us here.  I call on Night who gives rest to all moving life; I call on Savitar the God to lend us help.

verses.sanskrit: आ कर्ष्णेन रजसा वर्तमानो निवेशयन्न अम्र्तम मर्त्यं च हिरण्ययेन सविता रथेना देवो याति भुवनानि पश्यन |||
verses.transliteration: ā kṛṣṇena rajasā vartamāno niveśayann amṛtam martyaṃ ca hiraṇyayena savitā rathenā devo yāti bhuvanāni paśyan

translations.griffith: Throughout the dusky firmament advancing, laying to rest the immortal and the mortal,  Borne in his golden chariot he cometh, Savitar, God who looks on every creature.

verses.sanskrit: याति देवः परवता यात्य उद्वता याति शुभ्राभ्यां यजतो हरिभ्याम आ देवो याति सविता परावतो ऽप विश्वा दुरिता बाधमानः |||
verses.transliteration: yāti devaḥ pravatā yāty udvatā yāti śubhrābhyāṃ yajato haribhyām ā devo yāti savitā parāvato 'pa viśvā duritā bādhamānaḥ

translations.griffith: The God moves by the upward path, the downward; with two bright Bays, adorable, he journeys.  Savitar comes, the God from the far distance, and chases from us all distress and sorrow.

verses.sanskrit: अभीव्र्तं कर्शनैर विश्वरूपं हिरण्यशम्यं यजतो बर्हन्तम आस्थाद रथं सविता चित्रभानुः कर्ष्णा रजांसि तविषीं दधानः |||
verses.transliteration: abhīvṛtaṃ kṛśanair viśvarūpaṃ hiraṇyaśamyaṃ yajato bṛhantam āsthād rathaṃ savitā citrabhānuḥ kṛṣṇā rajāṃsi taviṣīṃ dadhānaḥ

translations.griffith: His chariot decked with pearl, of various colours, lofty, with golden pole, the God hath mounted,  The many-rayed One, Savitar the holy, bound, bearing power and might, for darksome regions.

verses.sanskrit: वि जनाञ्छ्यावाः शितिपादो अख्यन रथं हिरण्यप्ररौगं वहन्तः शश्वद विशः सवितुर दैव्यस्योपस्थे विश्वा भुवनानि तस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: vi janāñchyāvāḥ śitipādo akhyan rathaṃ hiraṇyapraraughaṃ vahantaḥ śaśvad viśaḥ savitur daivyasyopasthe viśvā bhuvanāni tasthuḥ

translations.griffith: Drawing the gold-yoked car his Bays, white-footed, have manifested light to all the peoples.  Held in the lap of Savitar, divine One, all men, all beings have their place for ever.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो दयावः सवितुर दवा उपस्थां एका यमस्य भुवने विराषाट आणिं न रथ्यम अम्र्ताधि तस्थुर इह बरवीतु य उ तच चिकेतत |||
verses.transliteration: tisro dyāvaḥ savitur dvā upasthāṃ ekā yamasya bhuvane virāṣāṭ āṇiṃ na rathyam amṛtādhi tasthur iha bravītu ya u tac ciketat

translations.griffith: Three heavens there are; two Savitar's, adjacent: in Yama's world is one, the home of heroes,  As on a linch-pin, firm, rest things immortal: he who hath known it let him here declare it.

verses.sanskrit: वि सुपर्णो अन्तरिक्षाण्य अख्यद गभीरवेपा असुरः सुनीथः कवेदानीं सूर्यः कश चिकेत कतमां दयां रश्मिर अस्या ततान |||
verses.transliteration: vi suparṇo antarikṣāṇy akhyad ghabhīravepā asuraḥ sunīthaḥ kvedānīṃ sūryaḥ kaś ciketa katamāṃ dyāṃ raśmir asyā tatāna

translations.griffith: He, strong of wing, hath lightened up the regions, deep-quivering Asura, the gentle Leader.  Where now is Sūrya, where is one to tell us to what celestial sphere his ray hath wandered?

verses.sanskrit: अष्टौ वय अख्यत ककुभः पर्थिव्यास तरी धन्व योजना सप्त सिन्धून हिरण्याक्षः सविता देव आगाद दधद रत्ना दाशुषे वार्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: aṣṭau vy akhyat kakubhaḥ pṛthivyās trī dhanva yojanā sapta sindhūn hiraṇyākṣaḥ savitā deva āghād dadhad ratnā dāśuṣe vāryāṇi

translations.griffith: The earth's eight points his brightness hath illumined, three desert regions and the Seven Rivers.  God Savitar the gold-eyed hath come hither, giving choice treasures unto him who worships.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यपाणिः सविता विचर्षणिर उभे दयावाप्र्थिवी अन्तर ईयते अपामीवाम बाधते वेति सूर्यम अभि कर्ष्णेन रजसा दयाम रणोति |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā vicarṣaṇir ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī antar īyate apāmīvām bādhate veti sūryam abhi kṛṣṇena rajasā dyām ṛṇoti

translations.griffith: The golden-handed Savitar, far-seeing, goes on his way between the earth and heaven,  Drives away sickness, bids the Sun approach us, and spreads the bright sky through the darksome region.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यहस्तो असुरः सुनीथः सुम्र्ळीकः सववान यात्वर्वां अपसेधन रक्षसो यातुधानानस्थाद देवः परतिदोषं गर्णानः |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyahasto asuraḥ sunīthaḥ sumṛḷīkaḥ svavān yātvarvāṃ apasedhan rakṣaso yātudhānānasthād devaḥ pratidoṣaṃ ghṛṇānaḥ

translations.griffith: May he, gold-handed Asura, kind Leader, come hither to us with his help and favour.  Driving off Rākṣasas and Yātudhānas, the God is present, praised in hymns at evening.

verses.sanskrit: ये ते पन्थाः सवितः पूर्व्यासो.अरेणवः सुक्र्ता अन्तरिक्षे तेभिर्नो अद्य पथिभिः सुगेभी रक्षा च नो अधि च बरूहि देव |||
verses.transliteration: ye te panthāḥ savitaḥ pūrvyāso.areṇavaḥ sukṛtā antarikṣe tebhirno adya pathibhiḥ sughebhī rakṣā ca no adhi ca brūhi deva

translations.griffith: O Savitar, thine ancient dustless pathways are well established in the air's mid-region:  O God, come by those paths so fair to travel, preserve thou us from harm this day, and bless us.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो यह्वं पुरूणां विशां देवयतीनाम अग्निं सूक्तेभिर्वचोभिरीमहे यं सीमिदन्य ईळते |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo yahvaṃ purūṇāṃ viśāṃ devayatīnām aghniṃ sūktebhirvacobhirīmahe yaṃ sīmidanya īḷate

translations.griffith: WITH words sent forth in holy hymns, Agni we supplicate, the Lord  Of many families who duly serve the Gods, yea, him whom others also praise.

verses.sanskrit: जनासो अग्निं दधिरे सहोव्र्धं हविष्मन्तो विधेम ते स तवं नो अद्य सुमना इहाविता भवा वाजेषु सन्त्य |||
verses.transliteration: janāso aghniṃ dadhire sahovṛdhaṃ haviṣmanto vidhema te sa tvaṃ no adya sumanā ihāvitā bhavā vājeṣu santya

translations.griffith: Men have won Agni, him who makes their strength abound: we, with oblations, worship thee.  Our gracious-minded Helper in our deeds of might, be thou, O Excellent, this day.

verses.sanskrit: पर तवा दूतं वर्णीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम महस्ते सतो वि चरन्त्यर्चयो दिवि सप्र्शन्ति भानवः |||
verses.transliteration: pra tvā dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam mahaste sato vi carantyarcayo divi spṛśanti bhānavaḥ

translations.griffith: Thee for our messenger we choose, thee, the Omniscient, for our Priest.  The flames of thee the mighty are spread wide around: thy splendour reaches to the sky.

verses.sanskrit: देवासस्त्वा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा सं दूतं परत्नमिन्धते विश्वं सो अग्ने जयति तवया धनं यस्ते ददाश मर्त्यः |||
verses.transliteration: devāsastvā varuṇo mitro aryamā saṃ dūtaṃ pratnamindhate viśvaṃ so aghne jayati tvayā dhanaṃ yaste dadāśa martyaḥ

translations.griffith: The Gods enkindle thee their ancient messenger,—Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman.  That mortal man, O Agni, gains through thee all wealth, who hath poured offerings unto thee.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रो होता गर्हपतिरग्ने दूतो विशामसि तवे विश्वा संगतानि वरता धरुवा यानि देवा अक्र्ण्वत |||
verses.transliteration: mandro hotā ghṛhapatiraghne dūto viśāmasi tve viśvā saṃghatāni vratā dhruvā yāni devā akṛṇvata

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, art a cheering Priest, Lord of the House, men's messenger:  All constant high decrees established by the Gods, gathered together, meet in thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवे इदग्ने सुभगे यविष्ठ्य विश्वमा हूयते हविः सत्वं नो अद्य सुमना उतापरं यक्षि देवान सुवीर्या |||
verses.transliteration: tve idaghne subhaghe yaviṣṭhya viśvamā hūyate haviḥ satvaṃ no adya sumanā utāparaṃ yakṣi devān suvīryā

translations.griffith: In thee, the auspicious One, O Agni, youthfullest, each sacred gift is offered up:  This day, and after, gracious, worship thou our Gods, that we may have heroic sons.

verses.sanskrit: तं घेमित्था नमस्विन उप सवराजमासते होत्राभिरग्निं मनुषः समिन्धते तितिर्वांसो अति सरिधः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ ghemitthā namasvina upa svarājamāsate hotrābhiraghniṃ manuṣaḥ samindhate titirvāṃso ati sridhaḥ

translations.griffith: To him in his own splendour bright draw near in worship the devout.  Men kindle Agni with their sacrificial gifts, victorious o’er the enemies.

verses.sanskrit: घनन्तो वर्त्रमतरन रोदसी अप उरु कषयाय चक्रिरे भुवत कण्वे वर्षा दयुम्न्याहुतः करन्ददश्वो गविष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: ghnanto vṛtramataran rodasī apa uru kṣayāya cakrire bhuvat kaṇve vṛṣā dyumnyāhutaḥ krandadaśvo ghaviṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: Vṛtra they smote and slew, and made the earth and heaven and firmament a wide abode.  The glorious Bull, invoked, hath stood at Kaṇva's side: loud neighed the Steed in frays for kine.

verses.sanskrit: सं सीदस्व महानसि शोचस्व देववीतमः वि धूममग्ने अरुषं मियेध्य सर्ज परशस्त दर्शतम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ sīdasva mahānasi śocasva devavītamaḥ vi dhūmamaghne aruṣaṃ miyedhya sṛja praśasta darśatam

translations.griffith: Seat thee, for thou art mighty; shine, best entertainer of the Gods.  Worthy of sacred food, praised Agni! loose the smoke, ruddy and beautiful to see.

verses.sanskrit: यं तवा देवासो मनवे दधुरिह यजिष्ठं हव्यवाहन यं कण्वो मेध्यातिथिर्धनस्प्र्तं यं वर्षा यमुपस्तुतः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvā devāso manave dadhuriha yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana yaṃ kaṇvo medhyātithirdhanaspṛtaṃ yaṃ vṛṣā yamupastutaḥ

translations.griffith: Bearer of offerings, whom, best sacrificing Priest, the Gods for Manu's sake ordained;  Whom Kaṇva, whom Medhyātithi made the source of wealth, and Vṛṣan and Upastuta.

verses.sanskrit: यमग्निं मेध्यातिथिः कण्व ईध रतादधि तस्य परेषो दीदियुस्तमिमा रचस्तमग्निं वर्धयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: yamaghniṃ medhyātithiḥ kaṇva īdha ṛtādadhi tasya preṣo dīdiyustamimā ṛcastamaghniṃ vardhayāmasi

translations.griffith: Him, Agni, whom Medhyātithi, whom Kaṇva kindled for his rite,  Him these our songs of praise, him, Agni, we extol: his powers shine out preeminent.

verses.sanskrit: रायस पूर्धि सवधावो.अस्ति हि ते.अग्ने देवेष्वाप्यम तवंवाजस्य शरुत्यस्य राजसि स नो मर्ळ महानसि |||
verses.transliteration: rāyas pūrdhi svadhāvo.asti hi te.aghne deveṣvāpyam tvaṃvājasya śrutyasya rājasi sa no mṛḷa mahānasi

translations.griffith: Make our wealth perfect thou, O Agni, Lord divine: for thou hast kinship with the Gods.  Thou rulest as a King o’er widely-famous strength: be good to us, for thou art great.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्व ऊ षु ण ऊतये तिष्ठा देवो न सविता ऊर्ध्वोवाजस्य सनिता यदञ्जिभिर्वाघद्भिर्विह्वयामहे |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇa ūtaye tiṣṭhā devo na savitā ūrdhvovājasya sanitā yadañjibhirvāghadbhirvihvayāmahe

translations.griffith: Stand up erect to lend us aid, stand up like Savitar the God:  Erect as strength-bestower we call aloud, with unguents and with priests, on thee.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो नः पाह्यंहसो नि केतुना विश्वं समत्रिणं दह कर्धी न ऊर्ध्वाञ्चरथाय जीवसे विदा देवेषु नो दुवः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo naḥ pāhyaṃhaso ni ketunā viśvaṃ samatriṇaṃ daha kṛdhī na ūrdhvāñcarathāya jīvase vidā deveṣu no duvaḥ

translations.griffith: Erect, preserve us from sore trouble; with thy flame burn thou each ravening demon dead.  Raise thou us up that we may walk and live: so thou shalt find our worship mid the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पाहि नो अग्ने रक्षसः पाहि धूर्तेरराव्णः पाहि रीषत उत वा जिघांसतो बर्हद्भानो यविष्ठ्य |||
verses.transliteration: pāhi no aghne rakṣasaḥ pāhi dhūrterarāvṇaḥ pāhi rīṣata uta vā jighāṃsato bṛhadbhāno yaviṣṭhya

translations.griffith: Preserve us, Agni, from the fiend, preserve us from malicious wrong.  Save us from him who fain would injure us or slay, Most Youthful, thou with lofty light.

verses.sanskrit: घनेव विष्वग वि जह्यराव्णस्तपुर्जम्भ यो अस्मध्रुक यो मर्त्यः शिशीते अत्यक्तुभिर्मा नः स रिपुरीशत |||
verses.transliteration: ghaneva viṣvagh vi jahyarāvṇastapurjambha yo asmadhruk yo martyaḥ śiśīte atyaktubhirmā naḥ sa ripurīśata

translations.griffith: Smite down as with a club, thou who hast fire for teeth, smite thou the wicked, right and left.  Let not the man who plots against us in the night, nor any foe prevail o’er us.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्वव्ने सुवीर्यमग्निः कण्वाय सौभगम अग्निः परावन मित्रोत मेध्यातिथिमग्निः साता उपस्तुतम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirvavne suvīryamaghniḥ kaṇvāya saubhagham aghniḥ prāvan mitrota medhyātithimaghniḥ sātā upastutam

translations.griffith: Agni hath given heroic might to Kaṇva, and felicity:  Agni hath helped our friends, hath helped Medhyātithi, hath helped Upastuta to win.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निना तुर्वशं यदुं परावत उग्रादेवं हवामहे अग्निर्नयन नववास्त्वं बर्हद्रथं तुर्वीतिं दस्यवे सहः |||
verses.transliteration: aghninā turvaśaṃ yaduṃ parāvata ughrādevaṃ havāmahe aghnirnayan navavāstvaṃ bṛhadrathaṃ turvītiṃ dasyave sahaḥ

translations.griffith: We call on Ugradeva, Yadu, Turvaśa, by means of Agni, from afar;  Agni, bring Navavāstva and Bṛhadratha, Turvīti, to subdue the foe.

verses.sanskrit: नि तवामग्ने मनुर्दधे जयोतिर्जनाय शश्वते दीदेथ कण्व रतजात उक्षितो यं नमस्यन्ति कर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: ni tvāmaghne manurdadhe jyotirjanāya śaśvate dīdetha kaṇva ṛtajāta ukṣito yaṃ namasyanti kṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Manu hath stablished thee a light, Agni, for all the race of men:  Sprung from the Law, oil-fed, for Kaṇva hast thou blazed, thou whom the people reverence.

verses.sanskrit: तवेषासो अग्नेरमवन्तो अर्चयो भीमासो न परतीतये रक्षस्विनः सदमिद यातुमावतो विश्वं समत्रिणं दह |||
verses.transliteration: tveṣāso aghneramavanto arcayo bhīmāso na pratītaye rakṣasvinaḥ sadamid yātumāvato viśvaṃ samatriṇaṃ daha

translations.griffith: The flames of Agni full of splendour and of might are fearful, not to be approached.  Consume for ever all demons and sorcerers, consume thou each devouring fiend.

verses.sanskrit: करीळं वः शर्धो मारुतमनर्वाणं रथेशुभम कण्वा अभि पर गायत |||
verses.transliteration: krīḷaṃ vaḥ śardho mārutamanarvāṇaṃ ratheśubham kaṇvā abhi pra ghāyata

translations.griffith: SING forth, O Kaṇvas, to your band of Maruts unassailable,  Sporting, resplendent on their car

verses.sanskrit: ये पर्षतीभिर्र्ष्टिभिः साकं वाशीभिरञ्जिभिः अजायन्त सवभानवः |||
verses.transliteration: ye pṛṣatībhirṛṣṭibhiḥ sākaṃ vāśībhirañjibhiḥ ajāyanta svabhānavaḥ

translations.griffith: They who, self-luminous, were born together, with the spotted deer,  Spears, swords, and glittering ornaments.

verses.sanskrit: इहेव शर्ण्व एषां कशा हस्तेषु यद वदान नि यामञ्चित्रं रञ्जते |||
verses.transliteration: iheva śṛṇva eṣāṃ kaśā hasteṣu yad vadān ni yāmañcitraṃ ṛñjate

translations.griffith: One hears, as though ’twere close at hand, the cracking of the whips they hold  They gather glory on their way.

verses.sanskrit: पर वः शर्धाय घर्ष्वये तवेषद्युम्नाय शुष्मिणे देवत्तं बरह्म गायत |||
verses.transliteration: pra vaḥ śardhāya ghṛṣvaye tveṣadyumnāya śuṣmiṇe devattaṃ brahma ghāyata

translations.griffith: Now sing ye forth the God-given hymn to your exultant Marut host,  The fiercely-vigorous, the strong.

verses.sanskrit: पर शंसा गोष्वघ्न्यं करीळं यच्छर्धो मारुतम जम्भे रसस्य वाव्र्धे |||
verses.transliteration: pra śaṃsā ghoṣvaghnyaṃ krīḷaṃ yacchardho mārutam jambhe rasasya vāvṛdhe

translations.griffith: Praise ye the Bull among the cows; for ’tis the Maruts’ sportive band:  It strengthened as it drank the rain.

verses.sanskrit: को वो वर्षिष्ठ आ नरो दिवश्च गमश्च धूतयः यत सीम अन्तं न धूनुथ |||
verses.transliteration: ko vo varṣiṣṭha ā naro divaśca ghmaśca dhūtayaḥ yat sīm antaṃ na dhūnutha

translations.griffith: Who is your mightiest, Heroes, when, O shakers of the earth and heaven,  Ye shake them like a garment's hem?

verses.sanskrit: नि वो यामाय मानुषो दध्र उग्राय मन्यवे जिहीत पर्वतो गिरिः |||
verses.transliteration: ni vo yāmāya mānuṣo dadhra ughrāya manyave jihīta parvato ghiriḥ

translations.griffith: At your approach man holds him down before the fury of your wrath:  The rugged-jointed mountain yields.

verses.sanskrit: येषाम अज्मेषु पर्थिवी जुजुर्वां इव विश्पतिः भिया यामेषु रेजते |||
verses.transliteration: yeṣām ajmeṣu pṛthivī jujurvāṃ iva viśpatiḥ bhiyā yāmeṣu rejate

translations.griffith: They at whose racings forth the earth, like an age-weakened lord of men,  Trembles in terror on their ways.

verses.sanskrit: सथिरं हि जानम एषां वयो मातुर निरेतवे यत सीम अनु दविता शवः |||
verses.transliteration: sthiraṃ hi jānam eṣāṃ vayo mātur niretave yat sīm anu dvitā śavaḥ

translations.griffith: Strong is their birth: vigour have they to issue from their Mother; strength,  Yea, even twice enough, is theirs.

verses.sanskrit: उद उ तये सूनवो गिरः काष्ठा अज्मेष्व अत्नत वाश्रा अभिज्ञु यातवे |||
verses.transliteration: ud u tye sūnavo ghiraḥ kāṣṭhā ajmeṣv atnata vāśrā abhijñu yātave

translations.griffith: And these, the Sons, the Singers, in their racings have enlarged the bounds,  So that the kine must walk knee-deep.

verses.sanskrit: तयं चिद घा दीर्घम पर्थुम मिहो नपातम अम्र्ध्रम पर चयावयन्ति यामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ cid ghā dīrgham pṛthum miho napātam amṛdhram pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Before them, on the ways they go, they drop this offspring of the cloud,  Long, broad, and inexhaustible.

verses.sanskrit: मरुतो यद ध वो बलं जनां अचुच्यवीतन गिरींर अचुच्यवीतन |||
verses.transliteration: maruto yad dha vo balaṃ janāṃ acucyavītana ghirīṃr acucyavītana

translations.griffith: O Maruts, as your strength is great, so have ye cast men down on earth,  So have ye made the mountains fall.

verses.sanskrit: यद ध यान्ति मरुतः सं ह बरुवते ऽधवन्न आ शर्णोति कश चिद एषाम |||
verses.transliteration: yad dha yānti marutaḥ saṃ ha bruvate 'dhvann ā śṛṇoti kaś cid eṣām

translations.griffith: The while the Maruts pass along, they talk together on the way:  Doth any hear them as they speak?

verses.sanskrit: पर यात शीभम आशुभिः सन्ति कण्वेषु वो दुवः तत्रो षु मादयाध्वै |||
verses.transliteration: pra yāta śībham āśubhiḥ santi kaṇveṣu vo duvaḥ tatro ṣu mādayādhvai

translations.griffith: Come quick with swift steeds, for ye have worshippers among Kaṇva's sons  May you rejoice among them well.

verses.sanskrit: अस्ति हि षमा मदाय वः समसि षमा वयम एषाम विश्वं चिद आयुर जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: asti hi ṣmā madāya vaḥ smasi ṣmā vayam eṣām viśvaṃ cid āyur jīvase

translations.griffith: All is prepared for your delight. We are their servants evermore,  To live as long as life may last.

verses.sanskrit: कद ध नूनं कधप्रियः पिता पुत्रं न हस्तयोः दधिध्वे वर्क्तबर्हिषः |||
verses.transliteration: kad dha nūnaṃ kadhapriyaḥ pitā putraṃ na hastayoḥ dadhidhve vṛktabarhiṣaḥ

translations.griffith: WHAT now? When will ye take us by both hands, as a dear sire his son,  Gods, for whom sacred grass is clipped?

verses.sanskrit: कव नूनं कद वो अर्थं गन्ता दिवो न पर्थिव्याः कव वो गावो न रण्यन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: kva nūnaṃ kad vo arthaṃ ghantā divo na pṛthivyāḥ kva vo ghāvo na raṇyanti

translations.griffith: Now whither? To what goal of yours go ye in heaven, and not on earth?  Where do your cows disport themselves?

verses.sanskrit: कव वः सुम्ना नव्यांसि मरुतः कव सुविता कव विश्वानि सौभगा |||
verses.transliteration: kva vaḥ sumnā navyāṃsi marutaḥ kva suvitā kv viśvāni saubhaghā

translations.griffith: Where are your newest favours shown? Where, Maruts, your prosperity?  Where all your high felicities?

verses.sanskrit: यद यूयम पर्श्निमातरो मर्तासः सयातन सतोता वो अम्र्तः सयात |||
verses.transliteration: yad yūyam pṛśnimātaro martāsaḥ syātana stotā vo amṛtaḥ syāt

translations.griffith: If, O ye Maruts, ye the Sons whom Pṛśni bore, were mortal, and  Immortal he who sings your praise.

verses.sanskrit: मा वो मर्गो न यवसे जरिता भूद अजोष्यः पथा यमस्य गाद उप |||
verses.transliteration: mā vo mṛgho na yavase jaritā bhūd ajoṣyaḥ pathā yamasya ghād upa

translations.griffith: Then never were your praiser loathed like a wild beast in pasture-land,  Nor should he go on Yama's path.

verses.sanskrit: मो षु णः परा-परा निर्र्तिर दुर्हणा वधीत पदीष्ट तर्ष्णया सह |||
verses.transliteration: mo ṣu ṇaḥ parā-parā nirṛtir durhaṇā vadhīt padīṣṭa tṛṣṇayā saha

translations.griffith: Let not destructive plague on plague hard to be conquered, strike its down:  Let each, with drought, depart from us.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यं तवेषा अमवन्तो धन्वञ चिद आ रुद्रियासः मिहं कर्ण्वन्त्य अवाताम |||
verses.transliteration: satyaṃ tveṣā amavanto dhanvañ cid ā rudriyāsaḥ mihaṃ kṛṇvanty avātām

translations.griffith: Truly, they the fierce and mighty Sons of Rudra send their windless  Rain e’en on the desert places.

verses.sanskrit: वाश्रेव विद्युन मिमाति वत्सं न माता सिषक्ति यद एषां वर्ष्टिर असर्जि |||
verses.transliteration: vāśreva vidyun mimāti vatsaṃ na mātā siṣakti yad eṣāṃ vṛṣṭir asarji

translations.griffith: Like a cow the lightning lows and follows, motherlike, her youngling,  When their rain-flood hath been loosened.

verses.sanskrit: दिवा चित तमः कर्ण्वन्ति पर्जन्येनोदवाहेन यत पर्थिवीं वयुन्दन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: divā cit tamaḥ kṛṇvanti parjanyenodavāhena yat pṛthivīṃ vyundanti

translations.griffith: When they inundate the earth they spread forth darkness e’en in day time,  With the water-laden rain-cloud.

verses.sanskrit: अध सवनान मरुतां विश्वम आ सद्म पार्थिवम अरेजन्त पर मानुषाः |||
verses.transliteration: adha svanān marutāṃ viśvam ā sadma pārthivam arejanta pra mānuṣāḥ

translations.griffith: O Maruts, at your voice's sound this earthly habitation shakes,  And each man reels who dwells therein.

verses.sanskrit: मरुतो वीळुपाणिभिश चित्रा रोधस्वतीर अनु यातेम अखिद्रयामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: maruto vīḷupāṇibhiś citrā rodhasvatīr anu yātem akhidrayāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: O Maruts, with your strong-hoofed steeds, unhindered in their courses, haste  Along the bright embanked streams.

verses.sanskrit: सथिरा वः सन्तु नेमयो रथा अश्वास एषाम सुसंस्क्र्ता अभीशवः |||
verses.transliteration: sthirā vaḥ santu nemayo rathā aśvāsa eṣām susaṃskṛtā abhīśavaḥ

translations.griffith: Firm be the fellies of your wheels, steady your horses and your cars,  And may your reins be fashioned well.

verses.sanskrit: अछा वदा तना गिरा जरायै बरह्मणस पतिम अग्निम मित्रं न दर्शतम |||
verses.transliteration: achā vadā tanā ghirā jarāyai brahmaṇas patim aghnim mitraṃ na darśatam

translations.griffith: Invite thou hither with this song, for praise, Agni the Lord of Prayer,  Him who is fair as Mitra is.

verses.sanskrit: मिमीहि शलोकम आस्यपर्जन्य इव ततनः गाय गायत्रम उक्थ्यम |||
