verses.transliteration: mimīhi ślokam āsyaparjanya iva tatanaḥ ghāya ghāyatram ukthyam

translations.griffith: Form in thy mouth the hymn of praise expand thee like, a rainy cloud  Sing forth the measured eulogy.

verses.sanskrit: वन्दस्व मारुतं गणं तवेषम पनस्युम अर्किणम अस्मे वर्द्धा असन्न इह |||
verses.transliteration: vandasva mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ tveṣam panasyum arkiṇam asme vṛddhā asann iha

translations.griffith: Sing glory to the Marut host, praiseworthy, tuneful, vigorous:  Here let the Strong Ones dwell with us.

verses.sanskrit: पर यद इत्था परावतः शोचिर न मानम अस्यथ कस्य करत्वा मरुतः कस्य वर्पसा कं याथ कं ह धूतयः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yad itthā parāvataḥ śocir na mānam asyatha kasya kratvā marutaḥ kasya varpasā kaṃ yātha kaṃ ha dhūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: WHEN thus, like flame, from far away, Maruts, ye cast your measure forth,  To whom go Ye, to whom, O shakers of the earth, moved by whose wisdom, whose design?

verses.sanskrit: सथिरा वः सन्त्व आयुधा पराणुदे वीळू उत परतिष्कभे युष्माकम अस्तु तविषी पनीयसी मा मर्त्यस्य मायिनः |||
verses.transliteration: sthirā vaḥ santv āyudhā parāṇude vīḷū uta pratiṣkabhe yuṣmākam astu taviṣī panīyasī mā martyasya māyinaḥ

translations.griffith: Strong let your weapons be to drive away your foes, firm for resistance let them be.  Yea, passing glorious must be your warrior might, not as a guileful mortal's strength.

verses.sanskrit: परा ह यत सथिरं हथ नरो वर्तयथा गुरु वि याथन वनिनः पर्थिव्या वय आशाः पर्वतानाम |||
verses.transliteration: parā ha yat sthiraṃ hatha naro vartayathā ghuru vi yāthana vaninaḥ pṛthivyā vy āśāḥ parvatānām

translations.griffith: When what is strong ye overthrow, and whirl about each ponderous thing,  Heroes, your course is through the forest trees of earth, and through the fissures of the rocks.

verses.sanskrit: नहि वः शत्रुर विविदे अधि दयवि न भूम्यां रिशादसः युष्माकम अस्तु तविषी तना युजा रुद्रासो नू चिद आध्र्षे |||
verses.transliteration: nahi vaḥ śatrur vivide adhi dyavi na bhūmyāṃ riśādasaḥ yuṣmākam astu taviṣī tanā yujā rudrāso nū cid ādhṛṣe

translations.griffith: Consumers of your foes, no enemy of yours is found in heaven or on the earth:  Ye Rudras, may the strength, held in this bond, be yours, to bid defiance even now.

verses.sanskrit: पर वेपयन्ति पर्वतान वि विञ्चन्ति वनस्पतीन परो आरत मरुतो दुर्मदा इव देवासः सर्वया विशा |||
verses.transliteration: pra vepayanti parvatān vi viñcanti vanaspatīn pro ārata maruto durmadā iva devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā

translations.griffith: They make the mountains rock and reel, they rend the forest-kings apart.  Onward, ye Maruts, drive, like creatures drunk with wine, ye, Gods with all your company.

verses.sanskrit: उपो रथेषु पर्षतीर अयुग्ध्वम परष्टिर वहति रोहितः आ वो यामाय पर्थिवी चिद अश्रोद अबीभयन्त मानुषाः |||
verses.transliteration: upo ratheṣu pṛṣatīr ayughdhvam praṣṭir vahati rohitaḥ ā vo yāmāya pṛthivī cid aśrod abībhayanta mānuṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Ye to your chariot have yoked the spotted deer: a red deer, as a leader, draws.  Even the Earth herself listened as ye came near, and men were sorely terrified.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो मक्षू तनाय कं रुद्रा अवो वर्णीमहे गन्ता नूनं नो ऽवसा यथा पुरेत्था कण्वाय बिभ्युषे |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo makṣū tanāya kaṃ rudrā avo vṛṇīmahe ghantā nūnaṃ no 'vasā yathā puretthā kaṇvāya bibhyuṣe

translations.griffith: O Rudras, quickly we desire your succour for this work of ours.  Come to us with your aid as in the days of old, so now for frightened Kaṇva's sake.

verses.sanskrit: युष्मेषितो मरुतो मर्त्येषित आ यो नो अभ्व ईषते वि तं युयोत शवसा वय ओजसा वि युष्माकाभिर ऊतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yuṣmeṣito maruto martyeṣita ā yo no abhva īṣate vi taṃ yuyota śavasā vy ojasā vi yuṣmākābhir ūtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Should any monstrous foe, O Maruts, sent by you or sent by mortals threaten us,  Tear ye him from us with your power and with your might, and with the succours that are yours.

verses.sanskrit: असामि हि परयज्यवः कण्वं दद परचेतसः असामिभिर्मरुत आ न ऊतिभिर्गन्ता वर्ष्तिं न विद्युतः |||
verses.transliteration: asāmi hi prayajyavaḥ kaṇvaṃ dada pracetasaḥ asāmibhirmaruta ā na ūtibhirghantā vṛṣtiṃ na vidyutaḥ

translations.griffith: For ye, the worshipful and wise, have guarded Kaṇva perfectly.  O Maruts, come to us with full protecting help, as lightning flashes seek the rain.

verses.sanskrit: असाम्योजो बिभ्र्था सुदानवो.असामि धूतयः शवः रषिद्विषे मरुतः परिमन्यव इषुं न सर्जत दविषम |||
verses.transliteration: asāmyojo bibhṛthā sudānavo.asāmi dhūtayaḥ śavaḥ ṛṣidviṣe marutaḥ parimanyava iṣuṃ na sṛjata dviṣam

translations.griffith: Whole strength have ye, O Bounteous Ones; perfect, earth-shakers, is your might.  Maruts, against the poet's wrathful enemy send ye an enemy like a dart.

verses.sanskrit: उत तिष्ठ बरह्मणस पते देवयन्तस्त्वेमहे उप पर यन्तु मरुतः सुदानव इन्द्र पराशूर्भवा सचा |||
verses.transliteration: ut tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate devayantastvemahe upa pra yantu marutaḥ sudānava indra prāśūrbhavā sacā

translations.griffith: O BRAHMAṆASPATI, stand up: God-serving men we pray to thee.  May they who give good gifts, the Maruts, come to us. Indra, most swift, be thou with them.

verses.sanskrit: तवामिद धि सहसस पुत्र मर्त्य उपब्रूते धने हिते सुवीर्यं मरुत आ सवश्व्यं दधीत यो व आचके |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmid dhi sahasas putra martya upabrūte dhane hite suvīryaṃ maruta ā svaśvyaṃ dadhīta yo va ācake

translations.griffith: O Son of Strength, each mortal calls to thee for aid when spoil of battle waits for him.  O Maruts, may this man who loves you well obtain wealth of good steeds and hero might.

verses.sanskrit: परैतु बरह्मणस पतिः पर देव्येतु सून्र्ता अछा वीरंनर्यं पङकतिराधसं देवा यज्ञं नयन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: praitu brahmaṇas patiḥ pra devyetu sūnṛtā achā vīraṃnaryaṃ paṅktirādhasaṃ devā yajñaṃ nayantu naḥ

translations.griffith: May Brahmaṇaspati draw nigh, may Sūnṛtā the Goddess come,  And Gods bring to this rite which gives the five-fold gift the Hero, lover of mankind.

verses.sanskrit: यो वाघते ददाति सूनरं वसु स धत्ते अक्षिति शरवः तस्मा इळां सुवीरामा यजामहे सुप्रतूर्तिमनेहसम |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāghate dadāti sūnaraṃ vasu sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ tasmā iḷāṃ suvīrāmā yajāmahe supratūrtimanehasam

translations.griffith: He who bestows a noble guerdon on the priest wins fame that never shall decay.  For him we offer sacred hero-giving food, peerless and conquering easily.

verses.sanskrit: पर नूनं बरह्मणस पतिर्मन्त्रं वदत्युक्थ्यम यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा देवा ओकांसि चक्रिरे |||
verses.transliteration: pra nūnaṃ brahmaṇas patirmantraṃ vadatyukthyam yasminnindro varuṇo mitro aryamā devā okāṃsi cakrire

translations.griffith: Now Brahmaṇaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise,  Wherein Indra and Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the Gods, have made their dwelling place.

verses.sanskrit: तमिद वोचेमा विदथेषु शम्भुवं मन्त्रं देवा अनेहसम इमां च वाचं परतिहर्यथा नरो विश्वेद वामा वो अश्नवत |||
verses.transliteration: tamid vocemā vidatheṣu śambhuvaṃ mantraṃ devā anehasam imāṃ ca vācaṃ pratiharyathā naro viśved vāmā vo aśnavat

translations.griffith: May we in holy synods, Gods! recite that hymn, peerless, that brings felicity.  If you, O Heroes, graciously accept this word, may it obtain all bliss from you.

verses.sanskrit: को देवयन्तमश्नवज्जनं को वर्क्तबर्हिषम पर-पर दाश्वान पस्त्याभिरस्थितान्तर्वावत कषयं दधे |||
verses.transliteration: ko devayantamaśnavajjanaṃ ko vṛktabarhiṣam pra-pra dāśvān pastyābhirasthitāntarvāvat kṣayaṃ dadhe

translations.griffith: Who shall approach the pious? who the man whose sacred grass is trimmed?  The offerer with his folk advances more and more: he fills his house with precious things.

verses.sanskrit: उप कष्स्त्रं पर्ञ्चीत हन्ति राजभिर्भये चित सुक्षितिं दधे नास्य वर्ता न तरुता महाधने नार्भे अस्ति वज्रिणः |||
verses.transliteration: upa kṣstraṃ pṛñcīta hanti rājabhirbhaye cit sukṣitiṃ dadhe nāsya vartā na tarutā mahādhane nārbhe asti vajriṇaḥ

translations.griffith: He amplifies his lordly might, with kings he slays: e’en mid alarms he dwells secure  In great or lesser fight none checks him, none subdues,—the wielder of the thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit: यं रक्षन्ति परचेतसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा नू चित स दभ्यते जनः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ rakṣanti pracetaso varuṇo mitro aryamā nū cit sa dabhyate janaḥ

translations.griffith: NE’ER is he injured whom the Gods Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,  The excellently wise, protect.

verses.sanskrit: यं बाहुतेव पिप्रति पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः अरिष्टः सर्व एधते |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ bāhuteva piprati pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ ariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate

translations.griffith: He prospers ever, free from scathe, whom they, as with full hands, enrich,  Whom they preserve from every foe.

verses.sanskrit: वि दुर्गा वि दविषः पुरो घनन्ति राजान एषाम नयन्ति दुरिता तिरः |||
verses.transliteration: vi durghā vi dviṣaḥ puro ghnanti rājāna eṣām nayanti duritā tiraḥ

translations.griffith: The Kings drive far away from him his troubles and his enemies,  And lead him safely o’er distress.

verses.sanskrit: सुगः पन्था अन्र्क्षर आदित्यास रतं यते नात्रावखादो अस्ति वः |||
verses.transliteration: sughaḥ panthā anṛkṣara ādityāsa ṛtaṃ yate nātrāvakhādo asti vaḥ

translations.griffith: Thornless, Ādityas, is the path, easy for him who seeks the Law:  With him is naught to anger you.

verses.sanskrit: यं यज्ञं नयथा नर आदित्या रजुना पथा पर वः स धीतये नशत |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ yajñaṃ nayathā nara ādityā ṛjunā pathā pra vaḥ sa dhītaye naśat

translations.griffith: What sacrifice, Ādityas, ye Heroes guide by the path direct,—  May that come nigh unto your thought.

verses.sanskrit: स रत्नं मर्त्यो वसु विश्वं तोकमुत तमना अछा गछत्यस्त्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: sa ratnaṃ martyo vasu viśvaṃ tokamuta tmanā achā ghachatyastṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: That mortal, ever unsubdued, gains wealth and every precious thing,  And children also of his own.

verses.sanskrit: कथा राधाम सखायः सतोमं मित्रस्यार्यम्णः महि पसरो वरुणस्य |||
verses.transliteration: kathā rādhāma sakhāyaḥ stomaṃ mitrasyāryamṇaḥ mahi psaro varuṇasya

translations.griffith: How, my friends, shall we prepare Aryaman's and Mitra's laud,  Glorious food of Varuṇa?

verses.sanskrit: मा वो घनन्तं मा शपन्तं परति वोचे देवयन्तम सुम्नैरिद व आ विवासे |||
verses.transliteration: mā vo ghnantaṃ mā śapantaṃ prati voce devayantam sumnairid va ā vivāse

translations.griffith: I point not out to you a man who strikes the pious, or reviles:  Only with hymns I call you nigh.

verses.sanskrit: चतुरश्चिद ददमानाद बिभीयादा निधातोः न दुरुक्ताय सप्र्हयेत |||
verses.transliteration: caturaścid dadamānād bibhīyādā nidhātoḥ na duruktāya spṛhayet

translations.griffith: Let him not love to speak ill words: but fear the One who holds all four  Within his hand, until they fall.

verses.sanskrit: सं पूषन्नध्वनस्तिर वयंहो विमुचो नपात सक्ष्वा देवप्र णस पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ pūṣannadhvanastira vyaṃho vimuco napāt sakṣvā devapra ṇas puraḥ

translations.griffith: SHORTEN our ways, O Pūṣan, move aside obstruction in the path:  Go close before us, cloud-born God.

verses.sanskrit: यो नः पूषन्नघो वर्को दुःशेव आदिदेशति अप सम तम्पथो जहि |||
verses.transliteration: yo naḥ pūṣannagho vṛko duḥśeva ādideśati apa sma tampatho jahi

translations.griffith: Drive, Pūṣan, from our road the wolf, the wicked inauspicious wolf,  Who lies in wait to injure us.

verses.sanskrit: अप तयं परिपन्थिनं मुषीवाणं हुरश्चितम दूरमधिस्रुतेरज |||
verses.transliteration: apa tyaṃ paripanthinaṃ muṣīvāṇaṃ huraścitam dūramadhisruteraja

translations.griffith: Who lurks about the path we take, the robber with a guileful heart:  Far from the road chase him away.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तस्य दवयाविनो.अघशंसस्य कस्य चित पदाभि तिष्ठ तपुषिम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tasya dvayāvino.aghaśaṃsasya kasya cit padābhi tiṣṭha tapuṣim

translations.griffith: Tread with thy foot and trample out the firebrand of the wicked one,  The double-tongued, whoe’er he be.

verses.sanskrit: आ तत ते दस्र मन्तुमः पूषन्नवो वर्णीमहे येन पितॄनचोदयः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tat te dasra mantumaḥ pūṣannavo vṛṇīmahe yena pitṝnacodayaḥ

translations.griffith: Wise Pūṣan, Wonder-Worker, we claim of thee now the aid wherewith  Thou furtheredst our sires of old.

verses.sanskrit: अधा नो विश्वसौभग हिरण्यवाशीमत्तम धनानि सुषणा कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: adhā no viśvasaubhagha hiraṇyavāśīmattama dhanāni suṣaṇā kṛdhi

translations.griffith: So, Lord of all prosperity, best wielder of the golden sword,  Make riches easy to be won.

verses.sanskrit: अति नः सश्चतो नय सुगा नः सुपथा कर्णु पूषन्निहक्रतुं विदः |||
verses.transliteration: ati naḥ saścato naya sughā naḥ supathā kṛṇu pūṣannihakratuṃ vidaḥ

translations.griffith: Past all pursuers lead us, make pleasant our path and fair to tread:  O Pūṣan, find thou power for this.

verses.sanskrit: अभि सूयवसं नय न नवज्वारो अध्वने पूषन्निहक्रतुं विदः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi sūyavasaṃ naya na navajvāro adhvane pūṣannihakratuṃ vidaḥ

translations.griffith: Lead us to meadows rich in grass: send on our way no early heat:  O Pūṣan, find thou power for this.

verses.sanskrit: शग्धि पूर्धि पर यंसि च शिशीहि परास्युदरम पूषन्निहक्रतुं विदः |||
verses.transliteration: śaghdhi pūrdhi pra yaṃsi ca śiśīhi prāsyudaram pūṣannihakratuṃ vidaḥ

translations.griffith: Be gracious to us, fill us full, give, feed us, and invigorate:  O Pūṣan, find thou power for this.

verses.sanskrit: न पूषणं मेथामसि सूक्तैरभि गर्णीमसि वसूनि दस्ममीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: na pūṣaṇaṃ methāmasi sūktairabhi ghṛṇīmasi vasūni dasmamīmahe

translations.griffith: No blame have we for Pūṣan; him we magnify with songs of praise:  We seek the Mighty One for wealth.

verses.sanskrit: कद रुद्राय परचेतसे मीळ्हुष्टमाय तव्यसे वोचेम शन्तमं हर्दे |||
verses.transliteration: kad rudrāya pracetase mīḷhuṣṭamāya tavyase vocema śantamaṃ hṛde

translations.griffith: WHAT shall we sing to Rudra, strong, most bounteous, excellently wise,  That shall be dearest to his heart?

verses.sanskrit: यथा नो अदितिः करत पश्वे नर्भ्यो यथा गवे यथा तोकाय रुद्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: yathā no aditiḥ karat paśve nṛbhyo yathā ghave yathā tokāya rudriyam

translations.griffith: That Aditi may grant the grace of Rudra to our folk, our kine,  Our cattle and our progeny;

verses.sanskrit: यथा नो मित्रो वरुणो यथा रुद्रश्चिकेतति यथा विश्वे सजोषसः |||
verses.transliteration: yathā no mitro varuṇo yathā rudraściketati yathā viśve sajoṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: That Mitra and that Varuṇa, that Rudra may remember us,  Yea, all the Gods with one accord.

verses.sanskrit: गाथपतिं मेधपतिं रुद्रं जलाषभेषजम तच्छंयोः सुम्नमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: ghāthapatiṃ medhapatiṃ rudraṃ jalāṣabheṣajam tacchaṃyoḥ sumnamīmahe

translations.griffith: To Rudra Lord of sacrifice, of hymns and balmy medicines,  We pray for joy and health and strength.

verses.sanskrit: यः शुक्र इव सूर्यो हिरण्यमिव रोचते शरेष्ठो देवानां वसुः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śukra iva sūryo hiraṇyamiva rocate śreṣṭho devānāṃ vasuḥ

translations.griffith: He shines in splendour like the Sun, refulgent as bright gold is he,  The good, the best among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: शं नः करत्यर्वते सुगं मेषाय मेष्ये नर्भ्यो नारिभ्यो गवे |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ naḥ karatyarvate sughaṃ meṣāya meṣye nṛbhyo nāribhyo ghave

translations.griffith: May he grant health into our steeds, wellbeing to our rams and ewes,  To men, to women, and to kine.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे सोम शरियमधि नि धेहि शतस्य नर्णाम महि शरवस्तुविन्र्म्णम |||
verses.transliteration: asme soma śriyamadhi ni dhehi śatasya nṛṇām mahi śravastuvinṛmṇam

translations.griffith: O Soma, set thou upon us the glory of a hundred men,  The great renown of mighty chiefs.

verses.sanskrit: मा नः सोमपरिबाधो मारातयो जुहुरन्त आ न इन्दो वाजे भज |||
verses.transliteration: mā naḥ somaparibādho mārātayo juhuranta ā na indo vāje bhaja

translations.griffith: Let not malignities, nor those who trouble Soma, hinder us.  Indu, give us a share of strength.

verses.sanskrit: यास्ते परजा अम्र्तस्य परस्मिन धामन्न्र्तस्य मूर्धा नाभा सोम वेन आभूषन्तीः सोम वेदः |||
verses.transliteration: yāste prajā amṛtasya parasmin dhāmannṛtasya mūrdhā nābhā soma vena ābhūṣantīḥ soma vedaḥ

translations.griffith: Soma! head, central point, love these; Soma! know these as serving thee,  Children of thee Immortal, at the highest place of holy law.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने विवस्वदुषसश्चित्रं राधो अमर्त्य आ दाशुषे जातवेदो वहा तवमद्या देवानुषर्बुधः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne vivasvaduṣasaścitraṃ rādho amartya ā dāśuṣe jātavedo vahā tvamadyā devānuṣarbudhaḥ

translations.griffith: IMMORTAL Jātavedas, thou many-hued fulgent gift of Dawn,  Agni, this day to him who pays oblations bring the Gods who waken with the morn.

verses.sanskrit: जुष्टो हि दूतो असि हव्यवाहनो.अग्ने रथीरध्वराणाम सजूरश्विभ्यामुषसा सुवीर्यमस्मे धेहि शरवो बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: juṣṭo hi dūto asi havyavāhano.aghne rathīradhvarāṇām sajūraśvibhyāmuṣasā suvīryamasme dhehi śravo bṛhat

translations.griffith: For thou art offering-bearer and loved messenger, the charioteer of sacrifice:  Accordant with the Aśvins and with Dawn grant us heroic strength and lofty fame.

verses.sanskrit: अद्या दूतं वर्णीमहे वसुमग्निं पुरुप्रियम धूमकेतुं भार्जीकं वयुष्टिषु यज्ञानामध्वरश्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: adyā dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe vasumaghniṃ purupriyam dhūmaketuṃ bhāṛjīkaṃ vyuṣṭiṣu yajñānāmadhvaraśriyam

translations.griffith: As messenger we choose to-day Agni the good whom many love,  Smoke-bannered spreader of the light, at break of day glory of sacrificial rites.

verses.sanskrit: शरेष्ठं यविष्ठमतिथिं सवाहुतं जुष्टं जनाय दाशुषे देवानछा यातवे जातवेदसमग्निमीळे वयुष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭhamatithiṃ svāhutaṃ juṣṭaṃ janāya dāśuṣe devānachā yātave jātavedasamaghnimīḷe vyuṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: Him noblest and most youthful, richly worshipped guest, dear to the men who offer gifts,  Him, Agni Jātavedas, I beseech at dawn that he may bring the Gods to us.

verses.sanskrit: सतविष्यामि तवामहं विश्वस्याम्र्त भोजन अग्ने तरातारमम्र्तं मियेध्य यजिष्ठं हव्यवाहन |||
verses.transliteration: staviṣyāmi tvāmahaṃ viśvasyāmṛta bhojana aghne trātāramamṛtaṃ miyedhya yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, will I glorify, deathless nourisher of the world,  Immortal, offering-bearer, meet for sacred food, preserver, best at sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: सुशंसो बोधि गर्णते यविष्ठ्य मधुजिह्वः सवाहुतः परस्कण्वस्य परतिरन्नायुर्जीवसे नमस्या दैव्यं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: suśaṃso bodhi ghṛṇate yaviṣṭhya madhujihvaḥ svāhutaḥ praskaṇvasya pratirannāyurjīvase namasyā daivyaṃ janam

translations.griffith: Tell good things to thy praiser, O most youthful God, as richly worshipped, honey-tongued,  And, granting to Praskaṇva lengthened days of life, show honour to the Heavenly Host.

verses.sanskrit: होतारं विश्ववेदसं सं हि तवा विश इन्धते स आ वह पुरुहूत परचेतसो.अग्ने देवानिह दरवत |||
verses.transliteration: hotāraṃ viśvavedasaṃ saṃ hi tvā viśa indhate sa ā vaha puruhūta pracetaso.aghne devāniha dravat

translations.griffith: For the men, Agni, kindle thee as all possessor and as Priest;  So Agni, much-invoked, bring hither with all speed the Gods, the excellently wise,

verses.sanskrit: सवितारमुषसमश्विना भगमग्निं वयुष्टिषु कषपः कण्वासस्त्वा सुतसोमास इन्धते हव्यवाहं सवध्वर |||
verses.transliteration: savitāramuṣasamaśvinā bhaghamaghniṃ vyuṣṭiṣu kṣapaḥ kaṇvāsastvā sutasomāsa indhate havyavāhaṃ svadhvara

translations.griffith: At dawn of day, at night, Uṣas and Savitar, the Aśvins, Bhaga, Agni's self:  Skilled in fair rites, with Soma poured, the Kaṇvas light thee, the oblation-wafting God.

verses.sanskrit: पतिर हि अध्वराणाम अग्ने दूतो विशाम असि उषर्बुध आवह सोमपीतये देवानद्य सवर्द्र्शः |||
verses.transliteration: patir hi adhvarāṇām aghne dūto viśām asi uṣarbudha āvaha somapītaye devānadya svardṛśaḥ

translations.griffith: For, Agni, Lord of sacrifice and messenger of men art thou:  Bring thou the Gods who wake at dawn who see the light, this day to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने पूर्वा अनूषसो विभावसो दीदेथ विश्वदर्षतः असि गरामेष्वविता पुरोहितो.असि यज्ञेषु मानुषः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne pūrvā anūṣaso vibhāvaso dīdetha viśvadarṣataḥ asi ghrāmeṣvavitā purohito.asi yajñeṣu mānuṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou shonest forth, O Agni, after former dawns, all visible, O rich in light.  Thou art our help in battle-strife, the Friend of man, the great high priest in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: नि तवा यज्ञस्य साधनमग्ने होतारं रत्विजम मनुष्वद देव धीमहि परचेतसं जीरं दूतममर्त्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ni tvā yajñasya sādhanamaghne hotāraṃ ṛtvijam manuṣvad deva dhīmahi pracetasaṃ jīraṃ dūtamamartyam

translations.griffith: Like Manu, we will stablish thee, Agni, performer of the rite,  Invoker, ministering Priest, exceeding wise, the swift immortal messenger.

verses.sanskrit: यद देवानां मित्रमहः पुरोहितो.अन्तरो यासि दूत्यम सिन्धोरिव परस्वनितास ऊर्मयो.अग्नेर्भ्राजन्ते अर्चयः |||
verses.transliteration: yad devānāṃ mitramahaḥ purohito.antaro yāsi dūtyam sindhoriva prasvanitāsa ūrmayo.aghnerbhrājante arcayaḥ

translations.griffith: When as the Gods’ High Priest, by many loved, thou dost their mission as their nearest Friend,  Then, like the far-resounding billows of the flood, thy flames, O Agni, roar aloud.

verses.sanskrit: शरुधि शरुत्कर्ण वह्निभिर्देवैरग्ने सयावभिः आ सीदन्तु बर्हिषि मित्रो अर्यमा परातर्यावाणो अध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: śrudhi śrutkarṇa vahnibhirdevairaghne sayāvabhiḥ ā sīdantu barhiṣi mitro aryamā prātaryāvāṇo adhvaram

translations.griffith: Hear, Agni, who hast ears to hear, with all thy train of escort Gods;  Let Mitra, Aryaman, seeking betimes our rite, seat them upon the sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: शर्ण्वन्तु सतोमं मरुतः सुदानवो.अग्निजिह्वा रताव्र्धः पिबतु सोमं वरुणो धर्तव्रतो.अश्विभ्यामुषसा सजूः |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṇvantu stomaṃ marutaḥ sudānavo.aghnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ pibatu somaṃ varuṇo dhṛtavrato.aśvibhyāmuṣasā sajūḥ

translations.griffith: Let those who strengthen Law, who bountifully give, the life-tongued Maruts, hear our praise.  May Law-supporting Varuṇa with the Aśvins twain and Uṣas, drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने वसून्रिह रुद्रानादित्यानुत यजा सवध्वरं जनं मनुजातं घर्तप्रुषम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne vasūnriha rudrānādityānuta yajā svadhvaraṃ janaṃ manujātaṃ ghṛtapruṣam

translations.griffith: WORSHIP the Vasus, Agni! here, the Rudras, the Ādityas, all  Who spring from Manu, those who know fair rites, who pour their blessings down.

verses.sanskrit: शरुष्टीवानो हि दाशुषे देवा अग्ने विचेतसः तान रोहिदश्व गिर्वणस्त्रयस्त्रिंशतमा वह |||
verses.transliteration: śruṣṭīvāno hi dāśuṣe devā aghne vicetasaḥ tān rohidaśva ghirvaṇastrayastriṃśatamā vaha

translations.griffith: Agni, the Gods who understand give ear unto the worshipper:  Lord of Red Steeds, who lovest song, bring thou those Three-and-Thirty Gods.

verses.sanskrit: परियमेधवदत्रिवज्जातवेदो विरूपवत अङगिरस्वन महिव्रत परस्कण्वस्य शरुधी हवम |||
verses.transliteration: priyamedhavadatrivajjātavedo virūpavat aṅghirasvan mahivrata praskaṇvasya śrudhī havam

translations.griffith: O Jātavedas, great in act, hearken thou to Praskaṇva's call,  As Priyamedha erst was heard, Atri, Virūpa, Aṅgiras.

verses.sanskrit: महिकेरव ऊतये परियमेधा अहूषत राजन्तमध्वराणामग्निं शुक्रेण शोचिषा |||
verses.transliteration: mahikerava ūtaye priyamedhā ahūṣata rājantamadhvarāṇāmaghniṃ śukreṇa śociṣā

translations.griffith: The sons of Priyamedha skilled in lofty praise have called for help  On Agni who with fulgent flame is Ruler of all holy rites.

verses.sanskrit: घर्ताहवन सन्त्येमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः याभिः कण्वस्य सूनवो हवन्ते.अवसे तवा |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtāhavana santyemā u ṣu śrudhī ghiraḥ yābhiḥ kaṇvasya sūnavo havante.avase tvā

translations.griffith: Hear thou, invoked with holy oil, bountiful giver of rewards,  These eulogies, whereby the sons of Kaṇva call thee to their aid.

verses.sanskrit: तवां चित्रश्रवस्तम हवन्ते विक्षु जन्तवः शोचिष्केशम्पुरुप्रियाग्ने हव्याय वोळ्हवे |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ citraśravastama havante vikṣu jantavaḥ śociṣkeśampurupriyāghne havyāya voḷhave

translations.griffith: O Agni, loved by many, thou of fame most wondrous, in their homes  Men call on thee whose hair is flame, to be the bearer of their gifts.

verses.sanskrit: नि तवा होतारं रत्विजं दधिरे वसुवित्तमम शरुत्कर्णं सप्रथस्तमं विप्रा अग्ने दिविष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: ni tvā hotāraṃ ṛtvijaṃ dadhire vasuvittamam śrutkarṇaṃ saprathastamaṃ viprā aghne diviṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, best to find out wealth, most widely famous, quick to hear,  Singers have stablished in their rites Herald and ministering Priest.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा विप्रा अचुच्यवुः सुतसोमा अभि परयः बर्हद भा बिभ्रतो हविरग्ने मर्ताय दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā viprā acucyavuḥ sutasomā abhi prayaḥ bṛhad bhā bibhrato haviraghne martāya dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Singers with Soma pressed have made thee, Agni, hasten to the feast,  Great light to mortal worshipper, what time they bring the sacred gift.

verses.sanskrit: परातर्याव्णः सहस्क्र्त सोमपेयाय सन्त्य इहाद्य दैव्यंजनं बर्हिरा सादया वसो |||
verses.transliteration: prātaryāvṇaḥ sahaskṛta somapeyāya santya ihādya daivyaṃjanaṃ barhirā sādayā vaso

translations.griffith: Good, bounteous, Son of Strength, this day seat here on sacred grass the Gods  Who come at early morn, the host of heaven, to drink the Soma juice

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चं दैव्यं जनमग्ने यक्ष्व सहूतिभिः अयं सोमः सुदानवस्तं पात तिरोह्न्यम |||
verses.transliteration: arvāñcaṃ daivyaṃ janamaghne yakṣva sahūtibhiḥ ayaṃ somaḥ sudānavastaṃ pāta tiroahnyam

translations.griffith: Bring with joint invocations thou, O Agni, the celestial host:  Here stands the Soma, bounteous Gods drink this expressed ere yesterday.

verses.sanskrit: एषो उषा अपूर्व्य वयुछति परिया दिवः सतुषे वामश्विना बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: eṣo uṣā apūrvya vyuchati priyā divaḥ stuṣe vāmaśvinā bṛhat

translations.griffith: Now Morning with her earliest light shines forth, dear Daughter of the Sky:  High, Aśvins, I extol your praise,

verses.sanskrit: या दस्रा सिन्धुमातरा मनोतरा रयीणाम धिया देवा वसुविदा |||
verses.transliteration: yā dasrā sindhumātarā manotarā rayīṇām dhiyā devā vasuvidā

translations.griffith: Sons of the Sea, mighty to save discoverers of riches, ye  Gods with deep thought who find out wealth.

verses.sanskrit: वच्यन्ते वां ककुहासो जूर्णायामधि विष्टपि यद वांरथो विभिष पतात |||
verses.transliteration: vacyante vāṃ kakuhāso jūrṇāyāmadhi viṣṭapi yad vāṃratho vibhiṣ patāt

translations.griffith: Your giant coursers hasten on over the region all in flames,  When your car flies with winged steeds.

verses.sanskrit: हविषा जारो अपां पिपर्ति पपुरिर्नरा पिता कुटस्य चर्षणिः |||
verses.transliteration: haviṣā jāro apāṃ piparti papurirnarā pitā kuṭasya carṣaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: He, liberal, lover of the flood, Lord of the House, the vigilant,  Chiefs! with oblations feeds you full.

verses.sanskrit: आदारो वां मतीनां नासत्या मतवचसा पातं सोमस्य धर्ष्णुया |||
verses.transliteration: ādāro vāṃ matīnāṃ nāsatyā matavacasā pātaṃ somasya dhṛṣṇuyā

translations.griffith: Ye have regard unto our hymns, Nāsatyas, thinking of our words:  Drink boldly of the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: या नः पीपरदश्विना जयोतिष्मती तमस्तिरः तामस्मे रासाथामिषम |||
verses.transliteration: yā naḥ pīparadaśvinā jyotiṣmatī tamastiraḥ tāmasme rāsāthāmiṣam

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe to us, O Aśvin Pair, such strength as, with attendant light,  May through the darkness carry us.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो नावा मतीनां यातं पाराय गन्तवे युञ्जाथामश्विना रथम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no nāvā matīnāṃ yātaṃ pārāya ghantave yuñjāthāmaśvinā ratham

translations.griffith: Come in the ship of these our hymns to bear you to the hither shore  O Aśvins, harness ye the car.

verses.sanskrit: अरित्रं वां दिवस पर्थु तीर्थे सिन्धूनां रथः धिया युयुज्र इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: aritraṃ vāṃ divas pṛthu tīrthe sindhūnāṃ rathaḥ dhiyā yuyujra indavaḥ

translations.griffith: The heaven's wide vessel is your own on the flood's shore your chariot waits  Drops, with the hymn, have been prepared.

verses.sanskrit: दिवस कण्वास इन्दवो वसु सिन्धूनां पदे सवं वव्रिं कुह धित्सथः |||
verses.transliteration: divas kaṇvāsa indavo vasu sindhūnāṃ pade svaṃ vavriṃ kuha dhitsathaḥ

translations.griffith: Kaṇvas, the drops are in the heaven; the wealth is at the waters' place:  Where will ye manifest your form?

verses.sanskrit: अभूदु भा उ अंशवे हिरण्यं परति सूर्यः वयख्यज्जिह्वयासितः |||
verses.transliteration: abhūdu bhā u aṃśave hiraṇyaṃ prati sūryaḥ vyakhyajjihvayāsitaḥ

translations.griffith: Light came to lighten up the branch, the Sun appeared as it were gold:  And with its tongue shone forth the dark.

verses.sanskrit: अभूदु पारमेतवे पन्था रतय्स साधुया अदर्शि वि सरुतिर्दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: abhūdu pārametave panthā ṛtaysa sādhuyā adarśi vi srutirdivaḥ

translations.griffith: The path of sacrifice was made to travel to the farther goal:  The road of heaven was manifest.

verses.sanskrit: तत-तदिदश्विनोरवो जरिता परति भूषति मदे सोमस्यपिप्रतोः |||
verses.transliteration: tat-tadidaśvinoravo jaritā prati bhūṣati made somasyapipratoḥ

translations.griffith: The singer of their praise awaits whatever grace the Aśvins give,  who save when Soma gladdens them.

verses.sanskrit: वावसाना विवस्वति सोमस्य पीत्या गिरा मनुष्वच्छम्भूा गतम |||
verses.transliteration: vāvasānā vivasvati somasya pītyā ghirā manuṣvacchambhūā ghatam

translations.griffith: Ye dwellers with Vivasvān come, auspicious, as to Manu erst;  come to the Soma and our praise.

verses.sanskrit: युवोरुषा अनु शरियं परिज्मनोरुपाचरत रता वनथो अक्तुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvoruṣā anu śriyaṃ parijmanorupācarat ṛtā vanatho aktubhiḥ

translations.griffith: O circumambient Aśvins, Dawn follows the brightness of your way:  Approve with beams our solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit: उभा पिबतमश्विनोभा नः शर्म यछतम अविद्रियाभिरूतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ubhā pibatamaśvinobhā naḥ śarma yachatam avidriyābhirūtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Drink ye of our libations, grant protection, O ye Aśvins Twain,  With aids which none may interrupt.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वां मधुमत्तमः सुतः सोम रताव्र्धा तमश्विना पिबतं तिरोह्न्यं धत्तं रत्नानि दाशुशे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā tamaśvinā pibataṃ tiroahnyaṃ dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuśe

translations.griffith: AŚVINS, for you who strengthen Law this sweetest Soma hath been shed.  Drink this expressed ere yesterday and give riches to him who offers it.

verses.sanskrit: तरिवन्धुरेण तरिव्र्ता सुपेशसा रथेना यातमश्विना कण्वासो वां बरह्म कर्ण्वन्त्यध्वरे तेषां सु शर्णुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā supeśasā rathenā yātamaśvinā kaṇvāso vāṃ brahma kṛṇvantyadhvare teṣāṃ su śṛṇutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: Come, O ye Aśvins, mounted on your triple car three-seated, beautiful of form  To you at sacrifice the Kaṇvas send the prayer: graciously listen to their call.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना मधुमत्तमं पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा अथाद्य दस्रा वसु बिभ्रता रथे दाश्वांसमुप गछतम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā madhumattamaṃ pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā athādya dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe dāśvāṃsamupa ghachatam

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, ye who strengthen Law, drink ye this sweetest Soma juice.  Borne on your wealth-fraught car come ye this day to him who offers, ye of wondrous deeds.

verses.sanskrit: तरिषधस्थे बर्हिषि विश्ववेदसा मध्वा यज्ञं मिमिक्षतम कण्वासो वां सुतसोमा अभिद्यवो युवां हवन्ते अश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: triṣadhasthe barhiṣi viśvavedasā madhvā yajñaṃ mimikṣatam kaṇvāso vāṃ sutasomā abhidyavo yuvāṃ havante aśvinā

translations.griffith: Omniscient Aśvins, on the thrice-heaped grass bedew with the sweet juice the sacrifice.  The sons of Kaṇva, striving heavenward, call on you with draughts of Soma juice out-poured.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः कण्वमभिष्टिभिः परावतं युवमश्विना ताभिः षवस्मानवतं शुभस पती पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ kaṇvamabhiṣṭibhiḥ prāvataṃ yuvamaśvinā tābhiḥ ṣvasmānavataṃ śubhas patī pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, with those aids wherewith ye guarded Kaṇva carefully,  Keep us, O Lords of Splendour: drink the Soma juice, ye strengtheners of holy law.

verses.sanskrit: सुदासे दस्रा वसु बिभ्रता रथे पर्क्षो वहतमश्विना रयिं समुद्रादुत वा दिवस पर्यस्मे धत्तं पुरुस्प्र्हम |||
verses.transliteration: sudāse dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe pṛkṣo vahatamaśvinā rayiṃ samudrāduta vā divas paryasme dhattaṃ puruspṛham

translations.griffith: O Mighty Ones, ye gave Sudās abundant food, brought on your treasure-laden car;  So now vouchsafe to us the wealth which many crave, either from heaven or from the sea.

verses.sanskrit: यन नासत्या परावति यद वा सथो अधि तुर्वशे अतो रथेन सुव्र्ता न आ गतं साकं सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yan nāsatyā parāvati yad vā stho adhi turvaśe ato rathena suvṛtā na ā ghataṃ sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Nāsatyas, whether ye be far away or close to Turvaśa,  Borne on your lightly-rolling chariot come to us, together with the sunbeams come.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चा वां सप्तयो.अध्वरश्रियो वहन्तु सवनेदुप इषं पर्ञ्चन्ता सुक्र्ते सुदानव आ बर्हिः सीदतं नरा |||
verses.transliteration: arvāñcā vāṃ saptayo.adhvaraśriyo vahantu savanedupa iṣaṃ pṛñcantā sukṛte sudānava ā barhiḥ sīdataṃ narā

translations.griffith: So let your coursers, ornaments of sacrifice, bring you to our libations here.  Bestowing food on him who acts and gives aright, sit, Chiefs, upon the sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: तेन नासत्या गतं रथेन सूर्यत्वचा येन शश्वदूहथुर्दाशुषे वसु मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: tena nāsatyā ghataṃ rathena sūryatvacā yena śaśvadūhathurdāśuṣe vasu madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Come, O Nāsatyas, on your car decked with a sunbright canopy,  Whereon ye ever bring wealth to the worshipper, to drink the Soma's pleasant juice.

verses.sanskrit: उक्थेभिरर्वागवसे पुरूवसू अर्कैश्च नि हवयामहे शश्वत कण्वानां सदसि परिये हि कं सोमं पपथुरश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: ukthebhirarvāghavase purūvasū arkaiśca ni hvayāmahe śaśvat kaṇvānāṃ sadasi priye hi kaṃ somaṃ papathuraśvinā

translations.griffith: With lauds and songs of praise we call them down to us, that they, most rich, may succour us;  For ye have ever in the Kaṇvas' well-loved house, O Aśvins, drunk the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: सह वामेन न उषो वयुछा दुहितर्दिवः सह दयुम्नेन बर्हता विभावरि राया देवि दास्वती |||
verses.transliteration: saha vāmena na uṣo vyuchā duhitardivaḥ saha dyumnena bṛhatā vibhāvari rāyā devi dāsvatī

translations.griffith: DAWN on us with prosperity, O Uṣas, Daughter of the Sky,  Dawn with great glory, Goddess, Lady of the Light, dawn thou with riches, Bounteous One.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्विश्वसुविदो भूरि चयवन्त वस्तवे उदीरय परति मा सून्र्ता उषश्चोद राधो मघोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrviśvasuvido bhūri cyavanta vastave udīraya prati mā sūnṛtā uṣaścoda rādho maghonām

translations.griffith: They, bringing steeds and kine, boon-givers of all wealth, have oft sped forth to lighten us.  O Uṣas, waken up for me the sounds of joy: send us the riches of the great.

verses.sanskrit: उवासोषा उछाच्च नु देवी जीरा रथानाम ये अस्या आचरणेषु दध्रिरे समुद्रे न शरवस्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: uvāsoṣā uchācca nu devī jīrā rathānām ye asyā ācaraṇeṣu dadhrire samudre na śravasyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Uṣas hath dawned, and now shall dawn, the Goddess, driver forth of cars  Which, as she cometh nigh, have fixed their thought on her, like glory-seekers on the flood.

verses.sanskrit: उषो ये ते पर यामेषु युञ्जते मनो दानाय सूरयः अत्राह तत कण्व एषां कण्वतमो नाम गर्णाति नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo ye te pra yāmeṣu yuñjate mano dānāya sūrayaḥ atrāha tat kaṇva eṣāṃ kaṇvatamo nāma ghṛṇāti nṛṇām

translations.griffith: Here Kaṇva, chief of Kaṇva's race, sings forth aloud the glories of the heroes’ names,—  The. princes who, O Uṣas, as thou comest near, direct their thoughts to liberal gifts.

verses.sanskrit: आ घा योषेव सूनर्युषा याति परभुञ्जती जरयन्ती वर्जनं पद्वदीयत उत पातयति पक्षिणः |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghā yoṣeva sūnaryuṣā yāti prabhuñjatī jarayantī vṛjanaṃ padvadīyata ut pātayati pakṣiṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Like a good matron Uṣas comes carefully tending everything:  Rousing all life she stirs all creatures that have feet, and makes the birds of air fly up.

verses.sanskrit: वि या सर्जति समनं वयर्थिनः पदां न वेत्योदती वयो नकिष टे पप्तिवांस आसते वयुष्टौ वाजिनीवति |||
verses.transliteration: vi yā sṛjati samanaṃ vyarthinaḥ padāṃ na vetyodatī vayo nakiṣ ṭe paptivāṃsa āsate vyuṣṭau vājinīvati

translations.griffith: She sends the busy forth, each man to his pursuit: delay she knows not as she springs.  O rich in opulence, after thy dawning birds that have flown forth no longer rest.

verses.sanskrit: एषायुक्त परावतः सूर्यस्योदयनादधि शतं रथेभिः सुभगोषा इयं वि यात्यभि मानुषान |||
verses.transliteration: eṣāyukta parāvataḥ sūryasyodayanādadhi śataṃ rathebhiḥ subhaghoṣā iyaṃ vi yātyabhi mānuṣān

translations.griffith: This Dawn hath yoked her steeds afar, beyond the rising of the Sun:  Borne on a hundred chariots she, auspicious Dawn, advances on her way to Men.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वमस्या नानाम चक्षसे जगज्ज्योतिष कर्णोति सूनरी अप दवेषो मघोनी दुहिता दिव उषा उछदप सरिधः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvamasyā nānāma cakṣase jaghajjyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī apa dveṣo maghonī duhitā diva uṣā uchadapa sridhaḥ

translations.griffith: To meet her glance all living creatures bend them down: Excellent One, she makes the light.  Uṣas, the Daughter of the Sky, the opulent, shines foes and enmities away.

verses.sanskrit: उष आ भाहि भानुना चन्द्रेण दुहितर्दिवः आवहन्ती भूर्यस्मभ्यं सौभगं वयुछन्ती दिविष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: uṣa ā bhāhi bhānunā candreṇa duhitardivaḥ āvahantī bhūryasmabhyaṃ saubhaghaṃ vyuchantī diviṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: Shine on us with thy radiant light, O Uṣas, Daughter of the Sky,  Bringing to us great store of high felicity, and beaming on our solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्य हि पराणनं जीवनं तवे वि यदुछसि सूनरि सा नो रथेन बर्हता विभावरि शरुधि चित्रामघे हवम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasya hi prāṇanaṃ jīvanaṃ tve vi yaduchasi sūnari sā no rathena bṛhatā vibhāvari śrudhi citrāmaghe havam

translations.griffith: For in thee is each living creature's breath and life, when, Excellent! thou dawnest forth.  Borne on thy lofty car, O Lady of the Light, hear, thou of wondrous wealth, our call.

verses.sanskrit: उषो वाजं हि वंस्व यश्चित्रो मानुषे जने तेना वह सुक्र्तो अध्वरानुप ये तवा गर्णन्ति वह्नयः |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo vājaṃ hi vaṃsva yaścitro mānuṣe jane tenā vaha sukṛto adhvarānupa ye tvā ghṛṇanti vahnayaḥ

translations.griffith: O Uṣas, win thyself the strength which among men is wonderful.  Bring thou thereby the pious unto holy rites, those who as priests sing praise to thee.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वान देवाना वह सोमपीतये.अन्तरिक्षादुषस्त्वम सास्मासु धा गोमदश्वावदुक्थ्यमुषो वाजं सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvān devānā vaha somapītaye.antarikṣāduṣastvam sāsmāsu dhā ghomadaśvāvadukthyamuṣo vājaṃ suvīryam

translations.griffith: Bring from the firmament, O Uṣas, all the Gods, that they may drink our Soma juice,  And, being what thou art, vouchsafe us kine and steeds, strength meet for praise and hero might.

verses.sanskrit: यस्या रुशन्तो अर्चयः परति भद्रा अद्र्क्षत सा नो रयिं विश्ववारं सुपेशसमुषा ददातु सुग्म्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yasyā ruśanto arcayaḥ prati bhadrā adṛkṣata sā no rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ supeśasamuṣā dadātu sughmyam

translations.griffith: May Uṣas whose auspicious rays are seen resplendent round about,  Grant us great riches, fair in form, of all good things, wealth which light labour may attain.

verses.sanskrit: ये चिद धि तवां रषयः पूर्व ऊतये जुहूरे.अवसे महि सा न सतोमानभि गर्णीहि राधसोषः शुक्रेण शोचिषा |||
verses.transliteration: ye cid dhi tvāṃ ṛṣayaḥ pūrva ūtaye juhūre.avase mahi sā na stomānabhi ghṛṇīhi rādhasoṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā

translations.griffith: Mighty One, whom the Ṛṣis of old time invoked for their protection and their help,  O Uṣas, graciously answer our songs of praise with bounty and with brilliant light.

verses.sanskrit: उषो यदद्य भानुना वि दवाराव रणवो दिवः पर नो यछतादव्र्कं पर्थु छर्दिः पर देवि गोमतीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo yadadya bhānunā vi dvārāv ṛṇavo divaḥ pra no yachatādavṛkaṃ pṛthu chardiḥ pra devi ghomatīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Uṣas, as thou with light to day hast opened the twin doors of heaven,  So grant thou us a dwelling wide and free from foes. O Goddess, give us food with kine.

verses.sanskrit: सं नो राया बर्हता विश्वपेशसा मिमिक्ष्वा समिळाभिरा सं दयुम्नेन विश्वतुरोषो महि सं वाजैर्वाजिनीवति |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ no rāyā bṛhatā viśvapeśasā mimikṣvā samiḷābhirā saṃ dyumnena viśvaturoṣo mahi saṃ vājairvājinīvati

translations.griffith: Bring us to wealth abundant, sent in every shape, to plentiful refreshing food,  To all-subduing splendour, Uṣas, Mighty One, to strength, thou rich in spoil and wealth.

verses.sanskrit: उषो भद्रेभिरा गहि दिवश्चिद रोचनादधि वहन्त्वरुणप्सव उप तवा सोमिनो गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo bhadrebhirā ghahi divaścid rocanādadhi vahantvaruṇapsava upa tvā somino ghṛham

translations.griffith: E'EN from above the sky's bright realm come, Uṣas, by auspicious ways:  Let red steeds bear thee to the house of him who pours the Soma, juice.

verses.sanskrit: सुपेशसं सुखं रथं यमध्यस्था उषस्त्वम तेना सुश्रवसं जनं परावाद्य दुहितर्दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: supeśasaṃ sukhaṃ rathaṃ yamadhyasthā uṣastvam tenā suśravasaṃ janaṃ prāvādya duhitardivaḥ

translations.griffith: The chariot which thou mountest, fair of shape, O Uṣas light to move,—  Therewith, O Daughter of the Sky, aid men of noble fame today.

verses.sanskrit: वयश्चित ते पतत्रिणो दविपच्चतुष्पदर्जुनि उषः परारन्न्र्तून्रनु दिवो अन्तेभ्यस परि |||
verses.transliteration: vayaścit te patatriṇo dvipaccatuṣpadarjuni uṣaḥ prārannṛtūnranu divo antebhyas pari

translations.griffith: Bright Uṣas, when thy times return, all quadrupeds and bipeds stir,  And round about flock winged birds from all the boundaries of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वयुछन्ती हि रश्मिभिर्विश्वमाभासि रोचनम तां तवामुषर्वसूयवो गीर्भिः कण्वा अहूषत |||
verses.transliteration: vyuchantī hi raśmibhirviśvamābhāsi rocanam tāṃ tvāmuṣarvasūyavo ghīrbhiḥ kaṇvā ahūṣata

translations.griffith: Thou dawning with thy beams of light illumest all the radiant realm.  Thee, as thou art, the Kaṇvas, fain for wealth, have called with sacred songs.

verses.sanskrit: उदु तयं जातवेदसं देवं वहन्ति केतवः दर्शे विश्वाय सूर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: udu tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ dṛśe viśvāya sūryam

translations.griffith: HIS bright rays bear him up aloft, the God who knoweth all that lives,  Sūrya, that all may look on him.

verses.sanskrit: अप तये तायवो यथा नक्षत्रा यन्त्यक्तुभिः सूराय विश्वचक्षसे |||
verses.transliteration: apa tye tāyavo yathā nakṣatrā yantyaktubhiḥ sūrāya viśvacakṣase

translations.griffith: The constellations pass away, like thieves, together with their beams,  Before the all-beholding Sun.

verses.sanskrit: अद्र्श्रमस्य केतवो वि रश्मयो जनाननु भराजन्तो अग्नयो यथा |||
verses.transliteration: adṛśramasya ketavo vi raśmayo janānanu bhrājanto aghnayo yathā

translations.griffith: His herald rays are seen afar refulgent o’er the world of men,  Like flames of fire that burn and blaze.

verses.sanskrit: तरणिर्विश्वदर्शतो जयोतिष्क्र्दसि सूर्य विश्वमा भासिरोचनम |||
verses.transliteration: taraṇirviśvadarśato jyotiṣkṛdasi sūrya viśvamā bhāsirocanam

translations.griffith: Swift and all beautiful art thou, O Sūrya, maker of the light,  Illuming all the radiant realm.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यं देवानां विशः परत्यङङ उदेषि मानुषान परत्यं विश्वं सवर्द्र्शे |||
verses.transliteration: pratyaṃ devānāṃ viśaḥ pratyaṅṅ udeṣi mānuṣān pratyaṃ viśvaṃ svardṛśe

translations.griffith: Thou goest to the hosts of Gods, thou comest hither to mankind,  Hither all light to be beheld.

verses.sanskrit: येना पावक चक्षसा भुरण्यन्तं जनाननु तवं वरुण पश्यसि |||
verses.transliteration: yenā pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantaṃ janānanu tvaṃ varuṇa paśyasi

translations.griffith: With that same eye of thine wherewith thou lookest brilliant Varuṇa,  Upon the busy race of men,

verses.sanskrit: वि दयामेषि रजस पर्थ्वहा मिमानो अक्तुभिः पश्यञ जन्मानि सूर्य |||
verses.transliteration: vi dyāmeṣi rajas pṛthvahā mimāno aktubhiḥ paśyañ janmāni sūrya

translations.griffith: Traversing sky and wide mid-air, thou metest with thy beams our days,  Sun, seeing all things that have birth.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त तवा हरितो रथे वहन्ति देव सूर्य शोचिष्केशं विचक्षण |||
verses.transliteration: sapta tvā harito rathe vahanti deva sūrya śociṣkeśaṃ vicakṣaṇa

translations.griffith: Seven Bay Steeds harnessed to thy car bear thee, O thou farseeing One,  God, Sūrya, with the radiant hair.

verses.sanskrit: अयुक्त सप्त शुन्ध्युवः सूरो रथस्य नप्त्यः ताभिर्याति सवयुक्तिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūro rathasya naptyaḥ tābhiryāti svayuktibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Sūrya hath yoked the pure bright Seven, the daughters of the car; with these,  His own dear team, he goeth forth.

verses.sanskrit: उद वयं तमसस परि जयोतिष पश्यन्त उत्तरम देवं देवत्रा सूर्यमगन्म जयोतिरुत्तमम |||
verses.transliteration: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari jyotiṣ paśyanta uttaram devaṃ devatrā sūryamaghanma jyotiruttamam

translations.griffith: Looking upon the loftier light above the darkness we have come  To Sūrya, God among the Gods, the light that is most excellent.

verses.sanskrit: उद्यन्नद्य मित्रमह आरोहन्नुत्तरां दिवम हर्द्रोगं ममसूर्य हरिमाणं च नाशय |||
verses.transliteration: udyannadya mitramaha ārohannuttarāṃ divam hṛdroghaṃ mamasūrya harimāṇaṃ ca nāśaya

translations.griffith: Rising this day, O rich in friends, ascending to the loftier heaven,  Sūrya remove my heart's disease, take from me this my yellow hue.

verses.sanskrit: शुकेषु मे हरिमाणं रोपणाकासु दध्मसि अथो हारिद्रवेषु मे हरिमाणं नि दध्मसि |||
verses.transliteration: śukeṣu me harimāṇaṃ ropaṇākāsu dadhmasi atho hāridraveṣu me harimāṇaṃ ni dadhmasi

translations.griffith: To parrots and to starlings let us give away my yellowness,  Or this my yellowness let us transfer to Haritāla trees.

verses.sanskrit: उदगादयमादित्यो विश्वेन सहसा सह दविषन्तं मह्यं रन्धयन मो अहम दविषते रधम |||
verses.transliteration: udaghādayamādityo viśvena sahasā saha dviṣantaṃ mahyaṃ randhayan mo aham dviṣate radham

translations.griffith: With all his conquering vigour this Āditya hath gone up on high,  Giving my foe into mine hand: let me not be my foeman's prey.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तयं मेषं पुरुहूतं रग्मियमिन्द्रं गीर्भिर्मदता वस्वो अर्णवम यस्य दयावो न विचरन्ति मानुषा भुजे मंहिष्ठमभि विप्रमर्चत |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tyaṃ meṣaṃ puruhūtaṃ ṛghmiyamindraṃ ghīrbhirmadatā vasvo arṇavam yasya dyāvo na vicaranti mānuṣā bhuje maṃhiṣṭhamabhi vipramarcata

translations.griffith: MAKE glad with songs that Ram whom many men invoke, worthy of songs of praise, Indra, the sea of wealth;  Whose gracious deeds for men spread like the heavens abroad: sing praise to him the Sage, most liberal for our good.

verses.sanskrit: अभीमवन्वन सवभिष्टिमूतयो.अन्तरिक्षप्रां तविषीभिराव्र्तम इन्द्रं दक्षास रभवो मदच्युतं शतक्रतुं जवनी सून्र्तारुहत |||
verses.transliteration: abhīmavanvan svabhiṣṭimūtayo.antarikṣaprāṃ taviṣībhirāvṛtam indraṃ dakṣāsa ṛbhavo madacyutaṃ śatakratuṃ javanī sūnṛtāruhat

translations.griffith: As aids the skilful Ṛbhus yearned to Indra strong to save, who fills mid-air, encompassed round with might,  Rushing in rapture; and o’er Śatakratu came the gladdening shout that urged him on to victory.

verses.sanskrit: तवं गोत्रमङगिरोभ्यो.अव्र्णोरपोतात्रये शतदुरेषु गातुवित ससेन चिद विमदायावहो वस्वाजावद्रिं वावसानस्यनर्तयन |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ ghotramaṅghirobhyo.avṛṇorapotātraye śatadureṣu ghātuvit sasena cid vimadāyāvaho vasvājāvadriṃ vāvasānasyanartayan

translations.griffith: Thou hast disclosed the kine's stall for the Aṅgirases, and made a way for Atri by a hundred doors.  On Vimada thou hast bestowed both food and wealth, making thy bolt dance in the sacrificer's fight.

verses.sanskrit: तवमपामपिधानाव्र्णोर अपाधारयः पर्वते दानुमद वसु वर्त्रं यदिन्द्र शवसावधीरहिमादित सूर्यं दिव्यारोहयो दर्शे |||
verses.transliteration: tvamapāmapidhānāvṛṇor apādhārayaḥ parvate dānumad vasu vṛtraṃ yadindra śavasāvadhīrahimādit sūryaṃ divyārohayo dṛśe

translations.griffith: Thou hast unclosed the prisons of the waters; thou hast in the mountain seized the treasure rich in gifts.  When thou hadst slain with might the dragon Vṛtra, thou, Indra, didst raise the Sun in heaven for all to see.

verses.sanskrit: तवं मायाभिरप मायिनो.अधमः सवधाभिर्ये अधि शुप्तावजुह्वत तवं पिप्रोर्न्र्मणः परारुजः पुरः पर रजिश्वानं दस्युहत्येष्वाविथ |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ māyābhirapa māyino.adhamaḥ svadhābhirye adhi śuptāvajuhvata tvaṃ piprornṛmaṇaḥ prārujaḥ puraḥ pra ṛjiśvānaṃ dasyuhatyeṣvāvitha

translations.griffith: With wondrous might thou blewest enchanter fiends away, with powers celestial those who called on thee in jest.  Thou, hero-hearted, hast broken down Pipru's forts, and helped Ṛjiśvan when the Dasyus were struck dead.

verses.sanskrit: तवं कुत्सं शुष्णहत्येष्वाविथारन्धयो.अतिथिग्वाय शम्बरम महान्तं चिदर्बुदं नि करमीः पदा सनादेव दस्युहत्याय जज्ञिषे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ kutsaṃ śuṣṇahatyeṣvāvithārandhayo.atithighvāya śambaram mahāntaṃ cidarbudaṃ ni kramīḥ padā sanādeva dasyuhatyāya jajñiṣe

translations.griffith: Thou savedst Kutsa when Śuṣṇa was smitten down; to Atithigva gavest Śambara for a prey.  E’en mighty Arbuda thou troddest under foot: thou from of old wast born to strike the Dasyus dead.

verses.sanskrit: तवे विश्वा तविषी सध्र्यग घिता तव राधः सोमपीथाय हर्षते तव वज्रश्चिकिते बाह्वोर्हितो वर्श्चा शत्रोरव विश्वानि वर्ष्ण्या |||
verses.transliteration: tve viśvā taviṣī sadhryagh ghitā tava rādhaḥ somapīthāya harṣate tava vajraścikite bāhvorhito vṛścā śatrorava viśvāni vṛṣṇyā

translations.griffith: All power and might is closely gathered up in thee; thy bounteous spirit joys in drinking Soma juice.  Known is the thunderbolt that lies within thine arms: rend off therewith all manly prowess of our foe.

verses.sanskrit: वि जानीह्यार्यान ये च दस्यवो बर्हिष्मते रन्धया शासदव्रतान शाकी भव यजमानस्य चोदिता विश्वेत ता ते सधमादेषु चाकन |||
verses.transliteration: vi jānīhyāryān ye ca dasyavo barhiṣmate randhayā śāsadavratān śākī bhava yajamānasya coditā viśvet tā te sadhamādeṣu cākana

translations.griffith: Discern thou well Āryas and Dasyus; punishing the lawless give them up to him whose grass is strewn.  Be thou the sacrificer's strong encourager all these thy deeds are my delight at festivals.

verses.sanskrit: अनुव्रताय रन्धयन्नपव्रतानाभूभिरिन्द्रः शनथयन्ननाभुवः वर्द्धस्य चिद वर्धतो दयामिनक्षत सतवानो वम्रो वि जघान सन्दिहः |||
verses.transliteration: anuvratāya randhayannapavratānābhūbhirindraḥ śnathayannanābhuvaḥ vṛddhasya cid vardhato dyāminakṣata stavāno vamro vi jaghāna sandihaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra gives up the lawless to the pious man, destroying by the Strong Ones those who have no strength.  Vamra when glorified destroyed the gathered piles of the still waxing great one who would reach the heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तक्षद यत त उशना सहसा सहो वि रोदसी मज्मना बाधते शवः आ तवा वातस्य नर्मणो मनोयुज आ पूर्यमाणमवहन्नभि शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: takṣad yat ta uśanā sahasā saho vi rodasī majmanā bādhate śavaḥ ā tvā vātasya nṛmaṇo manoyuja ā pūryamāṇamavahannabhi śravaḥ

translations.griffith: The might which Uśanā hath formed for thee with might rends in its greatness and with strength both worlds apart.  O Hero-souled, the steeds of Vāta, yoked by thought, have carried thee to fame while thou art filled with power.

verses.sanskrit: मन्दिष्ट यदुशने काव्ये सचानिन्द्रो वङकू वङकुतराधि तिष्ठति उग्रो ययिं निरपः सरोतसास्र्जद वि शुष्णस्य दरंहिता ऐरयत पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: mandiṣṭa yaduśane kāvye sacānindro vaṅkū vaṅkutarādhi tiṣṭhati ughro yayiṃ nirapaḥ srotasāsṛjad vi śuṣṇasya dṛṃhitā airayat puraḥ

translations.griffith: When Indra hath rejoiced with Kāvya Uśanā, he mounts his steeds who swerve wider and wider yet.  The Strong hath loosed his bolt with the swift rush of rain, and he hath rent in pieces Śuṣṇa's firm-built forts.

verses.sanskrit: आ समा रथं वर्षपाणेषु तिष्ठसि शार्यातस्य परभ्र्तायेषु मन्दसे इन्द्र यथा सुतसोमेषु चाकनो.अनर्वाणंश्लोकमा रोहसे दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: ā smā rathaṃ vṛṣapāṇeṣu tiṣṭhasi śāryātasya prabhṛtāyeṣu mandase indra yathā sutasomeṣu cākano.anarvāṇaṃślokamā rohase divi

translations.griffith: Thou mountest on thy car amid strong Soma draughts: Śāryāta brought thee those in which thou hast delight.  Indra, when thou art pleased with men whose Soma flows thou risest to unchallenged glory in the sky.

verses.sanskrit: अददा अर्भां महते वचस्यवे कक्षीवते वर्चयामिन्द्र सुन्वते मेनाभवो वर्षणश्वस्य सुक्रतो विश्वेत ता ते सवनेषु परवाच्या |||
verses.transliteration: adadā arbhāṃ mahate vacasyave kakṣīvate vṛcayāmindra sunvate menābhavo vṛṣaṇaśvasya sukrato viśvet tā te savaneṣu pravācyā

translations.griffith: To old Kakṣīvān, Soma-presser, skilled in song, O Indra, thou didst give the youthful Vṛcayā.  Thou, very wise, wast Menā, Vrsanśva's child: those deeds of thine must all be told at Soma feasts.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो अश्रायि सुध्यो निरेके पज्रेषु सतोमो दुर्यो न यूपः अश्वयुर्गव्यू रथयुर्वसूयुरिन्द्र इद रायः कषयति परयन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: indro aśrāyi sudhyo nireke pajreṣu stomo duryo na yūpaḥ aśvayurghavyū rathayurvasūyurindra id rāyaḥ kṣayati prayantā

translations.griffith: The good man's refuge in his need is Indra, firm as a doorpost, praised among the Pajras.  Indra alone is Lord of wealth, the Giver, lover of riches, chariots, kine, and horses.

verses.sanskrit: इदं नमो वर्षभाय सवराजे सत्यशुष्माय तवसे.अवाचि अस्मिन्निन्द्र वर्जने सर्ववीराः समत सूरिभिस्तव शर्मन सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ namo vṛṣabhāya svarāje satyaśuṣmāya tavase.avāci asminnindra vṛjane sarvavīrāḥ smat sūribhistava śarman syāma

translations.griffith: To him the Mighty One, the self-resplendent, verily strong and great, this praise is uttered.  May we and all the heroes, with the princes, be, in this fray, O Indra, in thy keeping.

verses.sanskrit: तयं सु मेषं महया सवर्विदं शतं यस्य सुभ्वः साकमीरते अत्यं न वाजं हवनस्यदं रथमेन्द्रं वव्र्त्यामवसे सुव्र्क्तिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ su meṣaṃ mahayā svarvidaṃ śataṃ yasya subhvaḥ sākamīrate atyaṃ na vājaṃ havanasyadaṃ rathamendraṃ vavṛtyāmavase suvṛktibhiḥ

translations.griffith: I GLORIFY that Ram who finds the light of heaven, whose hundred nobly-natured ones go forth with him.  With hymns may I turn hither Indra to mine aid,—the Car which like a strong steed hasteth to the call.

verses.sanskrit: स पर्वतो न धरुणेष्वच्युतः सहस्रमूतिस्तविषीषु वाव्र्धे इन्द्रो यद वर्त्रमवधीन नदीव्र्तमुब्जन्नर्णांसिजर्ह्र्षाणो अन्धसा |||
verses.transliteration: sa parvato na dharuṇeṣvacyutaḥ sahasramūtistaviṣīṣu vāvṛdhe indro yad vṛtramavadhīn nadīvṛtamubjannarṇāṃsijarhṛṣāṇo andhasā

translations.griffith: Like as a mountain on firm basis, unremoved, he, thousandfold protector, waxed in mighty strength,  When Indra, joying in the draughts of Soma juice, forced the clouds, slaying Vṛtra stayer of their flow.

verses.sanskrit: स हि दवरो दवरिषु वव्र ऊधनि चन्द्रबुध्नो मदव्र्द्धो मनीषिभिः इन्द्रं तमह्वे सवपस्यया धिया मंहिष्ठरातिं स हि पप्रिरन्धसः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi dvaro dvariṣu vavra ūdhani candrabudhno madavṛddho manīṣibhiḥ indraṃ tamahve svapasyayā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭharātiṃ sa hi paprirandhasaḥ

translations.griffith: For he stays e’en the stayers, spread o’er laden cloud, rooted in light, strengthened in rapture by the wise.  Indra with thought, with skilled activity, I call, most liberal giver, for he sates him with the juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ यं पर्णन्ति दिवि सद्मबर्हिषः समुद्रं न सुभ्वः सवा अभिष्टयः तं वर्त्रहत्ये अनु तस्थुरूतयः शुष्मािन्द्रमवाता अह्रुतप्सवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaṃ pṛṇanti divi sadmabarhiṣaḥ samudraṃ na subhvaḥ svā abhiṣṭayaḥ taṃ vṛtrahatye anu tasthurūtayaḥ śuṣmāindramavātā ahrutapsavaḥ

translations.griffith: Whom those that flow in heaven on sacred grass, his own assistants, nobly-natured, fill full like the sea,—  Beside that Indra when he smote down Vṛtra stood his helpers, straight in form, mighty, invincible.

verses.sanskrit: अभि सवव्र्ष्टिं मदे अस्य युध्यतो रघ्वीरिव परवणे सस्रुरूतयः इन्द्रो यद वज्री धर्षमाणो अन्धसा भिनद वलस्य परिधीन्रिव तरितः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi svavṛṣṭiṃ made asya yudhyato raghvīriva pravaṇe sasrurūtayaḥ indro yad vajrī dhṛṣamāṇo andhasā bhinad valasya paridhīnriva tritaḥ

translations.griffith: To him, as in wild joy he fought with him who stayed the rain, his helpers sped like swift streams down a slope,  When Indra, thunder-armed, made bold by Soma draughts, as Tṛta cleaveth Vala's fences, cleft him through.

verses.sanskrit: परीं घर्णा चरति तित्विषे शवो.अपो वर्त्वी रजसो बुध्नमाशयत वर्त्रस्य यत परवणे दुर्ग्र्भिश्वनो निजघन्थ हन्वोरिन्द्र तन्यतुम |||
verses.transliteration: parīṃ ghṛṇā carati titviṣe śavo.apo vṛtvī rajaso budhnamāśayat vṛtrasya yat pravaṇe durghṛbhiśvano nijaghantha hanvorindra tanyatum

translations.griffith: Splendour encompassed thee, forth shone thy warrior might: the rain-obstructer lay in mid-air's lowest deep,  What time, O Indra, thou didst cast thy thunder down upon the jaws of Vṛitra hard to be restrained.

verses.sanskrit: हरदं न हि तवा नय्र्षन्त्यूर्मयो बरह्माणीन्द्र तव यानि वर्धना तवष्टा चित ते युज्यं वाव्र्धे शवस्ततक्ष वज्रमभिभूत्योजसम |||
verses.transliteration: hradaṃ na hi tvā nyṛṣantyūrmayo brahmāṇīndra tava yāni vardhanā tvaṣṭā cit te yujyaṃ vāvṛdhe śavastatakṣa vajramabhibhūtyojasam

translations.griffith: The hymns which magnify thee, Indra, reach to thee even as water-brooks flow down and fill the lake.  Tvaṣṭar gave yet more force to thine appropriate strength, and forged thy thunderbolt of overpowering might.

verses.sanskrit: जघन्वानु हरिभिः सम्भ्र्तक्रतविन्द्र वर्त्रं मनुषे गातुयन्नपः अयछथा बाह्वोर्वज्रमायसमधारयो दिव्या सूर्यं दर्शे |||
verses.transliteration: jaghanvānu haribhiḥ sambhṛtakratavindra vṛtraṃ manuṣe ghātuyannapaḥ ayachathā bāhvorvajramāyasamadhārayo divyā sūryaṃ dṛśe

translations.griffith: When, Indra, thou whose power is linked with thy Bay Steeds hadst smitten Vṛtra, causing floods to flow for man,  Thou heldst in thine arms the metal thunderbolt, and settest in the heaven the Sun for all to see.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हत सवश्चन्द्रममवद यदुक्थ्यमक्र्ण्वत भियसा रोहणं दिवः यन मानुषप्रधना इन्द्रमूतयः सवर्न्र्षाचो मरुतो.अमदन्ननु |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhat svaścandramamavad yadukthyamakṛṇvata bhiyasā rohaṇaṃ divaḥ yan mānuṣapradhanā indramūtayaḥ svarnṛṣāco maruto.amadannanu

translations.griffith: In fear they raised the lofty self-resplendent hymn, praise giving and effectual, leading up to heaven,  When Indra's helpers fighting for the good of men, the Maruts, faithful to mankind, joyed in the light.

verses.sanskrit: दयौश्चिदस्यामवानहेः सवनादयोयवीद भियसा वज्र इन्द्र ते वर्त्रस्य यद बद्बधानस्य रोदसी मदे सुतस्य शवसाभिनच्छिरः |||
verses.transliteration: dyauścidasyāmavānaheḥ svanādayoyavīd bhiyasā vajra indra te vṛtrasya yad badbadhānasya rodasī made sutasya śavasābhinacchiraḥ

translations.griffith: Then Heaven himself, the mighty, at that Dragon's roar reeled back in terror when, Indra, thy thunderbolt  In the wild joy of Soma had struck off with might the head of Vṛtra, tyrant of the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन नविन्द्र पर्थिवी दशभुजिरहानि विश्वा ततनन्तक्र्ष्टयः अत्राह ते मघवन विश्रुतं सहो दयामनु शवसा बर्हणा भुवत |||
verses.transliteration: yadin nvindra pṛthivī daśabhujirahāni viśvā tatanantakṛṣṭayaḥ atrāha te maghavan viśrutaṃ saho dyāmanu śavasā barhaṇā bhuvat

translations.griffith: O Indra, were this earth extended forth tenfold, and men who dwell therein multiplied day by day,  Still here thy conquering might, Maghavan, would be famed: it hath waxed vast as heaven in majesty and power.

verses.sanskrit: तवमस्य पारे रजसो वयोमनः सवभूत्योजा अवसे धर्षन्मनः चक्र्षे भूमिं परतिमानमोजसो.अपः सवः परिभूरेष्या दिवम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamasya pāre rajaso vyomanaḥ svabhūtyojā avase dhṛṣanmanaḥ cakṛṣe bhūmiṃ pratimānamojaso.apaḥ svaḥ paribhūreṣyā divam

translations.griffith: Thou, bold of heart, in thine own native might, for help, upon the limit of this mid-air and of heaven,  Hast made the earth to be the pattern of thy strength: embracing flood and light thou reachest to the sky.

verses.sanskrit: तवं भुवः परतिमानं पर्थिव्या रष्ववीरस्य बर्हतः पतिर्भूः विश्वमाप्रा अन्तरिक्षं महित्वा सत्यमद्धा नकिरन्यस्त्वावान |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ bhuvaḥ pratimānaṃ pṛthivyā ṛṣvavīrasya bṛhataḥ patirbhūḥ viśvamāprā antarikṣaṃ mahitvā satyamaddhā nakiranyastvāvān

translations.griffith: Thou art the counterpart of earth, the Master of lofty heaven with all its mighty Heroes:  Thou hast filled all the region with thy greatness: yea, of a truth there is none other like thee.

verses.sanskrit: न यस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी अनु वयचो न सिन्धवो रजसो अन्तमानशुः नोत सवव्र्ष्टिं मदे अस्य युध्यत एको अन्यच्चक्र्षे विश्वमानुषक |||
verses.transliteration: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī anu vyaco na sindhavo rajaso antamānaśuḥ nota svavṛṣṭiṃ made asya yudhyata eko anyaccakṛṣe viśvamānuṣak

translations.griffith: Whose amplitude the heaven and earth have not attained, whose bounds the waters of mid-air have never reached,—  Not, when in joy he fights the stayer of the rain: thou, and none else, hast made all things in order due.

verses.sanskrit: आर्चन्नत्र मरुतः सस्मिन्नाजौ विश्वे देवासो अमदन्ननुत्वा वर्त्रस्य यद भर्ष्टिमता वधेन नि तवमिन्द्र परत्यानं जघन्थ |||
verses.transliteration: ārcannatra marutaḥ sasminnājau viśve devāso amadannanutvā vṛtrasya yad bhṛṣṭimatā vadhena ni tvamindra pratyānaṃ jaghantha

translations.griffith: The Maruts sang thy praise in this encounter, and in thee all the Deities delighted,  What time thou, Indra, with thy spiky weapon, thy deadly bolt, smotest the face of Vṛtra.

verses.sanskrit: नयू षु वाचं पर महे भरामहे गिर इन्द्राय सदने विवस्वतः नू चिद धि रत्नं ससतामिवाविदन न दुष्टुतिर्द्रविणोदेषु शस्यते |||
verses.transliteration: nyū ṣu vācaṃ pra mahe bharāmahe ghira indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ nū cid dhi ratnaṃ sasatāmivāvidan na duṣṭutirdraviṇodeṣu śasyate

translations.griffith: WE will present fair praise unto the Mighty One, our hymns to Indra in Vivasvān's dwelling-place;  For he hath ne’er found wealth in those who seem to sleep: those who give wealth to men accept no paltry praise.

verses.sanskrit: दुरो अश्वस्य दुर इन्द्र गोरसि दुरो यवस्य वसुन इनस पतिः शिक्षानरः परदिवो अकामकर्शनः सखा सखिभ्यस्तमिदं गर्णीमसि |||
verses.transliteration: duro aśvasya dura indra ghorasi duro yavasya vasuna inas patiḥ śikṣānaraḥ pradivo akāmakarśanaḥ sakhā sakhibhyastamidaṃ ghṛṇīmasi

translations.griffith: Giver of horses, Indra, giver, thou, of kine, giver of barley, thou art Lord and guard of wealth:  Man's helper from of old, not disappointing hope, Friend of our friends, to thee as such we sing this praise.

verses.sanskrit: शचीव इन्द्र पुरुक्र्द दयुमत्तम तवेदिदमभितश्चेकिते वसु अतः संग्र्भ्याभिभूत आ भर मा तवायतो जरितुः काममूनयीः |||
verses.transliteration: śacīva indra purukṛd dyumattama tavedidamabhitaścekite vasu ataḥ saṃghṛbhyābhibhūta ā bhara mā tvāyato jarituḥ kāmamūnayīḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, most splendid, powerful, rich in mighty deeds, this treasure spread around is known to be thine own.  Gather therefrom, O Conqueror, and bring to us: fail not the hope of him who loves and sings to thee.

verses.sanskrit: एभिर्द्युभिः सुमना एभिरिन्दुभिर्निरुन्धानो अमतिं गोभिरश्विना इन्द्रेण दस्युं दरयन्त इन्दुभिर्युतद्वेषसःसमिषा रभेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: ebhirdyubhiḥ sumanā ebhirindubhirnirundhāno amatiṃ ghobhiraśvinā indreṇa dasyuṃ darayanta indubhiryutadveṣasaḥsamiṣā rabhemahi

translations.griffith: Well pleased with these bright flames and with these Soma drops, take thou away our poverty with seeds and kine.  With Indra scattering the Dasyu through these drops, freed from their hate may we obtain abundant food.

verses.sanskrit: समिन्द्र राया समिषा रभेमहि सं वाजेभिः पुरुश्चन्द्रैरभिद्युभिः सं देव्या परमत्या वीरशुष्मया गोग्रयाश्वावत्या रभेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: samindra rāyā samiṣā rabhemahi saṃ vājebhiḥ puruścandrairabhidyubhiḥ saṃ devyā pramatyā vīraśuṣmayā ghoaghrayāśvāvatyā rabhemahi

translations.griffith: Let us obtain, O Indra, plenteous wealth and food, with strength exceeding glorious, shining to the sky:  May we obtain the Goddess Providence, the strength of heroes, special source of cattle, rich in steeds.

verses.sanskrit: ते तवा मदा अमदन तानि वर्ष्ण्या ते सोमासो वर्त्रहत्येषु सत्पते यत कारवे दश वर्त्राण्यप्रति बर्हिष्मते नि सहस्राणि बर्हयः |||
verses.transliteration: te tvā madā amadan tāni vṛṣṇyā te somāso vṛtrahatyeṣu satpate yat kārave daśa vṛtrāṇyaprati barhiṣmate ni sahasrāṇi barhayaḥ

translations.griffith: These our libations strength-inspiring, Soma draughts, gladdened thee in the fight with Vṛtra, Hero Lord,  What time thou slewest for the singer with trimmed grass ten thousand Vṛtras, thou resistless in thy might.

verses.sanskrit: युधा युधमुप घेदेषि धर्ष्णुया पुरा पुरं समिदं हंस्योजसा नम्या यदिन्द्र सख्या परावति निबर्हयो नमुचिं नाम मायिनम |||
verses.transliteration: yudhā yudhamupa ghedeṣi dhṛṣṇuyā purā puraṃ samidaṃ haṃsyojasā namyā yadindra sakhyā parāvati nibarhayo namuciṃ nāma māyinam

translations.griffith: Thou goest on from fight to fight intrepidly, destroying castle after castle here with strength.  Thou, Indra, with thy friend who makes the foe bow down, slewest from far away the guileful Namuci.

verses.sanskrit: तवं करञ्जमुत पर्णयं वधीस्तेजिष्ठयातिथिग्वस्यवर्तनी तवं शता वङगर्दस्याभिनत पुरो.अनानुदः परिषूता रजिश्वना |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ karañjamuta parṇayaṃ vadhīstejiṣṭhayātithighvasyavartanī tvaṃ śatā vaṅghṛdasyābhinat puro.anānudaḥ pariṣūtā ṛjiśvanā

translations.griffith: Thou hast struck down in death Karañja, Parṇaya, in Atithigva's very glorious going forth.  Unyielding, when Ṛjiśvan compassed them with siege, thou hast destroyed the hundred forts of Vaṅgṛida.

verses.sanskrit: तवमेताञ जनराज्ञो दविर्दशाबन्धुना सुश्रवसोपजग्मुषः षष्टिं सहस्रा नवतिं नव शरुतो नि चक्रेण रथ्या दुष्पदाव्र्णक |||
verses.transliteration: tvametāñ janarājño dvirdaśābandhunā suśravasopajaghmuṣaḥ ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā navatiṃ nava śruto ni cakreṇa rathyā duṣpadāvṛṇak

translations.griffith: With all-outstripping chariot-wheel, O Indra, thou far-famed, hast overthrown the twice ten Kings of men,  With sixty thousand nine-and-ninety followers, who came in arms to fight with friendless Suśravas.

verses.sanskrit: तवमाविथ सुश्रवसं तवोतिभिस्तव तरामभिरिन्द्र तूर्वयाणम तवमस्मै कुत्समतिथिग्वमायुं महे राज्ञे यूने अरन्धनायः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamāvitha suśravasaṃ tavotibhistava trāmabhirindra tūrvayāṇam tvamasmai kutsamatithighvamāyuṃ mahe rājñe yūne arandhanāyaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou hast protected Suśravas with succour, and Tūrvayāṇa with thine aid, O Indra.  Thou madest Kutsa, Atithigva, Āyu, subject unto this King, the young, the mighty.

verses.sanskrit: य उद्र्चीन्द्र देवगोपाः सखायस्ते शिवतमा असाम तवां सतोषाम तवया सुवीरा दराघीय आयुः परतरं दधानाः |||
verses.transliteration: ya udṛcīndra devaghopāḥ sakhāyaste śivatamā asāma tvāṃ stoṣāma tvayā suvīrā drāghīya āyuḥ prataraṃ dadhānāḥ

translations.griffith: May we protected by the Gods hereafter remain thy very prosperous friends, O Indra.  Thee we extol, enjoying through thy favour life long and joyful and with store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो अस्मिन मघवन पर्त्स्वंहसि नहि ते अन्तः शवसः परीणशे अक्रन्दयो नद्यो रोरुवद वना कथा न कषोणीर्भियसा समारत |||
verses.transliteration: mā no asmin maghavan pṛtsvaṃhasi nahi te antaḥ śavasaḥ parīṇaśe akrandayo nadyo roruvad vanā kathā na kṣoṇīrbhiyasā samārata

translations.griffith: URGE us not, Maghavan, to this distressful fight, for none may comprehend the limit of thy strength.  Thou with fierce shout hast made the woods and rivers roar: did not men run in crowds together in their fear?

verses.sanskrit: अर्चा शक्राय शाकिने शचीवते शर्ण्वन्तमिन्द्रं महयन्नभि षटुहि यो धर्ष्णुना शवसा रोदसी उभे वर्षा वर्षत्वा वर्षभो नय्र्ञ्जते |||
verses.transliteration: arcā śakrāya śākine śacīvate śṛṇvantamindraṃ mahayannabhi ṣṭuhi yo dhṛṣṇunā śavasā rodasī ubhe vṛṣā vṛṣatvā vṛṣabho nyṛñjate

translations.griffith: Sing hymns of praise to Śakra, Lord of power and might; laud thou and magnify Indra who heareth thee,  Who with his daring might, a Bull exceeding strong in strength, maketh him master of the heaven and earth.

verses.sanskrit: अर्चा दिवे बर्हते शूष्यं वचः सवक्षत्रं यस्य धर्षतो धर्षन मनः बर्हच्छ्रवा असुरो बर्हणा कर्तः पुरो हरिभ्यां वर्षभो रथो हि षः |||
verses.transliteration: arcā dive bṛhate śūṣyaṃ vacaḥ svakṣatraṃ yasya dhṛṣato dhṛṣan manaḥ bṛhacchravā asuro barhaṇā kṛtaḥ puro haribhyāṃ vṛṣabho ratho hi ṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Sing forth to lofty Dyaus a strength-bestowing song, the Bold, whose resolute mind hath independent sway.  High glory hath the Asura, compact of strength, drawn on by two Bay Steeds: a Bull, a Car is he.

verses.sanskrit: तवं दिवो बर्हतः सानु कोपयो.अव तमना धर्षता शम्बरं भिनत यन मायिनो वरन्दिनो मन्दिना धर्षच्छितां गभस्तिमशनिं पर्तन्यसि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ divo bṛhataḥ sānu kopayo.ava tmanā dhṛṣatā śambaraṃ bhinat yan māyino vrandino mandinā dhṛṣacchitāṃ ghabhastimaśaniṃ pṛtanyasi

translations.griffith: The ridges of the lofty heaven thou madest shake; thou, daring, of thyself smotest through Śambara,  When bold with gladdening juice, thou warredst with thy bolt, sharp and two-edged, against the banded sorcerers.

verses.sanskrit: नि यद वर्णक्षि शवसनस्य मूर्धनि शुष्णस्य चिद वरन्दिनोरोरुवद वना पराचीनेन मनसा बर्हणावता यदद्या चित कर्णवः कस्त्वा परि |||
verses.transliteration: ni yad vṛṇakṣi śvasanasya mūrdhani śuṣṇasya cid vrandinororuvad vanā prācīnena manasā barhaṇāvatā yadadyā cit kṛṇavaḥ kastvā pari

translations.griffith: When with a roar that fills the woods, thou forcest down on wind's head the stores which Śuṣṇa kept confined,  Who shall have power to stay thee firm and eager-souled from doing still this day what thou of old hast done?

verses.sanskrit: तवमाविथ नर्यं तुर्वशं यदुं तवं तुर्वीतिं वय्यंशतक्रतो तवं रथमेतशं कर्त्व्ये धने तवं पुरो नवतिं दम्भयो नव |||
verses.transliteration: tvamāvitha naryaṃ turvaśaṃ yaduṃ tvaṃ turvītiṃ vayyaṃśatakrato tvaṃ rathametaśaṃ kṛtvye dhane tvaṃ puro navatiṃ dambhayo nava

translations.griffith: Thou helpest Narya, Turvaśa, and Yadu, and Vayya's son Turvīti, Śatakratu!  Thou helpest horse and car in final battle thou breakest down the nine-and-ninety castles.

verses.sanskrit: स घा राजा सत्पतिः शूशुवज्जनो रातहव्यः परति यः शासमिन्वति उक्था वा यो अभिग्र्णाति राधसा दानुरस्मा उपरा पिन्वते दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghā rājā satpatiḥ śūśuvajjano rātahavyaḥ prati yaḥ śāsaminvati ukthā vā yo abhighṛṇāti rādhasā dānurasmā uparā pinvate divaḥ

translations.griffith: A hero-lord is he, King of a mighty folk, who offers free oblations and promotes the Law,  Who with a bounteous guerdon welcomes hymns of praise: for him flows down the abundant stream below the sky.

verses.sanskrit: असमं कषत्रमसमा मनीषा पर सोमपा अपसा सन्तु नेमे ये त इन्द्र ददुषो वर्धयन्ति महि कषत्रं सथविरं वर्ष्ण्यं च |||
verses.transliteration: asamaṃ kṣatramasamā manīṣā pra somapā apasā santu neme ye ta indra daduṣo vardhayanti mahi kṣatraṃ sthaviraṃ vṛṣṇyaṃ ca

translations.griffith: His power is matchless, matchless is his wisdom; chief, through their work, be some who drink the Soma,  Those, Indra, who increase the lordly power, the firm heroic strength of thee the Giver.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्येदेते बहुला अद्रिदुग्धाश्चमूषदश्चमसा इन्द्रपानाः वयश्नुहि तर्पया काममेषामथा मनो वसुदेयाय कर्ष्व |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyedete bahulā adridughdhāścamūṣadaścamasā indrapānāḥ vyaśnuhi tarpayā kāmameṣāmathā mano vasudeyāya kṛṣva

translations.griffith: Therefore for thee are these abundant beakers Indra's drink, stone-pressed juices held in ladles.  Quaff them and satisfy therewith thy longing; then fix thy mind upon bestowing treasure.

verses.sanskrit: अपामतिष्ठद धरुणह्वरं तमो.अन्तर्व्र्त्रस्य जठरेषुपर्वतः अभीमिन्द्रो नद्यो वव्रिणा हिता विश्वा अनुष्ठाः परवणेषु जिघ्नते |||
verses.transliteration: apāmatiṣṭhad dharuṇahvaraṃ tamo.antarvṛtrasya jaṭhareṣuparvataḥ abhīmindro nadyo vavriṇā hitā viśvā anuṣṭhāḥ pravaṇeṣu jighnate

translations.griffith: There darkness stood, the vault that stayed the waters’ flow: in Vṛtra's hollow side the rain-cloud lay concealed.  But Indra smote the rivers which the obstructer stayed, flood following after flood, down steep declivities.

verses.sanskrit: स शेव्र्धमधि धा दयुम्नमस्मे महि कषत्रं जनाषाळिन्द्र तव्यम रक्षा च नो मघोनः पाहि सूरीन राये च नः सवपत्या इषे धाः |||
verses.transliteration: sa śevṛdhamadhi dhā dyumnamasme mahi kṣatraṃ janāṣāḷindra tavyam rakṣā ca no maghonaḥ pāhi sūrīn rāye ca naḥ svapatyā iṣe dhāḥ

translations.griffith: So give us, Indra, bliss-increasing glory give us great sway and strength that conquers people.  Preserve our wealthy patrons, save our princes; vouchsafe us wealth and food with noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit: दिवश्चिदस्य वरिमा वि पप्रथ इन्द्रं न मह्ना पर्थिवीचन परति भीमस्तुविष्माञ्चर्षणिभ्य आतपः शिशीते वज्रं तेजसे न वंसगः |||
verses.transliteration: divaścidasya varimā vi papratha indraṃ na mahnā pṛthivīcana prati bhīmastuviṣmāñcarṣaṇibhya ātapaḥ śiśīte vajraṃ tejase na vaṃsaghaḥ

translations.griffith: THOUGH e’en this heaven's wide space and earth have spread them out, nor heaven nor earth may be in greatness Indra's match.  Awful and very mighty, causing woe to men, he whets his thunderbolt for sharpness, as a bull.

verses.sanskrit: सो अर्णवो न नद्यः समुद्रियः परति गर्भ्णाति विश्रिता वरीमभिः इन्द्रः सोमस्य पीतये वर्षायते सनात स युध्म ओजसा पनस्यते |||
verses.transliteration: so arṇavo na nadyaḥ samudriyaḥ prati ghṛbhṇāti viśritā varīmabhiḥ indraḥ somasya pītaye vṛṣāyate sanāt sa yudhma ojasā panasyate

translations.griffith: Like as the watery ocean, so doth he receive the rivers spread on all sides in their ample width.  He bears him like a bull to drink of Soma juice, and will, as Warrior from of old, be praised for might.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तमिन्द्र पर्वतं न भोजसे महो नर्म्णस्य धर्मणामिरज्यसि पर वीर्येण देवताति चेकिते विश्वस्मा उग्रः कर्मणे पुरोहितः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tamindra parvataṃ na bhojase maho nṛmṇasya dharmaṇāmirajyasi pra vīryeṇa devatāti cekite viśvasmā ughraḥ karmaṇe purohitaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou swayest, Indra, all kinds of great manly power, so as to bend, as’t were, even that famed mountain down.  Foremost among the Gods is he through hero might, set in the van, the Strong One, for each arduous deed.

verses.sanskrit: स इद वने नमस्युभिर्वचस्यते चारु जनेषु परब्रुवाण इन्द्रियम वर्षा छन्दुर्भवति हर्यतो वर्षा कषेमेण धेनाम्मघवा यदिन्वति |||
verses.transliteration: sa id vane namasyubhirvacasyate cāru janeṣu prabruvāṇa indriyam vṛṣā chandurbhavati haryato vṛṣā kṣemeṇa dhenāmmaghavā yadinvati

translations.griffith: He only in the wood is praised by worshippers, when he shows forth to men his own fair Indra-power.  A friendly Bull is he, a Bull to be desired when Maghavan auspiciously sends forth his voice.

verses.sanskrit: स इन महानि समिथानि मज्मना कर्णोति युध्म ओजसा जनेभ्यः अधा चन शरद दधति तविषीमत इन्द्राय वज्रं निघनिघ्नते वधम |||
verses.transliteration: sa in mahāni samithāni majmanā kṛṇoti yudhma ojasā janebhyaḥ adhā cana śrad dadhati tviṣīmata indrāya vajraṃ nighanighnate vadham

translations.griffith: Yet verily the Warrior in his vigorous strength stirreth up with his might great battles for mankind;  And men have faith in Indra, the resplendent One, what time he hurleth down his bolt, his dart of death.

verses.sanskrit: स हि शरवस्युः सदनानि कर्त्रिमा कष्मया वर्धान ओजसाविनाशयन जयोतींषि कर्ण्वन्नव्र्काणि यज्यवे.अव सुक्रतुः सर्तवा अपः सर्जत |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi śravasyuḥ sadanāni kṛtrimā kṣmayā vṛdhāna ojasāvināśayan jyotīṃṣi kṛṇvannavṛkāṇi yajyave.ava sukratuḥ sartavā apaḥ sṛjat

translations.griffith: Though, fain for glory, and with strength increased on earth, he with great might destroys the dwellings made with art,  He makes the lights of heaven shine forth secure, he bids, exceeding wise, the floods flow for his worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: दानाय मनः सोमपावन्नस्तु ते.अर्वाञ्चा हरी वन्दनश्रुदा कर्धि यमिष्ठासः सारथयो य इन्द्र ते न तवा केताा दभ्नुवन्ति भूर्णयः |||
verses.transliteration: dānāya manaḥ somapāvannastu te.arvāñcā harī vandanaśrudā kṛdhi yamiṣṭhāsaḥ sārathayo ya indra te na tvā ketāā dabhnuvanti bhūrṇayaḥ

translations.griffith: Drinker of Soma, let thy heart incline to give; bring thy Bays hitherward, O thou who hearest praise.  Those charioteers of thine, best skilled to draw the rein, the rapid sunbeams, Indra, lead thee not astray.

verses.sanskrit: अप्रक्षितं वसु बिभर्षि हस्तयोरषाळ्हं सहस्तन्वि शरुतो दधे आव्र्तासो.अवतासो न कर्त्र्भिस्तनूषु ते करतवैन्द्र भूरयः |||
verses.transliteration: aprakṣitaṃ vasu bibharṣi hastayoraṣāḷhaṃ sahastanvi śruto dadhe āvṛtāso.avatāso na kartṛbhistanūṣu te kratavaindra bhūrayaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou bearest in both hands treasure that never fails; the famed One in his body holds unvanquished might.  O Indra, in thy members many powers abide, like wells surrounded by the ministering priests.

verses.sanskrit: एष पर पूर्वीरव तस्य चम्रिषो.अत्यो न योषामुदयंस्त भुर्वणिः दक्षं महे पाययते हिरण्ययं रथमाव्र्त्या हरियोगं रभ्वसम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa pra pūrvīrava tasya camriṣo.atyo na yoṣāmudayaṃsta bhurvaṇiḥ dakṣaṃ mahe pāyayate hiraṇyayaṃ rathamāvṛtyā hariyoghaṃ ṛbhvasam

translations.griffith: FOR this man's full libations held in ladles, he hath roused him, eager, as a horse to meet the mare.  He stays his golden car, yoked with Bay Horses, swift, and drinks the Soma juice which strengthens for great deeds.

verses.sanskrit: तं गूर्तयो नेमन्निषः परीणसः समुद्रं न संचरणे सनिष्यवः पतिं दक्षस्य विदथस्य नू सहो गिरिं न वेना अधि रोह तेजसा |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ ghūrtayo nemanniṣaḥ parīṇasaḥ samudraṃ na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavaḥ patiṃ dakṣasya vidathasya nū saho ghiriṃ na venā adhi roha tejasā

translations.griffith: To him the guidance-following songs of praise flow full, as those who seek gain go in company to the flood.  To him the Lord of power, the holy synod's might, as to a hill, with speed, ascend the loving ones.

verses.sanskrit: स तुर्वणिर्महानरेणु पौंस्ये गिरेर्भ्र्ष्टिर्न भराजते तुजा शवः येन शुष्णं मायिनमायसो मदे दुध्राभूषु रामयन नि दामनि |||
verses.transliteration: sa turvaṇirmahānareṇu pauṃsye ghirerbhṛṣṭirna bhrājate tujā śavaḥ yena śuṣṇaṃ māyinamāyaso made dudhraābhūṣu rāmayan ni dāmani

translations.griffith: Victorious, great is he; in manly battle shines, unstained with dust, his might, as shines a mountain peak;  Wherewith the iron one, fierce e’en against the strong, in rapture, fettered wily Śushṇa fast in bonds.

verses.sanskrit: देवी यदि तविषी तवाव्र्धोतय इन्द्रं सिषक्त्युषसं न सूर्यः यो धर्ष्णुना शवसा बाधते तम इयर्ति रेणुं बर्हदर्हरिष्वणिः |||
verses.transliteration: devī yadi taviṣī tvāvṛdhotaya indraṃ siṣaktyuṣasaṃ na sūryaḥ yo dhṛṣṇunā śavasā bādhate tama iyarti reṇuṃ bṛhadarhariṣvaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: When Strength the Goddess, made more strong for help by thee, waits upon Indra as the Sun attends the Dawn,  Then. he who with his might unflinching kills the gloom stirs up the dust aloft, with joy and triumphing.

verses.sanskrit: वि यत तिरो धरुणमच्युतं रजो.अतिष्ठिपो दिव आतासुबर्हणा सवर्मीळ्हे यन मद इन्द्र हर्ष्याहन वर्त्रं निरपामौब्जो अर्णवम |||
verses.transliteration: vi yat tiro dharuṇamacyutaṃ rajo.atiṣṭhipo diva ātāsubarhaṇā svarmīḷhe yan mada indra harṣyāhan vṛtraṃ nirapāmaubjo arṇavam
