translations.griffith: When thou with might, upon the framework of the heaven, didst fix, across, air's region firmly, unremoved,  In the light-winning war, Indra, in rapturous joy, thou smotest Vṛtra dead and broughtest floods of rain.

verses.sanskrit: तवं दिवो धरुणं धिष ओजसा पर्थिव्या इन्द्र सदनेषु माहिनः तवं सुतस्य मदे अरिणा अपो वि वर्त्रस्य समया पाष्यारुजः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ divo dharuṇaṃ dhiṣa ojasā pṛthivyā indra sadaneṣu māhinaḥ tvaṃ sutasya made ariṇā apo vi vṛtrasya samayā pāṣyārujaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou with thy might didst grasp, the holder-up of heaven, thou who art mighty also in the seats of earth.  Thou, gladdened by the juice, hast set the waters free, and broken Vṛtra's stony fences through and through.

verses.sanskrit: पर मंहिष्ठाय बर्हते बर्हद्रये सत्यशुष्माय तवसे मतिं भरे अपामिव परवणे यस्य दुर्धरं राधो विश्वायुशवसे अपाव्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satyaśuṣmāya tavase matiṃ bhare apāmiva pravaṇe yasya durdharaṃ rādho viśvāyuśavase apāvṛtam

translations.griffith: To him most liberal, lofty Lord of lofty wealth, verily powerful and strong, I bring my hymn,—  Whose checkless bounty, as of waters down a slope, is spread abroad for all that live, to give them strength.

verses.sanskrit: अध ते विश्वमनु हासदिष्टय आपो निम्नेव सवना हविष्मतः यत पर्वते न समशीत हर्यत इन्द्रस्य वज्रः शनथिता हिरण्ययः |||
verses.transliteration: adha te viśvamanu hāsadiṣṭaya āpo nimneva savanā haviṣmataḥ yat parvate na samaśīta haryata indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ

translations.griffith: Now all this world, for worship, shall come after thee—the offerer's libations like floods to the depth,  When the well-loved one seems to rest upon the hill, the thunderbolt of Indra, shatterer wrought of gold.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मै भीमाय नमसा समध्वर उषो न शुभ्र आ भरापनीयसे यस्य धाम शरवसे नामेन्द्रियं जयोतिरकारिहरितो नायसे |||
verses.transliteration: asmai bhīmāya namasā samadhvara uṣo na śubhra ā bharāpanīyase yasya dhāma śravase nāmendriyaṃ jyotirakāriharito nāyase

translations.griffith: To him the terrible, most meet for lofty praise, like bright Dawn, now bring gifts with reverence in this rite,  Whose being, for renown, yea, Indra-power and light, have been created, like bay steeds, to move with speed.

verses.sanskrit: इमे त इन्द्र ते वयं पुरुष्टुत ये तवारभ्य चरामसि परभूवसो नहि तवदन्यो गिर्वणो गिरः सघत कषोणीरिव परति नो हर्य तद वचः |||
verses.transliteration: ime ta indra te vayaṃ puruṣṭuta ye tvārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso nahi tvadanyo ghirvaṇo ghiraḥ saghat kṣoṇīriva prati no harya tad vacaḥ

translations.griffith: Thine, Indra, praised by many, excellently rich! are we who trusting in thy help draw near to thee.  Lover of praise, none else but thou receives our laud: as earth loves all her creatures, love thou this our hymn.

verses.sanskrit: भूरि त इन्द्र वीर्यं तव समस्यस्य सतोतुर्मघवन काममा पर्ण अनु ते दयौर्ब्र्हती वीर्यं मम इयं च ते पर्थिवी नेम ओजसे |||
verses.transliteration: bhūri ta indra vīryaṃ tava smasyasya stoturmaghavan kāmamā pṛṇa anu te dyaurbṛhatī vīryaṃ mama iyaṃ ca te pṛthivī nema ojase

translations.griffith: Great is thy power, O Indra, we are thine. Fulfil, O Maghavan, the wish of this thy worshipper.  After thee lofty heaven hath measured out its strength: to thee and to thy power this earth hath bowed itself.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तमिन्द्र पर्वतं महामुरुं वज्रेण वज्रिन पर्वशश्चकर्तिथ अवास्र्जो निव्र्ताः सर्तवा अपः सत्रा विश्वं दधिषे केवलं सहः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tamindra parvataṃ mahāmuruṃ vajreṇa vajrin parvaśaścakartitha avāsṛjo nivṛtāḥ sartavā apaḥ satrā viśvaṃ dadhiṣe kevalaṃ sahaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, who hast thunder for thy weapon, with thy bolt hast shattered into pieces this broad massive cloud.  Thou hast sent down the obstructed floods that they may flow: thou hast, thine own for ever, all victorious might.

verses.sanskrit: नू चित सहोजा अम्र्तो नि तुन्दते होता यद दूतो अभवद विवस्वतः वि साधिष्ठेभिः पथिभी रजो मम आ देवताताहविषा विवासति |||
verses.transliteration: nū cit sahojā amṛto ni tundate hotā yad dūto abhavad vivasvataḥ vi sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhī rajo mama ā devatātāhaviṣā vivāsati

translations.griffith: NE’ER waxeth faint the Immortal, Son of Strength, since he, the Herald, hath become Vivasvān's messenger.  On paths most excellent he measured out mid-air: he with oblation calls to service of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ सवमद्म युवमानो अजरस्त्र्ष्वविष्यन्नतसेषु तिष्ठति अत्यो न पर्ष्ठं परुषितस्य रोचते दिवो न सानु सतनयन्नचिक्रदत |||
verses.transliteration: ā svamadma yuvamāno ajarastṛṣvaviṣyannataseṣu tiṣṭhati atyo na pṛṣṭhaṃ pruṣitasya rocate divo na sānu stanayannacikradat

translations.griffith: Never decaying, seizing his appropriate food, rapidly, eagerly through the dry wood he spreads.  His back, as he is sprinkled, glistens like a horse: loud hath he roared and shouted like the heights of heaven?

verses.sanskrit: कराणा रुद्रेभिर्वसुभिः पुरोहितो होता निषत्तो रयिषाळमर्त्यः रथो न विक्ष्व रञ्जसान आयुषु वयानुषग वार्या देव रण्वति |||
verses.transliteration: krāṇā rudrebhirvasubhiḥ purohito hotā niṣatto rayiṣāḷamartyaḥ ratho na vikṣv ṛñjasāna āyuṣu vyānuṣagh vāryā deva ṛṇvati

translations.griffith: Set high in place o’er all that Vasus, Rudras do, immortal, Lord of riches, seated as High Priest;  Hastening like a car to men, to those who live, the God without delay gives boons to be desired.

verses.sanskrit: वि वातजूतो अतसेषु तिष्ठते वर्था जुहूभिः सर्ण्या तुविष्वणिः तर्षु यदग्ने वनिनो वर्षायसे कर्ष्णं त एम रुशदूर्मे अजर |||
verses.transliteration: vi vātajūto ataseṣu tiṣṭhate vṛthā juhūbhiḥ sṛṇyā tuviṣvaṇiḥ tṛṣu yadaghne vanino vṛṣāyase kṛṣṇaṃ ta ema ruśadūrme ajara

translations.griffith: Urged by the wind be spreads through dry wood as he lists, armed with his tongues for sickles, with a mighty roar.  Black is thy path, Agni, changeless, with glittering waves! when like a bull thou rushest eager to the trees.

verses.sanskrit: तपुर्जम्भो वन आ वातचोदितो यूथे न साह्वानव वाति वंसगः अभिव्रजन्नक्षितं पाजसा रजः सथातुश्चरथं भयते पतत्रिणः |||
verses.transliteration: tapurjambho vana ā vātacodito yūthe na sāhvānava vāti vaṃsaghaḥ abhivrajannakṣitaṃ pājasā rajaḥ sthātuścarathaṃ bhayate patatriṇaḥ

translations.griffith: With teeth of flame, wind-driven, through the wood he speeds, triumphant like a bull among the herd of cows,  With bright strength roaming to the everlasting air: things fixed, things moving quake before him as he flies.

verses.sanskrit: दधुष टवा भर्गवो मानुषेष्वा रयिं न चारुं सुहवं जनेभ्यः होतारमग्ने अतिथिं वरेण्यं मित्रं न शेवं दिव्याय जन्मने |||
verses.transliteration: dadhuṣ ṭvā bhṛghavo mānuṣeṣvā rayiṃ na cāruṃ suhavaṃ janebhyaḥ hotāramaghne atithiṃ vareṇyaṃ mitraṃ na śevaṃ divyāya janmane

translations.griffith: The Bhṛgus established thee among mankind for men, like as a treasure, beauteous, easy to invoke;  Thee, Agni, as a herald and choice-worthy guest, as an auspicious Friend to the Celestial Race.

verses.sanskrit: होतारं सप्त जुह्वो यजिष्ठं यं वाघतो वर्णते अध्वरेषु अग्निं विश्वेषामरतिं वसूनां सपर्यामि परयसा यामि रत्नम |||
verses.transliteration: hotāraṃ sapta juhvo yajiṣṭhaṃ yaṃ vāghato vṛṇate adhvareṣu aghniṃ viśveṣāmaratiṃ vasūnāṃ saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam

translations.griffith: Agni, the seven tongues' deftest Sacrificer, him whom the priests elect at solemn worship,  The Herald, messenger of all the Vasus, I serve with dainty food, I ask for riches.

verses.sanskrit: अछिद्रा सूनो सहसो नो अद्य सतोत्र्भ्यो मित्रमहः शर्म यछ अग्ने गर्णन्तमंहस उरुष्योर्जो नपात पूर्भिरायसीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: achidrā sūno sahaso no adya stotṛbhyo mitramahaḥ śarma yacha aghne ghṛṇantamaṃhasa uruṣyorjo napāt pūrbhirāyasībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Grant, Son of Strength, thou rich in friends, a refuge without a flaw this day to us thy praisers.  O Agni, Son of Strength, with forts of iron preserve thou from distress the man who lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit: भवा वरूथं गर्णते विभावो भवा मघवन मघवद्भ्यःशर्म उरुष्याग्ने अंहसो गर्णन्तं परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात |||
verses.transliteration: bhavā varūthaṃ ghṛṇate vibhāvo bhavā maghavan maghavadbhyaḥśarma uruṣyāghne aṃhaso ghṛṇantaṃ prātarmakṣū dhiyāvasurjaghamyāt

translations.griffith: Be thou a refuge, Bright One, to the singer, a shelter, Bounteous Lord, to those who worship.  Preserve the singer from distress, O Agni. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit: वया इदग्ने अग्नयस्ते अन्ये तवे विश्वे अम्र्ता मादयन्ते वैश्वानर नाभिरसि कषितीनां सथूणेव जनानुपमिद ययन्थ |||
verses.transliteration: vayā idaghne aghnayaste anye tve viśve amṛtā mādayante vaiśvānara nābhirasi kṣitīnāṃ sthūṇeva janānupamid yayantha

translations.griffith: THE other fires are, verily, thy branches; the Immortals all rejoice in thee, O Agni.  Centre art thou, Vaiśvānara, of the people, sustaining men like a deep-founded pillar.

verses.sanskrit: मूर्धा दिवो नाभिरग्निः पर्थिव्या अथाभवदरती रोदस्योः तं तवा देवासो.अजनयन्त देवं वैश्वानर जयोतिरिदार्याय |||
verses.transliteration: mūrdhā divo nābhiraghniḥ pṛthivyā athābhavadaratī rodasyoḥ taṃ tvā devāso.ajanayanta devaṃ vaiśvānara jyotiridāryāya

translations.griffith: The forehead of the sky, earth's centre, Agni became the messenger of earth and heaven.  Vaiśvānara, the Deities produced thee, a God, to be a light unto the Ārya.

verses.sanskrit: आ सूर्ये न रश्मयो धरुवासो वैश्वानरे दधिरे.अग्ना वसूनि या पर्वतेष्वोषधीष्वप्सु या मानुषेष्वसि तस्य राजा |||
verses.transliteration: ā sūrye na raśmayo dhruvāso vaiśvānare dadhire.aghnā vasūni yā parvateṣvoṣadhīṣvapsu yā mānuṣeṣvasi tasya rājā

translations.griffith: As in the Sun firm rays are set for ever, treasures are in Vaiśvānara, in Agni.  Of all the riches in the hills, the waters, the herbs, among mankind, thou art the Sovran.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हती इव सूनवे रोदसी गिरो होता मनुष्यो न दक्षः सवर्वते सत्यशुष्माय पूर्वीर्वैश्वानराय नर्तमाय यह्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhatī iva sūnave rodasī ghiro hotā manuṣyo na dakṣaḥ svarvate satyaśuṣmāya pūrvīrvaiśvānarāya nṛtamāya yahvīḥ

translations.griffith: As the great World-halves, so are their Son's praises; skilled, as a man, to act, is he the Herald.  Vaiśvānara, celestial, truly mighty, most manly One, hath many a youthful consort.

verses.sanskrit: दिवश्चित ते बर्हतो जातवेदो वैश्वानर पर रिरिचे महित्वम राजा कर्ष्टीनामसि मानुषीणां युधा देवेभ्यो वरिवश्चकर्थ |||
verses.transliteration: divaścit te bṛhato jātavedo vaiśvānara pra ririce mahitvam rājā kṛṣṭīnāmasi mānuṣīṇāṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaścakartha

translations.griffith: Even the lofty heaven, O Jātavedas Vaiśvānara, hath not attained thy greatness.  Thou art the King of lands where men are settled, thou hast brought comfort to the Gods in battle.

verses.sanskrit: पर नू महित्वं वर्षभस्य वोचं यं पूरवो वर्त्रहणं सचन्ते वैश्वानरो दस्युमग्निर्जघन्वानधूनोत काष्ठा अव शम्बरं भेत |||
verses.transliteration: pra nū mahitvaṃ vṛṣabhasya vocaṃ yaṃ pūravo vṛtrahaṇaṃ sacante vaiśvānaro dasyumaghnirjaghanvānadhūnot kāṣṭhā ava śambaraṃ bhet

translations.griffith: Now will I tell the greatness of the Hero whom Pūru's sons follow as Vṛtra's slayer:  Agni Vaiśvānara struck down the Dasyu, cleave Śambara through and shattered down his fences.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानरो महिम्ना विश्वक्र्ष्टिर्भरद्वाजेषु यजतो विभावा शातवनेये शतिनीभिरग्निः पुरुणीथे जरते सून्र्तावान |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaro mahimnā viśvakṛṣṭirbharadvājeṣu yajato vibhāvā śātavaneye śatinībhiraghniḥ puruṇīthe jarate sūnṛtāvān

translations.griffith: Vaiśvānara, dwelling by his might with all men, far-shining, holy mid the Bharadvājas,  Is lauded, excellent, with hundred praises by Purūṇītha, son of Śatavani.

verses.sanskrit: वह्निं यशसं विदथस्य केतुं सुप्राव्यं दूतं सद्योर्थम दविजन्मानं रयिमिव परशस्तं रातिं भरद भर्गवेमातरिश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: vahniṃ yaśasaṃ vidathasya ketuṃ suprāvyaṃ dūtaṃ sadyoartham dvijanmānaṃ rayimiva praśastaṃ rātiṃ bharad bhṛghavemātariśvā

translations.griffith: As ’twere Some goodly treasure Mātariśvan brought, as a gift, the glorious Priest to Bhṛgu,  Banner of sacrifice, the good Protector, child of two births, the swiftly moving envoy.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य शासुरुभयासः सचन्ते हविष्मन्त उशिजो ये च मर्ताः दिवश्चित पूर्वो नयसादि होताप्र्छ्यो विश्पतिर्विक्षुवेधाः |||
verses.transliteration: asya śāsurubhayāsaḥ sacante haviṣmanta uśijo ye ca martāḥ divaścit pūrvo nyasādi hotāpṛchyo viśpatirvikṣuvedhāḥ

translations.griffith: Both Gods and men obey this Ruler's order, Gods who are worshipped, men who yearn and worship.  As Priest he takes his seat ere break of morning, House-Lord, adorable with men, Ordainer.

verses.sanskrit: तं नव्यसी हर्द आ जायमानमस्मत सुकीर्तिर्मधुजिह्वमश्याः यं रत्विजो वर्जने मानुषासः परयस्वन्त आयवो जीजनन्त |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ navyasī hṛda ā jāyamānamasmat sukīrtirmadhujihvamaśyāḥ yaṃ ṛtvijo vṛjane mānuṣāsaḥ prayasvanta āyavo jījananta

translations.griffith: May our fair praise, heart-born, most recent, reach him whose tongue, e’en at his birth, is sweet as honey;  Whom mortal priests, men, with their strong endeavour, supplied with dainty viands, have created.

verses.sanskrit: उशिक पावको वसुर्मानुषेषु वरेण्यो होताधायि विक्षु दमूना गर्हपतिर्दम आ अग्निर्भुवद रयिपती रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: uśik pāvako vasurmānuṣeṣu vareṇyo hotādhāyi vikṣu damūnā ghṛhapatirdama ā aghnirbhuvad rayipatī rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Good to mankind, the yearning Purifier hath among men been placed as Priest choice-worthy.  May Agni be our Friend, Lord of the Household, protector of the riches in the dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा वयं पतिमग्ने रयीणां पर शंसामो मतिभिर्गोतमासः आशुं न वाजम्भरं मर्जयन्तः परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ patimaghne rayīṇāṃ pra śaṃsāmo matibhirghotamāsaḥ āśuṃ na vājambharaṃ marjayantaḥ prātarmakṣū dhiyāvasurjaghamyāt

translations.griffith: As such we Gotamas with hymns extol thee, O Agni, as the guardian Lord of riches,  Decking thee like a horse, the swift prizewinner. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु पर तवसे तुराय परयो न हर्मि सतोमं माहिनाय रचीषमायाध्रिगव ओहमिन्द्राय बरह्माणि राततमा |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu pra tavase turāya prayo na harmi stomaṃ māhināya ṛcīṣamāyādhrighava ohamindrāya brahmāṇi rātatamā

translations.griffith: EVEN to him, swift, strong and high. exalted, I bring my song of praise as dainty viands,  My thought to him resistless, praise-deserving, prayers offered most especially to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु परय इव पर यंसि भराम्याङगूषं बाधे सुव्र्क्ति इन्द्राय हर्दा मनसा मनीषा परत्नाय पत्ये धियोमर्जयन्त |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu praya iva pra yaṃsi bharāmyāṅghūṣaṃ bādhe suvṛkti indrāya hṛdā manasā manīṣā pratnāya patye dhiyomarjayanta

translations.griffith: Praise, like oblation, I present, and utter aloud my song, my fair hymn to the Victor.  For Indra, who is Lord of old, the singers have decked their lauds with heart and mind and spirit.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु तयमुपमं सवर्षां भराम्याङगूषमास्येन मंहिष्ठमछोक्तिभिर्मतीनां सुव्र्क्तिभिः सूरिं वाव्र्धध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu tyamupamaṃ svarṣāṃ bharāmyāṅghūṣamāsyena maṃhiṣṭhamachoktibhirmatīnāṃ suvṛktibhiḥ sūriṃ vāvṛdhadhyai

translations.griffith: To him then with my lips mine adoration, winning heaven's light, most excellent, I offer,  To magnify with songs of invocation and with fair hymns the Lord, most bounteous Giver.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु सतोमं सं हिनोमि रथं न तष्टेव तत्सिनाय गिरश्च गिर्वाहसे सुव्र्क्तीन्द्राय विश्वमिन्वं मेधिराय |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu stomaṃ saṃ hinomi rathaṃ na taṣṭeva tatsināya ghiraśca ghirvāhase suvṛktīndrāya viśvaminvaṃ medhirāya

translations.griffith: Even for him I frame a laud, as fashions the wright a chariot for the man who needs it,—  Praises to him who gladly hears our praises, a hymn well-formed, all-moving, to wise Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु सप्तिमिव शरवस्येन्द्रायार्कं जुह्वा समञ्जे वीरं दानौकसं वन्दध्यै पुरां गूर्तश्रवसं दर्माणम |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu saptimiva śravasyendrāyārkaṃ juhvā samañje vīraṃ dānaukasaṃ vandadhyai purāṃ ghūrtaśravasaṃ darmāṇam

translations.griffith: So with my tongue I deck, to please that Indra, my hymn, as ’twere a horse, through love of glory,  To reverence the Hero, bounteous Giver, famed far and wide, destroyer of the castles.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु तवष्टा तक्षद वज्रं सवपस्तमं सवर्यं रणाय वर्त्रस्य चिद विदद येन मर्म तुजन्नीशानस्तुजता कियेधाः |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu tvaṣṭā takṣad vajraṃ svapastamaṃ svaryaṃ raṇāya vṛtrasya cid vidad yena marma tujannīśānastujatā kiyedhāḥ

translations.griffith: Even for him hath Tvaṣṭar forged the thunder, most deftly wrought, celestial, for the battle,  Wherewith he reached the vital parts of Vṛtra, striking-the vast, the mighty with the striker.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदु मातुः सवनेषु सद्यो महः पितुं पपिवाञ्चार्वन्ना मुषायद विष्णुः पचतं सहीयान विध्यद वराहन्तिरो अद्रिमस्ता |||
verses.transliteration: asyedu mātuḥ savaneṣu sadyo mahaḥ pituṃ papivāñcārvannā muṣāyad viṣṇuḥ pacataṃ sahīyān vidhyad varāhantiro adrimastā

translations.griffith: As soon as, at libations of his mother, great Viṣṇu had drunk up the draught, he plundered.  The dainty cates, the cooked mess; but One stronger transfixed the wild boar, shooting through the mountain.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु गनाश्चिद देवपत्नीरिन्द्रायार्कमहिहत्य ऊवुः परि दयावाप्र्थिवी जभ्र उर्वी नास्य ते महिमानं परिष्टः |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu ghnāścid devapatnīrindrāyārkamahihatya ūvuḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī jabhra urvī nāsya te mahimānaṃ pariṣṭaḥ

translations.griffith: To him, to Indra, when he slew the Dragon, the Dames, too, Consorts of the Gods, wove praises.  The mighty heaven and earth hath he encompassed: thy greatness heaven and earth, combined, exceed not.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदेव पर रिरिचे महित्वं दिवस पर्थिव्याः पर्यन्तरिक्षात सवराळ इन्द्रो दम आ विश्वगूर्तः सवरिरमत्रो ववक्षे रणाय |||
verses.transliteration: asyedeva pra ririce mahitvaṃ divas pṛthivyāḥ paryantarikṣāt svarāḷ indro dama ā viśvaghūrtaḥ svariramatro vavakṣe raṇāya

translations.griffith: Yea, of a truth, his magnitude surpasseth the magnitude of earth, mid-air, and heaven.  Indra, approved by all men, self-resplendent, waxed in his home, loud-voiced and strong for battle.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदेव शवसा शुषन्तं वि वर्श्चद वज्रेण वर्त्रमिन्द्रः गा न वराणा अवनीरमुञ्चदभि शरवो दावने सचेताः |||
verses.transliteration: asyedeva śavasā śuṣantaṃ vi vṛścad vajreṇa vṛtramindraḥ ghā na vrāṇā avanīramuñcadabhi śravo dāvane sacetāḥ

translations.griffith: Through his own strength Indra with bolt of thunder cut piece-meal Vṛtra, drier up of waters.  He let the floods go free, like cows imprisoned, for glory, with a heart inclined to bounty.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदु तवेषसा रन्त सिन्धवः परि यद वज्रेण सीमयछत ईशानक्र्द दाशुषे दशस्यन तुर्वीतये गाधं तुर्वणिः कः |||
verses.transliteration: asyedu tveṣasā ranta sindhavaḥ pari yad vajreṇa sīmayachat īśānakṛd dāśuṣe daśasyan turvītaye ghādhaṃ turvaṇiḥ kaḥ

translations.griffith: The rivers played, through his impetuous splendour, since with his bolt he compassed them on all sides.  Using his might and favouring him who worshipped, he made a ford, victorious, for Turvīti.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु पर भरा तूतुजानो वर्त्राय वज्रमीशानः कियेधाः गोर्न पर्व वि रदा तिरश्चेष्यन्नर्णांस्यपां चरध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu pra bharā tūtujāno vṛtrāya vajramīśānaḥ kiyedhāḥ ghorna parva vi radā tiraśceṣyannarṇāṃsyapāṃ caradhyai

translations.griffith: Vast, with thine ample power, with eager movement, against this Vṛtra cast thy bolt of thunder.  Rend thou his joints, as of an ox, dissevered, with bolt oblique, that floods of rain may follow.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदु पर बरूहि पूर्व्याणि तुरस्य कर्माणि नव्य उक्थैः युधे यदिष्णान आयुधान्य रघायमाणो निरिणाति शत्रून |||
verses.transliteration: asyedu pra brūhi pūrvyāṇi turasya karmāṇi navya ukthaiḥ yudhe yadiṣṇāna āyudhāny ṛghāyamāṇo niriṇāti śatrūn

translations.griffith: Sing with new lauds his exploits wrought aforetime, the deeds of him, yea, him who moveth swiftly,  When, hurling forth his weapons in the battle, he with impetuous wrath lays low the foemen.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदु भिया गिरयश्च दर्ळ्हा दयावा च भूमा जनुषस्तुजेते उपो वेनस्य जोगुवान ओणिं सद्यो भुवद वीर्याय नोधाः |||
verses.transliteration: asyedu bhiyā ghirayaśca dṛḷhā dyāvā ca bhūmā januṣastujete upo venasya joghuvāna oṇiṃ sadyo bhuvad vīryāya nodhāḥ

translations.griffith: When he, yea, he, comes forth the firm. Set mountains and the whole heaven and earth, tremble for terror.  May Nodhas, ever praising the protection of that dear Friend, gain quickly strength heroic.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इदु तयदनु दाय्येषामेको यद वव्ने भूरेरीशानः परैतशं सूर्ये पस्प्र्धानं सौवश्व्ये सुष्विमावदिन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: asmā idu tyadanu dāyyeṣāmeko yad vavne bhūrerīśānaḥ praitaśaṃ sūrye paspṛdhānaṃ sauvaśvye suṣvimāvadindraḥ

translations.griffith: Now unto him of these things hath been given what he who rules alone o’er much, electeth.  Indra hath helped Etaśa, Soma-presser, contending in the race of steeds with Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: एवा ते हारियोजना सुव्र्क्तीन्द्र बरह्माणि गोतमासो अक्रन ऐषु विश्वपेशसं धियं धाः परातर मक्षू धियावसुर जगम्यात|| |
verses.transliteration: evā te hāriyojanā suvṛktīndra brahmāṇi ghotamāso akran aiṣu viśvapeśasaṃ dhiyaṃ dhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jaghamyāt||

translations.griffith: Thus to thee, Indra, yoker of Bay Coursers, the Gotamas have brought their prayers to please thee.  Bestow upon them thought, decked with all beauty. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit: पर मन्महे शवसानाय शूषमाङगूषं गिर्वणसे अङगिरस्वत सुव्र्क्तिभिः सतुवत रग्मियायार्चामार्कं नरे विश्रुताय |||
verses.transliteration: pra manmahe śavasānāya śūṣamāṅghūṣaṃ ghirvaṇase aṅghirasvat suvṛktibhiḥ stuvata ṛghmiyāyārcāmārkaṃ nare viśrutāya

translations.griffith: LIKE Aṅgiras a gladdening laud we ponder to him who loveth song, exceeding mighty.  Let us sing glory to the far-famed Hero who must be praised with fair hymns by the singer.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो महे महि नमो भरध्वमाङगूष्यं शवसानाय साम येना नः पूर्वे पितरः पदज्ञा अर्चन्तो अङगिरसो गा अविन्दन |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo mahe mahi namo bharadhvamāṅghūṣyaṃ śavasānāya sāma yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñā arcanto aṅghiraso ghā avindan

translations.griffith: Unto the great bring ye great adoration, a chant with praise to him exceeding mighty,  Through whom our sires, Aṅgirases, singing praises and knowing well the places, found the cattle.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रस्याङगिरसां चेष्टौ विदत सरमा तनयाय धासिम बर्हस्पतिर्भिनदद्रिं विदद गाः समुस्रियाभिर्वावशन्त नरः |||
verses.transliteration: indrasyāṅghirasāṃ ceṣṭau vidat saramā tanayāya dhāsim bṛhaspatirbhinadadriṃ vidad ghāḥ samusriyābhirvāvaśanta naraḥ

translations.griffith: When Indra and the Aṅgirases desired it, Saramā found provision for her offspring.  Bṛhaspati cleft the mountain, found the cattle: the heroes shouted with the kine in triumph.

verses.sanskrit: स सुष्टुभा स सतुभा सप्त विप्रैः सवरेणाद्रिं सवर्यो नवग्वैः सरण्युभिः फलिगमिन्द्र शक्र वलं रवेणदरयो दशग्वैः |||
verses.transliteration: sa suṣṭubhā sa stubhā sapta vipraiḥ svareṇādriṃ svaryo navaghvaiḥ saraṇyubhiḥ phalighamindra śakra valaṃ raveṇadarayo daśaghvaiḥ

translations.griffith: Mid shout, loud shout, and roar, with the Navagvas, seven singers, hast thou, heavenly, rent the mountain;  Thou hast, with speeders, with Daśagvas, Indra, Śakra, with thunder rent obstructive Vala.

verses.sanskrit: गर्णानो अङगिरोभिर्दस्म वि वरुषसा सूर्येण गोभिरन्धः वि भूम्या अप्रथय इन्द्र सानु दिवो रज उपरमस्तभायः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛṇāno aṅghirobhirdasma vi varuṣasā sūryeṇa ghobhirandhaḥ vi bhūmyā aprathaya indra sānu divo raja uparamastabhāyaḥ

translations.griffith: Praised by Aṅgirases, thou, foe-destroyer, hast, with the Dawn, Sun, rays, dispelled the darkness.  Thou Indra, hast spread out the earth's high ridges, and firmly fixed the region under heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तदु परयक्षतममस्य कर्म दस्मस्य चारुतममस्ति दंसः उपह्वरे यदुपरा अपिन्वन मध्वर्णसो नद्यश्चतस्रः |||
verses.transliteration: tadu prayakṣatamamasya karma dasmasya cārutamamasti daṃsaḥ upahvare yaduparā apinvan madhvarṇaso nadyaścatasraḥ

translations.griffith: This is the deed most worthy of all honour, the fairest marvel of the Wonder-Worker,  That, nigh where heaven bends down, he made four rivers flow full with waves that carry down sweet water.

verses.sanskrit: दविता वि वव्रे सनजा सनीळे अयास्य सतवमानेभिरर्कैः भगो न मेने परमे वयोमन्नधारयद रोदसी सुदंसाः |||
verses.transliteration: dvitā vi vavre sanajā sanīḷe ayāsya stavamānebhirarkaiḥ bhagho na mene parame vyomannadhārayad rodasī sudaṃsāḥ

translations.griffith: Unwearied, won with lauding hymns, he parted of old the ancient Pair, united ever.  In highest sky like Bhaga, he the doer of marvels set both Dames and earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सनाद दिवं परि भूमा विरूपे पुनर्भुवा युवती सवेभिरेवैः कर्ष्णेभिरक्तोषा रुशद्भिर्वपुर्भिरा चरतो अन्यान्या |||
verses.transliteration: sanād divaṃ pari bhūmā virūpe punarbhuvā yuvatī svebhirevaiḥ kṛṣṇebhiraktoṣā ruśadbhirvapurbhirā carato anyānyā

translations.griffith: Still born afresh, young Dames, each in her manner, unlike in hue, the Pair in alternation  Round heaven and earth from ancient time have travelled, Night with her dark limbs, Dawn with limbs of splendour.

verses.sanskrit: सनेमि सख्यं सवपस्यमानः सूनुर्दाधार शवसा सुदंसाः आमासु चिद दधिषे पक्वमन्तः पयः कर्ष्णासु रुशद रोहिणीषु |||
verses.transliteration: sanemi sakhyaṃ svapasyamānaḥ sūnurdādhāra śavasā sudaṃsāḥ āmāsu cid dadhiṣe pakvamantaḥ payaḥ kṛṣṇāsu ruśad rohiṇīṣu

translations.griffith: Rich in good actions, skilled in operation, the Son with might maintains his perfect friendship.  Thou in the raw cows, black of hue or ruddy, storest the ripe milk glossy white in colour.

verses.sanskrit: सनात सनीला अवनीरवाता वरता रक्षन्ते अम्र्ताः सहोभिः पुरू सहस्रा जनयो न पत्नीर्दुवस्यन्ति सवसारो अह्रयाणम |||
verses.transliteration: sanāt sanīlā avanīravātā vratā rakṣante amṛtāḥ sahobhiḥ purū sahasrā janayo na patnīrduvasyanti svasāro ahrayāṇam

translations.griffith: Their paths, of old connected, rest uninjured; they with great might preserve the immortal statutes.  For many thousand holy works the Sisters wait on the haughty Lord like wives and matrons.

verses.sanskrit: सनायुवो नमसा नव्यो अर्कैर्वसूयवो मतयो दस्म दद्रुः पतिं न पत्नीरुशतीरुशन्तं सप्र्शन्ति तवा शवसावन्मनीषाः |||
verses.transliteration: sanāyuvo namasā navyo arkairvasūyavo matayo dasma dadruḥ patiṃ na patnīruśatīruśantaṃ spṛśanti tvā śavasāvanmanīṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Thoughts ancient, seeking wealth, with adoration, with newest lauds have sped to thee, O Mighty.  As yearning wives cleave to their yearning husband, so cleave our hymns to thee, O Lord most potent.

verses.sanskrit: सनादेव तव रायो गभस्तौ न कषीयन्ते नोप दस्यन्ति दस्म दयुमानसि करतुमानिन्द्र धीरः शिक्षा शचीवस्तव नः शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sanādeva tava rāyo ghabhastau na kṣīyante nopa dasyanti dasma dyumānasi kratumānindra dhīraḥ śikṣā śacīvastava naḥ śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Strong God, the riches which thy hands have holden from days of old have perished not nor wasted.  Splendid art thou, O Indra, wise, unbending: strengthen us with might, O Lord of Power.

verses.sanskrit: सनायते गोतम इन्द्र नव्यमतक्षद बरह्म हरियोजनाय सुनीथाय नः शवसान नोधाः परातर मक्षू धियावसुर जगम्यात|| |
verses.transliteration: sanāyate ghotama indra navyamatakṣad brahma hariyojanāya sunīthāya naḥ śavasāna nodhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jaghamyāt||

translations.griffith: O mighty Indra, Gotama's son Nodhas hath fashioned this new prayer to thee Eternal,  Sure leader, yoker of the Tawny Coursers. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit: तवं महानिन्द्र यो ह शुष्मैर्द्यावा जज्ञानः पर्थिवीमे धाः यद ध ते विश्वा गिरयश्चिदभ्वा भिया दर्ळ्हासः किरणा नैजन |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ mahānindra yo ha śuṣmairdyāvā jajñānaḥ pṛthivīame dhāḥ yad dha te viśvā ghirayaścidabhvā bhiyā dṛḷhāsaḥ kiraṇā naijan

translations.griffith: THOU art the Mighty One; when born, O Indra, with power thou terrifiedst earth and heaven;  When, in their fear of thee, all firm-set mountains and monstrous creatures shook like dust before thee.

verses.sanskrit: आ यद धरी इन्द्र विव्रता वेरा ते वज्रं जरिता बाह्वोर्धात येनाविहर्यतक्रतो अमित्रान पुर इष्णासि पुरुहूत पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad dharī indra vivratā verā te vajraṃ jaritā bāhvordhāt yenāviharyatakrato amitrān pura iṣṇāsi puruhūta pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: When thy two wandering Bays thou drawest hither, thy praiser laid within thine arms the thunder,  Wherewith, O Much-invoked, in will resistless, thou smitest foemen down and many a castle.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सत्य इन्द्र धर्ष्णुरेतान तवं रभुक्षा नर्यस्त्वंषाट तवं शुष्णं वर्जने पर्क्ष आणौ यूने कुत्सायद्युमते सचाहन |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ satya indra dhṛṣṇuretān tvaṃ ṛbhukṣā naryastvaṃṣāṭ tvaṃ śuṣṇaṃ vṛjane pṛkṣa āṇau yūne kutsāyadyumate sacāhan

translations.griffith: Faithful art thou, these thou defiest, Indra; thou art the Ṛbhus' Lord, heroic, victor.  Thou, by his side, for young and glorious Kutsa, with steed and car in battle slewest Śuṣṇa,

verses.sanskrit: तवं ह तयदिन्द्र चोदीः सखा वर्त्रं यद वज्रिन वर्षकर्मन्नुभ्नाः यद ध शूर वर्षमणः पराचैर्वि दस्यून्र्योनावक्र्तो वर्थाषाट |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ ha tyadindra codīḥ sakhā vṛtraṃ yad vajrin vṛṣakarmannubhnāḥ yad dha śūra vṛṣamaṇaḥ parācairvi dasyūnryonāvakṛto vṛthāṣāṭ

translations.griffith: That, as a friend, thou furtheredst, O Indra, when, Thunderer, strong in act, thou crushedst Vṛtra;  When, Hero, thou, great-souled, with easy conquest didst rend the Dasyus in their  distant dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: तवं ह तयदिन्द्रारिषण्यन दर्ळ्हस्य चिन मर्तानामजुष्टौ वयस्मदा काष्ठा अर्वते वर्घनेव वज्रिञ्छ्नथिह्यमित्रान |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ ha tyadindrāriṣaṇyan dṛḷhasya cin martānāmajuṣṭau vyasmadā kāṣṭhā arvate varghaneva vajriñchnathihyamitrān

translations.griffith: This doest thou, and art not harmed, O Indra, e’en in the anger of the strongest mortal.  Lay thou the race-course open for our horses: as with a club, slay, Thunder-armed! our foemen.

verses.sanskrit: तवां ह तयदिन्द्रार्णसातौ सवर्मीळ्हे नर आजा हवन्ते तव सवधाव इयमा समर्य ऊतिर्वाजेष्वतसाय्या भूत |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ ha tyadindrārṇasātau svarmīḷhe nara ājā havante tava svadhāva iyamā samarya ūtirvājeṣvatasāyyā bhūt

translations.griffith: Hence men invoke thee, Indra, in the tumult of battle, in the light-bestowing conflict.  This aid of thine, O Godlike One, was ever to be implored in deeds of might in combat.

verses.sanskrit: तवं ह तयदिन्द्र सप्त युध्यन पुरो वज्रिन पुरुकुत्साय दर्दः बर्हिर्न यत सुदासे वर्था वर्गंहो राजन वरिवः पूरवे कः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ ha tyadindra sapta yudhyan puro vajrin purukutsāya dardaḥ barhirna yat sudāse vṛthā varghaṃho rājan varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ

translations.griffith: Warring for Purukutsa thou, O Indra, Thunder-armed! breakest down the seven castles;  Easily, for Sudās, like grass didst rend them, and out of need, King, broughtest gain to Pūru.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तयां न इन्द्र देव चित्रामिषमापो न पीपयः परिज्मन यया शूर परत्यस्मभ्यं यंसि तमनमूर्जं न विश्वध कषरध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tyāṃ na indra deva citrāmiṣamāpo na pīpayaḥ parijman yayā śūra pratyasmabhyaṃ yaṃsi tmanamūrjaṃ na viśvadha kṣaradhyai

translations.griffith: O Indra, God who movest round about us, feed us with varied food plenteous as water—  Food wherewithal, O Hero, thou bestowest vigour itself to flow to us for ever.

verses.sanskrit: अकारि त इन्द्र गोतमेभिर्ब्रह्माण्योक्ता नमसा हरिभ्याम सुपेशसं वाजमा भरा नः परातर मक्षू धियावसुर जगम्यात |||
verses.transliteration: akāri ta indra ghotamebhirbrahmāṇyoktā namasā haribhyām supeśasaṃ vājamā bharā naḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jaghamyāt

translations.griffith: Prayers have been made by Gotamas, O Indra, addressed to thee, with laud for thy Bay Horses.  Bring us in noble shape abundant riches. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्णे शर्धाय सुमखाय वेधसे नोधः सुव्र्क्तिं पर भरा मरुद्भ्यः अपो न धीरो मनसा सुहस्त्यो गिरः समञ्जे विदथेष्वाभुवः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇe śardhāya sumakhāya vedhase nodhaḥ suvṛktiṃ pra bharā marudbhyaḥ apo na dhīro manasā suhastyo ghiraḥ samañje vidatheṣvābhuvaḥ

translations.griffith: BRING for the manly host, wise and majestical, O Nodhas, for the Maruts bring thou a pure gift.  I deck my songs as one deft-handed, wise in mind prepares the water that hath power in solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit: ते जज्ञिरे दिव रष्वास उक्षणो रुद्रस्य मर्या असुरा अरेपसः पावकासः शुचयः सूर्या इव सत्वानो न दरप्सिनोघोरवर्पसः |||
verses.transliteration: te jajñire diva ṛṣvāsa ukṣaṇo rudrasya maryā asurā arepasaḥ pāvakāsaḥ śucayaḥ sūryā iva satvāno na drapsinoghoravarpasaḥ

translations.griffith: They spring to birth, the lofty Ones, the Bulls of Heaven, divine, the youths of Rudra, free from spot and stain;  The purifiers, shining brightly even as suns, awful of form like giants, scattering rain-drops down.

verses.sanskrit: युवानो रुद्रा अजरा अभोग्घनो ववक्षुरध्रिगावः पर्वता इव दर्ळ्हा चिद विश्वा भुवनानि पार्थिवा पर चयावयन्तिदिव्यानि मज्मना |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāno rudrā ajarā abhoghghano vavakṣuradhrighāvaḥ parvatā iva dṛḷhā cid viśvā bhuvanāni pārthivā pra cyāvayantidivyāni majmanā

translations.griffith: Young Rudras, demon-slayers, never growing old, they have waxed, even as mountains, irresistible.  They make all beings tremble with their mighty strength, even the very strongest, both of earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: चित्रैरञ्जिभिर्वपुषे वयञ्जते वक्षस्सु रुक्मानधि येतिरे शुभे अंसेष्वेषां नि मिम्र्क्षुर रष्टयः साकं जज्ञिरे सवधया दिवो नरः |||
verses.transliteration: citrairañjibhirvapuṣe vyañjate vakṣassu rukmānadhi yetire śubhe aṃseṣveṣāṃ ni mimṛkṣur ṛṣṭayaḥ sākaṃ jajñire svadhayā divo naraḥ

translations.griffith: With glittering ornaments they deck them forth for show; for beauty on their breasts they bind their chains of gold.  The lances on their shoulders pound to pieces; they were born together, of themselves, the Men of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: ईशानक्र्तो धुनयो रिशादसो वातान विद्युतस्तविषीभिरक्रत दुहन्त्यूधर्दिव्यानि धूतयो भूमिं पिन्वन्ति पयसापरिज्रयः |||
verses.transliteration: īśānakṛto dhunayo riśādaso vātān vidyutastaviṣībhirakrata duhantyūdhardivyāni dhūtayo bhūmiṃ pinvanti payasāparijrayaḥ

translations.griffith: Loud roarers, giving strength, devourers of the foe, they make the winds, they make the lightnings with their powers.  The restless shakers drain the udders of the sky, and ever wandering round fill the earth full with milk.

verses.sanskrit: पिन्वन्त्यपो मरुतः सुदानवः पयो घर्तवद विदथेष्वाभुवः अत्यं न मिहे वि नयन्ति वाजिनमुत्सं दुहन्ति सतनयन्तमक्षितम |||
verses.transliteration: pinvantyapo marutaḥ sudānavaḥ payo ghṛtavad vidatheṣvābhuvaḥ atyaṃ na mihe vi nayanti vājinamutsaṃ duhanti stanayantamakṣitam

translations.griffith: The bounteous Maruts with the fatness dropping milk fill full the waters which avail in solemn rites.  They lead, as ’twere, the Strong Horse forth, that it may rain: they milk the thundering, the never-failing spring.

verses.sanskrit: महिषासो मायिनश्चित्रभानवो गिरयो न सवतवसो रघुष्यदः मर्गा इव हस्तिनः खादथा वना यदारुणीषु तविषीरयुग्ध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: mahiṣāso māyinaścitrabhānavo ghirayo na svatavaso raghuṣyadaḥ mṛghā iva hastinaḥ khādathā vanā yadāruṇīṣu taviṣīrayughdhvam

translations.griffith: Mighty, with wondrous power and marvellously bright, selfstrong like mountains, ye glide swiftly on your way.  Like the wild elephants ye eat the forests up when ye assume your strength among the bright red flames.

verses.sanskrit: सिंहा इव नानदति परचेतसः पिशा इव सुपिशो विश्ववेदसः कषपो जिन्वन्तः पर्षतीभिर रष्टिभिः समित सबाधः शवसाहिमन्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: siṃhā iva nānadati pracetasaḥ piśā iva supiśo viśvavedasaḥ kṣapo jinvantaḥ pṛṣatībhir ṛṣṭibhiḥ samit sabādhaḥ śavasāhimanyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Exceeding wise they roar like lions mightily, they, all-possessing, are beauteous as antelopes;  Stirring the darkness with lances and spotted deer, combined as priests, with serpents' fury through their might.

verses.sanskrit: रोदसी आ वदता गणश्रियो नर्षाचः शूराः शवसाहिमन्यवः आ वन्धुरेष्वमतिर्न दर्शता विद्युन न तस्थौ मरुतो रथेषु वः |||
verses.transliteration: rodasī ā vadatā ghaṇaśriyo nṛṣācaḥ śūrāḥ śavasāhimanyavaḥ ā vandhureṣvamatirna darśatā vidyun na tasthau maruto ratheṣu vaḥ

translations.griffith: Heroes who march in companies, befriending man, with serpents' ire through strength, ye greet the earth and heaven.  Upon the seats, O Maruts, of your chariots, upon the cars stands lightning visible as light.

verses.sanskrit: विश्ववेदसो रयिभिः समोकसः सम्मिश्लासस्तविषीभिर्विरप्शिनः अस्तार इषुं दधिरे गभस्त्योरनन्तशुष्मा वर्षखादयो नरः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvavedaso rayibhiḥ samokasaḥ sammiślāsastaviṣībhirvirapśinaḥ astāra iṣuṃ dadhire ghabhastyoranantaśuṣmā vṛṣakhādayo naraḥ

translations.griffith: Lords of all riches, dwelling in the home of wealth, endowed with mighty vigour, singers loud of voice,  Heroes, of powers infinite, armed with strong men's rings, the archers, they have laid the arrow on their arms.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्ययेभिः पविभिः पयोव्र्ध उज्जिघ्नन्त आपथ्यो न पर्वतान मखा अयासः सवस्र्तो धरुवच्युतो दुध्रक्र्तो मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyayebhiḥ pavibhiḥ payovṛdha ujjighnanta āpathyo na parvatān makhā ayāsaḥ svasṛto dhruvacyuto dudhrakṛto maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: They who with golden fellies make the rain increase drive forward the big clouds like wanderers on the way.  Self-moving, brisk, unwearied, they o’erthrow the firm; the Maruts with bright lances make all things to reel.

verses.sanskrit: घर्षुं पावकं वनिनं विचर्षणिं रुद्रस्य सूनुं हवसा गर्णीमसि रजस्तुरं तवसं मारुतं गणं रजीषिणंव्र्षणं सश्चत शरिये |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛṣuṃ pāvakaṃ vaninaṃ vicarṣaṇiṃ rudrasya sūnuṃ havasā ghṛṇīmasi rajasturaṃ tavasaṃ mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ ṛjīṣiṇaṃvṛṣaṇaṃ saścata śriye

translations.griffith: The progeny of Rudra we invoke with prayer, the brisk, the bright, the worshipful, the active Ones  To the strong band of Maruts cleave for happiness, the chasers of the sky, impetuous, vigorous.

verses.sanskrit: पर नू स मर्तः शवसा जनानति तस्थौ व ऊती मरुतो यमावत अर्वद्भिर्वजं भरते धना नर्भिराप्र्छ्यंक्रतुमा कषेति पुष्यति |||
verses.transliteration: pra nū sa martaḥ śavasā janānati tasthau va ūtī maruto yamāvata arvadbhirvajaṃ bharate dhanā nṛbhirāpṛchyaṃkratumā kṣeti puṣyati

translations.griffith: Maruts, the man whom ye have guarded with your help, he verily in strength surpasseth all mankind.  Spoil with his steeds he gaineth, treasure with his men; he winneth honourable strength and prospereth.

verses.sanskrit: चर्क्र्त्यं मरुतः पर्त्सु दुष्टरं दयुमन्तं शुष्मं मघवत्सु धत्तन धनस्प्र्तमुक्थ्यं विश्वचर्षणिं तोकं पुष्येम तनयं शतं हिमः |||
verses.transliteration: carkṛtyaṃ marutaḥ pṛtsu duṣṭaraṃ dyumantaṃ śuṣmaṃ maghavatsu dhattana dhanaspṛtamukthyaṃ viśvacarṣaṇiṃ tokaṃ puṣyema tanayaṃ śataṃ himaḥ

translations.griffith: O Maruts, to the worshippers give glorious strength invincible in battle, brilliant, bringing wealth,  Praiseworthy, known to all men. May we foster well, during a hundred winters, son and progeny.

verses.sanskrit: नू षठिरं मरुतो वीरवन्तं रतीषाहं रयिमस्मासु धत्त सहस्रिणं शतिनं शूशुवांसं परातर मक्षू धियावसुर जगम्यात |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭhiraṃ maruto vīravantaṃ ṛtīṣāhaṃ rayimasmāsu dhatta sahasriṇaṃ śatinaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jaghamyāt

translations.griffith: Will ye then, O ye Maruts, grant us riches, durable, rich in men, defying onslaught.  A hundred, thousandfold, ever increasing? May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit: पश्वा न तायुं गुहा चतन्तं नमो युजानं नमो वहन्तम सजोषा धीराः पदैरनु गमन्नुप तवा सीदन विश्वेयजत्राः |||
verses.transliteration: paśvā na tāyuṃ ghuhā catantaṃ namo yujānaṃ namo vahantam sajoṣā dhīrāḥ padairanu ghmannupa tvā sīdan viśveyajatrāḥ

translations.griffith: ONE-MINDED, wise, they tracked thee like a thief lurking in dark cave with a stolen cow:  Thee claiming worship, bearing it to Gods: there nigh to thee sate all the Holy Ones.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य देवा अनु वरता गुर्भुवत परिष्टिर्द्यौर्न भूम वर्धन्तीमापः पन्वा सुशिश्विं रतस्य योना गर्भे सुजातम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya devā anu vratā ghurbhuvat pariṣṭirdyaurna bhūma vardhantīmāpaḥ panvā suśiśviṃ ṛtasya yonā gharbhe sujātam

translations.griffith: The Gods approached the ways of holy Law; there was a gathering vast as heaven itself.  The waters feed with praise the growing Babe, born nobly in the womb, the seat of Law.

verses.sanskrit: पुष्टिर्न रण्वा कषितिर्न पर्थिवी गिरिर्न भुज्म कषोदो न शम्भु अत्यो नाज्मन सर्गप्रतक्तः सिन्धुर्न कषोदः क ईं वराते |||
verses.transliteration: puṣṭirna raṇvā kṣitirna pṛthivī ghirirna bhujma kṣodo na śambhu atyo nājman sarghaprataktaḥ sindhurna kṣodaḥ ka īṃ varāte

translations.griffith: Like grateful food, like some wide dwelling place, like a fruit-bearing hill, a wholesome stream.  Like a steed urged to run in swift career, rushing like Sindhu, who may check his course?

verses.sanskrit: जामिः सिन्धूनां भरातेव सवस्रामिभ्यान न राजा वनान्यत्ति यद वातजूतो वना वयस्थादग्निर्ह दाति रोमा पर्थिव्याः |||
verses.transliteration: jāmiḥ sindhūnāṃ bhrāteva svasrāmibhyān na rājā vanānyatti yad vātajūto vanā vyasthādaghnirha dāti romā pṛthivyāḥ

translations.griffith: Kin as a brother to his sister floods, he eats the woods as a King eats the rich.  When through the forest, urged by wind, he spreads, verily Agni shears the hair of earth.

verses.sanskrit: शवसित्यप्सु हंसो न सीदन करत्वा चेतिष्ठो विशामुषर्भुत सोमो न वेधा रतप्रजातः पशुर्न शिश्वा विभुर्दूरेभाः |||
verses.transliteration: śvasityapsu haṃso na sīdan kratvā cetiṣṭho viśāmuṣarbhut somo na vedhā ṛtaprajātaḥ paśurna śiśvā vibhurdūrebhāḥ

translations.griffith: Like a swan sitting in the floods he pants wisest in mind mid men he wakes at morn.  A Sage like Soma, sprung from Law, he grew like some young creature, mighty, shining far.

verses.sanskrit: रयिर्न चित्रा सूरो न सन्द्र्गायुर्न पराणो नित्यो नसूनुः तक्वा न भूर्णिर्वना सिषक्ति पयो न धेनुः शुचिर्विभावा |||
verses.transliteration: rayirna citrā sūro na sandṛghāyurna prāṇo nityo nasūnuḥ takvā na bhūrṇirvanā siṣakti payo na dhenuḥ śucirvibhāvā

translations.griffith: LIKE the Sun's glance, like wealth of varied sort, like breath which is the life, like one's own son,  Like a swift bird, a cow who yields her milk, pure and refulgent to the wood he speeds.

verses.sanskrit: दाधार कषेममोको न रण्वो यवो न पक्वो जेता जनानाम रषिर्न सतुभ्वा विक्षु परशस्तो वाजी न परीतो वयोदधति |||
verses.transliteration: dādhāra kṣemamoko na raṇvo yavo na pakvo jetā janānām ṛṣirna stubhvā vikṣu praśasto vājī na prīto vayodadhati

translations.griffith: He offers safety like a pleasant home, like ripened corn, the Conqueror of men.  Like a Seer lauding, famed among the folk; like a steed friendly he vouchsafes us power.

verses.sanskrit: दुरोकशोचिः करतुर्न नित्यो जायेव योनावरं विश्वस्मै चित्रो यदभ्राट छवेतो न विक्षु रथो न रुक्मी तवेषः समत्सु |||
verses.transliteration: durokaśociḥ kraturna nityo jāyeva yonāvaraṃ viśvasmai citro yadabhrāṭ chveto na vikṣu ratho na rukmī tveṣaḥ samatsu

translations.griffith: With flame insatiate, like eternal might; caring for each one like a dame at home;  Bright when he shines forth, whitish mid the folk, like a car, gold-decked, thundering to the fight.

verses.sanskrit: सेनेव सर्ष्टामं दधात्यस्तुर्न दिद्युत तवेषप्रतीका यमो ह जातो यमो जनित्वं जारः कनीनां पतिर्जनीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: seneva sṛṣṭāmaṃ dadhātyasturna didyut tveṣapratīkā yamo ha jāto yamo janitvaṃ jāraḥ kanīnāṃ patirjanīnām

translations.griffith: He strikes with terror like a dart shot forth, e’en like an archer's arrow tipped with flame;  Master of present and of future life, the maidens’ lover and the matrons’ Lord.

verses.sanskrit: तं वश्चराथा वयं वसत्यास्तं न गावो नक्षन्त इद्धम सिन्धुर्न कषोदः पर नीचीरैनोन नवन्त गावः सवर्द्र्शीके |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vaścarāthā vayaṃ vasatyāstaṃ na ghāvo nakṣanta iddham sindhurna kṣodaḥ pra nīcīrainon navanta ghāvaḥ svardṛśīke

translations.griffith: To him lead all your ways: may we attain the kindled God as cows their home at eve.  He drives the flames below as floods their swell: the rays rise up to the fair place of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वनेषु जायुर्मर्तेषु मित्रो वर्णीते शरुष्टिं राजेवाजुर्यम कषेमो न साधुः करतुर्न भद्रो भुवत सवाधिर्होता हव्यवाट |||
verses.transliteration: vaneṣu jāyurmarteṣu mitro vṛṇīte śruṣṭiṃ rājevājuryam kṣemo na sādhuḥ kraturna bhadro bhuvat svādhirhotā havyavāṭ

translations.griffith: VICTORIOUS in the wood, Friend among men, ever he claims obedience as a King.  Gracious like peace, blessing like mental power, Priest was he, offering-bearer, full of thought.

verses.sanskrit: हस्ते दधानो नर्म्णा विश्वान्यमे देवान धाद गुहा निषीदन विदन्तीमत्र नरो धियन्धा हर्दा यत तष्टान मन्त्रानशंसन |||
verses.transliteration: haste dadhāno nṛmṇā viśvānyame devān dhād ghuhā niṣīdan vidantīmatra naro dhiyandhā hṛdā yat taṣṭān mantrānaśaṃsan

translations.griffith: He, bearing in his hand all manly might, crouched in the cavern, struck the Gods with fear.  Men filled with understanding find him there, when they have sting prayers formed within their heart.

verses.sanskrit: अजो न कषां दाधार पर्थिवीं तस्तम्भ दयां मन्त्रेभिः सत्यैः परिया पदानि पश्वो नि पाहि विश्वायुरग्ने गुहा गुहं गाः |||
verses.transliteration: ajo na kṣāṃ dādhāra pṛthivīṃ tastambha dyāṃ mantrebhiḥ satyaiḥ priyā padāni paśvo ni pāhi viśvāyuraghne ghuhā ghuhaṃ ghāḥ

translations.griffith: He, like the Unborn, holds the broad earth up; and with effective utterance fixed the sky.  O Agni, guard the spots which cattle love: thou, life of all, hast gone from lair to lair.

verses.sanskrit: य ईं चिकेत गुहा भवन्तमा यः ससाद धारां रतस्य वि ये चर्तन्त्य रता सपन्त आदिद वसूनि पर ववाचास्मै |||
verses.transliteration: ya īṃ ciketa ghuhā bhavantamā yaḥ sasāda dhārāṃ ṛtasya vi ye cṛtanty ṛtā sapanta ādid vasūni pra vavācāsmai

translations.griffith: Whoso hath known him dwelling in his lair, and hath approached the stream of holy Law,—  They who release him, paying sacred rites,—truly to such doth he announce great wealth.

verses.sanskrit: वि यो वीरुत्सु रोधन महित्वोत परजा उत परसूष्वन्तः चित्तिरपां दमे विश्वायुः सद्मेव धीराः सम्माय चक्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: vi yo vīrutsu rodhan mahitvota prajā uta prasūṣvantaḥ cittirapāṃ dame viśvāyuḥ sadmeva dhīrāḥ sammāya cakruḥ

translations.griffith: He who grows mightily in herbs, within each fruitful mother and each babe she bears,  Wise, life of all men, in the waters’ home,—for him have sages built as ’twere a seat.

verses.sanskrit: शरीणन्नुप सथाद दिवं भुरण्यु सथातुश्चरथमक्तून्व्यूर्णोत परि यदेषामेको विश्वेषां भुवद देवो देवानां महित्वा |||
verses.transliteration: śrīṇannupa sthād divaṃ bhuraṇyu sthātuścarathamaktūnvyūrṇot pari yadeṣāmeko viśveṣāṃ bhuvad devo devānāṃ mahitvā

translations.griffith: COMMINGLING, restless, he ascends the sky, unveiling nights and all that stands or moves,  As he the sole God is preeminent in greatness among all these other Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आदित ते विश्वे करतुं जुषन्त शुष्काद यद देव जीवो जनिष्ठाः भजन्त विश्वे देवत्वं नाम रतं सपन्तो अम्र्तमेवैः |||
verses.transliteration: ādit te viśve kratuṃ juṣanta śuṣkād yad deva jīvo janiṣṭhāḥ bhajanta viśve devatvaṃ nāma ṛtaṃ sapanto amṛtamevaiḥ

translations.griffith: All men are joyful in thy power, O God, that living from the dry wood thou art born.  All truly share thy Godhead while they keep, in their accustomed ways, eternal Law.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य परेषा रतस्य धीतिर्विश्वायुर्विश्वे अपांसि चक्रुः यस्तुभ्यं दाशाद यो वा ते शिक्षात तस्मै चिकित्वान्रयिं दयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya preṣā ṛtasya dhītirviśvāyurviśve apāṃsi cakruḥ yastubhyaṃ dāśād yo vā te śikṣāt tasmai cikitvānrayiṃ dayasva

translations.griffith: Strong is the thought of Law, the Law's behest; all works have they performed; he quickens all.  Whoso will bring oblation, gifts to thee, to him, bethinking thee, vouchsafe thou wealth.

verses.sanskrit: होता निषत्तो मनोरपत्ये स चिन नवासां पती रयीणाम इछन्त रेतो मिथस्तनूषु सं जानत सवैर्दक्षैरमूराः |||
verses.transliteration: hotā niṣatto manorapatye sa cin nvāsāṃ patī rayīṇām ichanta reto mithastanūṣu saṃ jānata svairdakṣairamūrāḥ

translations.griffith: Seated as Priest with Manu's progeny, of all these treasures he alone is Lord.  Men yearn for children to prolong their line, and are not disappointed in their hope.

verses.sanskrit: पितुर्न पुत्राः करतुं जुषन्त शरोषन ये अस्य शासं तुरासः वि राय और्णोद दुरः पुरुक्षुः पिपेश नाकं सत्र्भिर्दमूनाः |||
verses.transliteration: piturna putrāḥ kratuṃ juṣanta śroṣan ye asya śāsaṃ turāsaḥ vi rāya aurṇod duraḥ purukṣuḥ pipeśa nākaṃ stṛbhirdamūnāḥ

translations.griffith: Eagerly they who hear his word fulfil his wish as sons obey their sire's behest.  He, rich in food, unbars his wealth like doors: he, the House-Friend, hath decked heaven's vault with stars.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्रः शुशुक्वानुषो न जारः पप्रा समीची दिवो नज्योतिः परि परजातः करत्वा बभूथ भुवो देवानां पिता पुत्रः सन |||
verses.transliteration: śukraḥ śuśukvānuṣo na jāraḥ paprā samīcī divo najyotiḥ pari prajātaḥ kratvā babhūtha bhuvo devānāṃ pitā putraḥ san

translations.griffith: BRIGHT, splendid, like Dawn's lover, he hath filled the two joined worlds as with the light of heaven.  When born, with might thou hast encompassed them: Father of Gods, and yet their Son wast thou.

verses.sanskrit: वेधा अद्र्प्तो अग्निर्विजानन्नूधर्न गोनां सवाद्मा पितूनाम जने न शेव आहूर्यः सन मध्ये निषत्तो रण्वो दुरोणे |||
verses.transliteration: vedhā adṛpto aghnirvijānannūdharna ghonāṃ svādmā pitūnām jane na śeva āhūryaḥ san madhye niṣatto raṇvo duroṇe

translations.griffith: Agni, the Sage, the humble, who discerns like the cow's udder, the sweet taste of food,  Like a bliss-giver to be drawn to men, sits gracious in the middle of the house.

verses.sanskrit: पुत्रो न जातो रण्वो दुरोणे वाजी न परीतो विशो वि तारीत विशो यदह्वे नर्भिः सनीळा अग्निर्देवत्वा विश्वान्यश्याः |||
verses.transliteration: putro na jāto raṇvo duroṇe vājī na prīto viśo vi tārīt viśo yadahve nṛbhiḥ sanīḷā aghnirdevatvā viśvānyaśyāḥ

translations.griffith: Born in the dwelling like a lovely son, pleased, like a strong steed, he bears on the folk.  What time the men and I, with heroes, call, may Agni then gain all through Godlike power.

verses.sanskrit: नकिष ट एता वरता मिनन्ति नर्भ्यो यदेभ्यः शरुष्टिं चकर्थ तत तु ते दंसो यदहन समानैर्न्र्भिर्यद युक्तो विवे रपांसि |||
verses.transliteration: nakiṣ ṭa etā vratā minanti nṛbhyo yadebhyaḥ śruṣṭiṃ cakartha tat tu te daṃso yadahan samānairnṛbhiryad yukto vive rapāṃsi

translations.griffith: None breaks these holy laws of thine when thou hast granted audience to these chieftains here.  This is thy boast, thou smotest with thy peers, and joined with heroes dravest off disgrace.

verses.sanskrit: उषो न जारो विभावोस्रः संज्ञातरूपश्चिकेतदस्मै तमना वहन्तो दुरो वय रण्वन नवन्त विश्वे सवर्द्र्शीके |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo na jāro vibhāvosraḥ saṃjñātarūpaściketadasmai tmanā vahanto duro vy ṛṇvan navanta viśve svardṛśīke

translations.griffith: Like the Dawn's lover, spreading light, well-known as hued like morn, may he remember me.  They, bearing of themselves, unbar the doors: they all ascend to the fair place of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वनेम पूर्वीरर्यो मनीषा अग्निः सुशोको विश्वान्यश्याः आ दैव्यानि वरता चिकित्वाना मानुषस्य जनस्य जन्म |||
verses.transliteration: vanema pūrvīraryo manīṣā aghniḥ suśoko viśvānyaśyāḥ ā daivyāni vratā cikitvānā mānuṣasya janasya janma

translations.griffith: MAY we, the pious, win much food by prayer, may Agni with fair light pervade each act,—  He the observer of the heavenly laws of Gods, and of the race of mortal man.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भो यो अपां गर्भो वनानां गर्भश्च सथातां गर्भश्चरथाम अद्रौ चिदस्मा अन्तर्दुरोणे विशां न विश्वो अम्र्तः सवाधीः |||
verses.transliteration: gharbho yo apāṃ gharbho vanānāṃ gharbhaśca sthātāṃ gharbhaścarathām adrau cidasmā antarduroṇe viśāṃ na viśvo amṛtaḥ svādhīḥ

translations.griffith: He who is germ of waters, germ of woods, germ of all things that move not and that move,—  To him even in the rock and in the house: Immortal One, he cares for all mankind.

verses.sanskrit: स हि कषपावानग्नी रयीणां दाशद यो अस्मा अरं सूक्तैः एता चिकित्वो भूमा नि पाहि देवानां जन्म मर्तांश्च विद्वान |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi kṣapāvānaghnī rayīṇāṃ dāśad yo asmā araṃ sūktaiḥ etā cikitvo bhūmā ni pāhi devānāṃ janma martāṃśca vidvān

translations.griffith: Agni is Lord of riches for the man who serves him readily with sacred songs.  Protect these beings thou with careful thought, knowing the races both of Gods and men.

verses.sanskrit: वर्धान यं पूर्वीः कषपो विरूपा सथातुश्च रथं रतप्रवीतम अराधि होता सवर्निषत्तः कर्ण्वन विश्वान्यपांसि सत्या |||
verses.transliteration: vardhān yaṃ pūrvīḥ kṣapo virūpā sthātuśca rathaṃ ṛtapravītam arādhi hotā svarniṣattaḥ kṛṇvan viśvānyapāṃsi satyā

translations.griffith: Whom many dawns and nights, unlike, make strong, whom, born in Law, all things that move and stand,—  He hath been won, Herald who sits in light, making effectual all our holy works.

verses.sanskrit: गोषु परशस्तिं वनेषु धिषे भरन्त विश्वे बलिं सवर्णः वि तवा नरः पुरुत्रा सपर्यन पितुर्न जिव्रेर्वि वेदोभरन्त |||
verses.transliteration: ghoṣu praśastiṃ vaneṣu dhiṣe bharanta viśve baliṃ svarṇaḥ vi tvā naraḥ purutrā saparyan piturna jivrervi vedobharanta

translations.griffith: Thou settest value on our cows and woods: all shall bring tribute to us to the light.  Men have served thee in many and sundry spots, parting, as ’twere, an aged father's wealth.

verses.sanskrit: साधुर्न गर्ध्नुरस्तेव शूरो यातेव भीमस्त्वेषः समत्सु ||
verses.transliteration: sādhurna ghṛdhnurasteva śūro yāteva bhīmastveṣaḥ samatsu

translations.griffith: Like a brave archer, like one skilled and bold, a fierce avenger, so he shines in fight.

verses.sanskrit: उप पर जिन्वन्नुशतीरुशन्तं पतिं न नित्यं जनयः सनीळाः सवसारः शयावीमरुषीमजुष्रञ्चित्रमुछन्तीमुषसं न गावः |||
verses.transliteration: upa pra jinvannuśatīruśantaṃ patiṃ na nityaṃ janayaḥ sanīḷāḥ svasāraḥ śyāvīmaruṣīmajuṣrañcitramuchantīmuṣasaṃ na ghāvaḥ

translations.griffith: LOVING the loving One, as wives their husband, the sisters of one home have urged him forward,  Bright-coloured, even, as the cows love morning, dark, breaking forth to view, and redly beaming.

verses.sanskrit: वीळु चिद दर्ळ्हा पितरो न उक्थैरद्रिं रुजन्नङगिरसो रवेण चक्रुर्दिवो बर्हतो गातुमस्मे अहः सवर्विविदुः केतुमुस्राः |||
verses.transliteration: vīḷu cid dṛḷhā pitaro na ukthairadriṃ rujannaṅghiraso raveṇa cakrurdivo bṛhato ghātumasme ahaḥ svarvividuḥ ketumusrāḥ

translations.griffith: Our sires with lauds burst e’en the firm-set fortress, yea, the Aṅgirases, with roar, the mountain.  They made for us a way to reach high heaven, they found us day, light, day's sign, beams of morning.

verses.sanskrit: दधन्न्र्तं धनयन्नस्य धीतिमादिदर्यो दिधिष्वो विभ्र्त्राः अत्र्ष्यन्तीरपसो यन्त्यछा देवाञ जन्म परयसा वर्धयन्तीः |||
verses.transliteration: dadhannṛtaṃ dhanayannasya dhītimādidaryo didhiṣvo vibhṛtrāḥ atṛṣyantīrapaso yantyachā devāñ janma prayasā vardhayantīḥ

translations.griffith: They stablished order, made his service fruitful; then parting them among the longing faithful,  Not thirsting after aught, they come, most active, while with sweet food the race of Gods they strengthen.

verses.sanskrit: मथीद यदीं विभ्र्तो मातरिश्वा गर्हे-गर्हे शयेतो जेन्यो भूत आदीं राज्ञे न सहीयसे सचा सन्ना दूत्यं भर्गवाणो विवाय |||
verses.transliteration: mathīd yadīṃ vibhṛto mātariśvā ghṛhe-ghṛhe śyeto jenyo bhūt ādīṃ rājñe na sahīyase sacā sannā dūtyaṃ bhṛghavāṇo vivāya

translations.griffith: Since Mātariśvan, far-diffused, hath stirred him, and he in every house grown bright and noble,  He, Bhṛgu-like I hath gone as his companion, as on commission to a greater Sovran.

verses.sanskrit: महे यत पित्र ईं रसं दिवे करव तसरत पर्शन्यश्चिकित्वान सर्जदस्ता धर्षता दिद्युमस्मै सवायां देवो दुहितरि तविषिं धात |||
verses.transliteration: mahe yat pitra īṃ rasaṃ dive karava tsarat pṛśanyaścikitvān sṛjadastā dhṛṣatā didyumasmai svāyāṃ devo duhitari tviṣiṃ dhāt

translations.griffith: When man poured juice to Heaven, the mighty Father, he knew and freed himself from close embracement.  The archer boldly shot at him his arrow, and the God threw his splendour on his Daughter.

verses.sanskrit: सव आ यस्तुभ्यं दम आ विभाति नमो वा दाशादुशतो अनु दयून वर्धो अग्ने वयो अस्य दविबर्हा यासद राया सरथं यं जुनासि |||
verses.transliteration: sva ā yastubhyaṃ dama ā vibhāti namo vā dāśāduśato anu dyūn vardho aghne vayo asya dvibarhā yāsad rāyā sarathaṃ yaṃ junāsi

translations.griffith: Whoso, hath flames for thee within his dwelling, or brings the worship which thou lovest daily,  Do thou of double might increase his substance: may he whom thou incitest meet with riches.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं विश्वा अभि पर्क्षः सचन्ते समुद्रं न सरवतः सप्त यह्वीः न जामिभिर्वि चिकिते वयो नो विदा देवेषु परमतिं चिकित्वान |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ viśvā abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante samudraṃ na sravataḥ sapta yahvīḥ na jāmibhirvi cikite vayo no vidā deveṣu pramatiṃ cikitvān

translations.griffith: All sacrificial viands wait on Agni as the Seven mighty Rivers seek the ocean.  Not by our brethren was our food discovered: find with the Gods care for us, thou who knowest.

verses.sanskrit: आ यदिषे नर्पतिं तेज आनट छुचि रेतो निषिक्तं दयौरभीके अग्निः शर्धमनवद्यं युवानं सवाध्यं जनयत सूदयच्च |||
verses.transliteration: ā yadiṣe nṛpatiṃ teja ānaṭ chuci reto niṣiktaṃ dyaurabhīke aghniḥ śardhamanavadyaṃ yuvānaṃ svādhyaṃ janayat sūdayacca

translations.griffith: When light hath filled the Lord of men for increase, straight from the heaven descends the limpid moisture.  Agni hath brought to light and filled with spirit the youthful host blameless and well providing.

verses.sanskrit: मनो न यो.अध्वनः सद्य एत्येकः सत्रा सूरो वस्व ईशे राजाना मित्रावरुणा सुपाणी गोषु परियमम्र्तं रक्षमाणा |||
verses.transliteration: mano na yo.adhvanaḥ sadya etyekaḥ satrā sūro vasva īśe rājānā mitrāvaruṇā supāṇī ghoṣu priyamamṛtaṃ rakṣamāṇā

translations.griffith: He who like thought goes swiftly on his journey, the Sun, alone is ever Lord of riches.  The Kings with fair hands, Varuṇa and Mitra, protect the precious nectar in our cattle.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो अग्ने सख्या पित्र्याणि पर मर्षिष्ठा अभि विदुष कविः सन नभो न रूपं जरिमा मिनाति पुरा तस्या अभिशस्तेरधीहि |||
verses.transliteration: mā no aghne sakhyā pitryāṇi pra marṣiṣṭhā abhi viduṣ kaviḥ san nabho na rūpaṃ jarimā mināti purā tasyā abhiśasteradhīhi

translations.griffith: O Agni, break not our ancestral friendship, Sage as thou art, endowed with deepest knowledge.  Old age, like gathering cloud, impairs the body: before that evil be come nigh protect me.

verses.sanskrit: नि काव्या वेधसः शश्वतस कर्हस्ते दधानो नर्या पुरूणि अग्निर्भुवद रयिपती रयीणां सत्रा चक्राणो अम्र्तानि विश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: ni kāvyā vedhasaḥ śaśvatas karhaste dadhāno naryā purūṇi aghnirbhuvad rayipatī rayīṇāṃ satrā cakrāṇo amṛtāni viśvā

translations.griffith: THOUGH holding many gifts for men, he humbleth the higher powers of each wise ordainer.  Agni is now the treasure-lord of treasures, for ever granting all immortal bounties.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे वत्सं परि षन्तं न विन्दन्निछन्तो विश्वे अम्र्ता अमूराः शरमयुवः पदव्यो धियन्धास्तस्थुः पदे परमेचार्वग्नेः |||
verses.transliteration: asme vatsaṃ pari ṣantaṃ na vindannichanto viśve amṛtā amūrāḥ śramayuvaḥ padavyo dhiyandhāstasthuḥ pade paramecārvaghneḥ

translations.griffith: The Gods infallible all searching found not him, the dear Babe who still is round about us.  Worn weary, following his track, devoted, they reached the lovely highest home of Agni.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो यदग्ने शरदस्त्वामिच्छुचिं घर्तेन शुचयः सपर्यान नामानि चिद दधिरे यज्ञियान्यसूदयन्त तन्वः सुजाताः |||
verses.transliteration: tisro yadaghne śaradastvāmicchuciṃ ghṛtena śucayaḥ saparyān nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyānyasūdayanta tanvaḥ sujātāḥ

translations.griffith: Because with holy oil the pure Ones, Agni, served thee the very pure three autumn seasons,  Therefore they won them holy names for worship, and nobly born they dignified their bodies.

verses.sanskrit: आ रोदसी बर्हती वेविदानाः पर रुद्रिया जभ्रिरे यज्ञियासः विदन मर्तो नेमधिता चिकित्वानग्निं पदे परमे तस्थिवांसम |||
verses.transliteration: ā rodasī bṛhatī vevidānāḥ pra rudriyā jabhrire yajñiyāsaḥ vidan marto nemadhitā cikitvānaghniṃ pade parame tasthivāṃsam

translations.griffith: Making them known to spacious earth and heaven, the holy Ones revealed the powers of Rudra.  The mortal band, discerning in the distance, found Agni standing in the loftiest station.

verses.sanskrit: संजानाना उप सीदन्नभिज्ञु पत्नीवन्तो नमस्यं नमस्यन रिरिक्वांसस्तन्वः कर्ण्वत सवाः सखा सख्युर्निमिषिरक्षमाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃjānānā upa sīdannabhijñu patnīvanto namasyaṃ namasyan ririkvāṃsastanvaḥ kṛṇvata svāḥ sakhā sakhyurnimiṣirakṣamāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Nigh they approached, one-minded, with their spouses, kneeling to him adorable paid worship.  Friend finding in his own friend's eye protection, they made their own the bodies which they chastened.

verses.sanskrit: तरिः सप्त यद गुह्यानि तवे इत पदाविदन निहिता यज्ञियासः तेभी रक्षन्ते अम्र्तं सजोषाः पशूञ्च सथातॄञ्चरथं च पाहि |||
verses.transliteration: triḥ sapta yad ghuhyāni tve it padāvidan nihitā yajñiyāsaḥ tebhī rakṣante amṛtaṃ sajoṣāḥ paśūñca sthātṝñcarathaṃ ca pāhi

translations.griffith: Soon as the holy beings had discovered the thrice-seven mystic things contained within thee,  With these, one-minded, they preserve the Amṛta: guard thou the life of all their plants and cattle.

verses.sanskrit: विद्वानग्ने वयुनानि कषितीनां वयानुषक छुरुधो जीवसेधाः अन्तर्विद्वानध्वनो देवयानानतन्द्रो दूतो अभवो हविर्वाट |||
verses.transliteration: vidvānaghne vayunāni kṣitīnāṃ vyānuṣak churudho jīvasedhāḥ antarvidvānadhvano devayānānatandro dūto abhavo havirvāṭ

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, knower of men's works, hast sent us good food in constant course for our subsistence:  Thou deeply skilled in paths of Gods becamest an envoy never wearied, offering-bearer.

verses.sanskrit: सवाध्यो दिव आ सप्त यह्वी रायो दुरो वय रतज्ञा अजानन विदद गव्यं सरमा दर्ळ्हमूर्वं येना नु कं मानुषीभोजते विट |||
verses.transliteration: svādhyo diva ā sapta yahvī rāyo duro vy ṛtajñā ajānan vidad ghavyaṃ saramā dṛḷhamūrvaṃ yenā nu kaṃ mānuṣībhojate viṭ

translations.griffith: Knowing the Law, the seven strong floods from heaven, full of good thought, discerned the doors of riches.  Saramā found the cattle's firm-built prison whereby the race of man is still supported.

verses.sanskrit: आ ये विश्वा सवपत्यानि तस्थुः कर्ण्वानासो अम्र्तत्वाय गातुम मह्ना महद्भिः पर्थिवी वि तस्थे माता पुत्रैरदितिर्धायसे वेः |||
verses.transliteration: ā ye viśvā svapatyāni tasthuḥ kṛṇvānāso amṛtatvāya ghātum mahnā mahadbhiḥ pṛthivī vi tasthe mātā putrairaditirdhāyase veḥ

translations.griffith: They who approached all noble operations making a path that leads to life immortal,  To be the Bird's support, the spacious mother, Aditi, and her great Sons stood in power.

verses.sanskrit: अधि सरियं नि दधुश्चारुमस्मिन दिवो यदक्षी अम्र्ता अक्र्ण्वन अध कषरन्ति सिन्धवो न सर्ष्टाः पर नी चीरग्नेरुषीरजानन |||
verses.transliteration: adhi sriyaṃ ni dadhuścārumasmin divo yadakṣī amṛtā akṛṇvan adha kṣaranti sindhavo na sṛṣṭāḥ pra nī cīraghnearuṣīrajānan

translations.griffith: When Gods immortal made both eyes of heaven, they gave to him the gift of beauteous glory.  Now they flow forth like rivers set in motion: they knew the Red Steeds coming down, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: रयिर्न यः पित्र्वित्तो वयोधाः सुप्रणीतिश्चिकितुषो नशासुः सयोनाशीरतिथिर्न परीणानो होतेव सद्म विधतो वि तारीत |||
verses.transliteration: rayirna yaḥ pitṛvitto vayodhāḥ supraṇītiścikituṣo naśāsuḥ syonāśīratithirna prīṇāno hoteva sadma vidhato vi tārīt

translations.griffith: HE who gives food, like patrimonial riches and guides aright like some wise man's instruction,  Loved like a guest who lies in pleasant lodging,—may he, as Priest, prosper his servant's dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: देवो न यः सविता सत्यमन्मा करत्वा निपाति वर्जनानि विश्वा पुरुप्रशस्तो अमतिर्न सत्य आत्मेव शेवो दिधिषाय्यो भूत |||
verses.transliteration: devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā kratvā nipāti vṛjanāni viśvā purupraśasto amatirna satya ātmeva śevo didhiṣāyyo bhūt

translations.griffith: He who like Savitar the God, true-minded protecteth with his power. all acts of vigour,  Truthful, like splendour, glorified by many, like breath joy-giving,—all must strive to win him.

verses.sanskrit: देवो न यः पर्थिवीं विश्वधाया उपक्षेति हितमित्रो न राजा पुरःसदः शर्मसदो न वीरा अनवद्या पतिजुष्टेव नारी |||
verses.transliteration: devo na yaḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyā upakṣeti hitamitro na rājā puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā anavadyā patijuṣṭeva nārī

translations.griffith: He who on earth dwells like a king surrounded by faithful friends, like a God all-sustaining,  Like heroes who preside, who sit in safety: like as a blameless dame dear to her husband.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा नरो दम आ नित्यमिद्धमग्ने सचन्त कषितिषु धरुवासु अधि दयुम्नं नि दधुर्भूर्यस्मिन भवा विश्वायुर्धरुणो रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā naro dama ā nityamiddhamaghne sacanta kṣitiṣu dhruvāsu adhi dyumnaṃ ni dadhurbhūryasmin bhavā viśvāyurdharuṇo rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Thee, such, in settlements secure, O Agni, our men serve ever kindled in each dwelling.  On him have they laid splendour in abundance: dear to all men, bearer be he of riches.

verses.sanskrit: वि पर्क्षो अग्ने मघवानो अश्युर्वि सूरयो ददतो विश्वमायुः सनेम वाजं समिथेष्वर्यो भागं देवेषु शरवसेदधानाः |||
verses.transliteration: vi pṛkṣo aghne maghavāno aśyurvi sūrayo dadato viśvamāyuḥ sanema vājaṃ samitheṣvaryo bhāghaṃ deveṣu śravasedadhānāḥ

translations.griffith: May thy rich worshippers win food, O Agni, and princes gain long life who bring oblation.  May we get booty from our foe in battle, presenting to the Gods their share for glory.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य हि धेनवो वावशानाः समदूध्नीः पीपयन्त दयुभक्ताः परावतः सुमतिं भिक्षमाणा वि सिन्धवः समया सस्रुरद्रिम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya hi dhenavo vāvaśānāḥ smadūdhnīḥ pīpayanta dyubhaktāḥ parāvataḥ sumatiṃ bhikṣamāṇā vi sindhavaḥ samayā sasruradrim

translations.griffith: The cows of holy law, sent us by Heaven, have swelled with laden udders, loudly lowing;  Soliciting his favour, from a distance the rivers to the rock have flowed together.

verses.sanskrit: तवे अग्ने सुमतिं भिक्षमाणा दिवि शरवो दधिरे यज्ञियासः नक्ता च चक्रुरुषसा विरूपे कर्ष्णं च वर्णमरुणं च सं धुः |||
verses.transliteration: tve aghne sumatiṃ bhikṣamāṇā divi śravo dadhire yajñiyāsaḥ naktā ca cakruruṣasā virūpe kṛṣṇaṃ ca varṇamaruṇaṃ ca saṃ dhuḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, with thee, soliciting thy favour, the holy Ones have gained glory in heaven.  They made the Night and Dawn of different colours, and set the black and purple hues together.

verses.sanskrit: यान राये मर्तान सुषूदो अग्ने ते सयाम मघवानो वयं च छायेव विश्वं भुवनं सिसक्ष्यापप्रिवान रोदसी अन्तरिक्षम |||
verses.transliteration: yān rāye martān suṣūdo aghne te syāma maghavāno vayaṃ ca chāyeva viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ sisakṣyāpaprivān rodasī antarikṣam

translations.griffith: May we and those who worship be the mortals whom thou, O Agni, leadest on to riches.  Thou hast filled earth and heaven and air's mid-region, and followest the whole world like a shadow.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वद्भिरग्ने अर्वतो नर्भिर्नॄन वीरैर्वीरान वनुयामा तवोताः ईशानासः पित्र्वित्तस्य रायो वि सूरयः शतहिमा नो अश्युः |||
verses.transliteration: arvadbhiraghne arvato nṛbhirnṝn vīrairvīrān vanuyāmā tvotāḥ īśānāsaḥ pitṛvittasya rāyo vi sūrayaḥ śatahimā no aśyuḥ

translations.griffith: Aided by thee, O Agni, may we conquer steeds with steeds, men with men, heroes with heroes,  Lords of the wealth transmitted by our fathers: and may our princes live a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit: एता ते अग्न उचथानि वेधो जुष्टानि सन्तु मनसे हर्दे च शकेम रायः सुधुरो यमं ते.अधि शरवो देवभक्तं दधानाः |||
verses.transliteration: etā te aghna ucathāni vedho juṣṭāni santu manase hṛde ca śakema rāyaḥ sudhuro yamaṃ te.adhi śravo devabhaktaṃ dadhānāḥ

translations.griffith: May these our hymns of praise, Agni, Ordainer, be pleasant to thee in thy heart and spirit.  May we have power to hold thy steeds of riches, laying on thee the God-sent gift of glory.

verses.sanskrit: उपप्रयन्तो अध्वरं मन्त्रं वोचेमाग्नये आरे अस्मे च शर्ण्वते |||
verses.transliteration: upaprayanto adhvaraṃ mantraṃ vocemāghnaye āre asme ca śṛṇvate

translations.griffith: As forth to sacrifice we go, a hymn to a hymn let us say,  Who hears us even when afar;

verses.sanskrit: यः सनीहितीषु पूर्व्यः संजग्मानासु कर्ष्टिषु अरक्षद दाशुषे गयम |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ snīhitīṣu pūrvyaḥ saṃjaghmānāsu kṛṣṭiṣu arakṣad dāśuṣe ghayam

translations.griffith: Who, from of old, in carnage, when the people gathered, hath preserved  His household for the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: उत बरुवन्तु जन्तव उदग्निर्व्र्त्रहाजनि धनंजयो रणे-रणे |||
verses.transliteration: uta bruvantu jantava udaghnirvṛtrahājani dhanaṃjayo raṇe-raṇe

translations.griffith: And let men say, Agni is born, e’en he who slayeth Vṛtra, he  Who winneth wealth in every fight.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य दूतो असि कषये वेषि हव्यानि वीतये दस्मत कर्णोष्यध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: yasya dūto asi kṣaye veṣi havyāni vītaye dasmat kṛṇoṣyadhvaram

translations.griffith: Him in whose house an envoy thou lovest to taste his offered gifts,  And strengthenest his sacrifice,

verses.sanskrit: तमित सुहव्यमङगिरः सुदेवं सहसो यहो जना आहुः सुबर्हिषम |||
verses.transliteration: tamit suhavyamaṅghiraḥ sudevaṃ sahaso yaho janā āhuḥ subarhiṣam

translations.griffith: Him, Aṅgiras, thou Son of Strength, all men call happy in his God,  His offerings, and his sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: आ च वहासि तानिह देवानुप परशस्तये हव्या सुश्चन्द्र वीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā ca vahāsi tāniha devānupa praśastaye havyā suścandra vītaye

translations.griffith: Hitherward shalt thou bring these Gods to our laudation and to taste.  These offered gifts, fair-shining One.

verses.sanskrit: न योरुपब्दिरश्व्यः शर्ण्वे रथस्य कच्चन यदग्नेयासि दूत्यम |||
verses.transliteration: na yorupabdiraśvyaḥ śṛṇve rathasya kaccana yadaghneyāsi dūtyam

translations.griffith: When, Agni, on thine embassage thou goest not a sound is heard of steed or straining of thy car.

verses.sanskrit: तवोतो वाज्यह्रयो.अभि पूर्वस्मादपरः पर दाश्वानग्ने अस्थात |||
verses.transliteration: tvoto vājyahrayo.abhi pūrvasmādaparaḥ pra dāśvānaghne asthāt

translations.griffith: Aided by thee uninjured, strong, one after other, goes he forth:  Agni, the offerer forward steps.

verses.sanskrit: उत दयुमत सुवीर्यं बर्हदग्ने विवाससि देवेभ्यो देव दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: uta dyumat suvīryaṃ bṛhadaghne vivāsasi devebhyo deva dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: And splendid strength, heroic, high, Agni, thou grantest from the Gods,  Thou God, to him who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit: जुषस्व सप्रथस्तमं वचो देवप्सरस्तमम हव्या जुह्वानासनि |||
verses.transliteration: juṣasva saprathastamaṃ vaco devapsarastamam havyā juhvānaāsani

translations.griffith: ACCEPT our loudest-sounding hymn, food most delightful to the Gods,  Pouring our offerings in thy mouth.

verses.sanskrit: अथा ते अङगिरस्तमाग्ने वेधस्तम परियम वोचेम बरह्म सानसि |||
verses.transliteration: athā te aṅghirastamāghne vedhastama priyam vocema brahma sānasi

translations.griffith: Now, Agni, will we say to thee, O wisest and best Aṅgiras,  Our precious, much-availing prayer.

verses.sanskrit: कस्ते जामिर्जनानामग्ने को दाश्वध्वरः को ह कस्मिन्नसि शरितः |||
verses.transliteration: kaste jāmirjanānāmaghne ko dāśvadhvaraḥ ko ha kasminnasi śritaḥ

translations.griffith: Who, Agni, is thy kin, of men? who is thy worthy worshipper?  On whom dependent? who art thou?

verses.sanskrit: तवं जामिर्जनानामग्ने मित्रो असि परियः सखा सखिभ्य ईड्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ jāmirjanānāmaghne mitro asi priyaḥ sakhā sakhibhya īḍyaḥ

translations.griffith: The kinsman, Agni, of mankind, their well beloved Friend art thou,  A Friend whom friends may supplicate.

verses.sanskrit: यजा नो मित्रावरुणा यजा देवान रतं बर्हत अग्ने यक्षिस्वं दमम |||
verses.transliteration: yajā no mitrāvaruṇā yajā devān ṛtaṃ bṛhat aghne yakṣisvaṃ damam

translations.griffith: Bring to us Mitra, Varuṇa, bring the Gods to mighty sacrifice.  Bring them, O Agni, to thine home.

verses.sanskrit: का त उपेतिर्मनसो वराय भुवदग्ने शन्तमा का मनीषा को वा यज्ञैः परि दक्षं त आप केन वा ते मनसादाशेम |||
verses.transliteration: kā ta upetirmanaso varāya bhuvadaghne śantamā kā manīṣā ko vā yajñaiḥ pari dakṣaṃ ta āpa kena vā te manasādāśema

translations.griffith: How may the mind draw nigh to please thee, Agni? What hymn of praise shall bring us greatest blessing?  Or who hath gained thy power by sacrifices? or with what mind shall we bring thee oblations?

verses.sanskrit: एह्यग्न इह होता नि षीदादब्धः सु पुरेता भवा नः अवतां तवा रोदसी विश्वमिन्वे यजा महे सौमनसाय देवान |||
verses.transliteration: ehyaghna iha hotā ni ṣīdādabdhaḥ su puraetā bhavā naḥ avatāṃ tvā rodasī viśvaminve yajā mahe saumanasāya devān

translations.griffith: Come hither, Agni; sit thee down as Hotar; be thou who never wast deceived our leader.  May Heaven and Earth, the all-pervading, love thee: worship the Gods to win for us their favour.

verses.sanskrit: पर सु विश्वान रक्षसो धक्ष्यग्ने भवा यज्ञानामभिशस्तिपावा अथा वह सोमपतिं हरिभ्यामातिथ्यमस्मै चक्र्मा सुदाव्ने |||
verses.transliteration: pra su viśvān rakṣaso dhakṣyaghne bhavā yajñānāmabhiśastipāvā athā vaha somapatiṃ haribhyāmātithyamasmai cakṛmā sudāvne

translations.griffith: Burn thou up all the Rākṣasas, O Agni; ward thou off curses from our sacrifices.  Bring hither with his Bays the Lord of Soma: here is glad welcome for the Bounteous Giver.

verses.sanskrit: परजावता वचसा वह्निरासा च हुवे नि च सत्सीह देवैः वेषि होत्रमुत पोत्रं यजत्र बोधि परयन्तर्जनितर्वसूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: prajāvatā vacasā vahnirāsā ca huve ni ca satsīha devaiḥ veṣi hotramuta potraṃ yajatra bodhi prayantarjanitarvasūnām

translations.griffith: Thou Priest with lip and voice that bring us children hast been invoked. Here with the Gods be seated.  Thine is the task of Cleanser and Presenter: waken us, Wealth-bestower and Producer.

verses.sanskrit: यथा विप्रस्य मनुषो हविर्भिर्देवानयजः कविभिः कविः सन एवा होतः सत्यतर तवमद्याग्ने मन्द्रया जुह्वा यजस्व |||
verses.transliteration: yathā viprasya manuṣo havirbhirdevānayajaḥ kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san evā hotaḥ satyatara tvamadyāghne mandrayā juhvā yajasva

translations.griffith: As with oblations of the priestly Manus thou worshippedst the Gods, a Sage with sages,  So now, O truthfullest Invoker Agni, worship this day with joy-bestowing ladle.

verses.sanskrit: कथा दाशेमाग्नये कास्मै देवजुष्टोच्यते भामिने गीः यो मर्त्येष्वम्र्त रतावा होता यजिष्ठ इत कर्णोति देवान |||
verses.transliteration: kathā dāśemāghnaye kāsmai devajuṣṭocyate bhāmine ghīḥ yo martyeṣvamṛta ṛtāvā hotā yajiṣṭha it kṛṇoti devān

translations.griffith: How shall we pay oblation unto Agni? What hymn, Godloved, is said to him refulgent?  Who, deathless, true to Law, mid men a herald, bringeth the Gods as best of sacrificers?

verses.sanskrit: यो अध्वरेषु शन्तम रतावा होता तमू नमोभिरा कर्णुध्वम अग्निर्यद वेर्मर्ताय देवान स चा बोधाति मनसायजाति |||
verses.transliteration: yo adhvareṣu śantama ṛtāvā hotā tamū namobhirā kṛṇudhvam aghniryad vermartāya devān sa cā bodhāti manasāyajāti

translations.griffith: Bring him with reverence hither, most propitious in sacrifices, true to Law, the herald;  For Agni, when he seeks the Gods for mortals, knows them full well and worships them in spirit.

verses.sanskrit: स हि करतुः स मर्यः स साधुर्मित्रो न भूदद्भुतस्य रथीः तं मेधेषु परथमं देवयन्तीर्विश उप बरुवते दस्ममारीः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi kratuḥ sa maryaḥ sa sādhurmitro na bhūdadbhutasya rathīḥ taṃ medheṣu prathamaṃ devayantīrviśa upa bruvate dasmamārīḥ

translations.griffith: For he is mental power, a man, and perfect; he is the bringer, friend-like, of the wondrous.  The pious Āryan tribes at sacrifices address them first to him who doeth marvels.

verses.sanskrit: स नो नर्णां नर्तमो रिशाद अग्निर्गिरो.अवसा वेतु धीतिम तना च ये मघवानः शविष्ठ वाजप्रसूता इषयन्तमन्म |||
verses.transliteration: sa no nṛṇāṃ nṛtamo riśāda aghnirghiro.avasā vetu dhītim tanā ca ye maghavānaḥ śaviṣṭha vājaprasūtā iṣayantamanma

translations.griffith: May Agni, foe-destroyer, manliest Hero, accept with love our hymns and our devotion.  So may the liberal lords whose strength is strongest, urged by their riches, stir our thoughts with vigour.

verses.sanskrit: एवाग्निर्गोतमेभिर्र्तावा विप्रेभिरस्तोष्ट जातवेदाः स एषु दयुम्नं पीपयत स वाजं स पुष्टिं याति जोषमा चिकित्वान |||
verses.transliteration: evāghnirghotamebhirṛtāvā viprebhirastoṣṭa jātavedāḥ sa eṣu dyumnaṃ pīpayat sa vājaṃ sa puṣṭiṃ yāti joṣamā cikitvān

translations.griffith: Thus Agni Jātavedas, true to Order, hath by the priestly Gotamas been lauded.  May he augment in them splendour and vigour: observant, as he lists, he gathers increase.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा गोतमा गिरा जातवेदो विचर्षणे दयुम्नैरभि पर णोनुमः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā ghotamā ghirā jātavedo vicarṣaṇe dyumnairabhi pra ṇonumaḥ

translations.griffith: O JĀTAVEDAS, keen and swift, we Gotamas with sacred song exalt thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा गोतमो गिरा रायस्कामो दुवस्यति दयुम्नैरभि पर णोनुमः |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā ghotamo ghirā rāyaskāmo duvasyati dyumnairabhi pra ṇonumaḥ

translations.griffith: Thee, as thou art, desiring wealth Gotama worships with his song:  We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा वाजसातममङगिरस्वद धवामहे दयुम्नैरभि पर णोनुमः |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā vājasātamamaṅghirasvad dhavāmahe dyumnairabhi pra ṇonumaḥ

translations.griffith: As such, like Aṅgiras we call on thee best winner of the spoil:  We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा वर्त्रहन्तमं यो दस्यून्रवधूनुषे दयुम्नैरभि पर णोनुमः |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā vṛtrahantamaṃ yo dasyūnravadhūnuṣe dyumnairabhi pra ṇonumaḥ

translations.griffith: Thee, best of Vṛtra-slayers, thee who shakest off our Dasyu foes:  We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit: अवोचाम रहूगणा अग्नये मधुमद वचः दयुम्नैरभि पर णोनुमः |||
verses.transliteration: avocāma rahūghaṇā aghnaye madhumad vacaḥ dyumnairabhi pra ṇonumaḥ

translations.griffith: A pleasant song to Agni we, sons of Rahūgaṅa, have sung:  We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यकेशो रजसो विसारे.अहिर्धुनिर्वात इव धरजीमान शुचिभ्राजा उषसो नवेदा यशस्वतीरपस्युवो न सत्याः |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyakeśo rajaso visāre.ahirdhunirvāta iva dhrajīmān śucibhrājā uṣaso navedā yaśasvatīrapasyuvo na satyāḥ

translations.griffith: HE in mid-air's expanse hath golden tresses; a raging serpent, like the rushing tempest:  Purely refulgent, knowing well the morning; like honourable dames, true, active workers.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते सुपर्णा अमिनन्तमेवैः कर्ष्णो नोनाव वर्षभो यदीदम शिवाभिर्न समयमानाभिरागात पतन्ति मिहः सतनयन्त्यभ्रा |||
verses.transliteration: ā te suparṇā aminantamevaiḥ kṛṣṇo nonāva vṛṣabho yadīdam śivābhirna smayamānābhirāghāt patanti mihaḥ stanayantyabhrā

translations.griffith: Thy well-winged flashes strengthen in their manner, when the black Bull hath bellowed round about us.  With drops that bless and seem to smile he cometh: the waters fall, the clouds utter their thunder.

verses.sanskrit: यदीं रतस्य पयसा पियानो नयन्न्र्तस्य पथिभी रजिष्ठैः अर्यमा मित्रो वरुनः परिज्मा तवचं पर्ञ्चन्त्युपरस्य योनौ |||
