verses.transliteration: yadīṃ ṛtasya payasā piyāno nayannṛtasya pathibhī rajiṣṭhaiḥ aryamā mitro varunaḥ parijmā tvacaṃ pṛñcantyuparasya yonau

translations.griffith: When he comes streaming with the milk of worship, conducting by directest paths of Order  Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, Parijman fill the hide full where lies the nether press-stone.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने वाजस्य गोमत ईशानः सहसो यहो अस्मे धेहि जातवेदो महि शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne vājasya ghomata īśānaḥ sahaso yaho asme dhehi jātavedo mahi śravaḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, thou who art the lord of wealth in kine, thou Son of Strength,  Vouchsafe to us, O Jātavedas, high renown.

verses.sanskrit: स इधनो वसुष कविरग्निरीळेन्यो गिरा रेवदस्मभ्यम्पुर्वणीक दीदिहि |||
verses.transliteration: sa idhano vasuṣ kaviraghnirīḷenyo ghirā revadasmabhyampurvaṇīka dīdihi

translations.griffith: He, Agni, kindled, good and wise, must be exalted in our song:  Shine, thou of many forms, shine radiantly on us.

verses.sanskrit: कषपो राजन्नुत तमनाग्ने वस्तोरुतोषसः स तिग्मजम्भ रक्षसो दह परति |||
verses.transliteration: kṣapo rājannuta tmanāghne vastorutoṣasaḥ sa tighmajambha rakṣaso daha prati

translations.griffith: O Agni, shining of thyself by night and when the morning breaks,  Burn, thou whose teeth are sharp, against the Rākṣasas.

verses.sanskrit: अवा नो अग्न ऊतिभिर्गायत्रस्य परभर्मणि विश्वासु धीषु वन्द्य |||
verses.transliteration: avā no aghna ūtibhirghāyatrasya prabharmaṇi viśvāsu dhīṣu vandya

translations.griffith: Adorable in all our rites, favour us, Agni, with thine aid,  When the great hymn is chanted forth.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो अग्ने रयिं भर सत्रासाहं वरेण्यम विश्वासु पर्त्सुदुष्टरम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no aghne rayiṃ bhara satrāsāhaṃ vareṇyam viśvāsu pṛtsuduṣṭaram

translations.griffith: Bring to us ever-conquering wealth, wealth, Agni, worthy of our choice,  In all our frays invincible.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो अग्ने सुचेतुना रयिं विश्वायुपोषसम मार्डीकं धेहि जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: ā no aghne sucetunā rayiṃ viśvāyupoṣasam mārḍīkaṃ dhehi jīvase

translations.griffith: Give us, O Agni, through thy grace wealth that supporteth all our life,  Thy favour so that we may live.

verses.sanskrit: पर पूतास्तिग्मशोचिषे वाचो गोतमाग्नये भरस्व सुम्नयुर्गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: pra pūtāstighmaśociṣe vāco ghotamāghnaye bharasva sumnayurghiraḥ

translations.griffith: O Gotama, desiring bliss present thy songs composed with care  To Agni of the pointed flames.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो अग्ने.अभिदासत्यन्ति दूरे पदीष्ट सः अस्माकमिद वर्धे भव |||
verses.transliteration: yo no aghne.abhidāsatyanti dūre padīṣṭa saḥ asmākamid vṛdhe bhava

translations.griffith: May the man fall, O Agni, who near or afar assaileth us:  Do thou increase and prosper us.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्राक्षो विचर्षणिरग्नी रक्षांसि सेधति होता गर्णीत उक्थ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sahasrākṣo vicarṣaṇiraghnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati hotā ghṛṇīta ukthyaḥ

translations.griffith: Keen and swift Agni, thousand-eyed, chaseth the Rākṣasas afar:  He singeth, herald meet for lauds.

verses.sanskrit: इत्था हि सोम इन मदे बरह्मा चकार वर्धनम शविष्ठ वज्रिन्नोजसा पर्थिव्या निः शशा अहिमर्चन्ननु सवराज्यम |||
verses.transliteration: itthā hi soma in made brahmā cakāra vardhanam śaviṣṭha vajrinnojasā pṛthivyā niḥ śaśā ahimarcannanu svarājyam

translations.griffith: THUS in the Soma, in wild joy the Brahman hath exalted thee:  Thou, mightiest thunder-armed, hast driven by force the Dragon from the earth, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: स तवामदद वर्षा मदः सोमः शयेनाभ्र्तः सुतः येना वृत्रं निरद्भ्यो जघन्थ वज्रिन्नोजसार्चन्ननु स्वराज्यम् |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvāmadad vṛṣā madaḥ somaḥ śyenābhṛtaḥ sutaḥ yenā vṛtraṃ niradbhyo jaghantha vajrinnojasārcannanu svarājyam

translations.griffith: The mighty flowing Soma-draught, brought by the Hawk, hath gladdened thee,  That in thy strength, O Thunderer, thou hast struck down Vṛtra from the floods, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: परेह्यभीहि धर्ष्णुहि न ते वज्रो नि यंसते इन्द्र नृम्णं हि ते शवो हनो वृत्रं जया अपोऽर्चन्ननु स्वराज्यम् |||
verses.transliteration: prehyabhīhi dhṛṣṇuhi na te vajro ni yaṃsate indra nṛmṇaṃ hi te śavo hano vṛtraṃ jayā apo'rcannanu svarājyam

translations.griffith: Go forward, meet the foe, be bold; thy bolt of thunder is not checked.  Manliness, Indra, is thy might: stay Vṛtra, make the waters thine, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: निरिन्द्र भूम्या अधि वर्त्रं जघन्थ निर्दिवः सृजा मरुत्वतीरव जीवधन्या इमा अपोऽर्चन्ननु स्वराज्यम् |||
verses.transliteration: nirindra bhūmyā adhi vṛtraṃ jaghantha nirdivaḥ sṛjā marutvatīrava jīvadhanyā imā apo'rcannanu svarājyam

translations.griffith: Thou smotest Vṛtra from the earth, smotest him, Indra, from the sky.  Let these life-fostering waters flow attended by the Marut host, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो वर्त्रस्य दोधतः सानुं वज्रेण हीळितः अभिक्रम्याव जिघ्नतेऽपः सर्माय चोदयन्नर्चन्ननु स्वराज्यम् |||
verses.transliteration: indro vṛtrasya dodhataḥ sānuṃ vajreṇa hīḷitaḥ abhikramyāva jighnate'paḥ sarmāya codayannarcannanu svarājyam

translations.griffith: The wrathful Indra with his bolt of thunder rushing on the foe,  Smote fierce on trembling Vṛtra's back, and loosed the waters free to run, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: अधि सानौ नि जिघ्नते वज्रेण शतपर्वणा मन्दान इन्द्रो अन्धसः सखिभ्यो गातुमिछत्यर्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: adhi sānau ni jighnate vajreṇa śataparvaṇā mandāna indro andhasaḥ sakhibhyo ghātumichatyarcann...

translations.griffith: With hundred-jointed thunderbolt Indra hath struck him on the back,  And, while rejoicing in the juice, seeketh prosperity for friends, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र तुभ्यमिदद्रिवो.अनुत्तं वज्रिन वीर्यम यद ध तयम्मायिनं मर्गं तमु तवं माययावधीरर्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: indra tubhyamidadrivo.anuttaṃ vajrin vīryam yad dha tyammāyinaṃ mṛghaṃ tamu tvaṃ māyayāvadhīrarcann...

translations.griffith: Indra, unconquered might is thine, Thunderer, Caster of the Stone;  For thou with thy surpassing power smotest to death the guileful beast, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: वि ते वज्रासो अस्थिरन नवतिं नाव्या अनु महत त इन्द्र वीर्यं बाह्वोस्ते बलं हितमर्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: vi te vajrāso asthiran navatiṃ nāvyā anu mahat ta indra vīryaṃ bāhvoste balaṃ hitamarcann...

translations.griffith: Far over ninety spacious floods thy thunderbolts were cast abroad:  Great, Indra, is thy hero might, and strength is seated in thine arms, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रं साकमर्चत परि षटोभत विंशतिः शतैनमन्वनोनवुरिन्द्राय बरह्मोद्यतमर्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: sahasraṃ sākamarcata pari ṣṭobhata viṃśatiḥ śatainamanvanonavurindrāya brahmodyatamarcann...

translations.griffith: Laud him a thousand all at once, shout twenty forth the hymn of praise.  Hundreds have sung aloud to him, to Indra hath the prayer been raised, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो वर्त्रस्य तविषीं निरहन सहसा सहः महत तदस्य पौंस्यं वर्त्रं जघन्वानस्र्जदर्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: indro vṛtrasya taviṣīṃ nirahan sahasā sahaḥ mahat tadasya pauṃsyaṃ vṛtraṃ jaghanvānasṛjadarcann...

translations.griffith: Indra hath smitten down the power of Vṛtra,—might with stronger might.  This was his manly exploit, he slew Vṛtra and let loose the floods, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: इमे चित तव मन्यवे वेपेते भियसा मही यदिन्द्र वज्रिन्नोजसा वर्त्रं मरुत्वानवधीरर्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: ime cit tava manyave vepete bhiyasā mahī yadindra vajrinnojasā vṛtraṃ marutvānavadhīrarcann...

translations.griffith: Yea, even this great Pair of Worlds trembled in terror at thy wrath,  When, Indra, Thunderer, Marut-girt, thou slewest Vṛtra in thy strength, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: न वेपसा न तन्यतेन्द्रं वर्त्रो वि बीभयत अभ्येनं वज्र आयसः सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिरायतार्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: na vepasā na tanyatendraṃ vṛtro vi bībhayat abhyenaṃ vajra āyasaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭirāyatārcann...

translations.griffith: But Vṛtra scared not Indra with his shaking or his thunder roar.  On him that iron thunderbolt fell fiercely with its thousand points, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: यद वर्त्रं तव चशनिं वज्रेण समयोधयः अहिमिन्द्रजिघांसतो दिवि ते बद्बधे शवो.अर्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: yad vṛtraṃ tava caśaniṃ vajreṇa samayodhayaḥ ahimindrajighāṃsato divi te badbadhe śavo.arcann...

translations.griffith: When with the thunder thou didst make thy dart and Vṛtra meet in war,  Thy might, O Indra, fain to slay the Dragon, was set firm in heaven, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: अभिष्टने ते अद्रिवो यत सथा जगच्च रेजते तवष्टा चित तव मन्यव इन्द्र वेविज्यते भियार्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: abhiṣṭane te adrivo yat sthā jaghacca rejate tvaṣṭā cit tava manyava indra vevijyate bhiyārcann...

translations.griffith: When at thy shout, O Thunder-armed, each thing both fixed and moving shook,  E’en Tvaṣṭar trembled at thy wrath and quaked with fear because of thee, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: नहि नु यादधीमसीन्द्रं को वीर्या परः तस्मिन नर्म्णमुत करतुं देवा ओजांसि सं दधुरर्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: nahi nu yādadhīmasīndraṃ ko vīryā paraḥ tasmin nṛmṇamuta kratuṃ devā ojāṃsi saṃ dadhurarcann...

translations.griffith: There is not, in our knowledge, one who passeth Indra in his strength:  In him the Deities have stored manliness, insight, power and might, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: यमथर्व मनुष पिता दध्यं धियमत्नत तस्मिन बरह्माणि पुर्वथेन्द्र उक्था समग्मतार्चन्न... |||
verses.transliteration: yamatharva manuṣ pitā dadhyaṃ dhiyamatnata tasmin brahmāṇi purvathendra ukthā samaghmatārcann...

translations.griffith: Still as of old, whatever rite Atharvan, Manus sire of all,  Dadhyach performed, their prayer and praise united in that Indra meet, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो मदाय वाव्र्धे शवसे वर्त्रहा नर्भिः तमिन महत्स्वाजिषूतेमर्भे हवामहे स वाजेषु पर नो.अविषत |||
verses.transliteration: indro madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ tamin mahatsvājiṣūtemarbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra no.aviṣat

translations.griffith: THE men have lifted Indra up, the Vṛtra slayer, to joy and strength:  Him, verily, we invocate in battles whether great or small: be he our aid in deeds of might.

verses.sanskrit: असि हि वीर सेन्यो.असि भूरि पराददिः असि दभ्रस्य चिद्व्र्धो यजमानाय शिक्षसि सुन्वते भूरि ते वसु |||
verses.transliteration: asi hi vīra senyo.asi bhūri parādadiḥ asi dabhrasya cidvṛdho yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu

translations.griffith: Thou, Hero, art a warrior, thou art giver of abundant spoil.  Strengthening e’en the feeble, thou aidest the sacrificer, thou givest the offerer ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit: यदुदीरत आजयो धर्ष्णवे धीयते धना युक्ष्वा मदच्युता हरी कं हनः कं वसौ दधो.अस्मानिन्द्र वसौ दधः |||
verses.transliteration: yadudīrata ājayo dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā yukṣvā madacyutā harī kaṃ hanaḥ kaṃ vasau dadho.asmānindra vasau dadhaḥ

translations.griffith: When war and battles are on foot, booty is laid before the bold.  Yoke thou thy wildly-rushing Bays. Whom wilt thou slay and whom enrich? Do thou, O Indra, make us rich.

verses.sanskrit: करत्वामहाननुष्वधं भीम आ वाव्र्धे शवः शरियर्ष्व उपाकयोर्नि शिप्री हरिवान दधे हस्तयोर्वज्रमायसम |||
verses.transliteration: kratvāmahānanuṣvadhaṃ bhīma ā vāvṛdhe śavaḥ śriyaṛṣva upākayorni śiprī harivān dadhe hastayorvajramāyasam

translations.griffith: Mighty through wisdom, as he lists, terrible, he hath waxed in strength.  Lord of Bay Steeds, strong-jawed, sublime, he in joined hands for glory's sake hath grasped his iron thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit: आ पप्रौ पार्थिवं रजो बद्बधे रोचना दिवि न तवावानिन्द्र कश्चन न जातो न जनिष्यते.अति विश्वं ववक्षिथ |||
verses.transliteration: ā paprau pārthivaṃ rajo badbadhe rocanā divi na tvāvānindra kaścana na jāto na janiṣyate.ati viśvaṃ vavakṣitha

translations.griffith: He filled the earthly atmosphere and pressed against the lights in heaven.  None like thee ever hath been born, none, Indra, will be born like thee. Thou hast waxed mighty over all.

verses.sanskrit: यो अर्यो मर्तभोजनं पराददाति दाशुषे इन्द्रो अस्मभ्यंशिक्षतु वि भजा भूरि ते वसु भक्षीय तव राधसः |||
verses.transliteration: yo aryo martabhojanaṃ parādadāti dāśuṣe indro asmabhyaṃśikṣatu vi bhajā bhūri te vasu bhakṣīya tava rādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: May he who to the offerer gives the foeman's man-sustaining food,  May Indra lend his aid to us. Deal forth—abundant is thy wealth—that in thy bounty I may share.

verses.sanskrit: मदे-मदे हि नो ददिर्यूथा गवां रजुक्रतुः सं गर्भायपुरू शतोभयाहस्त्या वसु शिशीहि राय आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: made-made hi no dadiryūthā ghavāṃ ṛjukratuḥ saṃ ghṛbhāyapurū śatobhayāhastyā vasu śiśīhi rāya ā bhara

translations.griffith: He, righteous-hearted, at each time of rapture gives us herds of kine.  Gather in both thy hands for us treasures of many hundred sorts. Sharpen thou us, and bring us wealth.

verses.sanskrit: मादयस्व सुते सचा शवसे शूर राधसे विद्मा हि तवापुरूवसुमुप कामान सस्र्ज्महे.अथा नो.अविता भव |||
verses.transliteration: mādayasva sute sacā śavase śūra rādhase vidmā hi tvāpurūvasumupa kāmān sasṛjmahe.athā no.avitā bhava

translations.griffith: Refresh thee, Hero, with the juice outpoured for bounty and for strength.  We know thee Lord of ample store, to thee have sent our hearts' desires: be therefore our Protector thou.

verses.sanskrit: एते त इन्द्र जन्तवो विश्वं पुष्यन्ति वार्यम अन्तर्हि खयोजनानामर्यो वेदो अदाशुषां तेषां नो वेद आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: ete ta indra jantavo viśvaṃ puṣyanti vāryam antarhi khyojanānāmaryo vedo adāśuṣāṃ teṣāṃ no veda ā bhara

translations.griffith: These people, Indra, keep for thee all that is worthy of thy choice.  Discover thou, as Lord, the wealth of men who offer up no gifts: bring thou to us this wealth of theirs.

verses.sanskrit: उपो षु शर्णुही गिरो मघवन मातथा इव यदा नः सून्र्तावतः कर आदर्थयास इद योजा नविन्द्र ते हरी |||
verses.transliteration: upo ṣu śṛṇuhī ghiro maghavan mātathā iva yadā naḥ sūnṛtāvataḥ kara ādarthayāsa id yojā nvindra te harī

translations.griffith: GRACIOUSLY listen to our songs, Maghavan, be not negligent.  As thou hast made us full of joy and lettest us solicit thee, now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षन्नमीमदन्त हयव परिया अधूषत अस्तोषत सवभानवो विप्रा नविष्ठया मती योजा ... |||
verses.transliteration: akṣannamīmadanta hyava priyā adhūṣata astoṣata svabhānavo viprā naviṣṭhayā matī yojā ...

translations.griffith: Well have they eaten and rejoiced; the friends have risen and passed away.  The sages luminous in themselves have. praised thee with their latest hymn. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit: सुसन्द्र्शं तवा वयं मघवन वन्दिषीमहि पर नूनं पूर्णवन्धुर सतुतो याहि वशाननु योजा ... |||
verses.transliteration: susandṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavan vandiṣīmahi pra nūnaṃ pūrṇavandhura stuto yāhi vaśānanu yojā ...

translations.griffith: Maghavan, we will reverence thee who art so fair to look upon.  Thus praised, according to our wish come now with richly laden car. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit: स घा तं वर्षणं रथमधि तिष्ठाति गोविदम यःपात्रं हारियोजनं पूर्णमिन्द्र चिकेतति योजा ... |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghā taṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rathamadhi tiṣṭhāti ghovidam yaḥpātraṃ hāriyojanaṃ pūrṇamindra ciketati yojā ...

translations.griffith: He will in very truth ascend the powerful car that finds the kine,  Who thinks upon the well-filled bowl, the Tawny Coursers' harnesser. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit: युक्तस्ते अस्तु दक्षिण उत सव्यः शतक्रतो ||
verses.transliteration: yuktaste astu dakṣiṇa uta savyaḥ śatakrato

translations.griffith: Let, Lord of Hundred Powers, thy Steeds be harnessed on the right and left.  Therewith in rapture of the juice, draw near to thy beloved Spouse. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit: तेन जायामुप परियां मन्दानो याह्यन्धसो योजा ... ||
verses.transliteration: tena jāyāmupa priyāṃ mandāno yāhyandhaso yojā ...

translations.griffith: With holy prayer I yoke thy long-maned pair of Bays: come hitherward; thou holdest them in both thy hands.  The stirring draughts of juice outpoured have made thee glad: thou, Thunderer, hast rejoiced with Pūṣan and thy Spouse.

verses.sanskrit: युनज्मि ते बरह्मणा केशिना हरी उप पर याहि दधिषे गभस्त्योः उत तवा सुतासो रभसा अमन्दिषुः पूषण्वान वज्रिन समु पत्न्यामदः |||
verses.transliteration: yunajmi te brahmaṇā keśinā harī upa pra yāhi dadhiṣe ghabhastyoḥ ut tvā sutāso rabhasā amandiṣuḥ pūṣaṇvān vajrin samu patnyāmadaḥ

translations.griffith: Missing Line From Griffith

verses.sanskrit: अश्वावति परथमो गोषु गछति सुप्रावीरिन्द्र मर्त्यस्तवोतिभिः तमित पर्णक्षि वसुना भवीयसा सिन्धुमापो यथाभितो विचेतसः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāvati prathamo ghoṣu ghachati suprāvīrindra martyastavotibhiḥ tamit pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhumāpo yathābhito vicetasaḥ

translations.griffith: INDRA, the mortal man well guarded by thine aid goes foremost in the wealth of horses and of kine.  With amplest wealth thou fillest him, as round about the waters clearly seen afar fill Sindhu full.

verses.sanskrit: आपो न देवीरुप यन्ति होत्रियमवः पश्यन्ति विततं यथा रजः पराचैर्देवासः पर णयन्ति देवयुं बरह्मप्रियं जोषयन्ते वरा इव |||
verses.transliteration: āpo na devīrupa yanti hotriyamavaḥ paśyanti vitataṃ yathā rajaḥ prācairdevāsaḥ pra ṇayanti devayuṃ brahmapriyaṃ joṣayante varā iva

translations.griffith: The heavenly Waters come not nigh the priestly bowl: they but look down and see how far mid-air is spread:  The Deities conduct the pious man to them: like suitors they delight in him who loveth prayer.

verses.sanskrit: अधि दवयोरदधा उक्थ्यं वचो यतस्रुचा मिथुना या सपर्यतः असंयत्तो वरते ते कषेति पुष्यति भद्रा शक्तिर्यजमानाय सुन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: adhi dvayoradadhā ukthyaṃ vaco yatasrucā mithunā yā saparyataḥ asaṃyatto vrate te kṣeti puṣyati bhadrā śaktiryajamānāya sunvate

translations.griffith: Praiseworthy blessing hast thou laid upon the pair who with uplifted ladle serve thee, man and wife.  Unchecked he dwells and prospers in thy law: thy power brings blessing to the sacrificer pouring gifts.

verses.sanskrit: आदङगिराः परथमं दधिरे वय इद्धाग्नयः शम्या येसुक्र्त्यया सर्वं पणेः समविन्दन्त भोजनमश्वावन्तं गोमन्तमा पशुं नरः |||
verses.transliteration: ādaṅghirāḥ prathamaṃ dadhire vaya iddhāghnayaḥ śamyā yesukṛtyayā sarvaṃ paṇeḥ samavindanta bhojanamaśvāvantaṃ ghomantamā paśuṃ naraḥ

translations.griffith: First the Aṅgirases won themselves vital power, whose fires were kindled through good deeds and sacrifice.  The men together found the Paṇi's hoarded wealth, the cattle, and the wealth in horses and in kine.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञैरथर्वा परथमः पथस्तते ततः सूर्यो वरतपावेन आजनि आ गा आजदुशना काव्यः सचा यमस्य जातमम्र्तं यजामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yajñairatharvā prathamaḥ pathastate tataḥ sūryo vratapāvena ājani ā ghā ājaduśanā kāvyaḥ sacā yamasya jātamamṛtaṃ yajāmahe

translations.griffith: Atharvan first by sacrifices laid the paths then, guardian of the Law, sprang up the loving Sun.  Uśanā Kāvya straightway hither drove the kine. Let us with offerings honour Yama's deathless birth.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हिर्वा यत सवपत्याय वर्ज्यते.अर्को वा शलोकमाघोषतेदिवि गरावा यत्र वदति कारुरुक्थ्यस्तस्येदिन्द्रो अभिपित्वेषु रण्यति |||
verses.transliteration: barhirvā yat svapatyāya vṛjyate.arko vā ślokamāghoṣatedivi ghrāvā yatra vadati kārurukthyastasyedindro abhipitveṣu raṇyati

translations.griffith: When sacred grass is trimmed to aid the auspicious work, or the hymn makes its voice of praise sound to the sky.  Where the stone rings as ’twere a singer skilled in laud,—Indra in truth delights when these come near to him.

verses.sanskrit: असावि सोम इन्द्र ते शविष्ठ धर्ष्णवा गहि आ तवा पर्णक्त्विन्द्रियं रजः सूर्यो न रश्मिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: asāvi soma indra te śaviṣṭha dhṛṣṇavā ghahi ā tvā pṛṇaktvindriyaṃ rajaḥ sūryo na raśmibhiḥ

translations.griffith: The Soma hath been pressed for thee, O Indra; mightiest, bold One, come.  May Indra-vigour fill thee full, as the Sun fills mid-air with rays.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमिद धरी वहतो.अप्रतिध्र्ष्टशवसम रषीणां च सतुतीरुप यज्ञं च मानुषाणाम |||
verses.transliteration: indramid dharī vahato.apratidhṛṣṭaśavasam ṛṣīṇāṃ ca stutīrupa yajñaṃ ca mānuṣāṇām

translations.griffith: His pair of Tawny Coursers bring Indra of unresisted might  Hither to Ṛṣis’ songs of praise and sacrifice performed by men.

verses.sanskrit: आ तिष्ठ वर्त्रहन रथं युक्ता ते बरह्मणा हरी अर्वाचीनं सु ते मनो गरावा कर्णोतु वग्नुना |||
verses.transliteration: ā tiṣṭha vṛtrahan rathaṃ yuktā te brahmaṇā harī arvācīnaṃ su te mano ghrāvā kṛṇotu vaghnunā

translations.griffith: Slayer of Vṛtra, mount thy car; thy Bay Steeds have been yoked by prayer.  May, with its voice, the pressing-stone draw thine attention hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: इममिन्द्र सुतं पिब जयेष्ठममर्त्यं मदम शुक्रस्य तवाभ्यक्षरन धारा रतस्य सादने |||
verses.transliteration: imamindra sutaṃ piba jyeṣṭhamamartyaṃ madam śukrasya tvābhyakṣaran dhārā ṛtasya sādane

translations.griffith: This poured libation, Indra, drink, immortal, gladdening, excellent.  Streams of the bright have flowed to thee here at the seat of holy Law.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय नूनमर्चतोक्थानि च बरवीतन सुता अमत्सुरिन्दवो जयेष्ठं नमस्यता सहः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya nūnamarcatokthāni ca bravītana sutā amatsurindavo jyeṣṭhaṃ namasyatā sahaḥ

translations.griffith: Sing glory now to Indra, say to him your solemn eulogies.  The drops poured forth have made him glad: pay reverence to his might supreme.

verses.sanskrit: नकिष टवद रथीतरो हरी यदिन्द्र यछसे नकिष टवानु मज्मना नकिः सवश्व आनशे |||
verses.transliteration: nakiṣ ṭvad rathītaro harī yadindra yachase nakiṣ ṭvānu majmanā nakiḥ svaśva ānaśe

translations.griffith: When, Indra, thou dost yoke thy Steeds, there is no better charioteer:  None hath surpassed thee in thy might, none with good steeds o’ertaken thee.

verses.sanskrit: य एक इद विदयते वसु मर्ताय दाशुषे ईशानो अप्रतिष्कुत इन्द्रो अङग |||
verses.transliteration: ya eka id vidayate vasu martāya dāśuṣe īśāno apratiṣkuta indro aṅgha

translations.griffith: He who alone bestoweth on mortal man who offereth gifts,  The ruler of resistless power, is Indra, sure.

verses.sanskrit: कदा मर्तमराधसं पदा कषुम्पमिव सफुरत कदा नःशुश्रवद गिर इन्द्रो अङग |||
verses.transliteration: kadā martamarādhasaṃ padā kṣumpamiva sphurat kadā naḥśuśravad ghira indro aṅgha

translations.griffith: When will he trample, like a weed, the man who hath no gift for him?  When, verily, will Indra hear our songs of praise?

verses.sanskrit: यश्चिद धि तवा बहुभ्य आ सुतावानाविवासति उग्रं तत पत्यते शव इन्द्रो अङग |||
verses.transliteration: yaścid dhi tvā bahubhya ā sutāvānāvivāsati ughraṃ tat patyate śava indro aṅgha

translations.griffith: He who with Soma juice prepared amid the many honours thee,—  Verily Indra gains thereby tremendous might.

verses.sanskrit: सवादोरित्था विषूवतो मध्वः पिबन्ति गौर्यः या इन्द्रेण सयावरीर्व्र्ष्णा मदन्ति शोभसे वस्वीरनु सवराज्यम |||
verses.transliteration: svādoritthā viṣūvato madhvaḥ pibanti ghauryaḥ yā indreṇa sayāvarīrvṛṣṇā madanti śobhase vasvīranu svarājyam

translations.griffith: The juice of Soma thus diffused, sweet to the taste, the bright cows drink,  Who for the sake of splendour close to mighty Indra's side rejoice, good in their own supremacy.

verses.sanskrit: ता अस्य पर्शनायुवः सोमं शरीणन्ति पर्श्नयः परिया इन्द्रस्य धेनवो वज्रं हिन्वन्ति सायकं वस्वीर... |||
verses.transliteration: tā asya pṛśanāyuvaḥ somaṃ śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ priyā indrasya dhenavo vajraṃ hinvanti sāyakaṃ vasvīr...

translations.griffith: Craving his touch the dappled kine mingle the Soma with their milk.  The milch-kine dear to Indra send forth his death-dealing thunderbolt, good in their own supremacy.

verses.sanskrit: ता अस्य नमसा सहः सपर्यन्ति परचेतसः वरतान्यस्य सश्चिरे पुरूणि पूर्वचित्तये वस्वीर... |||
verses.transliteration: tā asya namasā sahaḥ saparyanti pracetasaḥ vratānyasya saścire purūṇi pūrvacittaye vasvīr...

translations.griffith: With veneration, passing wise, honouring his victorious might,  They follow close his many laws to win them due preeminence, good in their  own supremacy.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो दधीचो अस्थभिर्व्र्त्राण्यप्रतिष्कुतः जघान नवतीर्नव |||
verses.transliteration: indro dadhīco asthabhirvṛtrāṇyapratiṣkutaḥ jaghāna navatīrnava

translations.griffith: With bones of Dadhyach for his arms, Indra, resistless in attack,  Struck nine-and-ninety Vṛtras dead.

verses.sanskrit: इछन्नश्वस्य यच्छिरः पर्वतेष्वपश्रितम तद विदच्छर्यणावति |||
verses.transliteration: ichannaśvasya yacchiraḥ parvateṣvapaśritam tad vidaccharyaṇāvati

translations.griffith: He, searching for the horse's head, removed among the mountains, found  At Śaryaṇāvān what he sought.

verses.sanskrit: अत्राह गोरमन्वत नाम तवष्टुरपीच्यम इत्था चन्द्रमसो गर्हे |||
verses.transliteration: atrāha ghoramanvata nāma tvaṣṭurapīcyam itthā candramaso ghṛhe

translations.griffith: Then verily they recognized the essential form of Tvaṣṭar's Bull,  Here in the mansion of the Moon.

verses.sanskrit: को अद्य युङकते धुरि गा रतस्य शिमीवतो भामिनो दुर्ह्र्णायून असन्निषून हर्त्स्वसो मयोभून य एषां भर्त्यां रणधत स जीवात |||
verses.transliteration: ko adya yuṅkte dhuri ghā ṛtasya śimīvato bhāmino durhṛṇāyūn asanniṣūn hṛtsvaso mayobhūn ya eṣāṃ bhṛtyāṃ ṛṇadhat sa jīvāt

translations.griffith: Who yokes to-day unto the pole of Order the strong and passionate steers of checkless spirit,  With shaft-armed mouths, heart-piercing, health-bestowing?  Long shall he live who richly pays their service.

verses.sanskrit: क ईषते तुज्यते को बिभाय को मंसते सन्तमिन्द्रं को अन्ति कस्तोकाय क इभायोत राये.अधि बरवत तन्वे को जनाय |||
verses.transliteration: ka īṣate tujyate ko bibhāya ko maṃsate santamindraṃ ko anti kastokāya ka ibhāyota rāye.adhi bravat tanve ko janāya

translations.griffith: Who fleeth forth? who suffereth? who feareth? Who knoweth Indra present, Indra near us?  Who sendeth benediction on his offspring, his household, wealth and person, and the People?

verses.sanskrit: को अग्निमीट्टे हविषा घर्तेन सरुचा यजाता रतुभिर्ध्रुवेभिः कस्मै देवा आ वहानाशु होम को मंसते वीतिहोत्रः सुदेवः |||
verses.transliteration: ko aghnimīṭṭe haviṣā ghṛtena srucā yajātā ṛtubhirdhruvebhiḥ kasmai devā ā vahānāśu homa ko maṃsate vītihotraḥ sudevaḥ

translations.griffith: Who with poured oil and offering honours Agni, with ladle worships at appointed seasons?  To whom to the Gods bring oblation quickly? What offerer, God-favoured, knows him thoroughly?

verses.sanskrit: तवमङग पर शंसिषो देवः शविष्ठ मर्त्यम न तवदन्यो मघवन्नस्ति मर्डितेन्द्र बरवीमि ते वचः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaṅgha pra śaṃsiṣo devaḥ śaviṣṭha martyam na tvadanyo maghavannasti marḍitendra bravīmi te vacaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou as a God, O Mightiest, verily blessest mortal man.  O Maghavan, there is no comforter but thou: Indra, I speak my words to thee.

verses.sanskrit: मा ते राधांसि मा त ऊतयो वसो.अस्मान कदा चना दभन विश्वा च न उपमिमीहि मानुष वसूनि चर्षणिभ्य आ |||
verses.transliteration: mā te rādhāṃsi mā ta ūtayo vaso.asmān kadā canā dabhan viśvā ca na upamimīhi mānuṣa vasūni carṣaṇibhya ā

translations.griffith: Let not thy bounteous gifts, let not thy saving help fail us, good Lord, at any time;  And measure out to us, thou lover of mankind, all riches hitherward from men.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये शुम्भन्ते जनयो न सप्तयो यामन रुद्रस्य सूनवःसुदंससः रोदसी हि मरुतश्चक्रिरे वर्धे मदन्ति वीरा विदथेषु घर्ष्वयः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye śumbhante janayo na saptayo yāman rudrasya sūnavaḥsudaṃsasaḥ rodasī hi marutaścakrire vṛdhe madanti vīrā vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ

translations.griffith: THEY who are glancing forth, like women, on their way, doers of mighty deeds, swift racers, Rudra's Sons,  The Maruts have made heaven and earth increase and grow: in sacrifices they delight, the strong and wild.

verses.sanskrit: त उक्षितासो महिमानमाशत दिवि रुद्रासो अधि चक्रिरे सदः अर्चन्तो अर्कं जनयन्त इन्द्रियमधि शरियो दधिरे पर्श्निमातरः |||
verses.transliteration: ta ukṣitāso mahimānamāśata divi rudrāso adhi cakrire sadaḥ arcanto arkaṃ janayanta indriyamadhi śriyo dadhire pṛśnimātaraḥ

translations.griffith: Grown to their perfect strength greatness have they attained; the Rudras have established their abode in heaven.  Singing their song of praise and generating might, they have put glory on, the Sons whom Pṛśni bare.

verses.sanskrit: गोमातरो यच्छुभयन्ते अञ्जिभिस्तनूषु शुभ्रा दधिरे विरुक्मतः बाधन्ते विश्वमभिमातिनमप वर्त्मान्येषामनु रीयते घर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: ghomātaro yacchubhayante añjibhistanūṣu śubhrā dadhire virukmataḥ bādhante viśvamabhimātinamapa vartmānyeṣāmanu rīyate ghṛtam

translations.griffith: When, Children of the Cow, they shine in bright attire, and on their fair limbs lay their golden ornaments,  They drive away each adversary from their path, and, following their traces, fatness floweth down,

verses.sanskrit: वि ये भराजन्ते सुमखास रष्टिभिः परच्यावयन्तो अच्युताचिदोजसा मनोजुवो यन मरुतो रथेष्वा वर्षव्रातासः पर्षतीरयुग्ध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: vi ye bhrājante sumakhāsa ṛṣṭibhiḥ pracyāvayanto acyutācidojasā manojuvo yan maruto ratheṣvā vṛṣavrātāsaḥ pṛṣatīrayughdhvam

translations.griffith: When, mighty Warriors, ye who glitter with your spears, o’erthrowing with your strength e’en what is ne’er o’erthrown,  When, O ye Maruts, ye the host that send the rain, had harnessed to your cars the thought-fleet spotted deer.

verses.sanskrit: पर यद रथेषु पर्षतीरयुग्ध्वं वाजे अद्रिं मरुतो रंहयन्तः उतारुषस्य वि षयन्ति धाराश्चर्मेवोदभिर्व्युन्दन्ति भूम |||
verses.transliteration: pra yad ratheṣu pṛṣatīrayughdhvaṃ vāje adriṃ maruto raṃhayantaḥ utāruṣasya vi ṣyanti dhārāścarmevodabhirvyundanti bhūma

translations.griffith: When ye have harnessed to your cars the spotted deer, urging the thunderbolt, O Maruts, to the fray,  Forth rush the torrents of the dark red stormy cloud, and moisten, like a skin, the earth with water-floods.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो वहन्तु सप्तयो रघुष्यदो रघुपत्वानः पर जिगात बाहुभिः सीदता बर्हिरुरु वः सदस कर्तं मादयध्वं मरुतो मध्वो अन्धसः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo vahantu saptayo raghuṣyado raghupatvānaḥ pra jighāta bāhubhiḥ sīdatā barhiruru vaḥ sadas kṛtaṃ mādayadhvaṃ maruto madhvo andhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Let your swift-gliding coursers bear you hitherward with their fleet pinions. Come ye forward with your arms.  Sit on the grass; a wide seat hath been made for you: delight yourselves, O Maruts, in the pleasant food.

verses.sanskrit: ते.अवर्धन्त सवतवसो महित्वना नाकं तस्थुरुरु चक्रिरे सदः विष्णुर्यद धावद वर्षणं मदच्युतं वयो न सीदन्नधि बर्हिषि परिये |||
verses.transliteration: te.avardhanta svatavaso mahitvanā nākaṃ tasthururu cakrire sadaḥ viṣṇuryad dhāvad vṛṣaṇaṃ madacyutaṃ vayo na sīdannadhi barhiṣi priye

translations.griffith: Strong in their native strength to greatness have they grown, stepped to the firmament and made their dwelling wide.  When Viṣṇu saved the Soma bringing wild delight, the Maruts sate like birds on their dear holy grass.

verses.sanskrit: शूरा इवेद युयुधयो न जग्मयः शरवस्यवो न पर्तनासु येतिरे भयन्ते विश्वा भुवना मरुद्भ्यो राजान इव तवेषसन्द्र्शो नरः |||
verses.transliteration: śūrā ived yuyudhayo na jaghmayaḥ śravasyavo na pṛtanāsu yetire bhayante viśvā bhuvanā marudbhyo rājāna iva tveṣasandṛśo naraḥ

translations.griffith: In sooth like heroes fain for fight they rush about, like combatants fame-seeking have they striven in war.  Before the Maruts every creature is afraid: the men are like to Kings, terrible to behold.

verses.sanskrit: तवष्टा यद वज्रं सुक्र्तं हिरण्ययं सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिं सवपा अवर्तयत धत्त इन्द्रो नर्यपांसि कर्तवे.अहन वर्त्रं निरपामौब्जदर्णवम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṣṭā yad vajraṃ sukṛtaṃ hiraṇyayaṃ sahasrabhṛṣṭiṃ svapā avartayat dhatta indro naryapāṃsi kartave.ahan vṛtraṃ nirapāmaubjadarṇavam

translations.griffith: When Tvaṣṭar deft of hand had turned the thunderbolt, golden, with thousand edges, fashioned more skilfully,  Indra received it to perform heroic deeds. Vṛtra he slew, and forced the flood of water forth.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वं नुनुद्रे.अवतं त ओजसा दद्र्हाणं चिद बिभिदुर्विपर्वतम धमन्तो वाणं मरुतः सुदानवो मदे सोमस्य रण्यानि चक्रिरे |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvaṃ nunudre.avataṃ ta ojasā dadṛhāṇaṃ cid bibhidurviparvatam dhamanto vāṇaṃ marutaḥ sudānavo made somasya raṇyāni cakrire

translations.griffith: They with their vigorous strength pushed the well up on high, and clove the cloud in twain though it was passing strong.  The Maruts, bounteous Givers, sending forth their voice, in the wild joy of Soma wrought their glorious deeds.

verses.sanskrit: जिह्मं नुनुद्रे.अवतं तया दिशासिञ्चन्नुत्सं गोतमाय तर्ष्णजे आ गछन्तीमवसा चित्रभानवः कामं विप्रस्यतर्पयन्त धामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: jihmaṃ nunudre.avataṃ tayā diśāsiñcannutsaṃ ghotamāya tṛṣṇaje ā ghachantīmavasā citrabhānavaḥ kāmaṃ viprasyatarpayanta dhāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: They drave the cloud transverse directed hitherward, and poured the fountain forth for thirsting Gotama.  Shining with varied light they come to him with help: they with their might fulfilled the longing of the sage.

verses.sanskrit: या वः शर्म शशमानाय सन्ति तरिधातूनि दाशुषे यछताधि अस्मभ्यं तानि मरुतो वि यन्त रयिं नो धत्त वर्षणः सुवीरम |||
verses.transliteration: yā vaḥ śarma śaśamānāya santi tridhātūni dāśuṣe yachatādhi asmabhyaṃ tāni maruto vi yanta rayiṃ no dhatta vṛṣaṇaḥ suvīram

translations.griffith: The shelters which ye have for him who lauds you, bestow them threefold on the man who offers.  Extend the same boons unto us, ye Maruts. Give us, O Heroes, wealth with noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit: मरुतो यस्य हि कषये पाथा दिवो विमहसः स सुगोपातमो जनः |||
verses.transliteration: maruto yasya hi kṣaye pāthā divo vimahasaḥ sa sughopātamo janaḥ

translations.griffith: THE best of guardians hath that man within whose dwelling place ye drink,  O Maruts, giants of the sky.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञैर्वा यज्ञवाहसो विप्रस्य वा मतीनाम मरुतः शर्णुता हवम |||
verses.transliteration: yajñairvā yajñavāhaso viprasya vā matīnām marutaḥ śṛṇutā havam

translations.griffith: Honoured with sacrifice or with the worship of the sages’ hymns,  O Maruts, listen to the call.

verses.sanskrit: उत वा यस्य वाजिनो.अनु विप्रमतक्षत स गन्ता गोमतिव्रजे |||
verses.transliteration: uta vā yasya vājino.anu vipramatakṣata sa ghantā ghomativraje

translations.griffith: Yea, the strong man to whom ye have vouchsafed to give a sage, shall move  Into a stable rich in kine.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य वीरस्य बर्हिषि सुतः सोमो दिविष्टिषु उक्थं मदश्च शस्यते |||
verses.transliteration: asya vīrasya barhiṣi sutaḥ somo diviṣṭiṣu ukthaṃ madaśca śasyate

translations.griffith: Upon this hero's sacred grass Soma is poured in daily rites:  Praise and delight are sung aloud.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य शरोषन्त्वा भुवो विश्वा यश्चर्षणीरभि सूरं चित सस्रुषीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: asya śroṣantvā bhuvo viśvā yaścarṣaṇīrabhi sūraṃ cit sasruṣīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Let the strong Maruts hear him, him surpassing all men: strength be his  That reaches even to the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वीभिर्हि ददाशिम शरद्भिर्मरुतो वयम अवोभिश्चर्षणीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvībhirhi dadāśima śaradbhirmaruto vayam avobhiścarṣaṇīnām

translations.griffith: For, through the swift Gods’ loving help, in many an autumn, Maruts, we  Have offered up our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: सुभगः स परयज्यवो मरुतो अस्तु मर्त्यः यस्य परयांसिपर्षथ |||
verses.transliteration: subhaghaḥ sa prayajyavo maruto astu martyaḥ yasya prayāṃsiparṣatha

translations.griffith: Fortunate shall that mortal be, O Maruts most adorable,  Whose offerings ye bear away.

verses.sanskrit: शशमानस्य वा नरः सवेदस्य सत्यशवसः विदा कामस्यवेनतः |||
verses.transliteration: śaśamānasya vā naraḥ svedasya satyaśavasaḥ vidā kāmasyavenataḥ

translations.griffith: O Heroes truly strong, ye know the toil of him who sings your praise,  The heart's desire of him who loves.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं तत सत्यशवस आविष कर्त महित्वना विध्यता विद्युता रक्षः |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ tat satyaśavasa āviṣ karta mahitvanā vidhyatā vidyutā rakṣaḥ

translations.griffith: O ye of true strength, make this thing manifest by your greatness: strike  The demon with your thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit: गूहता गुह्यं तमो वि यात विश्वमत्रिणम जयोतिष कर्ता यदुश्मसि |||
verses.transliteration: ghūhatā ghuhyaṃ tamo vi yāta viśvamatriṇam jyotiṣ kartā yaduśmasi

translations.griffith: Conceal the horrid darkness, drive far from us each devouring fiend.  Create the light for which we long.

verses.sanskrit: परत्वक्षसः परतवसो विरप्शिनो.अनानता अविथुरा रजीषिणः जुष्टतमासो नर्तमासो अञ्जिभिर्व्यानज्रे के चिदुस्रा इव सत्र्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: pratvakṣasaḥ pratavaso virapśino.anānatā avithurā ṛjīṣiṇaḥ juṣṭatamāso nṛtamāso añjibhirvyānajre ke cidusrā iva stṛbhiḥ

translations.griffith: LOUD Singers, never humbled, active, full of strength, immovable, impetuous, manliest, best-beloved,  They have displayed themselves with glittering ornaments, a few in number only, like the heavens with stars.

verses.sanskrit: उपह्वरेषु यदचिध्वं ययिं वय इव मरुतः केन चित पथा शचोतन्ति कोशा उप वो रथेष्वा घर्तमुक्षता मधुवर्णमर्चते |||
verses.transliteration: upahvareṣu yadacidhvaṃ yayiṃ vaya iva marutaḥ kena cit pathā ścotanti kośā upa vo ratheṣvā ghṛtamukṣatā madhuvarṇamarcate

translations.griffith: When, Maruts, on the steeps ye pile the moving cloud, ye are like birds on whatsoever path it be.  Clouds everywhere shed forth the rain upon your cars. Drop fatness, honey-hued, for him who sings your praise.

verses.sanskrit: परैषामज्मेषु विथुरेव रेजते भूमिर्यामेषु यद ध युञ्जते शुभे ते करीळयो धुनयो भराजद्र्ष्टयः सवयं महित्वं पनयन्त धूतयः |||
verses.transliteration: praiṣāmajmeṣu vithureva rejate bhūmiryāmeṣu yad dha yuñjate śubhe te krīḷayo dhunayo bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ svayaṃ mahitvaṃ panayanta dhūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Earth at their racings trembles as if weak and worn, when on their ways they yoke their cars for victory.  They, sportive, loudly roaring, armed with glittering spears, shakers of all, themselves admire their mightiness.

verses.sanskrit: स हि सवस्र्त पर्षदश्वो युवा गणो.अया ईशानस्तविषीभिराव्र्तः असि सत्य रणयावानेद्यो.अस्या धियः पराविताथा वर्षा गणः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi svasṛt pṛṣadaśvo yuvā ghaṇo.ayā īśānastaviṣībhirāvṛtaḥ asi satya ṛṇayāvānedyo.asyā dhiyaḥ prāvitāthā vṛṣā ghaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Self-moving is that youthful band, with spotted steeds; thus it hath lordly sway, endued with power and might.  Truthful art thou, and blameless, searcher out of sin: so thou, Strong Host, wilt be protector of this prayer.

verses.sanskrit: पितुः परत्नस्य जन्मना वदामसि सोमस्य जिह्वा पर जिगाति चक्षसा यदीमिन्द्रं शम्य रक्वाण आशतादिन नामानि यज्ञियानि दधिरे |||
verses.transliteration: pituḥ pratnasya janmanā vadāmasi somasya jihvā pra jighāti cakṣasā yadīmindraṃ śamy ṛkvāṇa āśatādin nāmāni yajñiyāni dadhire

translations.griffith: We speak by our descent from our primeval Sire; our tongue, when we behold the Soma, stirs itself.  When, shouting, they had joined Indra in toil of fight, then only they obtained their sacrificial names.

verses.sanskrit: शरियसे कं भानुभिः सं मिमिक्षिरे ते रश्मिभिस्त रक्वभिः सुखादयः ते वाशीमन्त इष्मिणो अभीरवो विद्रे परियस्य मारुतस्य धाम्नः |||
verses.transliteration: śriyase kaṃ bhānubhiḥ saṃ mimikṣire te raśmibhista ṛkvabhiḥ sukhādayaḥ te vāśīmanta iṣmiṇo abhīravo vidre priyasya mārutasya dhāmnaḥ

translations.griffith: Splendours they gained for glory, they who wear bright rings; rays they obtained, and men to celebrate their praise.  Armed with their swords, impetuous and fearing naught, they have possessed the Maruts’ own beloved home.

verses.sanskrit: आ विद्युन्मद्भिर्मरुतः सवर्कै रथेभिर्यात रष्टिमद्भिरश्वपर्णैः आ वर्षिष्ठया न इषा वयो न पप्तता सुमायाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vidyunmadbhirmarutaḥ svarkai rathebhiryāta ṛṣṭimadbhiraśvaparṇaiḥ ā varṣiṣṭhayā na iṣā vayo na paptatā sumāyāḥ

translations.griffith: COME hither, Maruts, on your lightning laden cars, sounding with sweet songs, armed with lances, winged with steeds.  Fly unto us with noblest food, like birds, O ye of mighty power.

verses.sanskrit: ते.अरुणेभिर्वरमा पिशङगैः शुभे कं यान्ति रथतूर्भिरश्वैः रुक्मो न चित्रः सवधितीवान पव्या रथस्य जङघनन्त भूम |||
verses.transliteration: te.aruṇebhirvaramā piśaṅghaiḥ śubhe kaṃ yānti rathatūrbhiraśvaiḥ rukmo na citraḥ svadhitīvān pavyā rathasya jaṅghananta bhūma

translations.griffith: With their red-hued or, haply, tawny coursers which speed their chariots on, they come for glory.  Brilliant like gold is he who holds the thunder. Earth have they smitten with the chariot's felly.

verses.sanskrit: शरिये कं वो अधि तनूषु वाशीर्मेधा वना न कर्णवन्त ऊर्ध्वा युष्मभ्यं कं मरुतः सुजातास्तुविद्युम्नासो धनयन्ते अद्रिम |||
verses.transliteration: śriye kaṃ vo adhi tanūṣu vāśīrmedhā vanā na kṛṇavanta ūrdhvā yuṣmabhyaṃ kaṃ marutaḥ sujātāstuvidyumnāso dhanayante adrim

translations.griffith: For beauty ye have swords upon your bodies. As they stir woods so may they stir our spirits.  For your sake, O ye Maruts very mighty and well-born, have they set the stone, in motion.

verses.sanskrit: अहानि गर्ध्राः पर्या व आगुरिमां धियं वार्कार्यांच देवीम बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तो गोतमासो अर्कैरूर्ध्वं नुनुद्रौत्सधिं पिबध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: ahāni ghṛdhrāḥ paryā va āghurimāṃ dhiyaṃ vārkāryāṃca devīm brahma kṛṇvanto ghotamāso arkairūrdhvaṃ nunudrautsadhiṃ pibadhyai

translations.griffith: The days went round you and came back O yearners, back, to this prayer and to this solemn worship.  The Gotamas making their prayer with singing have pushed the well's lid up to drink the water.

verses.sanskrit: एतत तयन न योजनमचेति सस्वर्ह यन मरुतो गोतमो वः पश्यन हिरण्यचक्रानयोदंष्ट्रान विधावतो वराहून |||
verses.transliteration: etat tyan na yojanamaceti sasvarha yan maruto ghotamo vaḥ paśyan hiraṇyacakrānayodaṃṣṭrān vidhāvato varāhūn

translations.griffith: No hymn way ever known like this aforetime which Gotama sang forth for you, O Maruts,  What time upon your golden wheels he saw you, wild boars rushing about with tusks of iron.

verses.sanskrit: एषा सया वो मरुतो.अनुभर्त्री परति षटोभति वाघतो न वाणी अस्तोभयद वर्थासामनु सवधां गभस्त्योः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā syā vo maruto.anubhartrī prati ṣṭobhati vāghato na vāṇī astobhayad vṛthāsāmanu svadhāṃ ghabhastyoḥ

translations.griffith: To you this freshening draught of Soma rusheth, O Maruts, like the voice of one who prayeth.  It rusheth freely from our hands as these libations wont to flow.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो भद्राः करतवो कष्यन्तु विश्वतो.अदब्धासो अपरीतास उद्भिदः देवा नो यथा सदमिद वर्धे असन्नप्रायुवो रक्षितारो दिवे-दिवे |||
verses.transliteration: ā no bhadrāḥ kratavo kṣyantu viśvato.adabdhāso aparītāsa udbhidaḥ devā no yathā sadamid vṛdhe asannaprāyuvo rakṣitāro dive-dive

translations.griffith: MAY powers auspicious come to us from every side, never deceived, unhindered, and victorious,  That the Gods ever may be with us for our gain, our guardians day by day unceasing in their care.

verses.sanskrit: देवानां भद्रा सुमतिर्र्जूयतां देवानां रातिरभि नोनि वर्तताम देवानां सख्यमुप सेदिमा वयं देवा न आयुः पर तिरन्तु जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: devānāṃ bhadrā sumatirṛjūyatāṃ devānāṃ rātirabhi noni vartatām devānāṃ sakhyamupa sedimā vayaṃ devā na āyuḥ pra tirantu jīvase

translations.griffith: May the auspicious favour of the Gods be ours, on us descend the bounty of the righteous Gods.  The friendship of the Gods have we devoutly sought: so may the Gods extend our life that we may live.

verses.sanskrit: तान पूर्वया निविदा हूमहे वयं भगं मित्रमदितिं दक्षमस्रिधम अर्यमणं वरुणं सोममश्विना सरस्वतीनः सुभगा मयस करत |||
verses.transliteration: tān pūrvayā nividā hūmahe vayaṃ bhaghaṃ mitramaditiṃ dakṣamasridham aryamaṇaṃ varuṇaṃ somamaśvinā sarasvatīnaḥ subhaghā mayas karat

translations.griffith: We call them hither with a hymn of olden time, Bhaga, the friendly Dakṣa, Mitra, Aditi,  Aryaman, Varuṇa, Soma, the Aśvins. May Sarasvatī, auspicious, grant felicity.

verses.sanskrit: तन नो वातो मयोभु वातु भेषजं तन माता पर्थिवी तत्पिता दयौः तद गरावाणः सोमसुतो मयोभुवस्तदश्विना शर्णुतं धिष्ण्या युवम |||
verses.transliteration: tan no vāto mayobhu vātu bheṣajaṃ tan mātā pṛthivī tatpitā dyauḥ tad ghrāvāṇaḥ somasuto mayobhuvastadaśvinā śṛṇutaṃ dhiṣṇyā yuvam

translations.griffith: May the Wind waft to us that pleasant medicine, may Earth our Mother give it, and our Father Heaven,  And the joy-giving stones that press the Soma's juice. Aśvins, may ye, for whom our spirits long, hear this.

verses.sanskrit: तमीशानं जगतस्तस्थुषस पतिं धियंजिन्वमवसे हूमहे वयम पूषा नो यथा वेदसामसद वर्धे रक्षिता पायुरदब्धः सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: tamīśānaṃ jaghatastasthuṣas patiṃ dhiyaṃjinvamavase hūmahe vayam pūṣā no yathā vedasāmasad vṛdhe rakṣitā pāyuradabdhaḥ svastaye

translations.griffith: Him we invoke for aid who reigns supreme, the Lord of all that stands or moves, inspirer of the soul,  That Pūṣan may promote the increase of our wealth, our keeper and our guard infallible for our good.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्ति न इन्द्रो वर्द्धश्रवाः सवस्ति नः पुषा विश्ववेदाः सवस्ति नस्तार्क्ष्यो अरिष्टनेमिः सवस्ति नो बर्हस्पतिर्दधातु |||
verses.transliteration: svasti na indro vṛddhaśravāḥ svasti naḥ puṣā viśvavedāḥ svasti nastārkṣyo ariṣṭanemiḥ svasti no bṛhaspatirdadhātu

translations.griffith: Illustrious far and wide, may Indra prosper us: may Pūṣan prosper us, the Master of all wealth.  May Tārkṣya with uninjured fellies prosper us: Bṛhaspati vouchsafe to us prosperity.

verses.sanskrit: पर्षदश्वा मरुतः पर्श्निमातरः शुभंयावानो विदथेषुजग्मयः अग्निजिह्वा मनवः सूरचक्षसो विश्वे नो देवा अवसा गमन्निह |||
verses.transliteration: pṛṣadaśvā marutaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhaṃyāvāno vidatheṣujaghmayaḥ aghnijihvā manavaḥ sūracakṣaso viśve no devā avasā ghamanniha

translations.griffith: The Maruts, Sons of Pṛśni, borne by spotted steeds, moving in glory, oft visiting holy rites,  Sages whose tongue is Agni, brilliant as the Sun,—hither let all the Gods for our protection come.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रं कर्णेभिः शर्णुयाम देवा भद्रं पश्येमाक्षभिर्यजत्राः सथिरैरङगैस्तुष्टुवांसस्तनूभिर्व्यशेमदेवहितं यदायुः |||
verses.transliteration: bhadraṃ karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devā bhadraṃ paśyemākṣabhiryajatrāḥ sthirairaṅghaistuṣṭuvāṃsastanūbhirvyaśemadevahitaṃ yadāyuḥ

translations.griffith: Gods, may we with our ears listen to what is good, and with our eyes see what is good, ye Holy Ones.  With limbs and bodies firm may we extolling you attain the term of life appointed by the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: शतमिन नु शरदो अन्ति देवा यत्रा नश्चक्रा जरसं तनूनाम पुत्रासो यत्र पितरो भवन्ति मा नो मध्या रीरिषतायुर्गन्तोः |||
verses.transliteration: śatamin nu śarado anti devā yatrā naścakrā jarasaṃ tanūnām putrāso yatra pitaro bhavanti mā no madhyā rīriṣatāyurghantoḥ

translations.griffith: A hundred autumns stand before us, O ye Gods, within whose space ye bring our bodies to decay;  Within whose space our sons become fathers in turn. Break ye not in the midst our course of fleeting life.

verses.sanskrit: अदितिर्द्यौरदितिरन्तरिक्षमदितिर्माता स पिता स पुत्रः विश्वे देवा अदितिः पञ्च जना अदितिर्जातमदितिर्जनित्वम |||
verses.transliteration: aditirdyauraditirantarikṣamaditirmātā sa pitā sa putraḥ viśve devā aditiḥ pañca janā aditirjātamaditirjanitvam

translations.griffith: Aditi is the heaven, Aditi is mid-air, Aditi is the Mother and the Sire and Son.  Aditi is all Gods, Aditi five-classed men, Aditi all that hath been born and shall be born.

verses.sanskrit: रजुनीती नो वरुणो मित्रो नयतु विद्वान अर्यमा देवैः सजोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjunītī no varuṇo mitro nayatu vidvān aryamā devaiḥ sajoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: MAY Varuṇa with guidance straight, and Mitra lead us, he who knows,  And Aryaman in accord with Gods.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि वस्वो वसवानास्ते अप्रमूरा महोभिः वरता रक्षन्ते विश्वाहा |||
verses.transliteration: te hi vasvo vasavānāste apramūrā mahobhiḥ vratā rakṣante viśvāhā

translations.griffith: For they are dealers forth of wealth, and, not deluded, with their might  Guard evermore the holy laws.

verses.sanskrit: ते अस्मभ्यं शर्म यंसन्नम्र्ता मर्त्येभ्यः बाधमानाप दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: te asmabhyaṃ śarma yaṃsannamṛtā martyebhyaḥ bādhamānāapa dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Shelter may they vouchsafe to us, Immortal Gods to mortal men,  Chasing our enemies away.

verses.sanskrit: वि नः पथः सुविताय चियन्त्विन्द्रो मरुतः पूषा भगो वन्द्यासः |||
verses.transliteration: vi naḥ pathaḥ suvitāya ciyantvindro marutaḥ pūṣā bhagho vandyāsaḥ

translations.griffith: May they mark out our paths to bliss, Indra, the Maruts, Pūṣan,  and Bhaga, the Gods to be adored.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो धियो गोग्राः पूषन विष्णवेवयावः कर्ता नः सवस्तिमतः |||
verses.transliteration: uta no dhiyo ghoaghrāḥ pūṣan viṣṇavevayāvaḥ kartā naḥ svastimataḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, Pūṣan, Viṣṇu, ye who run your course, enrich our hymns with kine;  Bless us with all prosperity.

verses.sanskrit: मधु वाता रतायते मधु कषरन्ति सिन्धवः माध्वीर्नः सन्त्वोषधीः |||
verses.transliteration: madhu vātā ṛtāyate madhu kṣaranti sindhavaḥ mādhvīrnaḥ santvoṣadhīḥ

translations.griffith: The winds waft sweets, the rivers pour sweets for the man who keeps the Law  So may the plants be sweet for us.

verses.sanskrit: मधु नक्तमुतोषसो मधुमत पार्थिवं रजः मधु दयौरस्तु नः पिता |||
verses.transliteration: madhu naktamutoṣaso madhumat pārthivaṃ rajaḥ madhu dyaurastu naḥ pitā

translations.griffith: Sweet be the night and sweet the dawns, sweet the terrestrial atmosphere;  Sweet be our Father Heaven to us.

verses.sanskrit: मधुमान नो वनस्पतिर्मधुमानस्तु सूर्यः माध्वीर्गावो भवन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: madhumān no vanaspatirmadhumānastu sūryaḥ mādhvīrghāvo bhavantu naḥ

translations.griffith: May the tall tree be full of sweets for us, and full of sweets the Sun:  May our milch-kine be sweet for us.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो मित्रः शं वरुणः शं नो भवत्वर्यमा शं न इन्द्रो बर्हस्पतिः शं नो विष्णुरुरुक्रमः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no mitraḥ śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavatvaryamā śaṃ na indro bṛhaspatiḥ śaṃ no viṣṇururukramaḥ

translations.griffith: Be Mitra gracious unto us, and Varuṇa and Aryaman:  Indra, Bṛhaspati be kind, and Viṣṇu of the mighty stride.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम पर चिकितो मनीषा तवं रजिष्ठमनु नेषि पन्थाम तव परणीती पितरो न इन्दो देवेषु रत्नमभजन्त धीराः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma pra cikito manīṣā tvaṃ rajiṣṭhamanu neṣi panthām tava praṇītī pitaro na indo deveṣu ratnamabhajanta dhīrāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Soma, art preeminent for wisdom; along the straightest path thou art our leader.  Our wise forefathers by thy guidance, Indu, dealt out among the Gods their share of treasure.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम करतुभिः सुभूस्त्वं दक्षैः सुदक्षो विश्ववेदाः तवं वर्षा वर्षत्वेभिर्महित्वा दयुम्नेभिर्द्युम्न्यभवो नर्चक्षाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma kratubhiḥ subhūstvaṃ dakṣaiḥ sudakṣo viśvavedāḥ tvaṃ vṛṣā vṛṣatvebhirmahitvā dyumnebhirdyumnyabhavo nṛcakṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou by thine insight art most wise, O Soma, strong by thine energies and all possessing,  Mighty art thou by all thy powers and greatness, by glories art thou glorious, guide of mortals.

verses.sanskrit: राज्ञो नु ते वरुणस्य वरतानि बर्हद गभीरं तव सोम धाम शुचिष टवमसि परियो न मित्रो दक्षाय्यो अर्यमेवासिसोम |||
verses.transliteration: rājño nu te varuṇasya vratāni bṛhad ghabhīraṃ tava soma dhāma śuciṣ ṭvamasi priyo na mitro dakṣāyyo aryamevāsisoma

translations.griffith: Thine are King Varuṇa's eternal statutes, lofty and deep, O Soma, is thy glory.  All-pure art thou like Mitra the beloved, adorable, like Aryaman, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit: या ते धामानि दिवि या पर्थिव्यां या पर्वतेष्वोषधीष्वप्सु तेभिर्नो विश्वैः सुमना अहेळन राजन सोम परतिहव्या गर्भाय |||
verses.transliteration: yā te dhāmāni divi yā pṛthivyāṃ yā parvateṣvoṣadhīṣvapsu tebhirno viśvaiḥ sumanā aheḷan rājan soma pratihavyā ghṛbhāya

translations.griffith: With all thy glories on the earth, in heaven, on mountains, in the plants, and in the waters,—  With all of these, well-pleased and not in anger, accept, O royal Soma, our oblations.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोमासि सत्पतिस्त्वं राजोत वर्त्रहा तवं भद्रो असि करतुः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ somāsi satpatistvaṃ rājota vṛtrahā tvaṃ bhadro asi kratuḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Soma, art the Lord of heroes, King, yea, Vṛtra-slayer thou:  Thou art auspicious energy.

verses.sanskrit: तवं च सोम नो वशो जीवातुं न मरामहे परियस्तोत्रो वनस्पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ ca soma no vaśo jīvātuṃ na marāmahe priyastotro vanaspatiḥ

translations.griffith: And, Soma, let it be thy wish that we may live and may not die:  Praise-loving Lord of plants art thou.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम महे भगं तवं यून रतायते दक्षं दधासि जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma mahe bhaghaṃ tvaṃ yūna ṛtāyate dakṣaṃ dadhāsi jīvase

translations.griffith: To him who keeps the law, both old and young, thou givest happiness,  And energy that he may live.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नः सोम विश्वतो रक्षा राजन्नघायतः न रिष्येत्त्वावतः सखा |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato rakṣā rājannaghāyataḥ na riṣyettvāvataḥ sakhā

translations.griffith: Guard us, King Soma, on all sides from him who threatens us: never let  The friend of one like thee be harmed.

verses.sanskrit: सोम यास्ते मयोभुव ऊतयः सन्ति दाशुषे ताभिर्नो.अविता भव |||
verses.transliteration: soma yāste mayobhuva ūtayaḥ santi dāśuṣe tābhirno.avitā bhava

translations.griffith: With those delightful aids which thou hast, Soma, for the worshipper,—  Even with those protect thou us.

verses.sanskrit: इमं यज्ञमिदं वचो जुजुषाण उपागहि सोम तवं नोव्र्धे भव |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ yajñamidaṃ vaco jujuṣāṇa upāghahi soma tvaṃ novṛdhe bhava

translations.griffith: Accepting this our sacrifice and this our praise, O Soma, come,  And be thou nigh to prosper us.

verses.sanskrit: सोम गीर्भिष टवा वयं वर्धयामो वचोविदः सुम्र्ळीकोन आ विश |||
verses.transliteration: soma ghīrbhiṣ ṭvā vayaṃ vardhayāmo vacovidaḥ sumṛḷīkona ā viśa

translations.griffith: Well-skilled in speech we magnify thee, Soma, with our sacred songs:  Come thou to us, most gracious One.

verses.sanskrit: गयस्फानो अमीवहा वसुवित पुष्टिवर्धनः सुमित्रः सोमनो भव |||
verses.transliteration: ghayasphāno amīvahā vasuvit puṣṭivardhanaḥ sumitraḥ somano bhava

translations.griffith: Enricher, healer of disease, wealth-finder, prospering our store,  Be, Soma, a good Friend to us.

verses.sanskrit: सोम रारन्धि नो हर्दि गावो न यवसेष्वा मर्य इव सवोक्ये |||
verses.transliteration: soma rārandhi no hṛdi ghāvo na yavaseṣvā marya iva svaokye

translations.griffith: Soma, be happy in our heart, as milch-kine in the grassy meads,  As a young man in his own house.

verses.sanskrit: यः सोम सख्ये तव रारणद देव मर्त्यः तं दक्षः सचते कविः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ soma sakhye tava rāraṇad deva martyaḥ taṃ dakṣaḥ sacate kaviḥ

translations.griffith: O Soma, God, the mortal man who in thy friendship hath delight,  Him doth the mighty Sage befriend.

verses.sanskrit: उरुष्या णो अभिशस्तेः सोम नि पाह्यंहसः सखा सुशेव एधि नः |||
verses.transliteration: uruṣyā ṇo abhiśasteḥ soma ni pāhyaṃhasaḥ sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ

translations.griffith: Save us from slanderous reproach, keep us., O Soma, from distress:  Be unto us a gracious Friend.

verses.sanskrit: आ पयायस्व समेतु ते विश्वतः सोम वर्ष्ण्यम भवा वाजस्य संगथे |||
verses.transliteration: ā pyāyasva sametu te viśvataḥ soma vṛṣṇyam bhavā vājasya saṃghathe

translations.griffith: Soma, wax great. From every side may vigorous powers unite in thee:  Be in the gathering-place of strength.

verses.sanskrit: आ पयायस्व मदिन्तम सोम विश्वेभिरंशुभिः भवा नःसुश्रवस्तमः सखा वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: ā pyāyasva madintama soma viśvebhiraṃśubhiḥ bhavā naḥsuśravastamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe

translations.griffith: Wax, O most gladdening Soma, great through all thy rays of light, and be  A Friend of most illustrious fame to prosper us.

verses.sanskrit: सं ते पयांसि समु यन्तु वाजाः सं वर्ष्ण्यान्यभिमातिषाहः आप्यायमानो अम्र्ताय सोम दिवि शरवांस्युत्तमानि धिष्व |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ te payāṃsi samu yantu vājāḥ saṃ vṛṣṇyānyabhimātiṣāhaḥ āpyāyamāno amṛtāya soma divi śravāṃsyuttamāni dhiṣva

translations.griffith: In thee be juicy nutriments united, and powers and mighty foe-subduing vigour,  Waxing to immortality, O Soma: win highest glories for thyself in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: या ते धामानि हविषा यजन्ति ता ते विश्वा परिभूरस्तुयज्ञम गयस्फानः परतरणः सुवीरो.अवीरहा पर चरा सोम दुर्यान |||
verses.transliteration: yā te dhāmāni haviṣā yajanti tā te viśvā paribhūrastuyajñam ghayasphānaḥ prataraṇaḥ suvīro.avīrahā pra carā soma duryān

translations.griffith: Such of thy glories as with poured oblations men honour, may they all invest our worship.  Wealth-giver, furtherer with troops of heroes, sparing the brave, come, Soma, to our houses.

verses.sanskrit: सोमो धेनुं सोमो अर्वन्तमाशुं सोमो वीरं कर्मण्यं ददाति सादन्यं विदथ्यं सभेयं पित्र्श्रवणं यो ददाशदस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: somo dhenuṃ somo arvantamāśuṃ somo vīraṃ karmaṇyaṃ dadāti sādanyaṃ vidathyaṃ sabheyaṃ pitṛśravaṇaṃ yo dadāśadasmai

translations.griffith: To him who worships Soma gives the milch-cow, a fleet steed and a man of active knowledge,  Skilled in home duties, meet for holy synod, for council meet, a glory to his father.

verses.sanskrit: अषाळ्हं युत्सु पर्तनासु पप्रिं सवर्षामप्सां वर्जनस्यगोपाम भरेषुजां सुक्षितिं सुश्रवसं जयन्तं तवामनु मदेम सोम |||
verses.transliteration: aṣāḷhaṃ yutsu pṛtanāsu papriṃ svarṣāmapsāṃ vṛjanasyaghopām bhareṣujāṃ sukṣitiṃ suśravasaṃ jayantaṃ tvāmanu madema soma

translations.griffith: Invincible in fight, saver in battles, guard of our camp, winner of light and water,  Born amid hymns, well-housed, exceeding famous, victor, in thee will we rejoice, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिमा ओषधीः सोम विश्वास्त्वमपो अजनयस्त्वं गाः तवमा ततन्थोर्वन्तरिक्षं तवं जयोतिषा वि तमो ववर्थ |||
verses.transliteration: tvamimā oṣadhīḥ soma viśvāstvamapo ajanayastvaṃ ghāḥ tvamā tatanthorvantarikṣaṃ tvaṃ jyotiṣā vi tamo vavartha

translations.griffith: These herbs, these milch-kine, and these running waters, all these, O Soma, thou hast generated.  The spacious firmament hast thou expanded, and with the light thou hast dispelled the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: देवेन नो मनसा देव सोम रायो भागं सहसावन्नभि युध्य मा तवा तनदीशिषे वीर्यस्योभयेभ्यः पर चिकित्सा गविष्टौ |||
verses.transliteration: devena no manasā deva soma rāyo bhāghaṃ sahasāvannabhi yudhya mā tvā tanadīśiṣe vīryasyobhayebhyaḥ pra cikitsā ghaviṣṭau

translations.griffith: Do thou, God Soma, with thy Godlike spirit, victorious, win for us a share of riches.  Let none prevent thee: thou art Lord of valour. Provide for both sides in the fray for booty.

verses.sanskrit: एता उ तया उषसः केतुमक्रत पूर्वे अर्धे रजसो भानुमञ्जते निष्क्र्ण्वाना आयुधानीव धर्ष्णवः परति गावोऽरुषीर्यन्ति मातरः |||
verses.transliteration: etā u tyā uṣasaḥ ketumakrata pūrve ardhe rajaso bhānumañjate niṣkṛṇvānā āyudhānīva dhṛṣṇavaḥ prati ghāvo'ruṣīryanti mātaraḥ

translations.griffith: THESE Dawns have raised their banner; in the eastern half of the mid-air they spread abroad their shining light.  Like heroes who prepare their weapons for the war, onward they come bright red in hue, the Mother Cows.

verses.sanskrit: उदपप्तन्नरुणा भानवो वर्था सवायुजो अरुषीर्गा अयुक्सत अक्रन्नुषासो वयुनानि पूर्वथा रुशन्तं भानुमरुषीरशिश्रयुः |||
verses.transliteration: udapaptannaruṇā bhānavo vṛthā svāyujo aruṣīrghā ayuksata akrannuṣāso vayunāni pūrvathā ruśantaṃ bhānumaruṣīraśiśrayuḥ

translations.griffith: Readily have the purple beams of light shot up; the Red Cows have they harnessed, easy to be yoked.  The Dawns have brought distinct perception as before: red-hued, they have attained their fulgent brilliancy.

verses.sanskrit: अर्चन्ति नारीरपसो न विष्टिभिः समानेन योजनेना परावतः इषं वहन्तीः सुक्र्ते सुदानवे विश्वेदह यजमानाय सुन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: arcanti nārīrapaso na viṣṭibhiḥ samānena yojanenā parāvataḥ iṣaṃ vahantīḥ sukṛte sudānave viśvedaha yajamānāya sunvate

translations.griffith: They sing their song like women active in their tasks, along their common path hither from far away,  Bringing refreshment to the liberal devotee, yea, all things to the worshipper who pours the juice.

verses.sanskrit: अधि पेशांसि वपते नर्तूरिवापोर्णुते वक्ष उस्रेव बर्जहम जयोतिर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय कर्ण्वती गावो न वरजं वयुषा आवर्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: adhi peśāṃsi vapate nṛtūrivāporṇute vakṣa usreva barjaham jyotirviśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvatī ghāvo na vrajaṃ vyuṣā āvartamaḥ

translations.griffith: She, like a dancer, puts her broidered garments on: as a cow yields her udder so she bares her breast.  Creating light for all the world of life, the Dawn hath laid the darkness open as the cows their stall.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यर्ची रुशदस्या अदर्शि वि तिष्ठते बाधते कर्ष्णमभ्वम सवरुं न पेशो विदथेष्वञ्जञ्चित्रं दिवो दुहिता भानुमश्रेत |||
verses.transliteration: pratyarcī ruśadasyā adarśi vi tiṣṭhate bādhate kṛṣṇamabhvam svaruṃ na peśo vidatheṣvañjañcitraṃ divo duhitā bhānumaśret

translations.griffith: We have beheld the brightness of her shining; it spreads and drives away the darksome monster.  Like tints that deck the Post at sacrifices, Heaven's Daughter hath attained her wondrous splendour.

verses.sanskrit: अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्योषा उछन्ती वयुना कर्णोति शरिये छन्दो न समयते विभाती सुप्रतीका सौमनसायाजीगः |||
verses.transliteration: atāriṣma tamasas pāramasyoṣā uchantī vayunā kṛṇoti śriye chando na smayate vibhātī supratīkā saumanasāyājīghaḥ

translations.griffith: We have o’erpast the limit of this darkness; Dawn breaking forth again brings clear perception.  She like a flatterer smiles in light for glory, and fair of face hath wakened to rejoice us.

verses.sanskrit: भास्वती नेत्री सून्र्तानां दिव सतवे दुहिता गोतमेभिः परजावतो नर्वतो अश्वबुध्यानुषो गोग्रानुप मासि वाजान |||
verses.transliteration: bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānāṃ diva stave duhitā ghotamebhiḥ prajāvato nṛvato aśvabudhyānuṣo ghoaghrānupa māsi vājān

translations.griffith: The Gotamas have praised Heaven's radiant Daughter, the leader of the charm of pleasant voices.  Dawn, thou conferrest on us strength with offspring and men, conspicuous with kine and horses.

verses.sanskrit: उषस्तमश्यां यशसं सुवीरं दासप्रवर्गं रयिमश्वबुध्यम सुदंससा शरवसा या विभासि वाजप्रसूता सुभगे बर्हन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: uṣastamaśyāṃ yaśasaṃ suvīraṃ dāsapravarghaṃ rayimaśvabudhyam sudaṃsasā śravasā yā vibhāsi vājaprasūtā subhaghe bṛhantam

translations.griffith: O thou who shinest forth in wondrous glory, urged onward by thy strength, auspicious Lady,  Dawn, may I gain that wealth, renowned and ample, in brave sons, troops of slaves, far-famed for horses.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वानि देवी भुवनाभिचक्ष्या परतीची चक्षुरुर्विया वि भाति विश्वं जीवं चरसे बोधयन्ती विश्वस्य वाचमविदन मनायोः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāni devī bhuvanābhicakṣyā pratīcī cakṣururviyā vi bhāti viśvaṃ jīvaṃ carase bodhayantī viśvasya vācamavidan manāyoḥ

translations.griffith: Bending her looks on all the world, the Goddess shines, widely spreading with her bright eye westward.  Waking to motion every living creature, she understands the voice of each adorer.

verses.sanskrit: पुनः-पुनर्जायमाना पुराणी समानं वर्णमभि शुम्भमाना शवघ्नीव कर्त्नुर्विज आमिनाना मर्तस्य देवी जरयन्त्यायुः |||
verses.transliteration: punaḥ-punarjāyamānā purāṇī samānaṃ varṇamabhi śumbhamānā śvaghnīva kṛtnurvija āminānā martasya devī jarayantyāyuḥ

translations.griffith: Ancient of days, again again born newly, decking her beauty with the self-same raiment.  The Goddess wastes away the life of mortals, like a skilled hunter cutting birds in pieces.

verses.sanskrit: वयूर्ण्वती दिवो अन्तानबोध्यप सवसारं सनुतर्युयोति परमिनती मनुष्या युगानि योषा जारस्य चक्षसा वि भाति |||
verses.transliteration: vyūrṇvatī divo antānabodhyapa svasāraṃ sanutaryuyoti praminatī manuṣyā yughāni yoṣā jārasya cakṣasā vi bhāti

translations.griffith: She hath appeared discovering heaven's borders: to the far distance she drives off her Sister.  Diminishing the days of human creatures, the Lady shines with all her lover's splendour.

verses.sanskrit: पशून न चित्रा सुभगा परथाना सिन्धुर्न कषोद उर्विया वयश्वैत अमिनती दैव्यानि वरतानि सूर्यस्य चेति रश्मिभिर्द्र्शाना |||
verses.transliteration: paśūn na citrā subhaghā prathānā sindhurna kṣoda urviyā vyaśvait aminatī daivyāni vratāni sūryasya ceti raśmibhirdṛśānā

translations.griffith: The bright, the blessed One shines forth extending her rays like kine, as a flood rolls his waters.  Never transgressing the divine commandments, she is beheld visible with the sunbeams.

verses.sanskrit: उषस्तच्चित्रमा भरास्मभ्यं वाजिनीवति येन तोकंच तनयं च धामहे |||
verses.transliteration: uṣastaccitramā bharāsmabhyaṃ vājinīvati yena tokaṃca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe

translations.griffith: O Dawn enriched with ample wealth, bestow on us the wondrous gift  Wherewith we may support children and children's sons.

verses.sanskrit: उषो अद्येह गोमत्यश्वावति विभावरि रेवदस्मे वयुछ सून्र्तावति |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo adyeha ghomatyaśvāvati vibhāvari revadasme vyucha sūnṛtāvati

translations.griffith: Thou radiant mover of sweet sounds, with wealth of horses and of kine  Shine thou on us this day, O Dawn auspiciously.

verses.sanskrit: युक्ष्वा हि वाजिनीवत्यश्वानद्यारुणानुषः अथा नोविश्वा सौभगान्या वह |||
verses.transliteration: yukṣvā hi vājinīvatyaśvānadyāruṇānuṣaḥ athā noviśvā saubhaghānyā vaha

translations.griffith: O Dawn enriched with holy rites, yoke to thy car thy purple steeds,  And then bring thou unto us all felicities.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना वर्तिरस्मदा गोमद दस्रा हिरण्यवत अर्वाग रथं समनसा नि यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā vartirasmadā ghomad dasrā hiraṇyavat arvāgh rathaṃ samanasā ni yachatam

translations.griffith: O Aśvins wonderful in act, do ye unanimous direct  Your chariot to our home wealthy in kine and gold.

verses.sanskrit: यावित्था शलोकमा दिवो जयोतिर्जनाय चक्रथुः आ नूर्जं वहतमश्विना युवम |||
verses.transliteration: yāvitthā ślokamā divo jyotirjanāya cakrathuḥ ā naūrjaṃ vahatamaśvinā yuvam

translations.griffith: Ye who brought down the hymn from heaven, a light that giveth light to man,  Do ye, O Aśvins, bring strength hither unto us.

verses.sanskrit: एह देवा मयोभुवा दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी उषर्बुधो वहन्तु सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: eha devā mayobhuvā dasrā hiraṇyavartanī uṣarbudho vahantu somapītaye

translations.griffith: Hither may they who wake at dawn bring, to drink Soma both the Gods  Health-givers Wonder-Workers, borne on paths of gold.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमाविमं सु मे शर्णुतं वर्षणा हवम परति सूक्तानि हर्यतं भवतं दाशुषे मयः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomāvimaṃ su me śṛṇutaṃ vṛṣaṇā havam prati sūktāni haryataṃ bhavataṃ dāśuṣe mayaḥ

translations.griffith: AGNI and Soma, mighty Pair, graciously hearken to my call,  Accept in friendly wise my hymn, and prosper him who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा यो अद्य वामिदं वचः सपर्यति तस्मै धत्तं सुवीर्यं गवां पोषं सवश्व्यम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomā yo adya vāmidaṃ vacaḥ saparyati tasmai dhattaṃ suvīryaṃ ghavāṃ poṣaṃ svaśvyam

translations.griffith: The man who honours you to-day, Agni and Soma, with this hymn,  Bestow on him heroic strength, increase of kine, and noble steeds.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा य आहुतिं यो वां दाशाद धविष्क्र्तिम स परजया सुवीर्यं विश्वमायुर्व्यश्नवत |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomā ya āhutiṃ yo vāṃ dāśād dhaviṣkṛtim sa prajayā suvīryaṃ viśvamāyurvyaśnavat

translations.griffith: The man who offers holy oil and burnt oblations unto you,  Agni and Soma, shall enjoy great strength, with offspring, all his life.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा चेति तद वीर्यं वां यदमुष्णीतमवसं पणिं गाः अवातिरतं बर्सयस्य शेषो.अविन्दतं जयोतिरेकं बहुभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomā ceti tad vīryaṃ vāṃ yadamuṣṇītamavasaṃ paṇiṃ ghāḥ avātirataṃ bṛsayasya śeṣo.avindataṃ jyotirekaṃ bahubhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni and Soma, famed is that your. prowess wherewith ye stole the kine, his food, from Paṇi.  Ye caused the brood of Bṛsaya to perish; ye found the light, the single light for many.

verses.sanskrit: युवमेतानि दिवि रोचनान्यग्निश्च सोम सक्रतू अधत्तम युवं सिन्धून्रभिशस्तेरवद्यादग्नीषोमावमुञ्चतं गर्भीतान |||
verses.transliteration: yuvametāni divi rocanānyaghniśca soma sakratū adhattam yuvaṃ sindhūnrabhiśasteravadyādaghnīṣomāvamuñcataṃ ghṛbhītān

translations.griffith: Agni and Soma, joined in operation ye have set up the shining lights in heaven.  From curse and from reproach, Agni and Soma, ye freed the rivers that were bound in fetters.

verses.sanskrit: आन्यं दिवो मातरिश्वा जभारामथ्नादन्यं परि शयेनोद्रेः अग्नीषोमा बरह्मणा वाव्र्धानोरुं यज्ञाय चक्रथुरु लोकम |||
verses.transliteration: ānyaṃ divo mātariśvā jabhārāmathnādanyaṃ pari śyenoadreḥ aghnīṣomā brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānoruṃ yajñāya cakrathuru lokam

translations.griffith: One of you Mātariśvan brought from heaven, the Falcon rent the other from the mountain.  Strengthened by holy prayer Agni and Soma have made us ample room for sacrificing.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा हविषः परस्थितस्य वीतं हर्यतं वर्षणा जुषेथाम सुशर्माणा सववसा हि भूतमथा धत्तं यजमानाय शं योः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomā haviṣaḥ prasthitasya vītaṃ haryataṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām suśarmāṇā svavasā hi bhūtamathā dhattaṃ yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ

translations.griffith: Taste, Agni, Soma, this prepared oblation; accept it, Mighty Ones, and let it please you.  Vouchsafe us good protection and kind favour: grant to the sacrificer health and riches.

verses.sanskrit: यो अग्नीषोमा हविषा सपर्याद देवद्रीचा मनसा यो घर्तेन तस्य वरतं रक्षतं पातमंहसो विशे जनाय महिशर्म यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: yo aghnīṣomā haviṣā saparyād devadrīcā manasā yo ghṛtena tasya vrataṃ rakṣataṃ pātamaṃhaso viśe janāya mahiśarma yachatam

translations.griffith: Whoso with oil and poured oblation honours, with God-devoted heart, Agni and Soma,—  Protect his sacrifice, preserve him from distress, grant to the sacrificer great felicity.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा सवेदसा सहूती वनतं गिरः सं देवत्रा बभूवथुः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomā savedasā sahūtī vanataṃ ghiraḥ saṃ devatrā babhūvathuḥ

translations.griffith: Invoked together, mates in wealth, Agni-Soma, accept our hymns:  Together be among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमावनेन वां यो वां घर्तेन दाशति तस्मै दीदयतं बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomāvanena vāṃ yo vāṃ ghṛtena dāśati tasmai dīdayataṃ bṛhat

translations.griffith: Agni and Soma, unto him who worships you with holy oil  Shine forth an ample recompense.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमाविमानि नो युवं हव्या जुजोषतम आ यातमुपनः सचा |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomāvimāni no yuvaṃ havyā jujoṣatam ā yātamupanaḥ sacā

translations.griffith: Agni and Soma, be ye pleased with these oblations brought to you,  And come, together, nigh to us.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा पिप्र्तमर्वतो न आ पयायन्तामुस्रिया हव्यसूदः अस्मे बलानि मघवत्सु धत्तं कर्णुतं नो अध्वरं शरुष्टिमन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnīṣomā pipṛtamarvato na ā pyāyantāmusriyā havyasūdaḥ asme balāni maghavatsu dhattaṃ kṛṇutaṃ no adhvaraṃ śruṣṭimantam

translations.griffith: Agni and Soma, cherish well our horses, and let our cows be fat who yield oblations.  Grant power to us and to our wealthy patrons, and cause our holy rites to be successful.

verses.sanskrit: इमं सतोममर्हते जातवेदसे रथमिव सं महेमा मनीषया भद्रा हि नः परमतिरस्य संसद्यग्ने सख्ये मा रिषामा वयं तव |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ stomamarhate jātavedase rathamiva saṃ mahemā manīṣayā bhadrā hi naḥ pramatirasya saṃsadyaghne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava

translations.griffith: FOR Jātavedas worthy of our praise will we frame with our mind this eulogy as ’twere a car.  For good, in his assembly, is this care of ours. Let us not, in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मै तवमायजसे स साधत्यनर्वा कषेति दधते सुवीर्यम स तूताव नैनमश्नोत्यंहतिरग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: yasmai tvamāyajase sa sādhatyanarvā kṣeti dadhate suvīryam sa tūtāva nainamaśnotyaṃhatiraghne ...

translations.griffith: The man for whom thou sacrificest prospereth, dwelleth without a foe, gaineth heroic might.  He waxeth strong, distress never approacheth him. Let us not, in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: शकेम तवा समिधं साधया धियस्त्वे देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम तवमादित्याना वह तान हयुश्मस्यग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: śakema tvā samidhaṃ sādhayā dhiyastve devā haviradantyāhutam tvamādityānā vaha tān hyuśmasyaghne ...

translations.griffith: May we have power to kindle thee. Fulfil our thoughts. In thee the Gods eat the presented offering,  Bring hither the Ādityas, for we long for them. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: भरामेध्मं कर्णवामा हवींषि ते चितयन्तः पर्वणा-पर्वणा वयम जीवातवे परतरं साधया धियो.अग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: bharāmedhmaṃ kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi te citayantaḥ parvaṇā-parvaṇā vayam jīvātave prataraṃ sādhayā dhiyo.aghne ...

translations.griffith: We will bring fuel and prepare burnt offerings, reminding thee at each successive festival.  Fulfil our thought that so we may prolong our lives. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: विशां गोपा अस्य चरन्ति जन्तवो दविपच्च यदुत चतुष्पदक्तुभिः चित्रः परकेत उषसो महानस्य अग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: viśāṃ ghopā asya caranti jantavo dvipacca yaduta catuṣpadaktubhiḥ citraḥ praketa uṣaso mahānasya aghne ...

translations.griffith: His ministers move forth, the guardians of the folk, protecting quadruped and biped with their rays.  Mighty art thou, the wondrous herald of the Dawn. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: तवमध्वर्युरुत होतासि पूर्व्यः परशास्ता पोता जनुषा पुरोहितः विश्वा विद्वानार्त्विज्या धीर पुष्यस्यग्ने .. . |||
verses.transliteration: tvamadhvaryuruta hotāsi pūrvyaḥ praśāstā potā januṣā purohitaḥ viśvā vidvānārtvijyā dhīra puṣyasyaghne .. .

translations.griffith: Thou art Presenter and the chief Invoker, thou Director, Purifier, great High Priest by birth.  Knowing all priestly work thou perfectest it, Sage. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: यो विश्वतः सुप्रतीकः सद्रंं असि दूरे चित सन तळिदिवाति रोचसे रात्र्याश्चिदन्धो अति देव पश्यस्यग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: yo viśvataḥ supratīkaḥ sadṛṃṃ asi dūre cit san taḷidivāti rocase rātryāścidandho ati deva paśyasyaghne ...

translations.griffith: Lovely of form art thou, alike on every side; though far, thou shinest brightly as if close at hand.  O God, thou seest through even the dark of night. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वो देवा भवतु सुन्वतो रथो.अस्माकं शंसो अभ्यस्तु दूढ्यः तदा जानीतोत पुष्यता वचो.अग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvo devā bhavatu sunvato ratho.asmākaṃ śaṃso abhyastu dūḍhyaḥ tadā jānītota puṣyatā vaco.aghne ...

translations.griffith: Gods, foremost be his car who pours libations out, and let our hymn prevail o’er evil-hearted men.  Attend to this our speech and make it prosper well. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: वधैर्दुःशंसानप दूढ्यो जहि दूरे वा ये अन्ति वा के चिदत्रिणः अथा यज्ञाय गर्णते सुगं कर्ध्यग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: vadhairduḥśaṃsānapa dūḍhyo jahi dūre vā ye anti vā ke cidatriṇaḥ athā yajñāya ghṛṇate sughaṃ kṛdhyaghne ...

translations.griffith: Smite with thy weapons those of evil speech and thought, devouring demons, whether near or tar away.  Then to the singer give free way for sacrifice. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: यदयुक्था अरुषा रोहिता रथे वातजूता वर्षभस्येव तेरवः आदिन्वसि वनिनो धूमकेतुनाग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadayukthā aruṣā rohitā rathe vātajūtā vṛṣabhasyeva teravaḥ ādinvasi vanino dhūmaketunāghne ...

translations.griffith: When to thy chariot thou hadst yoked two red steeds and two ruddy steeds, wind-sped, thy roar was like a bull's.  Thou with smoke-bannered flame attackest forest trees. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: अध सवनादुत बिभ्युः पतत्रिणो दरप्सा यत ते यवसादो वयस्थिरन सुगं तत ते तावकेभ्यो रथेभ्यो.अग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: adha svanāduta bibhyuḥ patatriṇo drapsā yat te yavasādo vyasthiran sughaṃ tat te tāvakebhyo rathebhyo.aghne ...

translations.griffith: Then at thy roar the very birds are terrified, when, eating-up the grass, thy sparks fly forth abroad.  Then is it easy for thee and thy car to pass. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: अयं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धायसे.अवयातां मरुतां हेळो अद्भुतः मर्ळा सु नो भूत्वेषां मनः पुनरग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāyase.avayātāṃ marutāṃ heḷo adbhutaḥ mṛḷā su no bhūtveṣāṃ manaḥ punaraghne ...

translations.griffith: He hath the Power to soothe Mitra and Varuṇa: wonderful is the Maruts’ wrath when they descend.  Be gracious; let their hearts he turned to us again. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: देवो देवानामसि मित्रो अद्भुतो वसुर्वसूनामसि चारुरध्वरे शर्मन सयाम तव सप्रथस्तमे.अग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: devo devānāmasi mitro adbhuto vasurvasūnāmasi cāruradhvare śarman syāma tava saprathastame.aghne ...

translations.griffith: Thou art a God, thou art the wondrous Friend of Gods, the Vasu of the Vasus, fair in sacrifice.  Under, thine own most wide protection may we dwell. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: तत ते भद्रं यत समिद्धः सवे दमे सोमाहुतो जरसे मर्ळयत्तमः दधासि रत्नं दरविणं च दाशुषे.अग्ने ... |||
verses.transliteration: tat te bhadraṃ yat samiddhaḥ sve dame somāhuto jarase mṛḷayattamaḥ dadhāsi ratnaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dāśuṣe.aghne ...

translations.griffith: This is thy grace that, kindled in thine own abode, invoked with Soma thou soundest forth most benign,  Thou givest wealth and treasure to the worshipper. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मै तवं सुद्रविणो ददाशो.अनागास्त्वमदिते सर्वताता यं भद्रेण शवसा चोदयासि परजावता राधसा ते सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: yasmai tvaṃ sudraviṇo dadāśo.anāghāstvamadite sarvatātā yaṃ bhadreṇa śavasā codayāsi prajāvatā rādhasā te syāma

translations.griffith: To whom thou, Lord of goodly riches, grantest freedom from every sin with perfect wholeness,  Whom with good strength thou  quickenest  , with children and wealth—may we be they, Eternal Being.

verses.sanskrit: स तवमग्ने सौभगत्वस्य विद्वानस्माकमायुः पर तिरेहदेव तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्तामदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थिवी उत दयौः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvamaghne saubhaghatvasya vidvānasmākamāyuḥ pra tirehadeva tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantāmaditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ

translations.griffith: Such, Agni, thou who knowest all good fortune, God, lengthen here the days of our existence.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: दवे वीरूपे चरतः सवर्थे अन्यान्या वत्समुप धापयेते हरिरन्यस्यां भवति सवधावाञ्छुक्रो अन्यस्यां दद्र्शे सुवर्चाः |||
verses.transliteration: dve vīrūpe carataḥ svarthe anyānyā vatsamupa dhāpayete hariranyasyāṃ bhavati svadhāvāñchukro anyasyāṃ dadṛśe suvarcāḥ

translations.griffith: To fair goals travel Two unlike in semblance: each in succession nourishes an infant.  One bears a Godlike Babe of golden colour; bright and fair-shining, is he with the other.

verses.sanskrit: दशेमं तवष्टुर्जनयन्त गर्भमतन्द्रासो युवतयो विभ्र्त्रम तिग्मानीकं सवयशसं जनेषु विरोचमानं परि षीं नयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: daśemaṃ tvaṣṭurjanayanta gharbhamatandrāso yuvatayo vibhṛtram tighmānīkaṃ svayaśasaṃ janeṣu virocamānaṃ pari ṣīṃ nayanti

translations.griffith: Tvaṣṭar's ten daughters, vigilant and youthful, produced this Infant borne to sundry quarters.  They bear around him whose long flames are pointed, fulgent among mankind with native splendour.
