verses.sanskrit: तरीणि जाना परि भूषन्त्यस्य समुद्र एकं दिव्येकमप्सु पूर्वामनु पर दिशं पार्थिवानां रतून परशासद विदधावनुष्ठु |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi jānā pari bhūṣantyasya samudra ekaṃ divyekamapsu pūrvāmanu pra diśaṃ pārthivānāṃ ṛtūn praśāsad vidadhāvanuṣṭhu

translations.griffith: Three several places of his birth they honour, in mid-air, in the heaven, and in the waters.  Governing in the east of earthly regions, the seasons hath he stablished in their order.

verses.sanskrit: क इमं वो निण्यमा चिकेत वत्सो मातॄर्जनयत सवधाभिः बह्वीनां गर्भो अपसामुपस्थान महान कविर्निश्चरति सवधावान |||
verses.transliteration: ka imaṃ vo niṇyamā ciketa vatso mātṝrjanayata svadhābhiḥ bahvīnāṃ gharbho apasāmupasthān mahān kavirniścarati svadhāvān

translations.griffith: Who of you knows this secret One? The Infant by his own nature hath brought forth his Mothers.  The germ of many, from the waters' bosom he goes forth, wise and great, of Godlike nature.

verses.sanskrit: आविष्ट्यो वर्धते चारुरासु जिह्मानामूर्ध्वः सवयशा उपस्थे उभे तवष्टुर्बिभ्यतुर्जायमानात परतीची सिंहम्प्रति जोषयेते |||
verses.transliteration: āviṣṭyo vardhate cārurāsu jihmānāmūrdhvaḥ svayaśā upasthe ubhe tvaṣṭurbibhyaturjāyamānāt pratīcī siṃhamprati joṣayete

translations.griffith: Visible, fair, he grows in native brightness uplifted in the lap of waving waters.  When he was born both Tvaṣṭar's worlds were frightened: they turn to him and reverence the Lion.

verses.sanskrit: उभे भद्रे जोषयेते न मेने गावो न वाश्रा उप तस्थुरेवैः स दक्षाणां दक्षपतिर्बभूवाञ्जन्ति यं दक्षिणतो हविर्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe bhadre joṣayete na mene ghāvo na vāśrā upa tasthurevaiḥ sa dakṣāṇāṃ dakṣapatirbabhūvāñjanti yaṃ dakṣiṇato havirbhiḥ

translations.griffith: The Two auspicious Ones, like women, tend him: like lowing cows they seek him in their manner.  He is the Lord of Might among the mighty; him, on the right, they balm with their oblations.

verses.sanskrit: उद यंयमीति सवितेव बाहू उभे सिचौ यतते भीम रञ्जन उच्छुक्रमत्कमजते सिमस्मान नवा मात्र्भ्यो वसना जहाति |||
verses.transliteration: ud yaṃyamīti saviteva bāhū ubhe sicau yatate bhīma ṛñjan ucchukramatkamajate simasmān navā mātṛbhyo vasanā jahāti

translations.griffith: Like Savitar his arms with might he stretches; awful, he strives grasping the world's two borders.  He forces out from all a brilliant vesture, yea, from his Mothers draws he forth new raiment.

verses.sanskrit: तवेषं रूपं कर्णुत उत्तरं यत सम्प्र्ञ्चानः सदने गोभिरद्भिः कविर्बुध्नं परि मर्म्र्ज्यते धीः सा देवताता समितिर्बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇuta uttaraṃ yat sampṛñcānaḥ sadane ghobhiradbhiḥ kavirbudhnaṃ pari marmṛjyate dhīḥ sā devatātā samitirbabhūva

translations.griffith: He makes him a most noble form of splendour, decking him in his home with milk and waters.  The Sage adorns the depths of air with wisdom: this is the meeting where the Gods are worshipped.

verses.sanskrit: उरु ते जरयः पर्येति बुध्नं विरोचमानं महिषस्य धाम विश्वेभिरग्ने सवयशोभिरिद्धो.अदब्धेभिः पायुभिः पाह्यस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: uru te jrayaḥ paryeti budhnaṃ virocamānaṃ mahiṣasya dhāma viśvebhiraghne svayaśobhiriddho.adabdhebhiḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhyasmān

translations.griffith: Wide through the firmament spreads forth triumphant the far-resplendent strength of thee the Mighty.  Kindled by us do thou preserve us, Agni, with all thy self-bright undiminished succours.

verses.sanskrit: धन्वन सरोतः कर्णुते गातुमूर्मिं शुक्रैरूर्मिभिरभिनक्षति कषाम विश्वा सनानि जठरेषु धत्ते.अन्तर्नवासु चरति परसूषु |||
verses.transliteration: dhanvan srotaḥ kṛṇute ghātumūrmiṃ śukrairūrmibhirabhinakṣati kṣām viśvā sanāni jaṭhareṣu dhatte.antarnavāsu carati prasūṣu

translations.griffith: In dry spots he makes stream, and course, and torrent, and inundates the earth with floods that glisten.  All ancient things within his maw he gathers, and moves among the new fresh-sprouting grasses.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नो अग्ने समिधा वर्धानो रेवत पावक शरवसे वि भाहि तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्ताम अदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थ्विवी उतो दयौः |||
verses.transliteration: evā no aghne samidhā vṛdhāno revat pāvaka śravase vi bhāhi tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthvivī uto dyauḥ

translations.griffith: Fed with our fuel, purifying Agni, so blaze to us auspiciously for glory.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: स परत्नथा सहसा जायमानः सद्यः काव्यानि बळ अधत्त विश्वा अपश्च मित्रं धिषणा च साधन देवा अग्निन्धारयन दरविणोदाम |||
verses.transliteration: sa pratnathā sahasā jāyamānaḥ sadyaḥ kāvyāni baḷ adhatta viśvā apaśca mitraṃ dhiṣaṇā ca sādhan devā aghnindhārayan draviṇodām

translations.griffith: HE in the ancient way by strength engendered, lo! straight hath taken to himself all wisdom.  The waters and the bowl have made him friendly. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit: स पूर्वया निविदा कव्यतायोरिमाः परजा अजनयन मनूनाम विवस्वता चक्षसा दयामपश्च देवा अ. ध. द. |||
verses.transliteration: sa pūrvayā nividā kavyatāyorimāḥ prajā ajanayan manūnām vivasvatā cakṣasā dyāmapaśca devā a. dh. d.

translations.griffith: At Āyu's ancient call he by his wisdom gave all this progeny of men their being,  And, by refulgent light, heaven and the waters. The Gods possessed the wealth. bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit: तमीळत परथमं यज्ञसाधं विश आरीराहुतं रञ्जसानम ऊर्जः पुत्रं भरतं सर्प्रदानुं देवा ... |||
verses.transliteration: tamīḷata prathamaṃ yajñasādhaṃ viśa ārīrāhutaṃ ṛñjasānam ūrjaḥ putraṃ bharataṃ sṛpradānuṃ devā ...

translations.griffith: Praise him, ye Āryan folk, as chief performer of sacrifice adored and ever toiling,  Well-tended, Son of Strength, the Constant Giver. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit: स मातरिश्वा पुरुवारपुष्टिर्विदद गातुं तनयाय सवर्वित विशां गोपा जनिता रोदस्योर्देवा ... |||
verses.transliteration: sa mātariśvā puruvārapuṣṭirvidad ghātuṃ tanayāya svarvit viśāṃ ghopā janitā rodasyordevā ...

translations.griffith: That Mātariśvan rich in wealth and treasure, light-winner, finds a pathway for his offspring.  Guard of our folk, Father of earth and heaven. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit: नक्तोषासा वर्णमामेम्याने धापयेते शिशुमेकं समीची दयावाक्षामा रुक्मो अन्तर्वि भाति देवा ... |||
verses.transliteration: naktoṣāsā varṇamāmemyāne dhāpayete śiśumekaṃ samīcī dyāvākṣāmā rukmo antarvi bhāti devā ...

translations.griffith: Night and Dawn, changing each the other's colour, meeting together suckle one same Infant:  Golden between the heaven and earth he shineth. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit: रायो बुध्नः संगमनो वसूनां यज्ञस्य केतुर्मन्मसाधनो वेः अम्र्तत्वं रक्षमाणास एनं देवा ... |||
verses.transliteration: rāyo budhnaḥ saṃghamano vasūnāṃ yajñasya keturmanmasādhano veḥ amṛtatvaṃ rakṣamāṇāsa enaṃ devā ...

translations.griffith: Root of wealth, gathering-place of treasures, banner of sacrifice, who grants the suppliant's wishes:  Preserving him as their own life immortal, the Gods possessed the wealth-bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit: नू च पुरा च सदनं रयीणां जातस्य च जायमानस्य च कषाम सतश्च गोपां भवतश्च भूरेर्देवा ... |||
verses.transliteration: nū ca purā ca sadanaṃ rayīṇāṃ jātasya ca jāyamānasya ca kṣām sataśca ghopāṃ bhavataśca bhūrerdevā ...

translations.griffith: Now and of old the home of wealth, the mansion of what is born and what was born aforetime,  Guard of what is and what will be hereafter,—the Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit: दरविणोदा दरविणसस्तुरस्य दरविणोदाः सनरस्य पर यंसत दरविणोदा वीरवतीमिषं नो दरविणोदा रसते दीर्घमायुः |||
verses.transliteration: draviṇodā draviṇasasturasya draviṇodāḥ sanarasya pra yaṃsat draviṇodā vīravatīmiṣaṃ no draviṇodā rasate dīrghamāyuḥ

translations.griffith: May the Wealth-Giver grant us conquering riches; may the Wealth-Giver grant us wealth with heroes.  May the Wealth-Giver grant us food with offspring, and length of days may the Wealth-Giver send us.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नो अग्ने समिधा वर्धानो रेवत पावक शरवसे वि भाहि ||
verses.transliteration: evā no aghne samidhā vṛdhāno revat pāvaka śravase vi bhāhi

translations.griffith: Fed with our fuel, purifying Agni, so blaze to us auspiciously for glory.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्ताम अदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थ्विवी उतो दयौः ||
verses.transliteration: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthvivī uto dyauḥ

translations.griffith: Missing Line From Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: अप नः शोशुचदघमग्ने शुशुग्ध्या रयिम अप नः शोशुचदघम |||
verses.transliteration: apa naḥ śośucadaghamaghne śuśughdhyā rayim apa naḥ śośucadagham

translations.griffith: CHASING with light our sin away, O Agni, shine thou wealth on us.  May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit: सुक्षेत्रिया सुगातुया वसूया च यजामहे अप ... |||
verses.transliteration: sukṣetriyā sughātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe apa ...

translations.griffith: For goodly fields, for pleasant homes, for wealth we sacrifice to thee.  May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit: पर यद भन्दिष्ठ एषां परास्माकासश्च सूरयः अप... |||
verses.transliteration: pra yad bhandiṣṭha eṣāṃ prāsmākāsaśca sūrayaḥ apa...

translations.griffith: Best praiser of all these be he; foremost, our chiefs who sacrifice.  May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit: पर यत ते अग्ने सूरयो जायेमहि पर ते वयम अप ... |||
verses.transliteration: pra yat te aghne sūrayo jāyemahi pra te vayam apa ...

translations.griffith: So that thy worshippers and we, thine, Agni, in our sons may live.  May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit: पर यदग्नेः सहस्वतो विश्वतो यन्ति भानवः अप ... |||
verses.transliteration: pra yadaghneḥ sahasvato viśvato yanti bhānavaḥ apa ...

translations.griffith: As ever-conquering Agni's beams of splendour go to every side,  May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि विश्वतोमुख विश्वतः परिभूरसि अप ... |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi viśvatomukha viśvataḥ paribhūrasi apa ...

translations.griffith: To every side thy face is turned, thou art triumphant everywhere.  May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit: दविषो नो विश्वतोमुखाति नावेव पारय अप ... |||
verses.transliteration: dviṣo no viśvatomukhāti nāveva pāraya apa ...

translations.griffith: O thou whose face looks every way, bear us past foes as in a ship.  May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit: स नः सिन्धुमिव नावयाति पर्षा सवस्तये अप ... |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ sindhumiva nāvayāti parṣā svastaye apa ...

translations.griffith: As in a ship, convey thou us for our advantage o’er the flood.  May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानरस्य सुमतौ सयाम राजा हि कं भुवनानामभिश्रीः इतो जातो विश्वमिदं वि चष्टे वैश्वानरो यतते सूर्येण |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarasya sumatau syāma rājā hi kaṃ bhuvanānāmabhiśrīḥ ito jāto viśvamidaṃ vi caṣṭe vaiśvānaro yatate sūryeṇa

translations.griffith: STILL in Vaiśvānara's grace may we continue: yea, he is King supreme o’er all things living.  Sprung hence to life upon this All he looketh. Vaiśvānara hath rivalry with Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: पर्ष्टो दिवि पर्ष्टो अग्निः पर्थिव्यां पर्ष्टो विश्वा ओषधीरा विवेश वैश्वानरः सहसा पर्ष्टो अग्निः स नो दिवा स रिषः पातु नक्तम |||
verses.transliteration: pṛṣṭo divi pṛṣṭo aghniḥ pṛthivyāṃ pṛṣṭo viśvā oṣadhīrā viveśa vaiśvānaraḥ sahasā pṛṣṭo aghniḥ sa no divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam

translations.griffith: Present in heaven, in earth, all-present Agni,—all plants that grow on ground hath he pervaded.  May Agni, may Vaiśvānara with vigour, present, preserve us day and night from foemen.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानर तव तत सत्यमस्त्वस्मान रायो मघवानः सचन्ताम तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānara tava tat satyamastvasmān rāyo maghavānaḥ sacantām tan no ...

translations.griffith: Be this thy truth, Vaiśvānara, to us-ward: let wealth in rich abundance gather round us.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: जातवेदसे सुनवाम सोममरातीयतो नि दहाति वेदः स नः पर्षदति दुर्गाणि विश्वा नावेव सिन्धुं दुरितात्यग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: jātavedase sunavāma somamarātīyato ni dahāti vedaḥ sa naḥ parṣadati durghāṇi viśvā nāveva sindhuṃ duritātyaghniḥ

translations.griffith: FOR Jātavedas let us press the Soma: may he consume the wealth of the malignant.  May Agni carry us through all our troubles, through grief as in a boat across the river.

verses.sanskrit: स यो वर्षा वर्ष्ण्येभिः समोका महो दिवः पर्थिव्याश्चसम्राट सतीनसत्वा हव्यो भरेषु मरुत्वान नो भवत्विन्द्र ऊती |||
verses.transliteration: sa yo vṛṣā vṛṣṇyebhiḥ samokā maho divaḥ pṛthivyāścasamrāṭ satīnasatvā havyo bhareṣu marutvān no bhavatvindra ūtī

translations.griffith: MAY he who hath his home with strength, the Mighty, the King supreme of earth and spacious heaven,  Lord of true power, to he invoked in battles,—may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: यस्यानाप्तः सूर्यस्येव यामो भरे-भरे वर्त्रहा शुष्मो अस्ति वर्षन्तमः सखिभिः सवेभिरेवैर्म... |||
verses.transliteration: yasyānāptaḥ sūryasyeva yāmo bhare-bhare vṛtrahā śuṣmo asti vṛṣantamaḥ sakhibhiḥ svebhirevairma...

translations.griffith: Whose way is unattainable like Sūrya's: he in each fight is the strong Vṛtra-slayer,  Mightiest with his Friends in his own courses. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो न यस्य रेतसो दुघानाः पन्थासो यन्ति शवसापरीताः तरद्द्वेषाः सासहिः पौंस्येभिर्म... |||
verses.transliteration: divo na yasya retaso dughānāḥ panthāso yanti śavasāparītāḥ taraddveṣāḥ sāsahiḥ pauṃsyebhirma...

translations.griffith: Whose paths go forth in their great might resistless, forthmilking, as it were, heaven's genial moisture.  With manly strength triumphant, foe-subduer,—may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: सो अङगिरोभिरङगिरस्तमो भूद वर्षा वर्षभिः सखिभिः सखा सन रग्मिभिर्र्ग्मी गातुभिर्ज्येष्ठो म... |||
verses.transliteration: so aṅghirobhiraṅghirastamo bhūd vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sakhā san ṛghmibhirṛghmī ghātubhirjyeṣṭho ma...

translations.griffith: Among Aṅgirases he was the chiefest, a Friend with friends, mighty amid the mighty.  Praiser mid praisers, honoured most of singers. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: स सूनुभिर्न रुद्रेभिर्र्भ्वा नर्षाह्ये सासह्वानमित्रान सनीळेभिः शरवस्यानि तूर्वन म... |||
verses.transliteration: sa sūnubhirna rudrebhirṛbhvā nṛṣāhye sāsahvānamitrān sanīḷebhiḥ śravasyāni tūrvan ma...

translations.griffith: Strong with the Rudras as with his own children, in manly battle conquering his foemen '  With his close comrades doing deeds of glory,—may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: स मन्युमीः समदनस्य कर्तास्माकेभिर्न्र्भिः सूर्यं सनत अस्मिन्नहन सत्पतिः पुरुहूतो म... |||
verses.transliteration: sa manyumīḥ samadanasya kartāsmākebhirnṛbhiḥ sūryaṃ sanat asminnahan satpatiḥ puruhūto ma...

translations.griffith: Humbler of pride, exciter of the conflict, the Lord of heroes, God invoked of many,  May he this day gain with our men the sunlight. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: तमूतयो रणयञ्छूरसातौ तं कषेमस्य कषितयः कर्ण्वत तराम स विश्वस्य करुणस्येश एको म... |||
verses.transliteration: tamūtayo raṇayañchūrasātau taṃ kṣemasya kṣitayaḥ kṛṇvata trām sa viśvasya karuṇasyeśa eko ma...

translations.griffith: His help hath made him cheerer in the battle, the folk have made him guardian of their comfort.  Sole Lord is he of every holy service. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: तमप्सन्त शवस उत्सवेषु नरो नरमवसे तं धनाय सो अन्धे चित तमसि जयोतिर्विदन म... |||
verses.transliteration: tamapsanta śavasa utsaveṣu naro naramavase taṃ dhanāya so andhe cit tamasi jyotirvidan ma...

translations.griffith: To him the Hero, on high days of prowess, heroes for help and booty shall betake them.  He hath found light even in the blinding darkness. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: स सव्येन यमति वराधतश्चित स दक्षिणे संग्र्भीता कर्तानि स कीरिणा चित सनिता धनानि म... |||
verses.transliteration: sa savyena yamati vrādhataścit sa dakṣiṇe saṃghṛbhītā kṛtāni sa kīriṇā cit sanitā dhanāni ma...

translations.griffith: He with his left hand checketh even the mighty, and with his right hand gathereth up the booty.  Even with the humble he acquireth riches. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: स गरामेभिः सनिता स रथेभिर्विदे विश्वाभिः कर्ष्टिभिर्न्वद्य स पौंस्येभिरभिभूरशस्तीर्म... |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghrāmebhiḥ sanitā sa rathebhirvide viśvābhiḥ kṛṣṭibhirnvadya sa pauṃsyebhirabhibhūraśastīrma...

translations.griffith: With hosts on foot and cars he winneth treasures: well is he known this day by all the people.  With manly might he conquereth those who hate him. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: स जामिभिर्यत समजाति मीळ्हे.अजामिभिर्वा पुरुहूत एवैः अपां तोकस्य तनयस्य जेषे म... |||
verses.transliteration: sa jāmibhiryat samajāti mīḷhe.ajāmibhirvā puruhūta evaiḥ apāṃ tokasya tanayasya jeṣe ma...

translations.griffith: When in his ways with kinsmen or with strangers he speedeth to the fight, invoked of many,  For gain of waters, and of sons and grandsons, may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: स वज्रभ्र्द दस्युहा भीम उग्रः सहस्रचेताः शतनीथर्भ्वा चम्रीषो न शवसा पाञ्चजन्यो म... |||
verses.transliteration: sa vajrabhṛd dasyuhā bhīma ughraḥ sahasracetāḥ śatanīthaṛbhvā camrīṣo na śavasā pāñcajanyo ma...

translations.griffith: Awful and fierce, fiend-slayer, thunder-wielder, with boundless knowledge, hymned by hundreds, mighty,  In strength like Soma, guard of the Five Peoples, may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: तस्य वज्रः करन्दति समत सवर्षा दिवो न तवेषो रवथःशिमीवान तं सचन्ते सनयस्तं धनानि म... |||
verses.transliteration: tasya vajraḥ krandati smat svarṣā divo na tveṣo ravathaḥśimīvān taṃ sacante sanayastaṃ dhanāni ma...

translations.griffith: Winning the light, hitherward roars his thunder like the terrific mighty voice of Heaven.  Rich gifts and treasures evermore attend him. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: यस्याजस्रं शवसा मानमुक्थं परिभुजद रोदसी विश्वतः सीम स पारिषत करतुभिर्मन्दसानो म... |||
verses.transliteration: yasyājasraṃ śavasā mānamukthaṃ paribhujad rodasī viśvataḥ sīm sa pāriṣat kratubhirmandasāno ma...

translations.griffith: Whose home eternal through his strength surrounds him on every side, his laud, the earth and heaven,  May he, delighted with our service, save us. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit: न यस्य देवा देवता न मर्ता आपश्चन शवसो अन्तमापुः स पररिक्वा तवक्षसा कष्मो दिवश्च म... |||
verses.transliteration: na yasya devā devatā na martā āpaścana śavaso antamāpuḥ sa prarikvā tvakṣasā kṣmo divaśca ma...

translations.griffith: The limit of whose power not Gods by Godhead, nor mortal men have reached, nor yet the Waters.  Both Earth and Heaven in vigour he surpasseth. May Indra, girt by Maruts, he our succour.

verses.sanskrit: रोहिच्छ्यावा सुमदंशुर्ललामीर्द्युक्षा राय रज्राश्वस्य वर्षण्वन्तं बिभ्रती धूर्षु रथं मन्द्रा चिकेत नाहुषीषु विक्षु |||
verses.transliteration: rohicchyāvā sumadaṃśurlalāmīrdyukṣā rāya ṛjrāśvasya vṛṣaṇvantaṃ bibhratī dhūrṣu rathaṃ mandrā ciketa nāhuṣīṣu vikṣu

translations.griffith: The red and tawny mare, blaze-marked, high standing, celestial who, to bring Ṛjrāśva riches,  Drew at the pole the chariot yoked with stallions, joyous, among the hosts of men was noted.

verses.sanskrit: एतत तयत त इन्द्र वर्ष्ण उक्थं वार्षागिरा अभि गर्णन्ति राधः रज्राश्वः परष्टिभिरम्बरीषः सहदेवो भयमानः सुराधाः |||
verses.transliteration: etat tyat ta indra vṛṣṇa ukthaṃ vārṣāghirā abhi ghṛṇanti rādhaḥ ṛjrāśvaḥ praṣṭibhirambarīṣaḥ sahadevo bhayamānaḥ surādhāḥ

translations.griffith: The Vārṣāgiras unto thee, O Indra, the Mighty One, sing forth this laud to please thee,  Ṛjrāśva with his fellows, Ambarīṣa, Surādhas, Sahadeva, Bhayamāna.

verses.sanskrit: दस्यूञ्छिम्यूंश्च पुरुहूत एवैर्हत्वा पर्थिव्यां शर्वा नि बर्हीत सनत कषेत्रं सखिभिः शवित्न्येभिः सनत्सूर्यं सनदपः सुवज्रः |||
verses.transliteration: dasyūñchimyūṃśca puruhūta evairhatvā pṛthivyāṃ śarvā ni barhīt sanat kṣetraṃ sakhibhiḥ śvitnyebhiḥ sanatsūryaṃ sanadapaḥ suvajraḥ

translations.griffith: He, much invoked, hath slain Dasyus and Śimyus, after his wont, and laid them low with arrows.  The mighty Thunderer with his fair-complexioned friends won the land, the sunlight, and the waters.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वाहेन्द्रो अधिवक्ता नो अस्त्वपरिह्व्र्ताः सनुयाम वाजम तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāhendro adhivaktā no astvaparihvṛtāḥ sanuyāma vājam tan no ...

translations.griffith: May Indra evermore be our protector, and unimperilled may we win the booty.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पर मन्दिने पितुमदर्चता वचो यः कर्ष्णगर्भा निरहन्न्र्जिश्वना अवस्यवो वर्षणं वज्रदक्षिणं मरुत्वन्तं सख्याय हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: pra mandine pitumadarcatā vaco yaḥ kṛṣṇagharbhā nirahannṛjiśvanā avasyavo vṛṣaṇaṃ vajradakṣiṇaṃ marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe

translations.griffith: SING, with oblation, praise to him who maketh glad, who with Ṛjiśvan drove the dusky brood away.  Fain for help, him the strong whose right hand wields the bolt, him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: यो वयंसं जाह्र्षाणेन मन्युना यः शम्बरं यो अहन पिप्रुमव्रतम इन्द्रो यः शुष्णमशुषं नयाव्र्णं म. .. |||
verses.transliteration: yo vyaṃsaṃ jāhṛṣāṇena manyunā yaḥ śambaraṃ yo ahan piprumavratam indro yaḥ śuṣṇamaśuṣaṃ nyāvṛṇaṃ ma. ..

translations.griffith: Indra, who with triumphant wrath smote Vyaṁsa down, and Śambara, and Pipru the unrighteous one;  Who extirpated Śuṣṇa the insatiate,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी पौंस्यं महद यस्य वरते वरुणो यस्य सूर्यः यस्येन्द्रस्य सिन्धवः सश्चति वरतं म... |||
verses.transliteration: yasya dyāvāpṛthivī pauṃsyaṃ mahad yasya vrate varuṇo yasya sūryaḥ yasyendrasya sindhavaḥ saścati vrataṃ ma...

translations.griffith: He whose great work of manly might is heaven and earth, and Varuṇa and Sūrya keep his holy law;  Indra, whose law the rivers follow as they flow,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: यो अश्वानां यो गवां गोपतिर्वशी य आरितः कर्मणि कर्मणि सथिरः वीळोश्चिदिन्द्रो यो असुन्वतो वधो म... |||
verses.transliteration: yo aśvānāṃ yo ghavāṃ ghopatirvaśī ya āritaḥ karmaṇi karmaṇi sthiraḥ vīḷościdindro yo asunvato vadho ma...

translations.griffith: He who is Lord and Master of the steeds and kine, honoured—the firm and sure—at every holy act;  Stayer even of the strong who pours no offering out,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: यो विश्वस्य जगतः पराणतस पतिर्यो बरह्मणे परथमो गा अविन्दत इन्द्रो यो दस्यून्रधरानवातिरन म... |||
verses.transliteration: yo viśvasya jaghataḥ prāṇatas patiryo brahmaṇe prathamo ghā avindat indro yo dasyūnradharānavātiran ma...

translations.griffith: He who is Lord of all the world that moves and breathes, who for the Brahman first before all found the Cows;  Indra who cast the Dasyus down beneath his feet,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: यः शूरेभिर्हव्यो यश्च भीरुभिर्यो धावद्भिर्हूयते यश्च जिग्युभिः इन्द्रं यं विश्वा भुवनाभि सन्दधुर्म... |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śūrebhirhavyo yaśca bhīrubhiryo dhāvadbhirhūyate yaśca jighyubhiḥ indraṃ yaṃ viśvā bhuvanābhi sandadhurma...

translations.griffith: Whom cowards must invoke and valiant men of war, invoked by those who conquer and by those who flee;  Indra, to whom all beings turn their constant thought,—him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: रुद्राणामेति परदिशा विचक्षणो रुद्रेभिर्योषा तनुते पर्थु जरयः इन्द्रं मनीषा अभ्यर्चति शरुतं म... |||
verses.transliteration: rudrāṇāmeti pradiśā vicakṣaṇo rudrebhiryoṣā tanute pṛthu jrayaḥ indraṃ manīṣā abhyarcati śrutaṃ ma...

translations.griffith: Refulgent in the Rudras’ region he proceeds, and with the Rudras through the wide space speeds the Dame.  The hymn of praise extols Indra the far-renowned: him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: यद वा मरुत्वः परमे सधस्थे यद वावमे वर्जने मादयासे अत आ याह्यध्वरं नो अछा तवाया हविश्चक्र्मा सत्यराधः |||
verses.transliteration: yad vā marutvaḥ parame sadhasthe yad vāvame vṛjane mādayāse ata ā yāhyadhvaraṃ no achā tvāyā haviścakṛmā satyarādhaḥ

translations.griffith: O girt by Maruts, whether thou delight thee in loftiest gathering-place or lowly dwelling,  Come thence unto our rite, true boon-bestower: through love of thee have we prepared oblations.

verses.sanskrit: तवायेन्द्र सोमं सुषुमा सुदक्ष तवाया हविश्चक्र्मा बरह्मवाहः अधा नियुत्वः सगणो मरुद्भिरस्मिन यज्ञे बर्हिषिमादयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: tvāyendra somaṃ suṣumā sudakṣa tvāyā haviścakṛmā brahmavāhaḥ adhā niyutvaḥ saghaṇo marudbhirasmin yajñe barhiṣimādayasva

translations.griffith: We, fain for thee, strong Indra, have pressed Soma, and, O thou sought with prayer, have made oblations.  Now at this sacrifice, with all thy Maruts, on sacred grass, O team-borne God, rejoice thee.

verses.sanskrit: मादयस्व हरिभिर्ये त इन्द्र वि षयस्व शिप्रे वि सर्जस्व धेने आ तवा सुशिप्र हरयो वहन्तूशन हव्यानि परति नो जुषस्व |||
verses.transliteration: mādayasva haribhirye ta indra vi ṣyasva śipre vi sṛjasva dhene ā tvā suśipra harayo vahantūśan havyāni prati no juṣasva

translations.griffith: Rejoice thee with thine own Bay Steeds, O Indra, unclose thy jaws and let thy lips be open.  Thou with the fair cheek, let thy Bay Steeds bring thee: gracious to us, he pleased with our oblation.

verses.sanskrit: मरुत्स्तोत्रस्य वर्जनस्य गोपा वयमिन्द्रेण सनुयाम वाजम तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: marutstotrasya vṛjanasya ghopā vayamindreṇa sanuyāma vājam tan no ...

translations.griffith: Guards of the camp whose praisers are the Maruts, may we through Indra, get ourselves the booty.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इमां ते धियं पर भरे महो महीमस्य सतोत्रे धिषणायत त आनजे तमुत्सवे च परसवे च सासहिमिन्द्रं देवासः शवसामदन्ननु |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ te dhiyaṃ pra bhare maho mahīmasya stotre dhiṣaṇāyat ta ānaje tamutsave ca prasave ca sāsahimindraṃ devāsaḥ śavasāmadannanu

translations.griffith: To thee the Mighty One I bring this mighty hymn, for thy desire hath been gratified by my laud.  In Indra, yea in him victorious through his strength, the Gods have joyed at feast and when the Soma flowed.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य शरवो नद्यः सप्त बिभ्रति दयावाक्षामा पर्थिवी दर्शतं वपुः अस्मे सूर्याचन्द्रमसाभिचक्षे शरद्धे कमिन्द्र चरतो वितर्तुरम |||
verses.transliteration: asya śravo nadyaḥ sapta bibhrati dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī darśataṃ vapuḥ asme sūryācandramasābhicakṣe śraddhe kamindra carato vitarturam

translations.griffith: The Seven Rivers bear his glory far and wide, and heaven and sky and earth display his comely form.  The Sun and Moon in change alternate run their course, that we, O Indra, may behold and may have faith.

verses.sanskrit: तं समा रथं मघवन्न्प्राव सातये जैत्रं यं ते अनुमदाम संगमे आजा न इन्द्र मनसा पुरुष्टुत तवायद्भ्यो मघवञ्छर्म यछ नः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ smā rathaṃ maghavannprāva sātaye jaitraṃ yaṃ te anumadāma saṃghame ājā na indra manasā puruṣṭuta tvāyadbhyo maghavañcharma yacha naḥ

translations.griffith: Maghavan, grant us that same car to bring us spoil, thy conquering car in which we joy in shock of fight.  Thou, Indra, whom our hearts praise highly in the war, grant shelter, Maghavan, to us who love thee well.

verses.sanskrit: वयं जयेम तवया युजा वर्तमस्माकमंशमुदवा भरे-भरे अस्मभ्यमिन्द्र वरिवः सुगं कर्धि पर शत्रूणांमघवन वर्ष्ण्या रुज |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ jayema tvayā yujā vṛtamasmākamaṃśamudavā bhare-bhare asmabhyamindra varivaḥ sughaṃ kṛdhi pra śatrūṇāṃmaghavan vṛṣṇyā ruja

translations.griffith: Encourage thou our side in every fight: may we, with thee for our ally, conquer the foeman's host.  Indra, bestow on us joy and felicity break down, O Maghavan, the vigour of our foes.

verses.sanskrit: नाना हि तवा हवमाना जना इमे धनानां धर्तरवसाविपन्यवः अस्माकं समा रथमा तिष्ठ सातये जैत्रंहीन्द्र निभ्र्तं मनस्तव |||
verses.transliteration: nānā hi tvā havamānā janā ime dhanānāṃ dhartaravasāvipanyavaḥ asmākaṃ smā rathamā tiṣṭha sātaye jaitraṃhīndra nibhṛtaṃ manastava

translations.griffith: For here in divers ways these men invoking thee, holder of treasures, sing hymns to win thine aid.  Ascend the car that thou mayest bring spoil to us, for, Indra, thy fixt winneth the victory.

verses.sanskrit: गोजिता बाहू अमितक्रतुः सिमः कर्मन कर्मञ्छतमूतिः खजंकरः अकल्प इन्द्रः परतिमानमोजसाथा जना विह्वयन्ते सिषासवः |||
verses.transliteration: ghojitā bāhū amitakratuḥ simaḥ karman karmañchatamūtiḥ khajaṃkaraḥ akalpa indraḥ pratimānamojasāthā janā vihvayante siṣāsavaḥ

translations.griffith: His arms win kine, his power is boundless in each act best, with a hundred helps, waker of battle's din  Is Indra: none may rival him in mighty strength. Hence, eager for the spoil the people call on him.

verses.sanskrit: उत ते शतान मघवन्नुच्च भूयस उत सहस्राद रिरिचे कर्ष्टिषु शरवः अमात्रं तवा धिषणा तित्विषे मह्यधा वर्त्राणि जिघ्नसे पुरन्दर |||
verses.transliteration: ut te śatān maghavannucca bhūyasa ut sahasrād ririce kṛṣṭiṣu śravaḥ amātraṃ tvā dhiṣaṇā titviṣe mahyadhā vṛtrāṇi jighnase purandara

translations.griffith: Thy glory, Maghavan, exceeds a hundred yea, more than a hundred, than a thousand mid the folk,  The great bowl hath inspirited thee boundlessly: so mayst thou slay the Vṛtras, breaker-down of forts!

verses.sanskrit: तरिविष्टिधातु परतिमानमोजसस्तिस्रो भूमीर्न्र्पते तरीणि रोचना अतीदं विश्वं भुवनं ववक्षिथाशत्रुरिन्द्रजनुषा सनादसि |||
verses.transliteration: triviṣṭidhātu pratimānamojasastisro bhūmīrnṛpate trīṇi rocanā atīdaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ vavakṣithāśatrurindrajanuṣā sanādasi

translations.griffith: Of thy great might there is a three counterpart, the three earths, Lord men and the three realms of light.  Above this whole world, Indra, thou hast waxen great: without a foe art thou, nature, from of old.

verses.sanskrit: तवां देवेषु परथमं हवामहे तवं बभूथ पर्तनासु सासहिः सेमं नः कारुमुपमन्युमुद्भिदमिन्द्रः कर्णोतु परसवे रथं पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ deveṣu prathamaṃ havāmahe tvaṃ babhūtha pṛtanāsu sāsahiḥ semaṃ naḥ kārumupamanyumudbhidamindraḥ kṛṇotu prasave rathaṃ puraḥ

translations.griffith: We invocate thee first among the Deities: thou hast become a mighty Conquer in fight.  May Indra fill with spirit this our singer's heart, and make our car impetuous, foremost in attack.

verses.sanskrit: तवं जिगेथ न धना रुरोधिथार्भेष्वाजा मघवन महत्सु च तवामुग्रमवसे सं शिशीमस्यथा न इन्द्र हवनेषु चोदय |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ jighetha na dhanā rurodhithārbheṣvājā maghavan mahatsu ca tvāmughramavase saṃ śiśīmasyathā na indra havaneṣu codaya

translations.griffith: Thou hast prevailed, and hast not kept the booty back, in trifling battles in those of great account.  We make thee keen, the Mighty One, succour us: inspire us, Maghavan, when we defy the foe.

verses.transliteration: viśvāhendro ...

translations.griffith: May Indra evermore be our Protector, and unimperilled may we win the booty.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तत त इन्द्रियं परमं पराचैरधारयन्त कवयः पुरेदम कषमेदमन्यद दिव्यन्यदस्य समी पर्च्यते समनेव केतुः |||
verses.transliteration: tat ta indriyaṃ paramaṃ parācairadhārayanta kavayaḥ puredam kṣamedamanyad divyanyadasya samī pṛcyate samaneva ketuḥ

translations.griffith: THAT highest Indra-power of thine is distant: that which is here sages possessed aforetime.  This one is on the earth, in heaven the other, and both unite as flag with flag in battle.

verses.sanskrit: स धारयत पर्थिवीं पप्रथच्च वज्रेण हत्वा निरपः ससर्ज अहन्नहिमभिनद रौहिणं वयहन वयंसं मघवा शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa dhārayat pṛthivīṃ paprathacca vajreṇa hatvā nirapaḥ sasarja ahannahimabhinad rauhiṇaṃ vyahan vyaṃsaṃ maghavā śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: He spread the wide earth out and firmly fixed it, smote with his thunderbolt and loosed the waters.  Maghavan with his puissance struck down Ahi, rent Rauhiṇa to death and slaughtered Vyaṁsa.

verses.sanskrit: स जातूभर्मा शरद्दधान ओजः पुरो विभिन्दन्नचरद विदासीः विद्वान वज्रिन दस्यवे हेतिमस्यार्यं सहो वर्धया दयुम्नमिन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: sa jātūbharmā śraddadhāna ojaḥ puro vibhindannacarad vidāsīḥ vidvān vajrin dasyave hetimasyāryaṃ saho vardhayā dyumnamindra

translations.griffith: Armed with his bolt and trusting in his prowess he wandered shattering the forts of Dāsas.  Cast thy dart, knowing, Thunderer, at the Dasyu; increase the Ārya's might and glory, Indra.

verses.sanskrit: तदूचुषे मानुषेमा युगानि कीर्तेन्यं मघवा नाम बिभ्रत उपप्रयन दस्युहत्याय वज्री यद ध सूनुः शरवसे नाम दधे |||
verses.transliteration: tadūcuṣe mānuṣemā yughāni kīrtenyaṃ maghavā nāma bibhrat upaprayan dasyuhatyāya vajrī yad dha sūnuḥ śravase nāma dadhe

translations.griffith: For him who thus hath taught these human races, Maghavan, bearing a fame-worthy title,  Thunderer, drawing nigh to slay the Dasyus, hath given himself the name of Son for glory.

verses.sanskrit: तदस्येदं पश्यता भूरि पुष्टं शरदिन्द्रस्य धत्तन वीर्याय स गा अविन्दत सो अविन्ददश्वान स ओषधीः सोपः स वनानि |||
verses.transliteration: tadasyedaṃ paśyatā bhūri puṣṭaṃ śradindrasya dhattana vīryāya sa ghā avindat so avindadaśvān sa oṣadhīḥ soapaḥ sa vanāni

translations.griffith: See this abundant wealth that he possesses, and put your trust in Indra's hero vigour.  He found the cattle, and he found the horses, he found the plants, the forests and the waters.

verses.sanskrit: भुरिकर्मणे वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे सत्यशुष्माय सुनवाम सोमम य आद्र्त्या परिपन्थीव शूरो.अयज्वनो विभजन्नेति वेदः |||
verses.transliteration: bhurikarmaṇe vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe satyaśuṣmāya sunavāma somam ya ādṛtyā paripanthīva śūro.ayajvano vibhajanneti vedaḥ

translations.griffith: To him the truly strong, whose deeds are many, to him the strong Bull let us pour the Soma.  The Hero, watching like a thief in ambush, goes parting the possessions of the godless.

verses.sanskrit: तदिन्द्र परेव वीर्यं चकर्थ यत ससन्तं वज्रेणाबोधयो.अहिम अनु तवा पत्नीर्ह्र्षितं वयश्च विश्वे देवासो अमदन्ननु तवा |||
verses.transliteration: tadindra preva vīryaṃ cakartha yat sasantaṃ vajreṇābodhayo.ahim anu tvā patnīrhṛṣitaṃ vayaśca viśve devāso amadannanu tvā

translations.griffith: Well didst thou do that hero deed, O Indra, in waking with thy bolt the slumbering Ahi.  in thee, delighted, Dames divine rejoiced them, the flying Maruts and all Gods were joyful.

verses.sanskrit: शुष्णं पिप्रुं कुयवं वर्त्रमिन्द्र यदावधीर्वि पुरःशम्बरस्य तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: śuṣṇaṃ pipruṃ kuyavaṃ vṛtramindra yadāvadhīrvi puraḥśambarasya tan no ...

translations.griffith: As thou hast smitten Śuṣṇa, Pipru, Vṛtra and Kuyava, and Śambara's forts  ,  O Indra.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: योनिष ट इन्द्र निषदे अकारि तमा नि षीद सवानो नार्वा विमुच्य वयो.अवसायाश्वान दोषा वस्तोर्वहीयसः परपित्वे |||
verses.transliteration: yoniṣ ṭa indra niṣade akāri tamā ni ṣīda svāno nārvā vimucya vayo.avasāyāśvān doṣā vastorvahīyasaḥ prapitve

translations.griffith: THE altar hath been made for thee to rest on: come like a panting courser and be seated.  Loosen thy flying Steeds, set free thy Horses who bear thee swiftly nigh at eve and morning.

verses.sanskrit: ओ तये नर इन्द्रमूतये गुर्नू चित तान सद्यो अध्वनो जगम्यात देवासो मन्युं दासस्य शचम्नन ते न आ वक्षन सुविताय वर्णम |||
verses.transliteration: o tye nara indramūtaye ghurnū cit tān sadyo adhvano jaghamyāt devāso manyuṃ dāsasya ścamnan te na ā vakṣan suvitāya varṇam

translations.griffith: These men have come to Indra for assistance: shall he not quickly come upon these pathways?  May the Gods quell the fury of the Dāsa, and may they lead our folk to happy fortune.

verses.sanskrit: अव तमन भरते केतवेदा अव तमना भरते फेनमुदन कषीरेण सनातः कुयवस्य योषे हते ते सयातां परवणे शिफायाः |||
verses.transliteration: ava tmana bharate ketavedā ava tmanā bharate phenamudan kṣīreṇa snātaḥ kuyavasya yoṣe hate te syātāṃ pravaṇe śiphāyāḥ

translations.griffith: He who hath only wish as his possession casts on himself, casts foam amid the waters.  Both wives of Kuyava in milk have bathed them: may they be drowned within the depth of Śiphā.

verses.sanskrit: युयोप नाभिरुपरस्यायोः पर पूर्वाभिस्तिरते राष्टि शूरः अञ्जसी कुलिशी वीरपत्नी पयो हिन्वाना उदभिर्भरन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: yuyopa nābhiruparasyāyoḥ pra pūrvābhistirate rāṣṭi śūraḥ añjasī kuliśī vīrapatnī payo hinvānā udabhirbharante

translations.griffith: This hath his kinship checked who lives beside us: with ancient streams forth speeds and rules the Hero,  Añjasī, Kuliśī, and Virapatnī, delighting him, bear milk upon their waters.

verses.sanskrit: परति यत सया नीथादर्शि दस्योरोको नाछा सदनं जानती गात अध समा नो मघवञ्चर्क्र्तादिन मा नो मघेव निष्षपी परा दाः |||
verses.transliteration: prati yat syā nīthādarśi dasyoroko nāchā sadanaṃ jānatī ghāt adha smā no maghavañcarkṛtādin mā no magheva niṣṣapī parā dāḥ

translations.griffith: Soon as this Dasyu's traces were discovered, as she who knows her home, he sought the dwelling.  Now think thou of us, Maghavan, nor cast us away as doth a profligate his treasure.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं न इन्द्र सूर्ये सो अप्स्वनागास्त्व आ भज जीवशंसे मान्तरां भुजमा रीरिषो नः शरद्धितं ते महत इन्द्रियाय |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indra sūrye so apsvanāghāstva ā bhaja jīvaśaṃse māntarāṃ bhujamā rīriṣo naḥ śraddhitaṃ te mahata indriyāya

translations.griffith: Indra, as such, give us a share of sunlight, of waters, sinlessness, and reputation.  Do thou no harm to our yet unborn offspring: our trust is in thy mighty Indra-power.

verses.sanskrit: अधा मन्ये शरत ते अस्मा अधायि वर्षा चोदस्व महते धनाय मा नो अक्र्ते पुरुहूत योनाविन्द्र कषुध्यद्भ्यो वय आसुतिं दाः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā manye śrat te asmā adhāyi vṛṣā codasva mahate dhanāya mā no akṛte puruhūta yonāvindra kṣudhyadbhyo vaya āsutiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: Now we, I think, in thee as such have trusted: lead us on, Mighty One, to ample riches.  In no unready house give us, O Indra invoked of many, food and drink when hungry.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो वधीरिन्द्र मा परा दा मा नः परिया भोजनानि पर मोषीः आण्डा मा नो मघवञ्छक्र निर्भेन मा नः पात्रा भेत सहजानुषाणि |||
verses.transliteration: mā no vadhīrindra mā parā dā mā naḥ priyā bhojanāni pra moṣīḥ āṇḍā mā no maghavañchakra nirbhen mā naḥ pātrā bhet sahajānuṣāṇi

translations.griffith: Slay us not, Indra; do not thou forsake us: steal not away the joys which we delight in.  Rend not our unborn brood, strong Lord of Bounty! our vessels with the life that is within them.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वां एहि सोमकामं तवाहुरयं सुतस्तस्य पिबा मदाय उरुव्यचा जथर आ वर्षस्व पितेव नः शर्णुहि हूयमानः |||
verses.transliteration: arvāṃ ehi somakāmaṃ tvāhurayaṃ sutastasya pibā madāya uruvyacā jathara ā vṛṣasva piteva naḥ śṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Come to us; they have called thee Soma-lover: here is the pressed juice. Drink thereof for rapture.  Widely-capacious, pour it down within thee, and, invocated, hear us like a Father.

verses.sanskrit: चन्द्रमा अप्स्वन्तरा सुपर्णो धावते दिवि न वो हिरण्यनेमयः पदं विन्दन्ति विद्युतो वित्तं मे अस्य रोदसी |||
verses.transliteration: candramā apsvantarā suparṇo dhāvate divi na vo hiraṇyanemayaḥ padaṃ vindanti vidyuto vittaṃ me asya rodasī

translations.griffith: WITHIN the waters runs the Moon, he with the beauteous wings in heaven.  Ye lightnings with your golden wheels, men find not your abiding-place. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अर्थमिद वा उ अर्थिन आ जाया युवते पतिम तुञ्जाते वर्ष्ण्यं पयः परिदाय रसं दुहे वित्तम... |||
verses.transliteration: arthamid vā u arthina ā jāyā yuvate patim tuñjāte vṛṣṇyaṃ payaḥ paridāya rasaṃ duhe vittam...

translations.griffith: Surely men crave and gain their wish. Close to her husband clings the wife.  And, in embraces intertwined, both give and take the bliss of love. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: मो षु देव अदः सवरव पादि दिवस परि मा सोम्यस्य शम्भुवः शूने भूम कदा चन वित्तम... |||
verses.transliteration: mo ṣu deva adaḥ svarava pādi divas pari mā somyasya śambhuvaḥ śūne bhūma kadā cana vittam...

translations.griffith: O never may that light, ye Gods, fall from its station in the sky.  Ne’er fail us one like Soma sweet, the spring of our felicity. Mark this my woe  ,  ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञं पर्छाम्यवमं स तद दूतो वि वोचति कव रतं पूर्व्यं गतं कस्तद बिभर्ति नूतनो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: yajñaṃ pṛchāmyavamaṃ sa tad dūto vi vocati kva ṛtaṃ pūrvyaṃ ghataṃ kastad bibharti nūtano vi...

translations.griffith: I ask the last of sacrifice. As envoy he shall tell it forth.  Where is the ancient law divine? Who is its new diffuser now? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अमी ये देवा सथन तरिष्वा रोचने दिवः कद व रतं कदन्र्तं कव परत्ना व आहुतिर्वि... |||
verses.transliteration: amī ye devā sthana triṣvā rocane divaḥ kad va ṛtaṃ kadanṛtaṃ kva pratnā va āhutirvi...

translations.griffith: Ye Gods who yonder have your home in the three lucid realms of heaven,  What count ye truth and what untruth? Where is mine ancient call on you? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: कद व रतस्य धर्णसि कद वरुणस्य चक्षणम कदर्यम्णो महस पथाति करामेम दूढ्यो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: kad va ṛtasya dharṇasi kad varuṇasya cakṣaṇam kadaryamṇo mahas pathāti krāmema dūḍhyo vi...

translations.griffith: What is your firm support of Law? What Varuṇa's observant eye?  How may we pass the wicked on the path of mighty Aryaman? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अहम सो अस्मि यः पुरा सुते वदामि कानि चित तं मा वयन्त्याध्यो वर्को न तर्ष्णजं मर्गं वि... |||
verses.transliteration: aham so asmi yaḥ purā sute vadāmi kāni cit taṃ mā vyantyādhyo vṛko na tṛṣṇajaṃ mṛghaṃ vi...

translations.griffith: I am the man who sang of old full many a laud when Soma flowed.  Yet torturing cares consume me as the wolf assails the thirsty deer. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सं मा तपन्त्यभितः सपत्नीरिव पर्शवः मूषो न शिश्ना वयदन्ति माध्य सतोतारं ते शतक्रतो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ mā tapantyabhitaḥ sapatnīriva parśavaḥ mūṣo na śiśnā vyadanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato vi...

translations.griffith: Like rival wives on every side enclosing ribs oppress me sore.  O Śatakratu, biting cares devour me, singer of thy praise, as rats devour the weaver's threads. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अमी ये सप्त रश्मयस्तत्रा मे नाभिरातता तरितस्तद वेदाप्त्यः स जामित्वाय रेभति वि... |||
verses.transliteration: amī ye sapta raśmayastatrā me nābhirātatā tritastad vedāptyaḥ sa jāmitvāya rebhati vi...

translations.griffith: Where those seven rays are shining, thence my home and family extend.  This Tṛta Āptya knoweth well, and speaketh out for brotherhood. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अमी ये पञ्चोक्षणो मध्ये तस्थुर्महो दिवः देवत्रा नु परवाच्यं सध्रीचीना नि वाव्र्तुर्वि... |||
verses.transliteration: amī ye pañcokṣaṇo madhye tasthurmaho divaḥ devatrā nu pravācyaṃ sadhrīcīnā ni vāvṛturvi...

translations.griffith: May those five Bulls which stand on high full in the midst of mighty heaven,  Having together swiftly borne my praises to the Gods, return. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सुपर्णा एत आसते मध्य आरोधने दिवः ते सेधन्ति पथो वर्कं तरन्तं यह्वतीरपो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: suparṇā eta āsate madhya ārodhane divaḥ te sedhanti patho vṛkaṃ tarantaṃ yahvatīrapo vi...

translations.griffith: High in the mid ascent of heaven those Birds of beauteous pinion sit.  Back from his path they drive the wolf as he would cross the restless floods. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: नव्यं तदुक्थ्यं हितं देवासः सुप्रवाचनम रतमर्षन्ति सिन्धवः सत्यं तातान सूर्यो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: navyaṃ tadukthyaṃ hitaṃ devāsaḥ supravācanam ṛtamarṣanti sindhavaḥ satyaṃ tātāna sūryo vi...

translations.griffith: Firm is this new-wrought hymn of praise, and meet to be told forth, O Gods.  The flowing of the floods is Law, Truth is the Sun's extended light. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तव तयदुक्थ्यं देवेष्वस्त्याप्यम स नः सत्तो मनुष्वदा देवान यक्षि विदुष्टरो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tava tyadukthyaṃ deveṣvastyāpyam sa naḥ satto manuṣvadā devān yakṣi viduṣṭaro vi...

translations.griffith: Worthy of laud, O Agni, is that kinship which thou hast with Gods.  Here seat thee like a man: most wise, bring thou the Gods for sacrifice. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सत्तो होता मनुष्वदा देवानछा विदुष्टरः अग्निर्हव्या सुषूदति देवो देवेषु मेधिरो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: satto hotā manuṣvadā devānachā viduṣṭaraḥ aghnirhavyā suṣūdati devo deveṣu medhiro vi...

translations.griffith: Here seated, man-like as a priest shall wisest Agni to the Gods  Speed onward our oblations, God among the Gods, intelligent. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मा कर्णोति वरुणो गातुविदं तमीमहे वयूर्णोति हर्दा मतिं नव्यो जायतां रतं वि... |||
verses.transliteration: brahmā kṛṇoti varuṇo ghātuvidaṃ tamīmahe vyūrṇoti hṛdā matiṃ navyo jāyatāṃ ṛtaṃ vi...

translations.griffith: Varuṇa makes the holy prayer. To him who finds the path we pray.  He in the heart reveals his thought. Let sacred worship rise anew. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: असौ यः पन्था आदित्यो दिवि परवाच्यं कर्तः न स देवा अतिक्रमे तं मर्तासो न पश्यथ वि... |||
verses.transliteration: asau yaḥ panthā ādityo divi pravācyaṃ kṛtaḥ na sa devā atikrame taṃ martāso na paśyatha vi...

translations.griffith: That pathway of the Sun in heaven, made to be highly glorified,  Is not to be transgressed, O Gods. O mortals, ye behold it not. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तरितः कूपे.अवहितो देवान हवत ऊतये तच्छुश्राव बर्हस्पतिः कर्ण्वन्नंहूरणादुरु वि... |||
verses.transliteration: tritaḥ kūpe.avahito devān havata ūtaye tacchuśrāva bṛhaspatiḥ kṛṇvannaṃhūraṇāduru vi...

translations.griffith: Tṛta, when buried in the well, calls on the Gods to succour him.  That call of his Bṛhaspati heard and released him from distress. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अरुणो मा सक्र्द वर्कः पथा यन्तं ददर्श हि उज्जिहीते निचाय्या तष्टेव पर्ष्ट्यामयी वि... |||
verses.transliteration: aruṇo mā sakṛd vṛkaḥ pathā yantaṃ dadarśa hi ujjihīte nicāyyā taṣṭeva pṛṣṭyāmayī vi...

translations.griffith: A ruddy wolf beheld me once, as I was faring on my path.  He, like a carpenter whose back is aching crouched and slunk away. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: एनाङगूषेण वयमिन्द्रवन्तो.अभि षयाम वर्जने सर्ववीराः तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: enāṅghūṣeṇa vayamindravanto.abhi ṣyāma vṛjane sarvavīrāḥ tan no ...

translations.griffith: Through this our song may we, allied with Indra, with all our heroes conquer in the battle.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणमग्निमूतये मारुतं शर्धो अदितिंहवामहे रथं न दुर्गाद वसवः सुदानवो विश्वस्मान नोंहसो निष पिपर्तन |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇamaghnimūtaye mārutaṃ śardho aditiṃhavāmahe rathaṃ na durghād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān noaṃhaso niṣ pipartana

translations.griffith: CALL we for aid on Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni and the Marut host and Aditi.  Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit: त आदित्या आ गता सर्वतातये भूत देवा वर्त्रतूर्येषु शम्भुवः रथं ... |||
verses.transliteration: ta ādityā ā ghatā sarvatātaye bhūta devā vṛtratūryeṣu śambhuvaḥ rathaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Come ye Ādityas for our full prosperity, in conquests of the foe, ye Gods, bring joy to us.  Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit: अवन्तु नः पितरः सुप्रवाचना उत देवी देवपुत्रे रताव्र्धा रथं ... |||
verses.transliteration: avantu naḥ pitaraḥ supravācanā uta devī devaputre ṛtāvṛdhā rathaṃ ...

translations.griffith: May the most glorious Fathers aid us, and the two Goddesses, Mothers of the Gods, who strengthen Law.  Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit: नराशंसं वाजिनं वाजयन्निह कषयद्वीरं पूषणं सुम्नैरीमहे रथं ... |||
verses.transliteration: narāśaṃsaṃ vājinaṃ vājayanniha kṣayadvīraṃ pūṣaṇaṃ sumnairīmahe rathaṃ ...

translations.griffith: To mighty Narāśaṁsa, strengthening his might, to Pūṣan, ruler over men, we pray with hymns.  Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते सदमिन नः सुगं कर्धि शं योर्यत ते मनुर्हितं तदीमहे रथं ... |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate sadamin naḥ sughaṃ kṛdhi śaṃ yoryat te manurhitaṃ tadīmahe rathaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, make us evermore an easy path: we crave what boon thou hast for men in rest and stir.  Like as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं कुत्सो वर्त्रहणं शचीपतिं काटे निबाळ्ह रषिरह्वदूतये रथं ... |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ kutso vṛtrahaṇaṃ śacīpatiṃ kāṭe nibāḷha ṛṣirahvadūtaye rathaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Sunk in the pit the Ṛṣi Kutsa called, to aid, Indra the Vṛtra-slayer, Lord of power and might.  Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit: देवैर्नो देव्यदितिर्नि पातु देवस्त्राता तरायतामप्रयुछन तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: devairno devyaditirni pātu devastrātā trāyatāmaprayuchan tan no ...

translations.griffith: May Aditi the Goddess guard us with the Gods: may the protecting God keep us with ceaseless care.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञो देवानां परत्येति सुम्नमादित्यासो भवता मर्ळयन्तः आ वो.अर्वाची सुमतिर्वव्र्त्यादंहोश्चिद या वरिवोवित्तरासत |||
verses.transliteration: yajño devānāṃ pratyeti sumnamādityāso bhavatā mṛḷayantaḥ ā vo.arvācī sumatirvavṛtyādaṃhościd yā varivovittarāsat

translations.griffith: THE sacrifice obtains the Gods’ acceptance: be graciously inclined to us, Ādityas.  Hitherward let your favour be directed, and be our best deliverer from trouble.

verses.sanskrit: उप नो देवा अवसा गमन्त्वङगिरसां सामभिः सतूयमानाः इन्द्र इन्द्रियैर्मरुतो मरुद्भिरादित्यैर्नो अदितिः शर्म यंसत |||
verses.transliteration: upa no devā avasā ghamantvaṅghirasāṃ sāmabhiḥ stūyamānāḥ indra indriyairmaruto marudbhirādityairno aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat

translations.griffith: By praise-songs of Aṅgirases exalted, may the Gods come to us with their protection.  May Indra with his powers, Maruts with Maruts, Aditi with Ādityas grant us shelter.

verses.sanskrit: तन न इन्द्रस्तद वरुणस्तदग्निस्तदर्यमा तत सविताचनो धात तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: tan na indrastad varuṇastadaghnistadaryamā tat savitācano dhāt tan no ...

translations.griffith: This laud of ours may Varuṇa and Indra, Aryaman Agni, Savitar find pleasant.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: य इन्द्राग्नी चित्रतमो रथो वामभि विश्वानि भुवनानि चष्टे तेना यातं सरथं तस्थिवांसाथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: ya indrāghnī citratamo ratho vāmabhi viśvāni bhuvanāni caṣṭe tenā yātaṃ sarathaṃ tasthivāṃsāthā somasya pibataṃ sutasya

translations.griffith: ON that most wondrous car of yours, O Indra and Agni, which looks round on all things living,  Take ye your stand and come to us together, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यावदिदं भुवनं विश्वमस्त्युरुव्यचा वरिमता गभीरम तावानयं पातवे सोमो अस्त्वरमिन्द्राग्नी मनसे युवभ्याम |||
verses.transliteration: yāvadidaṃ bhuvanaṃ viśvamastyuruvyacā varimatā ghabhīram tāvānayaṃ pātave somo astvaramindrāghnī manase yuvabhyām

translations.griffith: As vast as all this world is in its compass, deep as it is, with its far-stretching surface,  So let this Soma be, Indra and Agni, made for your drinking till your soul be sated.

verses.sanskrit: चक्राथे हि सध्र्यं नाम भद्रं सध्रीचीना वर्त्रहणाुत सथः ताविन्द्राग्नी सध्र्यञ्चा निषद्या वर्ष्णः सोमस्य वर्षणा वर्षेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: cakrāthe hi sadhryaṃ nāma bhadraṃ sadhrīcīnā vṛtrahaṇāuta sthaḥ tāvindrāghnī sadhryañcā niṣadyā vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām

translations.griffith: For ye have won a blessed name together: yea, with one aim ye strove, O Vṛtra-slayers.  So Indra-Agni, seated here together, pour in, ye Mighty Ones, the mighty Soma.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धेष्वग्निष्वानजाना यतस्रुचा बर्हिरु तिस्तिराणा तीव्रैः सोमैः परिषिक्तेभिरर्वागेन्द्राग्नी सौमनसाय यातम |||
verses.transliteration: samiddheṣvaghniṣvānajānā yatasrucā barhiru tistirāṇā tīvraiḥ somaiḥ pariṣiktebhirarvāghendrāghnī saumanasāya yātam

translations.griffith: Both stand adorned, when fires are duly kindled, spreading the sacred grass, with lifted ladles.  Drawn by strong Soma juice poured forth around us, come, Indra-Agni, and display your favour.

verses.sanskrit: यानीन्द्राग्नी चक्रथुर्वीर्याणि यानि रूपाण्युत वर्ष्ण्यानि या वां परत्नानि सख्या शिवानि तेभिः सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: yānīndrāghnī cakrathurvīryāṇi yāni rūpāṇyuta vṛṣṇyāni yā vāṃ pratnāni sakhyā śivāni tebhiḥ somasya pibataṃ sutasya

translations.griffith: The brave deeds ye have done, Indra and Agni, the forms ye have displayed and mighty exploits,  The ancient and auspicious bonds of friendship,—for sake of these drink of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यदब्रवं परथमं वां वर्णानो.अयं सोमो असुरैर्नो विहव्यः तां सत्यां शरद्धामभ्या हि यातमथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: yadabravaṃ prathamaṃ vāṃ vṛṇāno.ayaṃ somo asurairno vihavyaḥ tāṃ satyāṃ śraddhāmabhyā hi yātamathā somasya pibataṃ sutasya

translations.griffith: As first I said when choosing you, in battle we must contend with Asuras for this Soma.  So came ye unto this my true conviction, and drank libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी मदथः सवे दुरोणे यद बरह्मणि राजनि वायजत्रा अतः परि वर्षणावा हि यातमथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāghnī madathaḥ sve duroṇe yad brahmaṇi rājani vāyajatrā ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāvā hi yātamathā somasya pibataṃ sutasya

translations.griffith: If in your dwelling, or with prince or Brahman, ye, Indra-Agni, Holy Ones, rejoice you,  Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libation of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी यदुषु तुर्वशेषु यद दरुह्युष्वनुषु पूरुषु सथः अतः ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāghnī yaduṣu turvaśeṣu yad druhyuṣvanuṣu pūruṣu sthaḥ ataḥ ...

translations.griffith: If with, the Yadus, Turvaśas, ye sojourn, with Druhyus, Anus, Pūrus, Indra-Agni!  Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी अवमस्यां पर्थिव्यां मध्यमस्यां परमस्यामुत सथः अतः ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāghnī avamasyāṃ pṛthivyāṃ madhyamasyāṃ paramasyāmuta sthaḥ ataḥ ...

translations.griffith: Whether, O Indra-Agni, ye be dwelling in lowest earth, in central, or in highest.  Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी परमस्यां पर्थिव्यां मध्यमस्यामवमस्यामुत सथः अतः ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāghnī paramasyāṃ pṛthivyāṃ madhyamasyāmavamasyāmuta sthaḥ ataḥ ...

translations.griffith: Whether, O Indra-Agni, ye be dwelling in highest earth, in central, or in lowest,  Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी दिवि षठो यत पर्थिव्यां यत पर्वतेष्वोषधीष्वप्सु अतः ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāghnī divi ṣṭho yat pṛthivyāṃ yat parvateṣvoṣadhīṣvapsu ataḥ ...

translations.griffith: Whether ye be in heaven, O Indra-Agni, on earth, on mountains, in the herbs, or waters,  Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी उदिता सूर्यस्य मध्ये दिवः सवधया मादयेथे अतः ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāghnī uditā sūryasya madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayethe ataḥ ...

translations.griffith: If, when the Sun to the mid-heaven hath mounted, ye take delight in food, O Indra-Agni,  Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: एवेन्द्राग्नी पपिवांसा सुतस्य विश्वास्मभ्यं सं जयतन्धनानि तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: evendrāghnī papivāṃsā sutasya viśvāsmabhyaṃ saṃ jayatandhanāni tan no ...

translations.griffith: Thus having drunk your fill of our libation, win us all kinds of wealth, Indra and Agni.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वि हयख्यं मनसा वस्य इछन्निन्द्राग्नी जञास उत वा सजातान नान्या युवत परमतिरस्ति मह्यं स वां धियं वाजयन्तीमतक्षम |||
verses.transliteration: vi hyakhyaṃ manasā vasya ichannindrāghnī jñāsa uta vā sajātān nānyā yuvat pramatirasti mahyaṃ sa vāṃ dhiyaṃ vājayantīmatakṣam

translations.griffith: LONGING for weal I looked around, in spirit, for kinsmen, Indra-Agni, or for brothers.  No providence but yours alone is with me so have I wrought for you this hymn for succour.

verses.sanskrit: अश्रवं हि भूरिदावत्तरा वां विजामातुरुत वा घा सयालात अथा सोमस्य परयती युवभ्यामिन्द्राग्नी सतोमं जनयामि नव्यम |||
verses.transliteration: aśravaṃ hi bhūridāvattarā vāṃ vijāmāturuta vā ghā syālāt athā somasya prayatī yuvabhyāmindrāghnī stomaṃ janayāmi navyam

translations.griffith: For I have heard that ye give wealth more freely than worthless son-in-law or spouse's brother.  So offering to you this draught of Soma, I make you this new hymn, Indra and Agni,

verses.sanskrit: मा छेद्म रश्मीन्रिति नाधमानाः पितॄणां शक्तीरनुयछमानाः इन्द्राग्निभ्यां कं वर्षणो मदन्ति ता हयद्री धिषणाया उपस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: mā chedma raśmīnriti nādhamānāḥ pitṝṇāṃ śaktīranuyachamānāḥ indrāghnibhyāṃ kaṃ vṛṣaṇo madanti tā hyadrī dhiṣaṇāyā upasthe

translations.griffith: Let us not break the cords: with this petition we strive to gain the powers of our forefathers.  For Indra-Agni the strong drops are joyful, for here in the bowl's lap are both the press-stones.

verses.sanskrit: युवाभ्यां देवी धिषणा मदायेन्द्राग्नी सोममुशती सुनोति तावश्विना भद्रहस्ता सुपाणी आ धावतं मधुना पर्ङकतमप्सु |||
verses.transliteration: yuvābhyāṃ devī dhiṣaṇā madāyendrāghnī somamuśatī sunoti tāvaśvinā bhadrahastā supāṇī ā dhāvataṃ madhunā pṛṅktamapsu

translations.griffith: For you the bowl divine, Indra and Agni, presses the Soma gladly to delight you.  With hands auspicious and fair arms, ye Aśvins, haste, sprinkle it with sweetness in the waters.

verses.sanskrit: युवामिन्द्राग्नी वसुनो विभागे तवस्तमा शुश्रव वर्त्रहत्ये तावासद्या बर्हिषि यज्ञे अस्मिन पर चर्षणी मादयेथां सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāmindrāghnī vasuno vibhāghe tavastamā śuśrava vṛtrahatye tāvāsadyā barhiṣi yajñe asmin pra carṣaṇī mādayethāṃ sutasya

translations.griffith: You, I have heard, were mightiest, Indra-Agni, when Vṛtra fell and when the spoil was parted.  Sit at this sacrifice, ye ever active, on the strewn grass, and with the juice delight you.

verses.sanskrit: पर चर्षणिभ्यः पर्तनाहवेषु पर पर्थिव्या रिरिचाथे दिवश्च पर सिन्धुभ्यः पर गिरिभ्यो महित्वा परेन्द्राग्नी विश्वा भुवनात्यन्या |||
verses.transliteration: pra carṣaṇibhyaḥ pṛtanāhaveṣu pra pṛthivyā riricāthe divaśca pra sindhubhyaḥ pra ghiribhyo mahitvā prendrāghnī viśvā bhuvanātyanyā

translations.griffith: Surpassing all men where they shout for battle, ye Twain exceed the earth and heaven in greatness.  Greater are ye than rivers and than mountains, O Indra-Agni, and all things beside them.

verses.sanskrit: आ भरतं शिक्षतं वज्रबाहू अस्मानिन्द्राग्नी अवतं शचीभिः इमे नु ते रश्मयः सूर्यस्य येभिः सपित्वं पितरो न आसन |||
verses.transliteration: ā bharataṃ śikṣataṃ vajrabāhū asmānindrāghnī avataṃ śacībhiḥ ime nu te raśmayaḥ sūryasya yebhiḥ sapitvaṃ pitaro na āsan

translations.griffith: Bring wealth and give it, ye whose arms wield thunder: Indra and Agni, with your powers protect us.  Now of a truth these be the very sunbeams wherewith our fathers were of old united.

verses.sanskrit: पुरन्दरा शिक्षतं वज्रहस्तास्मानिन्द्राग्नी अवतं भरेषु तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: purandarā śikṣataṃ vajrahastāsmānindrāghnī avataṃ bhareṣu tan no ...

translations.griffith: Give, ye who shatter forts, whose hands wield thunder: Indra and Agni, save us in our battles.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: ततं मे अपस्तदु तायते पुनः सवादिष्ठा धीतिरुचथाय शस्यते अयं समुद्र इह विश्वदेव्यः सवाहाक्र्तस्य समु तर्प्णुत रभवः |||
verses.transliteration: tataṃ me apastadu tāyate punaḥ svādiṣṭhā dhītirucathāya śasyate ayaṃ samudra iha viśvadevyaḥ svāhākṛtasya samu tṛpṇuta ṛbhavaḥ

translations.griffith: THE holy work I wrought before is wrought again: my sweetest hymn is sung to celebrate your praise.  Here, O ye Ṛbhus, is this sea for all the Gods: sate you with Soma offered with the hallowing word.

verses.sanskrit: आभोगयं पर यदिछन्त ऐतनापाकाः पराञ्चो मम के चिदापयः सौधन्वनासश्चरितस्य भूमनागछत सवितुर्दाशुषो गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: ābhoghayaṃ pra yadichanta aitanāpākāḥ prāñco mama ke cidāpayaḥ saudhanvanāsaścaritasya bhūmanāghachata saviturdāśuṣo ghṛham

translations.griffith: When, seeking your enjoyment onward from afar, ye, certain of my kinsmen, wandered on your way,  Sons of Sudhanvan, after your long journeying, ye came unto the home of liberal Savitar.

verses.sanskrit: तत सविता वो.अम्र्तत्वामासुवदगोह्यं यच्छ्रवयन्त ऐतन तयं चिच्चमसमसुरस्य भक्षणमेकं सन्तमक्र्णुता चतुर्वयम |||
verses.transliteration: tat savitā vo.amṛtatvāmāsuvadaghohyaṃ yacchravayanta aitana tyaṃ ciccamasamasurasya bhakṣaṇamekaṃ santamakṛṇutā caturvayam

translations.griffith: Savitar therefore gave you immortality, because ye came proclaiming him whom naught can hide;  And this the drinking-chalice of the Asura, which till that time was one, ye made to be fourfold.

verses.sanskrit: विष्ट्वी शमी तरणित्वेन वाघतो मर्तासः सन्तो अम्र्तत्वमानशुः सौधन्वना रभवः सूरचक्षसः संवत्सरे समप्र्च्यन्त धीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: viṣṭvī śamī taraṇitvena vāghato martāsaḥ santo amṛtatvamānaśuḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavaḥ sūracakṣasaḥ saṃvatsare samapṛcyanta dhītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: When they had served with zeal at sacrifice as priests, they, mortal as they were, gained immortality.  The Ṛbhus, children of Sudhanvan, bright as suns, were in a year's course made associate with prayers.

verses.sanskrit: कषेत्रमिव वि ममुस्तेजनेनमेकं पात्रं रभवो जेहमानम उपस्तुता उपमं नाधमाना अमर्त्येषु शरव इछमानाः |||
verses.transliteration: kṣetramiva vi mamustejanenamekaṃ pātraṃ ṛbhavo jehamānam upastutā upamaṃ nādhamānā amartyeṣu śrava ichamānāḥ

translations.griffith: The Ṛbhus, with a rod measured, as ’twere a field, the single sacrificial chalice. wide of mouth,  Lauded of all who saw, praying for what is best, desiring glorious fame among Immortal Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ मनीषामन्तरिक्षस्य नर्भ्यः सरुचेव घर्तं जुहवाम विद्मना तरणित्वा ये पितुरस्य सश्चिर रभवो वाजमरुहन दिवो रजः |||
verses.transliteration: ā manīṣāmantarikṣasya nṛbhyaḥ sruceva ghṛtaṃ juhavāma vidmanā taraṇitvā ye piturasya saścira ṛbhavo vājamaruhan divo rajaḥ

translations.griffith: As oil in ladles, we through knowledge will present unto the Heroes of the firmament our hymn,—  The Ṛbhus who came near with this great Father's speed, and rose to heaven's high sphere to eat the strengthening food.

verses.sanskrit: रभुर्न इन्द्रः शवसा नवीयान रभुर्वाजेभिर्वसुभिर्वसुर्ददिः युष्माकं देवा अवसाहनि परिये.अभि तिष्ठेमप्र्त्सुतीरसुन्वताम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhurna indraḥ śavasā navīyān ṛbhurvājebhirvasubhirvasurdadiḥ yuṣmākaṃ devā avasāhani priye.abhi tiṣṭhemapṛtsutīrasunvatām

translations.griffith: Ṛbhu to us is Indra freshest in his might, Ṛbhu with powers and wealth is giver of rich gifts.  Gods, through your favour may we on the happy day quell the attacks of those who pour no offerings forth.

verses.sanskrit: निश्चर्मण रभवो गामपिंशत सं वत्सेनास्र्जता मातरं पुनः सौधन्वनासः सवपस्यया नरो जिव्री युवाना पितराक्र्णोतन |||
verses.transliteration: niścarmaṇa ṛbhavo ghāmapiṃśata saṃ vatsenāsṛjatā mātaraṃ punaḥ saudhanvanāsaḥ svapasyayā naro jivrī yuvānā pitarākṛṇotana

translations.griffith: Out of a skin, O Ṛbhus, once ye formed a cow, and brought the mother close unto her calf again.  Sons of Sudhanvan, Heroes, with surpassing skill ye made your aged Parents youthful as before.

verses.sanskrit: वाजेभिर्नो वाजसातावविड्ढ्य रभुमानिन्द्र चित्रमा दर्षि राधः तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: vājebhirno vājasātāvaviḍḍhy ṛbhumānindra citramā darṣi rādhaḥ tan no ...

translations.griffith: Help us with strength where spoil is won, O Indra: joined with the Ṛbhus give us varied bounty.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तक्षन रथं सुव्र्तं विदम्नापसस्तक्षन हरी इन्द्रवाहा वर्षण्वसू तक्षन पित्र्भ्यां रभवो युवद वयस्तक्षन्वत्साय मातरं सचाभुवम |||
verses.transliteration: takṣan rathaṃ suvṛtaṃ vidamnāpasastakṣan harī indravāhā vṛṣaṇvasū takṣan pitṛbhyāṃ ṛbhavo yuvad vayastakṣanvatsāya mātaraṃ sacābhuvam

translations.griffith: WORKING with skill they wrought the lightly rolling car: they wrought the Bays who bear Indra and bring great gifts.  The Ṛbhus for their Parents made life young again; and fashioned for the calf a mother by its side.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो यज्ञाय तक्षत रभुमद वयः करत्वे दक्षाय सुप्रजावतीमिषम यथा कषयाम सर्ववीरया विशा तन नःशर्धाय धासथा सविन्द्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yajñāya takṣata ṛbhumad vayaḥ kratve dakṣāya suprajāvatīmiṣam yathā kṣayāma sarvavīrayā viśā tan naḥśardhāya dhāsathā svindriyam

translations.griffith: For sacrifice make for us active vital power for skill and wisdom food with noble progeny.  Grant to our company this power most excellent, that with a family all-heroic we may dwell.

verses.sanskrit: आ तक्षत सातिमस्मभ्यं रभवः सातिं रथाय सातिमर्वते नरः सातिं नो जैत्रीं सं महेत विश्वहा जामिमजामिं पर्तनासु सक्षणिम |||
verses.transliteration: ā takṣata sātimasmabhyaṃ ṛbhavaḥ sātiṃ rathāya sātimarvate naraḥ sātiṃ no jaitrīṃ saṃ maheta viśvahā jāmimajāmiṃ pṛtanāsu sakṣaṇim

translations.griffith: Do ye, O Ṛbhus, make prosperity for us, prosperity for car, ye Heroes, and for steed.  Grant us prosperity victorious evermore,  conquering foes in battle, strangers or akin.

verses.sanskrit: रभुक्षणमिन्द्रमा हुव ऊतय रभून वाजान मरुतः सोमपीतये उभा मित्रावरुणा नूनमश्विना ते नो हिन्वन्तु सातये धिये जिषे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhukṣaṇamindramā huva ūtaya ṛbhūn vājān marutaḥ somapītaye ubhā mitrāvaruṇā nūnamaśvinā te no hinvantu sātaye dhiye jiṣe

translations.griffith: Indra, the Ṛbhus' Lord, I invocate for aid, the Ṛbhus, Vājas, Maruts to the Soma draught.  Varuṇa, Mitra, both, yea, and the Aśvins Twain: let them speed us to wealth, wisdom, and victory.

verses.sanskrit: रभुर्भराय सं शिशातु सातिं समर्यजिद वाजो अस्मानविष्टु तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhurbharāya saṃ śiśātu sātiṃ samaryajid vājo asmānaviṣṭu tan no ...

translations.griffith: May Ṛbhu send prosperity for battle, may Vāja conquering in the fight protect us.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: ईळे दयावाप्र्थिवी पूर्वचित्तये.अग्निं घर्मं सुरुचं यामन्निष्टये याभिर्भरे कारमंशाय जिन्वथस्ताभिरू षु ऊतिभिरश्विना गतम |||
verses.transliteration: īḷe dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvacittaye.aghniṃ gharmaṃ surucaṃ yāmanniṣṭaye yābhirbhare kāramaṃśāya jinvathastābhirū ṣu ūtibhiraśvinā ghatam

translations.griffith: To give first thought to them, I worship Heaven and Earth, and Agni, fair bright glow, to hasten their approach.  Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids wherewith in fight ye speed the war-cry to the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: युवोर्दानाय सुभरा असश्चतो रथमा तस्थुर्वचसं न मन्तवे याभिर्धियो.अवथःकर्मन्निष्टये ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yuvordānāya subharā asaścato rathamā tasthurvacasaṃ na mantave yābhirdhiyo.avathaḥkarmanniṣṭaye tābhir...

translations.griffith: Ample, unfailing, they have mounted as it were an eloquent car that ye may think of us and give.  Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids wherewith ye help our thoughts to further holy acts.

verses.sanskrit: युवं तासां दिव्यस्य परशासने विशां कषयथो अम्र्तस्यमज्मना याभिर्धेनुमस्वं पिन्वथो नरा ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ tāsāṃ divyasya praśāsane viśāṃ kṣayatho amṛtasyamajmanā yābhirdhenumasvaṃ pinvatho narā tābhir...

translations.griffith: Ye by the might which heavenly nectar giveth you are in supreme dominion Lords of all these folk.  Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids wherewith ye, Heroes, made the barren cow give milk.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः परिज्मा तनयस्य मज्मना दविमाता तूर्षु तरणिर्विभूषति याभिस्त्रिमन्तुरभवद विचक्षणस्ताभिर.. . |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ parijmā tanayasya majmanā dvimātā tūrṣu taraṇirvibhūṣati yābhistrimanturabhavad vicakṣaṇastābhir.. .

translations.griffith: The aids wherewith the Wanderer through his offspring's might, or the Two-Mothered Son shows swiftest mid the swift;  Wherewith the sapient one acquired his triple lore,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभी रेभं निव्र्तं सितमद्भ्य उद वन्दनमैरयतं सवर्द्र्शे याभिः कण्वं पर सिषासन्तमावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhī rebhaṃ nivṛtaṃ sitamadbhya ud vandanamairayataṃ svardṛśe yābhiḥ kaṇvaṃ pra siṣāsantamāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye raised from waters, prisoned and fast bound, Rebha, and Vandana to look upon the light;  Wherewith ye succoured Kaṇva as he strove to win,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिरन्तकं जसमानमारणे भुज्यं याभिरव्यथिभिर्जिजिन्वथुः याभिः कर्कन्धुं वय्यं च जिन्वथस्ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhirantakaṃ jasamānamāraṇe bhujyaṃ yābhiravyathibhirjijinvathuḥ yābhiḥ karkandhuṃ vayyaṃ ca jinvathastābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye rescued Antaka when languishing deep in the pit, and Bhujyu with unfailing help.  And comforted Karkandhu, Vayya, in their woe,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः शुचन्तिं धनसां सुषंसदं तप्तं घर्ममोम्यावन्तमत्रये याभिः पर्ष्निगुं पुरुकुत्समावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ śucantiṃ dhanasāṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ taptaṃ gharmamomyāvantamatraye yābhiḥ pṛṣnighuṃ purukutsamāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye gave Śucanti wealth and happy home, and made the fiery pit friendly for Atri's sake;  Wherewith ye guarded Purukutsa, Pṛśnigu,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvin;, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः शचीभिर्व्र्षणा पराव्र्जं परान्धं शरोणं चक्षस एतवे कर्थः याभिर्वर्तिकां गरसिताममुञ्चतन्ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ śacībhirvṛṣaṇā parāvṛjaṃ prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ cakṣasa etave kṛthaḥ yābhirvartikāṃ ghrasitāmamuñcatantābhir...

translations.griffith: Mighty Ones, with what powers ye gave Parāvṛj aid what time ye made the blind and lame to see and walk;  Wherewith ye set at liberty the swallowed quail,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः सिन्धुं मधुमन्तमसश्चतं वसिष्ठं याभिरजरावजिन्वतम याभिः कुत्सं शरुतर्यं नर्यमावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ sindhuṃ madhumantamasaścataṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ yābhirajarāvajinvatam yābhiḥ kutsaṃ śrutaryaṃ naryamāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye quickened the most sweet exhaustless flood, and comforted Vasiṣṭha, ye who ne’er decay;  And to Śrutarya, Kutsa, Narya gave your help,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिर्विश्पलां धनसामथर्व्यं सहस्रमीळ्ह आजावजिन्वतम याभिर्वशमश्व्यं परेणिमावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhirviśpalāṃ dhanasāmatharvyaṃ sahasramīḷha ājāvajinvatam yābhirvaśamaśvyaṃ preṇimāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye helped, in battle of a thousand spoils, Viśpalā seeking booty, powerless to move.  Wherewith ye guarded friendly Vaśa, Aśva's son,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः सुदानू औशिजाय वणिजे दीर्घश्रवसे मधु कोशोक्षरत कक्षीवन्तं सतोतारं याभिरावतं ताभिर. .. |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ sudānū auśijāya vaṇije dīrghaśravase madhu kośoakṣarat kakṣīvantaṃ stotāraṃ yābhirāvataṃ tābhir. ..

translations.griffith: Whereby the cloud, ye Bounteous Givers, shed sweet rain for Dīrghaśravas, for the merchant Auśija,  Wherewith ye helped Kakṣīvān, singer of your praise,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभी रसां कषोदसोद्नः पिपिन्वथुरनश्वं याभी रथमावतं जिषे याभिस्त्रिशोक उस्रिया उदाजत ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhī rasāṃ kṣodasodnaḥ pipinvathuranaśvaṃ yābhī rathamāvataṃ jiṣe yābhistriśoka usriyā udājata tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye made Rasā swell full with water-floods, and urged to victory the car without a horse;  Wherewith Triśoka drove forth his recovered cows,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः सूर्यं परियाथः परावति मन्धातारं कषैत्रपत्येष्वावतम याभिर्विप्रं पर भरद्वाजमावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ sūryaṃ pariyāthaḥ parāvati mandhātāraṃ kṣaitrapatyeṣvāvatam yābhirvipraṃ pra bharadvājamāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye, compass round the Sun when far away, strengthened Mandhātar in his tasks as lord of lands,  And to sage Bharadvāja gave protecting help,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिर्महामतिथिग्वं कशोजुवं दिवोदासं शम्बरहत्यावतम याभिः पूर्भिद्ये तरसदस्युमावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhirmahāmatithighvaṃ kaśojuvaṃ divodāsaṃ śambarahatyaāvatam yābhiḥ pūrbhidye trasadasyumāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith, when Śambara was slain, ye guarded well great Atithigva, Divodāsa, Kaśoju,  And Trasadasyu when the forts were shattered down,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिर्वम्रं विपिपानमुपस्तुतं कलिं याभिर्वित्तजानिं दुवस्यथः याभिर्व्यश्वमुत पर्थिमावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhirvamraṃ vipipānamupastutaṃ kaliṃ yābhirvittajāniṃ duvasyathaḥ yābhirvyaśvamuta pṛthimāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye honoured the great drinker Vamra, and Upastuta and Kali when he gained his wife,  And lent to Vyaśva and to Pṛthi favouring help,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिर्नरा शयवे याभिरत्रये याभिः पुरा मनवे गातुमीषथुः याभिः शारीराजतं सयूमरश्मये ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhirnarā śayave yābhiratraye yābhiḥ purā manave ghātumīṣathuḥ yābhiḥ śārīrājataṃ syūmaraśmaye tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith, O Heroes, ye vouchsafed deliverance to Śayu, Atri, and to Manu long ago;  Wherewith ye shot your shafts in Syūmaraśmi's cause.—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः पठर्वा जठरस्य मज्मनाग्निर्नादीदेच्चित इद्धो अज्मन्ना याभिः शर्यातमवथो महाधने ताभिर.. . |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ paṭharvā jaṭharasya majmanāghnirnādīdeccita iddho ajmannā yābhiḥ śaryātamavatho mahādhane tābhir.. .

translations.griffith: Wherewith Paṭharvā, in his majesty of form, shone in his course like to a gathered kindled fire;  Wherewith ye helped Śāryāta in the mighty fray,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिरङगिरो मनसा निरण्यथो.अग्रं गछथो विवरे गोर्णसः याभिर्मनुं शूरमिषा समावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiraṅghiro manasā niraṇyatho.aghraṃ ghachatho vivare ghoarṇasaḥ yābhirmanuṃ śūramiṣā samāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith, Aṅgirases! ye triumphed in your heart, and onward went to liberate the flood of milk;  Wherewith ye helped the hero Manu with new strength,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः पत्नीर्विमदाय नयूहथुरा घ वा याभिररुणीरशिक्षतम याभिः सुदास ऊहथुः सुदेव्यं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ patnīrvimadāya nyūhathurā gha vā yābhiraruṇīraśikṣatam yābhiḥ sudāsa ūhathuḥ sudevyaṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye brought a wife for Vimada to wed, wherewith ye freely gave the ruddy cows away;  Wherewith ye brought the host of kind Gods to Sudās—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः शन्ताती भवथो ददाशुषे भुज्युं याभिरवथो याभिरध्रिगुम ओम्यावतीं सुभरां रतस्तुभं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ śantātī bhavatho dadāśuṣe bhujyuṃ yābhiravatho yābhiradhrighum omyāvatīṃ subharāṃ ṛtastubhaṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye bring great bliss to him who offers gifts, wherewith ye have protected Bhujyu, Adhrigu,  And good and gracious Subharā and Ṛtastup,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः कर्शानुमसने दुवस्यथो जवे याभिर्यूनो अर्वन्तमावतम मधु परियं भरथो यत सरड्भ्यस्ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ kṛśānumasane duvasyatho jave yābhiryūno arvantamāvatam madhu priyaṃ bharatho yat saraḍbhyastābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye served Kṛśānu where the shafts were shot, and helped the young man's horse to swiftness in the race;  Wherewith ye bring delicious honey to the bees,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिर्नरं गोषुयुधं नर्षाह्ये कषेत्रस्य साता तनयस्य जिन्वथः याभी रथानवथो याभिरर्वतस्ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhirnaraṃ ghoṣuyudhaṃ nṛṣāhye kṣetrasya sātā tanayasya jinvathaḥ yābhī rathānavatho yābhirarvatastābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye speed the hero as he fights for kine in hero battle, in the strife for land and sons,  Wherewith ye safely guard his horses and his car,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः कुत्समार्जुनेयं शतक्रतू पर तुर्वीतिं पर च दभीतिमावतम याभिर्ध्वसन्तिं पुरुषन्तिमावतं ताभिर... |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ kutsamārjuneyaṃ śatakratū pra turvītiṃ pra ca dabhītimāvatam yābhirdhvasantiṃ puruṣantimāvataṃ tābhir...

translations.griffith: Wherewith ye, Lords of Hundred Powers, helped Kutsa, son of Ārjuni, gave Turvīti and Dabhīti strength,  Favoured Dhvasanti and lent Puruṣanti help,—Come hither unto us, O Aśvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit: अप्नस्वतीमश्विना वाचमस्मे कर्तं नो दस्रा वर्षणा मनीषाम अद्यूत्ये.अवसे नि हवये वां वर्धे च नो भवतं वाजसातौ |||
verses.transliteration: apnasvatīmaśvinā vācamasme kṛtaṃ no dasrā vṛṣaṇā manīṣām adyūtye.avase ni hvaye vāṃ vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau

translations.griffith: Make ye our speech effectual, O ye Aśvins, and this our hymn, ye mighty Wonder-Workers.  In luckless game I call on you for succour: strengthen us also on the field of battle.

verses.sanskrit: दयुभिरक्तुभिः परि पातमस्मानरिष्टेभिरश्विना सौभगेभिः तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: dyubhiraktubhiḥ pari pātamasmānariṣṭebhiraśvinā saubhaghebhiḥ tan no ...

translations.griffith: With, undiminished blessings, O ye Aśvins, for evermore both night and day protect us.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इदं शरेष्ठं जयोतिषां जयोतिरागाच्चित्रः परकेतो अजनिष्ट विभ्वा यथा परसूता सवितुः सवयमेवा रात्र्युषसे योनिमारैक |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotirāghāccitraḥ praketo ajaniṣṭa vibhvā yathā prasūtā savituḥ savayamevā rātryuṣase yonimāraik

translations.griffith: This light is come, amid all lights the fairest; born is the brilliant, far-extending brightness.  Night, sent away for Savitar's uprising, hath yielded up a birth-place for the Morning.
