verses.sanskrit: रुशद्वत्सा रुशती शवेत्यागादारैगु कर्ष्णा सदनान्यस्याः समानबन्धू अम्र्ते अनुची दयावा वर्णं चरत आमिनाने |||
verses.transliteration: ruśadvatsā ruśatī śvetyāghādāraighu kṛṣṇā sadanānyasyāḥ samānabandhū amṛte anucī dyāvā varṇaṃ carata āmināne

translations.griffith: The Fair, the Bright is come with her white offspring; to her the Dark One hath resigned her dwelling.  Akin, immortal, following each other, changing their colours both the heavens move onward.

verses.sanskrit: समानो अध्वा सवस्रोरनन्तस्तमन्यान्या चरतो देवशिष्टे न मेथेते न तस्थतुः सुमेके नक्तोषासा समनसा विरूपे |||
verses.transliteration: samāno adhvā svasroranantastamanyānyā carato devaśiṣṭe na methete na tasthatuḥ sumeke naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe

translations.griffith: Common, unending is the Sisters' pathway; taught by the Gods, alternately they travel.  Fair-formed, of different hues and yet one-minded, Night and Dawn clash not, neither do they travel.

verses.sanskrit: भास्वती नेत्री सून्र्तानामचेति चित्रा वि दुरो न आवः परार्प्या जगद वयु नो रायो अख्यदुषा अजीगर्भुवनानि विश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānāmaceti citrā vi duro na āvaḥ prārpyā jaghad vyu no rāyo akhyaduṣā ajīgharbhuvanāni viśvā

translations.griffith: Bright leader of glad sounds, our eyes behold her; splendid in hue she hath unclosed the portals.  She, stirring up the world, hath shown us riches: Dawn hath awakened every living creature.

verses.sanskrit: जिह्मश्ये चरितवे मघोन्याभोगय इष्टये राय उ तवम दभ्रं पश्यद्भ्य उर्विया विचक्ष उषा |||
verses.transliteration: jihmaśye caritave maghonyābhoghaya iṣṭaye rāya u tvam dabhraṃ paśyadbhya urviyā vicakṣa uṣā

translations.griffith: Rich Dawn, she sets afoot the coiled-up sleeper, one for enjoyment, one for wealth or worship,  Those who saw little for extended vision. All living creatures hath the Dawn awakened.

verses.sanskrit: कषत्राय तवं शरवसे तवं महीया इष्टये तवमर्थमिवत्वमित्यै विसद्र्शा जीविताभिप्रचक्ष उषा ... |||
verses.transliteration: kṣatrāya tvaṃ śravase tvaṃ mahīyā iṣṭaye tvamarthamivatvamityai visadṛśā jīvitābhipracakṣa uṣā ...

translations.griffith: One to high sway, one to exalted glory, one to pursue his gain, and one his labour:  All to regard their different vocations, all moving creatures hath the Dawn awakened.

verses.sanskrit: एषा दिवो दुहिता परत्यदर्शि वयुछन्ती युवतिः शुक्रवासाः विश्वस्येशाना पार्थिवस्य वस्व उषो अद्येह सुभगेव्युछ |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā divo duhitā pratyadarśi vyuchantī yuvatiḥ śukravāsāḥ viśvasyeśānā pārthivasya vasva uṣo adyeha subhaghevyucha

translations.griffith: We see her there, the Child of Heaven apparent, the young Maid, flushing in her shining raiment.  Thou sovran Lady of all earthly treasure, flush on us here, auspicious Dawn, this morning.

verses.sanskrit: परायतीनामन्वेति पाथ आयतीनां परथमा शश्वतीनाम वयुछन्ती जीवमुदीरयन्त्युषा मर्तं कं चन बोधयन्ती |||
verses.transliteration: parāyatīnāmanveti pātha āyatīnāṃ prathamā śaśvatīnām vyuchantī jīvamudīrayantyuṣā mṛtaṃ kaṃ cana bodhayantī

translations.griffith: She first of endless morns to come hereafter, follows the path of morns that have departed.  Dawn, at her rising, urges forth the living him who is dead she wakes not from his slumber.

verses.sanskrit: उषो यदग्निं समिधे चकर्थ वि यदावश्चक्षसा सूर्यस्य यन मानुषान यक्ष्यमाणानजीगस्तद देवेषु चक्र्षे भद्रमप्नः |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo yadaghniṃ samidhe cakartha vi yadāvaścakṣasā sūryasya yan mānuṣān yakṣyamāṇānajīghastad deveṣu cakṛṣe bhadramapnaḥ

translations.griffith: As thou, Dawn, hast caused Agni to be kindled, and with the Sun's eye hast revealed creation.  And hast awakened men to offer worship, thou hast performed, for Gods, a noble service.

verses.sanskrit: कियात्या यत समया भवाति या वयूषुर्याश्च नूनंव्युछान अनु पूर्वाः कर्पते वावशाना परदीध्याना जोषमन्याभिरेति |||
verses.transliteration: kiyātyā yat samayā bhavāti yā vyūṣuryāśca nūnaṃvyuchān anu pūrvāḥ kṛpate vāvaśānā pradīdhyānā joṣamanyābhireti

translations.griffith: How long a time, and they shall be together,—Dawns that have shone and Dawns to shine hereafter?  She yearns for former Dawns with eager longing, and goes forth gladly shining with the others.

verses.sanskrit: ईयुष टे ये पूर्वतरामपश्यन वयुछन्तीमुषसं मर्त्यासः अस्माभिरू नु परतिचक्ष्याभूदो ते यन्ति ये अपरीषु पश्यान |||
verses.transliteration: īyuṣ ṭe ye pūrvatarāmapaśyan vyuchantīmuṣasaṃ martyāsaḥ asmābhirū nu praticakṣyābhūdo te yanti ye aparīṣu paśyān

translations.griffith: Gone are the men who in the days before us looked on the rising of the earlier Morning.  We, we the living, now behold her brightness and they come nigh who shall hereafter see her.

verses.sanskrit: यावयद्द्वेषा रतपा रतेजाः सुम्नावरी सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती सुमङगलीर्बिभ्रती देववीतिमिहाद्योषः शरेष्ठतमाव्युछ |||
verses.transliteration: yāvayaddveṣā ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ sumnāvarī sūnṛtā īrayantī sumaṅghalīrbibhratī devavītimihādyoṣaḥ śreṣṭhatamāvyucha

translations.griffith: Foe-chaser, born of Law, the Law's protectress, joy-giver, waker of all pleasant voices,  Auspicious, bringing food for Gods’ enjoyment, shine on us here, most bright, O Dawn, this morning.

verses.sanskrit: शश्वत पुरोषा वयुवास देव्यथो अद्येदं वयावो मघोनी अथो वयुछादुत्तराननु दयूनजराम्र्ता चरति सवधाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: śaśvat puroṣā vyuvāsa devyatho adyedaṃ vyāvo maghonī atho vyuchāduttarānanu dyūnajarāmṛtā carati svadhābhiḥ

translations.griffith: From days eternal hath Dawn shone, the Goddess, and shows this light to-day, endowed with riches.  So will she shine on days to come immortal she moves on in her own strength, undecaying.

verses.sanskrit: वयञ्जिभिर्दिव आतास्वद्यौदप कर्ष्णां निर्णिजं देव्यावः परबोधयन्त्यरुणेभिरश्वैरोषा याति सुयुजा रथेन |||
verses.transliteration: vyañjibhirdiva ātāsvadyaudapa kṛṣṇāṃ nirṇijaṃ devyāvaḥ prabodhayantyaruṇebhiraśvairoṣā yāti suyujā rathena

translations.griffith: In the sky's borders hath she shone in splendour: the Goddess hath thrown off the veil of darkness.  Awakening the world with purple horses, on her well-harnessed chariot Dawn approaches.

verses.sanskrit: आवहन्ती पोष्या वार्याणि चित्रं केतुं कर्णुते चेकिताना ईयुषीणामुपमा शश्वतीनां विभातीनां परथमोषा वयश्वैत |||
verses.transliteration: āvahantī poṣyā vāryāṇi citraṃ ketuṃ kṛṇute cekitānā īyuṣīṇāmupamā śaśvatīnāṃ vibhātīnāṃ prathamoṣā vyaśvait

translations.griffith: Bringing all life-sustaining blessings with her, showing herself she sends forth brilliant lustre.  Last of the countless mornings that have vanished, first of bright morns to come hath Dawn arisen.

verses.sanskrit: उदीर्ध्वं जीवो असुर्न आगादप परागात तम आ जयोतिरेति आरैक पन्थां यातवे सूर्यायागन्म यत्र परतिरन्त आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: udīrdhvaṃ jīvo asurna āghādapa prāghāt tama ā jyotireti āraik panthāṃ yātave sūryāyāghanma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ

translations.griffith: Arise! the breath, the life, again hath reached us: darkness hath passed away and light approacheth.  She for the Sun hath left a path to travel we have arrived where men prolong existence.

verses.sanskrit: सयूमना वाच उदियर्ति वह्नि सतवानो रेभ उषसो विभातीः अद्या तदुछ गर्णते मघोन्यस्मे आयुर्नि दिदीहि परजावत |||
verses.transliteration: syūmanā vāca udiyarti vahni stavāno rebha uṣaso vibhātīḥ adyā taducha ghṛṇate maghonyasme āyurni didīhi prajāvat

translations.griffith: Singing the praises of refulgent Mornings with his hymn's web the priest, the poet rises.  Shine then to-day, rich Maid, on him who lauds thee, shine down on us the gift of life and offspring.

verses.sanskrit: या गोमतीरुषसः सर्ववीरा वयुछन्ति दाशुषे मर्त्याय वायोरिव सून्र्तानामुदर्के ता अश्वदा अश्नवत सोमसुत्वा |||
verses.transliteration: yā ghomatīruṣasaḥ sarvavīrā vyuchanti dāśuṣe martyāya vāyoriva sūnṛtānāmudarke tā aśvadā aśnavat somasutvā

translations.griffith: Dawns giving sons all heroes, kine and horses, shining upon the man who brings oblations,—  These let the Soma-presser gain when ending his glad songs louder than the voice of Vāyu.

verses.sanskrit: माता देवानामदितेरनीकं यज्ञस्य केतुर्ब्र्हती वि भाहि परशस्तिक्र्द बरह्मणे नो वयुछा नो जने जनय विश्ववारे |||
verses.transliteration: mātā devānāmaditeranīkaṃ yajñasya keturbṛhatī vi bhāhi praśastikṛd brahmaṇe no vyuchā no jane janaya viśvavāre

translations.griffith: Mother of Gods, Aditi's form of glory, ensign of sacrifice, shine forth exalted.  Rise up, bestowing praise on our devotion all-bounteous, make us chief among the people.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चित्रमप्न उषसो वहन्तीजानाय शशमानाय भद्रम तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: yaccitramapna uṣaso vahantījānāya śaśamānāya bhadram tan no ...

translations.griffith: Whatever splendid wealth the Dawns bring with them to bless the man who offers praise and worship,  Even that may Mitra, Varuṇa vouchsafe us, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इमा रुद्राय तवसे कपर्दिने कषयद्वीराय पर भरामहे मतीः यथा शमसद दविपदे चतुष्पदे विश्वं पुष्टंग्रामे अस्मिन्ननातुरम |||
verses.transliteration: imā rudrāya tavase kapardine kṣayadvīrāya pra bharāmahe matīḥ yathā śamasad dvipade catuṣpade viśvaṃ puṣṭaṃghrāme asminnanāturam

translations.griffith: To the strong Rudra bring we these our songs of praise, to him the Lord of Heroes with the braided hair,  That it be well with all our cattle and our men, that in this village all be healthy and well-fed.

verses.sanskrit: मर्ळा नो रुद्रोत नो मयस कर्धि कषयद्वीराय नमसा विधेमते यच्छं च योश्च मनुरायेजे पिता तदश्याम तवरुद्र परणीतिषु |||
verses.transliteration: mṛḷā no rudrota no mayas kṛdhi kṣayadvīrāya namasā vidhemate yacchaṃ ca yośca manurāyeje pitā tadaśyāma tavarudra praṇītiṣu

translations.griffith: Be gracious unto us, O Rudra, bring us joy: thee, Lord of Heroes, thee with reverence will we serve.  Whatever health and strength our father Manu won by sacrifice may we, under thy guidance, gain.

verses.sanskrit: अश्याम ते सुमतिं देवयज्यया कषयद्वीरस्य तव रुद्र मीढ्वः सुम्नायन्निद विशो अस्माकमा चरारिष्टवीरा जुहवाम ते हविः |||
verses.transliteration: aśyāma te sumatiṃ devayajyayā kṣayadvīrasya tava rudra mīḍhvaḥ sumnāyannid viśo asmākamā carāriṣṭavīrā juhavāma te haviḥ

translations.griffith: By worship of the Gods may we, O Bounteous One, O Rudra, gain thy grace, Ruler of valiant men.  Come to our families, bringing them bliss: may we, whose heroes are uninjured, bring thee sacred gifts,

verses.sanskrit: तवेषं वयं रुद्रं यज्ञसाधं वङकुं कविमवसे निह्वयामहे आरे अस्मद दैव्यं हेळो अस्यतु सुमतिमिद वयमस्या वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tveṣaṃ vayaṃ rudraṃ yajñasādhaṃ vaṅkuṃ kavimavase nihvayāmahe āre asmad daivyaṃ heḷo asyatu sumatimid vayamasyā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Hither we call for aid the wise, the wanderer, impetuous Rudra, perfecter of sacrifice.  May he repel from us the anger of the Gods: verily we desire his favourable grace.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो वराहमरुषं कपर्दिनं तवेषं रूपं नमसा निह्वयामहे हस्ते बिभ्रद भेषजा वार्याणि शर्म वर्म छर्दिरस्मभ्यं यंसत |||
verses.transliteration: divo varāhamaruṣaṃ kapardinaṃ tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ namasā nihvayāmahe haste bibhrad bheṣajā vāryāṇi śarma varma chardirasmabhyaṃ yaṃsat

translations.griffith: Him with the braided hair we call with reverence down, the wild-boar of the sky, the red, the dazzling shape.  May he, his hand filled full of sovran medicines, grant us protection, shelter, and a home secure.

verses.sanskrit: इदं पित्रे मरुतामुच्यते वचः सवादोः सवादीयो रुद्राय वर्धनम रास्वा च नो अम्र्त मर्तभोजनं तमने तोकाय तनयाय मर्ळ |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ pitre marutāmucyate vacaḥ svādoḥ svādīyo rudrāya vardhanam rāsvā ca no amṛta martabhojanaṃ tmane tokāya tanayāya mṛḷa

translations.griffith: To him the Maruts’ Father is this hymn addressed, to strengthen Rudra's might, a song more sweet than sweet.  Grant us, Immortal One, the food which mortals eat: be gracious unto me, my seed, my progeny.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो महान्तमुत मा नो अर्भकं मा न उक्षन्तमुत मान उक्षितम मा नो वधीः पितरं मोत मातरं मा नः परियास्तन्वो रुद्र रीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: mā no mahāntamuta mā no arbhakaṃ mā na ukṣantamuta māna ukṣitam mā no vadhīḥ pitaraṃ mota mātaraṃ mā naḥ priyāstanvo rudra rīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: O Rudra, harm not either great or small of us, harm not the growing boy, harm not the full-grown man.  Slay not a sire among us, slay no mother here, and to our own dear bodies, Rudra, do not harm.

verses.sanskrit: मा नस्तोके तनये मा न आयौ मा नो गोषु मा नो अश्वेषुरीरिषः वीरान मा नो रुद्र भामितो वधीर्हविष्मन्तःसदमित तवा हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: mā nastoke tanaye mā na āyau mā no ghoṣu mā no aśveṣurīriṣaḥ vīrān mā no rudra bhāmito vadhīrhaviṣmantaḥsadamit tvā havāmahe

translations.griffith: Harm us not, Rudra, in our seed and progeny, harm us not in the living, nor in cows or steeds,  Slay not our heroes in the fury of thy wrath. Bringing oblations evermore we call to thee.

verses.sanskrit: उप ते सतोमान पशुपा इवाकरं रास्वा पितर्मरुतां सुम्नमस्मे भद्रा हि ते सुमतिर्म्र्ळयत्तमाथा वयमव इत्ते वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: upa te stomān paśupā ivākaraṃ rāsvā pitarmarutāṃ sumnamasme bhadrā hi te sumatirmṛḷayattamāthā vayamava itte vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Even as a herdsman I have brought thee hymns of praise: O Father of the Maruts, give us happiness,  Blessed is thy most favouring benevolence, so, verily, do we desire thy saving help.

verses.sanskrit: आरे ते गोघ्नमुत पूरुषघ्नं कषयद्वीर सुम्नमस्मे तेस्तु मर्ळा च नो अधि च बरूहि देवाधा च नः शर्म यछद्विबर्हाः |||
verses.transliteration: āre te ghoghnamuta pūruṣaghnaṃ kṣayadvīra sumnamasme teastu mṛḷā ca no adhi ca brūhi devādhā ca naḥ śarma yachadvibarhāḥ

translations.griffith: Far be thy dart that killeth men or cattle: thy bliss be with us, O thou Lord of Heroes.  Be gracious unto us, O God, and bless us, and then vouchsafe us doubly-strong protection.

verses.sanskrit: अवोचाम नमो अस्मा अवस्यवः शर्णोतु नो हवं रुद्रो मरुत्वान तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: avocāma namo asmā avasyavaḥ śṛṇotu no havaṃ rudro marutvān tan no ...

translations.griffith: We, seeking help, have spoken and adored him: may Rudra, girt by Maruts, hear our calling.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: चित्रं देवानामुदगादनीकं चक्षुर्मित्रस्य वरुणस्याग्नेः आप्रा दयावाप्र्थिवी अन्तरिक्षं सूर्य आत्मा जगतस्तस्थुषश्च |||
verses.transliteration: citraṃ devānāmudaghādanīkaṃ cakṣurmitrasya varuṇasyāghneḥ āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ sūrya ātmā jaghatastasthuṣaśca

translations.griffith: THE brilliant presence of the Gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni.  The soul of all that moveth not or moveth, the Sun hath filled the air and earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्यो देवीमुषसं रोचमानां मर्यो न योषामभ्येति पश्चात यत्रा नरो देवयन्तो युगानि वितन्वते परति भद्राय भद्रम |||
verses.transliteration: sūryo devīmuṣasaṃ rocamānāṃ maryo na yoṣāmabhyeti paścāt yatrā naro devayanto yughāni vitanvate prati bhadrāya bhadram

translations.griffith: Like as a young man followeth a maiden, so doth the Sun the Dawn, refulgent Goddess:  Where pious men extend their generations, before the Auspicious One for happy fortune.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रा अश्वा हरितः सूर्यस्य चित्रा एतग्वा अनुमाद्यासः नमस्यन्तो दिव आ पर्ष्ठमस्थुः परि दयावाप्र्थिवी यन्ति सद्यः |||
verses.transliteration: bhadrā aśvā haritaḥ sūryasya citrā etaghvā anumādyāsaḥ namasyanto diva ā pṛṣṭhamasthuḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti sadyaḥ

translations.griffith: Auspicious are the Sun's Bay-coloured Horses, bright, changing hues, meet for our shouts of triumph.  Bearing our prayers, the sky's ridge have they mounted, and in a moment speed round earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तत सूर्यस्य देवत्वं तन महित्वं मध्या कर्तोर्विततं सं जभार यदेदयुक्त हरितः सधस्थादाद रात्री वासस्तनुते सिमस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: tat sūryasya devatvaṃ tan mahitvaṃ madhyā kartorvitataṃ saṃ jabhāra yadedayukta haritaḥ sadhasthādād rātrī vāsastanute simasmai

translations.griffith: This is the Godhead, this might of Sūrya: he hath withdrawn what spread o’er work unfinished.  When he hath loosed his Horses from their station, straight over all Night spreadeth out her garment.

verses.sanskrit: तन मित्रस्य वरुणस्याभिचक्षे सूर्यो रूपं कर्णुते दयोरुपस्थे अनन्तमन्यद रुशदस्य पाजः कर्ष्णमन्यद धरितः सं भरन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: tan mitrasya varuṇasyābhicakṣe sūryo rūpaṃ kṛṇute dyorupasthe anantamanyad ruśadasya pājaḥ kṛṣṇamanyad dharitaḥ saṃ bharanti

translations.griffith: In the sky's lap the Sun this form assumeth that Varuṇa and Mitra may behold it.  His Bay Steeds well maintain his power eternal, at one time bright and darksome at another.

verses.sanskrit: अद्या देवा उदिता सूर्यस्य निरंहसः पिप्र्ता नरवद्यात तन नो ... |||
verses.transliteration: adyā devā uditā sūryasya niraṃhasaḥ pipṛtā naravadyāt tan no ...

translations.griffith: This day, O Gods, while Sūrya is ascending, deliver us from trouble and dishonour.  This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: नासत्याभ्यां बर्हिरिव पर वर्ञ्जे सतोमानियर्म्यभ्रियेव वातः यावर्भगाय विमदाय जायां सेनाजुवा नयूहतूरथेन |||
verses.transliteration: nāsatyābhyāṃ barhiriva pra vṛñje stomāniyarmyabhriyeva vātaḥ yāvarbhaghāya vimadāya jāyāṃ senājuvā nyūhatūrathena

translations.griffith: I TRIM like grass my song for the Nāsatyas and send their lauds forth as the wind drives rain-clouds,  Who, in a chariot rapid as an arrow, brought to the youthful Vimada a consort.

verses.sanskrit: वीळुपत्मभिराशुहेमभिर्वा देवानां वा जूतिभिः शाशदाना तद रासभो नासत्या सहस्रमाजा यमस्य परधने जिगाय |||
verses.transliteration: vīḷupatmabhirāśuhemabhirvā devānāṃ vā jūtibhiḥ śāśadānā tad rāsabho nāsatyā sahasramājā yamasya pradhane jighāya

translations.griffith: Borne on by rapid steeds of mighty pinion, or proudly trusting in the Gods’ incitements.  That stallion ass of yours won, O Nāsatyas, that thousand in the race, in Yama's contest.

verses.sanskrit: तुग्रो ह भुज्युमश्विनोदमेघे रयिं न कश्चिन मम्र्वानवाहाः तमूहथुर्नौभिरात्मन्वतीभिरन्तरिक्षप्रुद्भिरपोदकाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tughro ha bhujyumaśvinodameghe rayiṃ na kaścin mamṛvānavāhāḥ tamūhathurnaubhirātmanvatībhirantarikṣaprudbhirapodakābhiḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, Aśvins, as a dead man leaves his riches, Tugra left Bhujyu in the cloud of waters.  Ye brought him back in animated vessels, traversing air, unwetted by the billows.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रः कषपस्त्रिरहातिव्रजद्भिर्नासत्या भुज्युमूहथुः पतंगैः समुद्रस्य धन्वन्नार्द्रस्य पारे तरिभी रथैः शतपद्भिः षळश्वैः |||
verses.transliteration: tisraḥ kṣapastrirahātivrajadbhirnāsatyā bhujyumūhathuḥ pataṃghaiḥ samudrasya dhanvannārdrasya pāre tribhī rathaiḥ śatapadbhiḥ ṣaḷaśvaiḥ

translations.griffith: Bhujyu ye bore with winged things, Nāsatyas, which for three nights, three days full swiftly travelled,  To the sea's farther shore, the strand of ocean, in three cars, hundred-footed, with six horses.

verses.sanskrit: अनारम्भणे तदवीरयेथामनास्थाने अग्रभणे समुद्रे यदश्विना ऊहथुर्भुज्युमस्तं शतारित्रां नावमातस्थिवांसम |||
verses.transliteration: anārambhaṇe tadavīrayethāmanāsthāne aghrabhaṇe samudre yadaśvinā ūhathurbhujyumastaṃ śatāritrāṃ nāvamātasthivāṃsam

translations.griffith: Ye wrought that hero exploit in the ocean which giveth no support, or hold or station,  What time ye carried Bhujyu to his dwelling, borne in a ship with hundred oars, O Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: यमश्विना ददथुः शवेतमश्वमघाश्वाय शश्वदित्स्वस्ति तद वां दात्रं महि कीर्तेन्यं भूत पैद्वो वाजीसदमिद धव्यो अर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: yamaśvinā dadathuḥ śvetamaśvamaghāśvāya śaśvaditsvasti tad vāṃ dātraṃ mahi kīrtenyaṃ bhūt paidvo vājīsadamid dhavyo aryaḥ

translations.griffith: The white horse which of old ye gave Aghāśva, Aśvins, a gift to be his wealth for ever,—  Still to be praised is that your glorious present, still to be famed is the brave horse of Pedu.

verses.sanskrit: युवं नरा सतुवते पज्रियाय कक्षीवते अरदतं पुरन्धिम कारोतराच्छफादश्वस्य वर्ष्णः शतं कुम्भानसिञ्चतं सुरायाः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ narā stuvate pajriyāya kakṣīvate aradataṃ purandhim kārotarācchaphādaśvasya vṛṣṇaḥ śataṃ kumbhānasiñcataṃ surāyāḥ

translations.griffith: O Heroes, ye gave wisdom to Kakṣīvān who sprang from Pajra's line, who sang your praises.  Ye poured forth from the hoof of your strong charger a hundred jars of wine as from a strainer.

verses.sanskrit: हिमेनाग्निं घरंसमवारयेथां पितुमतीमूर्जमस्मा अधत्तम रबीसे अत्रिमश्विनावनीतमुन निन्यथुः सर्वगणं सवस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: himenāghniṃ ghraṃsamavārayethāṃ pitumatīmūrjamasmā adhattam ṛbīse atrimaśvināvanītamun ninyathuḥ sarvaghaṇaṃ svasti

translations.griffith: Ye warded off with cold the fire's fierce burning; food very rich in nourishment ye furnished.  Atri, cast downward in the cavern, Aśvins ye brought, with all his people, forth to comfort.

verses.sanskrit: परावतं नासत्यानुदेथामुच्चाबुध्नं चक्रथुर्जिह्मबारम कषरन्नापो न पायनाय राये सहस्राय तर्ष्यते गोतमस्य |||
verses.transliteration: parāvataṃ nāsatyānudethāmuccābudhnaṃ cakrathurjihmabāram kṣarannāpo na pāyanāya rāye sahasrāya tṛṣyate ghotamasya

translations.griffith: Ye lifted up the well, O ye Nāsatyas, and set the base on high to open downward.  Streams flowed for folk of Gotama who thirsted, like rain to bring forth thousandfold abundance.

verses.sanskrit: जुजुरुषो नासत्योत वव्रिं परामुञ्चतं दरापिमिव चयवानात परातिरतं जहितस्यायुर्दस्रादित पतिमक्र्णुतं कनीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: jujuruṣo nāsatyota vavriṃ prāmuñcataṃ drāpimiva cyavānāt prātirataṃ jahitasyāyurdasrādit patimakṛṇutaṃ kanīnām

translations.griffith: Ye from the old Cyavāna, O Nāsatyas, stripped, as ’twere mail, the skin upon  his body,  Lengthened his life when all had left him helpless, Dasras! and made him lord of youthful maidens.

verses.sanskrit: तद वां नरा शंस्यं राध्यं चाभिष्टिमन नासत्या वरूथम यद विद्वांसा निधिमिवापगूळ्हमुद दर्शतादूपथुर्वन्दनाय |||
verses.transliteration: tad vāṃ narā śaṃsyaṃ rādhyaṃ cābhiṣṭiman nāsatyā varūtham yad vidvāṃsā nidhimivāpaghūḷhamud darśatādūpathurvandanāya

translations.griffith: Worthy of praise and worth the winning, Heroes, is that your favouring succour O Nāsatyas,  What time ye, knowing well his case, delivered Vandana from the pit like hidden treasure.

verses.sanskrit: तद वां नरा सनये दंस उग्रमाविष कर्णोमि तन्यतुर्नव्र्ष्टिम दध्यं ह यन मध्वाथर्वणो वामश्वस्य शीर्ष्णा पर यदीमुवाच |||
verses.transliteration: tad vāṃ narā sanaye daṃsa ughramāviṣ kṛṇomi tanyaturnavṛṣṭim dadhyaṃ ha yan madhvātharvaṇo vāmaśvasya śīrṣṇā pra yadīmuvāca

translations.griffith: That mighty deed of yours, for gain, O Heroes, as thunder heraldeth the rain, I publish,  When, by the horse's head, Atharvan's offspring Dadhyac made known to you the Soma's sweetness.

verses.sanskrit: अजोहवीन नासत्या करा वां महे यामन पुरुभुजा पुरन्धिः शरुतं तच्छासुरिव वध्रिमत्या हिरण्यहस्तमश्विनावदत्तम |||
verses.transliteration: ajohavīn nāsatyā karā vāṃ mahe yāman purubhujā purandhiḥ śrutaṃ tacchāsuriva vadhrimatyā hiraṇyahastamaśvināvadattam

translations.griffith: In the great rite the wise dame called, Nāsatyas, you, Lords of many treasures, to assist her.  Ye heard the weakling's wife, as ’twere an order, and gave to her a son Hiraṇyahasta.

verses.sanskrit: आस्नो वर्कस्य वर्तिकामभीके युवं नरा नासत्यामुमुक्तम उतो कविं पुरुभुजा युवं ह कर्पमाणमक्र्णुतं विचक्षे |||
verses.transliteration: āsno vṛkasya vartikāmabhīke yuvaṃ narā nāsatyāmumuktam uto kaviṃ purubhujā yuvaṃ ha kṛpamāṇamakṛṇutaṃ vicakṣe

translations.griffith: Ye from the wolf's jaws, as ye stood together, set free the quail, O Heroes, O Nāsatyas.  Ye, Lords of many treasures, gave the poet his perfect vision as he mourned his trouble.

verses.sanskrit: चरित्रं हि वेरिवाछेदि पर्णमाजा खेलस्य परितक्म्यायाम सद्यो जङघामायसीं विश्पलायै धने हिते सर्तवेप्रत्यधत्तम |||
verses.transliteration: caritraṃ hi verivāchedi parṇamājā khelasya paritakmyāyām sadyo jaṅghāmāyasīṃ viśpalāyai dhane hite sartavepratyadhattam

translations.griffith: When in the time of night, in Khela's battle, a leg was severed like a wild bird's pinion,  Straight ye gave Viśpalā a leg of iron that she might move what time the conflict opened.

verses.sanskrit: शतं मेषान वर्क्ये चक्षदानं रज्राश्वं तं पितान्धंचकार तस्मा अक्षी नासत्या विचक्ष आधत्तं दस्रा भिषजावनर्वन |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ meṣān vṛkye cakṣadānaṃ ṛjrāśvaṃ taṃ pitāndhaṃcakāra tasmā akṣī nāsatyā vicakṣa ādhattaṃ dasrā bhiṣajāvanarvan

translations.griffith: His father robbed Ṛjrāśva of his eyesight who for the she-wolf slew a hundred wethers.  Ye gave him eyes, Nāsatyas, Wonder-Workers, Physicians, that he saw with sight uninjured.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां रथं दुहिता सूर्यस्य कार्ष्मेवातिष्ठदर्वताजयन्ती विश्वे देवा अन्वमन्यत हर्द्भिः समु शरिया नासत्या सचेथे |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ rathaṃ duhitā sūryasya kārṣmevātiṣṭhadarvatājayantī viśve devā anvamanyata hṛdbhiḥ samu śriyā nāsatyā sacethe

translations.griffith: The Daughter of the Sun your car ascended, first reaching as it were the goal with coursers.  All Deities within their hearts assented, and ye, Nāsatyas, are close linked with glory.

verses.sanskrit: यदयातं दिवोदासाय वर्तिर्भरद्वाजायाश्विना हयन्ता रेवदुवाह सचनो रथो वां वर्षभश्च शिंशुमारश्च युक्ता |||
verses.transliteration: yadayātaṃ divodāsāya vartirbharadvājāyāśvinā hayantā revaduvāha sacano ratho vāṃ vṛṣabhaśca śiṃśumāraśca yuktā

translations.griffith: When to his house ye came, to Divodāsa, hasting to Bharadvāja, O ye Aśvins,  The car that came with you brought splendid riches: a porpoise and a bull were yoked together.

verses.sanskrit: रयिं सुक्षत्रं सवपत्यमायुः सुवीर्यं नासत्या वहन्ता आ जह्नावीं समनसोप वाजैस्त्रिरह्नो भागं दधतीमयातम |||
verses.transliteration: rayiṃ sukṣatraṃ svapatyamāyuḥ suvīryaṃ nāsatyā vahantā ā jahnāvīṃ samanasopa vājaistrirahno bhāghaṃ dadhatīmayātam

translations.griffith: Ye, bringing wealth with rule, and life with offspring, life rich in noble heroes; O Nāsatyas,  Accordant came with strength to Jahnu's children who offered you thrice every day your portion.

verses.sanskrit: परिविष्टं जाहुषं विश्वतः सीं सुगेभिर्नक्तमूहथू रजोभिः विभिन्दुना नासत्या रथेन वि पर्वतानजरयू अयातम |||
verses.transliteration: pariviṣṭaṃ jāhuṣaṃ viśvataḥ sīṃ sughebhirnaktamūhathū rajobhiḥ vibhindunā nāsatyā rathena vi parvatānajarayū ayātam

translations.griffith: Ye bore away at night by easy pathways Jāhuṣa compassed round on every quarter,  And, with your car that cleaves the toe asunder, Nāsatyas never decaying! rent the mountains.

verses.sanskrit: एकस्या वस्तोरावतं रणाय वशमश्विना सनये सहस्रा निरहतं दुछुना इन्द्रवन्ता पर्थुश्रवसो वर्षणावरातीः |||
verses.transliteration: ekasyā vastorāvataṃ raṇāya vaśamaśvinā sanaye sahasrā nirahataṃ duchunā indravantā pṛthuśravaso vṛṣaṇāvarātīḥ

translations.griffith: One morn ye strengthened Vaśa for the battle, to gather spoils that might be told in thousands.  With Indra joined ye drove away misfortunes, yea foes of Pṛthuśravas, O ye mighty.

verses.sanskrit: शरस्य चिदार्चत्कस्यावतादा नीचादुच्चा चक्रथुः पातवे वाः शयवे चिन नासत्या शचीभिर्जसुरये सतर्यं पिप्यथुर्गाम |||
verses.transliteration: śarasya cidārcatkasyāvatādā nīcāduccā cakrathuḥ pātave vāḥ śayave cin nāsatyā śacībhirjasuraye staryaṃ pipyathurghām

translations.griffith: From the deep well ye raised on high the water, so that Ṛcatka's son, Sara, should drink it;  And with your might, to help the weary Śayu, ye made the barren cow yield milk, Nāsatyas.

verses.sanskrit: अवस्यते सतुवते कर्ष्णियाय रजूयते नासत्या शचीभिः पशुं न नष्टमिव दर्शनाय विष्णाप्वं ददथुर्विश्वकाय |||
verses.transliteration: avasyate stuvate kṛṣṇiyāya ṛjūyate nāsatyā śacībhiḥ paśuṃ na naṣṭamiva darśanāya viṣṇāpvaṃ dadathurviśvakāya

translations.griffith: To Viśvaka, Nāsatyas! son of Kṛṣṇa, the righteous man who sought your aid and praised you,  Ye with your powers restored, like some lost creature, his son Viṣṇāpū for his eyes to look on.

verses.sanskrit: दश रात्रीरशिवेना नव दयूनवनद्धं शनथितमप्स्वन्तः विप्रुतं रेभमुदनि परव्र्क्तमुन निन्यथुः सोममिव सरुवेण |||
verses.transliteration: daśa rātrīraśivenā nava dyūnavanaddhaṃ śnathitamapsvantaḥ viprutaṃ rebhamudani pravṛktamun ninyathuḥ somamiva sruveṇa

translations.griffith: Aśvins, ye raised, like Soma in a ladle Rebha, who for ten days and ten nights, fettered.  Had lain in cruel bonds, immersed and wounded, suffering sore affliction, in the waters.

verses.sanskrit: पर वां दंसांस्यश्विनाववोचमस्य पतिः सयां सुगवः सुवीरः उत पश्यन्नश्नुवन दीर्घमायुरस्तमिवेज्जरिमाणं जगम्याम |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāṃ daṃsāṃsyaśvināvavocamasya patiḥ syāṃ sughavaḥ suvīraḥ uta paśyannaśnuvan dīrghamāyurastamivejjarimāṇaṃ jaghamyām

translations.griffith: 1 have declared your wondrous deeds, O Aśvins: may this be mine, and many kine and heroes.  May I, enjoying lengthened life, still seeing, enter old age as ’twere the house I live in.

verses.sanskrit: मध्वः सोमस्याश्विना मदाय परत्नो होता विवासते वाम बर्हिष्मती रातिर्विश्रिता गीरिषा यातं नासत्योप वाजैः |||
verses.transliteration: madhvaḥ somasyāśvinā madāya pratno hotā vivāsate vām barhiṣmatī rātirviśritā ghīriṣā yātaṃ nāsatyopa vājaiḥ

translations.griffith: AŚVINS, your ancient priest invites you hither to gladden you with draughts of meath of Soma.  Our gift is on the grass, our song apportioned: with food and strength come hither, O Nāsatyas.

verses.sanskrit: यो वामश्विना मनसो जवीयान रथः सवश्वो विश आजिगाति येन गछथः सुक्र्तो दुरोणं तेन नरा वर्तिरस्मभ्यं यातम |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāmaśvinā manaso javīyān rathaḥ svaśvo viśa ājighāti yena ghachathaḥ sukṛto duroṇaṃ tena narā vartirasmabhyaṃ yātam

translations.griffith: That car of yours, swifter than thought, O Aśvins, which drawn by brave steeds cometh to the people,  Whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious,—come ye thereon to our abode, O Heroes.

verses.sanskrit: रषिं नरावंहसः पाञ्चजन्यं रबीसादत्रिं मुञ्चथो गणेन मिनन्ता दस्योरशिवस्य माया अनुपूर्वं वर्षणा चोदयन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣiṃ narāvaṃhasaḥ pāñcajanyaṃ ṛbīsādatriṃ muñcatho ghaṇena minantā dasyoraśivasya māyā anupūrvaṃ vṛṣaṇā codayantā

translations.griffith: Ye freed sage Atri, whom the Five Tribes honoured, from the strait pit, ye Heroes with his people,  Baffling the guiles of the malignant Dasyu, repelling them, ye Mighty in succession.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वं न गूळ्हमश्विना दुरेवैर्र्षिं नरा वर्षणा रेभमप्सु सं तं रिणीथो विप्रुतं दंसोभिर्न वां जूर्यन्ति पूर्व्या कर्तानि |||
verses.transliteration: aśvaṃ na ghūḷhamaśvinā durevairṛṣiṃ narā vṛṣaṇā rebhamapsu saṃ taṃ riṇītho viprutaṃ daṃsobhirna vāṃ jūryanti pūrvyā kṛtāni

translations.griffith: Rebha the sage, ye mighty Heroes, Aśvins! whom, like a horse, vile men had sunk in water,—  Him, wounded, with your wondrous power ye rescued: your exploits of old time endure for ever.

verses.sanskrit: सुषुप्वांसं न निर्र्तेरुपस्थे सूर्यं न दस्रा तमसि कषियन्तम शुभे रुक्मं न दर्शतं निखातमुदूपथुरश्विना वन्दनाय |||
verses.transliteration: suṣupvāṃsaṃ na nirṛterupasthe sūryaṃ na dasrā tamasi kṣiyantam śubhe rukmaṃ na darśataṃ nikhātamudūpathuraśvinā vandanāya

translations.griffith: Ye brought forth Vandana, ye Wonder-Workers, for triumph, like fair gold that hath been buried,  Like one who slumbered in destruction's bosom, or like the Sun when dwelling in the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: तद वां नरा शंस्यं पज्रियेण कक्षीवता नासत्या परिज्मन शफादश्वस्य वाजिनो जनाय शतं कुम्भानसिञ्चतं मधूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: tad vāṃ narā śaṃsyaṃ pajriyeṇa kakṣīvatā nāsatyā parijman śaphādaśvasya vājino janāya śataṃ kumbhānasiñcataṃ madhūnām

translations.griffith: Kakṣīvān, Pajra's son, must laud that exploit of yours, Nāsatyas, Heroes, ye who wander!  When from the hoof of your strong horse ye showered a hundred jars of honey for the people.

verses.sanskrit: युवं नरा सतुवते कर्ष्णियाय विष्णाप्वं ददथुर्विश्वकाय घोषायै चित पित्र्षदे दुरोने पतिं जूर्यन्त्या अश्विनावदत्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ narā stuvate kṛṣṇiyāya viṣṇāpvaṃ dadathurviśvakāya ghoṣāyai cit pitṛṣade durone patiṃ jūryantyā aśvināvadattam

translations.griffith: To Kṛṣṇa's son, to Viśvaka who praised you, O Heroes, ye restored his son Viṣṇāpū.  To Ghoṣā, living in her father's dwelling, stricken in years, ye gave a husband, Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: युवं शयावाय रुशतीमदत्तं महः कषोणस्याश्विना कण्वाय परवाच्यं तद वर्षणा कर्तं वां यन नार्षदायश्रवो अध्यधत्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ śyāvāya ruśatīmadattaṃ mahaḥ kṣoṇasyāśvinā kaṇvāya pravācyaṃ tad vṛṣaṇā kṛtaṃ vāṃ yan nārṣadāyaśravo adhyadhattam

translations.griffith: Ruṣatī, of the mighty people, Aśvins, ye gave to Śyāva of the line of Kaṇva.  This deed of yours, ye Strong Ones should be published, that ye gave glory to the son of Nṛṣad.

verses.sanskrit: पुरू वर्पांस्यश्विना दधाना नि पेदव ऊहथुराशुमश्वम सहस्रसां वाजिनमप्रतीतमहिहनं शरवस्यं तरुत्रम |||
verses.transliteration: purū varpāṃsyaśvinā dadhānā ni pedava ūhathurāśumaśvam sahasrasāṃ vājinamapratītamahihanaṃ śravasyaṃ tarutram

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, wearing many forms at pleasure, on Pedu ye bestowed a fleet-foot courser,  Strong, winner of a thousand spoils, resistless the serpent slayer, glorious, triumphant.

verses.sanskrit: एतानि वां शरवस्या सुदानू बरह्माङगूषं सदनं रोदस्योः यद वां पज्रासो अश्विना हवन्ते यातमिषा च विदुषे च वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: etāni vāṃ śravasyā sudānū brahmāṅghūṣaṃ sadanaṃ rodasyoḥ yad vāṃ pajrāso aśvinā havante yātamiṣā ca viduṣe ca vājam

translations.griffith: These glorious things are yours, ye Bounteous Givers; prayer, praise in both worlds are your habitation.  O Aśvins, when the sons of Pajra call you, send strength with nourishment to him who knoweth.

verses.sanskrit: सूनोर्मानेनाश्विना गर्णाना वाजं विप्राय भुरणा रदन्ता अगस्त्ये बरह्मणा वाव्र्धाना सं विश्पलां नासत्यारिणीतम |||
verses.transliteration: sūnormānenāśvinā ghṛṇānā vājaṃ viprāya bhuraṇā radantā aghastye brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānā saṃ viśpalāṃ nāsatyāriṇītam

translations.griffith: Hymned with the reverence of a son, O Aśvins ye Swift Ones giving booty to the singer,  Glorified by Agastya with devotion, established Viśpalā again, Nāsatyas.

verses.sanskrit: कुह यान्ता सुष्टुतिं काव्यस्य दिवो नपाता वर्षणा शयुत्रा हिरण्यस्येव कलशं निखातमुदूपथुर्दशमे अश्विनाहन |||
verses.transliteration: kuha yāntā suṣṭutiṃ kāvyasya divo napātā vṛṣaṇā śayutrā hiraṇyasyeva kalaśaṃ nikhātamudūpathurdaśame aśvināhan

translations.griffith: Ye Sons of Heaven, ye Mighty, whither went ye, sought ye, for his fair praise the home of Kāvya.  When, like a pitcher full of gold, O Aśvins, on the tenth day ye lifted up the buried?

verses.sanskrit: युवं चयवानमश्विना जरन्तं पुनर्युवानं चक्रथुः शचीभिः युवो रथं दुहिता सूर्यस्य सह शरिया नासत्याव्र्णीत |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ cyavānamaśvinā jarantaṃ punaryuvānaṃ cakrathuḥ śacībhiḥ yuvo rathaṃ duhitā sūryasya saha śriyā nāsatyāvṛṇīta

translations.griffith: Ye with the aid of your great powers, O Aśvins, restored to youth the ancient man Cyavāna.  The Daughter of the Sun with all her glory, O ye Nāsatyas, chose your car to bear her.

verses.sanskrit: युवं तुग्राय पूर्व्येभिरेवैः पुनर्मन्यावभवतं युवाना युवं भुज्युमर्णसो निः समुद्राद विभिरूहथुर्र्ज्रेभिरश्वैः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ tughrāya pūrvyebhirevaiḥ punarmanyāvabhavataṃ yuvānā yuvaṃ bhujyumarṇaso niḥ samudrād vibhirūhathurṛjrebhiraśvaiḥ

translations.griffith: Ye, ever-youthful Ones, again remembered Tugra, according to your ancient manner:  With horses brown of hue that flew with swift wings ye brought back Bhujyu from the sea of billows.

verses.sanskrit: अजोहवीदश्विना तौग्र्यो वां परोळ्हः समुद्रमव्यथिर्जगन्वान निष टमूहथुः सुयुजा रथेन मनोजवसा वर्षणास्वस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ajohavīdaśvinā taughryo vāṃ proḷhaḥ samudramavyathirjaghanvān niṣ ṭamūhathuḥ suyujā rathena manojavasā vṛṣaṇāsvasti

translations.griffith: The son of Tugra had invoked you, Aśvins; borne on he went uninjured through the ocean.  Ye with your chariot swift as thought, well-harnessed, carried him off, O Mighty Ones, to safety.

verses.sanskrit: अजोहवीदश्विना वर्तिका वामास्नो यत सीममुञ्चतं वर्कस्य वि जयुषा ययथुः सान्वद्रेर्जातं विष्वाचो अहतं विषेण |||
verses.transliteration: ajohavīdaśvinā vartikā vāmāsno yat sīmamuñcataṃ vṛkasya vi jayuṣā yayathuḥ sānvadrerjātaṃ viṣvāco ahataṃ viṣeṇa

translations.griffith: The quail had invocated you, O Aśvins, when from the wolf's devouring jaws ye freed her.  With conquering car ye cleft the mountain's ridges: the offspring of Viśvāc ye killed with poison.

verses.sanskrit: शतं मेषान वर्क्ये मामहानं तमः परणीतमशिवेन पित्रा आक्षी रज्राश्वे अश्विनावधत्तं जयोतिरन्धाय चक्रथुर्विचक्षे |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ meṣān vṛkye māmahānaṃ tamaḥ praṇītamaśivena pitrā ākṣī ṛjrāśve aśvināvadhattaṃ jyotirandhāya cakrathurvicakṣe

translations.griffith: He whom for furnishing a hundred wethers to the she-wolf, his wicked father blinded,—  To him, Ṛjrāśva, gave ye eyes, O Aśvins; light to the blind ye sent for perfect vision.

verses.sanskrit: शुनमन्धाय भरमह्वयत सा वर्कीरश्विना वर्षणा नरेति जारः कनीन इव चक्षदान रज्राश्वः शतमेकंच मेषान |||
verses.transliteration: śunamandhāya bharamahvayat sā vṛkīraśvinā vṛṣaṇā nareti jāraḥ kanīna iva cakṣadāna ṛjrāśvaḥ śatamekaṃca meṣān

translations.griffith: To bring the blind man joy thus cried the she-wolf: O Aśvins, O ye Mighty Ones, O Heroes,  For me Ṛjrāśva, like a youthful lover, hath. cut piecemeal one and a hundred wethers.

verses.sanskrit: मही वामूतिरश्विना मयोभूरुत सरामं धिष्ण्या संरिणीथः अथा युवामिदह्वयत पुरन्धिरागछतं सीं वर्षणाववोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: mahī vāmūtiraśvinā mayobhūruta srāmaṃ dhiṣṇyā saṃriṇīthaḥ athā yuvāmidahvayat purandhirāghachataṃ sīṃ vṛṣaṇāvavobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Great and weal-giving is your aid, O Aśvins, ye, objects of all thought, made whole the cripple.  Purandhi also for this cause invoked you, and ye, O mighty, came to her with succours.

verses.sanskrit: अधेनुं दस्रा सतर्यं विषक्टामपिन्वतं शयवे अश्विनागाम युवं शचीभिर्विमदाय जायां नयूहथुः पुरुमित्रस्य योषाम |||
verses.transliteration: adhenuṃ dasrā staryaṃ viṣakṭāmapinvataṃ śayave aśvināghām yuvaṃ śacībhirvimadāya jāyāṃ nyūhathuḥ purumitrasya yoṣām

translations.griffith: Ye, Wonder-Workers, filled with milk for Śayu the milkless cow, emaciated, barren;  And by your powers the child of Purumitra ye brought to Vimada to be his consort.

verses.sanskrit: यवं वर्केणाश्विना वपन्तेषं दुहन्ता मनुषाय दस्रा अभि दस्युं बकुरेणा धमन्तोरु जयोतिश्चक्रथुरार्याय |||
verses.transliteration: yavaṃ vṛkeṇāśvinā vapanteṣaṃ duhantā manuṣāya dasrā abhi dasyuṃ bakureṇā dhamantoru jyotiścakrathurāryāya

translations.griffith: Ploughing and sowing barley, O ye Aśvins, milking out food for men, ye Wonder-Workers,  Blasting away the Dasyu with your trumpet, ye gave far-spreading light unto the Ārya.

verses.sanskrit: आथर्वणायाश्विना दधीचे.अश्व्यं शिरः परत्यैरयतम स वां मधु पर वोचद रतायन तवाष्ट्रं यद दस्रावपिकक्ष्यं वाम |||
verses.transliteration: ātharvaṇāyāśvinā dadhīce.aśvyaṃ śiraḥ pratyairayatam sa vāṃ madhu pra vocad ṛtāyan tvāṣṭraṃ yad dasrāvapikakṣyaṃ vām

translations.griffith: Ye brought the horse's head, Aśvins, and gave it unto Dadhyac the offspring of Atharvan.  True, he revealed to you, O Wonder-Workers, sweet Soma, Tvaṣṭar's secret, as your girdle.

verses.sanskrit: सदा कवी सुमतिमा चके वां विश्वा धियो अश्विना परावतं मे अस्मे रयिं नासत्या बर्हन्तमपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं रराथाम |||
verses.transliteration: sadā kavī sumatimā cake vāṃ viśvā dhiyo aśvinā prāvataṃ me asme rayiṃ nāsatyā bṛhantamapatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ rarāthām

translations.griffith: O Sages, evermore I crave your favour: be gracious unto all my prayers, O Aśvins.  Grant me, Nāsatyas, riches in abundance, wealth famous and accompanied with children.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यहस्तमश्विना रराणा पुत्रं नरा वध्रिमत्या अदत्तम तरिधा ह शयावमश्विना विकस्तमुज्जीवस ऐरयतंसुदानू |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyahastamaśvinā rarāṇā putraṃ narā vadhrimatyā adattam tridhā ha śyāvamaśvinā vikastamujjīvasa airayataṃsudānū

translations.griffith: With liberal bounty to the weakling's consorts ye, Heroes, gave a son Hiraṇyahasta;  And Śyāva, cut into three several pieces, ye brought to life again, O bounteous Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: एतानि वामश्विना वीर्याणि पर पूर्व्याण्यायवो.अवोचन बरह्मक्र्ण्वन्तो वर्षणा युवभ्यां सुवीरासो विदथमा वदेम |||
verses.transliteration: etāni vāmaśvinā vīryāṇi pra pūrvyāṇyāyavo.avocan brahmakṛṇvanto vṛṣaṇā yuvabhyāṃ suvīrāso vidathamā vadema

translations.griffith: These your heroic exploits, O ye Aśvins, done in the days. of old, have men related.  May we, addressing prayer to you, ye Mighty, speak with brave sons about us to the synod.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां रथो अश्विना शयेनपत्वा सुम्र्ळीकः सववान यात्वर्वां यो मर्त्यस्य मनसो जवीयान तरिवन्धुरो वर्षणा वातरंहाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ ratho aśvinā śyenapatvā sumṛḷīkaḥ svavān yātvarvāṃ yo martyasya manaso javīyān trivandhuro vṛṣaṇā vātaraṃhāḥ

translations.griffith: FLYING, with falcons, may your chariot, Aśvins, most gracious, bringing friendly  help, come hither,—  Your chariot, swifter than the mind of mortal, fleet as the wind, three-seated O ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: तरिवन्धुरेण तरिव्र्ता रथेन तरिचक्रेण सुव्र्ता यातमर्वाक पिन्वतं गा जिन्वतमर्वतो नो वर्धयतमश्विना वीरमस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā rathena tricakreṇa suvṛtā yātamarvāk pinvataṃ ghā jinvatamarvato no vardhayatamaśvinā vīramasme

translations.griffith: Come to us with your chariot triple seated, three-wheeled, of triple form, that rolleth lightly.  Fill full our cows, give mettle to our horses, and make each hero son grow strong, O Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: परवद्यामना सुव्र्ता रथेन दस्राविमं शर्णुतं शलोकमद्रेः किमङग वां परत्यवर्तिं गमिष्ठाहुर्विप्रासोश्विना पुराजाः |||
verses.transliteration: pravadyāmanā suvṛtā rathena dasrāvimaṃ śṛṇutaṃ ślokamadreḥ kimaṅgha vāṃ pratyavartiṃ ghamiṣṭhāhurviprāsoaśvinā purājāḥ

translations.griffith: With your well-rolling car, descending swiftly, hear this the press-stone's song, ye Wonder-Workers.  How then have ancient sages said, O Aśvins, that ye most swiftly come to stay affliction?

verses.sanskrit: आ वां शयेनासो अश्विना वहन्तु रथे युक्तास आशवः पतंगाः ये अप्तुरो दिव्यासो न गर्ध्रा अभि परयो नासत्या वहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ śyenāso aśvinā vahantu rathe yuktāsa āśavaḥ pataṃghāḥ ye apturo divyāso na ghṛdhrā abhi prayo nāsatyā vahanti

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, let your falcons bear you hither, yoked to your chariot, swift, with flying pinions,  Which, ever active, like the airy eagles, carry you, O Nāsatyas, to the banquet.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां रथं युवतिस्तिष्ठदत्र जुष्ट्वी नरा दुहितासूर्यस्य परि वामश्वा वपुषः पतंगा वयो वहन्त्वरुषा अभीके |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ rathaṃ yuvatistiṣṭhadatra juṣṭvī narā duhitāsūryasya pari vāmaśvā vapuṣaḥ pataṃghā vayo vahantvaruṣā abhīke

translations.griffith: The youthful Daughter of the Sun, delighting in you, ascended there your chariot, Heroes.  Borne on their swift wings let your beauteous horses, your birds of ruddy hue, convey you near us.

verses.sanskrit: उद वन्दनमैरतं दंसनाभिरुद रेभं दस्रा वर्षणा शचीभिः निष टौग्र्यं पारयथः समुद्रात पुनश्च्यवानं चक्रथुर्युवानम |||
verses.transliteration: ud vandanamairataṃ daṃsanābhirud rebhaṃ dasrā vṛṣaṇā śacībhiḥ niṣ ṭaughryaṃ pārayathaḥ samudrāt punaścyavānaṃ cakrathuryuvānam

translations.griffith: Ye raised up Vandana, strong Wonder-Workers! with great might, and with power ye rescued Rebha.  From out the sea ye saved the son of Tugra, and gave his youth again unto Cyavāna.

verses.sanskrit: युवमत्रये.अवनीताय तप्तमूर्जमोमानमश्विनावधत्तम युवं कण्वायापिरिप्ताय चक्षुः परत्यधत्तं सुष्टुतिं जुजुषाणा |||
verses.transliteration: yuvamatraye.avanītāya taptamūrjamomānamaśvināvadhattam yuvaṃ kaṇvāyāpiriptāya cakṣuḥ pratyadhattaṃ suṣṭutiṃ jujuṣāṇā

translations.griffith: To Atri, cast down to the fire that scorched him, ye gave, O Aśvins, strengthening food and favour.  Accepting his fair praises with approval, ye gave his eyes again to blinded Kaṇva.

verses.sanskrit: युवं धेनुं शयवे नाधितायापिन्वतमश्विना पूर्व्याय अमुञ्चतं वर्तिकामंहसो निः परति जङघां विश्पलाया अधत्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ dhenuṃ śayave nādhitāyāpinvatamaśvinā pūrvyāya amuñcataṃ vartikāmaṃhaso niḥ prati jaṅghāṃ viśpalāyā adhattam

translations.griffith: For ancient Śayu in his sore affliction ye caused his cow to swell with milk, O Aśvins.  The quail from her great misery ye delivered, and a new leg for Viśpalā provided.

verses.sanskrit: युवं शवेतं पेदव इन्द्रजूतमहिहनमश्विनादत्तमश्वम जोहूत्रमर्यो अभिभूतिमुग्रं सहस्रसां वर्षणं वीड्वङगम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ śvetaṃ pedava indrajūtamahihanamaśvinādattamaśvam johūtramaryo abhibhūtimughraṃ sahasrasāṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vīḍvaṅgham

translations.griffith: A white horse, Aśvins, ye bestowed on Pedu, a serpent-slaying steed sent down by Indra,  Loud-neighing, conquering the foe, high-mettled, firm-limbed and vigorous, winning thousand treasures.

verses.sanskrit: ता वां नरा सववसे सुजाता हवामहे अश्विना नाधमानाः आ न उप वसुमता रथेन गिरो जुसाना सुविताय यातम |||
verses.transliteration: tā vāṃ narā svavase sujātā havāmahe aśvinā nādhamānāḥ ā na upa vasumatā rathena ghiro jusānā suvitāya yātam

translations.griffith: Such as ye are, O nobly born, O Heroes, we in our trouble call on you for succour.  Accepting these our songs, for our wellbeing come to us on your chariot treasure-laden.

verses.sanskrit: आ शयेनस्य जवसा नूतनेनास्मे यातं नासत्या सजोषाः हवे हि वामश्विना रातहव्यः शश्वत्तमाया उषसो वयुष्टौ |||
verses.transliteration: ā śyenasya javasā nūtanenāsme yātaṃ nāsatyā sajoṣāḥ have hi vāmaśvinā rātahavyaḥ śaśvattamāyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau

translations.griffith: Come unto us combined in love, Nāsatyas come with the fresh swift vigour of the falcon.  Bearing oblations I invoke you, Aśvins, at the first break of everlasting morning.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां रथं पुरुमायं मनोजुवं जीराश्वं यज्ञियं जीवसे हुवे सहस्रकेतुं वनिनं शतद्वसुं शरुष्टीवानं वरिवोधामभि परयः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ rathaṃ purumāyaṃ manojuvaṃ jīrāśvaṃ yajñiyaṃ jīvase huve sahasraketuṃ vaninaṃ śatadvasuṃ śruṣṭīvānaṃ varivodhāmabhi prayaḥ

translations.griffith: HITHER, that I may live, I call unto the feast your wondrous car, thought-swift, borne on by rapid steeds.  With thousand banners, hundred treasures, pouring gifts, promptly obedient, bestowing ample room.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वा धीतिः परत्यस्य परयामन्यधायि शस्मन समयन्त आ दिशः सवदामि घर्मं परति यन्त्यूतय आ वामूर्जानी रथमश्विनारुहत |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvā dhītiḥ pratyasya prayāmanyadhāyi śasman samayanta ā diśaḥ svadāmi gharmaṃ prati yantyūtaya ā vāmūrjānī rathamaśvināruhat

translations.griffith: Even as it moveth near my hymn is lifted up, and all the regions come together to sing praise.  I sweeten the oblations; now the helpers come. Ūrjānī hath, O Aśvins, mounted on your car.

verses.sanskrit: सं यन मिथः पस्प्र्धानासो अग्मत शुभे मखा अमिता जायवो रणे युवोरह परवणे चेकिते रथो यदश्विना वहथः सूरिमा वरम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yan mithaḥ paspṛdhānāso aghmata śubhe makhā amitā jāyavo raṇe yuvoraha pravaṇe cekite ratho yadaśvinā vahathaḥ sūrimā varam

translations.griffith: When striving man with man for glory they have met, brisk, measureless, eager for victory in fight,  Then verily your car is seen upon the slope when ye, O Aśvins, bring some choice boon to the prince.

verses.sanskrit: युवं भुज्युं भुरमाणं विभिर्गतं सवयुक्तिभिर्निवहन्ता पित्र्भ्य आ यासिष्टं वर्तिर्व्र्षणा विजेन्यं दिवोदासाय महि चेति वामवः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ bhujyuṃ bhuramāṇaṃ vibhirghataṃ svayuktibhirnivahantā pitṛbhya ā yāsiṣṭaṃ vartirvṛṣaṇā vijenyaṃ divodāsāya mahi ceti vāmavaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye came to Bhujyu while he struggled in the flood, with flying birds, self-yoked, ye bore him to his sires.  Ye went to the far-distant home, O Mighty Ones; and famed is your great aid to Divodāsa given.

verses.sanskrit: युवोरश्विना वपुषे युवायुजं रथं वाणी येमतुरस्य शर्ध्यम आ वां पतित्वं सख्याय जग्मुषी योषाव्र्णीतजेन्या युवां पती |||
verses.transliteration: yuvoraśvinā vapuṣe yuvāyujaṃ rathaṃ vāṇī yematurasya śardhyam ā vāṃ patitvaṃ sakhyāya jaghmuṣī yoṣāvṛṇītajenyā yuvāṃ patī

translations.griffith: Aśvins, the car which you had yoked for glorious show your own two voices urged directed to its goal.  Then she who came for friendship, Maid of noble birth, elected you as Husbands, you to be her Lords.

verses.sanskrit: युवं रेभं परिषूतेरुरुष्यथो हिमेन घर्मं परितप्तमत्रये युवं शयोरवसं पिप्यथुर्गवि पर दीर्घेण वन्दनस्तार्यायुषा |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ rebhaṃ pariṣūteruruṣyatho himena gharmaṃ paritaptamatraye yuvaṃ śayoravasaṃ pipyathurghavi pra dīrgheṇa vandanastāryāyuṣā

translations.griffith: Rebha ye saved from tyranny; for Atri's sake ye quenched with cold the fiery pit that compassed him.  Ye made the cow of Śayu stream refreshing milk, and Vandana was holpen to extended life.

verses.sanskrit: युवं वन्दनं निर्र्तं जरण्यया रथं न दस्रा करणा समिन्वथः कषेत्रादा विप्रं जनथो विपन्यया पर वामत्र विधते दंसना भुवत |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ vandanaṃ nirṛtaṃ jaraṇyayā rathaṃ na dasrā karaṇā saminvathaḥ kṣetrādā vipraṃ janatho vipanyayā pra vāmatra vidhate daṃsanā bhuvat

translations.griffith: Doers of marvels, skilful workers, ye restored Vandana, like a car, worn out with length of days.  From earth ye brought the sage to life in wondrous mode; be your great deeds done here for him who honours you.

verses.sanskrit: अगछतं कर्पमाणं परावति पितुः सवस्य तयजसा निबाधितम सवर्वतीरित ऊतीर्युवोरह चित्रा अभीके अभवन्नभिष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: aghachataṃ kṛpamāṇaṃ parāvati pituḥ svasya tyajasā nibādhitam svarvatīrita ūtīryuvoraha citrā abhīke abhavannabhiṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye went to him who mourned in a far distant place, him who was left forlorn by treachery of his sire.  Rich with the light of heaven was then the help ye gave, and marvellous your succour when ye stood by him.

verses.sanskrit: उत सया वां मधुमन मक्षिकारपन मदे सोमस्यौशिजो हुवन्यति युवं दधीचो मन आ विवासथो.अथा शिरः परति वामश्व्यं वदत |||
verses.transliteration: uta syā vāṃ madhuman makṣikārapan made somasyauśijo huvanyati yuvaṃ dadhīco mana ā vivāsatho.athā śiraḥ prati vāmaśvyaṃ vadat

translations.griffith: To you in praise of sweetness sang the honey-bee: Auśija calleth you in Soma's rapturous joy.  Ye drew unto yourselves the spirit of Dadhyac, and then the horse's head uttered his words to you.

verses.sanskrit: युवं पेदवे पुरुवारमश्विना सप्र्धां शवेतं तरुतारन्दुवस्यथः शर्यैरभिद्युं पर्तनासु दुष्टरं चर्क्र्त्यमिन्द्रमिव चर्षणीसहम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ pedave puruvāramaśvinā spṛdhāṃ śvetaṃ tarutāranduvasyathaḥ śaryairabhidyuṃ pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraṃ carkṛtyamindramiva carṣaṇīsaham

translations.griffith: A horse did ye provide for Pedu, excellent, white, O ye Aśvins, conqueror of combatants,  Invincible in war by arrows, seeking heaven worthy of fame, like Indra, vanquisher of men.

verses.sanskrit: का राधद धोत्राश्विना वां को वां जोष उभयोः कथा विधात्यप्रचेताः |||
verses.transliteration: kā rādhad dhotrāśvinā vāṃ ko vāṃ joṣa ubhayoḥ kathā vidhātyapracetāḥ

translations.griffith: AŚVINS, what praise may win your grace? Who may be pleasing to you both?  How shall the ignorant worship you?

verses.sanskrit: विद्वांसाविद दुरः पर्छेदविद्वानित्थापरो अचेताः नू चिन नु मर्ते अक्रौ |||
verses.transliteration: vidvāṃsāvid duraḥ pṛchedavidvānitthāparo acetāḥ nū cin nu marte akrau

translations.griffith: Here let the ignorant ask the means of you who know—for none beside you knoweth aught—  Not of a spiritless mortal man.

verses.sanskrit: ता विद्वांसा हवामहे वां ता नो विद्वांसा मन्म वोचेतमद्य परार्चद दयमानो युवाकुः |||
verses.transliteration: tā vidvāṃsā havāmahe vāṃ tā no vidvāṃsā manma vocetamadya prārcad dayamāno yuvākuḥ

translations.griffith: Such as ye: are, all-wise, we call you. Ye wise, declare to us this day accepted prayer.  Loving you well your servant lauds you.

verses.sanskrit: वि पर्छामि पाक्या न देवान वषट्क्र्तस्याद्भुतस्य दस्रा पातं च सह्यसो युवं च रभ्यसो नः |||
verses.transliteration: vi pṛchāmi pākyā na devān vaṣaṭkṛtasyādbhutasya dasrā pātaṃ ca sahyaso yuvaṃ ca rabhyaso naḥ

translations.griffith: Simply, ye Mighty Ones, I ask the Gods of that wondrous oblation hallowed by the mystic word.  Save us from what is stronger, fiercer than ourselves.

verses.sanskrit: पर या घोषे भर्गवाणे न शोभे यया वाचा यजति पज्रियो वाम परैषयुर्न विद्वान |||
verses.transliteration: pra yā ghoṣe bhṛghavāṇe na śobhe yayā vācā yajati pajriyo vām praiṣayurna vidvān

translations.griffith: Forth go the hymn that shone in Ghoṣā Bhṛgu's like, the song wherewith the son of Pajra worships you,  Like some wise minister.

verses.sanskrit: शरुतं गायत्रं तकवानस्याहं चिद धि रिरेभाश्विना वाम आक्षी शुभस पती दन |||
verses.transliteration: śrutaṃ ghāyatraṃ takavānasyāhaṃ cid dhi rirebhāśvinā vām ākṣī śubhas patī dan

translations.griffith: Hear ye the song of him who hastens speedily. O Aśvins, I am he who sang your praise.  Hither, ye Lords of Splendour, hither turn your eyes.

verses.sanskrit: युवं हयास्तं महो रन युवं वा यन निरततंसतम तानो वसू सुगोपा सयातं पातं नो वर्कादघायोः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ hyāstaṃ maho ran yuvaṃ vā yan niratataṃsatam tāno vasū sughopā syātaṃ pātaṃ no vṛkādaghāyoḥ

translations.griffith: For ye were ever nigh to deal forth ample wealth, to give the wealth that ye had gathered up.  As such, ye Vasus, guard us well, and keep us safely from the wicked wolf.

verses.sanskrit: मा कस्मै धातमभ्यमित्रिणे नो माकुत्रा नो गर्हेभ्यो धेनवो गुः सतनाभुजो अशिश्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: mā kasmai dhātamabhyamitriṇe no mākutrā no ghṛhebhyo dhenavo ghuḥ stanābhujo aśiśvīḥ

translations.griffith: Give us not up to any man who hateth us, nor let our milch-cows stray, whose udders give us food,  Far from our homes without their calves.

verses.sanskrit: दुहीयन मित्रधितये युवाकु राये च नो मिमीतं वाजवत्यै इषे च नो मिमीतं धेनुमत्यै |||
verses.transliteration: duhīyan mitradhitaye yuvāku rāye ca no mimītaṃ vājavatyai iṣe ca no mimītaṃ dhenumatyai

translations.griffith: May they who love you gain you for their Friends. Prepare ye us for opulence with strengthening food,  Prepare us for the food that floweth from our cows

verses.sanskrit: अश्विनोरसनं रथमनश्वं वाजिनावतोः तेनाहं भूरि चाकन |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinorasanaṃ rathamanaśvaṃ vājināvatoḥ tenāhaṃ bhūri cākana

translations.griffith: I have obtained the horseless car of Aśvins rich in sacrifice,  And I am well content therewith.

verses.sanskrit: अयं समह मा तनूह्याते जनाननु सोमपेयं सुखो रथः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ samaha mā tanūhyāte janānanu somapeyaṃ sukho rathaḥ

translations.griffith: May it convey me evermore: may the light chariot pass from men  To men unto the Soma draught.

verses.sanskrit: अध सवप्नस्य निर्विदे.अभुञ्जतश्च रेवतः उभा ता बस्रि नश्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: adha svapnasya nirvide.abhuñjataśca revataḥ ubhā tā basri naśyataḥ

translations.griffith: It holdeth slumber in contempt. and the rich who enjoyeth not:  Both vanish quickly and are lost.

verses.sanskrit: कदित्था नॄनः पात्रं देवयतां शरवद गिरो अङगिरसां तुरण्यन पर यदानड विश आ हर्म्यस्योरु करंसते अध्वरे यजत्रः |||
verses.transliteration: kaditthā nṝnḥ pātraṃ devayatāṃ śravad ghiro aṅghirasāṃ turaṇyan pra yadānaḍ viśa ā harmyasyoru kraṃsate adhvare yajatraḥ

translations.griffith: WHEN Will men's guardians hasting hear with favour the song of Aṅgiras's pious    children  ?  When to the people of the home he cometh he strideth to the sacrifice, the Holy.

verses.sanskrit: सतम्भीद ध दयां स धरुणं परुषायद रभुर्वाजाय दरविणं नरो गोः अनु सवाजां महिषश्चक्षत वरां मेनामश्वस्य परि मातरं गोः |||
verses.transliteration: stambhīd dha dyāṃ sa dharuṇaṃ pruṣāyad ṛbhurvājāya draviṇaṃ naro ghoḥ anu svājāṃ mahiṣaścakṣata vrāṃ menāmaśvasya pari mātaraṃ ghoḥ

translations.griffith: He stablished heaven; he poured forth, skilful worker, the wealth of kine, for strength, that nurtures heroes.  The Mighty One his self-born host regarded, the horse's mate, the mother of the heifer.

verses.sanskrit: नक्षद धवमरुणीः पूर्व्यं राट तुरो विशामङगिरसामनु दयून तक्षद वज्रं नियुतं तस्तम्भद दयां चतुष्पदे नर्याय दविपादे |||
verses.transliteration: nakṣad dhavamaruṇīḥ pūrvyaṃ rāṭ turo viśāmaṅghirasāmanu dyūn takṣad vajraṃ niyutaṃ tastambhad dyāṃ catuṣpade naryāya dvipāde

translations.griffith: Lord of red dawns, he came victorious, daily to the Aṅgirases' former invocation.  His bolt and team hath he prepared, and stablished the heaven for quadrupeds and men two-footed.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य मदे सवर्यं दा रतायापीव्र्तमुस्रियाणामनीकम यद ध परसर्गे तरिककुं निवर्तदप दरुहो मानुषस्य दुरो वः |||
verses.transliteration: asya made svaryaṃ dā ṛtāyāpīvṛtamusriyāṇāmanīkam yad dha prasarghe trikakuṃ nivartadapa druho mānuṣasya duro vaḥ

translations.griffith: In joy of this thou didst restore, for worship, the lowing company of hidden cattle.  When the three-pointed one descends with onslaught he opens wide the doors that cause man trouble.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं पयो यत पितरावनीतां राधः सुरेतस्तुरणे भुरण्यू शुचि यत ते रेक्ण आयजन्त सबर्दुघायाः पयौस्रियायाः |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ payo yat pitarāvanītāṃ rādhaḥ suretasturaṇe bhuraṇyū śuci yat te rekṇa āyajanta sabardughāyāḥ payausriyāyāḥ

translations.griffith: Thine is that milk which thy swift-moving Parents brought down, a strengthening genial gift for conquest;  When the pure treasure unto thee they offered, the milk shed from the cow who streameth nectar.

verses.sanskrit: अध पर जज्ञे तरणिर्ममत्तु पर रोच्यस्या उषसो न सूरः इन्दुर्येभिराष्ट सवेदुहव्यैः सरुवेण सिञ्चञ जरणाभि धाम |||
verses.transliteration: adha pra jajñe taraṇirmamattu pra rocyasyā uṣaso na sūraḥ induryebhirāṣṭa sveduhavyaiḥ sruveṇa siñcañ jaraṇābhi dhāma

translations.griffith: There is he born. May the Swift give us rapture, and like the Sun shine forth from yonder dawning,  Indu, even us who drank, whose toils are offerings, poured from the spoon, with praise, upon the altar.

verses.sanskrit: सविध्मा यद वनधितिरपस्यात सूरो अध्वरे परि रोधना गोः यद ध परभासि कर्त्व्याननु दयूननर्विशे पश्विषेतुराय |||
verses.transliteration: svidhmā yad vanadhitirapasyāt sūro adhvare pari rodhanā ghoḥ yad dha prabhāsi kṛtvyānanu dyūnanarviśe paśviṣeturāya

translations.griffith: When the wood-pile, made of good logs, is ready, at the Sun's worship to bind fast the Bullock,  Then when thou shinest forth through days of action for the Car-borne, the Swift, the Cattle-seeker.

verses.sanskrit: अष्टा महो दिव आदो हरी इह दयुम्नासाहमभि योधानौत्सम हरिं यत ते मन्दिनं दुक्षन वर्धे गोरभसमद्रिभिर्वाताप्यम |||
verses.transliteration: aṣṭā maho diva ādo harī iha dyumnāsāhamabhi yodhānautsam hariṃ yat te mandinaṃ dukṣan vṛdhe ghorabhasamadribhirvātāpyam

translations.griffith: Eight steeds thou broughtest down from mighty heaven, when fighting for the well that giveth splendour,  That men might press with stones the gladdening yellow, strengthened with milk, fermenting, to exalt thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवमायसं परति वर्तयो गोर्दिवो अश्मानमुपनीतं रभ्वा कुत्साय यत्र पुरुहूत वन्वञ्छुष्णमनन्तैः परियासि वधैः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamāyasaṃ prati vartayo ghordivo aśmānamupanītaṃ ṛbhvā kutsāya yatra puruhūta vanvañchuṣṇamanantaiḥ pariyāsi vadhaiḥ

translations.griffith: Thou hurledst forth from heaven the iron missile, brought by the Skilful, from the sling of leather,  When thou, O Much-invoked, assisting Kutsa with endless deadly darts didst compass Śuṣṇa.

verses.sanskrit: पुरा यत सूरस्तमसो अपीतेस्तमद्रिवः फलिगं हेतिमस्य शुष्णस्य चित परिहितं यदोजो दिवस परि सुग्रथितं तदादः |||
verses.transliteration: purā yat sūrastamaso apītestamadrivaḥ phalighaṃ hetimasya śuṣṇasya cit parihitaṃ yadojo divas pari sughrathitaṃ tadādaḥ

translations.griffith: Bolt-armed, ere darkness overtook the sunlight, thou castest at the veiling cloud thy weapon,  Thou rentest, out of heaven, though firmly knotted, the might of Śuṣṇa that was thrown around him.

verses.sanskrit: अनु तवा मही पाजसी अचक्रे दयावाक्षामा मदतामिन्द्र कर्मन तवं वर्त्रमाशयानं सिरासु महो वज्रेण सिष्वपोवराहुम |||
verses.transliteration: anu tvā mahī pājasī acakre dyāvākṣāmā madatāmindra karman tvaṃ vṛtramāśayānaṃ sirāsu maho vajreṇa siṣvapovarāhum

translations.griffith: The mighty Heaven and Earth, those bright expanses that have no wheels, joyed, Indra, at thine exploit.  Vṛtra, the boar who lay amid the waters, to sleep thou sentest with thy mighty thunder.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र नर्यो यानवो नॄन तिष्ठा वातस्य सुयुजो वहिष्ठान यं ते काव्य उशना मन्दिनं दाद वर्त्रहणं पार्यं ततक्ष वज्रम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindra naryo yānavo nṝn tiṣṭhā vātasya suyujo vahiṣṭhān yaṃ te kāvya uśanā mandinaṃ dād vṛtrahaṇaṃ pāryaṃ tatakṣa vajram

translations.griffith: Mount Indra, lover of the men thou guardest, the well-yoked horses of the wind, best bearers.  The bolt which Kāvya Uśanā erst gave thee, strong, gladdening, Vṛtra-slaying, hath he fashioned.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सूरो हरितो रामयो नॄन भरच्चक्रमेतशो नायमिन्द्र परास्य पारं नवतिं नाव्यानामपि कर्तमवर्तयोऽयज्यून |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ sūro harito rāmayo nṝn bharaccakrametaśo nāyamindra prāsya pāraṃ navatiṃ nāvyānāmapi kartamavartayo'yajyūn

translations.griffith: The strong Bay Horses of the Sun thou stayedst: this Etaśa drew not the wheel, O Indra.  Casting them forth beyond the ninety rivers thou dravest down into the pit the godless.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अस्या इन्द्र दुर्हणायाः पाहि वज्रिवो दुरितादभीके पर नो वाजान रथ्यो अश्वबुध्यानिषे यन्धि शरवसे सून्र्तायै |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no asyā indra durhaṇāyāḥ pāhi vajrivo duritādabhīke pra no vājān rathyo aśvabudhyāniṣe yandhi śravase sūnṛtāyai

translations.griffith: Indra, preserve thou us from this affliction Thunder-armed, save us from the misery near us.  Vouchsafe us affluence in chariots, founded on horses, for our food and fame and gladness.

verses.sanskrit: मा सा ते अस्मत सुमतिर्वि दसद वाजप्रमहः समिषो वरन्त आ नो भज मघवन गोष्वर्यो मंहिष्ठास्ते सधमादः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: mā sā te asmat sumatirvi dasad vājapramahaḥ samiṣo varanta ā no bhaja maghavan ghoṣvaryo maṃhiṣṭhāste sadhamādaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Never may this thy loving-kindness fail us; mighty in strength, may plenteous food surround us.  Maghavan, make us share the foeman's cattle: may we be thy most liberal feast companions.

verses.sanskrit: पर वः पान्तं रघुमन्यवो.अन्धो यज्ञं रुद्राय मीळ्हुषे भरद्वम दिवो अस्तोष्यसुरस्य वीरैरिषुध्येव मरुतो रोदस्योः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vaḥ pāntaṃ raghumanyavo.andho yajñaṃ rudrāya mīḷhuṣe bharadvam divo astoṣyasurasya vīrairiṣudhyeva maruto rodasyoḥ

translations.griffith: SAY, bringing sacrifice to bounteous Rudra, This juice for drink to you whose wrath is fleeting!  With Dyaus the Asura's Heroes I have lauded the Maruts as with prayer to Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पत्नीव पूर्वहूतिं वाव्र्धध्या उषासानक्ता पुरुधा विदाने सतरीर नात्कं वयुतं वसाना सूर्यस्य शरिया सुद्र्शी हिरण्यैः |||
verses.transliteration: patnīva pūrvahūtiṃ vāvṛdhadhyā uṣāsānaktā purudhā vidāne starīr nātkaṃ vyutaṃ vasānā sūryasya śriyā sudṛśī hiraṇyaiḥ

translations.griffith: Strong to exalt the early invocation are Night and Dawn who show with varied aspect.  The Barren clothes her in wide-woven raiment, and fair Morn shines with Sūrya's golden splendour.

verses.sanskrit: ममत्तु नः परिज्मा वसर्हा ममत्तु वातो अपां वर्षण्वान शिशीतमिन्द्रापर्वता युवं नस्तन नो विश्वे वरिवस्यन्तुदेवाः |||
verses.transliteration: mamattu naḥ parijmā vasarhā mamattu vāto apāṃ vṛṣaṇvān śiśītamindrāparvatā yuvaṃ nastan no viśve varivasyantudevāḥ

translations.griffith: Cheer us the Roamer round, who strikes at morning, the Wind delight us, pourer forth of waters!  Sharpen our wits, O Parvata and Indra. May all the Gods vouchsafe to us this favour.

verses.sanskrit: उत तया मे यशसा शवेतनायै वयन्ता पान्तौशिजो हुवध्यै पर वो नपातमपां कर्णुध्वं पर मातरा रास्पिनस्यायोः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyā me yaśasā śvetanāyai vyantā pāntauśijo huvadhyai pra vo napātamapāṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ pra mātarā rāspinasyāyoḥ

translations.griffith: And Auśija shall call for me that famous Pair who enjoy and drink, who come to brighten.  Set ye the Offspring of the Floods before you; both Mothers of the Living One who beameth.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो रुवण्युमौशिजो हुवध्यै घोषेव शंसमर्जुनस्य नंशे पर वः पूष्णे दावन आनछा वोचेय वसुतातिमग्नेः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo ruvaṇyumauśijo huvadhyai ghoṣeva śaṃsamarjunasya naṃśe pra vaḥ pūṣṇe dāvana ānachā voceya vasutātimaghneḥ

translations.griffith: For you shall Auśija call him who thunders, as, to win Arjuna's assent, cried Ghoṣā.  I will invoke, that Pūṣan may be bounteous to you, the rich munificence of Agni.

verses.sanskrit: शरुतं मे मित्रावरुणा हवेमोत शरुतं सदने विश्वतः सीम शरोतु नः शरोतुरातिः सुश्रोतुः सुक्षेत्रा सिन्धुरद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: śrutaṃ me mitrāvaruṇā havemota śrutaṃ sadane viśvataḥ sīm śrotu naḥ śroturātiḥ suśrotuḥ sukṣetrā sindhuradbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Hear, Mitra-Varuṇa, these mine invocations, hear them from all men in the hall of worship.  Giver of famous gifts, kind hearer, Sindhu who gives fair fields, listen with all his waters!

verses.sanskrit: सतुषे सा वां वरुण मित्र रातिर्गवां शता पर्क्षयामेषु पज्रे शरुतरथे परियरथे दधानाः सद्यः पुष्टिंनिरुन्धानासो अग्मन |||
verses.transliteration: stuṣe sā vāṃ varuṇa mitra rātirghavāṃ śatā pṛkṣayāmeṣu pajre śrutarathe priyarathe dadhānāḥ sadyaḥ puṣṭiṃnirundhānāso aghman

translations.griffith: Praised, Mitra, Varuṇa! is your gift, a hundred cows to the Pṛkṣayāmas and the Pajra.  Presented by car-famous Priyaratha, supplying nourishment, they came directly.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य सतुषे महिमघस्य राधः सचा सनेम नहुषः सुवीराः जनो यः पज्रेभ्यो वाजिनीवानश्वावतो रथिनो मह्यं सूरिः |||
verses.transliteration: asya stuṣe mahimaghasya rādhaḥ sacā sanema nahuṣaḥ suvīrāḥ jano yaḥ pajrebhyo vājinīvānaśvāvato rathino mahyaṃ sūriḥ

translations.griffith: Praised is the gift of him the very wealthy: may we enjoy it, men with hero children:  His who hath many gifts to give the Pajras, a chief who makes me rich in cars and horses.

verses.sanskrit: जनो यो मित्रावरुणावभिध्रुगपो न वां सुनोत्यक्ष्णयाध्रुक सवयं स यक्ष्मं हर्दये नि धत्त आप यदीं होत्राभिर्र्तावा |||
verses.transliteration: jano yo mitrāvaruṇāvabhidhrughapo na vāṃ sunotyakṣṇayādhruk svayaṃ sa yakṣmaṃ hṛdaye ni dhatta āpa yadīṃ hotrābhirṛtāvā

translations.griffith: The folk, O Mitra-Varuṇa, who hate you, who sinfully hating pour you no libations,  Lay in their hearts, themselves, a wasting sickness, whereas the righteous gaineth all by worship.

verses.sanskrit: स वराधतो नहुषो दंसुजूतः शर्धस्तरो नरां गूर्तश्रवाः विस्र्ष्टरातिर्याति बाळ्हस्र्त्वा विश्वासु पर्त्सु सदमिच्छूरः |||
verses.transliteration: sa vrādhato nahuṣo daṃsujūtaḥ śardhastaro narāṃ ghūrtaśravāḥ visṛṣṭarātiryāti bāḷhasṛtvā viśvāsu pṛtsu sadamicchūraḥ

translations.griffith: That man, most puissant, wondrously urged onward, famed among heroes, liberal in giving,  Moveth a warrior, evermore undaunted in all encounters even with the mighty.

verses.sanskrit: अध गमन्ता नहुषो हवं सूरेः शरोता राजानो अम्र्तस्य मन्द्राः नभोजुवो यन निरवस्य राधः परशस्तये महिनारथवते |||
verses.transliteration: adha ghmantā nahuṣo havaṃ sūreḥ śrotā rājāno amṛtasya mandrāḥ nabhojuvo yan niravasya rādhaḥ praśastaye mahinārathavate

translations.griffith: Come to the man's, the sacrificer's calling: hear, Kings of Immortality, joy-givers!  While ye who speed through clouds decree your bounty largely, for fame, to him the chariot rider.

verses.sanskrit: एतं शर्धं धाम यस्य सूरेरित्यवोचन दशतयस्य नंशे दयुम्नानि येषु वसुताती रारन विश्वे सन्वन्तु परभ्र्थेषु वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ śardhaṃ dhāma yasya sūrerityavocan daśatayasya naṃśe dyumnāni yeṣu vasutātī rāran viśve sanvantu prabhṛtheṣu vājam

translations.griffith: Vigour will we bestow on that adorer whose tenfold draught we come to taste, so spake they.  May all in whom rest splendour and great riches obtain refreshment in these sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: मन्दामहे दशतयस्य धासेर्द्विर्यत पञ्च बिभ्रतो यन्त्यन्ना किमिष्टाश्व इष्टरश्मिरेत ईशानासस्तरुषर्ञ्जते नॄन |||
verses.transliteration: mandāmahe daśatayasya dhāserdviryat pañca bibhrato yantyannā kimiṣṭāśva iṣṭaraśmireta īśānāsastaruṣaṛñjate nṝn

translations.griffith: We will rejoice to drink the tenfold present when the twicefive come bearing sacred viands.  What can he do whose steeds and reins are choicest? These, the all-potent, urge brave men to conquest.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यकर्णं मणिग्रीवमर्णस्तन नो विश्वे वरिवस्यन्तु देवाः अर्यो गिरः सद्य आ जग्मुषीरोस्राश्चाकन्तूभयेष्वस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyakarṇaṃ maṇighrīvamarṇastan no viśve varivasyantu devāḥ aryo ghiraḥ sadya ā jaghmuṣīrosrāścākantūbhayeṣvasme

translations.griffith: The sea and all the Deities shall give us him with the golden ear and neck bejewelled.  Dawns, hasting to the praises of the pious, be pleased with us, both offerers and singers.

verses.sanskrit: चत्वारो मा मशर्शारस्य शिश्वस्त्रयो राज्ञ आयवसस्यजिष्णोः रथो वां मित्रावरुणा दीर्घा]पसाः सयूमगभस्तिः सूरो नाद्यौत |||
verses.transliteration: catvāro mā maśarśārasya śiśvastrayo rājña āyavasasyajiṣṇoḥ ratho vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā dīrghā]psāḥ syūmaghabhastiḥ sūro nādyaut

translations.griffith: Four youthful sons of Maśarśāra vex me, three, of the king, the conquering Ayavasa.  Now like the Sun, O Varuṇa and Mitra, your car hath shone, long-shaped and reined with splendour.

verses.sanskrit: पर्थू रथो दक्षिणाया अयोज्यैनं देवासो अम्र्तासो अस्थुः कर्ष्णादुदस्थादर्या विहायाश्चिकित्सन्ती मानुषायक्षयाय |||
verses.transliteration: pṛthū ratho dakṣiṇāyā ayojyainaṃ devāso amṛtāso asthuḥ kṛṣṇādudasthādaryā vihāyāścikitsantī mānuṣāyakṣayāya

translations.griffith: THE Dakṣiṇā's broad chariot hath been harnessed: this car the Gods Immortal have ascended.  Fain to bring light to homes of men the noble and active Goddess hath emerged from darkness.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वा विश्वस्माद भुवनादबोधि जयन्ती वाजं बर्हती सनुत्री उच्चा वयख्यद युवतिः पुनर्भूरोषा अगन परथमा पूर्वहूतौ |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvā viśvasmād bhuvanādabodhi jayantī vājaṃ bṛhatī sanutrī uccā vyakhyad yuvatiḥ punarbhūroṣā aghan prathamā pūrvahūtau

translations.griffith: She before all the living world hath wakened, the Lofty One who wins and gathers treasure.  Revived and ever young on high she glances. Dawn hath come first unto our morning worship.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्य भागं विभजासि नर्भ्य उषो देवि मर्त्यत्रा सुजाते देवो नो अत्र सविता दमूना अनागसो वोचति सूर्याय |||
verses.transliteration: yadadya bhāghaṃ vibhajāsi nṛbhya uṣo devi martyatrā sujāte devo no atra savitā damūnā anāghaso vocati sūryāya

translations.griffith: If, Dawn, thou Goddess nobly born, thou dealest fortune this day to all the race of mortals,  May Savitar the God, Friend of the homestead, declare before the Sun that we are sinless.

verses.sanskrit: गर्हं-गर्हमहना यात्यछा दिवे-दिवे अधि नामा दधाना सिषासन्ती दयोतना शश्वदागादग्रम-अग्रमिद भजतेवसूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛhaṃ-ghṛhamahanā yātyachā dive-dive adhi nāmā dadhānā siṣāsantī dyotanā śaśvadāghādaghram-aghramid bhajatevasūnām

translations.griffith: Showing her wonted form each day that passeth, spreading the light she visiteth each dwelling.  Eager for conquest, with bright sheen she cometh. Her portion is the best of goodly treasures.

verses.sanskrit: भगस्य सवसा वरुणस्य जामिरुषः सून्र्ते परथमा जरस्व पश्चा स दघ्या यो अघस्य धाता जयेम तं दक्षिणया रथेन |||
verses.transliteration: bhaghasya svasā varuṇasya jāmiruṣaḥ sūnṛte prathamā jarasva paścā sa daghyā yo aghasya dhātā jayema taṃ dakṣiṇayā rathena

translations.griffith: Sister of Varuṇa, sister of Bhaga, first among all sing forth, O joyous Morning.  Weak be the strength of him who worketh evil: may we subdue him with our car the guerdon.

verses.sanskrit: उदीरतां सून्र्ता उत पुरन्धीरुदग्नयः शुशुचानासोस्थुः सपार्हा वसूनि तमसापगूळ्हाविष कर्ण्वन्त्युषसो विभातीः |||
verses.transliteration: udīratāṃ sūnṛtā ut purandhīrudaghnayaḥ śuśucānāsoasthuḥ spārhā vasūni tamasāpaghūḷhāviṣ kṛṇvantyuṣaso vibhātīḥ

translations.griffith: Let our glad hymns and holy thoughts rise upward, for the flames brightly burning have ascended.  The far-refulgent Mornings make apparent the lovely treasures which the darkness covered.

verses.sanskrit: अपान्यदेत्यभ्यन्यदेति विषुरूपे अहनी सं चरेते परिक्षितोस्तमो अन्या गुहाकरद्यौदुषाः शोशुचता रथेन |||
verses.transliteration: apānyadetyabhyanyadeti viṣurūpe ahanī saṃ carete parikṣitostamo anyā ghuhākaradyauduṣāḥ śośucatā rathena

translations.griffith: The one departeth and the other cometh: unlike in hue day's, halves march on successive.  One hides the gloom of the surrounding Parents. Dawn on her shining chariot is resplendent.

verses.sanskrit: सद्र्शीरद्य सद्र्शीरिदु शवो दीर्घं सचन्ते वरुणस्यधाम अनवद्यास्त्रिंशतं योजनान्येकैका करतुं परियन्ति सद्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sadṛśīradya sadṛśīridu śvo dīrghaṃ sacante varuṇasyadhāma anavadyāstriṃśataṃ yojanānyekaikā kratuṃ pariyanti sadyaḥ

translations.griffith: The same in form to-day, the same tomorrow, they still keep Varuṇa's eternal statute.  Blameless, in turn they traverse thirty regions, and dart across the spirit in a moment.

verses.sanskrit: जानत्यह्नः परथमस्य नाम शुक्रा कर्ष्णादजनिष्ट शवितीची रतस्य योषा न मिनाति धामाहर अहर्निष्क्र्तमाचरन्ती |||
verses.transliteration: jānatyahnaḥ prathamasya nāma śukrā kṛṣṇādajaniṣṭa śvitīcī ṛtasya yoṣā na mināti dhāmāhar aharniṣkṛtamācarantī

translations.griffith: She who hath knowledge Of the first day's nature is born refulgent white from out the darkness.  The Maiden breaketh not the law of Order, day by day coming to the place appointed.

verses.sanskrit: कन्येव तन्वा शाशदानानेषि देवि देवमियक्षमाणम संस्मयमाना युवतिः पुरस्तादाविर्वक्षांसि कर्णुषे विभाती |||
verses.transliteration: kanyeva tanvā śāśadānāneṣi devi devamiyakṣamāṇam saṃsmayamānā yuvatiḥ purastādāvirvakṣāṃsi kṛṇuṣe vibhātī

translations.griffith: In pride of beauty like a maid thou goest, O Goddess, to the God who longs to win thee,  And smiling youthful, as thou shinest brightly, before him thou discoverest thy bosom.

verses.sanskrit: सुसंकाशा मात्र्म्र्ष्टेव योषाविस्तन्वं कर्णुषे दर्शे कम भद्रा तवमुषो वितरं वयुछ न तत ते अन्या उषसोनशन्त |||
verses.transliteration: susaṃkāśā mātṛmṛṣṭeva yoṣāvistanvaṃ kṛṇuṣe dṛśe kam bhadrā tvamuṣo vitaraṃ vyucha na tat te anyā uṣasonaśanta

translations.griffith: Fair as a bride embellished by her mother thou showest forth thy form that all may see it.  Blessed art thou O Dawn. Shine yet more widely. No other Dawns have reached what thou attainest.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्विश्ववारा यतमाना रश्मिभिः सूर्यस्य परा च यन्ति पुनरा च यन्ति भद्रा नाम वहमानाुषासः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrviśvavārā yatamānā raśmibhiḥ sūryasya parā ca yanti punarā ca yanti bhadrā nāma vahamānāuṣāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Rich in kine, horses, and all goodly treasures, in constant operation with the sunbeams,  The Dawns depart and come again assuming their wonted forms that promise happy fortune.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य रश्मिमनुयछमाना भद्रम-भद्रं करतुमस्मासु धेहि उषो नो अद्य सुहवा वयुछास्मासु रायो मघवत्सु च सयुः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya raśmimanuyachamānā bhadram-bhadraṃ kratumasmāsu dhehi uṣo no adya suhavā vyuchāsmāsu rāyo maghavatsu ca syuḥ

translations.griffith: Obedient to the rein of Law Eternal give us each thought that more and more shall bless us.  Shine thou on us to-day, Dawn, swift to listen. With us be riches and with chiefs who worship.

verses.sanskrit: उषा उछन्ती समिधाने अग्ना उद्यन सूर्य उर्विया जयोतिरश्रेत देवो नो अत्र सविता नवर्थं परासावीद दविपत पर चतुष्पदित्यै |||
verses.transliteration: uṣā uchantī samidhāne aghnā udyan sūrya urviyā jyotiraśret devo no atra savitā nvarthaṃ prāsāvīd dvipat pra catuṣpadityai

translations.griffith: THE Dawn refulgent when the fire is kindled, and the Sun rising, far diffuse their brightness.  Savitar, God, hath sent us forth to labour, each quadruped, each biped, to be active.

verses.sanskrit: अमिनती दैव्यानि वरतानि परमिनती मनुष्या युगानि ईयुषीणामुपमा शश्वतीनामायतीनां परथमोषा वयद्यौत |||
verses.transliteration: aminatī daivyāni vratāni praminatī manuṣyā yughāni īyuṣīṇāmupamā śaśvatīnāmāyatīnāṃ prathamoṣā vyadyaut

translations.griffith: Not interrupting heavenly ordinances, although she minisheth human generations.  The last of endless morns that have departed, the first of those that come, Dawn brightly shineth.

verses.sanskrit: एषा दिवो दुहिता परत्यदर्शि जयोतिर्वसाना समना पुरस्तात रतस्य पन्थामन्वेति साधु परजानतीव न दिशो मिनाति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā divo duhitā pratyadarśi jyotirvasānā samanā purastāt ṛtasya panthāmanveti sādhu prajānatīva na diśo mināti

translations.griffith: There in the eastern region she, Heaven's Daughter, arrayed in garments all of light, appeareth.  Truly she followeth the path of Order, nor faileth, knowing well, the heavenly quarters.

verses.sanskrit: उपो अदर्शि शुन्ध्युवो न वक्षो नोधा इवाविरक्र्त परियाणि अद्मसन न ससतो बोधयन्ती शश्वत्तमागात पुनरेयुषीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: upo adarśi śundhyuvo na vakṣo nodhā ivāvirakṛta priyāṇi admasan na sasato bodhayantī śaśvattamāghāt punareyuṣīṇām

translations.griffith: Near is she seen, as ’twere the Bright One's bosom: she showeth sweet things like a new song-singer.  She cometh like a fly awaking sleepers, of all returning dames most true and constant.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वे अर्धे रजसो अप्त्यस्य गवां जनित्र्यक्र्त पर केतुम वयु परथते वितरं वरीय ओभा पर्णन्ती पित्रोरुपस्था |||
verses.transliteration: pūrve ardhe rajaso aptyasya ghavāṃ janitryakṛta pra ketum vyu prathate vitaraṃ varīya obhā pṛṇantī pitrorupasthā

translations.griffith: There in the east half of the watery region the Mother of the Cows hath shown her ensign.  Wider and wider still she spreadeth onward, and filleth full the laps of both heir Parents.

verses.sanskrit: एवेदेषा पुरुतमा दर्शे कं नाजामिं न परि वर्णक्ति जामिम अरेपसा तन्वा शाशदाना नार्भादीषते न महोविभाती |||
verses.transliteration: evedeṣā purutamā dṛśe kaṃ nājāmiṃ na pari vṛṇakti jāmim arepasā tanvā śāśadānā nārbhādīṣate na mahovibhātī

translations.griffith: She, verily, exceeding vast to look on debarreth from her light nor kin nor stranger.  Proud of her spotless form she, brightly shining, turneth not from the high nor from the humble.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्रातेव पुंस एति परतीची गर्तारुगिव सनये धनानाम जायेय पत्य उशती सुवासा उषा हस्रेव नि रिणीते अप्सः |||
verses.transliteration: abhrāteva puṃsa eti pratīcī ghartārughiva sanaye dhanānām jāyeya patya uśatī suvāsā uṣā hasreva ni riṇīte apsaḥ

translations.griffith: She seeketh men, as she who hath no brother, mounting her car, as ’twere to gather riches.  Dawn, like a loving matron for her husband, smiling and well attired, unmasks her beauty.

verses.sanskrit: सवसा सवस्रे जयायस्यै योनिमारैगपैत्यस्याः परतिचक्ष्येव वयुछन्ती रश्मिभिः सूर्यस्याञ्ज्यङकते समनगा इवव्राः |||
verses.transliteration: svasā svasre jyāyasyai yonimāraighapaityasyāḥ praticakṣyeva vyuchantī raśmibhiḥ sūryasyāñjyaṅkte samanaghā ivavrāḥ

translations.griffith: The Sister quitteth, for the elder Sister, her place, and having looked on her departeth.  She decks her beauty, shining forth with sunbeams, like women trooping to the festal meeting.

verses.sanskrit: आसां पूर्वासामहसु सवसॄणामपरा पूर्वामभ्येति पश्चात ताः परत्नवन नव्यसीर्नूनमस्मे रेवदुछन्तु सुदिना उषासः |||
verses.transliteration: āsāṃ pūrvāsāmahasu svasṝṇāmaparā pūrvāmabhyeti paścāt tāḥ pratnavan navyasīrnūnamasme revaduchantu sudinā uṣāsaḥ

translations.griffith: To all these Sisters who ere now have vanished a later one each day in course succeedeth.  So, like the past, with days of happy fortune, may the new Dawns shine forth on us with riches.

verses.sanskrit: पर बोधयोषः पर्णतो मघोन्यबुध्यमानाः पणयः ससन्तु रेवदुछ मघवद्भ्यो मघोनि रेवत सतोत्रे सून्र्ते जारयन्ती |||
verses.transliteration: pra bodhayoṣaḥ pṛṇato maghonyabudhyamānāḥ paṇayaḥ sasantu revaducha maghavadbhyo maghoni revat stotre sūnṛte jārayantī

translations.griffith: Rouse up, O Wealthy One, the liberal givers; let niggard traffickers sleep on unwakened:  Shine richly, Wealthy One, on those who worship, richly, glad.  Dawn while wasting, on the singer.
