verses.transliteration: adhīvasaṃ pari matu rihannaha tuvighrebhiḥ satvabhiryāti vi jrayaḥ vayo dadhat padvate rerihat sadānu śyenī sacatevartanīraha

translations.griffith: Licking the mantle of the Mother, far and wide he wanders over fields with beasts that flee apace.  Strengthening all that walk, licking up all around, a blackened path, forsooth, he leaves where’er he goes.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकमग्ने मघवत्सु दीदिह्यध शवसीवान वर्षभो दमूनाः अवास्या शिशुमतीरदीदेर्वर्मेव युत्सु परिजर्भुराणः |||
verses.transliteration: asmākamaghne maghavatsu dīdihyadha śvasīvān vṛṣabho damūnāḥ avāsyā śiśumatīradīdervarmeva yutsu parijarbhurāṇaḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, shine resplendent with our wealthy chiefs, like a loud-snorting bull, accustomed to the house.  Thou casting off thine infant wrappings blazest forth as though thou hadst put on a coat of mail for war.

verses.sanskrit: इदमग्ने सुधितं दुर्धितादधि परियादु चिन मन्मनः परेयो अस्तु ते यत ते शुक्रं तन्वो रोचते शुचि तेनास्मभ्यंवनसे रत्नमा तवम |||
verses.transliteration: idamaghne sudhitaṃ durdhitādadhi priyādu cin manmanaḥ preyo astu te yat te śukraṃ tanvo rocate śuci tenāsmabhyaṃvanase ratnamā tvam

translations.griffith: May this our perfect prayer be dearer unto thee than an imperfect prayer although it please thee well.  With the pure brilliancy that radiates from thy form, mayest thou grant to us abundant store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: रथाय नावमुत नो गर्हाय नित्यारित्रां पद्वतीं रास्यग्ने अस्माकं वीरानुत नो मघोनो जनांश्च या] पारयाच्छर्म या च |||
verses.transliteration: rathāya nāvamuta no ghṛhāya nityāritrāṃ padvatīṃ rāsyaghne asmākaṃ vīrānuta no maghono janāṃśca yā] pārayāccharma yā ca

translations.griffith: Grant to our chariot, to our house, O Agni, a boat with moving feet and constant oarage,  One that may further well our wealthy princes and all the folk, and be our certain refuge.

verses.sanskrit: अभी नो अग्न उक्थमिज्जुगुर्या दयावाक्षामा सिन्धवश्च सवगूर्ताः गव्यं यव्यं यन्तो दीर्घाहेषं वरमरुण्यो वरन्त |||
verses.transliteration: abhī no aghna ukthamijjughuryā dyāvākṣāmā sindhavaśca svaghūrtāḥ ghavyaṃ yavyaṃ yanto dīrghāheṣaṃ varamaruṇyo varanta

translations.griffith: Welcome our laud with thine approval, Agni. May earth and heaven and freely flowing rivers  Yield us long life and food and corn and cattle, and may the red Dawns choose for us their choicest.

verses.sanskrit: बळ इत्था तद वपुषे धायि दर्शतं देवस्य भर्गः सहसो यतो जनि यदीमुप हवरते साधते मतिर्र्तस्य धेन अनयन्त सस्रुतः |||
verses.transliteration: baḷ itthā tad vapuṣe dhāyi darśataṃ devasya bharghaḥ sahaso yato jani yadīmupa hvarate sādhate matirṛtasya dhena anayanta sasrutaḥ

translations.griffith: YEA, verily, the fair effulgence of the God for glory was established, since he sprang from strength.  When he inclines thereto successful is the hymn: the songs of sacrifice have brought him as they flow

verses.sanskrit: पर्क्षो वपुः पितुमान नित्य आ शये दवितीयमा सप्तशिवासु मात्र्षु तर्तीयमस्य वर्षभस्य दोहसे दशप्रमतिं जनयन्त योषणः |||
verses.transliteration: pṛkṣo vapuḥ pitumān nitya ā śaye dvitīyamā saptaśivāsu mātṛṣu tṛtīyamasya vṛṣabhasya dohase daśapramatiṃ janayanta yoṣaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Wonderful, rich in nourishment, he dwells in food; next, in the seven auspicious Mothers is his home.  Thirdly, that they might drain the treasures of the Bull, the maidens brought forth him for whom the ten provide.

verses.sanskrit: निर्यदीं बुध्नान महिषस्य वर्पस ईशानासः शवसाक्रन्त सूरयः यदीमनु परदिवो मध्व आधवे गुहा सन्तं मातरिश्वा मथायति |||
verses.transliteration: niryadīṃ budhnān mahiṣasya varpasa īśānāsaḥ śavasākranta sūrayaḥ yadīmanu pradivo madhva ādhave ghuhā santaṃ mātariśvā mathāyati

translations.griffith: What time from out the deep, from the Steer's wondrous form, the Chiefs who had the power produced him with their strength;  When Mātariśvan rubbed forth him who lay concealed, for mixture of the sweet drink, in the days of old.

verses.sanskrit: पर यत पितुः परमान नीयते पर्या पर्क्षुधो वीरुधो दंसु रोहति उभा यदस्य जनुषं यदिन्वत आदिद यविष्ठो अभवद घर्णा शुचिः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yat pituḥ paramān nīyate paryā pṛkṣudho vīrudho daṃsu rohati ubhā yadasya januṣaṃ yadinvata ādid yaviṣṭho abhavad ghṛṇā śuciḥ

translations.griffith: When from the Highest Father he is brought to us, amid the plants he rises hungry, wondrously.  As both together join to expedite his birth, most youthful he is born resplendent in his light.

verses.sanskrit: आदिन मातॄराविशद यास्वा शुचिरहिंस्यमान उर्वियावि वाव्र्धे अनु यत पूर्वा अरुहत सनाजुवो नि नव्यसीष्ववरासु धावते |||
verses.transliteration: ādin mātṝrāviśad yāsvā śucirahiṃsyamāna urviyāvi vāvṛdhe anu yat pūrvā aruhat sanājuvo ni navyasīṣvavarāsu dhāvate

translations.griffith: Then also entered he the Mothers, and in them pure and uninjured he increased in magnitude.  As to the first he rose, the vigorous from of old, so now he runs among the younger lowest ones.

verses.sanskrit: आदिद धोतारं वर्णते दिविष्टिषु भगमिव पप्र्चानास रञ्जते देवान यत करत्वा मज्मना पुरुष्टुतो मर्तं संसं विश्वधा वेति धायसे |||
verses.transliteration: ādid dhotāraṃ vṛṇate diviṣṭiṣu bhaghamiva papṛcānāsa ṛñjate devān yat kratvā majmanā puruṣṭuto martaṃ saṃsaṃ viśvadhā veti dhāyase

translations.griffith: Therefore they choose him Herald at the morning rites, pressing to him as unto Bhaga, pouring gifts,  When, much-praised, by the power and will of Gods, he goes at all times to his mortal worshipper to drink.

verses.sanskrit: वि यदस्थाद यजतो वातचोदितो हवारो न वक्वा जरणा अनाक्र्तः तस्य पत्मन दक्षुषः कर्ष्णजंहसः शुचिजन्मनो रज आ वयध्वनः |||
verses.transliteration: vi yadasthād yajato vātacodito hvāro na vakvā jaraṇā anākṛtaḥ tasya patman dakṣuṣaḥ kṛṣṇajaṃhasaḥ śucijanmano raja ā vyadhvanaḥ

translations.griffith: What time the Holy One, wind-urged, hath risen up, serpent-like winding through the dry grass unrestrained,  Dust lies upon the way of him who burneth all, black-winged and pure of birth who follows sundry paths.

verses.sanskrit: रथो न यातः शिक्वभिः कर्तो दयामङगेभिररुषेभिरीयते आदस्य ते कर्ष्णासो दक्षि सूरयः शूरस्येव तवेषथादीषते वयः |||
verses.transliteration: ratho na yātaḥ śikvabhiḥ kṛto dyāmaṅghebhiraruṣebhirīyate ādasya te kṛṣṇāso dakṣi sūrayaḥ śūrasyeva tveṣathādīṣate vayaḥ

translations.griffith: Like a swift chariot made by men who know their art, he with his red limbs lifts himself aloft to heaven.  Thy worshippers become by burning black of hue: their strength flies as before a hero's violence.

verses.sanskrit: तवया हयग्ने वरुणो धर्तव्रतो मित्रः शाशद्रे अर्यमा सुदानवः यत सीमनु करतुना विश्वथा विभुररान न नेमिः परिभूरजायथाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā hyaghne varuṇo dhṛtavrato mitraḥ śāśadre aryamā sudānavaḥ yat sīmanu kratunā viśvathā vibhurarān na nemiḥ paribhūrajāyathāḥ

translations.griffith: By thee, O Agni, Varuṇa who guards the Law, Mitra and Aryaman, the Bounteous, are made strong;  For, as the felly holds the spokes, thou with thy might pervading hast been born encompassing them round.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने शशमानाय सुन्वते रत्नं यविष्ठ देवतातिमिन्वसि तं तवा नु नव्यं सहसो युवन वयं भगं न कारेमहिरत्न धीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne śaśamānāya sunvate ratnaṃ yaviṣṭha devatātiminvasi taṃ tvā nu navyaṃ sahaso yuvan vayaṃ bhaghaṃ na kāremahiratna dhīmahi

translations.griffith: Agni, to him who toils and pours libations, thou, Most Youthful! sendest wealth and all the host of Gods.  Thee, therefore, even as Bhaga, will we set anew, young Child of Strength, most wealthy! in our battle-song.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे रयिं न सवर्थं दमूनसं भगं दक्षं न पप्र्चासि धर्णसिम रश्मीन्रिव यो यमति जन्मनी उभे देवानां शंसं रत आ च सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: asme rayiṃ na svarthaṃ damūnasaṃ bhaghaṃ dakṣaṃ na papṛcāsi dharṇasim raśmīnriva yo yamati janmanī ubhe devānāṃ śaṃsaṃ ṛta ā ca sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe us riches turned to worthy ends, good luck abiding in the house, and strong capacity,  Wealth that directs both worlds as they were guiding-reins, and, very Wise, the Gods’ assent in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: उत नः सुद्योत्मा जीराश्वो होता मन्द्रः शर्णवच्चन्द्ररथः स नो नेषन नेषतमैरमूरो.अग्निर्वामं सुवितं वस्यो अछ |||
verses.transliteration: uta naḥ sudyotmā jīrāśvo hotā mandraḥ śṛṇavaccandrarathaḥ sa no neṣan neṣatamairamūro.aghnirvāmaṃ suvitaṃ vasyo acha

translations.griffith: May he, the Priest resplendent, joyful, hear us, he with the radiant car and rapid horses.  May Agni, ever wise, with best directions to bliss and highest happiness conduct us.

verses.sanskrit: अस्ताव्यग्निः शिमीवद्भिरर्कैः साम्राज्याय परतरं दधानः अमी च ये मघवानो वयं च मिहं न सूरो अतिनिष टतन्युः |||
verses.transliteration: astāvyaghniḥ śimīvadbhirarkaiḥ sāmrājyāya prataraṃ dadhānaḥ amī ca ye maghavāno vayaṃ ca mihaṃ na sūro atiniṣ ṭatanyuḥ

translations.griffith: With hymns of might hath Agni now been lauded, advanced to height of universal kingship.  Now may these wealthy chiefs and we together spread forth as spreads the Sun above the rain-clouds.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्न आ वह देवानद्य यतस्रुचे तन्तुं तनुष्व पूर्व्यं सुतसोमाय दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: samiddho aghna ā vaha devānadya yatasruce tantuṃ tanuṣva pūrvyaṃ sutasomāya dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: KINDLED, bring, Agni, Gods to-day for him who lifts the ladle up.  Spin out the ancient thread for him who sheds, with gifts, the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तवन्तमुप मासि मधुमन्तं तनूनपात यज्ञं विप्रस्य मावतः शशमानस्य दाशुषः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtavantamupa māsi madhumantaṃ tanūnapāt yajñaṃ viprasya māvataḥ śaśamānasya dāśuṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou dealest forth, Tanūnapāt, sweet sacrifice enriched with oil,  Brought by a singer such as I who offers gifts and toils for thee.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिः पावको अद्भुतो मध्वा यज्ञं मिमिक्षति नराशंसः तरिरा दिवो देवो देवेषु यज्ञियः |||
verses.transliteration: śuciḥ pāvako adbhuto madhvā yajñaṃ mimikṣati narāśaṃsaḥ trirā divo devo deveṣu yajñiyaḥ

translations.griffith: He wondrous, sanctifying, bright, sprinkles the sacrifice with mead,  Thrice, Narāśaṁsa from the heavens, a God mid Gods adorable.

verses.sanskrit: ईळितो अग्न आ वहेन्द्रं चित्रमिह परियम इयं हि तवा मतिर्ममाछा सुजिह्व वच्यते |||
verses.transliteration: īḷito aghna ā vahendraṃ citramiha priyam iyaṃ hi tvā matirmamāchā sujihva vacyate

translations.griffith: Agni, besought, bring hitherward Indra the Friend, the Wonderful,  For this my hymn of praise, O sweet of tongue, is chanted forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit: सत्र्णानासो यतस्रुचो बर्हिर्यज्ञे सवध्वरे वर्ञ्जे देवव्यचस्तममिन्द्राय शर्म सप्रथः |||
verses.transliteration: stṛṇānāso yatasruco barhiryajñe svadhvare vṛñje devavyacastamamindrāya śarma saprathaḥ

translations.griffith: The ladle-holders strew trimmed grass at this well-ordered sacrifice;  A home for Indra is adorned, wide, fittest to receive the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: वि शरयन्तां रताव्र्धः परयै देवेभ्यो महीः पावकासः पुरुस्प्र्हो दवारो देवीरसश्चतः |||
verses.transliteration: vi śrayantāṃ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ prayai devebhyo mahīḥ pāvakāsaḥ puruspṛho dvāro devīrasaścataḥ

translations.griffith: Thrown open be the Doors Divine, unfailing, that assist the rite,  High, purifying, much-desired, so that the Gods may enter in.

verses.sanskrit: आ भन्दमाने उपाके नक्तोषासा सुपेशसा यह्वी रतश्यमातरा सीदतां बर्हिरा सुमत |||
verses.transliteration: ā bhandamāne upāke naktoṣāsā supeśasā yahvī ṛtaśyamātarā sīdatāṃ barhirā sumat

translations.griffith: May Night and Morning, hymned with lauds, united, fair to look upon,  Strong Mothers of the sacrifice, seat them together on the grass.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रजिह्वा जुगुर्वणी होतारा दैव्या कवी यज्ञं नो यक्षतामिमं सिध्रमद्य दिविस्प्र्शम |||
verses.transliteration: mandrajihvā jughurvaṇī hotārā daivyā kavī yajñaṃ no yakṣatāmimaṃ sidhramadya divispṛśam

translations.griffith: May the two Priests Divine, the sage, the sweet-voiced lovers of the hymn,  Complete this sacrifice of ours, effectual, reaching heaven to-day.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिर्देवेष्वर्पिता होत्रा मरुत्सु भारती इळा सरस्वती मही बर्हिः सीदन्तु यज्ञियाः |||
verses.transliteration: śucirdeveṣvarpitā hotrā marutsu bhāratī iḷā sarasvatī mahī barhiḥ sīdantu yajñiyāḥ

translations.griffith: Let Hotrā pure, set among Gods, amid the Maruts Bhāratī, Iḷā, Sarasvatī, Mahī, rest on the grass, adorable.

verses.sanskrit: तन नस्तुरीपमद्भुतं पुरु वारं पुरु तमना तवष्टापोषाय वि षयतु राये नाभा नो अस्मयुः |||
verses.transliteration: tan nasturīpamadbhutaṃ puru vāraṃ puru tmanā tvaṣṭāpoṣāya vi ṣyatu rāye nābhā no asmayuḥ

translations.griffith: May Tvaṣṭar send us genial dew abundant, wondrous, rich in gifts,  For increase and for growth of wealth, Tvaṣṭar our kinsman and our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: अवस्र्जन्नुप तमना देवान यक्षि वनस्पते अग्निर्हव्या सुषूदति देवो देवेषु मेधिरः |||
verses.transliteration: avasṛjannupa tmanā devān yakṣi vanaspate aghnirhavyā suṣūdati devo deveṣu medhiraḥ

translations.griffith: Vanaspati, give forth, thyself, and call the Gods to sacrifice.  May Agni, God intelligent, speed our oblation to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पूषण्वते मरुत्वते विश्वदेवाय वायवे सवाहा गायत्रवेपसे हव्यमिन्द्राय कर्तन |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣaṇvate marutvate viśvadevāya vāyave svāhā ghāyatravepase havyamindrāya kartana

translations.griffith: To Vāyu joined with Pūṣan, with the Maruts, and the host of Gods,  To Indra who inspires the hymn cry Glory! and present the gift.

verses.sanskrit: सवाहाक्र्तान्या गह्युप हव्यानि वीतये इन्द्रा गहि शरुधी हवं तवां हवन्ते अध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: svāhākṛtānyā ghahyupa havyāni vītaye indrā ghahi śrudhī havaṃ tvāṃ havante adhvare

translations.griffith: Come hither to enjoy the gifts prepared with cry of Glory! Come,  O Indra, hear their calling; they invite thee to the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: पर तव्यसीं नव्यसीं धीतिमग्नये वाचो मतिं सहसःसूनवे भरे अपां नपाद यो वसुभिः सह परियो होता पर्थिव्यां नयसीदद रत्वियः |||
verses.transliteration: pra tavyasīṃ navyasīṃ dhītimaghnaye vāco matiṃ sahasaḥsūnave bhare apāṃ napād yo vasubhiḥ saha priyo hotā pṛthivyāṃ nyasīdad ṛtviyaḥ

translations.griffith: To Agni I present a newer mightier hymn, I bring my words and song unto the Son of Strength,  Who, Offspring of the Waters, bearing precious things sits on the earth, in season, dear Invoking Priest.

verses.sanskrit: स जायमानः परमे वयोमन्याविरग्निरभवन मातरिश्वने अस्य करत्वा समिधानस्य मज्मना पर दयावा शोचिः पर्थिवी अरोचयत |||
verses.transliteration: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomanyāviraghnirabhavan mātariśvane asya kratvā samidhānasya majmanā pra dyāvā śociḥ pṛthivī arocayat

translations.griffith: Soon as he sprang to birth that Agni was shown forth to Mātariśvan in the highest firmament.  When he was kindled, through his power and majesty his fiery splendour made the heavens and earth to shine.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य तवेषा अजरा अस्य भानवः सुसन्द्र्शः सुप्रतीकस्यसुद्युतः भात्वक्षसो अत्यक्तुर्न सिन्धवो.अग्ने रेजन्ते अससन्तो अजराः |||
verses.transliteration: asya tveṣā ajarā asya bhānavaḥ susandṛśaḥ supratīkasyasudyutaḥ bhātvakṣaso atyakturna sindhavo.aghne rejante asasanto ajarāḥ

translations.griffith: His flames that wax not old, beams fair to look upon of him whose face is lovely, shine with beauteous sheen.  The rays of Agni, him whose active force is light, through the nights glimmer sleepless, ageless, like the floods.

verses.sanskrit: यमेरिरे भर्गवो विश्ववेदसं नाभा पर्थिव्या भुवनस्य मज्मना अग्निं तं गीर्भिर्हिनुहि सव आ दमे य एको वस्वो वरुणो न राजति |||
verses.transliteration: yamerire bhṛghavo viśvavedasaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā bhuvanasya majmanā aghniṃ taṃ ghīrbhirhinuhi sva ā dame ya eko vasvo varuṇo na rājati

translations.griffith: Send thou with hymns that Agni to his own abode, who rules, one Sovran Lord of wealth, like Varuṇa,  Him, All-possessor, whom the Bhṛgus with their might brought to earth's central point, the centre of the world.

verses.sanskrit: न यो वराय मरुतामिव सवनः सेनेव सर्ष्टा दिव्या यथाशनिः अग्निर्जम्भैस्तिगितैरत्ति भर्वति योधो न शत्रून स वना नय रञ्जते |||
verses.transliteration: na yo varāya marutāmiva svanaḥ seneva sṛṣṭā divyā yathāśaniḥ aghnirjambhaistighitairatti bharvati yodho na śatrūn sa vanā ny ṛñjate

translations.griffith: He whom no force can stay, even as the Maruts’ roar, like to a dart sent forth, even as the bolt from heaven,  Agni with sharpened jaws chews up and eats the trees, and conquers them as when the warrior smites his foes.

verses.sanskrit: कुविन नो अग्निरुचथस्य वीरसद वसुष कुविद वसुभिः काममावरत चोदः कुवित तुतुज्यात सातये धियः शुचिप्रतीकं तमया धिया गर्णे |||
verses.transliteration: kuvin no aghnirucathasya vīrasad vasuṣ kuvid vasubhiḥ kāmamāvarat codaḥ kuvit tutujyāt sātaye dhiyaḥ śucipratīkaṃ tamayā dhiyā ghṛṇe

translations.griffith: And will not Agni find enjoyment in our praise, will not the Vasu grant our wish with gifts of wealth?  Will not the Inspirer speed our prayers to gain their end? Him with the radiant glance I laud with this my song.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तप्रतीकं व रतस्य धूर्षदमग्निं मित्रं न समिधान रञ्जते इन्धानो अक्रो विदथेषु दीद्यच्छुक्रवर्णामुदु नो यंसते धियम |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtapratīkaṃ va ṛtasya dhūrṣadamaghniṃ mitraṃ na samidhāna ṛñjate indhāno akro vidatheṣu dīdyacchukravarṇāmudu no yaṃsate dhiyam

translations.griffith: The kindler of the flame wins Agni as a Friend, promoter of the Law, whose face is bright with oil.  Inflamed and keen, refulgent in our gatherings, he lifts our hymn on high clad in his radiant hues.

verses.sanskrit: अप्रयुछन्नप्रयुछद्भिरग्ने शिवेभिर्नः पायुभिः पाहि शग्मैः अदब्धेभिरद्र्पितेभिरिष्टे.अनिमिषद्भिः परि पाहि नो जाः |||
verses.transliteration: aprayuchannaprayuchadbhiraghne śivebhirnaḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhi śaghmaiḥ adabdhebhiradṛpitebhiriṣṭe.animiṣadbhiḥ pari pāhi no jāḥ

translations.griffith: Keep us incessantly with guards that cease not, Agni, with guards auspicious, very mighty.  With guards that never slumber, never heedless, never beguiled. O Helper, keep our children.

verses.sanskrit: एति पर होता वरतमस्य माययोर्ध्वां दधानः शुचिपेशसं धियम अभि सरुचः करमते दक्षिणाव्र्तो या अस्य धाम परथमं ह निंसते |||
verses.transliteration: eti pra hotā vratamasya māyayordhvāṃ dadhānaḥ śucipeśasaṃ dhiyam abhi srucaḥ kramate dakṣiṇāvṛto yā asya dhāma prathamaṃ ha niṃsate

translations.griffith: THE Priest goes forth to sacrifice, with wondrous power sending aloft the hymn of glorious brilliancy.  He moves to meet the ladles turning to the right, which are the first to kiss the place where he abides.

verses.sanskrit: अभीं रतस्य दोहना अनूषत योनौ देवस्य सदने परीव्र्ताः अपामुपस्थे विभ्र्तो यदावसदध सवधा अधयद याभिरीयते |||
verses.transliteration: abhīṃ ṛtasya dohanā anūṣata yonau devasya sadane parīvṛtāḥ apāmupasthe vibhṛto yadāvasadadha svadhā adhayad yābhirīyate

translations.griffith: To him sang forth the flowing streams of Holy Law, encompassed in the home and birth-place of the God.  He, when he dwelt extended in the waters’ lap, absorbed those Godlike powers for which he is adored.

verses.sanskrit: युयूषतः सवयसा तदिद वपुः समानमर्थं वितरित्रता मिथः आदीं भगो न हव्यः समस्मदा वोळ्हुर्न रश्मीन समयंस्त सारथिः |||
verses.transliteration: yuyūṣataḥ savayasā tadid vapuḥ samānamarthaṃ vitaritratā mithaḥ ādīṃ bhagho na havyaḥ samasmadā voḷhurna raśmīn samayaṃsta sārathiḥ

translations.griffith: Seeking in course altern to reach the selfsame end the two copartners strive to win this beauteous form.  Like Bhaga must he be duly invoked by us, as he who drives the car holds fast the horse's reins.

verses.sanskrit: यमीं दवा सवयसा सपर्यतः समाने योना मिथुना समोकसा दिवा न नक्तं पलितो युवाजनि पुरू चरन्नजरो मानुषा युगा |||
verses.transliteration: yamīṃ dvā savayasā saparyataḥ samāne yonā mithunā samokasā divā na naktaṃ palito yuvājani purū carannajaro mānuṣā yughā

translations.griffith: He whom the two copartners with observance tend, the pair who dwell together in the same abode,  By night as in the day the grey one was born young, passing untouched by eld through many an age of man.

verses.sanskrit: तमीं हिन्वन्ति धीतयो दश वरिशो देवं मर्तास ऊतये हवामहे धनोरधि परवत आ स रण्वत्यभिव्रजद्भिर्वयुना नवाधित |||
verses.transliteration: tamīṃ hinvanti dhītayo daśa vriśo devaṃ martāsa ūtaye havāmahe dhanoradhi pravata ā sa ṛṇvatyabhivrajadbhirvayunā navādhita

translations.griffith: Him the ten fingers, the devotions, animate: we mortals call on him a God to give us help.  He speeds over the sloping surface of the land: new deeds hath he performed with those who gird him round.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हयग्ने दिव्यस्य राजसि तवं पार्थिवस्य पशुपा इव तमना एनी त एते बर्हती अभिश्रिया हिरण्ययी वक्वरी बर्हिराशाते |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hyaghne divyasya rājasi tvaṃ pārthivasya paśupā iva tmanā enī ta ete bṛhatī abhiśriyā hiraṇyayī vakvarī barhirāśāte

translations.griffith: For, Agni, like a herdsman, thou by thine own might rulest o’er all that is in heaven and on the earth;  And these two Mighty Ones, bright, golden closely joined, rolling them round are come unto thy sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने जुषस्व परति हर्य तद वचो मन्द्र सवधाव रतजात सुक्रतो यो विश्वतः पर्त्यंं असि दर्शतो रण्वः सन्द्र्ष्टौ पितुमानिव कषयः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne juṣasva prati harya tad vaco mandra svadhāva ṛtajāta sukrato yo viśvataḥ partyaṃṃ asi darśato raṇvaḥ sandṛṣṭau pitumāniva kṣayaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, accept with joy, be glad in this our prayer, joy-giver, self-sustained, strong, born of Holy Law!  For fair to see art thou turning to every side, pleasant to look on as a dwelling filled with food.

verses.sanskrit: तं पर्छता स जगामा स वेद स चिकित्वानीयते सा नवीयते तस्मिन सन्ति परशिषस्तस्मिन्निष्टयः स वाजस्य शवसः शुष्मिणस पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ pṛchatā sa jaghāmā sa veda sa cikitvānīyate sā nvīyate tasmin santi praśiṣastasminniṣṭayaḥ sa vājasya śavasaḥ śuṣmiṇas patiḥ

translations.griffith: Ask ye of him for he is come, he knoweth it; he, full of wisdom, is implored, is now implored.  With him are admonitions and with him commands: he is the Lord of Strength, the Lord of Power and Might.

verses.sanskrit: तमित पर्छन्ति न सिमो वि पर्छति सवेनेव धीरो मनसा यदग्रभीत न मर्ष्यते परथमं नापरं वचो.अस्य करत्वसचते अप्रद्र्पितः |||
verses.transliteration: tamit pṛchanti na simo vi pṛchati sveneva dhīro manasā yadaghrabhīt na mṛṣyate prathamaṃ nāparaṃ vaco.asya kratvasacate apradṛpitaḥ

translations.griffith: They ask of him: not all learn by their questioning what he, the Sage, hath grasped, as ’twere, with his own mind.  Forgetting not the former nor the later word, he goeth on, not careless, in his mental power.

verses.sanskrit: तमिद गछन्ति जुह्वस्तमर्वतीर्विश्वान्येकः शर्णवद वचांसि मे पुरुप्रैषस्ततुरिर्यज्ञसाधनो.अछिद्रोतिः शिशुरादत्त सं रभः |||
verses.transliteration: tamid ghachanti juhvastamarvatīrviśvānyekaḥ śṛṇavad vacāṃsi me purupraiṣastaturiryajñasādhano.achidrotiḥ śiśurādatta saṃ rabhaḥ

translations.griffith: To him these ladles go, to him these racing mares: he only will give ear to all the words I speak.  All-speeding, victor, perfecter of sacrifice, the Babe with flawless help hath mustered vigorous might.

verses.sanskrit: उपस्थायं चरति यत समारत सद्यो जातस्तत्सार युज्येभिः अभि शवान्तं मर्शते नान्द्ये मुदे यदीं गछन्त्युशतीरपिष्ठितम |||
verses.transliteration: upasthāyaṃ carati yat samārata sadyo jātastatsāra yujyebhiḥ abhi śvāntaṃ mṛśate nāndye mude yadīṃ ghachantyuśatīrapiṣṭhitam

translations.griffith: Whate’er he meets he grasps and then runs farther on, and straightway, newly born, creeps forward with his kin.  He stirs the wearied man to pleasure and great joy what time the longing gifts approach him as he comes.

verses.sanskrit: स ईं मर्गो अप्यो वनर्गुरुप तवच्युपमस्यां नि धायि वयब्रवीद वयुना मर्त्येभ्यो.अग्निर्विद्वान रतचिद धि सत्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sa īṃ mṛgho apyo vanarghurupa tvacyupamasyāṃ ni dhāyi vyabravīd vayunā martyebhyo.aghnirvidvān ṛtacid dhi satyaḥ

translations.griffith: He is a wild thing of the flood and forest: he hath been laid upon the highest surface.  He hath declared the lore of works to mortals, Agni the Wise, for he knows Law, the Truthful.

verses.sanskrit: तरिमूर्धानं सप्तरश्मिं गर्णीषे.अनूनमग्निं पित्रोरुपस्थे निषत्तमस्य चरतो धरुवस्य विश्वा दिवो रोचनापप्रिवांसम |||
verses.transliteration: trimūrdhānaṃ saptaraśmiṃ ghṛṇīṣe.anūnamaghniṃ pitrorupasthe niṣattamasya carato dhruvasya viśvā divo rocanāpaprivāṃsam

translations.griffith: I LAUD the seven-rayed, the triple-headed, Agni all-perfect in his Parents’ bosom,  Sunk in the lap of all that moves and moves not, him who hath filled all luminous realms of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: उक्षा महानभि ववक्ष एने अजरस्तस्थावितूतिर्र्ष्वः उर्व्याः पदो नि दधाति सानौ रिहन्त्यूधो अरुषासो अस्य |||
verses.transliteration: ukṣā mahānabhi vavakṣa ene ajarastasthāvitaūtirṛṣvaḥ urvyāḥ pado ni dadhāti sānau rihantyūdho aruṣāso asya

translations.griffith: As a great Steer he grew to these his Parents; sublime he stands, untouched by eld, far-reaching.  He plants his footsteps on the lofty ridges of the broad earth: his red flames lick the udder.

verses.sanskrit: समानं वत्समभि संचरन्ती विष्वग धेनू वि चरतः सुमेके अनपव्र्ज्यानध्वनो मिमाने विश्वान केतानधि महोदधाने |||
verses.transliteration: samānaṃ vatsamabhi saṃcarantī viṣvagh dhenū vi carataḥ sumeke anapavṛjyānadhvano mimāne viśvān ketānadhi mahodadhāne

translations.griffith: Coming together to their common youngling both Cows, fairshaped, spread forth in all directions,  Measuring out the paths that must be travelled, entrusting all desires to him the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: धीरासः पदं कवयो नयन्ति नाना हर्दा रक्षमाणा अजुर्यम सिषासन्तः पर्यपश्यन्त सिन्धुमाविरेभ्यो अभवत्सूर्यो नॄन |||
verses.transliteration: dhīrāsaḥ padaṃ kavayo nayanti nānā hṛdā rakṣamāṇā ajuryam siṣāsantaḥ paryapaśyanta sindhumāvirebhyo abhavatsūryo nṝn

translations.griffith: The prudent sages lead him to his dwelling, guarding with varied skill the Ever-Youthful.  Longing, they turned their eyes unto the River: to these the Sun of men was manifested.

verses.sanskrit: दिद्र्क्षेण्यः परि काष्ठासु जेन्य ईळेन्यो महो अर्भाय जीवसे पुरुत्रा यदभवत सूरहैभ्यो गर्भेभ्यो मघवा विश्वदर्शतः |||
verses.transliteration: didṛkṣeṇyaḥ pari kāṣṭhāsu jenya īḷenyo maho arbhāya jīvase purutrā yadabhavat sūrahaibhyo gharbhebhyo maghavā viśvadarśataḥ

translations.griffith: Born noble in the regions, aim of all mens’ eyes to be implored for life by great and small alike,  Far as the Wealthy One hath spread himself abroad, he is the Sire all-visible of this progeny.

verses.sanskrit: कथा ते अग्ने शुचयन्त आयोर्ददाशुर्वाजेभिराशुषाणाः उभे यत तोके तनये दधाना रतस्य सामन रणयन्तदेवाः |||
verses.transliteration: kathā te aghne śucayanta āyordadāśurvājebhirāśuṣāṇāḥ ubhe yat toke tanaye dadhānā ṛtasya sāman raṇayantadevāḥ

translations.griffith: How, Agni, have the radiant ones, aspiring, endued thee with the vigour of the living,  So that on both sides fostering seed and offspring, the Gods may joy in Holy Law's fulfilment?

verses.sanskrit: बोधा मे अस्य वचसो यविष्ठ मंहिष्ठस्य परभ्र्तस्य सवधावः पीयति तवो अनु तवो गर्णाति वन्दारुस्ते तन्वं वन्देग्ने |||
verses.transliteration: bodhā me asya vacaso yaviṣṭha maṃhiṣṭhasya prabhṛtasya svadhāvaḥ pīyati tvo anu tvo ghṛṇāti vandāruste tanvaṃ vandeaghne

translations.griffith: Mark this my speech, Divine One, thou, Most Youthful! offered to thee by him who gives most freely.  One hates thee, and another sings thy praises: I thine adorer laud thy form, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यन्तो अन्धं दुरितादरक्षन ररक्ष तान सुक्र्तो विश्ववेदा दिप्सन्त इद रिपवो नाह देभुः |||
verses.transliteration: ye pāyavo māmateyaṃ te aghne paśyanto andhaṃ duritādarakṣan rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ

translations.griffith: Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Māmateya from affliction.  Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious the foes who fain would harm them did no mischief.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो अग्ने अररिवानघायुररातीवा मर्चयति दवयेन मन्त्रो गुरुः पुनरस्तु सो अस्मा अनु मर्क्षीष्ट तन्वं दुरुक्तैः |||
verses.transliteration: yo no aghne ararivānaghāyurarātīvā marcayati dvayena mantro ghuruḥ punarastu so asmā anu mṛkṣīṣṭa tanvaṃ duruktaiḥ

translations.griffith: The sinful man who worships not, O Agni, who, offering not, harms us with double-dealing,—  Be this in turn to him a heavy sentence: may he distress himself by his revilings.

verses.sanskrit: उत वा यः सहस्य परविद्वान मर्तो मर्तं मर्चयति दवयेन अतः पाहि सतवमान सतुवन्तमग्ने माकिर्नो दुरिताय धायीः |||
verses.transliteration: uta vā yaḥ sahasya pravidvān marto martaṃ marcayati dvayena ataḥ pāhi stavamāna stuvantamaghne mākirno duritāya dhāyīḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, when a mortal knowingly, O Victor, injures with double tongue a fellow-mortal,  From him, praised Agni! save thou him that lauds thee: bring us not into trouble and affliction.

verses.sanskrit: मथीद यदीं विष्टो मातरिश्वा होतारं विश्वाप्सुं विश्वदेव्यम नि यं दधुर्मनुष्यासु विक्षु सवर्ण चित्रं वपुषे विभावम |||
verses.transliteration: mathīd yadīṃ viṣṭo mātariśvā hotāraṃ viśvāpsuṃ viśvadevyam ni yaṃ dadhurmanuṣyāsu vikṣu svarṇa citraṃ vapuṣe vibhāvam

translations.griffith: WHAT Mātariśvan, piercing, formed by friction, Herald of all the Gods. in varied figure,  Is he whom they have set mid human houses, gay-hued as light and shining forth for beauty.

verses.sanskrit: ददानमिन न ददभन्त मन्माग्निर्वरूथं मम तस्य चाकन जुषन्त विश्वन्यस्य कर्मोपस्तुतिं भरमाणस्य कारोः |||
verses.transliteration: dadānamin na dadabhanta manmāghnirvarūthaṃ mama tasya cākan juṣanta viśvanyasya karmopastutiṃ bharamāṇasya kāroḥ

translations.griffith: They shall not harm the man who brings thee praises: such as I am, Agni my help approves me.  All acts of mine shall they accept with pleasure, laudation from the singer who presents it.

verses.sanskrit: नित्ये चिन नु यं सदने जग्र्भ्रे परशस्तिभिर्दधिरे यज्ञियसः पर सू नयन्त गर्भयन्त इष्टावश्वासो न रथ्योररहणाः |||
verses.transliteration: nitye cin nu yaṃ sadane jaghṛbhre praśastibhirdadhire yajñiyasaḥ pra sū nayanta ghṛbhayanta iṣṭāvaśvāso na rathyorarahaṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Him in his constant seat men skilled in worship have taken and with praises have established.  As, harnessed to a chariot fleet-foot horses, at his command let bearers lead him forward.

verses.sanskrit: पुरूणि दस्मो नि रिणाति जम्भैराद रोचते वन आ विभावा आदस्य वातो अनु वाति शोचिरस्तुर्न शर्यामसनामनु दयून |||
verses.transliteration: purūṇi dasmo ni riṇāti jambhairād rocate vana ā vibhāvā ādasya vāto anu vāti śocirasturna śaryāmasanāmanu dyūn

translations.griffith: Wondrous, full many a thing he chews and crunches: he shines amid the wood with spreading brightness.  Upon his glowing flames the wind blows daily, driving them like the keen shaft of an archer.

verses.sanskrit: न यं रिपवो न रिषण्यवो गर्भे सन्तं रेषणा रेषयन्ति अन्धा अपश्या न दभन्नभिख्या नित्यास ईं परेतारो अरक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: na yaṃ ripavo na riṣaṇyavo gharbhe santaṃ reṣaṇā reṣayanti andhā apaśyā na dabhannabhikhyā nityāsa īṃ pretāro arakṣan

translations.griffith: Him, whom while yet in embryo the hostile, both skilled and fain to harm, may never injure,  Men blind and sightless through his splendour hurt not: his never-failing lovers have preserved him.

verses.sanskrit: महः स राय एषते पतिर्दन्निन इनस्य वसुनः पद आ उप धरजन्तमद्रयो विधन्नित |||
verses.transliteration: mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate patirdannina inasya vasunaḥ pada ā upa dhrajantamadrayo vidhannit

translations.griffith: HITHER he hastens to give, Lord of great riches, King of the mighty, to the place of treasure.  The pressing-stones shall serve him speeding near us.

verses.sanskrit: स यो वर्षा नरां न रोदस्योः शरवोभिरस्ति जीवपीतसर्गः पर यः सस्राणः शिश्रीत योनौ |||
verses.transliteration: sa yo vṛṣā narāṃ na rodasyoḥ śravobhirasti jīvapītasarghaḥ pra yaḥ sasrāṇaḥ śiśrīta yonau

translations.griffith: As Steer of men so Steer of earth and heaven by glory, he whose streams all life hath drunken,  Who hasting forward rests upon the altar.

verses.sanskrit: आ यः पुरं नार्मिणीमदीदेदत्यः कविर्नभन्यो नार्व सूरो न रुरुक्वाञ्छतात्मा |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaḥ puraṃ nārmiṇīmadīdedatyaḥ kavirnabhanyo nārva sūro na rurukvāñchatātmā

translations.griffith: He who hath lighted up the joyous castle, wise Courser like the Steed of cloudy heaven,  Bright like the Sun, with hundredfold existence.

verses.sanskrit: अभि दविजन्मा तरी रोचनानि विश्व रजांसि शुशुचनो अस्थात होता यजिष्ठो अपां सधस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: abhi dvijanmā trī rocanāni viśva rajāṃsi śuśucano asthāt hotā yajiṣṭho apāṃ sadhasthe

translations.griffith: He, doubly born, hath spread in his effulgence through the three luminous realms, through all the regions,  Best sacrificing Priest where waters gather.

verses.sanskrit: अयं स होत यो दविजन्मा विश्वा दधे वार्याणि शरवस्या मर्तो यो अस्मै सुतुको ददाश |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ sa hota yo dvijanmā viśvā dadhe vāryāṇi śravasyā marto yo asmai sutuko dadāśa

translations.griffith: Priest doubly born, he through his love of glory hath in his keeping all things worth the choosing,  The man who brings him gifts hath noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit: पुरु तव दाश्वान वोचे.अरिरग्ने तव सविदा तोदस्येव शरण आ महस्य |||
verses.transliteration: puru tva dāśvān voce.ariraghne tava svidā todasyeva śaraṇa ā mahasya

translations.griffith: AGNI, thy faithful servant I call upon thee with many a gift,  As in the keeping of the great inciting God;

verses.sanskrit: वयनिनस्य धनिनः परहोषे चिदररुषः कदा चन परजिगतो अदेवयोः |||
verses.transliteration: vyaninasya dhaninaḥ prahoṣe cidararuṣaḥ kadā cana prajighato adevayoḥ

translations.griffith: Thou who ne’er movest thee to aid the indolent, the godless man,  Him who though wealthy never brings an offering.

verses.sanskrit: स चन्द्रो विप्र मर्त्यो महो वराधन्तमो दिवि पर-परेत ते अग्ने वनुषः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: sa candro vipra martyo maho vrādhantamo divi pra-pret te aghne vanuṣaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Splendid, O Singer, is that man, mightiest of the great in heaven.  Agni, may we be foremost, we thy worshippers.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रं न यं शिम्या गोषु गव्यवः सवाध्यो विदथे अप्सुजीजनन अरेजेतां रोदसी पाजसा गिरा परति परियं यजतं जनुषमवः |||
verses.transliteration: mitraṃ na yaṃ śimyā ghoṣu ghavyavaḥ svādhyo vidathe apsujījanan arejetāṃ rodasī pājasā ghirā prati priyaṃ yajataṃ januṣamavaḥ

translations.griffith: HEAVEN and earth trembled at the might and voice of him, whom, loved and Holy One, helper of all mankind,  The wise who longed for spoil in fight for kine brought forth with power, a Friend, mid waters, at the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: यद ध तयद वां पुरुमीळ्हस्य सोमिनः पर मित्रासो न दधिरे सवाभुवः अध करतुं विदतं गतुमर्चत उत शरुतं वर्षणा पस्त्यावतः |||
verses.transliteration: yad dha tyad vāṃ purumīḷhasya sominaḥ pra mitrāso na dadhire svābhuvaḥ adha kratuṃ vidataṃ ghatumarcata uta śrutaṃ vṛṣaṇā pastyāvataḥ

translations.griffith: As these, like friends, have done this work for you, these prompt servants of Purumīlha Soma-offerer,  Give mental power to him who sings the sacred song, and hearken, Strong Ones, to the master of the house.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां भूषन कषितयो जन्म रोदस्योः परवाच्यं वर्षणा दक्षसे महे यदीं रताय भरथो यदर्वते पर होत्रया शिम्य वीथो अध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ bhūṣan kṣitayo janma rodasyoḥ pravācyaṃ vṛṣaṇā dakṣase mahe yadīṃ ṛtāya bharatho yadarvate pra hotrayā śimya vītho adhvaram

translations.griffith: The folk have glorified your birth from Earth and Heaven, to be extolled, ye Strong Ones, for your mighty power.  Ye, when ye bring to singer and the rite, enjoy the sacrifice performed with holy praise and strength.

verses.sanskrit: पर सा कषितिरसुर या महि परिय रतावानाव रतमा घोषथो बर्हत युवं दिवो बर्हतो दक्षमभुवं गां न धुर्युप युञ्जाथे अपः |||
verses.transliteration: pra sā kṣitirasura yā mahi priya ṛtāvānāv ṛtamā ghoṣatho bṛhat yuvaṃ divo bṛhato dakṣamabhuvaṃ ghāṃ na dhuryupa yuñjāthe apaḥ

translations.griffith: The people prospers, Asuras! whom ye dearly love: ye, Righteous Ones, proclaim aloud the Holy Law.  That efficacious power that comes from lofty heaven, ye bind unto the work, as to the pole an ox.

verses.sanskrit: मही अत्र महिना वारं रण्वथो.अरेणवस्तुज आ सद्मन धेनवः सवरन्ति ता उपरताति सूर्यमा निम्रुच उषसस्तक्ववीरिव |||
verses.transliteration: mahī atra mahinā vāraṃ ṛṇvatho.areṇavastuja ā sadman dhenavaḥ svaranti tā uparatāti sūryamā nimruca uṣasastakvavīriva

translations.griffith: On this great earth ye send your treasure down with might: unstained by dust, the crowding kine are in the stalls.  Here in the neighbourhood they cry unto the Sun at morning and at evening, like swift birds of prey.

verses.sanskrit: आ वं रताय केशिनीरनुषत मित्र यत्र वरुण गातुमर्चथः अव तमन सर्जतं पिन्वतं धियो युवं विप्रस्य मन्मनमिरज्यथः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vaṃ ṛtāya keśinīranuṣata mitra yatra varuṇa ghātumarcathaḥ ava tmana sṛjataṃ pinvataṃ dhiyo yuvaṃ viprasya manmanamirajyathaḥ

translations.griffith: The flames with curling tresses serve your sacrifice, whereto ye sing the song, Mitra and Varuṇa.  Send down of your free will, prosper our holy songs: ye are sole Masters of the singer's hymn of praise.

verses.sanskrit: यो वां यज्ञैः शशमानो ह दाशति कविर्होता यजति मन्मसाधनः उपाह तं गछथो वीथो अध्वरमछा गिरः सुमतिं गन्तमस्मयु |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāṃ yajñaiḥ śaśamāno ha dāśati kavirhotā yajati manmasādhanaḥ upāha taṃ ghachatho vītho adhvaramachā ghiraḥ sumatiṃ ghantamasmayu

translations.griffith: Whoso with sacrifices toiling brings you gifts, and worships, sage and priest, fulfilling your desire,—  To him do ye draw nigh and taste his sacrifice. Come well-inclined to us unto our songs and prayer.

verses.sanskrit: युवां यज्ञैः परथमा गोभिरञ्जत रतावना मनसो नप्रयुक्तिषु भरन्ति वां मन्मना संयता गिरो.अद्र्प्यता मनस रेवदशाथे |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāṃ yajñaiḥ prathamā ghobhirañjata ṛtāvanā manaso naprayuktiṣu bharanti vāṃ manmanā saṃyatā ghiro.adṛpyatā manasa revadaśāthe

translations.griffith: With sacrifices and with milk they deck you first, ye Righteous Ones, as if through stirrings of the mind.  To you they bring their hymns with their collected thought, while ye with earnest soul come to us gloriously.

verses.sanskrit: रेवद वयो दधाथे रेवदाशथे नरा मयाभिरितौति महिनम न वं दयावो.अहभिर्नोत सिन्धवो न देवत्वं पणयो नानशुर्मघम |||
verses.transliteration: revad vayo dadhāthe revadāśathe narā mayābhiritauti mahinam na vaṃ dyāvo.ahabhirnota sindhavo na devatvaṃ paṇayo nānaśurmagham

translations.griffith: Rich strength of life is yours: ye, Heroes, have obtained through your surpassing powers rich far-extending might.  Not the past days conjoined with nights, not rivers, not the Paṇis have attained your Godhead and your wealth.

verses.sanskrit: युवं वस्त्रणि पुवसा वसाथे युवोरछिद्रा मन्तवो ह सर्गाः अवातिरतमन्र्तानि विश्व रतेन मित्रावरुणा सचेथे |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ vastraṇi puvasā vasāthe yuvorachidrā mantavo ha sarghāḥ avātiratamanṛtāni viśva ṛtena mitrāvaruṇā sacethe

translations.griffith: THE robes which ye put on abound with fatness: uninterrupted courses are your counsels.  All falsehood, Mitra-Varuṇa! ye conquer, and closely cleave unto the Law Eternal.

verses.sanskrit: एतच्चन तवो वि चिकेतदेषां सत्यो मन्त्रः कविशस्त रघावान तरिरश्रिं हन्ति चतुरश्रिरुग्रो देवनिदो ह परथमाजूर्यन |||
verses.transliteration: etaccana tvo vi ciketadeṣāṃ satyo mantraḥ kaviśasta ṛghāvān triraśriṃ hanti caturaśrirughro devanido ha prathamāajūryan

translations.griffith: This might of theirs hath no one comprehended. True is the crushing word the sage hath uttered,  The fearful four-edged bolt smites down the three-edged, and those who hate the Gods first fall and perish.

verses.sanskrit: अपादेति परथमा पद्वतीनां कस्तद वां मित्रावरुणा चिकेत गर्भो भारं भरत्या चिदस्य रतं पिपर्त्यन्र्तं नि तारीत |||
verses.transliteration: apādeti prathamā padvatīnāṃ kastad vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā ciketa gharbho bhāraṃ bharatyā cidasya ṛtaṃ pipartyanṛtaṃ ni tārīt

translations.griffith: The Footless Maid precedeth footed creatures. Who marketh, Mitra-Varuṇa, this your doing?  The Babe Unborn supporteth this world's burthen, fulfilleth Law and overcometh falsehood.

verses.sanskrit: परयन्तमित परि जारं कनीनां पश्यामसि नोपनिपद्यमानम अनवप्र्ग्णा वितता वसानं परियं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम |||
verses.transliteration: prayantamit pari jāraṃ kanīnāṃ paśyāmasi nopanipadyamānam anavapṛghṇā vitatā vasānaṃ priyaṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma

translations.griffith: We look on him the darling of the Maidens, always advancing, never falling downward,  Wearing inseparable, wide-spread raiment, Mitra's and Varuṇa's delightful glory.

verses.sanskrit: अनश्वो जातो अनभीशुरर्वा कनिक्रदत पतयदूर्ध्वसानुः अचित्तं बरह्म जुजुषुर्युवानः पर मित्रे धाम वरुणेग्र्णन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: anaśvo jāto anabhīśurarvā kanikradat patayadūrdhvasānuḥ acittaṃ brahma jujuṣuryuvānaḥ pra mitre dhāma varuṇeghṛṇantaḥ

translations.griffith: Unbridled Courser, born but not of horses, neighing he flieth on with back uplifted.  The youthful love mystery thought-surpassing, praising in Mitra-Varuṇa, its glory.

verses.sanskrit: आ धेनवो मामतेयमवन्तीर्ब्रह्मप्रियं पीपयन सस्मिन्नूधन पित्वो भिक्षेत वयुनानि विद्वानासाविवासन्नदितिमुरुष्येत |||
verses.transliteration: ā dhenavo māmateyamavantīrbrahmapriyaṃ pīpayan sasminnūdhan pitvo bhikṣeta vayunāni vidvānāsāvivāsannaditimuruṣyet

translations.griffith: May the milch-kine who favour Māmateya prosper in this world him who loves devotion.  May he, well skilled in rites, be food, and calling Aditi with his lips give us assistance.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां मित्रावरुणा हव्यजुष्टिं नमसा देवाववसा वव्र्त्याम अस्माकं बरह्म पर्तनासु सह्या अस्माकं वर्ष्टिर्दिव्यासुपारा |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā havyajuṣṭiṃ namasā devāvavasā vavṛtyām asmākaṃ brahma pṛtanāsu sahyā asmākaṃ vṛṣṭirdivyāsupārā

translations.griffith: Gods, Mitra-Varuṇa, with love and worship, let me make you delight in this oblation.  May our prayer be victorious in battles, may we have rain from heaven to make us prosper.

verses.sanskrit: यजामहे वां महः सजोषा हव्येभिर्मित्रावरुणा नमोभिः घर्तैर्घ्र्तस्नू अध यद वामस्मे अध्वर्यवो न धीतिभिर्भरन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: yajāmahe vāṃ mahaḥ sajoṣā havyebhirmitrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ ghṛtairghṛtasnū adha yad vāmasme adhvaryavo na dhītibhirbharanti

translations.griffith: WE worship with our reverence and oblations you, Mitra Varuṇa, accordant, mighty,  So that with us, ye Twain whose backs are sprinkled with oil, the priests with oil and hymns support you.

verses.sanskrit: परस्तुतिर्वां धाम न परयुक्तिरयामि मित्रावरुणा सुव्र्क्तिः अनक्ति यद वां विदथेषु होता सुम्नं वां सूरिर्व्र्षणावियक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: prastutirvāṃ dhāma na prayuktirayāmi mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktiḥ anakti yad vāṃ vidatheṣu hotā sumnaṃ vāṃ sūrirvṛṣaṇāviyakṣan

translations.griffith: Your praise is like a mighty power, an impulse: to you, Twain Gods, a well-formed hymn is offered,  As the priest decks yon, Strong Ones, in assemblies, and the prince fain to worship you for blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पीपाय धेनुरदितिर्र्ताय जनाय मित्रावरुणा हविर्दे हिनोति यद वां विदथे सपर्यन स रातहव्यो मानुषो न होता |||
verses.transliteration: pīpāya dhenuraditirṛtāya janāya mitrāvaruṇā havirde hinoti yad vāṃ vidathe saparyan sa rātahavyo mānuṣo na hotā

translations.griffith: O Mitra-Varuṇa, Aditi the Milch-cow streams for the rite, for folk who bring oblation,  When in the assembly he who worships moves you, like to a human priest, with gifts presented.

verses.sanskrit: उत वां विक्षु मद्यास्वन्धो गाव आपश्च पीपयन्त देवीः उतो नो अस्य पूर्व्यः पतिर्दन वीतं पातं पयस उस्रियायाः |||
verses.transliteration: uta vāṃ vikṣu madyāsvandho ghāva āpaśca pīpayanta devīḥ uto no asya pūrvyaḥ patirdan vītaṃ pātaṃ payasa usriyāyāḥ

translations.griffith: So may the kine and heavenly Waters pour you sweet drink in families that make you joyful.  Of this may he, the ancient House-Lord, give us. Enjoy, drink of the milk the cow provideth.

verses.sanskrit: विष्णोर्नु कं वीर्याणि पर वोचं यः पार्थिवानि विममेरजांसि यो अस्कभायदुत्तरं सधस्थं विचक्रमाणस्त्रेधोरुगायः |||
verses.transliteration: viṣṇornu kaṃ vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yaḥ pārthivāni vimamerajāṃsi yo askabhāyaduttaraṃ sadhasthaṃ vicakramāṇastredhorughāyaḥ

translations.griffith: I WILL declare the mighty deeds of Viṣṇu, of him who measured out the earthly regions,  Who propped the highest place of congregation, thrice setting down his footstep, widely striding.

verses.sanskrit: पर तद विष्णु सतवते वीर्येण मर्गो न भीमः कुचरो गिरिष्ठाः यस्योरुषु तरिषु विक्रमणेष्वधिक्षियन्ति भुवनानि विश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: pra tad viṣṇu stavate vīryeṇa mṛgho na bhīmaḥ kucaro ghiriṣṭhāḥ yasyoruṣu triṣu vikramaṇeṣvadhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā

translations.griffith: For this his mighty deed is Viṣṇu lauded, like some wild beast, dread, prowling, mountain-roaming;  He within whose three wide-extended paces all living creatures have their habitation.

verses.sanskrit: पर विष्णवे शूषमेतु मन्म गिरिक्षित उरुगायाय वर्ष्णे य इदं दीर्घं परयतं सधस्थमेको विममे तरिभिरित पदेभिः |||
verses.transliteration: pra viṣṇave śūṣametu manma ghirikṣita urughāyāya vṛṣṇe ya idaṃ dīrghaṃ prayataṃ sadhasthameko vimame tribhirit padebhiḥ

translations.griffith: Let the hymn lift itself as strength to Viṣṇu, the Bull far-striding, dwelling on the mountains,  Him who alone with triple step hath measured this common dwelling-place, long, far extended.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य तरी पूर्णा मधुना पदान्यक्षीयमाणा सवधयामदन्ति य उ तरिधातु पर्तिवीमुत दयामेको दाधार भुवनानि विश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: yasya trī pūrṇā madhunā padānyakṣīyamāṇā svadhayāmadanti ya u tridhātu pṛtivīmuta dyāmeko dādhāra bhuvanāni viśvā

translations.griffith: Him whose three places that are filled with sweetness, imperishable, joy as it may list them,  Who verily alone upholds the threefold, the earth, the heaven, and all living creatures.

verses.sanskrit: तदस्य परियमभि पाथो अश्यां नरो यत्र देवयवो मदन्ति उरुक्रमस्य स हि बन्धुरित्था विष्णोः पदे परमे मध्व उत्सः |||
verses.transliteration: tadasya priyamabhi pātho aśyāṃ naro yatra devayavo madanti urukramasya sa hi bandhuritthā viṣṇoḥ pade parame madhva utsaḥ

translations.griffith: May I attain to that his well-loved mansion where men devoted to the Gods are happy.  For there springs, close akin to the Wide-Strider, the well of meath in Viṣṇu's highest footstep.

verses.sanskrit: ता वं वास्तून्युश्मसि गमध्यै यत्र गावो भूरिश्र्ङगायासः अत्राह तदुरुगायस्य वर्ष्णः परमं पदमव भाति भूरि |||
verses.transliteration: tā vaṃ vāstūnyuśmasi ghamadhyai yatra ghāvo bhūriśṛṅghāayāsaḥ atrāha tadurughāyasya vṛṣṇaḥ paramaṃ padamava bhāti bhūri

translations.griffith: Fain would we go unto your dwelling-places where there are many-horned and nimble oxen,  For mightily, there, shineth down upon us the widely-striding Bull's sublimest mansion.

verses.sanskrit: पर वः पान्तमन्धसो धियायते महे शूराय विष्णवे चार्चत या सानुनि पर्वतानामदाभ्या महस्तस्थतुरर्वतेव साधुना |||
verses.transliteration: pra vaḥ pāntamandhaso dhiyāyate mahe śūrāya viṣṇave cārcata yā sānuni parvatānāmadābhyā mahastasthaturarvateva sādhunā

translations.griffith: To the great Hero, him who sets his mind thereon, and Viṣṇu, praise aloud in song your draught of juice,—  Gods ne’er beguiled, who borne as ’twere by noble steed, have stood upon the lofty ridges of the hills.

verses.sanskrit: तवेषमित्था समरणं शिमीवतोरिन्द्राविष्णू सुतपा वामुरुष्यति या मर्त्याय परतिधीयमानमित कर्शानोरस्तुरसनामुरुष्यथः |||
verses.transliteration: tveṣamitthā samaraṇaṃ śimīvatorindrāviṣṇū sutapā vāmuruṣyati yā martyāya pratidhīyamānamit kṛśānorasturasanāmuruṣyathaḥ

translations.griffith: Your Soma-drinker keeps afar your furious rush, Indra and Viṣṇu, when ye come with all your might.  That which hath been directed well at mortal man, bow-armed Kṛśānu's arrow, ye turn far aside.

verses.sanskrit: ता ईं वर्धन्ति मह्यस्य पौंस्यं नि मातरा नयति रेतसे भुजे दधाति पुत्रो.अवरं परं पितुर्नाम तर्तीयमधि रोचने दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: tā īṃ vardhanti mahyasya pauṃsyaṃ ni mātarā nayati retase bhuje dadhāti putro.avaraṃ paraṃ piturnāma tṛtīyamadhi rocane divaḥ

translations.griffith: These offerings increase his mighty manly strength: he brings both Parents down to share the genial flow.  He lowers, though a son, the Father's highest name; the third is that which is high in the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तत-तदिदस्य पौंस्यं गर्णीमसीनस्य तरतुरव्र्कस्य मीळ्हुषः यः पार्थिवानि तरिभिरिद विगामभिरुरु करमिष्टोरुगायाय जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: tat-tadidasya pauṃsyaṃ ghṛṇīmasīnasya traturavṛkasya mīḷhuṣaḥ yaḥ pārthivāni tribhirid vighāmabhiruru kramiṣṭorughāyāya jīvase

translations.griffith: We laud this manly power of him the Mighty One, preserver, inoffensive, bounteous and benign;  His who strode, widely pacing, with three steppings forth over the realms of earth for freedom and for life.

verses.sanskrit: दवे इदस्य करमणे सवर्द्र्शो.अभिख्याय मर्त्यो भुरण्यति तर्तीयमस्य नकिरा दधर्षति वयश्चन पतयन्तः पतत्रिणः |||
verses.transliteration: dve idasya kramaṇe svardṛśo.abhikhyāya martyo bhuraṇyati tṛtīyamasya nakirā dadharṣati vayaścana patayantaḥ patatriṇaḥ

translations.griffith: A mortal man, when he beholds two steps of him who looks upon the light, is restless with amaze.  But his third step doth no one venture to approach, no, nor the feathered birds of air who fly with wings.

verses.sanskrit: चतुर्भिः साकं नवतिं च नामभिश्चक्रं न वर्त्तं वयतीन्रवीविपत बर्हच्छरीरो विमिमान रक्वभिर्युवाकुमारः परत्येत्याहवम |||
verses.transliteration: caturbhiḥ sākaṃ navatiṃ ca nāmabhiścakraṃ na vṛttaṃ vyatīnravīvipat bṛhaccharīro vimimāna ṛkvabhiryuvākumāraḥ pratyetyāhavam

translations.griffith: He, like a rounded wheel, hath in swift motion set his ninety racing steeds together with the four.  Developed, vast in form, with those who sing forth praise, a youth, no more a child, he cometh to our call.

verses.sanskrit: भवा मित्रो न शेव्यो घर्तासुतिर्विभूतद्युम्न एवया उ सप्रथाः अधा ते विष्णो विदुषा चिदर्ध्य सतोमो यज्ञश्चराध्यो हविष्मता |||
verses.transliteration: bhavā mitro na śevyo ghṛtāsutirvibhūtadyumna evayā u saprathāḥ adhā te viṣṇo viduṣā cidardhya stomo yajñaścarādhyo haviṣmatā

translations.griffith: FAR-SHINING, widely famed, going thy wonted way, fed with the oil, be helpful. Mitra-like, to us.  So, Viṣṇu, e’en the wise must swell thy song of praise, and he who hath oblations pay thee solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit: यः पूर्व्याय वेधसे नवीयसे सुमज्जानये विष्णवे ददाशति यो जातमस्य महतो महि बरवत सेदु शरवोभिर्युज्यं चिदभ्यसत |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ pūrvyāya vedhase navīyase sumajjānaye viṣṇave dadāśati yo jātamasya mahato mahi bravat sedu śravobhiryujyaṃ cidabhyasat

translations.griffith: He who brings gifts to him the Ancient and the Last, to Viṣṇu who ordains, together with his Spouse,  Who tells the lofty birth of him the Lofty One, shall verily surpass in glory e’en his peer.

verses.sanskrit: तमु सतोतारः पूर्व्यं यथा विद रतस्य गर्भं जनुषापिपर्तन आस्य जानन्तो नाम चिद विवक्तन महस्ते विष्णो सुमतिं भजामहे |||
verses.transliteration: tamu stotāraḥ pūrvyaṃ yathā vida ṛtasya gharbhaṃ januṣāpipartana āsya jānanto nāma cid vivaktana mahaste viṣṇo sumatiṃ bhajāmahe

translations.griffith: Him have ye satisfied, singers, as well as ye know, primeval germ of Order even from his birth.  Ye, knowing e’en his name, have told it forth: may we, Viṣṇu, enjoy the grace of thee the Mighty One.

verses.sanskrit: तमस्य राजा वरुणस्तमश्विना करतुं सचन्त मारुतस्य वेधसः दाधार दक्षमुत्तममहर्विदं वरजं च विष्णुः सखिवानपोर्णुते |||
verses.transliteration: tamasya rājā varuṇastamaśvinā kratuṃ sacanta mārutasya vedhasaḥ dādhāra dakṣamuttamamaharvidaṃ vrajaṃ ca viṣṇuḥ sakhivānaporṇute

translations.griffith: The Sovran Varuṇa and both the Aśvins wait on this the will of him who guides the Marut host.  Viṣṇu hath power supreme and might that finds the day, and with his Friend unbars the stable of the kine.

verses.sanskrit: आ यो विवाय सचथाय दैव्य इन्द्राय विष्णुः सुक्र्ते सुक्र्त्तरः वेधा अजिन्वत तरिषधस्थ आर्यं रतस्य भागे यजमानमाभजत |||
verses.transliteration: ā yo vivāya sacathāya daivya indrāya viṣṇuḥ sukṛte sukṛttaraḥ vedhā ajinvat triṣadhastha āryaṃ ṛtasya bhāghe yajamānamābhajat

translations.griffith: Even he the Heavenly One who came for fellowship, Viṣṇu to Indra, godly to the godlier,  Who Maker, throned in three worlds, helps the Āryan man, and gives the worshipper his share of Holy Law.

verses.sanskrit: अबोध्यग्निर्ज्म उदेति सूर्यो वयुषाश्चन्द्रा मह्यावो अर्चिषा आयुक्षातामश्विना यातवे रथं परासावीद देवः सविता जगत पर्थक |||
verses.transliteration: abodhyaghnirjma udeti sūryo vyuṣāścandrā mahyāvo arciṣā āyukṣātāmaśvinā yātave rathaṃ prāsāvīd devaḥ savitā jaghat pṛthak

translations.griffith: AGNI is wakened: Sūrya riseth from the earth. Mighty, refulgent Dawn hath shone with all her light.  The Aśvins have equipped their chariot for the course. God Savitar hath moved the folk in sundry ways.

verses.sanskrit: यद युञ्जाथे वर्षणमश्विना रथं घर्तेन नो मधुना कषत्रमुक्षतम अस्माकं बरह्म पर्तनासु जिन्वतं वयं धना शूरसाता भजेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: yad yuñjāthe vṛṣaṇamaśvinā rathaṃ ghṛtena no madhunā kṣatramukṣatam asmākaṃ brahma pṛtanāsu jinvataṃ vayaṃ dhanā śūrasātā bhajemahi

translations.griffith: When, Aśvins, ye equip your very mighty car, bedew, ye Twain, our power with honey and with oil.  To our devotion give victorious strength in war: may we win riches in the heroes' strife for spoil.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वां तरिचक्रो मधुवाहनो रथो जीराश्वो अश्विनोर्यातु सुष्टुतः तरिवन्धुरो मघवा विश्वसौभगः शं न आ वक्षद दविपदे चतुष्पदे |||
verses.transliteration: arvāṃ tricakro madhuvāhano ratho jīrāśvo aśvinoryātu suṣṭutaḥ trivandhuro maghavā viśvasaubhaghaḥ śaṃ na ā vakṣad dvipade catuṣpade

translations.griffith: Nigh to us come the Aśvins' lauded three-wheeled car, the car laden with meath and drawn by fleet-foot steeds,  Three-seated, opulent, bestowing all delight. may it bring weal to us, to cattle and to men.

verses.sanskrit: आ न ऊर्जं वहतमश्विना युवं मधुमत्या नः कशया मिमिक्षतम परायुस्तारिष्टं नी रपांसि मर्क्षतं सेधतं दवेषो भवतं सचाभुवा |||
verses.transliteration: ā na ūrjaṃ vahatamaśvinā yuvaṃ madhumatyā naḥ kaśayā mimikṣatam prāyustāriṣṭaṃ nī rapāṃsi mṛkṣataṃ sedhataṃ dveṣo bhavataṃ sacābhuvā

translations.griffith: Bring hither nourishment for us, ye Aśvins Twain; sprinkle us with your whip that drops with honey-dew.  Prolong our days of life, wipe out our trespasses; destroy our foes, be our companions and our Friends.

verses.sanskrit: युवं ह गर्भं जगतीषु धत्थो युवं विश्वेषु भुवनेष्वन्तः युवमग्निं च वर्षणावपश्च वनस्पतीन्रश्विनावैरयेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ ha gharbhaṃ jaghatīṣu dhattho yuvaṃ viśveṣu bhuvaneṣvantaḥ yuvamaghniṃ ca vṛṣaṇāvapaśca vanaspatīnraśvināvairayethām

translations.griffith: Ye store the germ of life in female creatures, ye lay it up within all living beings.  Ye have sent forth, O Aśvins passing mighty, the fire, the sovrans of the wood, the waters,

verses.sanskrit: युवं ह सथो भिषजा भेषजेभिरथो ह सथो रथ्या राथ्येभिः अथो ह कषत्रमधि धत्थ उग्रा यो वां हविष्मान्मनसा ददाश |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ ha stho bhiṣajā bheṣajebhiratho ha stho rathyā rāthyebhiḥ atho ha kṣatramadhi dhattha ughrā yo vāṃ haviṣmānmanasā dadāśa

translations.griffith: Leeches are ye with medicines to heal us, and charioteers are ye with skill in driving.  Ye Strong, give sway to him who brings oblation and with his heart pours out his gift before you.

verses.sanskrit: वसू रुद्रा पुरुमन्तू वर्धन्ता दशस्यतं नो वर्षणावभिष्टौ दस्रा ह यद रेक्ण औचथ्यो वां पर यत सस्राथेकवाभिरूती |||
verses.transliteration: vasū rudrā purumantū vṛdhantā daśasyataṃ no vṛṣaṇāvabhiṣṭau dasrā ha yad rekṇa aucathyo vāṃ pra yat sasrātheakavābhirūtī

translations.griffith: YE Vasus Twain, ye Rudras full of counsel, grant us, Strong Strengtheners, when ye stand beside us,  What wealth Aucathya craves of you, great Helpers when ye come forward with no niggard succour.

verses.sanskrit: को वां दाशत सुमतये चिदस्यै वसू यद धेथे नमसा पदे गोः जिग्र्तमस्मे रेवतीः पुरन्धीः कामप्रेणेव मनसा चरन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: ko vāṃ dāśat sumataye cidasyai vasū yad dhethe namasā pade ghoḥ jighṛtamasme revatīḥ purandhīḥ kāmapreṇeva manasā carantā

translations.griffith: Who may give you aught, Vasus, for your favour, for what, at the Cow's place, ye grant through worship?  Wake for us understanding full of riches, come with a heart that will fulfil our longing.

verses.sanskrit: युक्तो ह यद वां तौग्र्याय पेरुर्वि मध्ये अर्णसो धायि पज्रः उप वामवः शरणं गमेयं शूरो नाज्म पतयद्भिरेवैः |||
verses.transliteration: yukto ha yad vāṃ taughryāya perurvi madhye arṇaso dhāyi pajraḥ upa vāmavaḥ śaraṇaṃ ghameyaṃ śūro nājma patayadbhirevaiḥ

translations.griffith: As erst for Tugra's son your car, sea-crossing, strong, was equipped and set amid the waters,  So may I gain your shelter and protection as with winged course a hero seeks his army.

verses.sanskrit: उपस्तुतिरौचथ्यमुरुष्येन मा मामिमे पतत्रिणी वि दुग्धाम मा मामेधो दशतयश्चितो धाक पर यद वां बद्धस्त्मनि खादति कषाम |||
verses.transliteration: upastutiraucathyamuruṣyen mā māmime patatriṇī vi dughdhām mā māmedho daśatayaścito dhāk pra yad vāṃ baddhastmani khādati kṣām

translations.griffith: May this my praise preserve Ucathya's offspring: let not these Twain who fly with wings exhaust me.  Let not the wood ten times up-piled consume me, when fixed for you it bites the ground it stands on.

verses.sanskrit: न मा गरन नद्यो मात्र्तमा दासा यदीं सुसमुब्धमवाधुः शिरो यदस्य तरैतनो वितक्षत सवयं दास उरो अंसावपि गध |||
verses.transliteration: na mā gharan nadyo mātṛtamā dāsā yadīṃ susamubdhamavādhuḥ śiro yadasya traitano vitakṣat svayaṃ dāsa uro aṃsāvapi ghdha

translations.griffith: The most maternal streams, wherein the Dāsas cast me securely bound, have not devoured me.  When Traitana would cleave my head asunder, the Dāsa wounded his own breast and shoulders.

verses.sanskrit: दीर्घतमा मामतेयो जुजुर्वान दशमे युगे अपामर्थं यतीनां बरह्मा भवति सारथिः |||
verses.transliteration: dīrghatamā māmateyo jujurvān daśame yughe apāmarthaṃ yatīnāṃ brahmā bhavati sārathiḥ

translations.griffith: Dīrghatamas the son of Mamatā hath come to length of days in the tenth age of human kind.  He is the Brahman of the waters as they strive to reach their end and aim: their charioteer is he.

verses.sanskrit: पर दयावा यज्ञैः पर्थिवी रताव्र्धा मही सतुषे विदथेषु परचेतसा देवेभिर्ये देवपुत्रे सुदंससेत्था धिया वार्याणि परभूषतः |||
verses.transliteration: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī ṛtāvṛdhā mahī stuṣe vidatheṣu pracetasā devebhirye devaputre sudaṃsasetthā dhiyā vāryāṇi prabhūṣataḥ

translations.griffith: I PRAISE with sacrifices mighty Heaven and Earth at festivals, the wise, the Strengtheners of Law.  Who, having Gods for progeny, conjoined with Gods, through wonder-working wisdom bring forth choicest boons.

verses.sanskrit: उत मन्ये पितुरद्रुहो मनो मातुर्महि सवतवस्तद धवीमभिः सुरेतसा पितरा भूम चक्रतुरुरु परजाया अम्र्तंवरीमभिः |||
verses.transliteration: uta manye pituradruho mano māturmahi svatavastad dhavīmabhiḥ suretasā pitarā bhūma cakratururu prajāyā amṛtaṃvarīmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: With invocations, on the gracious Father's mind, and on the Mother's great inherent power I muse.  Prolific Parents, they have made the world of life, and for their brood all round wide immortality.

verses.sanskrit: ते सूनवः सवपसः सुदंससो मही जज्ञुर्मातरा पूर्वचित्तये सथातुश्च सत्यं जगतश्च धर्मणि पुत्रस्य पाथः पदमद्वयाविनः |||
verses.transliteration: te sūnavaḥ svapasaḥ sudaṃsaso mahī jajñurmātarā pūrvacittaye sthātuśca satyaṃ jaghataśca dharmaṇi putrasya pāthaḥ padamadvayāvinaḥ

translations.griffith: These Sons of yours well skilled in work, of wondrous power, brought forth to life the two great Mothers first of all.  To keep the truth of all that stands and all that moves, ye guard the station of your Son who knows no guile.

verses.sanskrit: ते मायिनो ममिरे सुप्रचेतसो जामी सयोनी मिथुना समोकसा नव्यं-नव्यं तन्तुमा तन्वते दिवि समुद्रे अन्तः कवयः सुदीतयः |||
verses.transliteration: te māyino mamire supracetaso jāmī sayonī mithunā samokasā navyaṃ-navyaṃ tantumā tanvate divi samudre antaḥ kavayaḥ sudītayaḥ

translations.griffith: They with surpassing skill, most wise, have measured out the Twins united in their birth and in their home.  They, the refulgent Sages, weave within the sky, yea, in the depths of sea, a web for ever new.

verses.sanskrit: तद राधो अद्य सवितुर्वरेण्यं वयं देवस्य परसवे मनामहे अस्मभ्यं दयावाप्र्थिवी सुचेतुना रयिं धत्तं वसुमन्तं शतग्विनम |||
verses.transliteration: tad rādho adya saviturvareṇyaṃ vayaṃ devasya prasave manāmahe asmabhyaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantaṃ śataghvinam

translations.griffith: This is to-day the goodliest gift of Savitar: this thought we have when now the God is furthering us.  On us with loving-kindness Heaven and Earth bestow riches and various wealth and treasure hundredfold!

verses.sanskrit: ते हि दयावाप्र्थिवी विश्वशम्भुव रतावरी रजसो धारयत्कवी सुजन्मनी धिषणे अन्तरीयते देवो देवी धर्मणा सूर्यः शुचिः |||
verses.transliteration: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaśambhuva ṛtāvarī rajaso dhārayatkavī sujanmanī dhiṣaṇe antarīyate devo devī dharmaṇā sūryaḥ śuciḥ

translations.griffith: THESE, Heaven and Earth, bestow prosperity on all, sustainers of the region, Holy Ones and wise,  Two Bowls of noble kind: between these Goddesses the God, the fulgent Sun, travels by fixed decree.

verses.sanskrit: उरुव्यचसा महिनी असश्चता पिता माता च भुवनानि रक्षतः सुध्र्ष्टमे वपुष्ये न रोदसी पिता यत सीमभि रूपैरवासयत |||
verses.transliteration: uruvyacasā mahinī asaścatā pitā mātā ca bhuvanāni rakṣataḥ sudhṛṣṭame vapuṣye na rodasī pitā yat sīmabhi rūpairavāsayat

translations.griffith: Widely-capacious Pair, mighty, that never fail, the Father and the Mother keep all creatures safe:  The two world-halves, the spirited, the beautiful, because the Father hath clothed them in goodly forms.

verses.sanskrit: स वह्निः पुत्रः पित्रोः पवित्रवान पुनाति धीरो भुवनानि मायया धेनुं च पर्श्निं वर्षभं सुरेतसं विश्वाहा शुक्रं पयो अस्य दुक्षत |||
verses.transliteration: sa vahniḥ putraḥ pitroḥ pavitravān punāti dhīro bhuvanāni māyayā dhenuṃ ca pṛśniṃ vṛṣabhaṃ suretasaṃ viśvāhā śukraṃ payo asya dukṣata

translations.griffith: Son of these Parents, he the Priest with power to cleanse, Sage, sanctifies the worlds with his surpassing power.  Thereto for his bright milk he milked through all the days the party-coloured Cow and the prolific Bull.

verses.sanskrit: अयं देवानामपसामपस्तमो यो जजान रोदसी विश्वशम्भुवा वि यो ममे रजसी सुक्रतूययाजरेभि सकम्भनेभिःसमान्र्चे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ devānāmapasāmapastamo yo jajāna rodasī viśvaśambhuvā vi yo mame rajasī sukratūyayājarebhi skambhanebhiḥsamānṛce

translations.griffith: Among the skilful Gods most skilled is he, who made the two world-halves which bring prosperity to all;  Who with great wisdom measured both the regions out, and stablished them with pillars that shall ne’er decay.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो गर्णाने महिनी महि शरवः कषत्रं दयावाप्र्थिवी धासथो बर्हत येनाभि कर्ष्टीस्ततनाम विश्वहा पनाय्यमोजो अस्मे समिन्वतम |||
verses.transliteration: te no ghṛṇāne mahinī mahi śravaḥ kṣatraṃ dyāvāpṛthivī dhāsatho bṛhat yenābhi kṛṣṭīstatanāma viśvahā panāyyamojo asme saminvatam

translations.griffith: Extolled in song, O Heaven and Earth, bestow on us, ye mighty Pair, great glory and high lordly sway,  Whereby we may extend ourselves ever over the folk; and send us strength that shall deserve the praise of men.

verses.sanskrit: किमु शरेष्ठः किं यविष्ठो न आजगन किमीयते दूत्यं कद यदूचिम न निन्दिम चमसं यो महाकुलो.अग्ने भरातर्द्रुण इद भूतिमूदिम |||
verses.transliteration: kimu śreṣṭhaḥ kiṃ yaviṣṭho na ājaghan kimīyate dūtyaṃ kad yadūcima na nindima camasaṃ yo mahākulo.aghne bhrātardruṇa id bhūtimūdima

translations.griffith: WHY hath the Best, why hath the Youngest come to us? Upon what embassy comes he? What have we said?  We have not blamed the chalice of illustrious birth. We, Brother Agni, praised the goodness of the wood.

verses.sanskrit: एकं चमसं चतुरः कर्णोतन तद वो देवा अब्रुवन तद व आगमम सौधन्वना यद्येवा करिष्यथ साकं देवैर्यज्ञियासो भविष्यथ |||
verses.transliteration: ekaṃ camasaṃ caturaḥ kṛṇotana tad vo devā abruvan tad va āghamam saudhanvanā yadyevā kariṣyatha sākaṃ devairyajñiyāso bhaviṣyatha

translations.griffith: The chalice that is single make ye into four: thus have the Gods commanded; therefore am I come.  If, O Sudhanvan's Children, ye will do this thing ye shall participate in sacrifice with Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं दूतं परति यदब्रवीतनाश्वः कर्त्वो रथ उतेह कर्त्वः धेनुः कर्त्वा युवशा कर्त्वा दवा तानि भरातरनु वः कर्त्व्येमसि |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ dūtaṃ prati yadabravītanāśvaḥ kartvo ratha uteha kartvaḥ dhenuḥ kartvā yuvaśā kartvā dvā tāni bhrātaranu vaḥ kṛtvyemasi

translations.griffith: What to the envoy Agni in reply ye spake, A courser must be made, a chariot fashioned here,  A cow must be created, and the Twain made young. When we have done these things, Brother, we turn to you.

verses.sanskrit: चक्र्वांस रभवस्तदप्र्छत कवेदभूद यः सय दूतो न आजगन यदावाख्यच्चमसाञ्चतुरः कर्तानादित तवष्टा गनास्वन्तर्न्यानजे |||
verses.transliteration: cakṛvāṃsa ṛbhavastadapṛchata kvedabhūd yaḥ sya dūto na ājaghan yadāvākhyaccamasāñcaturaḥ kṛtānādit tvaṣṭā ghnāsvantarnyānaje

translations.griffith: When thus, O Ṛbhus, ye had done ye questioned thus, Whither went he who came to us a messenger?  Then Tvaṣṭar, when he viewed the four wrought chalices, concealed himself among the Consorts of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: हनामैनानिति तवष्टा यदब्रवीच्चमसं ये देवपानमनिन्दिषुः अन्या नामानि कर्ण्वते सुते सचानन्यैरेनान्कन्या नामभि सपरत |||
verses.transliteration: hanāmaināniti tvaṣṭā yadabravīccamasaṃ ye devapānamanindiṣuḥ anyā nāmāni kṛṇvate sute sacānanyairenānkanyā nāmabhi sparat

translations.griffith: As Tvaṣṭar thus had spoken, Let us slay these men who have reviled the chalice, drinking-cup of Gods,  They gave themselves new names when Soma juice was shed, and under these new names the Maiden welcomed them.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो हरी युयुजे अश्विना रथं बर्हस्पतिर्विश्वरूपामुपाजत रभुर्विभ्वा वाजो देवानगछत सवपसो यज्ञियम्भागमैतन |||
verses.transliteration: indro harī yuyuje aśvinā rathaṃ bṛhaspatirviśvarūpāmupājata ṛbhurvibhvā vājo devānaghachata svapaso yajñiyambhāghamaitana

translations.griffith: Indra hath yoked his Bays, the Aśvins' car is horsed, Bṛhaspati hath brought the Cow of every hue.  Ye went as Ṛbhus, Vibhvan, Vāja to the Gods, and skilled in war, obtained your share in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: निश्चर्मणो गामरिणीत धीतिभिर्या जरन्ता युवशा ताक्र्णोतन सौधन्वना अश्वादश्वमतक्षत युक्त्वा रथमुप देवानयातन |||
verses.transliteration: niścarmaṇo ghāmariṇīta dhītibhiryā jarantā yuvaśā tākṛṇotana saudhanvanā aśvādaśvamatakṣata yuktvā rathamupa devānayātana

translations.griffith: Ye by your wisdom brought a cow from out a hide; unto that ancient Pair ye gave again their youth.  Out of a horse, Sudhanvan's Sons, ye formed a horse: a chariot ye equipped, and went unto the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इदमुदकं पिबतेत्यब्रवीतनेदं वा घा पिबता मुञ्जनेजनम सौधन्वना यदि तन नेव हर्यथ तर्तीये घ सवने मादयाध्वै |||
verses.transliteration: idamudakaṃ pibatetyabravītanedaṃ vā ghā pibatā muñjanejanam saudhanvanā yadi tan neva haryatha tṛtīye gha savane mādayādhvai

translations.griffith: Drink ye this water, were the words ye spake to them; or drink ye this, the rinsing of the Muñja-grass.  If ye approve not even this, Sudhanvan's Sons, then at the third libation gladden ye yourselves.

verses.sanskrit: आपो भूयिष्ठा इत्येको अब्रवीदग्निर्भूयिष्ठ इत्यन्यो अब्रवीत वधर्यन्तीं बहुभ्यः परैको अब्रवीद रता वदन्तश्चमसानपिंशत |||
verses.transliteration: āpo bhūyiṣṭhā ityeko abravīdaghnirbhūyiṣṭha ityanyo abravīt vadharyantīṃ bahubhyaḥ praiko abravīd ṛtā vadantaścamasānapiṃśata

translations.griffith: Most excellent are waters, thus said one of you; most excellent is Agni, thus another said.  Another praised to many a one the lightning cloud. Then did ye shape the cups, speaking the words of truth.

verses.sanskrit: शरोणामेक उदकं गामवजति मांसमेकः पिंशति सूनयाभ्र्तम आ निम्रुचः शक्र्देको अपभरत किं सवित पुत्रेभ्यः पितरा उपावतुः |||
verses.transliteration: śroṇāmeka udakaṃ ghāmavajati māṃsamekaḥ piṃśati sūnayābhṛtam ā nimrucaḥ śakṛdeko apabharat kiṃ svit putrebhyaḥ pitarā upāvatuḥ

translations.griffith: One downward to the water drives the crippled cow, another trims the flesh brought on the carving-board.  One carries off the refuse at the set of sun. How did the Parents aid their children in their task!

verses.sanskrit: उद्वत्स्वस्मा अक्र्णोतन तर्णं निवत्स्वपः सवपस्यय नरः अगोह्यस्य यदसस्तना गर्हे तदद्येदं रभवो नानु गछथ |||
verses.transliteration: udvatsvasmā akṛṇotana tṛṇaṃ nivatsvapaḥ svapasyaya naraḥ aghohyasya yadasastanā ghṛhe tadadyedaṃ ṛbhavo nānu ghachatha

translations.griffith: On the high places ye have made the grass for man, and water in the valleys, by your skill, O Men.  Ṛbhus, ye iterate not to-day that act of yours, your sleeping in the house of him whom naught can hide.

verses.sanskrit: सम्मील्य यद भुवना पर्यसर्पत कव सवित तात्या पितर वासतुः अशपत यः करस्नं व अददे यः पराब्रवीत परोतस्म अब्रवीतन |||
verses.transliteration: sammīlya yad bhuvanā paryasarpata kva svit tātyā pitara vāsatuḥ aśapata yaḥ karasnaṃ va adade yaḥ prābravīt protasma abravītana

translations.griffith: As, compassing them round, ye glided through the worlds, where had the venerable Parents their abode?  Ye laid a curse on him who raised his arm at you: to him who spake aloud to you ye spake again.

verses.sanskrit: सुषुप्वांस रभवस्तदप्र्छतागोह्य क इदं नो अबूबुधत शवानं बस्तो बोधयितारमब्रवीत सम्वत्सर इदमद्या वयख्यत |||
verses.transliteration: suṣupvāṃsa ṛbhavastadapṛchatāghohya ka idaṃ no abūbudhat śvānaṃ basto bodhayitāramabravīt samvatsara idamadyā vyakhyata

translations.griffith: When ye had slept your fill, ye Ṛbhus, thus ye asked, O thou whom naught may hide, who now hath wakened us?  The goat declared the hound to be your wakener. That day, in a full year, ye first unclosed our eyes.

verses.sanskrit: दिवा यन्ति मरुतो भूम्याग्निरयं वातो अन्तरिक्षेण यति अद्भिर्यति वरुणः समुद्रैर्युष्मानिछन्तः शवसो नपातः |||
verses.transliteration: divā yanti maruto bhūmyāghnirayaṃ vāto antarikṣeṇa yati adbhiryati varuṇaḥ samudrairyuṣmānichantaḥ śavaso napātaḥ

translations.griffith: The Maruts move in heaven, on earth this Agni; through the mid-firmament the Wind approaches.  Varuṇa comes in the sea's gathered waters, O Sons of Strength, desirous of your presence.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमायुरिन्द्र रभुक्षा मरुतः परिख्यन यद वाजिनो देवजतस्य सप्तेः परवक्ष्यामो विदथे वीर्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: mā no mitro varuṇo aryamāyurindra ṛbhukṣā marutaḥ parikhyan yad vājino devajatasya sapteḥ pravakṣyāmo vidathe vīryāṇi

translations.griffith: SLIGHT us not Varuṇa, Aryaman, or Mitra, Ṛbhukṣan, Indra, Āyu, or the Maruts,  When we declare amid the congregation the virtues of the strong Steed, God-descended.

verses.sanskrit: यन निर्णिजा रेक्णसा पराव्र्तस्य रतिं गर्भीतां मुखतो नयन्ति सुप्रनजो मेम्यद विश्वरूप इन्द्रापूष्णोः परियमप्येति पाथः |||
verses.transliteration: yan nirṇijā rekṇasā prāvṛtasya ratiṃ ghṛbhītāṃ mukhato nayanti supranajo memyad viśvarūpa indrāpūṣṇoḥ priyamapyeti pāthaḥ

translations.griffith: What time they bear before the Courser, covered with trappings and with wealth, the grasped oblation,  The dappled goat goeth straightforward, bleating, to the place dear to Indra and to Pūṣan.

verses.sanskrit: एष छागः पुरो अश्वेन वाजिना पूष्णो भागो नीयते विश्वदेव्यः अभिप्रियं यत पुरोळाशमर्वता तवष्टेदेनं सौश्रवसाय जिन्वति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa chāghaḥ puro aśvena vājinā pūṣṇo bhāgho nīyate viśvadevyaḥ abhipriyaṃ yat puroḷāśamarvatā tvaṣṭedenaṃ sauśravasāya jinvati

translations.griffith: Dear to all Gods, this goat, the share of Pūṣan, is first led forward with the vigorous Courser,  While Tvaṣṭar sends him forward with the Charger, acceptable for sacrifice, to glory.

verses.sanskrit: यद धविष्यं रतुशो देवयानं तरिर्मानुषाः पर्यश्वं नयन्ति अत्रा पूष्णः परथमो भाग एति यज्ञं देवेभ्यः परतिवेदयन्नजः |||
verses.transliteration: yad dhaviṣyaṃ ṛtuśo devayānaṃ trirmānuṣāḥ paryaśvaṃ nayanti atrā pūṣṇaḥ prathamo bhāgha eti yajñaṃ devebhyaḥ prativedayannajaḥ

translations.griffith: When thrice the men lead round the Steed, in order, who goeth to the Gods as meet oblation,  The goat precedeth him, the share of Pūṣan, and to the Gods the sacrifice announceth.

verses.sanskrit: होताध्वर्युरावया अग्निमिन्धो गरावग्राभ उत शंस्ता सुविप्रः तेन यज्ञेन सवरंक्र्तेन सविष्टेन वक्षणा आप्र्णध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: hotādhvaryurāvayā aghnimindho ghrāvaghrābha uta śaṃstā suvipraḥ tena yajñena svaraṃkṛtena sviṣṭena vakṣaṇā āpṛṇadhvam

translations.griffith: Invoker, ministering priest, atoner, fire-kindler Soma-presser, sage, reciter,  With this well ordered sacrifice, well finished, do ye fill full the channels of the rivers.

verses.sanskrit: यूपव्रस्का उत ये यूपवाहाश्चषालं ये अश्वयूपाय तक्षति ये चार्वते पचनं सम्भरन्त्युतो तेषामभिगूर्तिर्न इन्वतु |||
verses.transliteration: yūpavraskā uta ye yūpavāhāścaṣālaṃ ye aśvayūpāya takṣati ye cārvate pacanaṃ sambharantyuto teṣāmabhighūrtirna invatu

translations.griffith: The hewers of the post and those who carry it, and those who carve the knob to deck the Horse's stake;  Those who prepare the cooking-vessels for the Steed,—may the approving help of these promote our work.

verses.sanskrit: उप परागात सुमन मे.अधायि मन्म देवानामाशा उप वीतप्र्ष्ठः अन्वेनं विप्रा रषयो मदन्ति देवानां पुष्टे चक्र्मा सुबन्धुम |||
verses.transliteration: upa prāghāt suman me.adhāyi manma devānāmāśā upa vītapṛṣṭhaḥ anvenaṃ viprā ṛṣayo madanti devānāṃ puṣṭe cakṛmā subandhum

translations.griffith: Forth, for the regions of the Gods, the Charger with his smooth back is come my prayer attends him.  In him rejoice the singers and the sages. A good friend have we won for the Gods’ banquet.

verses.sanskrit: यद वाजिनो दाम सुन्दानमर्वतो या शीर्षण्या रशनारज्जुरस्य यद वा घास्य परभ्र्तमास्ये तर्णं सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: yad vājino dāma sundānamarvato yā śīrṣaṇyā raśanārajjurasya yad vā ghāsya prabhṛtamāsye tṛṇaṃ sarvā tā te api deveṣvastu

translations.griffith: May the fleet Courser's halter and his heel-ropes, the head-stall and the girths and cords about him.  And the grass put within his mouth to bait him,—among the Gods, too, let all these be with thee.

verses.sanskrit: यदश्वस्य करविषो मक्षिकाश यद वा सवरौ सवधितौ रिप्तमस्ति यद धस्तयोः शमितुर्यन नखेषु सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: yadaśvasya kraviṣo makṣikāśa yad vā svarau svadhitau riptamasti yad dhastayoḥ śamituryan nakheṣu sarvā tā te api deveṣvastu

translations.griffith: What part of the Steed's flesh the fly hath eaten, or is left sticking to the post or hatchet,  Or to the slayer's hands and nails adhereth,—among the Gods, too, may all this be with thee.

verses.sanskrit: यदूवध्यमुदरस्यापवाति य आमस्य करविषो गन्धो अस्ति सुक्र्ता तच्छमितारः कर्ण्वन्तूत मेधं शर्तपाकं पचन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: yadūvadhyamudarasyāpavāti ya āmasya kraviṣo ghandho asti sukṛtā tacchamitāraḥ kṛṇvantūta medhaṃ śṛtapākaṃ pacantu

translations.griffith: Food undigested steaming from his belly, and any odour of raw flesh remaining,  This let the immolators set in order and dress the sacrifice with perfect cooking.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते गात्रादग्निना पच्यमानादभि शूलं निहतस्यावधावति मा तद भूम्यामा शरिषन मा तर्णेषु देवेभ्यस्तदुशद्भ्यो रातमस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: yat te ghātrādaghninā pacyamānādabhi śūlaṃ nihatasyāvadhāvati mā tad bhūmyāmā śriṣan mā tṛṇeṣu devebhyastaduśadbhyo rātamastu

translations.griffith: What from thy body which with fire is roasted, when thou art set upon the spit, distilleth,  Let not that lie on earth or grass neglected, but to the longing Gods let all be offered.

verses.sanskrit: ये वाजिनं परिपश्यन्ति पक्वं य ईमाहुः सुरभिर्निर्हरेति ये चार्वतो मांसभिक्षामुपासत उतो तेषामभिगूर्तिर्न इन्वतु |||
verses.transliteration: ye vājinaṃ paripaśyanti pakvaṃ ya īmāhuḥ surabhirnirhareti ye cārvato māṃsabhikṣāmupāsata uto teṣāmabhighūrtirna invatu

translations.griffith: They who observing that the Horse is ready call out and say, the smell is good; remove it;  And, craving meat, await the distribution,—may their approving help promote labour.

verses.sanskrit: यन नीक्षणं मांस्पचन्या उखाया या पात्राणि यूष्णासेचनानि ऊष्मण्यापिधाना चरूणामङकाः सूनाःपरि भूषन्त्यश्वम |||
verses.transliteration: yan nīkṣaṇaṃ māṃspacanyā ukhāyā yā pātrāṇi yūṣṇaāsecanāni ūṣmaṇyāpidhānā carūṇāmaṅkāḥ sūnāḥpari bhūṣantyaśvam

translations.griffith: The trial-fork of the flesh-cooking caldron, the vessels out of which the broth is sprinkled,  The warming-pots, the covers of the dishes, hooks, carving-boards,—all these attend the Charger.

verses.sanskrit: निक्रमणं निषदनं विवर्तनं यच्च पड्बीशमर्वतः यच्च पपौ यच्च घासिं जघास सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: nikramaṇaṃ niṣadanaṃ vivartanaṃ yacca paḍbīśamarvataḥ yacca papau yacca ghāsiṃ jaghāsa sarvā tā te api deveṣvastu

translations.griffith: The starting-place, his place of rest and rolling, the ropes wherewith the Charger's feet were fastened,  The water that he drank, the food he tasted,—among the Gods, too, may all these attend thee.

verses.sanskrit: मा तवाग्निर्ध्वनयीद धूमगन्धिर्मोखा भराजन्त्यभि विक्त जघ्रिः इष्टं वीतमभिगूर्तं वषट्क्र्तं तं देवासः परति गर्भ्णन्त्यश्वम |||
verses.transliteration: mā tvāghnirdhvanayīd dhūmaghandhirmokhā bhrājantyabhi vikta jaghriḥ iṣṭaṃ vītamabhighūrtaṃ vaṣaṭkṛtaṃ taṃ devāsaḥ prati ghṛbhṇantyaśvam

translations.griffith: Let not the fire, smoke-scented, make thee crackle, nor glowing caldron smell and break to pieces.  Offered, beloved, approved, and consecrated,—such Charger do the Gods accept with favour.

verses.sanskrit: यदश्वाय वास उपस्त्र्णन्त्यधीवासं या हिरण्यान्यस्मै सन्दानमर्वन्तं पड्बीशं परिया देवेष्वा यामयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: yadaśvāya vāsa upastṛṇantyadhīvāsaṃ yā hiraṇyānyasmai sandānamarvantaṃ paḍbīśaṃ priyā deveṣvā yāmayanti

translations.griffith: The robe they spread upon the Horse to clothe him, the upper covering and the golden trappings,  The halters which restrain the Steed, the heel-ropes,—all these, as grateful to the Gods, they offer.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते सादे महसा शूक्र्तस्य पार्ष्ण्या वा कशया वा तुतोद सरुचेव ता हविषो अध्वरेषु सर्वा ता ते बरह्मणासूदयामि |||
verses.transliteration: yat te sāde mahasā śūkṛtasya pārṣṇyā vā kaśayā vā tutoda sruceva tā haviṣo adhvareṣu sarvā tā te brahmaṇāsūdayāmi

translations.griffith: If one, when seated, with excessive urging hath with his heel or with his whip distressed thee,  All these thy woes, as with the oblations' ladle at sacrifices, with my prayer I banish.

verses.sanskrit: चतुस्त्रिंशद वाजिनो देवबन्धोर्वङकरीरश्वस्य सवधितिःसमेति अछिद्रा गात्रा वयुना कर्णोत परुष-परुरनुघुष्य वि शस्त |||
verses.transliteration: catustriṃśad vājino devabandhorvaṅkrīraśvasya svadhitiḥsameti achidrā ghātrā vayunā kṛṇota paruṣ-paruranughuṣya vi śasta

translations.griffith: The four-and-thirty ribs of the. Swift Charger, kin to the Gods, the slayer's hatchet pierces.  Cut ye with skill, so that the parts be flawless, and piece by piece declaring them dissect them.

verses.sanskrit: एकस्त्वष्तुरश्वस्या विशस्ता दवा यन्तारा भवतस्तथर्तुः या ते गात्राणां रतुथा कर्णोमि ता-ता पिण्डनां पर जुहोम्यग्नौ |||
verses.transliteration: ekastvaṣturaśvasyā viśastā dvā yantārā bhavatastathaṛtuḥ yā te ghātrāṇāṃ ṛtuthā kṛṇomi tā-tā piṇḍanāṃ pra juhomyaghnau

translations.griffith: Of Tvaṣṭar's Charger there is one dissector,—this is the custom-two there are who guide him.  Such of his limbs as I divide in order, these, amid the balls, in fire I offer.

verses.sanskrit: मा तवा तपत परिय आत्मापियन्तं मा सवधितिस्तन्व आ तिष्ठिपत ते मा ते गर्ध्नुरविशस्तातिहाय छिद्रा गात्रण्यसिना मिथू कः |||
verses.transliteration: mā tvā tapat priya ātmāpiyantaṃ mā svadhitistanva ā tiṣṭhipat te mā te ghṛdhnuraviśastātihāya chidrā ghātraṇyasinā mithū kaḥ
