translations.griffith: Let not thy dear soul burn thee as thou comest, let not the hatchet linger in thy body.  Let not a greedy clumsy immolator, missing the joints, mangle thy limbs unduly.

verses.sanskrit: न वा उ एतन मरियसे न रिष्यसि देवानिदेषि पथिभिः सुगेभिः हरी ते युञ्जा पर्षती अभूतामुपास्थाद वाजी धुरि रासभस्य |||
verses.transliteration: na vā u etan mriyase na riṣyasi devānideṣi pathibhiḥ sughebhiḥ harī te yuñjā pṛṣatī abhūtāmupāsthād vājī dhuri rāsabhasya

translations.griffith: No, here thou diest not, thou art not injured: by easy paths unto the Gods thou goest.  Both Bays, both spotted mares are now thy fellows, and to the ass's pole is yoked the Charger.

verses.sanskrit: सुगव्यं नो वाजी सवश्व्यं पुंसः पुत्रानुत विश्वापुषं रयिम अनागास्त्वं नो अदितिः कर्णोतु कषत्रं नो अश्वो वनतां हविष्मान |||
verses.transliteration: sughavyaṃ no vājī svaśvyaṃ puṃsaḥ putrānuta viśvāpuṣaṃ rayim anāghāstvaṃ no aditiḥ kṛṇotu kṣatraṃ no aśvo vanatāṃ haviṣmān

translations.griffith: May this Steed bring us all-sustaining riches, wealth in good kine, good horses, manly offspring.  Freedom from sin may Aditi vouchsafe us: the Steed with our oblations gain us lordship!

verses.sanskrit: यदक्रन्दः परथमं जायमान उद्यन समुद्रादुत वा पुरीषात शयेनस्य पक्षा हरिणस्य बाहू उपस्तुत्यं महि जातं ते अर्वन |||
verses.transliteration: yadakrandaḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāna udyan samudrāduta vā purīṣāt śyenasya pakṣā hariṇasya bāhū upastutyaṃ mahi jātaṃ te arvan

translations.griffith: WHAT time, first springing into life, thou neighedst, proceeding from the sea or upper waters,  Limbs of the deer hadst thou, and eagle pinions. O Steed, thy birth is nigh and must be lauded.

verses.sanskrit: यमेन दत्तं तरित एनमायुनगिन्द्र एणं परथमो अध्यतिष्ठत गन्धर्वो अस्य रशनामग्र्भ्णात सूरादश्वं वसवो निरतष्ट |||
verses.transliteration: yamena dattaṃ trita enamāyunaghindra eṇaṃ prathamo adhyatiṣṭhat ghandharvo asya raśanāmaghṛbhṇāt sūrādaśvaṃ vasavo nirataṣṭa

translations.griffith: This Steed which Yama gave hath Trita harnessed, and him, the first of all, hath Indra mounted.  His bridle the Gandharva grasped. O Vasus, from out the Sun ye fashioned forth the Courser.

verses.sanskrit: असि यमो अस्यादित्यो अर्वन्नसि तरितो गुह्येन वरतेन असि सोमेन समया विप्र्क्त आहुस्ते तरीणि दिवि बन्धनानि |||
verses.transliteration: asi yamo asyādityo arvannasi trito ghuhyena vratena asi somena samayā vipṛkta āhuste trīṇi divi bandhanāni

translations.griffith: Yama art thou, O Horse; thou art Āditya; Trita art thou by secret operation.  Thou art divided thoroughly from Soma. They say thou hast three bonds in heaven  that hold thee.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि त आहुर्दिवि बन्धनानि तरीण्यप्सु तरीण्यन्तः समुद्रे उतेव मे वरुणश्चन्त्स्यर्वन यत्रा त आहुः परमं जनित्रम |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi ta āhurdivi bandhanāni trīṇyapsu trīṇyantaḥ samudre uteva me varuṇaścantsyarvan yatrā ta āhuḥ paramaṃ janitram

translations.griffith: Three bonds, they say, thou hast in heaven that bind thee, three in the waters,  three within the ocean.  To me thou seemest Varuṇa, O Courser, there where they say is thy sublimest birth-place.

verses.sanskrit: इमा ते वाजिन्नवमार्जनानीमा शफानां सनितुर्निधाना अत्रा ते भद्रा रशना अपश्यं रतस्य या अभिरक्षन्तिगोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: imā te vājinnavamārjanānīmā śaphānāṃ saniturnidhānā atrā te bhadrā raśanā apaśyaṃ ṛtasya yā abhirakṣantighopāḥ

translations.griffith: Here-, Courser, are the places where they groomed thee, here are the traces of thy hoofs as winner.  Here have I seen the auspicious reins that guide thee, which those who guard the holy Law keep safely.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मानं ते मनसारादजानामवो दिवा पतयन्तं पतंगम शिरो अपश्यं पथिभिः सुगेभिररेणुभिर्जेहमानं पतत्रि |||
verses.transliteration: ātmānaṃ te manasārādajānāmavo divā patayantaṃ pataṃgham śiro apaśyaṃ pathibhiḥ sughebhirareṇubhirjehamānaṃ patatri

translations.griffith: Thyself from far I recognized in spirit,—a Bird that from below flew through the heaven.  I saw thy head still soaring, striving upward by paths unsoiled by dust, pleasant to travel.

verses.sanskrit: अत्रा ते रूपमुत्तममपश्यं जिगीषमाणमिष आ पदेगोः यदा ते मर्तो अनु भोगमानळ आदिद गरसिष्ठ ओषधीरजीगः |||
verses.transliteration: atrā te rūpamuttamamapaśyaṃ jighīṣamāṇamiṣa ā padeghoḥ yadā te marto anu bhoghamānaḷ ādid ghrasiṣṭha oṣadhīrajīghaḥ

translations.griffith: Here I beheld thy form, matchless in glory, eager to win thee food at the Cow's station.  Whene’er a man brings thee to thine enjoyment, thou swallowest the plants most greedy eater.

verses.sanskrit: अनु तवा रथो अनु मर्यो अर्वन्ननु गावो.अनु भगः कनीनाम अनु वरातासस्तव सख्यमीयुरनु देवा ममिरे वीर्यं ते |||
verses.transliteration: anu tvā ratho anu maryo arvannanu ghāvo.anu bhaghaḥ kanīnām anu vrātāsastava sakhyamīyuranu devā mamire vīryaṃ te

translations.griffith: After thee, Courser, come the car, the bridegroom, the kine come after, and the charm of maidens.  Full companies have followed for thy friendship: the pattern of thy vigour Gods have copied.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यश्र्ङगो.अयो अस्य पादा मनोजवा अवर इन्द्र आसीत देवा इदस्य हविरद्यमायन यो अर्वन्तं परथमो अध्यतिष्ठत |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyaśṛṅgho.ayo asya pādā manojavā avara indra āsīt devā idasya haviradyamāyan yo arvantaṃ prathamo adhyatiṣṭhat

translations.griffith: Horns made of gold hath he: his feet are iron: less fleet than he, though swift as thought, is Indra.  The Gods have come that they may taste the oblation of him who mounted, first of all, the Courser.

verses.sanskrit: ईर्मान्तासः सिलिकमध्यमासः सं शूरणासो दिव्यासो अत्याः हंसा इव शरेणिशो यतन्ते यदाक्षिषुर्दिव्यमज्ममश्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: īrmāntāsaḥ silikamadhyamāsaḥ saṃ śūraṇāso divyāso atyāḥ haṃsā iva śreṇiśo yatante yadākṣiṣurdivyamajmamaśvāḥ

translations.griffith: Symmetrical in flank, with rounded haunches, mettled like heroes, the Celestial Coursers  Put forth their strength, like swans in lengthened order, when they, the Steeds, have reached the heavenly causeway.

verses.sanskrit: तव शरीरं पतयिष्ण्वर्वन तव चित्तं वात इव धरजीमान तव शर्ङगाणि विष्ठिता पुरुत्रारण्येषु जर्भुराणा चरन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: tava śarīraṃ patayiṣṇvarvan tava cittaṃ vāta iva dhrajīmān tava śṛṅghāṇi viṣṭhitā purutrāraṇyeṣu jarbhurāṇā caranti

translations.griffith: A body formed for flight hast thou, O Charger; swift as the wind in motion is thy spirit.  Thy horns are spread abroad in all directions: they move with restless beat in wildernesses.

verses.sanskrit: उप परागाच्छसनं वाज्यर्वा देवद्रीचा मनसा दीध्यानः अजः पुरो नीयते नाभिरस्यानु पश्चात कवयो यन्तिरेभाः |||
verses.transliteration: upa prāghācchasanaṃ vājyarvā devadrīcā manasā dīdhyānaḥ ajaḥ puro nīyate nābhirasyānu paścāt kavayo yantirebhāḥ

translations.griffith: The strong Steed hath come forward to the slaughter, pondering with a mind directed God-ward.  The goat who is his kin is led before him the sages and the singers follow after.

verses.sanskrit: उप परागात परमं यत सधस्थमर्वानछा पितरं मातरं च अद्या देवाञ जुष्टतमो हि गम्या अथा शास्ते दाशुषे वार्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: upa prāghāt paramaṃ yat sadhasthamarvānachā pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca adyā devāñ juṣṭatamo hi ghamyā athā śāste dāśuṣe vāryāṇi

translations.griffith: The Steed is come unto the noblest mansion, is come unto his Father and his Mother.  This day shall he approach the Gods, most welcome: then he declares good gifts to him who offers.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य वामस्य पलितस्य होतुस्तस्य भराता मध्यमो अस्त्यश्नः तर्तीयो भराता घर्तप्र्ष्ठो अस्यात्रापश्यं विश्पतिं सप्तपुत्रम |||
verses.transliteration: asya vāmasya palitasya hotustasya bhrātā madhyamo astyaśnaḥ tṛtīyo bhrātā ghṛtapṛṣṭho asyātrāpaśyaṃ viśpatiṃ saptaputram

translations.griffith: OF this benignant Priest, with eld grey-coloured, the brother midmost of the three is lightning.  The third is he whose back with oil is sprinkled. Here I behold the Chief with seven male children.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त युञ्जन्ति रथमेकचक्रमेको अश्वो वहति सप्तनामा तरिनाभि चक्रमजरमनर्वं यत्रेमा विश्वा भुवनाधितस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: sapta yuñjanti rathamekacakrameko aśvo vahati saptanāmā trinābhi cakramajaramanarvaṃ yatremā viśvā bhuvanādhitasthuḥ

translations.griffith: Seven to the one-wheeled chariot yoke the Courser; bearing seven names the single Courser draws it.  Three-naved the wheel is, sound and undecaying, whereon are resting all these worlds of being.

verses.sanskrit: इमं रथमधि ये सप्त तस्थुः सप्तचक्रं सप्त वहन्त्यश्वाः सप्त सवसारो अभि सं नवन्ते यत्र गवां निहिता सप्त नाम |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ rathamadhi ye sapta tasthuḥ saptacakraṃ sapta vahantyaśvāḥ sapta svasāro abhi saṃ navante yatra ghavāṃ nihitā sapta nāma

translations.griffith: The seven who on the seven-wheeled car are mounted have horses, seven in tale, who draw them onward.  Seven Sisters utter songs of praise together, in whom the names of the seven Cows are treasured.

verses.sanskrit: को ददर्श परथमं जायमानमस्थन्वन्तं यदनस्था बिभर्ति भूम्या असुरस्र्गात्मा कव सवित को विद्वांसमुप गात परष्टुमेतत |||
verses.transliteration: ko dadarśa prathamaṃ jāyamānamasthanvantaṃ yadanasthā bibharti bhūmyā asurasṛghātmā kva svit ko vidvāṃsamupa ghāt praṣṭumetat

translations.griffith: Who hath beheld him as he sprang to being, seen how the boneless One supports the bony?  Where is the blood of earth, the life, the spirit? Who may approach the man who knows, to ask it?

verses.sanskrit: पाकः पर्छामि मनसाविजानन देवानामेना निहिता पदानि वत्से बष्कये.अधि सप्त तन्तून वि तत्निरे कवय ओतवाु |||
verses.transliteration: pākaḥ pṛchāmi manasāvijānan devānāmenā nihitā padāni vatse baṣkaye.adhi sapta tantūn vi tatnire kavaya otavāu

translations.griffith: Unripe in mind, in spirit undiscerning, I ask of these the Gods’ established places;  For up above the yearling Calf the sages, to form a web, their own seven threads have woven.

verses.sanskrit: अचिकित्वाञ्चिकितुषश्चिदत्र कवीन पर्छामि विद्मने न विद्वान वि यस्तस्तम्भ षळ इमा रजांस्यजस्य रूपे किमपि सविदेकम |||
verses.transliteration: acikitvāñcikituṣaścidatra kavīn pṛchāmi vidmane na vidvān vi yastastambha ṣaḷ imā rajāṃsyajasya rūpe kimapi svidekam

translations.griffith: I ask, unknowing, those who know, the sages, as one all ignorant for sake of knowledge,  What was that ONE who in the Unborn's image hath stablished and fixed firm these worlds' six regions.

verses.sanskrit: इह बरवीतु य ईमङग वेदास्य वामस्य निहितं पदं वेः शीर्ष्णः कषीरं दुह्रते गावो अस्य वव्रिं वसाना उदकं पदापुः |||
verses.transliteration: iha bravītu ya īmaṅgha vedāsya vāmasya nihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ śīrṣṇaḥ kṣīraṃ duhrate ghāvo asya vavriṃ vasānā udakaṃ padāpuḥ

translations.griffith: Let him who knoweth presently declare it, this lovely Bird's securely founded station.  Forth from his head the Cows draw milk, and, wearing his vesture, with their foot have drunk the water.

verses.sanskrit: माता पितरं रत आ बभाज धीत्यग्रे मनसा सं हि जग्मे सा बीभत्सुर्गर्भरसा निविद्धा नमस्वन्त इदुपवाकमीयुः |||
verses.transliteration: mātā pitaraṃ ṛta ā babhāja dhītyaghre manasā saṃ hi jaghme sā bībhatsurgharbharasā nividdhā namasvanta idupavākamīyuḥ

translations.griffith: The Mother gave the Sire his share of Order: with thought, at first, she wedded him in spirit.  She, the coy Dame, was filled with dew prolific: with adoration men approached to praise her.

verses.sanskrit: युक्ता मातासीद धुरि दक्षिणाया अतिष्ठद गर्भो वर्जनीष्वन्तः अमीमेद वत्सो अनु गामपश्यद विश्वरूप्यं तरिषु योजनेषु |||
verses.transliteration: yuktā mātāsīd dhuri dakṣiṇāyā atiṣṭhad gharbho vṛjanīṣvantaḥ amīmed vatso anu ghāmapaśyad viśvarūpyaṃ triṣu yojaneṣu

translations.griffith: Yoked was the Mother to the boon Cow's car-pole: in the dank rows of cloud the Infant rested.  Then the Calf lowed, and looked upon the Mother, the Cow who wears all shapes in three directions.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो मातॄस्त्रीन पितॄन बिभ्रदेक ऊर्ध्वस्तस्थौ नेमव गलापयन्ति मन्त्रयन्ते दिवो अमुष्य पर्ष्ठे विश्वविदं वाचमविश्वमिन्वाम |||
verses.transliteration: tisro mātṝstrīn pitṝn bibhradeka ūrdhvastasthau nemava ghlāpayanti mantrayante divo amuṣya pṛṣṭhe viśvavidaṃ vācamaviśvaminvām

translations.griffith: Bearing three Mothers and three Fathers, single he stood erect: they never make him weary.  There on the pitch of heaven they speak together in speech all-knowing but not all-impelling.

verses.sanskrit: दवादशारं नहि तज्जराय वर्वर्ति चक्रं परि दयां रतस्य आ पुत्रा अग्ने मिथुनासो अत्र सप्त शतानि विंशतिश्च तस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: dvādaśāraṃ nahi tajjarāya varvarti cakraṃ pari dyāṃ ṛtasya ā putrā aghne mithunāso atra sapta śatāni viṃśatiśca tasthuḥ

translations.griffith: Formed with twelve spokes, by length of time, unweakened, rolls round the heaven this wheel of during Order.  Herein established, joined in pairs together, seven hundred Sons and twenty stand, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: पञ्चपादं पितरं दवादशाक्र्तिं दिव आहुः परे अर्धे पुरीषिणम अथेमे अन्य उपरे विचक्षणं सप्तचक्रे षळर आहुरर्पितम |||
verses.transliteration: pañcapādaṃ pitaraṃ dvādaśākṛtiṃ diva āhuḥ pare ardhe purīṣiṇam atheme anya upare vicakṣaṇaṃ saptacakre ṣaḷara āhurarpitam

translations.griffith: They call him in the farther half of heaven the Sire five-footed, of twelve forms, wealthy in watery store.  These others say that he, God with far-seeing eyes, is mounted on the lower seven-wheeled, six-spoked car.

verses.sanskrit: पञ्चारे चक्रे परिवर्तमाने तस्मिन्ना तस्थुर्भुवनानि विश्वा तस्य नाक्षस्तप्यते भूरिभारः सनादेव न शीर्यते सनाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: pañcāre cakre parivartamāne tasminnā tasthurbhuvanāni viśvā tasya nākṣastapyate bhūribhāraḥ sanādeva na śīryate sanābhiḥ

translations.griffith: Upon this five-spoked wheel revolving ever all living creatures rest and are dependent.  Its axle, heavy-laden, is not heated: the nave from ancient time remains unbroken.

verses.sanskrit: सनेमि चक्रमजरं वि वाव्र्त उत्तानायां दश युक्ता वहन्ति सूर्यस्य चक्षू रजसैत्याव्र्तं तस्मिन्नार्पिता भुवनानि विश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: sanemi cakramajaraṃ vi vāvṛta uttānāyāṃ daśa yuktā vahanti sūryasya cakṣū rajasaityāvṛtaṃ tasminnārpitā bhuvanāni viśvā

translations.griffith: The wheel revolves, unwasting, with its felly: ten draw it, yoked to the far-stretching car-pole.  The Sun's eye moves encompassed by the region: on him dependent rest all living creatures.

verses.sanskrit: साकंजानां सप्तथमहुरेकजं षळ इद यमा रषयो देवजा इति तेषामिष्टानि विहितानि धामश सथात्रे रेजन्ते विक्र्तानि रूपशः |||
verses.transliteration: sākaṃjānāṃ saptathamahurekajaṃ ṣaḷ id yamā ṛṣayo devajā iti teṣāmiṣṭāni vihitāni dhāmaśa sthātre rejante vikṛtāni rūpaśaḥ

translations.griffith: Of the co-born they call the seventh single-born; the six twin pairs are called Ṛṣis, Children of Gods.  Their good gifts sought of men are ranged in order due, and various in their form move for the Lord who guides.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रियः सतीस्तानु मे पुंस आहुः पश्यदक्षण्वान नवि चेतदन्धः कविर्यः पुत्रः स ईमा चिकेत यस्ता विजानात स पितुष पितासत |||
verses.transliteration: striyaḥ satīstānu me puṃsa āhuḥ paśyadakṣaṇvān navi cetadandhaḥ kaviryaḥ putraḥ sa īmā ciketa yastā vijānāt sa pituṣ pitāsat

translations.griffith: They told me these were males, though truly females: he who hath eyes sees this, the blind discerns not.  The son who is a sage hath comprehended: who knows this rightly is his father's father.

verses.sanskrit: अवः परेण पर एनावरेण पदा वत्सं बिभ्रती गौरुदस्थात सा कद्रीची कं सविदर्धं परागात कव सवित सूते नहि यूथे अन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: avaḥ pareṇa para enāvareṇa padā vatsaṃ bibhratī ghaurudasthāt sā kadrīcī kaṃ svidardhaṃ parāghāt kva svit sūte nahi yūthe antaḥ

translations.griffith: Beneath the upper realm, above this lower, bearing her calf at foot the Cow hath risen.  Witherward, to what place hath she departed? Where calves she? Not amid this herd of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: अवः परेण पितरं यो अस्यानुवेद पर एनावरेण कवीयमानः क इह पर वोचद देवं मनः कुतो अधि पराजातम |||
verses.transliteration: avaḥ pareṇa pitaraṃ yo asyānuveda para enāvareṇa kavīyamānaḥ ka iha pra vocad devaṃ manaḥ kuto adhi prājātam

translations.griffith: Who, that the father of this Calf discerneth beneath the upper realm, above the lower,  Showing himself a sage, may here declare it? Whence hath the Godlike spirit had its rising?

verses.sanskrit: ये अर्वाञ्चस्तानु पराच आहुर्ये पराञ्चस्तानु अर्वाच आहुः इन्द्रश्च या चक्रथुः सोम तानि धुरा न युक्ता रजसो वहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ye arvāñcastānu parāca āhurye parāñcastānu arvāca āhuḥ indraśca yā cakrathuḥ soma tāni dhurā na yuktā rajaso vahanti

translations.griffith: Those that come hitherward they call departing, those that depart they call directed hither.  And what so ye have made, Indra and Soma, steeds bear as ’twere yoked to the region's car-pole.

verses.sanskrit: दवा सुपर्णा सयुजा सखाया समानं वर्क्षं परि षस्वजाते तयोरन्यः पिप्पलं सवाद्वत्त्यनश्नन्नन्यो अभि चाकशीति |||
verses.transliteration: dvā suparṇā sayujā sakhāyā samānaṃ vṛkṣaṃ pari ṣasvajāte tayoranyaḥ pippalaṃ svādvattyanaśnannanyo abhi cākaśīti

translations.griffith: Two Birds with fair wings, knit with bonds of friendship, in the same sheltering tree have found a refuge.  One of the twain eats the sweet Fig-tree's fruitage; the other eating not regardeth only.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रा सुपर्णा अम्र्तस्य भागमनिमेषं विदथाभिस्वरन्ति इनो विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपाः स मा धीरः पाकमत्रा विवेश |||
verses.transliteration: yatrā suparṇā amṛtasya bhāghamanimeṣaṃ vidathābhisvaranti ino viśvasya bhuvanasya ghopāḥ sa mā dhīraḥ pākamatrā viveśa

translations.griffith: Where those fine Birds hymn ceaselessly their portion of life eternal, and the sacred synods,  There is the Universe's mighty Keeper, who, wise, hath entered into me the simple.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन वर्क्षे मध्वदः सुपर्णा निविशन्ते सुवते चाधि विश्वे तस्येदाहुः पिप्पलं सवाद्वग्रे तन नोन नशद यःपितरं न वेद |||
verses.transliteration: yasmin vṛkṣe madhvadaḥ suparṇā niviśante suvate cādhi viśve tasyedāhuḥ pippalaṃ svādvaghre tan non naśad yaḥpitaraṃ na veda

translations.griffith: The, tree whereon the fine Birds eat the sweetness, where they all rest and procreate their offspring,—  Upon its top they say the fig is luscious: none gaineth it who knoweth not the Father.

verses.sanskrit: यद गायत्रे अधि गायत्रमाहितं तरैष्टुभाद वा तरैष्टुभं निरतक्षत यद वा जगज्जगत्याहितं पदं य इत तद विदुस्ते अम्र्तत्वमानशुः |||
verses.transliteration: yad ghāyatre adhi ghāyatramāhitaṃ traiṣṭubhād vā traiṣṭubhaṃ niratakṣata yad vā jaghajjaghatyāhitaṃ padaṃ ya it tad viduste amṛtatvamānaśuḥ

translations.griffith: How on the Gāyatrī the Gāyatrī was based, how from the Triṣṭup they fashioned the Triṣṭup forth,  How on the Jagatī was based the Jagatī,—they who know this have won themselves immortal life.

verses.sanskrit: गायत्रेण परति मिमीते अर्कमर्केण साम तरैष्टुभेन वाकम वाकेन वाकं दविपदा चतुष्पदाक्षरेण मिमते सप्त वाणीः |||
verses.transliteration: ghāyatreṇa prati mimīte arkamarkeṇa sāma traiṣṭubhena vākam vākena vākaṃ dvipadā catuṣpadākṣareṇa mimate sapta vāṇīḥ

translations.griffith: With Gāyatrī he measures out the praise-song, Sāma with praise-song, triplet with the Triṣṭup.  The triplet with the two or four-foot measure, and with the syllable they form seven metres.

verses.sanskrit: जगता सिन्धुं दिव्यस्थभायद रथन्तरे सूर्यं पर्यपश्यत गायत्रस्य समिधस्तिस्र आहुस्ततो मह्ना पर रिरिचे महित्वा |||
verses.transliteration: jaghatā sindhuṃ divyasthabhāyad rathantare sūryaṃ paryapaśyat ghāyatrasya samidhastisra āhustato mahnā pra ririce mahitvā

translations.griffith: With Jagatī the flood in heaven he stablished, and saw the Sun in the Rathantara Sāman.  Gāyatrī hath, they say, three brands for kindling: hence it excels in majesty and vigour.

verses.sanskrit: उप हवये सुदुघां धेनुमेतां सुहस्तो गोधुगुत दोहदेनाम शरेष्ठं सवं सविता साविषन नो.अभीद्धो घर्मस्तदु षु पर वोचम |||
verses.transliteration: upa hvaye sudughāṃ dhenumetāṃ suhasto ghodhughuta dohadenām śreṣṭhaṃ savaṃ savitā sāviṣan no.abhīddho gharmastadu ṣu pra vocam

translations.griffith: I invocate the milch-cow good for milking so that the milker, deft of hand, may drain her.  May Savitar give goodliest stimulation. The caldron is made hot; I will proclaim it.

verses.sanskrit: हिङकर्ण्वती वसुपत्नी वसूनां वत्समिछन्ती मनसाभ्यागात दुहामश्विभ्यां पयो अघ्न्येयं स वर्धतां महते सौभगाय |||
verses.transliteration: hiṅkṛṇvatī vasupatnī vasūnāṃ vatsamichantī manasābhyāghāt duhāmaśvibhyāṃ payo aghnyeyaṃ sa vardhatāṃ mahate saubhaghāya

translations.griffith: She, lady of all treasure, is come hither yearning in spirit for her calf and lowing.  May this cow yield her milk for both the Aśvins, and may she prosper to our high advantage.

verses.sanskrit: गौरमीमेदनु वत्सं मिषन्तं मूर्धानं हिंं अक्र्णोन मातवा उ सर्क्वाणं घर्ममभि वावशाना मिमाति मायुं पयते पयोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ghauramīmedanu vatsaṃ miṣantaṃ mūrdhānaṃ hiṃṃ akṛṇon mātavā u sṛkvāṇaṃ gharmamabhi vāvaśānā mimāti māyuṃ payate payobhiḥ

translations.griffith: The cow hath lowed after her blinking youngling; she licks his forehead, as she lows, to form it.  His mouth she fondly calls to her warm udder, and suckles him with milk while gently lowing.

verses.sanskrit: अयं स शिङकते येन गौरभीव्र्ता मिमाति मायुं धवसनावधि शरिता सा चित्तिभिर्नि हि चकार मर्त्यं विद्युद भवन्ती परति वव्रिमौहत |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ sa śiṅkte yena ghaurabhīvṛtā mimāti māyuṃ dhvasanāvadhi śritā sā cittibhirni hi cakāra martyaṃ vidyud bhavantī prati vavrimauhata

translations.griffith: He also snorts, by whom encompassed round the Cow laws as she clings unto the shedder of the rain.  She with her shrilling cries hath humbled mortal man, and, turned to lightning, hath stripped off her covering robe.

verses.sanskrit: अनच्छये तुरगातु जीवमेजद धरुवं मध्य आ पस्त्यानाम जीवो मर्तस्य चरति सवधाभिरमर्त्यो मर्त्येना सयोनिः |||
verses.transliteration: anacchaye turaghātu jīvamejad dhruvaṃ madhya ā pastyānām jīvo mṛtasya carati svadhābhiramartyo martyenā sayoniḥ

translations.griffith: That which hath breath and speed and life and motion lies firmly stablished in the midst of houses.  Living, by offerings to the Dead he moveth Immortal One, the brother of the mortal.

verses.sanskrit: अपश्यं गोपामनिपद्यमानमा च परा च पथिभिश्चरन्तम स सध्रीचीः स विशूचीर्वसान आ वरीवर्ति भुवनेष्वन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: apaśyaṃ ghopāmanipadyamānamā ca parā ca pathibhiścarantam sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viśūcīrvasāna ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣvantaḥ

translations.griffith: I saw the Herdsman, him who never stumbles, approaching by his pathways and departing.  He, clothed with gathered and diffusive splendour, within the worlds continually travels.

verses.sanskrit: य ईं चकार न सो अस्य वेद य ईं ददर्श हिरुगिन नुतस्मात स मातुर्योना परिवीतो अन्तर्बहुप्रजा निर्र्तिमा विवेश |||
verses.transliteration: ya īṃ cakāra na so asya veda ya īṃ dadarśa hirughin nutasmāt sa māturyonā parivīto antarbahuprajā nirṛtimā viveśa

translations.griffith: He who hath made him cloth not comprehend him: from him who saw him surely is he hidden.  He, yet enveloped in his Mother's bosom, source of much life, hath sunk into destruction.

verses.sanskrit: दयौर्मे पिता जनिता नाभिरत्र बन्धुर्मे माता पर्थिवीमहीयम उत्तानयोश्चम्वोर्योनिरन्तरत्रा पिता दुहितुर्गर्भमाधात |||
verses.transliteration: dyaurme pitā janitā nābhiratra bandhurme mātā pṛthivīmahīyam uttānayoścamvoryonirantaratrā pitā duhiturgharbhamādhāt

translations.griffith: Dyaus is my Father, my begetter: kinship is here. This great earth is my kin and Mother.  Between the wide-spread world-halves is the birth-place: the Father laid the Daughter's germ within it.

verses.sanskrit: पर्छामि तवा परमन्तं पर्थिव्याः पर्छामि यत्र भुवनस्यनाभिः पर्छामि तवा वर्ष्णो अश्वस्य रेतः पर्छामि वाचः परमं वयोम |||
verses.transliteration: pṛchāmi tvā paramantaṃ pṛthivyāḥ pṛchāmi yatra bhuvanasyanābhiḥ pṛchāmi tvā vṛṣṇo aśvasya retaḥ pṛchāmi vācaḥ paramaṃ vyoma

translations.griffith: I ask thee of the earth's extremest limit, where is the centre of the world, I ask thee.  I ask thee of the Stallion's seed prolific, I ask of highest heaven where Speech abideth.

verses.sanskrit: इयं वेदिः परो अन्तः पर्थिव्या अयं यज्ञो भुवनस्य नाभिः अयं सोमो वर्ष्णो अश्वस्य रेतो बरह्मायं वाचःपरमं वयोम |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ vediḥ paro antaḥ pṛthivyā ayaṃ yajño bhuvanasya nābhiḥ ayaṃ somo vṛṣṇo aśvasya reto brahmāyaṃ vācaḥparamaṃ vyoma

translations.griffith: This altar is the earth's extremest limit; this sacrifice of ours is the world's centre.  The Stallion's seed prolific is the Soma; this Brahman highest heaven where Speech abideth.

verses.sanskrit: सप्तार्धगर्भा भुवनस्य रेतो विष्णोस्तिष्ठन्ति परदिशाविधर्मणि ते धीतिभिर्मनसा ते विपश्चितः परिभुवः परि भवन्ति विश्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: saptārdhagharbhā bhuvanasya reto viṣṇostiṣṭhanti pradiśāvidharmaṇi te dhītibhirmanasā te vipaścitaḥ paribhuvaḥ pari bhavanti viśvataḥ

translations.griffith: Seven germs unripened yet are heaven's prolific seed: their functions they maintain by Viṣṇu's ordinance.  Endued with wisdom through intelligence and thought, they compass us about present on every side.

verses.sanskrit: अन वि जानामि यदिवेदमस्मि निण्यः संनद्धो मनसा चरामि यदा मागन परथमजा रतस्यादिद व[चो अश्नुवे भागमस्याः |||
verses.transliteration: an vi jānāmi yadivedamasmi niṇyaḥ saṃnaddho manasā carāmi yadā māghan prathamajā ṛtasyādid va[co aśnuve bhāghamasyāḥ

translations.griffith: What thing I truly am I know not clearly: mysterious, fettered in my mind I wander.  When the first-born of holy Law approached me, then of this speech I first obtain a portion.

verses.sanskrit: अपां परां एति सवधया गर्भीतो.अमर्त्यो मर्त्येना सयोनिः ता शश्वन्ता विषूचीना वियन्ता नयन्यं चिक्युर्न निचिक्युरन्यम |||
verses.transliteration: apāṃ prāṃ eti svadhayā ghṛbhīto.amartyo martyenā sayoniḥ tā śaśvantā viṣūcīnā viyantā nyanyaṃ cikyurna nicikyuranyam

translations.griffith: Back, forward goes he, grasped by strength inherent, the Immortal born the brother of the mortal  Ceaseless they move in opposite directions: men mark the one, and fail to mark the other.

verses.sanskrit: रचो अक्षरे परमे वयोमन यस्मिन देवा अधि विश्वे निषेदुः यस्तन न वेद किं रचा करिष्यति य इत तद विदुस्त इमे समासते |||
verses.transliteration: ṛco akṣare parame vyoman yasmin devā adhi viśve niṣeduḥ yastan na veda kiṃ ṛcā kariṣyati ya it tad vidusta ime samāsate

translations.griffith: Upon what syllable of holy praise-song, as twere their highest heaven, the Gods repose them,—  Who knows not this, what will he do with praise-song? But they who know it well sit here assembled.

verses.sanskrit: सूयवसाद भगवती हि भूया अथो वयं भगवन्तः सयाम अद्धि तर्णमघ्न्ये विश्वदानीं पिब शुद्धमुदकमाचरन्ती |||
verses.transliteration: sūyavasād bhaghavatī hi bhūyā atho vayaṃ bhaghavantaḥ syāma addhi tṛṇamaghnye viśvadānīṃ piba śuddhamudakamācarantī

translations.griffith: Fortunate  mayst thou be with goodly pasture, and may we also be exceeding wealthy.  Feed on the grass, O Cow, at every season, and coming hitherward drink limpid water.

verses.sanskrit: गौरीर्मिमाय सलिलानि तक्षत्येकपदी दविपदी सा चतुष्पदी अष्टापदी नवपदी बभूवुषी सहस्राक्षरा परमे वयोमन |||
verses.transliteration: ghaurīrmimāya salilāni takṣatyekapadī dvipadī sā catuṣpadī aṣṭāpadī navapadī babhūvuṣī sahasrākṣarā parame vyoman

translations.griffith: Forming the water-floods, the buffalo hath lowed, one-footed or two-footed or four-footed, she,  Who hath become eight-footed or hath got nine feet, the thousand-syllabled in the sublimest heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तस्याः समुद्रा अधि वि कषरन्ति तेन जीवन्ति परदिशश्चतस्रः ततः कषरत्यक्षरं तद विश्वमुप जीवति |||
verses.transliteration: tasyāḥ samudrā adhi vi kṣaranti tena jīvanti pradiśaścatasraḥ tataḥ kṣaratyakṣaraṃ tad viśvamupa jīvati

translations.griffith: From her descend in streams the seas of water; thereby the world's four regions have their being,  Thence flows the imperishable flood and thence the universe hath life.

verses.sanskrit: शकमयं धूममारादपश्यं विषूवता पर एनावरेण उक्षाणं पर्श्निमपचन्त वीरास्तानि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन |||
verses.transliteration: śakamayaṃ dhūmamārādapaśyaṃ viṣūvatā para enāvareṇa ukṣāṇaṃ pṛśnimapacanta vīrāstāni dharmāṇi prathamānyāsan

translations.griffith: I saw from far away the smoke of fuel with spires that rose on high o’er that beneath it.  The Mighty Men have dressed the spotted bullock. These were the customs in the days aforetime,

verses.sanskrit: तरयः केशिन रतुथा वि चक्षते संवत्सरे वपत एक एषाम विश्वमेको अभि चष्टे शचीभिर्ध्राजिरेकस्य दद्र्शेन रूपम |||
verses.transliteration: trayaḥ keśina ṛtuthā vi cakṣate saṃvatsare vapata eka eṣām viśvameko abhi caṣṭe śacībhirdhrājirekasya dadṛśena rūpam

translations.griffith: Three with long tresses show in ordered season. One of them sheareth when the year is ended.  One with his powers the universe regardeth: Of one, the sweep is seen, but his figure.

verses.sanskrit: चत्वारि वाक परिमिता पदानि तानि विदुर्ब्राह्मणा ये मनीषिणः गुहा तरीणि निहिता नेङगयन्ति तुरीयं वाचो मनुष्या वदन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: catvāri vāk parimitā padāni tāni vidurbrāhmaṇā ye manīṣiṇaḥ ghuhā trīṇi nihitā neṅghayanti turīyaṃ vāco manuṣyā vadanti

translations.griffith: Speech hath been measured out in four divisions, the Brahmans who have understanding know them.  Three kept in close concealment cause no motion; of speech, men speak only the fourth division.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणमग्निमाहुरथो दिव्यः स सुपर्णो गरुत्मान एकं सद विप्रा बहुधा वदन्त्यग्निं यमं मातरिश्वानमाहुः |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇamaghnimāhuratho divyaḥ sa suparṇo gharutmān ekaṃ sad viprā bahudhā vadantyaghniṃ yamaṃ mātariśvānamāhuḥ

translations.griffith: They call him Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa, Agni, and he is heavenly nobly-winged Garutmān.  To what is One, sages give many a title they call it Agni, Yama, Mātariśvan.

verses.sanskrit: कर्ष्णं नियानं हरयः सुपर्णा अपो वसाना दिवमुत पतन्ति त आवव्र्त्रन सदनाद रतस्यादिद घर्तेन पर्थिवी वयुद्यते |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṣṇaṃ niyānaṃ harayaḥ suparṇā apo vasānā divamut patanti ta āvavṛtran sadanād ṛtasyādid ghṛtena pṛthivī vyudyate

translations.griffith: Dark the descent: the birds are golden-coloured; up to the heaven they fly robed in the waters.  Again descend they from the seat of Order, and all the earth is moistened with their fatness.

verses.sanskrit: दवादश परधयश्चक्रमेकं तरीणि नभ्यानि क उ तच्चिकेत तस्मिन साकं तरिशता न शङकवो.अर्पिताः षष्टिर्न चलाचलासः |||
verses.transliteration: dvādaśa pradhayaścakramekaṃ trīṇi nabhyāni ka u tacciketa tasmin sākaṃ triśatā na śaṅkavo.arpitāḥ ṣaṣṭirna calācalāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Twelve are the fellies, and the wheel is single; three are the naves. What man hath understood it?  Therein are set together spokes three hundred and sixty, which in nowise can be loosened.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते सतनः शशयो यो मयोभूर्येन विश्वा पुष्यसि वार्याणि यो रत्नधा वसुविद यः सुदत्रः सरस्वति तमिह धातवे कः |||
verses.transliteration: yaste stanaḥ śaśayo yo mayobhūryena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi yo ratnadhā vasuvid yaḥ sudatraḥ sarasvati tamiha dhātave kaḥ

translations.griffith: That breast of thine exhaustless, spring of pleasure, wherewith thou feedest all things that are choicest,  Wealth-giver, treasure. finder, free bestower,—bring that, Sarasvatī, that we may drain it.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञेन यज्ञमयजन्त देवास्तनि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन ते ह नाकं महिमानः सचन्त यत्र पूर्वे साध्याः सन्ति देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: yajñena yajñamayajanta devāstani dharmāṇi prathamānyāsan te ha nākaṃ mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ

translations.griffith: By means of sacrifice the Gods accomplished their sacrifice: these were the earliest ordinances.  These Mighty Ones attained the height of heaven, there where the Sādhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: समानमेतदुदकमुच्चैत्यव चाहभिः भूमिं पर्जन्या जिन्वन्ति दिवं जिन्वन्त्यग्नयः |||
verses.transliteration: samānametadudakamuccaityava cāhabhiḥ bhūmiṃ parjanyā jinvanti divaṃ jinvantyaghnayaḥ

translations.griffith: Uniform, with the passing days, this water mounts and fails again.  The tempest-clouds give life to earth, and fires re-animate the heaven.

verses.sanskrit: दिव्यं सुपर्णं वायसं बर्हन्तमपां गर्भं दर्शतमोषधीनाम अभीपतो वर्ष्टिभिस्तर्पयन्तं सरस्वन्तमवसे जोहवीमि |||
verses.transliteration: divyaṃ suparṇaṃ vāyasaṃ bṛhantamapāṃ gharbhaṃ darśatamoṣadhīnām abhīpato vṛṣṭibhistarpayantaṃ sarasvantamavase johavīmi

translations.griffith: The Bird Celestial, vast with noble pinion, the lovely germ of plants, the germ of waters,  Him who delighteth us with rain in season, Sarasvān I invoke that he may help us.

verses.sanskrit: कया शुभा सवयसः सनीळाः समान्या मरुतः सं मिमिक्षुः कया मती कुत एतास एते.अर्चन्ति शुष्मं वर्षणो वसूया |||
verses.transliteration: kayā śubhā savayasaḥ sanīḷāḥ samānyā marutaḥ saṃ mimikṣuḥ kayā matī kuta etāsa ete.arcanti śuṣmaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasūyā

translations.griffith: WITH what bright beauty are the Maruts jointly invested, peers in age, who dwell together?  From what place have they come? With what intention? Sing they their strength through love of wealth, these Heroes?

verses.sanskrit: कस्य बरह्माणि जुजुषुर्युवानः को अध्वरे मरुत आ ववर्त शयेनानिव धरजतो अन्तरिक्षे केन महा मनसा रीरमाम |||
verses.transliteration: kasya brahmāṇi jujuṣuryuvānaḥ ko adhvare maruta ā vavarta śyenāniva dhrajato antarikṣe kena mahā manasā rīramāma

translations.griffith: Whose prayers have they, the Youthful Ones, accepted? Who to his sacrifice hath turned the Maruts?  We will delay them on their journey sweeping—with what high spirit!—through the air like eagles.

verses.sanskrit: कुतस्त्वमिन्द्र माहिनः सन्नेको यासि सत्पते किं त इत्था सं पर्छसे समराणः शुभानैर्वोचेस्तन नो हरिवो यत्ते अस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: kutastvamindra māhinaḥ sanneko yāsi satpate kiṃ ta itthā saṃ pṛchase samarāṇaḥ śubhānairvocestan no harivo yatte asme

translations.griffith: Whence comest thou alone, thou who art mighty, Indra, Lord of the Brave? What is thy purpose?  Thou greetest us when meeting us the Bright Ones. Lord of Bay Steeds, say what thou hast against us.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्माणि मे मतयः शं सुतासः शुष्म इयर्ति परभ्र्तो मे अद्रिः आ शासते परति हर्यन्त्युक्थेमा हरी वहतस्ता नो अछ |||
verses.transliteration: brahmāṇi me matayaḥ śaṃ sutāsaḥ śuṣma iyarti prabhṛto me adriḥ ā śāsate prati haryantyukthemā harī vahatastā no acha

translations.griffith: Mine are devotions, hymns; sweet are libations. Strength stirs, and hurled forth is my bolt of thunder.  They call for me, their lauds are longing for me. These my Bay Steeds bear me to these oblations.

verses.sanskrit: अतो वयमन्तमेभिर्युजानाः सवक्षत्रेभिस्तन्वः शुम्भमानाः महोभिरेतानुप युज्महे नविन्द्र सवधामनु हि नो बभूथ |||
verses.transliteration: ato vayamantamebhiryujānāḥ svakṣatrebhistanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ mahobhiretānupa yujmahe nvindra svadhāmanu hi no babhūtha

translations.griffith: Therefore together with our strong companions, having adorned our bodies, now we harness,  Our spotted deer with might, for thou, O Indra, hast learnt and understood our Godlike nature.

verses.sanskrit: कव सया वो मरुतः सवधासीद यन मामेकं समधत्ताहिहत्ये अहं हयूग्रस्तविषस्तुविष्मान विश्वस्य शत्रोरनमं वधस्नैः |||
verses.transliteration: kva syā vo marutaḥ svadhāsīd yan māmekaṃ samadhattāhihatye ahaṃ hyūghrastaviṣastuviṣmān viśvasya śatroranamaṃ vadhasnaiḥ

translations.griffith: Where was that nature then of yours, O Maruts, that ye charged me alone to slay the Dragon?  For I in truth am fierce and strong and mighty. I bent away from every foeman's weapons.

verses.sanskrit: भूरि चकर्थ युज्येभिरस्मे समानेभिर्व्र्षभ पौंस्येभिः भूरीणि हि कर्णवामा शविष्ठेन्द्र करत्वा मरुतो यद्वशाम |||
verses.transliteration: bhūri cakartha yujyebhirasme samānebhirvṛṣabha pauṃsyebhiḥ bhūrīṇi hi kṛṇavāmā śaviṣṭhendra kratvā maruto yadvaśāma

translations.griffith: Yea, much hast thou achieved with us for comrades, with manly valour like thine own, thou Hero.  Much may we too achieve, O mightiest Indra, with our great power, we Maruts, when we will it.

verses.sanskrit: वधीं वर्त्रं मरुत इन्द्रियेण सवेन भामेन तविषो बभूवान अहमेता मनवे विश्वश्चन्द्राः सुगा अपश्चकर वज्रबाहुः |||
verses.transliteration: vadhīṃ vṛtraṃ maruta indriyeṇa svena bhāmena taviṣo babhūvān ahametā manave viśvaścandrāḥ sughā apaścakara vajrabāhuḥ

translations.griffith: Vṛtra I slew by mine own strength, O Maruts, having waxed mighty in mine indignation.  I with the thunder in my hand created for man these lucid softly flowing waters.

verses.sanskrit: अनुत्तमा ते मघवन नकिर्नु न तवावानस्ति देवता विदानः न जायमानो नशते न जातो यानि करिष्या कर्णुहिप्रव्र्द्ध |||
verses.transliteration: anuttamā te maghavan nakirnu na tvāvānasti devatā vidānaḥ na jāyamāno naśate na jāto yāni kariṣyā kṛṇuhipravṛddha

translations.griffith: Nothing, O Maghavan, stands firm before thee; among the Gods not one is found thine equal.  None born or springing into life comes nigh thee. Do what thou hast to do, exceeding mighty?

verses.sanskrit: एकस्य चिन मे विभ्वस्त्वोजो या नु दध्र्ष्वान कर्णवै मनीषा अहं हयूग्रो मरुतो विदानो यानि चयवमिन्द्र इदीश एषाम |||
verses.transliteration: ekasya cin me vibhvastvojo yā nu dadhṛṣvān kṛṇavai manīṣā ahaṃ hyūghro maruto vidāno yāni cyavamindra idīśa eṣām

translations.griffith: Mine only be transcendent power, whatever I, daring in my spirit, may accomplish.  For I am known as terrible, O Maruts I, Indra, am the Lord of what I ruined.

verses.sanskrit: अमन्दन मा मरुत सतोमो अत्र यन मे नरः शरुत्यं बरह्म चक्र इन्द्राय वर्ष्णे सुमखाय मह्यं सख्ये सखायस्तन्वेतनूभिः |||
verses.transliteration: amandan mā maruta stomo atra yan me naraḥ śrutyaṃ brahma cakra indrāya vṛṣṇe sumakhāya mahyaṃ sakhye sakhāyastanvetanūbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Now, O ye Maruts, hath your praise rejoiced me, the glorious hymn which ye have made me, Heroes!  For me, for Indra, champion strong in battle, for me, yourselves, as lovers for a lover.

verses.sanskrit: एवेदेते परति मा रोचमाना अनेद्यः शरव एषो दधानाः संचक्ष्या मरुतश्चन्द्रवर्णा अछान्त मे छदयाथा चनूनम |||
verses.transliteration: evedete prati mā rocamānā anedyaḥ śrava eṣo dadhānāḥ saṃcakṣyā marutaścandravarṇā achānta me chadayāthā canūnam

translations.griffith: Here, truly, they send forth their sheen to meet me, wearing their blameless glory and their vigour.  When I have seen you, Maruts, in gay splendour, ye have delighted me, so now delight me.

verses.sanskrit: को नवत्र मरुतो मामहे वः पर यातन सखीन्रछा सखायः मन्मानि चित्रा अपिवातयन्त एषां भूत नवेदा म रतानाम |||
verses.transliteration: ko nvatra maruto māmahe vaḥ pra yātana sakhīnrachā sakhāyaḥ manmāni citrā apivātayanta eṣāṃ bhūta navedā ma ṛtānām

translations.griffith: Who here hath magnified you, O ye Maruts? speed forward, O ye lovers, to your lovers.  Ye Radiant Ones, assisting their devotions, of these my holy rites he ye regardful.

verses.sanskrit: आ यद दुवस्याद दुवसे न कारुरस्माञ्चक्रे मान्यस्य मेधा ओ षु वर्त्त मरुतो विप्रमछेमा बरह्माणि जरिता वोर्चत |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad duvasyād duvase na kārurasmāñcakre mānyasya medhā o ṣu vartta maruto vipramachemā brahmāṇi jaritā voarcat

translations.griffith: To this hath Mānya's wisdom brought us, so as to aid, as aids the poet him who worships.  Bring hither quick! On to the sage, ye Maruts! These prayers for you the singer hath recited.

verses.sanskrit: एष व सतोमो मरुत इयं गीर्मान्दार्यस्य मान्यस्य करोः एषा यासीष्ट तन्वे वयां विद्यामेषं वर्जनं जीरदानुम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa va stomo maruta iyaṃ ghīrmāndāryasya mānyasya karoḥ eṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayāṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum

translations.griffith: May this your praise, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Māna's son, Māndārya,  Bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance!

verses.sanskrit: तन नु वोचाम रभसाय जन्मने पूर्वं महित्वं वर्षभस्यकेतवे ऐधेव यामन मरुतस्तुविष्वणो युधेव शक्रास्तविषाणि कर्तन |||
verses.transliteration: tan nu vocāma rabhasāya janmane pūrvaṃ mahitvaṃ vṛṣabhasyaketave aidheva yāman marutastuviṣvaṇo yudheva śakrāstaviṣāṇi kartana

translations.griffith: Now let us publish, for the vigorous company the herald of the Strong One, their primeval might.  With fire upon your way, O Maruts loud of voice, with battle, Mighty Ones, achieve your deeds of strength.

verses.sanskrit: नित्यं न सूनुं मधु बिभ्रत उप करीळन्ति करीळा विदथेषु घर्ष्वयः नक्षन्ति रुद्रा अवसा नमस्विनं न मर्धन्ति सवतवसो हविष्क्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: nityaṃ na sūnuṃ madhu bibhrata upa krīḷanti krīḷā vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ nakṣanti rudrā avasā namasvinaṃ na mardhanti svatavaso haviṣkṛtam

translations.griffith: Bringing the pleasant meath as ’twere their own dear son, they sport in sportive wise gay at their gatherings.  The Rudras come with succour to the worshipper; self-strong they fail not him who offers sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मा ऊमासो अम्र्ता अरासत रायस पोषं च हविषा ददाशुषे उक्षन्त्यस्मै मरुतो हिता इव पुरू रजांसि पयसा मयोभुवः |||
verses.transliteration: yasmā ūmāso amṛtā arāsata rāyas poṣaṃ ca haviṣā dadāśuṣe ukṣantyasmai maruto hitā iva purū rajāṃsi payasā mayobhuvaḥ

translations.griffith: To whomsoever, bringer of oblations, they immortal guardians, have given plenteous wealth,  For him, like loving friends, the Maruts bringing bliss bedew the regions round with milk abundantly.

verses.sanskrit: आ ये रजांसि तविषीभिरव्यत पर व एवासः सवयतासोध्रजन भयन्ते विश्वा भुवनानि हर्म्या चित्रो वो यामःप्रयतास्व रष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: ā ye rajāṃsi taviṣībhiravyata pra va evāsaḥ svayatāsoadhrajan bhayante viśvā bhuvanāni harmyā citro vo yāmaḥprayatāsv ṛṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: Ye who with mighty powers have stirred the regions up, your coursers have sped forth directed by themselves.  All creatures of the earth, all dwellings are afraid, for brilliant is your coming with your spears advanced.

verses.sanskrit: यत तवेषयामा नदयन्त पर्वतान दिवो वा पर्ष्ठं नर्याचुच्यवुः विश्वो वो अज्मन भयते वनस्पती रथीयन्तीवप्र जिहीत ओषधिः |||
verses.transliteration: yat tveṣayāmā nadayanta parvatān divo vā pṛṣṭhaṃ naryāacucyavuḥ viśvo vo ajman bhayate vanaspatī rathīyantīvapra jihīta oṣadhiḥ

translations.griffith: When they in dazzling rush have made the mountains roar, and shaken heaven's high back in their heroic strength,  Each sovran of the forest fears as ye drive near, aid the shrubs fly before you swift as whirling wheels.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं न उग्रा मरुतः सुचेतुनारिष्टग्रामाः सुमतिं पिपर्तन यत्रा वो दिद्युद रदति करिविर्दती रिणाति पश्वः सुधितेव बर्हणा |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ na ughrā marutaḥ sucetunāriṣṭaghrāmāḥ sumatiṃ pipartana yatrā vo didyud radati krivirdatī riṇāti paśvaḥ sudhiteva barhaṇā

translations.griffith: Terrible Maruts, ye with ne’er-diminished host, with great benevolence fulfil our heart's desire.  Where’er your lightning bites armed with its gory teeth it crunches up the cattle like a well-aimed dart.

verses.sanskrit: पर सकम्भदेष्णा अनवभ्रराधसो.अलात्र्णासो विदथेषु सुष्टुताः अर्चन्त्यर्कं मदिरस्य पीतये विदुर्वीरस्य परथमानि पौंस्या |||
verses.transliteration: pra skambhadeṣṇā anavabhrarādhaso.alātṛṇāso vidatheṣu suṣṭutāḥ arcantyarkaṃ madirasya pītaye vidurvīrasya prathamāni pauṃsyā

translations.griffith: Givers of during gifts whose bounties never fail, free from ill-will, at sacrifices glorified,  They sing their song aloud that they may drink sweet juice: well do they know the Hero's first heroic deeds.

verses.sanskrit: शतभुजिभिस्तमभिह्रुतेरघात पूर्भी रक्षता मरुतो यमावत जनं यमुग्रास्तवसो विरप्शिनः पाथना शंसात तनयस्य पुष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: śatabhujibhistamabhihruteraghāt pūrbhī rakṣatā maruto yamāvata janaṃ yamughrāstavaso virapśinaḥ pāthanā śaṃsāt tanayasya puṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: With castles hundredfold, O Maruts, guard ye well the man whom ye have loved from ruin and from sin,—  The man whom ye the fierce, the Mighty ones who roar, preserve from calumny by cherishing his seed.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वानि भद्रा मरुतो रथेषु वो मिथस्प्र्ध्येव तविषाण्याहिता अंसेष्वा वः परपथेषु खादयो.अक्षो वश्चक्रा समया वि वाव्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāni bhadrā maruto ratheṣu vo mithaspṛdhyeva taviṣāṇyāhitā aṃseṣvā vaḥ prapatheṣu khādayo.akṣo vaścakrā samayā vi vāvṛte

translations.griffith: O Maruts, in your cars are all things that are good: great powers are set as ’twere in rivalry therein.  Rings are upon your shoulders when ye journey forth: your axle turns together both the chariot wheels.

verses.sanskrit: भूरीणि भद्रा नर्येषु बाहुषु वक्षस्सु रुक्मा रभसासो अञ्जयः अंसेष्वेताः पविषु कषुरा अधि वयो न पक्षान वयनु शरियो धिरे |||
verses.transliteration: bhūrīṇi bhadrā naryeṣu bāhuṣu vakṣassu rukmā rabhasāso añjayaḥ aṃseṣvetāḥ paviṣu kṣurā adhi vayo na pakṣān vyanu śriyo dhire

translations.griffith: Held in your manly arms are many goodly things, gold chains are on your chests, and glistering ornaments,  Deer-skins are on their shoulders, on their fellies knives: they spread their glory out as birds spread out their wings.

verses.sanskrit: महान्तो मह्ना विभ्वो विभूतयो दूरेद्र्शो ये दिव्या इव सत्र्भिः मन्द्राः सुजिह्वाः सवरितार आसभिः सम्मिश्ला इन्द्रे मरुतः परिष्टुभः |||
verses.transliteration: mahānto mahnā vibhvo vibhūtayo dūredṛśo ye divyā iva stṛbhiḥ mandrāḥ sujihvāḥ svaritāra āsabhiḥ sammiślā indre marutaḥ pariṣṭubhaḥ

translations.griffith: Mighty in mightiness, pervading, passing strong, visible from afar as ’twere with stars of heaven,  Lovely with pleasant tongues, sweet singers with their mouths, the Maruts, joined with Indra, shout forth all around.

verses.sanskrit: तद वः सुजाता मरुतो महित्वनं दीर्घं वो दात्रमदितेरिव वरतम इन्द्रश्चन तयजसा वि हरुणाति तज्जनाय यस्मै सुक्र्ते अराध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: tad vaḥ sujātā maruto mahitvanaṃ dīrghaṃ vo dātramaditeriva vratam indraścana tyajasā vi hruṇāti tajjanāya yasmai sukṛte arādhvam

translations.griffith: This is your majesty, ye Maruts nobly born, far as the sway of Aditi your bounty spreads.  Even Indra by desertion never disannuls the boon bestowed by you upon the pious man.

verses.sanskrit: तद वो जामित्वं मरुतः परे युगे पुरू यच्छंसमम्र्तासावत अया धिया मनवे शरुष्टिमाव्या साकं नरो दंसनैरा चिकित्रिरे |||
verses.transliteration: tad vo jāmitvaṃ marutaḥ pare yughe purū yacchaṃsamamṛtāsaāvata ayā dhiyā manave śruṣṭimāvyā sākaṃ naro daṃsanairā cikitrire

translations.griffith: This is your kinship, Maruts, that, Immortals, ye were oft in olden time regardful of our call,  Having vouchsafed to man a hearing through this prayer, by wondrous deeds the Heroes have displayed their might.

verses.sanskrit: येन दीर्घं मरुतः शूशवाम युष्माकेन परीणसा तुरासः आ यत ततनन वर्जने जनास एभिर्यज्ञेभिस्तदभीष्टिमश्याम |||
verses.transliteration: yena dīrghaṃ marutaḥ śūśavāma yuṣmākena parīṇasā turāsaḥ ā yat tatanan vṛjane janāsa ebhiryajñebhistadabhīṣṭimaśyām

translations.griffith: That, O ye Maruts, we may long time flourish through your abundant riches, O swift movers,  And that our men may spread in the encampment, let me complete the rite with these oblations.

verses.sanskrit: एष व सतोमो ... ||
verses.transliteration: eṣa va stomo ...

translations.griffith: May this your laud, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Māna's son, Māndārya,  Bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रं त इन्द्रोतयो नः सहस्रमिषो हरिवो गूर्ततमाः सहस्रं रायो मादयध्यै सहस्रिण उप नो यन्तु वाजाः |||
verses.transliteration: sahasraṃ ta indrotayo naḥ sahasramiṣo harivo ghūrtatamāḥ sahasraṃ rāyo mādayadhyai sahasriṇa upa no yantu vājāḥ

translations.griffith: A THOUSAND are thy helps for us, O Indra: a thousand, Lord of Bays, thy choice refreshments.  Wealth of a thousand sorts hast thou to cheer us: may precious goods come nigh to us in thousands.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो.अवोभिर्मरुतो यान्त्वछा जयेष्ठेभिर्वा बर्हद्दिवैःसुमायाः अध यदेषां नियुतः परमाः समुद्रस्य चिद्धनयन्त पारे |||
verses.transliteration: ā no.avobhirmaruto yāntvachā jyeṣṭhebhirvā bṛhaddivaiḥsumāyāḥ adha yadeṣāṃ niyutaḥ paramāḥ samudrasya ciddhanayanta pāre

translations.griffith: May the most sapient Maruts, with protection, with best boons brought from lofty heaven, approach us,  Now when their team of the most noble horses speeds even on the sea's extremest limit.

verses.sanskrit: मिम्यक्ष येषु सुधिता घर्ताची हिरण्यनिर्णिगुपरा न रष्टिः गुहा चरन्ती मनुषो न योषा सभावती विदथ्येव सं वाक |||
verses.transliteration: mimyakṣa yeṣu sudhitā ghṛtācī hiraṇyanirṇighuparā na ṛṣṭiḥ ghuhā carantī manuṣo na yoṣā sabhāvatī vidathyeva saṃ vāk

translations.griffith: Close to them clings one moving in seclusion, like a man's wife, like a spear carried rearward,  Well grasped, bright, decked with gold there is Vāk also, like to a courtly, eloquent dame, among them.

verses.sanskrit: परा शुभ्रा अयासो यव्या साधारण्येव मरुतो मिमिक्षुः न रोदसी अप नुदन्त घोरा जुषन्त वर्धं सख्याय देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: parā śubhrā ayāso yavyā sādhāraṇyeva maruto mimikṣuḥ na rodasī apa nudanta ghorā juṣanta vṛdhaṃ sakhyāya devāḥ

translations.griffith: Far off the brilliant, never-weary Maruts cling to the young Maid as a joint possession.  The fierce Gods drave not Rodasī before them, but wished for her to grow their friend and fellow.

verses.sanskrit: जोषद यदीमसुर्या सचध्यै विषितस्तुका रोदसी नर्मणाः आ सूर्येव विधतो रथं गात तवेषप्रतीका नभसो नेत्या |||
verses.transliteration: joṣad yadīmasuryā sacadhyai viṣitastukā rodasī nṛmaṇāḥ ā sūryeva vidhato rathaṃ ghāt tveṣapratīkā nabhaso netyā

translations.griffith: When chose immortal Rodasī to follow—she with loose tresses and heroic spirit—  She climbed her servant's chariot, she like Sūrya with cloud-like motion and refulgent aspect.

verses.sanskrit: आस्थापयन्त युवतिं युवानः शुभे निमिष्लां विदथेषुपज्राम अर्को यद वो मरुतो हविष्मान गायद गाथं सुतसोमो दुवस्यन |||
verses.transliteration: āsthāpayanta yuvatiṃ yuvānaḥ śubhe nimiṣlāṃ vidatheṣupajrām arko yad vo maruto haviṣmān ghāyad ghāthaṃ sutasomo duvasyan

translations.griffith: Upon their car the young men set the Maiden wedded to glory, mighty in assemblies,  When your song, Maruts, rose, and, with oblation, the Soma-pourer sang his hymn in worship.

verses.sanskrit: परतं विवक्मि वक्म्यो य एषां मरुतां महिमा सत्यो अस्ति सचा यदीं वर्षमणा अहंयु सथिरा चिज्जनीर्वहते सुभागाः |||
verses.transliteration: prataṃ vivakmi vakmyo ya eṣāṃ marutāṃ mahimā satyo asti sacā yadīṃ vṛṣamaṇā ahaṃyu sthirā cijjanīrvahate subhāghāḥ

translations.griffith: I will declare the greatness of these Maruts, their real greatness, worthy to be lauded,  How, with them, she though firm, strong-minded, haughty, travels to women happy in their fortune.

verses.sanskrit: पान्ति मित्रावरुणाववद्याच्चयत ईमर्यमो अप्रशस्तान उत चयवन्ते अच्युता धरुवाणि वाव्र्ध ईं मरुतो दातिवारः |||
verses.transliteration: pānti mitrāvaruṇāvavadyāccayata īmaryamo apraśastān uta cyavante acyutā dhruvāṇi vāvṛdha īṃ maruto dātivāraḥ

translations.griffith: Mitra and Varuṇa they guard from censure: Aryaman too, discovers worthless sinners Firm things are overthrown that ne’er were shaken: he prospers, Maruts, who gives choice oblations.

verses.sanskrit: नही नु वो मरुतो अन्त्यस्मे आरात्ताच्चिच्छवसो अन्तमापुः ते धर्ष्णुना शवसा शूशुवांसो.अर्णो न दवेषो धर्षता परि षठुः |||
verses.transliteration: nahī nu vo maruto antyasme ārāttāccicchavaso antamāpuḥ te dhṛṣṇunā śavasā śūśuvāṃso.arṇo na dveṣo dhṛṣatā pari ṣṭhuḥ

translations.griffith: None of us, Maruts, near or at a distance, hath ever reached the limit of your vigour.  They in courageous might still waxing boldly have compassed round their foemen like an ocean.

verses.sanskrit: वयमद्येन्द्रस्य परेष्ठा वयं शवो वोचेमहि समर्ये वयं पुरा महि च नो अनु दयून तन न रभुक्षा नरामनु षयात |||
verses.transliteration: vayamadyendrasya preṣṭhā vayaṃ śvo vocemahi samarye vayaṃ purā mahi ca no anu dyūn tan na ṛbhukṣā narāmanu ṣyāt

translations.griffith: May we this day be dearest friends of Indra, and let us call on him in fight to-morrow.  So were we erst. New might attend us daily! So be with us! Ṛbhukṣan of the Heroes!

verses.sanskrit: एष व सतोमो ... ||
verses.transliteration: eṣa va stomo ...

translations.griffith: May this your laud, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Māna's son, Māndārya,  Bring offspring for ourselves with. food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञा-यज्ञा वः समना तुतुर्वणिर्धियं-धियं वो देवया उ दधिध्वे आ वो.अर्वाचः सुविताय रोदस्योर्महे वव्र्त्यामवसे सुव्र्क्तिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yajñā-yajñā vaḥ samanā tuturvaṇirdhiyaṃ-dhiyaṃ vo devayā u dadhidhve ā vo.arvācaḥ suvitāya rodasyormahe vavṛtyāmavase suvṛktibhiḥ

translations.griffith: SWIFT gain is his who hath you near at every rite: ye welcome every song of him who serves the Gods.  So may I turn you hither with fair hymns of praise to give great succour for the weal of both the worlds.

verses.sanskrit: वव्रासो न ये सवजाः सवतवस इषं सवरभिजायन्त धूतयः सहस्रियासो अपां नोर्मय आसा गावो वन्द्यासो नोक्षणः |||
verses.transliteration: vavrāso na ye svajāḥ svatavasa iṣaṃ svarabhijāyanta dhūtayaḥ sahasriyāso apāṃ normaya āsā ghāvo vandyāso nokṣaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Surrounding, as it were, self-born, self-powerful, they spring to life the shakers-down of food and light;  Like as the countess undulations of the floods, worthy of praise when near, like bullocks and like kine.

verses.sanskrit: सोमासो न ये सुतास्त्र्प्तांशवो हर्त्सु पीतासो दुवसो नासते ऐषामंसेषु रम्भिणीव रारभे हस्तेषु खादिश्चक्र्तिश्च सं दधे |||
verses.transliteration: somāso na ye sutāstṛptāṃśavo hṛtsu pītāso duvaso nāsate aiṣāmaṃseṣu rambhiṇīva rārabhe hasteṣu khādiścakṛtiśca saṃ dadhe

translations.griffith: They who, like Somas with their well-grown stalks pressed out, imbibed within the heart, dwell there in friendly wise.  Upon their shoulders rests as ’twere a warrior's spear and in their hand they hold a dagger and a ring.

verses.sanskrit: अव सवयुक्ता दिव आ वर्था ययुरमर्त्याः कशया चोदत तमना अरेणवस्तुविजाता अचुच्यवुर्द्र्ळ्हानि चिन मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: ava svayuktā diva ā vṛthā yayuramartyāḥ kaśayā codata tmanā areṇavastuvijātā acucyavurdṛḷhāni cin maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Self-yoked they have descended lightly from the sky. With your own lash, Immortals, urge yourselves to speed.  Unstained by dust the Maruts, mighty in their strength, have cast down e’en firm things, armed with their shining spears.

verses.sanskrit: को वो.अन्तर्मरुत रष्टिविद्युतो रेजति तमना हन्वेव जिह्वया धन्वच्युत इषां न यामनि पुरुप्रैषा अहन्यो नैतशः |||
verses.transliteration: ko vo.antarmaruta ṛṣṭividyuto rejati tmanā hanveva jihvayā dhanvacyuta iṣāṃ na yāmani purupraiṣā ahanyo naitaśaḥ

translations.griffith: Who among you, O Maruts armed with lightning-spears, moveth you by himself, as with the tongue his jaws?  Ye rush from heaven's floor as though ye sought for food, on many errands like the Sun's diurnal Steed.

verses.sanskrit: कव सविदस्य रजसो महस परं कवावरं मरुतो यस्मिन्नायय यच्च्यावयथ विथुरेव संहितं वयद्रिणा पतथ तवेषमर्णवम |||
verses.transliteration: kva svidasya rajaso mahas paraṃ kvāvaraṃ maruto yasminnāyaya yaccyāvayatha vithureva saṃhitaṃ vyadriṇā patatha tveṣamarṇavam

translations.griffith: Say where, then, is this mighty region's farthest bound, where, Maruts, is the lowest depth that ye have reached,  When ye cast down like chaff the firmly stablished pile, and from the mountain send the glittering water-flood?

verses.sanskrit: सातिर्न वो.अमवती सवर्वती तवेषा विपाका मरुतः पिपिष्वती भद्रा वो रातिः पर्णतो न दक्षिणा पर्थुज्रयी असुर्येव जञ्जती |||
verses.transliteration: sātirna vo.amavatī svarvatī tveṣā vipākā marutaḥ pipiṣvatī bhadrā vo rātiḥ pṛṇato na dakṣiṇā pṛthujrayī asuryeva jañjatī

translations.griffith: Your winning is with strength, dazzling, with heavenly light, with fruit mature, O Maruts, fall of plenteousness.  Auspicious is your gift like a free giver's meed, victorious, spreading far, as of immortal Gods.

verses.sanskrit: परति षटोभन्ति सिन्धवः पविभ्यो यदभ्रियां वाचमुदीरयन्ति अव समयन्त विद्युतः पर्थिव्यां यदी घर्तं मरुतः परुष्णुवन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: prati ṣṭobhanti sindhavaḥ pavibhyo yadabhriyāṃ vācamudīrayanti ava smayanta vidyutaḥ pṛthivyāṃ yadī ghṛtaṃ marutaḥ pruṣṇuvanti

translations.griffith: The rivers roar before your chariot fellies when they are uttering the voice of rain-clouds.  The lightnings laugh upon the earth beneath them, what time the Maruts scatter forth their fatness.

verses.sanskrit: असूत पर्श्निर्महते रणाय तवेषमयासां मरुतामनीकम ते सप्सरासो.अजनयन्ताभ्वमादित सवधामिषिरां पर्यपश्यन |||
verses.transliteration: asūta pṛśnirmahate raṇāya tveṣamayāsāṃ marutāmanīkam te sapsarāso.ajanayantābhvamādit svadhāmiṣirāṃ paryapaśyan

translations.griffith: Pṛśni brought forth, to fight the mighty battle, the glittering army of the restless Maruts.  Nurtured together they begat the monster, and then looked round them for the food that strengthens.

verses.sanskrit: एष व सतोमो ... ||
verses.transliteration: eṣa va stomo ...

translations.griffith: May this your laud, may this your song O Maruts, sung by the poet Māna's son, Māndārya,  Bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: महश्चित तवमिन्द्र यत एतान महश्चिदसि तयजसो वरूता स नो वेधो मरुतां चिकित्वान सुम्ना वनुष्व तव हि परेष्ठा |||
verses.transliteration: mahaścit tvamindra yata etān mahaścidasi tyajaso varūtā sa no vedho marutāṃ cikitvān sumnā vanuṣva tava hi preṣṭhā

translations.griffith: As, Indra, from great treason thou protectest, yea, from great treachery these who approach us,  So, marking well, Controller of the Maruts grant us their blessings, for they are thy dearest.

verses.sanskrit: अयुज्रन त इन्द्र विश्वक्र्ष्टीर्विदानासो निष्षिधो मर्त्यत्रा मरुतां पर्त्सुतिर्हासमाना सवर्मीळ्हस्य परधनस्य सातौ |||
verses.transliteration: ayujran ta indra viśvakṛṣṭīrvidānāso niṣṣidho martyatrā marutāṃ pṛtsutirhāsamānā svarmīḷhasya pradhanasya sātau

translations.griffith: The various doings of all mortal people by thee are ordered, in thy wisdom, Indra.  The host of Maruts goeth forth exulting to win the light-bestowing spoil of battle.

verses.sanskrit: अम्यक सा त इन्द्र रष्टिरस्मे सनेम्यभ्वं मरुतो जुनन्ति अग्निश्चिद धि षमातसे शुशुक्वानापो न दवीपं दधतिप्रयांसि |||
verses.transliteration: amyak sā ta indra ṛṣṭirasme sanemyabhvaṃ maruto junanti aghniścid dhi ṣmātase śuśukvānāpo na dvīpaṃ dadhatiprayāṃsi

translations.griffith: That spear of thine sat firm for us, O Indra: the Maruts set their whole dread power in motion.  E’en Agni shines resplendent in the brush-wood: the viands hold him as floods hold an island.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तू न इन्द्र तं रयिं दा ओजिष्ठया दक्षिणयेव रातिम सतुतश्च यास्ते चकनन्त वायो सतनं न मध्वःपीपयन्त वाजैः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tū na indra taṃ rayiṃ dā ojiṣṭhayā dakṣiṇayeva rātim stutaśca yāste cakananta vāyo stanaṃ na madhvaḥpīpayanta vājaiḥ

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe us now that opulence, O Indra, as guerdon won by mightiest donation.  May hymns that please thee cause the breast of Vāyu to swell as with the mead's refreshing sweetness.

verses.sanskrit: तवे राय इन्द्र तोशतमाः परणेतारः कस्य चिद रतायोः ते षु णो मरुतो मर्ळयन्तु ये समा पुरा गातूयन्तीव देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: tve rāya indra tośatamāḥ praṇetāraḥ kasya cid ṛtāyoḥ te ṣu ṇo maruto mṛḷayantu ye smā purā ghātūyantīva devāḥ

translations.griffith: With thee, O Indra, are most bounteous riches that further every one who lives uprightly.  Now may these Maruts show us loving-kindness, Gods who of old were ever prompt to help us.

verses.sanskrit: परति पर याहीन्द्र मीळ्हुषो नॄन महः पार्थिवे सदने यतस्व अध यदेषां पर्थुबुध्नास एतास्तीर्थे नार्यः पौंस्यानि तस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: prati pra yāhīndra mīḷhuṣo nṝn mahaḥ pārthive sadane yatasva adha yadeṣāṃ pṛthubudhnāsa etāstīrthe nāryaḥ pauṃsyāni tasthuḥ

translations.griffith: Bring forth the Men who rain down boons, O Indra: exert thee in the great terrestrial region;  For their broad-chested speckled deer are standing like a King's armies on the field of battle.

verses.sanskrit: परति घोराणामेतानामयासां मरुतां शर्ण्व आयतामुपब्दिः ये मर्त्यं पर्तनायन्तमूमैर्र्णावानं न पतयन्त सर्गैः |||
verses.transliteration: prati ghorāṇāmetānāmayāsāṃ marutāṃ śṛṇva āyatāmupabdiḥ ye martyaṃ pṛtanāyantamūmairṛṇāvānaṃ na patayanta sarghaiḥ

translations.griffith: Heard is the roar of the advancing Maruts, terrific, glittering, and swiftly moving,  Who with their rush o’erthrow as ’twere a sinner the mortal who would fight with those who love him

verses.sanskrit: तवं मानेभ्य इन्द्र विश्वजन्या रदा मरुद्भिः शुरुधो गोग्राः सतवानेभि सतवसे देव देवैर्विद्यामेषं वर्जनं जीरदानुम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ mānebhya indra viśvajanyā radā marudbhiḥ śurudho ghoaghrāḥ stavānebhi stavase deva devairvidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum

translations.griffith: Give to the Mānas, Indra with Maruts, gifts universal, gifts of cattle foremost.  Thou, God, art praised with Gods who must be lauded. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: न नूनमस्ति नो शवः कस्तद वेद यदद्भुतम अन्यस्यचित्तमभि संचरेण्यमुताधीतं वि नश्यति |||
verses.transliteration: na nūnamasti no śvaḥ kastad veda yadadbhutam anyasyacittamabhi saṃcareṇyamutādhītaṃ vi naśyati

translations.griffith: NAUGHT is to-day, to-morrow naught. Who comprehends the mystery?  We must address ourselves unto another's thought, and lost is then the hope we formed.

verses.sanskrit: किं न इन्द्र जिघांससि भरातरो मरुतस्तव तेभिः कल्पस्व साधुया मा नः समरणे वधीः |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ na indra jighāṃsasi bhrātaro marutastava tebhiḥ kalpasva sādhuyā mā naḥ samaraṇe vadhīḥ

translations.griffith: The Maruts are thy brothers. Why, O Indra, wouldst thou take our lives?  Agree with them in friendly wise, and do not slay us in the fight.

verses.sanskrit: किं नो भरातरगस्त्य सखा सन्नति मन्यसे विद्मा हि तेयथा मनो.अस्मभ्यमिन न दित्ससि |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ no bhrātaraghastya sakhā sannati manyase vidmā hi teyathā mano.asmabhyamin na ditsasi

translations.griffith: Agastya, brother, why dost thou neglect us, thou who art our friend?  We know the nature of thy mind. Verity thou wilt give us naught.

verses.sanskrit: अरं कर्ण्वन्तु वेदिं समग्निमिन्धतां पुरः तत्राम्र्तस्य चेतनं यज्ञं ते तनवावहै |||
verses.transliteration: araṃ kṛṇvantu vediṃ samaghnimindhatāṃ puraḥ tatrāmṛtasya cetanaṃ yajñaṃ te tanavāvahai

translations.griffith: Let them prepare the altar, let them kindle fire in front: we two  Here will spread sacrifice for thee, that the Immortal may observe.

verses.sanskrit: तवमीशिषे वसुपते वसूनां तवं मित्राणां मित्रपते धेष्ठः इन्द्र तवं मरुद्भिः सं वदस्वाध पराशान रतुथा हवींषि |||
verses.transliteration: tvamīśiṣe vasupate vasūnāṃ tvaṃ mitrāṇāṃ mitrapate dheṣṭhaḥ indra tvaṃ marudbhiḥ saṃ vadasvādha prāśāna ṛtuthā havīṃṣi

translations.griffith: Thou, Lord of Wealth, art Master of all treasures, thou, Lord of friends, art thy friends' best supporter.  O Indra, speak thou kindly with the Maruts, and taste oblations in their proper season.

verses.sanskrit: परति व एना नमसाहमेमि सूक्तेन भिक्षे सुमतिं तुराणाम रराणता मरुतो वेद्याभिर्नि हेळो धत्त वि मुचध्वमश्वान |||
verses.transliteration: prati va enā namasāhamemi sūktena bhikṣe sumatiṃ turāṇām rarāṇatā maruto vedyābhirni heḷo dhatta vi mucadhvamaśvān

translations.griffith: To you I come with this mine adoration, and with a hymn I crave the Strong Ones' favour  A hymn that truly makes you joyful, Maruts. Suppress your anger and unyoke your horses.

verses.sanskrit: एष व सतोमो मरुतो नमस्वान हर्दा तष्टो मनसा धायि देवाः उपेमा यात मनसा जुषाणा यूयं हि षठा नमस इद वर्धासः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa va stomo maruto namasvān hṛdā taṣṭo manasā dhāyi devāḥ upemā yāta manasā juṣāṇā yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā namasa id vṛdhāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Maruts, to you this laud with prayer and worship, formed in the mind and heart, ye Gods, is offered.  Come ye to us, rejoicing in your spirit, for ye are they who make our prayer effective.

verses.sanskrit: सतुतासो नो मरुतो मर्ळयन्तूत सतुतो मघवा शमभविष्ठः ऊर्ध्वा नः सन्तु कोम्या वनान्यहानि विश्वा मरुतो जिगीषा |||
verses.transliteration: stutāso no maruto mṛḷayantūta stuto maghavā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ ūrdhvā naḥ santu komyā vanānyahāni viśvā maruto jighīṣā

translations.griffith: The Maruts, praised by us, shall show us favour; Maghavan, lauded, shall be most propitious.  Maruts,, may all our days that are to follow be very pleasant, lovely and triumphant.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मादहं तविषादीषमाण इन्द्राद भिया मरुतो रेजमानः युष्मभ्यं हव्या निशितान्यासन तान्यारे चक्र्मा मर्ळत नः |||
verses.transliteration: asmādahaṃ taviṣādīṣamāṇa indrād bhiyā maruto rejamānaḥ yuṣmabhyaṃ havyā niśitānyāsan tānyāre cakṛmā mṛḷata naḥ

translations.griffith: I fled in  terror  from this mighty Indra, my body trembling in alarm, O Maruts.  Oblations meant for you had been made ready; these have we set aside: for this forgive us.

verses.sanskrit: येन मानासश्चितयन्त उस्रा वयुष्टिषु शवसा शश्वतीनाम स नो मरुद्भिर्व्र्षभ शरवो धा उग्र उग्रेभि सथविरः सहोदाः |||
verses.transliteration: yena mānāsaścitayanta usrā vyuṣṭiṣu śavasā śaśvatīnām sa no marudbhirvṛṣabha śravo dhā ughra ughrebhi sthaviraḥ sahodāḥ

translations.griffith: By whom the Mānas recognize the day-springs, by whose strength at the dawn of endless mornings,  Give us, thou Mighty, glory with Maruts. fierce with the fierce, the Strong who givest triumph.

verses.sanskrit: तवं पाहीन्द्र सहीयसो नॄन भवा मरुद्भिरवयातहेळाः सुप्रकेतेभिः सासहिर्दधानो विद्यामेषं व. ज. |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ pāhīndra sahīyaso nṝn bhavā marudbhiravayātaheḷāḥ supraketebhiḥ sāsahirdadhāno vidyāmeṣaṃ v. j.

translations.griffith: Do thou, O Indra, guard the conquering Heroes, and rid thee of thy wrath against the Maruts,  With them, the wise, victorious and bestowing. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: चित्रो वो.अस्तु यामश्चित्र ऊती सुदानवः मरुतो अहिभानवः |||
verses.transliteration: citro vo.astu yāmaścitra ūtī sudānavaḥ maruto ahibhānavaḥ

translations.griffith: WONDERFUL let your coming be, wondrous with help, ye Bounteous Ones,  Maruts, who gleam as serpents gleam.

verses.sanskrit: आरे सा वः सुदानवो मरुत रञ्जती शरुः आरे अश्मा यमस्यथ |||
verses.transliteration: āre sā vaḥ sudānavo maruta ṛñjatī śaruḥ āre aśmā yamasyatha

translations.griffith: Far be from us, O Maruts, ye free givers, your impetuous shaft;  Far from us be the stone ye hurl.

verses.sanskrit: तर्णस्कन्दस्य नु विशः परि वर्ङकत सुदानवः ऊर्ध्वान नः कर्त जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: tṛṇaskandasya nu viśaḥ pari vṛṅkta sudānavaḥ ūrdhvān naḥ karta jīvase

translations.griffith: O Bounteous Givers, touch ye not, O Maruts, Tṛṇskanda's folk;  Lift ye us up that we may live.

verses.sanskrit: गायत साम नभन्यं यथा वेरर्चाम तद वाव्र्धानं सवर्वत गावो धेनवो बर्हिष्यदब्धा आ यत सद्मानं दिव्यं विवासान |||
verses.transliteration: ghāyat sāma nabhanyaṃ yathā verarcāma tad vāvṛdhānaṃ svarvat ghāvo dhenavo barhiṣyadabdhā ā yat sadmānaṃ divyaṃ vivāsān

translations.griffith: THE praise-song let him sing forth bursting bird-like: sing we that hymn which like heaven's light expandeth,  That the milk-giving cows may, unimpeded call to the sacred grass the Gods’ assembly.

verses.sanskrit: अर्चद वर्षा वर्षभिः सवेदुहव्यैर्म्र्गो नाश्नो अति यज्जुगुर्यात पर मन्दयुर्मनां गूर्त होता भरते मर्यो मिथुना यजत्रः |||
verses.transliteration: arcad vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sveduhavyairmṛgho nāśno ati yajjughuryāt pra mandayurmanāṃ ghūrta hotā bharate maryo mithunā yajatraḥ

translations.griffith: Let the Bull sing with Bulls whose toil is worship, with a loud roar like some wild beast that hungers.  Praised God! the glad priest brings his heart's devotion; the holy youth presents twofold oblation.

verses.sanskrit: नक्षद धोता परि सद्म मिता यन भरद गर्भमा शरदः पर्थिव्याः करन्ददश्वो नयमानो रुवद गौरन्तर्दूतो न रोदसी चरद वाक |||
verses.transliteration: nakṣad dhotā pari sadma mitā yan bharad gharbhamā śaradaḥ pṛthivyāḥ krandadaśvo nayamāno ruvad ghaurantardūto na rodasī carad vāk

translations.griffith: May the Priest come circling the measured stations, and with him bring the earth's autumnal fruitage.  Let the Horse neigh led near, let the Steer bellow: let the Voice go between both worlds as herald,

verses.sanskrit: ता कर्माषतरास्मै पर चयौत्नानि देवयन्तो भरन्ते जुजोषदिन्द्रो दस्मवर्चा नासत्येव सुग्म्यो रथेष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: tā karmāṣatarāsmai pra cyautnāni devayanto bharante jujoṣadindro dasmavarcā nāsatyeva sughmyo ratheṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: To him we offer welcomest oblations, the pious bring their strength-inspiring praises.  May Indra, wondrous in his might, accept them, car-borne and swift to move like the Nāsatyas.

verses.sanskrit: तमु षटुहीन्द्रं यो ह सत्वा यः शूरो मघवा यो रथेष्ठाः परतीचश्चिद योधीयान वर्षण्वान ववव्रुषश्चित तमसो विहन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: tamu ṣṭuhīndraṃ yo ha satvā yaḥ śūro maghavā yo ratheṣṭhāḥ pratīcaścid yodhīyān vṛṣaṇvān vavavruṣaścit tamaso vihantā

translations.griffith: Praise thou that Indra who is truly mighty, the car-borne Warrior, Maghavan the Hero;  Stronger in war than those who fight against him, borne by strong steeds, who kills enclosing darkness;

verses.sanskrit: पर यदित्था महिना नर्भ्यो अस्त्यरं रोदसी कक्ष्ये नास्मै सं विव्य इन्द्रो वर्जनं न भूमा भर्ति सवधावानोपशमिव दयाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra yaditthā mahinā nṛbhyo astyaraṃ rodasī kakṣye nāsmai saṃ vivya indro vṛjanaṃ na bhūmā bharti svadhāvānopaśamiva dyām

translations.griffith: Him who surpasses heroes in his greatness: the earth and heavens suffice not for his girdles.  Indra endues the earth to be his garment, and, God-like, wears the heaven as ’twere a frontlet,

verses.sanskrit: समत्सु तवा शूर सतामुराणं परपथिन्तमं परितंसयध्यै सजोषस इन्द्रं मदे कषोणीः सूरिं चिद ये अनुमदन्ति वाजैः |||
verses.transliteration: samatsu tvā śūra satāmurāṇaṃ prapathintamaṃ paritaṃsayadhyai sajoṣasa indraṃ made kṣoṇīḥ sūriṃ cid ye anumadanti vājaiḥ

translations.griffith: Thee, Hero, guardian of the brave in battles, who roamest in the van,—to draw thee hither,  Indra, the hosts agree beside the Soma, and joy, for his great actions, in the Chieftain.

verses.sanskrit: एवा हि ते शं सवना समुद्र आपो यत त आसु मदन्ति देवीः विश्वा ते अनु जोष्या भूद गौः सूरींश्चिद यदि धिषा वेषि जनान |||
verses.transliteration: evā hi te śaṃ savanā samudra āpo yat ta āsu madanti devīḥ viśvā te anu joṣyā bhūd ghauḥ sūrīṃścid yadi dhiṣā veṣi janān

translations.griffith: Libations in the sea to thee are pleasant, when thy divine Floods come to cheer these people.  To thee the Cow is sum of all things grateful when with the wish thou seekest men and princes.

verses.sanskrit: असाम यथा सुषखाय एन सवभिष्टयो नरां न शंसैः असद यथा न इन्द्रो वन्दनेष्ठास्तुरो न कर्म नयमान उक्था |||
verses.transliteration: asāma yathā suṣakhāya ena svabhiṣṭayo narāṃ na śaṃsaiḥ asad yathā na indro vandaneṣṭhāsturo na karma nayamāna ukthā

translations.griffith: So may we in this One be well befriended, well aided as it were through praise of chieftains,  That Indra still may linger at our worship, as one led swift to work, to hear our praises.

verses.sanskrit: विष्पर्धसो नरां न शंसैरस्माकासदिन्द्रो वज्रहस्तः मित्रायुवो न पूर्पतिं सुशिष्टौ मध्यायुव उप शिक्षन्ति यज्ञैः |||
verses.transliteration: viṣpardhaso narāṃ na śaṃsairasmākāsadindro vajrahastaḥ mitrāyuvo na pūrpatiṃ suśiṣṭau madhyāyuva upa śikṣanti yajñaiḥ

translations.griffith: Like men in rivalry extolling princes, our Friend be Indra, wielder of the thunder.  Like true friends of some city's lord within them held in good rule with sacrifice they help him.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञो हि षमेन्द्रं कश्चिद रन्धञ जुहुराणश्चिन मनसापरियन तीर्थे नाछा तात्र्षाणमोको दीर्घो न सिध्रमा कर्णोत्यध्वा |||
verses.transliteration: yajño hi ṣmendraṃ kaścid ṛndhañ juhurāṇaścin manasāpariyan tīrthe nāchā tātṛṣāṇamoko dīrgho na sidhramā kṛṇotyadhvā

translations.griffith: For every sacrifice makes Indra stronger, yea, when he goes around angry in spirit;  As pleasure at the ford invites the thirsty, as the long way brings him who gains his object.

verses.sanskrit: मो षू ण इन्द्रात्र पर्त्सु देवैरस्ति हि षमा ते शुष्मिन्नवयाः महश्चिद यस्य मीळ्हुषो यव्या हविष्मतो मरुतोवन्दते गीः |||
verses.transliteration: mo ṣū ṇa indrātra pṛtsu devairasti hi ṣmā te śuṣminnavayāḥ mahaścid yasya mīḷhuṣo yavyā haviṣmato marutovandate ghīḥ

translations.griffith: Let us not here contend with Gods, O Indra, for here, O Mighty One, is thine own portion,  The Great, whose Friends the bounteous Maruts honour, as with a stream, his song who pours oblations.

verses.sanskrit: एष सतोम इन्द्र तुभ्यमस्मे एतेन गातुं हरिवो विदो नः आ नो वव्र्त्याः सुविताय देव विद्यामेषं व. ज. |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa stoma indra tubhyamasme etena ghātuṃ harivo vido naḥ ā no vavṛtyāḥ suvitāya deva vidyāmeṣaṃ v. j.

translations.griffith: Addressed to thee is this our praise, O Indra: Lord of Bay Steeds, find us hereby advancement.  So mayst thou lead us on, O God, to comfort. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: तवं राजेन्द्र ये च देवा रक्षा नॄन पाह्यसुर तवमस्मान तवं सत्पतिर्मघवा नस्तरुत्रस्त्वं सत्यो वसवानः सहोदाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ rājendra ye ca devā rakṣā nṝn pāhyasura tvamasmān tvaṃ satpatirmaghavā nastarutrastvaṃ satyo vasavānaḥ sahodāḥ

translations.griffith: THOU art the King of all the Gods, O Indra: protect the men, O Asura, preserve us.  Thou Lord of Heroes, Maghavan, our saver, art faithful, very rich, the victory-giver.

verses.sanskrit: दनो विश इन्द्र मर्ध्रवाचः सप्त यत पुरः शर्म शारदीर्दर्त रणोरपो अनवद्यार्णा यूने वर्त्रं पुरुकुत्साय रन्धीः |||
verses.transliteration: dano viśa indra mṛdhravācaḥ sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīrdart ṛṇorapo anavadyārṇā yūne vṛtraṃ purukutsāya randhīḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, thou humbledst tribes that spake with insult by breaking down seven autumn forts, their refuge.  Thou stirredst, Blameless! billowy floods, and gavest his foe a prey to youthful Purukutsa.

verses.sanskrit: अजा वर्त इन्द्र शूरपत्नीर्द्यां च येभिः पुरुहूत नूनम रक्षो अग्निमशुषं तूर्वयाणं सिंहो न दमे अपांसि वस्तोः |||
verses.transliteration: ajā vṛta indra śūrapatnīrdyāṃ ca yebhiḥ puruhūta nūnam rakṣo aghnimaśuṣaṃ tūrvayāṇaṃ siṃho na dame apāṃsi vastoḥ

translations.griffith: With whom thou drivest troops whose lords are heroes, and bringest daylight now, much worshipped Indra,  With them guard lion-like wasting active Agni to dwell in our tilled fields and in our homestead.

verses.sanskrit: शेषन नु त इन्द्र सस्मिन योनौ परशस्तये पवीरवस्य मह्ना सर्जदर्णांस्यव यद युधा गास्तिष्ठद धरी धर्षता मर्ष्ट वाजान |||
verses.transliteration: śeṣan nu ta indra sasmin yonau praśastaye pavīravasya mahnā sṛjadarṇāṃsyava yad yudhā ghāstiṣṭhad dharī dhṛṣatā mṛṣṭa vājān

translations.griffith: They through the greatness of thy spear, O Indra, shall, to thy praise, rest in this earthly station.  To loose the floods, to seek, for kine, the battle, his Bays he mounted boldly seized the booty.

verses.sanskrit: वह कुत्समिन्द्र यस्मिञ्चाकन सयूमन्यू रज्रा वातस्याश्वा पर सूरश्चक्रं वर्हतादभीके.अभि सप्र्धो यासिषद्वज्रबाहुः |||
verses.transliteration: vaha kutsamindra yasmiñcākan syūmanyū ṛjrā vātasyāśvā pra sūraścakraṃ vṛhatādabhīke.abhi spṛdho yāsiṣadvajrabāhuḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, bear Kutsa, him in whom thou joyest: the dark-red horses of the Wind are docile.  Let the Sun roll his chariot wheel anear us, and let the Thunderer go to meet the foemen.

verses.sanskrit: जघन्वानिन्द्र मित्रेरूञ्चोदप्रव्र्द्धो हरिवो अदाशून परये पश्यन्नर्यमणं सचायोस्त्वया शूर्ता वहमाना अपत्यम |||
verses.transliteration: jaghanvānindra mitrerūñcodapravṛddho harivo adāśūn praye paśyannaryamaṇaṃ sacāyostvayā śūrtā vahamānā apatyam

translations.griffith: Thou Indra, Lord of Bays, made strong by impulse, hast slain the vexers of thy friends, who give not.  They who beheld the Friend beside the living were cast aside by thee as they rode onward.

verses.sanskrit: रपत कविरिन्द्रार्कसातौ कषां दासायोपबर्हणीं कः करत तिस्रो मघवा दानुचित्रा नि दुर्योणे कुयवाचं मर्धिश्रेत |||
verses.transliteration: rapat kavirindrārkasātau kṣāṃ dāsāyopabarhaṇīṃ kaḥ karat tisro maghavā dānucitrā ni duryoṇe kuyavācaṃ mṛdhiśret

translations.griffith: Indra, the bard sang forth in inspiration: thou madest earth a covering for the Dāsa.  Maghavan made the three that gleam with moisture, and to his home brought Kuyavāc to slay him.

verses.sanskrit: सना ता त इन्द्र नव्या आगुः सहो नभो.अविरणाय पूर्वीः भिनत पुरो न भिदो अदेवीर्ननमो वधरदेवस्य पीयोः |||
verses.transliteration: sanā tā ta indra navyā āghuḥ saho nabho.aviraṇāya pūrvīḥ bhinat puro na bhido adevīrnanamo vadharadevasya pīyoḥ

translations.griffith: These thine old deeds new bards have sung, O Indra. Thou conqueredst, boundest many tribes for ever.  Like castles thou hast crushed the godless races, and bowed the godless scorner's deadly weapon.

verses.sanskrit: तवं धुनिरिन्द्र धुनिमतीर्र्णोरपः सीरा न सरवन्तीः पर यत समुद्रमति शूर पर्षि पारया तुर्वशं यदुं सवस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ dhunirindra dhunimatīrṛṇorapaḥ sīrā na sravantīḥ pra yat samudramati śūra parṣi pārayā turvaśaṃ yaduṃ svasti

translations.griffith: A Stormer thou hast made the stormy waters flow down, O Indra, like the running rivers.  When o’er the flood thou broughtest them, O Hero, thou keptest Turvaśa and Yadu safely.

verses.sanskrit: तवमस्माकमिन्द्र विश्वध सय अव्र्कतमो नरां नर्पाता स नो विश्वासां सप्र्धां सहोदा वि... |||
verses.transliteration: tvamasmākamindra viśvadha sya avṛkatamo narāṃ nṛpātā sa no viśvāsāṃ spṛdhāṃ sahodā vi...

translations.griffith: Indra, mayst thou be ours in all occasions, protector of the men, most gentle-hearted,  Giving us victory over all our rivals. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: मत्स्यपायि ते महः पात्रस्येव हरिवो मत्सरो मदः वर्षा ते वर्ष्ण इन्दुर्वाजी सहस्रसातमः |||
verses.transliteration: matsyapāyi te mahaḥ pātrasyeva harivo matsaro madaḥ vṛṣā te vṛṣṇa indurvājī sahasrasātamaḥ

translations.griffith: GLAD thee: thy glory hath been quaffed, Lord of Bay Steeds, as ’twere the bowl's enlivening mead.  For thee the Strong there is strong drink, mighty, omnipotent to win.

verses.sanskrit: आ नस्ते गन्तु मत्सरो वर्षा मदो वरेण्यः सहावानिन्द्रसानसिः पर्तनाषाळ अमर्त्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ā naste ghantu matsaro vṛṣā mado vareṇyaḥ sahāvānindrasānasiḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ amartyaḥ

translations.griffith: Let our strong drink, most excellent, exhilarating, come to thee,  Victorious, Indra! bringing gain, immortal conquering in fight,

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि शूरः सनिता चोदयो मनुषो रथम सहावान दस्युमव्रतमोषः पात्रं न शोचिषा |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi śūraḥ sanitā codayo manuṣo ratham sahāvān dasyumavratamoṣaḥ pātraṃ na śociṣā

translations.griffith: Thou, Hero, winner of the spoil, urgest to speed the car of man.  Burn, like a vessel with the flame, the lawless Dasyu, Conqueror!

verses.sanskrit: मुषाय सुर्यं कवे चक्रमीशान ओजसा वह शुष्णायवधं कुत्सं वातस्याश्वैः |||
verses.transliteration: muṣāya suryaṃ kave cakramīśāna ojasā vaha śuṣṇāyavadhaṃ kutsaṃ vātasyāśvaiḥ

translations.griffith: Empowered by thine own might, O Sage, thou stolest Sūrya's chariot wheel.  Thou barest Kutsa with the steeds of Wind to Śuṣṇa as his death.

verses.sanskrit: शुष्मिन्तमो हि ते मदो दयुम्निन्तम उत करतुः वर्त्रघ्ना वरिवोविदा मंसीष्ठा अश्वसातमः |||
verses.transliteration: śuṣmintamo hi te mado dyumnintama uta kratuḥ vṛtraghnā varivovidā maṃsīṣṭhā aśvasātamaḥ

translations.griffith: Most mighty is thy rapturous joy, most splendid is thine active power,  Wherewith, foe-slaying, sending bliss, thou art supreme in gaining steeds.

verses.sanskrit: यथा पुर्वेभ्यो जरित्र्भ्य इन्द्र मय इवापो न तर्ष्यते बभूथ तामनु तवा निविदं जोहवीमि वि... |||
verses.transliteration: yathā purvebhyo jaritṛbhya indra maya ivāpo na tṛṣyate babhūtha tāmanu tvā nividaṃ johavīmi vi...

translations.griffith: As thou, O Indra, to the ancient singers wast ever joy, as water to the thirsty,  So unto thee I sing this invocation. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: मत्सि नो वस्यैष्टय इन्द्रमिन्दो वर्षा विश रघायमाणैन्वसि शत्रुमन्ति न विन्दसि |||
