verses.transliteration: matsi no vasyaiṣṭaya indramindo vṛṣā viśa ṛghāyamāṇainvasi śatrumanti na vindasi

translations.griffith: CHEER thee with draughts to win us bliss: Soma, pierce Indra in thy strength.  Thou stormest trembling in thy rage, and findest not a foeman nigh.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मिन्ना वेशया गिरो य एकश्चर्षणीनाम अनु सवधायमुप्यते यवं न चर्क्र्षद वर्षा |||
verses.transliteration: tasminnā veśayā ghiro ya ekaścarṣaṇīnām anu svadhāyamupyate yavaṃ na carkṛṣad vṛṣā

translations.griffith: Make our songs penetrate to him who is the Only One of men;  For whom the sacred food is spread, as the steer ploughs the barley in.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य विश्वानि हस्तयोः पञ्च कषितीनां वसु सपाशयस्व यो अस्मध्रुग दिव्येवाशनिर्जहि |||
verses.transliteration: yasya viśvāni hastayoḥ pañca kṣitīnāṃ vasu spāśayasva yo asmadhrugh divyevāśanirjahi

translations.griffith: Within whose hands deposited all the Five Peoples’ treasures rest.  Mark thou the man who injures us and kill him like the heavenly bolt.

verses.sanskrit: असुन्वन्तं समं जहि दूणाशं यो न ते मयः अस्मभ्यमस्य वेदनं दद्धि सूरिश्चिदोहते |||
verses.transliteration: asunvantaṃ samaṃ jahi dūṇāśaṃ yo na te mayaḥ asmabhyamasya vedanaṃ daddhi sūriścidohate

translations.griffith: Slay everyone who pours no gift, who, hard to reach, delights thee not.  Bestow on us what wealth he hath: this even the worshipper awaits.

verses.sanskrit: आवो यस्य दविबर्हसो.अर्केषु सानुषगसत आजाविन्द्रस्येन्दो परावो वाजेषु वाजिनम |||
verses.transliteration: āvo yasya dvibarhaso.arkeṣu sānuṣaghasat ājāvindrasyendo prāvo vājeṣu vājinam

translations.griffith: Thou helpest him the doubly strong whose hymns were sung unceasingly.  When Indra fought, O Soma, thou helpest the mighty in the fray.

verses.transliteration: yathā pūrvebhyo ...

translations.griffith: As thou, O Indra, to the ancient singers wast ever joy, like water to the thirsty,  So unto thee I sing this invocation. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: आ चर्षणिप्रा वर्षभो जनानां राजा कर्ष्टीनां पुरुहूत इन्द्रः सतुतः शरवस्यन्नवसोप मद्रिग युक्त्वा हरीव्र्षणा याह्यर्वां |||
verses.transliteration: ā carṣaṇiprā vṛṣabho janānāṃ rājā kṛṣṭīnāṃ puruhūta indraḥ stutaḥ śravasyannavasopa madrigh yuktvā harīvṛṣaṇā yāhyarvāṃ

translations.griffith: THE Bull of men, who cherishes all people, King of the Races, Indra, called of many,  Fame-loving, praised, hither to me with succour turn having yoked both vigorous Bay Horses!

verses.sanskrit: ये ते वर्षणो वर्षभास इन्द्र बरह्मयुजो वर्षरथासो अत्याः ताना तिष्ठ तेभिरा याह्यर्वां हवामहे तवा सुत इन्द्र सोमे |||
verses.transliteration: ye te vṛṣaṇo vṛṣabhāsa indra brahmayujo vṛṣarathāso atyāḥ tānā tiṣṭha tebhirā yāhyarvāṃ havāmahe tvā suta indra some

translations.griffith: Thy mighty Stallions, yoked by prayer, O Indra, thy. Coursers to thy mighty chariot harnessed,—  Ascend thou these, and borne by them come hither: with Soma juice outpoured, Indra, we call thee.

verses.sanskrit: आ तिष्ठ रथं वर्षणं वर्षा ते सुतः सोमः परिषिक्ता मधूनि युक्त्वा वर्षभ्यां वर्षभ कषितीनां हरिभ्यां याहि परवतोप मद्रिक |||
verses.transliteration: ā tiṣṭha rathaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vṛṣā te sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni yuktvā vṛṣabhyāṃ vṛṣabha kṣitīnāṃ haribhyāṃ yāhi pravatopa madrik

translations.griffith: Ascend thy mighty car: the mighty Soma is poured for thee and sweets are sprinkled round us.  Come down to us-ward, Bull of human races, come, having harnessed them, with strong Bay Horses.

verses.sanskrit: अयं यज्ञो देवया अयं मियेध इमा बरह्मण्ययमिन्द्र सोमः सतीर्णं बर्हिरा तु शक्र पर याहि पिबा निषद्यवि मुचा हरी इह |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ yajño devayā ayaṃ miyedha imā brahmaṇyayamindra somaḥ stīrṇaṃ barhirā tu śakra pra yāhi pibā niṣadyavi mucā harī iha

translations.griffith: Here is God-reaching sacrifice, here the victim; here, Indra, are the prayers, here is the Soma.  Strewn is the sacred grass: come hither, Śakra; seat thee and drink: unyoke thy two Bay Coursers.

verses.sanskrit: ओ सुष्टुत इन्द्र याह्यर्वां उप बरह्माणि मान्यस्य कारोः विद्याम वस्तोरवसा गर्णन्तो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: o suṣṭuta indra yāhyarvāṃ upa brahmāṇi mānyasya kāroḥ vidyāma vastoravasā ghṛṇanto vi...

translations.griffith: Come to us, Indra, come thou highly lauded to the devotions of the singer Māna.  Singing, may we find early through thy succour, may we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: यद ध सया त इन्द्र शरुष्टिरस्ति यया बभूथ जरित्र्भ्य ऊती मा नः कामं महयन्तमा धग विश्वा ते अश्याम्पर्याप आयोः |||
verses.transliteration: yad dha syā ta indra śruṣṭirasti yayā babhūtha jaritṛbhya ūtī mā naḥ kāmaṃ mahayantamā dhagh viśvā te aśyāmparyāpa āyoḥ

translations.griffith: IF, Indra, thou hast given that gracious hearing where with thou helpest those who sang thy praises.  Blast not the wish that would exalt us may I gain all from thee, and pay all man's devotions.

verses.sanskrit: न घा राजेन्द्र आ दभन नो या नु सवसारा कर्णवन्त योनौ आपश्चिदस्मै सुतुका अवेषन गमन न इन्द्रः सख्या वयश्च |||
verses.transliteration: na ghā rājendra ā dabhan no yā nu svasārā kṛṇavanta yonau āpaścidasmai sutukā aveṣan ghaman na indraḥ sakhyā vayaśca

translations.griffith: Let not the Sovran Indra disappoint us in what shall bring both Sisters to our dwelling.  To him have run the quickly flowing waters. May Indra come to us with life and friendship.

verses.sanskrit: जेता नर्भिरिन्द्रः पर्त्सु शूरः शरोता हवं नाधमानस्य कारोः परभर्ता रथं दाशुष उपक उद्यन्त गिरो यदि च तमना भूत |||
verses.transliteration: jetā nṛbhirindraḥ pṛtsu śūraḥ śrotā havaṃ nādhamānasya kāroḥ prabhartā rathaṃ dāśuṣa upaka udyanta ghiro yadi ca tmanā bhūt

translations.griffith: Victorious with the men, Hero in battles, Indra, who hears the singer's supplication,  Will bring his car nigh to the man who offers, if he himself upholds the songs that praise him.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नर्भिरिन्द्रः सुश्रवस्या परखादः पर्क्षो अभि मित्रिणो भूत समर्य इष सतवते विवाचि सत्राकरो यजमानस्यशंसः |||
verses.transliteration: evā nṛbhirindraḥ suśravasyā prakhādaḥ pṛkṣo abhi mitriṇo bhūt samarya iṣa stavate vivāci satrākaro yajamānasyaśaṃsaḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, Indra, with the men, through love of glory consumes the sacred food which friends have offered.  The ever-strengthening song of him who worships is sung in fight amid the clash of voices.

verses.sanskrit: तवया वयं मघवन्निन्द्र शत्रुनभि षयम महतो मन्यमनान तवं तराता तवमु नो वर्धे भुर्वि... |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ maghavannindra śatrunabhi ṣyama mahato manyamanān tvaṃ trātā tvamu no vṛdhe bhurvi...

translations.griffith: Aided by thee, O Maghavan, O Indra, may we subdue our foes who count them mighty.  Be our protector, strengthen and increase us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: परुवीरहं शरदः शश्रमणा दोषा वस्तोरुषसो जरयन्तीः मिनाति शरियं जरिमा तनूनमप्यु नु पत्नीर्व्र्षणो जगम्युः |||
verses.transliteration: pruvīrahaṃ śaradaḥ śaśramaṇā doṣā vastoruṣaso jarayantīḥ mināti śriyaṃ jarimā tanūnamapyu nu patnīrvṛṣaṇo jaghamyuḥ

translations.griffith: Many years have I been serving you diligently, both day and night, and through mornings, bringing on old age; decay now impairs the beauty of my limbsn  What, therefore, is now (to be done); let husbands approach their wives.

verses.sanskrit: ये चिद धि पूर्व रतसाप आसन साकं देवेभिरवदन्न्र्तानि ते चिदवसुर्नह्यन्तमापुः समू नु पत्नीर्व्र्षभिर्जगम्युः |||
verses.transliteration: ye cid dhi pūrva ṛtasāpa āsan sākaṃ devebhiravadannṛtāni te cidavasurnahyantamāpuḥ samū nu patnīrvṛṣabhirjaghamyuḥ

translations.griffith: The ancient sages, disseminators of truth, who, verily, conversed of tuths with the gods, begot (progeny), nor thereby violated (their vow of continence), therefore should wives be approached by their husbands.

verses.sanskrit: न मर्षा शरान्तं यदवन्ति देवा विश्वा इत सप्र्धो अभ्यश्नवाव जयावेदत्र शतनीथमजिं यत सम्यञ्चा मिथुनावभ्यजाव |||
verses.transliteration: na mṛṣā śrāntaṃ yadavanti devā viśvā it spṛdho abhyaśnavāva jayāvedatra śatanīthamajiṃ yat samyañcā mithunāvabhyajāva

translations.griffith: (Agastya): Penance has not been practised in vain; since the gods protect us, we may indulge all our desires; in this world we may triumph in many conflicts, if we exert ourselves mutually together

verses.sanskrit: नदस्य मा रुधतः काम आगन्नित आजातो अमुतः कुतश्चित लोपामुद्र वर्षणं नी रिणति धीरमधीर धयति शवसन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: nadasya mā rudhataḥ kāma āghannita ājāto amutaḥ kutaścit lopāmudra vṛṣaṇaṃ nī riṇati dhīramadhīra dhayati śvasantam

translations.griffith: Desire, either from this cause or from that, has come upon me whilst engaged in prayer and suppressing (passion); let Lopāmudrā approach her husband; the unsteady feminine le beguiles the firm and resolute man.

verses.sanskrit: इमं न सोममन्तितो हर्त्सु पीतमुप बरुवे यत सीमागश्चक्र्मा तत सु मर्ळतु पुलुकामो हि मर्त्यः |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ n somamantito hṛtsu pītamupa bruve yat sīmāghaścakṛmā tat su mṛḷatu pulukāmo hi martyaḥ

translations.griffith: (Pupil): I beseech the Soma, which has been drunk in my heart, that it may fully expiate the sin we have committed; man is subject to many desires.

verses.sanskrit: अगस्त्यः खनमनः खनित्रैः परजमपत्यं बलमिछमानः उभौ वर्णाव रषिरुग्रः पुपोष सत्या देवेष्वशिषो जगाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghastyaḥ khanamanaḥ khanitraiḥ prajamapatyaṃ balamichamānaḥ ubhau varṇāv ṛṣirughraḥ pupoṣa satyā deveṣvaśiṣo jaghāma

translations.griffith: Agastya, a venerable sage, working with (fit) implements, desiring progeny, offspring, and strength, practised both classes (of obligations), and received true benedictions from the gods.

verses.sanskrit: युवो रजांसि सुयमासो अश्वा रथो यद वां पर्यर्णांसिदियत हिरण्यया वां पवयह परुषायन मध्वः पिबन्ता उषसः सचेथे |||
verses.transliteration: yuvo rajāṃsi suyamāso aśvā ratho yad vāṃ paryarṇāṃsidiyat hiraṇyayā vāṃ pavayah pruṣāyan madhvaḥ pibantā uṣasaḥ sacethe

translations.griffith: LIGHTLY your coursers travel through the regions when round the sea of air your car is flying.  Your golden fellies scatter drops of moisture: drinking the sweetness ye  attend  the Mornings.

verses.sanskrit: युवमत्यस्याव नक्षथो यद विपत्मनो नर्यस्य परयज्योः सवसा यद वां विश्वगूर्ती भराति वाजायेट्टे मधुपाविषे च |||
verses.transliteration: yuvamatyasyāva nakṣatho yad vipatmano naryasya prayajyoḥ svasā yad vāṃ viśvaghūrtī bharāti vājāyeṭṭe madhupāviṣe ca

translations.griffith: Ye as ye travel overtake the Courser who flies apart, the Friend of man, most holy.  The prayer is that the Sister may convey you, all praised, meath-drinkers! to support and strengthen.

verses.sanskrit: युवं पय उस्रियायामधत्तं पक्वमामायामव पूर्व्यंगोः अन्तर्यद वनिनो वां रतप्सू हवारो न शुचिर्यजते हविष्मान |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ paya usriyāyāmadhattaṃ pakvamāmāyāmava pūrvyaṃghoḥ antaryad vanino vāṃ ṛtapsū hvāro na śuciryajate haviṣmān

translations.griffith: Ye have deposited, matured within her, in the raw cow the first milk of the milch-cow,  Which the bright offerer, shining like a serpent mid trees, presents to you whose form is perfect.

verses.sanskrit: युवं ह घर्मं मधुमन्तमत्रये.अपो न कषोदो.अव्र्णीतमेषे तद वां नरावश्विना पश्वैष्टी रथ्येव चक्रा परति यन्ति मध्वः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ ha gharmaṃ madhumantamatraye.apo na kṣodo.avṛṇītameṣe tad vāṃ narāvaśvinā paśvaiṣṭī rathyeva cakrā prati yanti madhvaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye made the fierce heat to be full of sweetness for Atri at his wish, like streaming water.  Fire-offering thence is yours, O Aśvins, Heroes: your car-wheels speed to us like springs of honey.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां दानाय वव्र्तीय दस्रा गोरोहेण तौग्र्यो न जिव्रिः अपः कषोणी सचते माहिना वां जूर्णो वामक्षुरंहसो यजत्रा |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ dānāya vavṛtīya dasrā ghoroheṇa taughryo na jivriḥ apaḥ kṣoṇī sacate māhinā vāṃ jūrṇo vāmakṣuraṃhaso yajatrā

translations.griffith: Like Tugra's ancient son may I, ye Mighty, bring you to give your gifts with milk-oblations.  Your greatness compasseth Earth, Heaven, and Waters: decayed for you is sorrow's net, ye Holy.

verses.sanskrit: नि यद युवेथे नियुतः सुदानू उप सवधाभिः सर्जथः पुरन्धिम परेषद वेषद वातो न सूरिरा महे ददे सुव्रतोन वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: ni yad yuvethe niyutaḥ sudānū upa svadhābhiḥ sṛjathaḥ purandhim preṣad veṣad vāto na sūrirā mahe dade suvratona vājam

translations.griffith: When, Bounteous Ones, ye drive your yoked team downward, ye send, by your own natures, understanding.  Swift as the wind let the prince please and feast you: he, like a pious man, gains strength for increase.

verses.sanskrit: वयं चिद धि वां जरितारः सत्या विपन्यामहे वि पणिर्हितावान अधा चिद धि षमाश्विनावनिन्द्या पाथो हि षमाव्र्षणावन्तिदेवम |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ cid dhi vāṃ jaritāraḥ satyā vipanyāmahe vi paṇirhitāvān adhā cid dhi ṣmāśvināvanindyā pātho hi ṣmāvṛṣaṇāvantidevam

translations.griffith: For verily we truthful singers praise you the niggard trafficker is here excluded.  Now, even now do ye O blameless Aśvins, ye Mighty, guard the man whose God is near him.

verses.sanskrit: युवं चिद धि षमाश्विनावनु दयून विरुद्रस्य परस्रवणस्यसातौ अगस्त्यो नरां नर्षु परशस्तः काराधुनीव चितयत सहस्रैः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ cid dhi ṣmāśvināvanu dyūn virudrasya prasravaṇasyasātau aghastyo narāṃ nṛṣu praśastaḥ kārādhunīva citayat sahasraiḥ

translations.griffith: You of a truth day after day, O Aśvins, that he might win the very plenteous torrent,  Agastya, famous among mortal heroes, roused with a thousand lauds like sounds of music.

verses.sanskrit: पर यद वहेथे महिना रथस्य पर सयन्द्रा याथो मनुषो न होता धत्तं सूरिभ्य उत व सवश्व्यं नासत्य रयिषाचः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra yad vahethe mahinā rathasya pra syandrā yātho manuṣo na hotā dhattaṃ sūribhya uta va svaśvyaṃ nāsatya rayiṣācaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: When with the glory of your car ye travel, when we go speeding like the priest of mortals,  And give good horses to sacrificers, may we, Nāsatyas! gain our share of riches.

verses.sanskrit: तं वां रथं वयमद्या हुवेम सतोमैरश्विना सुवितायनव्यम अरिष्टनेमिं परि दयामियानं वि... |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayamadyā huvema stomairaśvinā suvitāyanavyam ariṣṭanemiṃ pari dyāmiyānaṃ vi...

translations.griffith: With songs of praise we call to-day, O Aśvins, that your new chariot, for our own well-being,  That circles heaven with never-injured fellies. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: कदु परेष्टाविषां रयीणामध्वर्यन्ता यदुन्निनीथोपाम अयं वां यज्ञो अक्र्त परशस्तिं वसुधिती अवितारा जनानाम |||
verses.transliteration: kadu preṣṭāviṣāṃ rayīṇāmadhvaryantā yadunninīthoapām ayaṃ vāṃ yajño akṛta praśastiṃ vasudhitī avitārā janānām

translations.griffith: WHAT, dearest Pair, is this in strength and riches that ye as Priests are bring from the waters?  This sacrifice is your glorification, ye who protect mankind and give them treasures.

verses.sanskrit: आ वामश्वासः शुचयः पयस्पा वातरंहसो दिव्यासो अत्याः मनोजुवो वर्षणो वीतप्र्ष्ठा एह सवराजो अश्विनावहन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāmaśvāsaḥ śucayaḥ payaspā vātaraṃhaso divyāso atyāḥ manojuvo vṛṣaṇo vītapṛṣṭhā eha svarājo aśvināvahantu

translations.griffith: May your pure steeds, rain-drinkers, bring you hither, swift as the tempest, your celestial coursers,  Rapid as thought, with fair backs, full of vigour, resplendent in their native light, O Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां रथो.अवनिर्न परवत्वान सर्प्रवन्धुरः सुविताय गम्याः वर्ष्ण सथातारा मनसो जवीयानहम्पूर्वो यजतोधिष्ण्या यः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ ratho.avanirna pravatvān sṛpravandhuraḥ suvitāya ghamyāḥ vṛṣṇa sthātārā manaso javīyānahampūrvo yajatodhiṣṇyā yaḥ

translations.griffith: Your car is like a torrent rushing downward: may it come nigh, broad-seated, for our welfare,—  Car holy, strong, that ever would be foremost, thought-swift, which ye, for whom we long, have mounted.

verses.sanskrit: इहेह जाता समवावशीतामरेपसा तन्वा नामभिः सवैः जिष्णुर्वामन्यः सुमखस्य सूरिर्दिवो अन्यः सुभगः पुत्र ऊहे |||
verses.transliteration: iheha jātā samavāvaśītāmarepasā tanvā nāmabhiḥ svaiḥ jiṣṇurvāmanyaḥ sumakhasya sūrirdivo anyaḥ subhaghaḥ putra ūhe

translations.griffith: Here sprung to life, they both have sung together, with bodies free from stain, with signs that mark them;  One of you Prince of Sacrifice, the Victor, the other counts as Heaven's auspicious offspring.

verses.sanskrit: पर वां निचेरुः ककुहो वशाननु पिशङगरूपः सदनानि गम्याः हरी अन्यस्य पीपयन्त वाजैर्मथ्रा रजांस्यश्विना वि घोषैः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāṃ niceruḥ kakuho vaśānanu piśaṅgharūpaḥ sadanāni ghamyāḥ harī anyasya pīpayanta vājairmathrā rajāṃsyaśvinā vi ghoṣaiḥ

translations.griffith: May your car-seat, down-gliding, golden-coloured, according to your wish approach our dwellings.  Men shall feed full the bay steeds of the other, and, Aśvins they with roars shall stir the regions.

verses.sanskrit: पर वां शरद्वान वर्षभो न निष्षाट पूर्वीरिषश्चरति मध्व इष्णन एवैरन्यस्य पीपयन्त वाजैर्वेषन्तीरूर्ध्वा नद्यो न आगुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāṃ śaradvān vṛṣabho na niṣṣāṭ pūrvīriṣaścarati madhva iṣṇan evairanyasya pīpayanta vājairveṣantīrūrdhvā nadyo na āghuḥ

translations.griffith: Forth comes your strong Bull like a cloud of autumn, sending abundant food of liquid sweetness.  Let them feed with the other's ways and vigour: the upper streams have come and do us service.

verses.sanskrit: असर्जि वां सथविरा वेधसा गीर्बाळ्हे अश्विना तरेधा कषरन्ती उपस्तुताववतं नाधमानं यामन्नयामञ्छ्र्णुतं हवं मे |||
verses.transliteration: asarji vāṃ sthavirā vedhasā ghīrbāḷhe aśvinā tredhā kṣarantī upastutāvavataṃ nādhamānaṃ yāmannayāmañchṛṇutaṃ havaṃ me

translations.griffith: Your constant song hath been sent forth, Disposers! that flows threefold in mighty strength, O Aśvins.  Thus lauded, give the suppliant protection moving or resting hear mine invocation.

verses.sanskrit: उत सया वां रुशतो वप्ससो गीस्त्रिबर्हिषि सदसि पिन्वतेनॄन वर्षा वां मेघो वर्षणा पीपाय गोर्न सेके मनुषोदशस्यन |||
verses.transliteration: uta syā vāṃ ruśato vapsaso ghīstribarhiṣi sadasi pinvatenṝn vṛṣā vāṃ megho vṛṣaṇā pīpāya ghorna seke manuṣodaśasyan

translations.griffith: This song of bright contents for you is swelling in the men's hall where three-fold grass is ready.  Your strong rain-cloud, ye Mighty Ones, hath swollen, honouring men as ’twere with milk's outpouring.

verses.sanskrit: युवां पूषेवाश्विना पुरन्धिरग्निमुषां न जरते हविष्मान हुवे यद वां वरिवस्या गर्णानो वि... |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāṃ pūṣevāśvinā purandhiraghnimuṣāṃ na jarate haviṣmān huve yad vāṃ varivasyā ghṛṇāno vi...

translations.griffith: The prudent worshipper, like Pūṣan, Aśvins! praises you as he praises Dawn and Agni,  When, singing with devotion, he invokes you. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: अभूदिदं वयुनमो षु भूषता रथो वर्षण्वान मदता मनीषिणः धियंजिन्वा धिष्ण्या विश्पलावसू दिवो नपात सुक्र्ते शुचिव्रता |||
verses.transliteration: abhūdidaṃ vayunamo ṣu bhūṣatā ratho vṛṣaṇvān madatā manīṣiṇaḥ dhiyaṃjinvā dhiṣṇyā viśpalāvasū divo napāta sukṛte śucivratā

translations.griffith: THIS was the task. Appear promptly, ye prudent Ones. Here is the chariot drawn by strong steeds: be ye glad.  Heart-stirring, longed for, succourers of Viśpalā, here are Heaven's Sons whose sway blesses the pious man.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रतमा हि धिष्ण्या मरुत्तमा दस्रा दंसिष्ठा रथ्या रथीतमा पूर्णं रथं वहेथे मध्व आचितं तेन दाश्वांसमुप याथो अश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: indratamā hi dhiṣṇyā maruttamā dasrā daṃsiṣṭhā rathyā rathītamā pūrṇaṃ rathaṃ vahethe madhva ācitaṃ tena dāśvāṃsamupa yātho aśvinā

translations.griffith: Longed for, most Indra-like, mighty, most Marut-like, most wonderful in deed, car-borne, best charioteers,  Bring your full chariot hither heaped with liquid sweet: thereon, ye Aśvins, come to him who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit: किमत्र दस्रा कर्णुथः किमासाथे जनो यः कश्चिदहविर्महीयते अति करमिष्टं जुरतं पणेरसुं जयोतिर्विप्राय कर्णुतं वचस्यवे |||
verses.transliteration: kimatra dasrā kṛṇuthaḥ kimāsāthe jano yaḥ kaścidahavirmahīyate ati kramiṣṭaṃ jurataṃ paṇerasuṃ jyotirviprāya kṛṇutaṃ vacasyave

translations.griffith: What make ye there, ye Mighty? Wherefore linger ye with folk who, offering not, are held in high esteem?  Pass over them; make ye the niggard's life decay: give light unto the singer eloquent in praise.

verses.sanskrit: जम्भयतमभितो रायतः शुनो हतं मर्धो विदथुस्तान्यश्विना वाचं-वाचं जरितू रत्निनीं कर्तमुभा शंसं नासत्यावतं मम |||
verses.transliteration: jambhayatamabhito rāyataḥ śuno hataṃ mṛdho vidathustānyaśvinā vācaṃ-vācaṃ jaritū ratninīṃ kṛtamubhā śaṃsaṃ nāsatyāvataṃ mama

translations.griffith: Crunch up on. every side the dogs who bark at us: slay ye our foes, O Aśvins this ye understand.  Make wealthy every word of him who praises you: accept with favour, both Nāsatyas, this my laud.

verses.sanskrit: युवमेतं चक्रथुः सिन्धुषु पलवमात्मन्वन्तं पक्षिणन्तौग्र्याय कम येन देवत्रा मनसा निरूहथुः सुपप्तनीपेतथुः कषोदसो महः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvametaṃ cakrathuḥ sindhuṣu plavamātmanvantaṃ pakṣiṇantaughryāya kam yena devatrā manasā nirūhathuḥ supaptanīpetathuḥ kṣodaso mahaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye made for Tugra's son amid the water-floods that animated ship with wings to fly withal,  Whereon with God-devoted mind ye brought him forth, and fled with easy flight from out the mighty surge.

verses.sanskrit: अवविद्धं तौग्र्यमप्स्वन्तरनारम्भणे तमसि परविद्धम चतस्रो नावो जठलस्य जुष्टा उदश्विभ्यामिषिताः पारयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: avaviddhaṃ taughryamapsvantaranārambhaṇe tamasi praviddham catasro nāvo jaṭhalasya juṣṭā udaśvibhyāmiṣitāḥ pārayanti

translations.griffith: Four ships most welcome in the midst of ocean, urged by the Aśvins, save the son of Tugra,  Him who was cast down headlong in the waters, plunged in the thick inevitable darkness.

verses.sanskrit: कः सविद वर्क्षो निष्ठितो मध्ये अर्णसो यं तौग्र्यो नाधितः पर्यषस्वजत पर्णा मर्गस्य पतरोरिवारभ उदश्विना ऊहथुः शरोमताय कम |||
verses.transliteration: kaḥ svid vṛkṣo niṣṭhito madhye arṇaso yaṃ taughryo nādhitaḥ paryaṣasvajat parṇā mṛghasya patarorivārabha udaśvinā ūhathuḥ śromatāya kam

translations.griffith: What tree was that which stood fixed in surrounding sea to which the son of Tugra supplicating clung?  Like twigs, of which some winged creature may take hold, ye, Aśvins, bore him off safely to your renown.

verses.sanskrit: तद वां नरा नासत्यावनु षयाद यद वां मानास उचथमवोचन अस्मादद्य सदसः सोम्यादा] वि... |||
verses.transliteration: tad vāṃ narā nāsatyāvanu ṣyād yad vāṃ mānāsa ucathamavocan asmādadya sadasaḥ somyādā] vi...

translations.griffith: Welcome to you be this the hymn of praises uttered by Mānas, O Nāsatyas, Heroes,  From this our gathering where we offer Soma. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: तं युञ्जाथां मनसो यो जवीयान तरिवन्धुरो वर्षण यस्त्रिचक्रः येनोपयाथः सुक्र्तो दुरोणं तरिधातुन पतथोविर्न पर्णैः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ yuñjāthāṃ manaso yo javīyān trivandhuro vṛṣaṇa yastricakraḥ yenopayāthaḥ sukṛto duroṇaṃ tridhātuna patathovirna parṇaiḥ

translations.griffith: MAKE ready that which passes thought in swiftness, that hath three wheels and triple seat, ye Mighty,  Whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious, whereon, threefold, ye fly like birds with pinions.

verses.sanskrit: सुव्र्द रथो वर्तते यन्नभि कषां यत तिष्ठथः करतुमन्तानु पर्क्षे वपुर्वपुष्या सचतामियं गीर्दिवो दुहित्रोषसा सचेथे |||
verses.transliteration: suvṛd ratho vartate yannabhi kṣāṃ yat tiṣṭhathaḥ kratumantānu pṛkṣe vapurvapuṣyā sacatāmiyaṃ ghīrdivo duhitroṣasā sacethe

translations.griffith: Light rolls your easy chariot faring earthward, what time, for food, ye, full of wisdom, mount it.  May this song, wondrous fair, attend your glory: ye, as ye travel, wait on Dawn Heaven's Daughter.

verses.sanskrit: आ तिष्ठतं सुव्र्तं यो रथो वामनु वरतानि वर्तते हविष्मान येन नरा नासत्येषयध्यै वर्तिर्याथस्तनयायत्मने च |||
verses.transliteration: ā tiṣṭhataṃ suvṛtaṃ yo ratho vāmanu vratāni vartate haviṣmān yena narā nāsatyeṣayadhyai vartiryāthastanayāyatmane ca

translations.griffith: Ascend your lightly rolling car, approaching the worshipper who turns him to his duties,—  Whereon ye come unto the house to quicken man and his offspring, O Nāsatyas, Heroes.

verses.sanskrit: मा वां वर्को मा वर्कीरा दधर्षीन मा परि वर्क्तमुतमाति धक्तम अयं वां भागो निहित इयं गीर्दस्राविमे वां निधयो मधूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: mā vāṃ vṛko mā vṛkīrā dadharṣīn mā pari varktamutamāti dhaktam ayaṃ vāṃ bhāgho nihita iyaṃ ghīrdasrāvime vāṃ nidhayo madhūnām

translations.griffith: Let not the wolf, let not the she-wolf harm you. Forsake me not, nor pass me by or others.  Here stands your share, here is your hymn, ye Mighty: yours are these vessels, full of pleasant juices.

verses.sanskrit: युवां गोतमः पुरुमीळ्हो अत्रिर्दस्रा हवते.अवसे हविष्मान दिशं न दिष्टां रजूयेव यन्ता मे हवं नासत्योप यातम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāṃ ghotamaḥ purumīḷho atrirdasrā havate.avase haviṣmān diśaṃ na diṣṭāṃ ṛjūyeva yantā me havaṃ nāsatyopa yātam

translations.griffith: Gotama, Purumīlha, Atri bringing oblations all invoke you for protection.  Like one who goes straight to the point directed, ye Nāsatyas, to mine invocation.

verses.sanskrit: अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्य परति वां सतोमो अश्विनावधायि एह यातं पथिभिर्देवयानैर्वि... |||
verses.transliteration: atāriṣma tamasas pāramasya prati vāṃ stomo aśvināvadhāyi eha yātaṃ pathibhirdevayānairvi...

translations.griffith: We have passed o’er the limit of this darkness: our praise hath been bestowed on you, O Aśvins.  Come hitherward by paths which Gods have travelled. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: ता वामद्य तावपरं हुवेमोछन्त्यामुषसि वह्निरुक्थैः नासत्या कुह चित सन्तावर्यो दिवो नपाता सुदास्तराय |||
verses.transliteration: tā vāmadya tāvaparaṃ huvemochantyāmuṣasi vahnirukthaiḥ nāsatyā kuha cit santāvaryo divo napātā sudāstarāya

translations.griffith: LET us invoke you both this day and after the priest is here with lauds when morn is breaking:  Nāsatyas, wheresoe’er ye be, Heaven's Children, for him who is more liberal than the godless.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे ऊ षु वर्षणा मादयेथामुत पणीन्र्हतमूर्म्या मदन्ता शरुतं मे अछोक्तिभिर्मतीनामेष्टा नरा निचेतारच कर्णैः |||
verses.transliteration: asme ū ṣu vṛṣaṇā mādayethāmut paṇīnrhatamūrmyā madantā śrutaṃ me achoktibhirmatīnāmeṣṭā narā nicetāraca karṇaiḥ

translations.griffith: With us, ye Mighty, let yourselves be joyful, glad in our stream of Soma slay the niggards.  Graciously hear my hymns and invitations, marking, O Heroes, with your cars my longing.

verses.sanskrit: शरिये पूषन्निषुक्र्तेव देवा नासत्या वहतुं सूर्यायाः वच्यन्ते वां ककुहा अप्सु जाता युगा जूर्णेव वरुणस्य भूरेः |||
verses.transliteration: śriye pūṣanniṣukṛteva devā nāsatyā vahatuṃ sūryāyāḥ vacyante vāṃ kakuhā apsu jātā yughā jūrṇeva varuṇasya bhūreḥ

translations.griffith: Nāsatyas, Pūṣans, ye as Gods for glory arranged and set in order Sūrya's bridal.  Your giant steeds move on, sprung from the waters, like ancient times of Varuṇa the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे सा वां माध्वी रातिरस्तु सतोमं हिनोतं मान्यस्य कारोः अनु यद वां शरवस्या सुदानू सुवीर्याय चर्षणयोमदन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: asme sā vāṃ mādhvī rātirastu stomaṃ hinotaṃ mānyasya kāroḥ anu yad vāṃ śravasyā sudānū suvīryāya carṣaṇayomadanti

translations.griffith: Your grace be with us, ye who love sweet juices: further the hymn sung by the poet Māna,  When men are joyful in your glorious actions, to win heroic strength, ye Bounteous Givers.

verses.sanskrit: एष वां सतोमो अश्विनावकारि मानेभिर्मघवाना सुव्र्क्ति यातं वर्तिस्तनयाय तमने चागस्त्ये नासत्या मदन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa vāṃ stomo aśvināvakāri mānebhirmaghavānā suvṛkti yātaṃ vartistanayāya tmane cāghastye nāsatyā madantā

translations.griffith: This praise was made, O liberal Lords, O Aśvins, for you with fair adornment by the Mānas.  Come to our house for us and for our children, rejoicing, O Nāsatyas, in Agastya.

verses.transliteration: atāriṣma ...

translations.griffith: We have passed o’er the limit of this darkness: our praise hath been bestowed on you, O Aśvins.  Come hitherward by paths which Gods have travelled. may we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: कतरा पूर्वा कतरापरायोः कथा जाते कवयः को वि वेद विश्वं तमना बिभ्र्तो यद ध नाम वि वर्तेते अहनी चक्रियेव |||
verses.transliteration: katarā pūrvā katarāparāyoḥ kathā jāte kavayaḥ ko vi veda viśvaṃ tmanā bibhṛto yad dha nāma vi vartete ahanī cakriyeva

translations.griffith: WHETHER of these is elder, whether later? How were they born? Who knoweth it, ye sages?  These of themselves support all things existing: as on a car the Day and Night roll onward.

verses.sanskrit: भूरिं दवे अचरन्ती चरन्तं पद्वन्तं गर्भमपदी दधाते नित्यं न सूनुं पित्रोरुपस्थे दयावा रक्षतं पर्थिवी नो अभ्वात |||
verses.transliteration: bhūriṃ dve acarantī carantaṃ padvantaṃ gharbhamapadī dadhāte nityaṃ na sūnuṃ pitrorupasthe dyāvā rakṣataṃ pṛthivī no abhvāt

translations.griffith: The Twain uphold, though motionless and footless, a widespread offspring having feet and moving.  Like your own son upon his parents’ bosom, protect us, Heaven and earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit: अनेहो दात्रमदितेरनर्वं हुवे सवर्वदवधं नमस्वत तद रोदसी जनयतं जरित्रे दयावा ... |||
verses.transliteration: aneho dātramaditeranarvaṃ huve svarvadavadhaṃ namasvat tad rodasī janayataṃ jaritre dyāvā ...

translations.griffith: I call for Aditi's unrivalled bounty, perfect, celestial, deathless, meet for worship.  Produce this, ye Twain Worlds, for him who lauds you. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit: अतप्यमाने अवसावन्ती अनु षयाम रोदसी देवपुत्रे उभे देवानामुभयेभिरह्नां दयावा ... |||
verses.transliteration: atapyamāne avasāvantī anu ṣyāma rodasī devaputre ubhe devānāmubhayebhirahnāṃ dyāvā ...

translations.griffith: May we be close to both the Worlds who suffer no pain, Parents of Gods, who aid with favour,  Both mid the Gods, with Day and Night alternate. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit: संगछमाने युवती समन्ते सवसारा जामी पित्रोरुपस्थे अभिजिघ्रन्ती भुवनस्य नाभिं दयावा ... |||
verses.transliteration: saṃghachamāne yuvatī samante svasārā jāmī pitrorupasthe abhijighrantī bhuvanasya nābhiṃ dyāvā ...

translations.griffith: Faring together, young, with meeting limits, Twin Sisters lying in their Parents’ bosom,  Kissing the centre of the world together. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit: उर्वी सद्मनी बर्हती रतेन हुवे देवानामवसा जनित्री दधाते ये अम्र्तं सुप्रतीके दयावा ... |||
verses.transliteration: urvī sadmanī bṛhatī ṛtena huve devānāmavasā janitrī dadhāte ye amṛtaṃ supratīke dyāvā ...

translations.griffith: Duly I call the two wide seats, the mighty, the general Parents, with the God's protection.  Who, beautiful to look on, make the nectar. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit: उर्वी पर्थ्वी बहुले दूरेन्ते उप बरुवे नमसा यज्ञे अस्मिन दधाते ये सुभगे सुप्रतूर्ती दयावा ... |||
verses.transliteration: urvī pṛthvī bahule dūreante upa bruve namasā yajñe asmin dadhāte ye subhaghe supratūrtī dyāvā ...

translations.griffith: Wide, vast, and manifold, whose bounds are distant,—these, reverent, I address at this our worship,  The blessed Pair, victorious, all-sustaining. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit: देवान वा यच्चक्र्मा कच्चिदागः सखायं वा सदमिज्जास्पतिं वा इयं धीर्भूया अवयानमेषां दयावा .. . |||
verses.transliteration: devān vā yaccakṛmā kaccidāghaḥ sakhāyaṃ vā sadamijjāspatiṃ vā iyaṃ dhīrbhūyā avayānameṣāṃ dyāvā .. .

translations.griffith: What sin we have at any time committed against the Gods, our friend, our house's chieftain,  Thereof may this our hymn be expiation. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit: उभा शंसा नर्या मामविष्टामुभे मामूती अवसा सचेताम भूरि चिदर्यः सुदास्तरायेषा मदन्त इषयेम देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: ubhā śaṃsā naryā māmaviṣṭāmubhe māmūtī avasā sacetām bhūri cidaryaḥ sudāstarāyeṣā madanta iṣayema devāḥ

translations.griffith: May both these Friends of man, who bless, preserve me, may they attend me with their help and favour.  Enrich the man more liberal than the godless. May we, ye Gods, be strong with food rejoicing.

verses.sanskrit: रतं दिवे तदवोचं पर्थिव्या अभिश्रावाय परथमं सुमेधाः पातामवद्याद दुरितादभीके पिता माता च रक्षतामवोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtaṃ dive tadavocaṃ pṛthivyā abhiśrāvāya prathamaṃ sumedhāḥ pātāmavadyād duritādabhīke pitā mātā ca rakṣatāmavobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Endowed with understanding, I have uttered this truth, for all to hear, to Earth and Heaven.  Be near us, keep us from reproach and trouble. Father and Mother, with your help preserve us.

verses.sanskrit: इदं दयावाप्र्थिवी सत्यमस्तु पितर्मातर्यदिहोपब्रुवे वाम भूतं देवानामवमे अवोभिर्विद्या... |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī satyamastu pitarmātaryadihopabruve vām bhūtaṃ devānāmavame avobhirvidyā...

translations.griffith: Be this my prayer fulfilled, O Earth and Heaven, wherewith, Father and Mother, I address you.  Nearest of Gods be ye with your protection. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: आ न इळभिर्विदथे सुशस्ति विश्वानरः सविता देव एतु अपि यथा युवानो मत्सथा नो विश्वं जगदभिपित्वे मनीषा |||
verses.transliteration: ā na iḷabhirvidathe suśasti viśvānaraḥ savitā deva etu api yathā yuvāno matsathā no viśvaṃ jaghadabhipitve manīṣā

translations.griffith: LOVED of all men, may Savitar, through praises offered as sacred food, come to our synod,  That you too, through-our hymn, ye ever-youthful, may gladden, at your visit, all our people.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो विश्व आस्क्रा गमन्तु देवा मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणः सजोषाः भुवन यथा नो विश्वे वर्धासः करन सुषाहा विथुरं न शवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no viśva āskrā ghamantu devā mitro aryamā varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ bhuvan yathā no viśve vṛdhāsaḥ karan suṣāhā vithuraṃ na śavaḥ

translations.griffith: To us may all the Gods come trooped together, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa concordant,  That all may be promoters of our welfare, and with great might preserve our strength from slackness.

verses.sanskrit: परेष्ठं वो अतिथिं गर्णीषे.अग्निं शस्तिभिस्तुर्वणिः सजोषाः असद यथा नो वरुणः सुकीर्तिरिषश्च पर्षदरिगूर्तः सूरिः |||
verses.transliteration: preṣṭhaṃ vo atithiṃ ghṛṇīṣe.aghniṃ śastibhisturvaṇiḥ sajoṣāḥ asad yathā no varuṇaḥ sukīrtiriṣaśca parṣadarighūrtaḥ sūriḥ

translations.griffith: Agni I sing, the guest you love most dearly: the Conqueror through our lauds is friendly-minded.  That he may be our Varuṇa rich in glory and send food like a prince praised by the godly.

verses.sanskrit: उप व एषे नमसा जिगीषोषासानक्ता सुदुघेव धेनुः समाने अहन विमिमानो अर्कं विषुरूपे पयसि सस्मिन्नूधन |||
verses.transliteration: upa va eṣe namasā jighīṣoṣāsānaktā sudugheva dhenuḥ samāne ahan vimimāno arkaṃ viṣurūpe payasi sasminnūdhan

translations.griffith: To you I seek with reverence, Night and Morning, like a cow good to milk, with hope to conquer,  Preparing on a common day the praise. song with milk of various hues within this udder.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यो मयस कः शिशुं न पिप्युषीव वेति सिन्धुः येन नपातमपां जुनाम मनोजुवो वर्षणो यं वहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: uta no.ahirbudhnyo mayas kaḥ śiśuṃ na pipyuṣīva veti sindhuḥ yena napātamapāṃ junāma manojuvo vṛṣaṇo yaṃ vahanti

translations.griffith: May the great Dragon of the Deep rejoice us: as one who nourishes her young comes Sindhu,  With whom we will incite the Child of Waters whom vigorous course swift as thought bring hither.

verses.sanskrit: उत न ईं तवष्टा गन्त्वछा समत सूरिभिरभिपित्वे सजोषाः आ वर्त्रहेन्द्रश्चर्षणिप्रास्तुविष्टमो नरां नैह गम्याः |||
verses.transliteration: uta na īṃ tvaṣṭā ghantvachā smat sūribhirabhipitve sajoṣāḥ ā vṛtrahendraścarṣaṇiprāstuviṣṭamo narāṃ naiha ghamyāḥ

translations.griffith: Moreover Tvaṣṭar also shall approach us, one-minded with the princes at his visit.  Hither shall come the Vṛtra-slayer Indra, Ruler of men, as strongest of the Heroes.

verses.sanskrit: उत न ईं मतयो.अश्वयोगः शिशुं न गावस्तरुणं रिहन्ति तमीं गिरो जनयो न पत्नीः सुरभिष्टमं नरांनसन्त |||
verses.transliteration: uta na īṃ matayo.aśvayoghaḥ śiśuṃ na ghāvastaruṇaṃ rihanti tamīṃ ghiro janayo na patnīḥ surabhiṣṭamaṃ narāṃnasanta

translations.griffith: Him too our hymns delight, that yoke swift horses, like mother cows who lick their tender youngling.  To him our songs shall yield themselves like spouses, to him the most delightful of the Heroes.

verses.sanskrit: उत न ईं मरुतो वर्द्धसेनाः समद रोदसी समनसः सदन्तु पर्षदश्वासो.अवनयः न रथा रिशादसो मित्रयुजो न देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: uta na īṃ maruto vṛddhasenāḥ smad rodasī samanasaḥ sadantu pṛṣadaśvāso.avanayaḥ na rathā riśādaso mitrayujo na devāḥ

translations.griffith: So may the Maruts, armed with mighty weapons, rest here on heaven and earth with hearts in concord,  As Gods whose cars have dappled steeds like torrents, destroyers of the foe allies of Mitra.

verses.sanskrit: पर नु यदेषां महिना चिकित्रे पर युञ्जते परयुजस्ते सुव्र्क्ति अध यदेषां सुदिने न शरुर्विश्वमेरिणं परुषायन्त सेनः |||
verses.transliteration: pra nu yadeṣāṃ mahinā cikitre pra yuñjate prayujaste suvṛkti adha yadeṣāṃ sudine na śarurviśvameriṇaṃ pruṣāyanta senaḥ

translations.griffith: They hasten on to happy termination their orders when they are made known by  glory.  As on a fair bright day the arrow flieth o’er all the barren soil their missiles sparkle.

verses.sanskrit: परो अश्विनाववसे कर्णुध्वं पर पूषणं सवतवसो हि सन्ति अद्वेषो विष्णुर्वात रभुक्षा अछा सुम्नाय वव्र्तीयदेवान |||
verses.transliteration: pro aśvināvavase kṛṇudhvaṃ pra pūṣaṇaṃ svatavaso hi santi adveṣo viṣṇurvāta ṛbhukṣā achā sumnāya vavṛtīyadevān

translations.griffith: Incline the Aśvins to show grace, and Pūṣan, for power and might have they, their own possession.  Friendly are Viṣṇu, Vāta, and Ṛbhukṣan so may I bring the Gods to make us happy.

verses.sanskrit: इयं सा वो अस्मे दीधितिर्यजत्रा अपिप्राणी च सदनी च भूयः नि या देवेषु यतते वसूयुर्वि... |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ sā vo asme dīdhitiryajatrā apiprāṇī ca sadanī ca bhūyaḥ ni yā deveṣu yatate vasūyurvi...

translations.griffith: This is my reverent thought of you, ye Holy; may it inspire you, make you dwell among us,—  Thought, toiling for the Gods and seeking treasure. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: पितुं नु सतोषं महो धर्माणं तविषीम यस्य तरितो वयोजसा वर्त्रं विपर्वमर्दयत |||
verses.transliteration: pituṃ nu stoṣaṃ maho dharmāṇaṃ taviṣīm yasya trito vyojasā vṛtraṃ viparvamardayat

translations.griffith: Now will I glorify Food that upholds great strength,  By whose invigorating power Trita rent Vṛtra limb from limb.

verses.sanskrit: सवादो पितो मधो पितो वयं तवा वव्र्महे अस्माकमविता भव |||
verses.transliteration: svādo pito madho pito vayaṃ tvā vavṛmahe asmākamavitā bhava

translations.griffith: O pleasant Food, O Food of meath, thee have we chosen for our own,  So be our kind protector thou.

verses.sanskrit: उप नः पितवा चर शिवः शिवाभिरूतिभिः मयोभुरद्विषेण्यः सखा सुशेवो अद्वयाः |||
verses.transliteration: upa naḥ pitavā cara śivaḥ śivābhirūtibhiḥ mayobhuradviṣeṇyaḥ sakhā suśevo advayāḥ

translations.griffith: Come hitherward to us, O Food, auspicious with auspicious help,  Health-bringing, not unkind, a dear and guileless friend.

verses.sanskrit: तव तये पितो रस रजांस्यनु विष्ठिताः दिवि वाता इव शरिताः |||
verses.transliteration: tava tye pito rasa rajāṃsyanu viṣṭhitāḥ divi vātā iva śritāḥ

translations.griffith: These juices which, O Food, are thine throughout the regions are diffused.  like winds they have their place in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तव तये पितो ददतस्तव सवादिष्ठ ते पितो पर सवाद्मानो रसानां तुविग्रीवा इवेरते |||
verses.transliteration: tava tye pito dadatastava svādiṣṭha te pito pra svādmāno rasānāṃ tuvighrīvā iverate

translations.griffith: These gifts of thine, O Food, O Food most sweet to taste,  These savours of thy juices work like creatures that have mighty necks.

verses.sanskrit: तवे पितो महानां देवानां मनो हिताम अकारि चारु केतुना तवाहिमवसावधीत |||
verses.transliteration: tve pito mahānāṃ devānāṃ mano hitām akāri cāru ketunā tavāhimavasāvadhīt

translations.griffith: In thee, O Food, is set the spirit of great Gods.  Under thy flag brave deeds were done he slew the Dragon with thy help.

verses.sanskrit: यददो पितो अजगन विवस्व पर्वतानाम अत्रा चिन नो मधो पितो.अरं भक्षाय गम्याः |||
verses.transliteration: yadado pito ajaghan vivasva parvatānām atrā cin no madho pito.araṃ bhakṣāya ghamyāḥ

translations.griffith: If thou be gone unto the splendour of the clouds,  Even from thence, O Food of meath, prepared for our enjoyment, come.

verses.sanskrit: यदपामोषधीनां परिंशमारिशामहे वातपे पीवैद भव |||
verses.transliteration: yadapāmoṣadhīnāṃ pariṃśamāriśāmahe vātape pīvaid bhava

translations.griffith: Whatever morsel we consume from waters or from plants of earth, O Soma, wax thou fat thereby.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते सोम गवाशिरो यवाशिरो भजामहे वातापे ... |||
verses.transliteration: yat te soma ghavāśiro yavāśiro bhajāmahe vātāpe ...

translations.griffith: What Soma, we enjoy from thee in milky food or barley-brew, Vātāpi, grow thou fat thereby.

verses.sanskrit: करम्भ ओषधे भव पीवो वर्क्क उदारथिः वातापे ... |||
verses.transliteration: karambha oṣadhe bhava pīvo vṛkka udārathiḥ vātāpe ...

translations.griffith: O Vegetable, Cake of meal, he wholesome, firm, and strengthening: Vātāpi, grow thou fat thereby.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा वयं पितो वचोभिर्गावो न हव्या सुषूदिम देवेभ्यस्त्वा सधमादमस्मभ्यं तवा सधमादम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ pito vacobhirghāvo na havyā suṣūdima devebhyastvā sadhamādamasmabhyaṃ tvā sadhamādam

translations.griffith: O Food, from thee as such have we drawn forth with lauds, like cows, our sacrificial gifts,  From thee who banquetest with Gods, from thee who banquetest with us.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धो अद्य राजसि देवो देवैः सहस्रजित दूतो हव्या कविर्वह |||
verses.transliteration: samiddho adya rājasi devo devaiḥ sahasrajit dūto havyā kavirvaha

translations.griffith: WINNER of thousands, kindled, thou shinest a God with Gods to-day.  Bear out oblations, envoy, Sage.

verses.sanskrit: तनुनपाद रतं यते मध्वा यज्ञः समज्यते दधत सहस्रिणीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: tanunapād ṛtaṃ yate madhvā yajñaḥ samajyate dadhat sahasriṇīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Child of Thyself the sacrifice is for the righteous blent with meath,  Presenting viands thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit: आजुह्वानो न ईड्यो देवाना वक्षि यज्ञियान अग्ने सहस्रसा असि |||
verses.transliteration: ājuhvāno na īḍyo devānā vakṣi yajñiyān aghne sahasrasā asi

translations.griffith: Invoked and worthy of our praise bring Gods whose due is sacrifice:  Thou, Agni, givest countless gifts.

verses.sanskrit: पराचीनं बर्हिरोजसा सहस्रवीरमस्त्र्णन यत्रादित्या विराजथ |||
verses.transliteration: prācīnaṃ barhirojasā sahasravīramastṛṇan yatrādityā virājatha

translations.griffith: To seat a thousand Heroes they eastward have strewn the grass with might,  Whereon, Ādityas, ye shine forth.

verses.sanskrit: विराट सम्राड विभ्वीः परभ्वीर्बह्वीश्च भूयसीश्चयाः दुरो घर्तान्यक्षरन |||
verses.transliteration: virāṭ samrāḍ vibhvīḥ prabhvīrbahvīśca bhūyasīścayāḥ duro ghṛtānyakṣaran

translations.griffith: The sovran all-imperial Doors, wide, good, many and manifold,  Have poured their streams of holy oil.

verses.sanskrit: सुरुक्मे हि सुपेशसाधि शरिया विराजतः उषासावेहसीदताम |||
verses.transliteration: surukme hi supeśasādhi śriyā virājataḥ uṣāsāvehasīdatām

translations.griffith: With gay adornment, fair to see, in glorious beauty shine they forth:  Let Night and Morning rest them here.

verses.sanskrit: परथमा हि सुवाचसा होतारा दैव्या कवी यज्ञं नो यक्षतामिमम |||
verses.transliteration: prathamā hi suvācasā hotārā daivyā kavī yajñaṃ no yakṣatāmimam

translations.griffith: Let these two Sages first of all, heralds divine and eloquent,  Perform for us this sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: भारतीळे सरस्वति या वः सर्वा उपब्रुवे ता नश्चोदयत शरिये |||
verses.transliteration: bhāratīḷe sarasvati yā vaḥ sarvā upabruve tā naścodayata śriye

translations.griffith: You I address, Sarasvatī, and Bhāratī, and Iḷā, all:  Urge ye us on to glorious fame.

verses.sanskrit: तवष्टा रूपाणि हि परभुः पशुन विश्वान समानजे तेषां नः सफातिमा यज |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi hi prabhuḥ paśun viśvān samānaje teṣāṃ naḥ sphātimā yaja

translations.griffith: Tvaṣṭar the Lord hath made all forms and all the cattle of the field  Cause them to multiply for us.

verses.sanskrit: उप तमन्या वनस्पते पाथो देवेभ्यः सर्ज अग्निर्हव्यानि सिष्वदत |||
verses.transliteration: upa tmanyā vanaspate pātho devebhyaḥ sṛja aghnirhavyāni siṣvadat

translations.griffith: Send to the Gods, Vanaspati, thyself, the sacrificial draught:  Let Agni make the oblations sweet.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोगा अग्निर्देवानां गायत्रेण समज्यते सवाहाक्र्तीषु रोचते |||
verses.transliteration: puroghā aghnirdevānāṃ ghāyatreṇa samajyate svāhākṛtīṣu rocate

translations.griffith: Agni, preceder of the Gods, is honoured with the sacred song:  He glows at offerings blest with Hail!

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने नय सुपथा राये अस्मान विश्वानि देव वयुनानि विद्वान युयोध्यस्मज्जुहुराणमेनो भूयिष्ठां ते नमौक्तिंविधेम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne naya supathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān yuyodhyasmajjuhurāṇameno bhūyiṣṭhāṃ te namauktiṃvidhema

translations.griffith: BY goodly paths lead us to riches, Agni, God who knowest every sacred duty.  Remove the sin that makes us stray and wander. most ample adoration will we bring thee.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तवं पारया नव्यो अस्मान सवस्तिभिरति दुर्गाणि विश्वा पुश्च पर्थ्वी बहुला न उर्वि भवा तोकाय तनयाय शं योः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tvaṃ pārayā navyo asmān svastibhirati durghāṇi viśvā puśca pṛthvī bahulā na urvi bhavā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ

translations.griffith: Lead us anew to happiness, O Agni; lead us beyond all danger and affliction.  Be unto us a wide broad ample castle bless, prosper on their way our sons and offspring.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तवमस्मद युयोध्यमीवा अनग्नित्रा अभ्यमन्त कर्ष्टीः पुनरस्मभ्यं सुविताय देव कषां विश्वेभिरम्र्तेभिर्यजत्र |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tvamasmad yuyodhyamīvā anaghnitrā abhyamanta kṛṣṭīḥ punarasmabhyaṃ suvitāya deva kṣāṃ viśvebhiramṛtebhiryajatra

translations.griffith: Far from us, Agni, put thou all diseases let them strike lauds that have no saving Agni.  God, make our home again to be a blessing, with all the Immortal Deities, O Holy.

verses.sanskrit: पाहि नो अग्ने पायुभिरजस्रैरुत परिये सदन आ शुशुक्वान मा ते भयं जरितारं यविष्ठ नूनं विदन मापरं सहस्वः |||
verses.transliteration: pāhi no aghne pāyubhirajasrairuta priye sadana ā śuśukvān mā te bhayaṃ jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha nūnaṃ vidan māparaṃ sahasvaḥ

translations.griffith: Preserve us, Agni, with perpetual succour, refulgent in the dwelling which thou lovest.  O Conqueror, most youthful, let no danger touch him who praises thee to-day or after.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो अग्ने.अव सर्जो अघायाविष्यवे रिपवे दुछुनायै मादत्वते दशते मादते नो मा रीषते सहसावन परा दाः |||
verses.transliteration: mā no aghne.ava sṛjo aghāyāviṣyave ripave duchunāyai mādatvate daśate mādate no mā rīṣate sahasāvan parā dāḥ

translations.griffith: Give not us up a prey to sin, O Agni, the greedy enemy that brings us trouble;  Not to the fanged that bites, not to the toothless: give not us up, thou Conqueror, to the spoiler.

verses.sanskrit: वि घ तवावान रतजात यंसद गर्णानो अग्ने तन्वे वरूथम विश्वाद रिरिक्षोरुत वा निनित्सोरभिह्रुतामसि हि देव विष्पट |||
verses.transliteration: vi gha tvāvān ṛtajāta yaṃsad ghṛṇāno aghne tanve varūtham viśvād ririkṣoruta vā ninitsorabhihrutāmasi hi deva viṣpaṭ

translations.griffith: Such as thou art, born after Law, O Agni when lauded give protection to our bodies,  From whosoever would reproach or injure: for thou, God, rescuest from all oppression.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तानग्न उभयानिव विद्वान वेषि परपित्वे मनुषो यजत्र अभिपित्वे मनवे शास्यो भूर्मर्म्र्जेन्य उशिग्भिर्नाक्रः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tānaghna ubhayāniv vidvān veṣi prapitve manuṣo yajatra abhipitve manave śāsyo bhūrmarmṛjenya uśighbhirnākraḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, well discerning both these classes, comest to men at early morn, O holy Agni.  Be thou obedient unto man at evening, to be adorned, as keen, by eager suitors.

verses.sanskrit: अवोचाम निवचनान्यस्मिन मानस्य सूनुः सहसाने अग्नौ वयं सहस्रं रषिभिः सनेम वि... |||
verses.transliteration: avocāma nivacanānyasmin mānasya sūnuḥ sahasāne aghnau vayaṃ sahasraṃ ṛṣibhiḥ sanema vi...

translations.griffith: To him have we addressed our pious speeches, I, Māna's son, to him victorious Agni.  May we gain countless riches with the sages. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: अनर्वाणं वर्षभं मन्द्रजिह्वं बर्हस्पतिं वर्धया नव्यमर्कैः गाथान्यः सुरुचो यस्य देवा आश्र्ण्वन्ति नवमानस्य मर्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: anarvāṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ mandrajihvaṃ bṛhaspatiṃ vardhayā navyamarkaiḥ ghāthānyaḥ suruco yasya devā āśṛṇvanti navamānasya martāḥ

translations.griffith: GLORIFY thou Bṛhaspati, the scatheless, who must be praised with hymns, sweet-tongued and mighty,  To whom as leader of the song, resplendent, worthy of lauds, both Gods and mortals listen.

verses.sanskrit: तं रत्विया उप वाचः सचन्ते सर्गो न यो देवयतामसर्जि बर्हस्पतिः स हयञ्जो वरांसि विभ्वाभवत सं रते मातरिश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ ṛtviyā upa vācaḥ sacante sargho na yo devayatāmasarji bṛhaspatiḥ sa hyañjo varāṃsi vibhvābhavat saṃ ṛte mātariśvā

translations.griffith: On him wait songs according to the season even as a stream of pious men set moving.  Bṛhaspati—for he laid out the expanses—was, at the sacrifice, vast Mātariśvan.

verses.sanskrit: उपस्तुतिं नमस उद्यतिं च शलोकं यंसत सवितेव पर बाहू अस्य करत्वाहन्यो यो अस्ति मर्गो न भीमो अरक्षसस्तुविष्मान |||
verses.transliteration: upastutiṃ namasa udyatiṃ ca ślokaṃ yaṃsat saviteva pra bāhū asya kratvāhanyo yo asti mṛgho na bhīmo arakṣasastuviṣmān

translations.griffith: The praise, the verse that offers adoration, may he bring forth, as the Sun sends his arms out,  He who gives daily light through this God's wisdom, strong as a dread wild beast, and inoffensive.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य शलोको दिवीयते पर्थिव्यामत्यो न यंसद यक्षभ्र्द विचेताः मर्गाणां न हेतयो यन्ति चेमा बर्हस्पतेरहिमायानभि दयून |||
verses.transliteration: asya śloko divīyate pṛthivyāmatyo na yaṃsad yakṣabhṛd vicetāḥ mṛghāṇāṃ na hetayo yanti cemā bṛhaspaterahimāyānabhi dyūn

translations.griffith: His song of praise pervades the earth and heaven: let the wise worshipper draw it, like a courser.  These of Bṛhaspati, like hunters' arrows, go to the skies that change their hue like serpents.

verses.sanskrit: ये तवा देवोस्रिकं मन्यमानाः पापा भद्रमुपजीवन्ति पज्राः न दूढ्ये अनु ददासि वामं बर्हस्पते चयस इत पियारुम |||
verses.transliteration: ye tvā devosrikaṃ manyamānāḥ pāpā bhadramupajīvanti pajrāḥ na dūḍhye anu dadāsi vāmaṃ bṛhaspate cayasa it piyārum

translations.griffith: Those, God, who count thee as a worthless bullock, and, wealthy sinners, live on thee the Bounteous,—  On fools like these no blessing thou bestowest: Bṛhaspati, thou punishest the spiteful.

verses.sanskrit: सुप्रैतुः सूयवसो न पन्था दुर्नियन्तुः परिप्रीतो न मित्रः अनर्वाणो अभि ये चक्षते नो.अपीव्र्ता अपोर्णुवन्तो अस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: supraituḥ sūyavaso na panthā durniyantuḥ pariprīto na mitraḥ anarvāṇo abhi ye cakṣate no.apīvṛtā aporṇuvanto asthuḥ

translations.griffith: Like a fair path is he, where grass is pleasant, though hard to win, a Friend beloved most early.  Those who unharmed by enemies behold us, while they would make them bare, stood closely compassed.

verses.sanskrit: सं यं सतुभो.अवनयो न यन्ति समुद्रं न सरवतो रोधचक्राः स विद्वानुभयं चष्टे अन्तर्ब्र्हस्पतिस्तर आपश्च गर्ध्रः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yaṃ stubho.avanayo na yanti samudraṃ na sravato rodhacakrāḥ sa vidvānubhayaṃ caṣṭe antarbṛhaspatistara āpaśca ghṛdhraḥ

translations.griffith: He to whom songs of praise go forth like torrents, as rivers eddying under banks flow sea-ward—  Bṛhaspati the wise, the eager, closely looks upon both, the waters and the vessel.

verses.sanskrit: एवा महस्तुविजातस्तुविष्मान बर्हस्पतिर्व्र्षभो धायि देवः स न सतुतो वीरवद धातु गोमद वि... |||
verses.transliteration: evā mahastuvijātastuviṣmān bṛhaspatirvṛṣabho dhāyi devaḥ sa na stuto vīravad dhātu ghomad vi...

translations.griffith: So hath Bṛhaspati, great, strong and mighty, the God exceeding powerful, been brought hither.  May he thus lauded give us kine and horses. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit: कङकतो न कङकतो.अथो सतीनकङकतः दवाविति पलुषी इति नयद्र्ष्ट अलिप्सत |||
verses.transliteration: kaṅkato na kaṅkato.atho satīnakaṅkataḥ dvāviti pluṣī iti nyadṛṣṭa alipsata

translations.griffith: VENOMOUS, slightly venomous, or venomous aquatic worm,—  Both creatures, stinging, unobserved, with poison have infected me.

verses.sanskrit: अद्र्ष्टान हन्त्यायत्यथो हन्ति परायती अथो अवघ्नती हन्त्यथो पिनष्टि पिंषती |||
verses.transliteration: adṛṣṭān hantyāyatyatho hanti parāyatī atho avaghnatī hantyatho pinaṣṭi piṃṣatī

translations.griffith: Coming, it kills the unobserved; it kills them as it goes away,  It kills them as it drives them off, and bruising bruises them to death.

verses.sanskrit: शरासः कुशरासो दर्भासः सैर्या उत मौञ्जा अद्र्ष्टा वैरिणाः सर्वे साकं नयलिप्सत |||
verses.transliteration: śarāsaḥ kuśarāso darbhāsaḥ sairyā uta mauñjā adṛṣṭā vairiṇāḥ sarve sākaṃ nyalipsata

translations.griffith: Sara grass, Darbha, Kuśara, and Sairya, Muñja, Vīraṇa,  Where all these creatures dwell unseen, with poison have infected me.

verses.sanskrit: नि गावो गोष्ठे असदन नि मर्गासो अविक्षत नि केतवो जनानां नयद्र्ष्टा अलिप्सत |||
verses.transliteration: ni ghāvo ghoṣṭhe asadan ni mṛghāso avikṣata ni ketavo janānāṃ nyadṛṣṭā alipsata

translations.griffith: The cows had settled in their stalls, the beasts of prey had sought their lairs,  Extinguished were the lights of men, when things unseen infected me.

verses.sanskrit: एत उ तये परत्यद्र्श्रन परदोषं तस्करा इव अद्र्ष्टा विश्वद्र्ष्टाः परतिबुद्धा अभूतन |||
verses.transliteration: eta u tye pratyadṛśran pradoṣaṃ taskarā iva adṛṣṭā viśvadṛṣṭāḥ pratibuddhā abhūtana

translations.griffith: Or these, these reptiles, are observed, like lurking thieves at evening time.  Seers of all, themselves unseen: be therefore very vigilant.

verses.sanskrit: दयौर्वः पिता पर्थिवी माता सोमो भरातादितिः सवसा अद्र्ष्टा विश्वद्र्ष्टास्तिष्ठतेलयता सु कम |||
verses.transliteration: dyaurvaḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā somo bhrātāditiḥ svasā adṛṣṭā viśvadṛṣṭāstiṣṭhatelayatā su kam

translations.griffith: Heaven is your Sire, your Mother Earth, Soma your Brother, Aditi  Your Sister: seeing all, unseen, keep still and dwell ye happily.

verses.sanskrit: ये अंस्या ये अङगयाः सूचीका ये परकङकताः अद्र्ष्टाः किं चनेह वः सर्वे साकं नि जस्यत |||
verses.transliteration: ye aṃsyā ye aṅghyāḥ sūcīkā ye prakaṅkatāḥ adṛṣṭāḥ kiṃ caneha vaḥ sarve sākaṃ ni jasyata

translations.griffith: Biters of shoulder or of limb, with needle-stings, most venomous,  Unseen, whatever ye may be, vanish together and be gone.

verses.sanskrit: उत पुरस्तात सूर्य एति विश्वद्र्ष्टो अद्र्ष्टहा अद्र्ष्टान सर्वाञ जम्भयन सर्वाश्च यातुधान्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ut purastāt sūrya eti viśvadṛṣṭo adṛṣṭahā adṛṣṭān sarvāñ jambhayan sarvāśca yātudhānyaḥ

translations.griffith: Slayer of things unseen, the Sun, beheld of all, mounts, eastward, up,  Consuming all that are not seen, and evil spirits of the night.

verses.sanskrit: उदपप्तदसौ सूर्यः पुरु विश्वानि जूर्वन आदित्यः पर्वतेभ्यो विश्वद्र्ष्टो अद्र्ष्टहा |||
verses.transliteration: udapaptadasau sūryaḥ puru viśvāni jūrvan ādityaḥ parvatebhyo viśvadṛṣṭo adṛṣṭahā

translations.griffith: There hath the Sun-God mounted up, who scorches much and everything.  Even the Āditya from the hills, all-seen, destroying things unseen.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्ये विषमा सजामि दर्तिं सुरावतो गर्हे सो चिन नु नमराति नो वयं मरामारे अस्य योजनं हरिष्ठा मधु तवामधुला चकार |||
verses.transliteration: sūrye viṣamā sajāmi dṛtiṃ surāvato ghṛhe so cin nu namarāti no vayaṃ marāmāre asya yojanaṃ hariṣṭhā madhu tvāmadhulā cakāra

translations.griffith: I hang the poison in the Sun, a wine-skin in a vintner's house,  He will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

verses.sanskrit: इयत्तिका शकुन्तिका सका जघास ते विषम सो चिन नु ... |||
verses.transliteration: iyattikā śakuntikā sakā jaghāsa te viṣam so cin nu ...

translations.griffith: This little bird, so very small, hath swallowed all thy poison up.  She will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

verses.sanskrit: तरिः सप्त विष्पुलिङगका विषस्य पुष्यमक्षन ताश्चिन्नु न मरन्ति नो वयं म... |||
verses.transliteration: triḥ sapta viṣpuliṅghakā viṣasya puṣyamakṣan tāścinnu na maranti no vayaṃ ma...

translations.griffith: The three-times-seven bright sparks of fire have swallowed up the poison's strength.  They will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

verses.sanskrit: नवानां नवतीनां विषस्य रोपुषीणाम सर्वासामग्रभं नामारे अस्य यो... |||
verses.transliteration: navānāṃ navatīnāṃ viṣasya ropuṣīṇām sarvāsāmaghrabhaṃ nāmāre asya yo...

translations.griffith: Of ninety rivers and of nine with power to stay the venom's course,—  The names of all I have secured: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

verses.sanskrit: तरिः सप्त मयूर्यः सप्त सवसारो अग्रुवः तास्ते विषं वि जभ्रिर उदकं कुम्भिनीरिव |||
verses.transliteration: triḥ sapta mayūryaḥ sapta svasāro aghruvaḥ tāste viṣaṃ vi jabhrira udakaṃ kumbhinīriva

translations.griffith: So have the peahens three-times-seven, so have the maiden Sisters Seven  Carried thy venom far away, as girls bear water in their jars.

verses.sanskrit: इयत्तकः कुषुम्भकस्तकं भिनद्म्यश्मना ततो विषं पर वाव्र्ते पराचीरनु संवतः |||
verses.transliteration: iyattakaḥ kuṣumbhakastakaṃ bhinadmyaśmanā tato viṣaṃ pra vāvṛte parācīranu saṃvataḥ

translations.griffith: The poison-insect is so small; I crush the creature with a stone.  I turn the poison hence away, departed unto distant lands.

verses.sanskrit: कुषुम्भकस्तदब्रवीद गिरेः परवर्तमानकः वर्श्चिकस्यारसं विषमरसं वर्श्चिक ते विषम |||
verses.transliteration: kuṣumbhakastadabravīd ghireḥ pravartamānakaḥ vṛścikasyārasaṃ viṣamarasaṃ vṛścika te viṣam

translations.griffith: Forth issuing from the mountain's side the poison-insect spake and said:  Scorpion, they venom is but weak.
